Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay.”
Reviews.Author: globetrotter1113
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights, and it was a pleasant experience. We were greeted with leis and refreshments upon arrival, and shown to our Deluxe Room which was elegant, yet a bit uninspired. While the rooms lacked charm, the hotel's secluded location (note Kapalua is significantly windier than other areas onn Maui), service, stunning views of the ocean, and layout of the pool and grounds more than made up for it, and made our stay a worthwhile one.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Shishito
Reviews.Content: You could not expect less from a Ritz. It is quite expensive at about 800$/night but well worth it. Magnificent views. Great rooms. Great service. Nice common areas. Very nice kids club (educative). Great concierge service. Average Spa. Kapalua is much nicer than Wailea and more private. If you want to be at a place with more "action" then go to the four seasons in wilea. If you want to relax, this is the place. I would most defenitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location kills this...”
Reviews.Author: bobbybolly
Reviews.Content: Everything is good at the hotel except the location... We were there mid march .. The weather was raining and cloudy for over 10 days.. One needs to know that 10 miles away in lahaina .. Weather was perfect... Kapalua is at an elevation.. Causing it to be very windy and cloudy with rain... Lahaina is protected by mountains and much better weather... Nothing against the hotel.. But someone picked the wrong place to build it

Reviews.Title: “A great experience at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Laura O
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful experience at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. We really enjoyed our stay. Very nice setting, quiet and relaxing with enough entertainment and wonderful amenities to make your days very pleasant. What we liked the most about this hotel is that its beach and overall the whole Kapalua area is not crowded like other hotels in Kannapali (hotel zone) or even the Four Seasons in Wailea. The pool, the grounds and all the amenities are amazing. The restaurants offer nice options, from casual burgers and fries at the pool/beach cafe to sushi and sophisticated sea food at the Banyan Tree restaurant. Many people complain about the bad location of this hotel and I would say that they are right about that (weather wise). Kapalua is windy and a few degrees cooler than all the other resort areas in Maui; however, you can drive a few minutes and you'll find yourself enjoying sunny Maui. Personally, I don't like windy weather (who does?) but I didn't mind it too much because Kapalua is simply beautiful, even when it's raining. Honestly, this is the only place in West Maui that, for my taste, feels upscale. I definitely don't have any complaints about this hotel, the only minus in our trip was that it rained for three days during our stay, but of course that's something that the Ritz-Carlton's can't control.

Reviews.Title: “This is NOT a true Ritz”
Reviews.Author: rhuckabee5
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at many Ritz Carlton's and this one has been so disappointing that we have spent most our time looking for a house to stay in. We stayed in an Ocean Front Residential Suite and were extremely disappointed. If you come to Maui don't waste your time on this side of the island. Stay in Wailea at The Four Seasons. It was incredible!

Reviews.Title: “Even in dicy weather, wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: KKozey
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua for the first week in March, a week where the area saw more rain and high wind than it apparently had all year. But even with a few rainy days, the experience was wonderful. The staff at every point of the hotel was incredibly helpful and friendly. We took advantage of as much of their outdoor areas as possible and really enjoyed the beach and pool. We also loved the restaurants on site and within the Kapalua complex. And finally, the golf. Playing the Bay and Plantation courses and getting those breathtaking views of Moloka'i off in the distance was unforgettable. We also took advantage of the Ritz's whale watching tour and were very happy with it. Not only did we see lots of humpbacks, but the guide from the Ritz sent us amazing pictures he took on our trip. All in all, I wish we had been there during a little nicer weather, but the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is a decadent, relaxing, impeccable spot for a Maui vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is amazing.”
Reviews.Author: GEFromNH
Reviews.Content: Terrible weather while in Hawaii. One bright spot was we did club level. The staff was attentive, professional. They went out of their way. The food and drinks on club level were excellent. It was a great place to hang out during the monsoon like rain. In general the Ritz Carlton was wonderful. Facility was beautiful, pools nice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: teriw1214
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property with excellent service. I was surprised to see some peeling paint on the exterior of the building and public bathroom doors scratched and in need of repair. We stayed in a 1 bedroom residence. Very nice large room except the kitchen was lacking. It is strange because itâ€™s stocked with measuring and cooking utensils but the only cooking appliance is a small microwave. If there was a toaster oven versus the 4 slice toaster it would been helpful. There is only so much you can do with a small microwave. Nice beach however it is a bit of a walk from the actual hotel. Also, the beach is public so there are no loungers or umbrellas. Do take advantage of the trail that extends out of the hotel in the residential area. Unbelievable beach views so take your camera!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: buckeyetraveler-1
Reviews.Content: It was the perfect getaway. The Ritz is the ultimate experience and delivers the best of service. I will visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgetable Birthday”
Reviews.Author: tc1707
Reviews.Content: We only had 5 days in this fantastic hotel. Very friendly and helpful staff. Only negative point was the wind, which blew extremly on all days. Great pool area, great beach and nice restaurants. We had a suite with a beautiful ocean view although the walk to the Lobby is a bit long. We had a great time and an unforgetable birthday.

Reviews.Title: “5 star property on the windward side of the island”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: First, this is a fantastic hotel on an amazing property. However you should note that this is on the windward side of the island, so it can get windy. That being said during the 4 days we were there the wind was totally manageable by the pool, and the staff did a great job of telling us where to sit to minimize wind exposure. Once you get past the potential wind everything about this was great. We stayed in a garden suite (I think it was called garden). While it wasn't looking directly at the ocean you could easily see it from our lanai, and I personally preferred the view because you looked directly up at the lush hilltops. It was a very large room, big living room with a pullout couch which was unbelievably comfortable. Had a kitchen with a dishwasher, microwave etc. Large bedroom, large bathroom with separate rub and shower and 2 lanais. We started most of our days at the gym which is a great hotel gym, tons of treadmills and ellipticals as well as a full range of machines and free weights. When we didn't hit the gym we went for a run, and the concierge provided us with a map where we could get 5-6 miles easily. After working out we hit The Terrace for breakfast. Talk about a breakfast buffet! Great selection, omelet station, and macadamia nut banana pancakes?! After stuffing our faces at breakfast we hung out by the pool where the staff directed us to the optimal areas depending upon what we wanted and put down our chair covers for us, and gave us sunscreen. Throughout the day we were waited on constantly (try the 'mike tai') and they kept our water bottles filled. Sure 2 mai tais cost $25, but you are sitting by a pool at a 5 start hotel, what do you expect? We hit the spa one day. I was a huge fan of the whirlpool. There is also a eucalyptus steam, sauna and a relaxation room. If you book a treatment they let you use the facilities all day at no charge, otherwise it is $25. There were 3 dinner options at the hotel and all were good. Nothing fantastic, but we didn't leave disappointed at the food we ate either. There are a few restaurants in Kapalua as well as Nepali which you can walk to (about 25 mins) or take the shuttle or a taxi or drive if you have a car. We went to Merriman's one night which was great. As far as the beach goes, it is about a 4-5 min walk down the path where they have towel service and a restaurant. We didn't go to the beach while we were there because the surf was a bit rough, but it was beautiful. Last but not least if you a golfer you cannot beat the course. I am a novice and even I appreciated it. I will note that the hotel is a bit isolated. If you want to get away from it all this is the place to be. If you want to be able to walk to shops and restaurants you'll want to head south to Kannappali. I personally love the quiet. If you want to be in the middle of it all, just take a taxi elsewhere for the evening. I will definitely be back, great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome two week stay”
Reviews.Author: JManH0ttub
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 weeks in February with my wife and 7 year old son. We had a fantastic time and would go back in an instant. I don't oftern write reviews but reading some of the reviews before we left and after we returned, I was compelled to write. First, the beach is a short 2 minute stroll from the pool, nothing really. Never saw ANYONE take the shuttle in 2 weeks, the walk is that short. Never noticed any airplanes, that's just silly. The beach at the hotel was good, some days were a little rough but when we wanted calmer waters we went to Kapalua Bay, (short drive or shuttle) or we drove to Slaughterhouse Beach about 5 minutes away. This beach is just west of the Plantation Golf course and is very secluded, you have to walk down a bunch of steps to get there. Food at the hotel was all excellent, never had even an average meal. Service was what you expect from the Ritz-Carlton, from the time we arrived until the time we left. We ate at the Honolua store a few times and this was a great alternative, fast and cheaper, and the food is very good. It was windy at times around the hotel but it wasn't that bad. We used the Cousteau facility four times for my 7 yr old son and he loved it, kept asking to go back. He did the pizza making, night creatures, snorkelling, and the survivor class. That is an exceptional program and allowed us to have time (3 hrs each) on our own for dinner. The concierge group was also exceptional. We asked for dinner reservations in Lahaina four times on short notice and each time they were great recommendations and EACH time we were sat at the best tables in the place, right on the water. We sat at the pool for maybe 1 hour per day, service was always attentive and they setup your lounge for you. We have now been to all of the islands and this was the best hotel so far. Had a convertible Mustang and used it every day, lots to see and do around the island. An great example of the service... we had some leftovers, cheese, couple of other things in the fridge and I noticed one day the fridge had shut down. Called the desk, serviceman was literally there in 2 minutes, did his thing and got it working again. He noticed the food and without us asking or saying anything said that the hotel would make it up to us. It was about $20 worth of food, (old pizza), and they sent us a bottle of wine, and a platter with meats, cheese and some snacks, about $75 worth of food. Great service. Overall, even the average reviews are undeserved. Some of them are ridiculous... (airplanes?). This is a great hotel and every interaction we had, from the maids to the ladies at the coffee bar to the servers in the restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property.”
Reviews.Author: Hube60745
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Ritz-Carlton Kapalua from 2/20 to 2/27. 2 families with 3 kids (6,7,9). Such a beautiful property. Pros: Very well kept. Excellent landscaping. Staff/customer service was excellent, as expected. Club lounge was well kept. The lounge staff did a phenomenal job advising us on activities to do and beaches/restaurants to go to. Food at the club lounge was as expected. Pool/hot tub area is very well maintained. Towel service with complimentary fresh fruits! Beautiful views of the pacific. Ample parking(was not charged for self parking even though property website posted $10 per day) Cons: Hotel is located at the far end of the island. 20-25 min to Lahaina. 50 min to Airport. 1.5 hours to Wailea-Makena. 3 hours to Hana. Pool area was windy most of our stay. Beach is nice but current is very strong. red/orange flag was up all the time. Acitivies: Went to different beaches per club staff recommendations. Loved Kapalua bay beach (snorkeling of beach- saw green turtles, walking distance from Ritz) and Lahaina beach. Wailea beach (Fours Seasons) is also beautiful. Mala and Honu restaurants were excellent (food, location, and service) The road to Hana trip is a full day adventure. pack snacks. I learned that Ritz prepares a picnic basket upon request.. Did not go to crater as mountain top was foggy and cloudy most of the time. Winery and Lavender farm can be done in a 4 hour trip from Hotel. Overall, our stay at the Ritz was a great experience. we felt that the club lounge was well worth it. Wished that it was a little closer to main attractions. Will definitely visit Maui again and may return to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Coming to relax in Hawaii, don't book this property”
Reviews.Author: RP F
Reviews.Content: If your coming to Hawaii skip this property. As you no doubt have read from others, this property is no where near the water. You can't hear the sounds of the waves. They have Ocean Front Suites and all other rooms are at best partial ocean view. If you enjoy the sound of traffic, airplanes, and kids playing sitting on your Lanai, this is your hotel. Think Vegas if you could open the windows. If you're expecting an outstanding room, you will be disappointed. At best 2 steps above Best Western. All and all I would skip the north west side of Maui. Maui in general makes me feel like West LA came over here and dumped. The feel and vibe is not relaxing. The Fairmont Kea Lani is a much better choice if your set on coming to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Each visit better than the last!”
Reviews.Author: sf92603
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our fourth trip in three years to the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. Leslie and her staff in the Club Level are phenomenal and operate at the highest levels of excellence. Everyone in there has a passion for customer service and bring incredible value to this hotel. We much prefer this location to Wailea, and will be back for years to come!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, but not my favorite part of the island.”
Reviews.Author: imacookiemonster
Reviews.Content: Hotel was wonderful, but the location was VERY windy. We were told it's always more windy at the hotel, especially by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Don't hesitate...”
Reviews.Author: texasgirlandboy22
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in all three "resort" areas of Maui (Four Seasons Wailea,Westin, Kaanapali), and the Ritz at Kapalua is BY-FAR the better of the three! Yes, it may rain a little...did you really go to Maui to JUST stay at the hotel? Geez. Go take a day trip in the morning, and spend the rest of the day at the resort! Problem solved! The property is amazing, the service impeccable and the food at Banyan Tree was out of this world good! I would skip the breakfast at the hotel and run into Napili (sp), Lahaina or even stop and get a few items at the grocery and stock your fridge ( I am a "foodie" and their $30 breakfast was not remarkable; save your money for great dinners!) I am really surprised at the comments about the distance to the beach...it's about a five minute walk...down hill! If you just can't make it up the hill, they will bring you back on a cart, but I don't think I saw ANYone going that! (I have never stayed anywhere where you didn't have to walk a little down to the beach, with the exception of Belize, where my cottage was ON the beach!) We spent 7 nights here and it encompassed my 40th birthday, Valentine's Day and our anniversary...and it couldn't have been better! In fact, we have decided, this WILL be an annual trip for us! PS- there was a convention there when we were there, too, but we were not inconvenienced whatsoever; our service was outstanding, and never waivered!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: nld732
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua HI, what an amazing property! Everything you could possibly want is provided. We did not meet one staff member who wasn't completely hospitable. We were really made to feel as though we were more that welcome! The pool is wonderful, the beach fantastic and the Coastal Trail a wonderful morning walk. Check in was most welcoming, room service amazing, arrived on time, presentation perfect, food hot. The server even offered to take pictures of us without us asking. You know you are in heaven when you are at this property!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - Avoid the Bayon Tree for Dinner”
Reviews.Author: MuyFun
Reviews.Content: Would have been a 5 star review, but the family got food poisoning after eating dinner at Banyon Tree. Overall, the hotel was excellent, except for the food offerings. The Breakfast buffet was great - however all other meals were not very good. We stayed there for a week, and only ate 2 meals at the hotel. For such a nice place, im pretty suprised over the awful food experience. I would not stay there again. The Four Seasons and Kia Lani are much better and the food offerings are superb

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: chris l
Reviews.Content: Definitely NOT the kind of customer service my family expected from a "5-Star" resort. In terms of landscape, the resort deserves a 5 Star. In terms of customer service, the resort deserves a 1 Star. This was our second and definitely our last time to this resort. Our bad experiences are mainly in the restaurant area. We received rude, cold services from the waitresses, especially the early-middle age brunette-non islander at The Terrace-breakfast buffet) , who was dispassionate and not happy to be working there. They seem to be in a hurry and not happy to be here. Concierge not very helpful and only provided superficial information that I can find myself. Desk receptionist not happy-no eye contact. Overall, I believe the "emotional IQ" of the staff at this resort is very low, which translates into poor customer service. For a 5-Star experience, go to the Four Seasons, which is where I will take my family next time.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel on the West Coast of Maui”
Reviews.Author: Takebashi
Reviews.Content: Great location and facility, and great staff. You'll have a great time here, and you'll have a great time nearby (Lahaina, etc). When you get in, talk to Jerry at the concierge desk. I have never met someone as genuine, attentive, and down to earth as this guy. He was professional and sincere, and helped us to sort out whatever was needed. One other comment: do not check in early. We checked in at 12:30pm, well before their official check-in time of 4pm, and even though they placed "a rush" on cleaning our room, it wasn't ready til nearly 4pm. They gave us free drink tickets, etc, but nothing quite matches getting into your room on time. So, if doable, show up after their official check-in time.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort except -not beachfront& limited beach”
Reviews.Author: RH12571
Reviews.Content: Like all Ritz resorts, they have excellent service,rooms,beds, linens & attention to details. What was most disappointing is that this hotel was not near a beach & the beach was mediocre to say the least. Small sandy strip tHat was not attractive and good only for basic swimming- too many people and just not up to par with the rest of the resort. For the price you'd do better elsewhere unless you were a total golf fanatic. This Ritz had the most fantastic golf course but if you are going for a great beachfront property, this is NOT it! I would think even the biggest golf fans would like to be beachfront when on an island vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: malo008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights at the Ritz Carlton, Kapalua two months ago (right before Christmas- the decorations were amazing!) and we still talk about it everyday. We often thought we were dreaming, because it was such a perfect trip. Some people claim that the beach isn't close, but it IS close, just down small hill- and if you're not in the mood to take a pretty stroll down the hill the hotel will drive you down by golf cart. There is another beach about a mile away (still on Ritz property, so you can charge snorkel gear there to your room) which is a glorious walk (either by sidewalk, or skirting the coast on a lovely boardwalk/path). If you're a beach bum and just want to soak up the sun by the pool or beach all day, then perhaps you'd find the sunnier side of the island preferable. It's true, it is windier and rains more on this side of the island, but for those reasons, this is the most lush and beautiful part of the island. We were there in the rainy season and most days were glorious, clear and warm- it drizzled on us a couple of times but never lasted very long. If you like to be active on vacation there are plenty of options at this hotel. We hiked miles everyday, there are many paths to choose from, all with outstanding views of the ocean. On the other hand, you could nap on one of the many hammocks and then chill by the pool with a perfect pina colada. The staff is fantastic, the hotel grounds are gorgeous and it never feels like you're surrounded by a million other tourists- this hotel and the entire area feel like an oasis. We did venture to other areas of the island, which were great, but we felt that the peace and quiet of Kapalua was perfection. There is also the Honolua General Store which is a quaint market perfect for picking up breakfast to eat back on your private balcony- our morning ritual while there. An added bonus: the toiletries smell like coconut-beach-bliss, they're fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “A place to stay when you want to be pampered!”
Reviews.Author: bap58
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel 3 times on the Club level. this is the only way to go. You can actually have 3 meals and drinks everyday you are here. The staff in the Club lounge are extremely friendly and helpful. The property is exquisite and if your looking for a relaxing vacation or even a long weekend, you can't go wrong on this property. If you enjoy champagne and drinks the Club level is worth looking into!

Reviews.Title: “Ah....”
Reviews.Author: andiamo
Reviews.Content: Spent four wonderful nights on the club level in early February. Would have stayed much longer, but needed to join others at a Kanapali location for the next four days of our trip. This is a breathtakenly beautiful and well cared for property!! If you want lots of people, lots of shops, lots of traffic, this is not your place. We stayed on the club level as we generally do at RC's. Fabulous food, terrific cocktails!! Room was overlooking the golf course with balcony and a view of the sea. Wonderful walking trails on the ocean and through the plantation grounds. Best of all....the staff at every location within the hotel! Bravo Ritz Carlton....a testament to "you get what you pay for."

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: snowbird34
Reviews.Content: A really gorgeous property that is so large, we could not tell it was at 100% occupancy. I spoke with a couple during the walking workout who had been relocated to a nearby condo because the hotel was oversold (they were allowed to use Ritz-Carlton access and amenities). Plenty of chairs around the pool, even with the expected chair grabbers who drop there towel on chair at 7 am and rarely return. The Great: Breakfast- buffet was awesome, only wish you could eat outside. You are given a different flavored smoothie sample every morning. The service at breakfast was so pleasant. Great way to start the day. Monica - Yoga instructor extraordinaire. This isn't your run of the mill stretching and call it a yoga class. Monica is incredibly knowledgeable and her assists were so helpful. She gave us an intense workout every class. I also went on the workout walk on the beach path - Can't miss it. $20 per class. I wish they had outdoor classes. Nearby Restaurants- Awesome location for dining- Merriman's - best sunset location on the island with outstanding food. Sansei - best sushi I have ever experienced. Weather- phenomenal sunshine entire trip. We were told by our driver Maui is experiencing drought conditions and unseasonably high temps (mid-80's). The terrain resembled Mexico. Lush greenery on the hillsides and center of island was brown. Issues: 1. Poolside service just OK. No water spritzing or melon samples. One instance, lemonade was offered, out of five days at the pool. You set up your chair with towels retrieved from the towel stand. Food was a disappointment to say the least. The fish tacos should have been amazing but only the fries were edible. My friend liked her california rolls, but they ran out. 2. My company had several dinners at the resort and the food was depressing. Really not good and the desserts did not stand out either. Better to hit Sansei at 10:30 pm for half price sushi. 3. We could barely see the ocean from our deck even though we had an upgraded room near the beach. Very few rooms have a direct view of the ocean if that is important to you. 4. No turn down service. Not a big deal but, for the Ritz Carlton price tag you come to expect special amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: It's a very good experience in Ritz Carlton. The scene of the hotel is very beautiful. The service people are very kindness and sincere The setting was very scenic. I would definitely come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Pool Area”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuff510
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a weeklong vacation and had a great time staying here; I really enjoyed the pool area and overall was an enjoyable stay

Reviews.Title: “Great - But the location has its drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: Riverzlad
Reviews.Content: We had the amazing opportunity to stay here for free in the club level - it was great - so I'll focus on the two main issues - the location and weather. If you want to explore Maui, Kapalua is not the best place. It's far from most of the sights and the place is windy - at least in February, so unless you're the golfing type, there's not much to do around Kapalua. Yes, the pool is great and there are a few amazing beaches right by the hotel, but for the most part they are not for swimming (in winter). Kapalua Bay is a bit crowded on the weekends and while the beach is much calmer (being on the west side) the snorkeling is a 6 out of 10 compared to the Big Island. If you just want to sit by the pool and be served $15 drinks, then you will be thrilled with the property.

Reviews.Title: “The definition of reserved luxury”
Reviews.Author: RickNStl
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the RC Kapalua and definitely not the last. They recognized my Marriott status, upgraded us to an ocean view suite and other niceties. We paid about $100 a day for access to the club lounge--that's a huge bargain and the food was absolutely fantastic. Since the club serves everything in appetizer style, this is a great way to indulge and experience a wide range of unique dishes without over-eating. The resort is about 10 minutes beyond Kaanapali but that's not a problem. Once you're experiencing the Ritz beach, golf, pool and service you won't be motivated to venture out. (We did drive to Lahaina/Ruths Chris for dinner one night and it was less than 15 minutes each eay.) Self parking is a breeze and if you looking for a bit more affordability the twilight rates at Plantation and Bay are $100 cheaper than morning fees. Book ahead for the 1:30 tee time and get there by 1PM for the best start. There are many activites and excursions to experience on Maui and this trip we sailed on the Paragon to Lanai for the day. If you do this-hike up to the Four Season at Manele Bay-another spectacular hotel!

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: Dick H
Reviews.Content: Well named & richly deserving of the name. A Grand, Great & Beautiful Hotel - with a STAFF to meet all expectations & exceed many.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort - Rude Bartenders”
Reviews.Author: Sarah M
Reviews.Content: This place is amazing. My only complaint is their bartenders and their personalities. When you travel to Hawaii, you expect very happy islander bartenders, but that is not what you get at this resort. Most of the bartenders and very rude, slow and don't act like they care to help you...they have zero personality and they don't even care to smile at you. I have two other friends staying here for different vacations and they have experienced the same level of service that we have. We even recieved feedback from a local restuarant saying "that's what you get at that resort" which is very diappointing considering the amount of money you spend per night on rooms. If you like to go and grab a Mai Tai mid day or a drink to cap off your night, this is definitely not the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Carlton delivers again”
Reviews.Author: mspossum
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five days as part two of a trip to Maui in January. My last stay was seven years ago. I was very pleased to see that the pool area has been expanded and many rooms have been enlarged in the last renovation. The landscaping is top notch. We were upgraded to a room on the first floor (ground) at the very end of the hotel with it's own "garden entrance" and a splendid view out to the ocean. It felt like a private bungalow and I did not mind the long trek to the front of the hotel. Another definite plus is that the resort now has a shuttle available to take guests to the excellent area restaurants, and one of Maui's top rated restaurants Sensei has opened a restaurant that is a 5 minute walk from the entrance. The staff, as is often noted, were always friendly and attentive. Our room had a ac control problem and the maintenance staff was there to fix it in under ten minutes. When we had any request of housekeeping it was dealt with in less than five minutes. That's a gold standard for service that is hard to match. If you stay here don't miss the wonderful coastal trail walk that meanders behind the hotel. It's a beautiful way to start any day.

Reviews.Title: “What's not to love?”
Reviews.Author: Maitaiguy101
Reviews.Content: Aloha! My girlfriend & I just spent 8 days at the Ritz in Kapalua, Maui. I did a lot of homework before choosing this hotel. We have been to Hawaii almost a dozen times, and have stayed everywhere between Waialea to Kapalua. First off, it's the Ritz Carlton. The expectation is high & they delivered on every front! Classic Aloha Spirit seems to be lost nowadays at hotels in Hawaii, but the Ritz delivers. From the classic lei greeting getting out of the rental car, to passed pineapple at noon everyday poolside. Everyone seems to know your name...everywhere! It's Aloha top to bottom. It was our anniversary during the week spent there & they deliver champagne, gift basket & personal welcome notes to the room. C'mon...it's not cheap to stay here, but the service & thoughtfulness is what makes this hotel stand out! The pools are great, the food great & the staff is even better! As far as the location? Yes, it's ten minutes from Kaanapalli, (the hotel district), and another ten minutes to Lahaina. But the location is really in it's own world. After staying in Kaanapalli for so many times, you figure that's the only place to stay, but really, aside from walking the beach everyday, checking out all of the other hotels & drinks at the Hula Grill almost always, you're going to get in your car & drive to Lahaina anyway, so really the extra ten minutes is not even an issue, so it's not the deal breaker by any means. You've got three places to stay in Maui, assuming you're not ruffing it. Waialea, Kaanapalli or Kapalua. For us, Walalea is beautiful, but too too far removed from Kaanapalli or Lahaina. It's a 40 minute drive & if you're having a few maitais later in the evening at Cheeseburger in Paradise, that doesn't work well. So you're down to Kaanapalli or Kapalua. Yes, there's more action on Kaanapalli beach, and the weather is a bit more predictable, but you do have to like one hotel after another, on top of each other. Don't get me wrong. It's a beautiful beach & view, but it's the hotel zone and it's all hotels. Aside from hotel restaurants and of course the Hula Grill, (personal fav), there's not much to choose from for great dining. Roy's is moving from Kahana to the Kaanapalli golf course, so that will add some destination dining to Kaanapalli. So with that being said, you have to drive anyway, so Kapalua is really not a big deal, like some say. As far as the weather? Depending on the day, the winds can and do get a bit much. It didn't chase us away from the pool, it just made it a bit challenging to read a newspaper, etc. But out of eight days, 3 days were windy and the rest were absolutely perfect! So don't get your undies too much in a bunch over this. The Kapalua area is quiet, serene & absolutely georgous! It's quiet, but you have Kaanapalli & Lahaina for everything else. We did see some families there but not that much. They keep the shorties in kids pools & maintain one pool for adults, which is really nice. Kaanapalli is full of families which is fine. If you're paying $500 a day at the Ritz, frankly.....keep those kids away! Sorry Mom & Dad, this is Maui, leave those kids with the inlaws & enjoy your vacation! You can always load up the station wagon and drive to Disney World with those things. There should be an age restriction, like 21 or older to come to Maui. Just a thought.... Anyway, after being cautious from reading the reviews of the Ritz and the Kapalua area and staying at the hotel, I can tell you, that if you want service, attentiveness, peace, tranquility, beauty and the overall experience, do stay at the Ritz. You always have Lahaina for restaurants and a little partying and the beach at Kaanapalli for that and all those shorties who should have stayed at home! We're already booking our return at the Ritz Kapalua for next year. Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: Melissa L
Reviews.Content: You can't beat this hotel. The grounds are fantastic - you basically have a private beach. There are 3 gorgeous pools and one of them is adults only! Our room was beautiful - it was a nice size with a balcony overlooking the golf course. Our bathroom was very nice and a good size. The grounds are immaculate and the service is phenomenal. We enjoyed every minute of our stay. There are tennis and basketball courts if you want something different to do. There is also a free shuttle around the Kapalua area to take you to other beaches or to restaurants in Napili. Bonus - The Banyan Tree restaurant on their property is amazing. Also, the Honolua Store (walking distance) is a great alternative for a quick (and cheap) meal.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and attentive staff”
Reviews.Author: Twisted C
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from Jan 28th-Jan 31st. If youâ€™re looking for a beautiful hotel with friendly and attentive staff then I would suggest this hotel to you. I liked the fact that every time we left the property or came back we were always greeted from the valet staff with a "Have a great day" or "Welcome backâ€�. We stayed in a deluxe ocean view. The room was beautiful and spacious with a gorgeous bathroom. There is a short walk down the hill to the beach. The pools were sparkling clean with very few people in them.. I would suggest this hotel to any of my friends or family.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: californiagal62
Reviews.Content: We visited The Ritz January 2012. We found everything very fine. We appreciated the empty refrigerator in our room so we could store our own things in it. We appreciated the water bottles left each day as well. The bed was very comfortable. The deck was lovely and also relaxing to sit and enjoy the view. The staff were very helpful and friendly and did greet us with "aloha". We treated ourselves to staying on the club level and thought it was very nice. A chief on staff for the evening appetizers made them special and delicious. One evening barbecue pork on chips, delicious. Another evening grilled scallops. The Hotel is a bit set back from the ocean but the view is still spectacular. There are nice paths you can walk along the ocean although they are rocky at times and not recommended for elderly or those with balance issues. We also appreciated the self parking, easy to get to and always able to find a space. We thought the shops had nice things and we did purchase a few things with the $100.00 daily credit we received (because we were on the club level). We also had a deal if we stayed 4 nights we got the 5th night free. Our "special vacation" is not going to be repeated anytime soon but we loved being able to relax and enjoy the beautiful Maui Island at the comfortable Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent !”
Reviews.Author: amol p
Reviews.Content: Truly worthy of it's lofty name. What an experience.... one of the most beautiful resorts I've been to. We had the lowest priced room on the property and yet the room was lavishly appointed and luxurious. The staff was extremely helpful and super nice. Parking was a bit expensive but definitely not a blip on on otherwise extravagant affair. The pools were pristine and the proximity to your own private beach.... can't get better. The spa services were expensive and we did not sign up for those so can't really comment. The resort itself is part of a much larger property in Kapalua which is a scenic vista of various properties and restaurants overlooking the pacific. The views are breathtaking from anywhere on the property. A shuttle bus is available anywhere you need to go within the Kapalua properties. We rented a car for the whole week so did not utilise the shuttle services as much. Car rental is required though if you plan to visit Lahaina town or Kaanapali beach. It's only about a 5 - 10 min drive which is beautiful in it's own way. All in all a truly memorable experience ... can't wait to go back next year !

Reviews.Title: “Great place, as always”
Reviews.Author: Hb51travel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here before and is has always been great. This time I was part of a large group. The 2012 Hyundai Pro Am golf tournament. From the minute I arrived at the airport to the minuteI left the service was 100 plus procent. The food and service was great,looking forward to my next stay here

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here the location is not good”
Reviews.Author: BandAHarrington
Reviews.Content: We do not recommend this hotel. The cleaning staff and breakfast staff were excellent as the banyan tree staff, otherwise we were incredibly dissappointed. The concierge was particularly poor. We had to drive to other parts of Maui to enjoy our stay. Because the ritz is on a hill, it was a completely different day at the hotel- much cooler than other parts of Maui. Plus it was at least double in cost for everything. It is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, not "stuffy"”
Reviews.Author: WAREAGLE92
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week-long stay at the Ritz Kapalua for a conference. It takes about an hour to drive to the hotel from the airport (you go south from airport and then follow the west coast north to Kapalua). We stopped at the Safeway in Lahaina to pick up some food and drinks to keep in the room. No problems with checkin. We had a mandatory porterage fee which paid for them to take our luggage to the room and then to pick it up at the end of the visit---not sure if this is for all of the rooms or just my particular package. Our room was lovely! The bedding was heavenly, and the bathroom was big. We had a mini-fridge and a coffee service area. The room attendants were always friendly, saying "aloha" every time you passed them in the hall. We laid out by the pool several times: always available chairs and once again, pool attendants were always ready to assist you in setting up your chair. My husband did not care for the Hawaiian music that they played through the speakers around the pool, but we managed to find chairs away from them and just used our ipods. The beach is a 5 minute walk and is downhill getting there. There is a golf cart that will take guests back up to the hotel if you're not inclined to walk it. Now, on to restaurants: The Terrace---breakfast buffet or menu, but items are so expensive that you might as well pay full price and get the whole buffet ($30 per person). We splurged on the first day and the last day but then either went to the Honolua store or just ate food we had bought at the Safeway for the other days. If you do eat the buffet, you will be so full that you don't need to lunch anyway, which makes the cost even out a little. Kai: my husband and I had the California Roll and the Tuna Roll there one night and thought that it was very good. Pool bar: decent lunch menu if you don't want to leave the general pool area, but it IS the Ritz in Maui so it's going to be pricey. These were the only restaurants I visited while on property. Please see my separate reviews on Sansei, Lahaina Grill, Honolua Store, Lahaina pizza, Maui Brewing Co., and Old Lahaina Luau. Other aspects of our stay: the shopping at the Ritz was way out of my price range but they had lovely things. We all bought a Ritz Carlton hat at the Souvenir Shop. Checkout: we got a late checkout because our flight wasn't until 9pm. And by late, I mean 4pm! They were super-nice about it and probably would have let us stay later but we needed to go anyway. Also, when our server at the pool bar found out we were going to be leaving, she brought us a free dessert. Also, we printed out our boarding passes at the business center...easy as pie! In summary, this is an expensive property that normally I could not have afforded, but we got a discounted rate due to the conference I was attending. It is beautiful and well-maintained, with an extremely friendly staff. It is isolated but I felt very safe there. And the drive to Lahaina is not bad at all. I would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found”
Reviews.Author: travelin4funfools
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel last February. From the moment we got to the hotel until the time we left we felt like we were home. The staff was superb and the rooms are excellent and the food is very good. There is a nice jogging path along the beach and although the beach is a bit of a distance from the hotel it is very private and secluded. I was not able to golf this time, but I look forward to returning and trying the course. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, it is one of the finest on the island and Iâ€™m afraid this one spoiled me.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel/Undesirable location”
Reviews.Author: CCNYC80
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 1 year wedding anniversary in Maui and we stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua. To be fair to readers as well as the hotel, I am going to review the hotel and location separately. The hotel: The hotel itself was incredible. The rooms were spacious and clean and the hotel grounds were gorgeous. We had no complaints regarding service here as it was exceptional. Our bellman, Ken, was especially attentive. While showing us our room he inquired as to what brought us to Hawaii. When we told him it was our anniversary he casually asked what day we got married - we obviously thought nothing of it. A few days later on our anniversary, champagne and chocolate covered strawberries were delivered to our room courtesy of Ken. It was so kind of him to make a point to remember our anniversary and to make such a beautiful gesture. It was these small touches that made our stay at the Ritz a pleasure. We ate the breakfast buffet every morning, which was delicious albeit a bit expensive. We were prepared for this, though - we were staying at the Ritz after all. The only complaint was sometimes the services was a bit slow. We enjoyed dinner on the property twice. The sushi restaurant was good, but nothing spectacular so I would pass on it. The Banyan Tree, however, was probably the best meal we had the entire trip. It was delicious and worth every penny - do not miss out on eating here. A few final notes on the hotel. Don't bother with valet parking. The parking lot is so close and its worth saving a few extra dollars to park your car yourself. Also, I read a lot of reviews where people were complaining about the far walk to the beach. Its not that bad and a little walking could do everyone some good. If it bothers you, though, you can grab one of the golf carts to take you back to the main hotel. I always saw them around. The location: Unfortunately for the Ritz, my husband and I had a huge problem with where the hotel was located. The weather is incredibly unpredictable and windy. Sitting by the pool in the afternoon was often chilly and it didn't make it pleasant to sit on the beach. Plus, rain showers happened quite often. My husband and I decided to buy cheap beach chairs at the Wal-Mart and drove 15 minutes down the road to Ka'anapali beach. Although it was only a few miles away, it was always beautiful weather despite the rain and wind we had just left behind at the Ritz. This beach was amazing and it was worth the effort to drive down and find parking. I would also recommend renting snorkeling gear if you go to Ka'anapali beach since there is snorkeling right off the beach and you'll often see amazing things like huge sea turtles. Because of the crazy weather in Kapalua, we never spent any time at the Ritz recreationally. It really is unfortunate that such a beautiful hotel has such a significant downside that they can't fix. I'm not sure if I would recommend this hotel to friends because of this. If you rather a nice hotel and you don't mind having to drive, park and walk to the beach everyday then you should stay here. If location is more important to you then I would look into one of the resorts on Ka'anapali beach knowing that the hotel is probably not the 5 star experience you'd receive at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service! Amazing Place”
Reviews.Author: builder88
Reviews.Content: My wife and I picked the Ritz Carlton in Hawaii to go on our baby-moon at the beginning of January. It was our first trip to Hawaii and it was well worth it. Upon arriving at the resort, they upgraded us to a suite which was very appreciated. One thing that I was not pleased with was that we had booked an ocean view and the suite was not, I asked the bell hop and he told me I could see the ocean if I went out on the balcony and looked to the side, not worth arguing about to me, but it is nice to see the ocean. The resort is set up in a way that there are no real great ocean views in most of the rooms. The staff was excellent. We have been to the bahamas multiple times and we love the Caribbean, but there was no slow service here. Everyone was very friendly and if you have a problem they address it right away. The main beach is a bit rough, fun for me but not for a pregnant wife. The great thing is there is another 3 beaches all within walking distance that are much calmer and are great beaches. My favorite was the Beach at Napili Bay. It is only about a 15 minute walk away. There is a great walking trail that you can take that goes up and down cliffs and there are amazing views. We walked this trail almost everyday. The food was expensive but great, we booked the room with the breakfast buffet that was included and it was well worth it. You could order anything off the menu but the options for the buffet were great. We did not do too many activities, but there are many things to do on the Island. Bottom line is you get what you pay for. This is a great spot, with great service and amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Concierge Level”
Reviews.Author: JO3Esq
Reviews.Content: Due to a lucky break, my wife and I were upgraded to the Concierge Level. The staff, especially Leslie, was great in helping us plan to do things during our honeymoon. In the morning, Leslie was always sure to have coffee and pog juice waiting for us at our table overlooking the hotel. The gorgeous views as well as the discounts to play at the Plantation Couse was worthwhile. We also enjoyed our roomservice experience. We made sure to take advantage of the pools, beaches, and restaurants on the grounds. In fact, some of our favorite times was relaxing at the concierge lounge with the chef presentations, drinks, and assorted snacks. However, when we were ready to take a trip on the Road to Hana or see the sunrise on the top of Mt. Hakeakala, the concierge level packed us a lunch and put it in a cooler. Overall, this is by far the best hotel experience we have ever had. We have stayed at nice hotels with impeccible service, but none have even come remotely close to the experience we had at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. We cannot return soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, unless you need some shade”
Reviews.Author: janelitamirta
Reviews.Content: This is perfect service in Paradise. Just in case it has not been mentioned by others (I have not read the reviews lately): this is the best room service I ever had. The quality of the food is outstanding and the convenience (with a small child) irresistible. My only complaint: shade is at a premium, and premium means $100 to $300 for cabanas available for day rental. There are plenty of chairs and a never ending supply of towels, but I had to leave the children swimming pool because of the three chairs (partly) shaded two have been taken by an older couple who was looking for shade. Another morning I "borrowed" a shaded chair but had to give it up when the family that was using it before me came back. The beach (a short walk away) is beautiful, but there no umbrellas. This is a problem for families with young children or anybody worried about UV. I with the hotel were as generous with shade as they are with everything else.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for listening to our feedback!!”
Reviews.Author: jetsetter7981
Reviews.Content: We are currently in Maui, staying the nearby Bay Villas (review to come), where we have access to the Ritz pool. We stayed at the Ritz the last time we were here (Sept 2009). Since we didn't stay here this time, I won't post a lengthy review, but just wanted to point out a few changes that were extremely positive. The last time we were here and staying at the Ritz, we were extremely annoyed about having to rent our own beach chairs and haul them down to the beach everyday- thought this was tacky and quite a shock given the cost of the hotel stay. We also were a bit annoyed by the kids at the pool, but felt this wasn't something you can ever avoid at a beach resort. We did comment on both of these things on our checkout survey. Well, here we are again and guess what- there is now an adults only pool area, and beach chairs provided to guests, to be used at the Ritz or that can be signed out for the day!!! Thank you for listening!! Rates were a bit too high for our stay this time, but when we can we will be sure to return!!

Reviews.Title: “Details, details, details. You get what you pay for.”
Reviews.Author: Hiker100
Reviews.Content: First off, I have never stayed at a Ritz Carlton or similar level of luxury hotel so I was reluctant to even spend the discounted $350/night even if it was for a good friend's wedding there. As expected , the property was beautiful but what really stood out to me was the personalized service. From the valet to the maids and everyone in between, the genuinely friendly service and attention to your needs caught me by surprise. I truly felt welcomed and attended to every moment I was on the property. It really made me feel at home and welcome. At the end of the day, the property was probably similar to many of the nicer Hawaiian hotels but it was the service and personnel that set them apart. I felt the company really fostered a culture of sincerity and service among their employees. If I were to run a hospitality based company, I would model it after the Ritz Kapalua. I think if you have the budget and want a truly memorable experience for a special occasion, this would be the place you need to visit. A few other recommendations. Fly into Kapalua airport which is 3 miles away as opposed to the main airport on Maui which is about an hours drive. Really saves you time and money. Also be sure to check out Kapalua Golf School and the golf courses. Excellent instruction worth the cost and of course breath taking scenery on the greens.

Reviews.Title: “Great Maui Hotel”
Reviews.Author: tonytigerjaz
Reviews.Content: I was here on business. It was my first visit to Maui. I rented a car and drove to the hotel. It was a great drive along the coast. The hotel and location was great with a great pool and some great views of the beach area. I enjoyed the open hotel lobby feel and the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Very Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mimmo4244
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean view suite & truly enjoyed it while we had breakfast each am. The staff treated us excellently. We were greeted from start to finish by very friendly people who were there to make your stay fantastic. The pool area was kept very clean,neat & well stocked with needed supplies. The staff always were there for any need & they were friendly with great smiles. We will return to enjoy this great experience again.

Reviews.Title: “High quality, far from everything”
Reviews.Author: Dsullivan-76
Reviews.Content: Everything you'd expect a ritz-Carlton to be. First class all the way. World class golf right out your door. Great pool and beach. Great food nearby, and you can use a free shuttle to reach them. Drawback: driving distances to essentially everything else on Maui. There's basically one road in west Maui, circling the mountains, so it takes four times as long to go east as it would as the crow flies. Almost 2 hrs to Haleakala and I-don't-wanna-know to Hana. Judging by the clientele at the pool, there must have been some sort of tattoo convention in town that week.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property and exceptional service”
Reviews.Author: Chantae
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for the first time this past November. We had originally booked a Marriott property, but after discovering renovations were underway, we cancelled our reservation and chose the Ritz instead. We arrived after midnight and had a quiet drive from the airport to the hotel. Although the bellmen were gone for the night, the self-parking lot was close enough it was little inconvenience. In fact, we continued to self-park for the entire trip. The front desk staff was very welcoming and an employee even walked us to our beautiful ocean-view room. The furnishings were very comfortable and I loved the decor, dark wood with subtle island touches. The mini fridge was a plus and we had plenty of room to relax while listening to the waves. We found the entire property to be very well maintained, beautiful, and quiet. This was a trip for relaxation and the Ritz delivered. Every employee we encountered was friendly and professional. I have Celiac disease and must eat gluten free and the Ritz was beyond accommodating of my dietary restriction. I had inquired about food offerings before making a reservation and was assured my needs could be met. Upon check-in I found I had been flagged for needing gluten-free food and every dining experience was exceptional. We enjoyed daily breakfast at the hotel and the chef came out each time to tell me which items would be safe for me to eat. They even provided gluten-free waffles. Room service and pool-side dining was equally accommodating and delicious. I was treated so well and having been able to enjoy so many meals on-property means more than I can say. The pool area was relaxing with the beach a short walk away. There was often an employee driving up and down the hill to the beach in a golf cart offering rides as well. The hotel is in a very private area without any other hotels nearby. We liked the seclusion. We had a car and ate dinner at various places on the island throughout our stay. Each time we returned we were so glad to be coming back to the Ritz. The only downside to our trip was the wind, which was obviously beyond the control of the hotel staff. Several times at the pool we had to literally hold on to our towels and drinks so they wouldn't fly across the deck. We thought it was probably seasonal, but as we drove further south down the coastline the wind became noticeably calmer to non-existent. Several people told us it was due to the location of the hotel in terms of weather patterns. That being said, the privacy, beauty and exceptional service we found at the Ritz far outweighed any discomfort we experienced from the weather. We had a very relaxing vacation and would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Jeness B
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our entire wedding party in Jan 2012. Even though we booked through Travelocity, the Ritz was more than happy to accomodate our requests to have pool and/or ocean-view rooms. They're always pleasant and want to make sure that your stay is what you want it to be! They aspire to perfection. The Banyan Tree restaurant is amazing! We ate at Plantation House (Kapalua) and Merriman's Restaurant (Kapalua) and The Banyan Tree was by far the most delicious! Rumor has it an 'Iron Chef' is the chef there. The pool is amazing! So much so, that you could spend the whole day there and not even need to go to the beach (although there is one right on the property). Nearby is wonderful bays including Kapalua Bay where you can snorkel. There are also many hikes with amazing views! You have awesome views of the island of Molokai from Kapalua Bay. We got married at Kapalua Bay and everyone stayed at the Ritz. Everyone had a great time! There is also a shuttle that can take you to any of the Kapalua sites, restaurants while you are there that is free. 5 minutes north of Kaanapali and 10 minutes north of Lahaina. About an hour from the airport. This was our second time staying there and would definitely do it again! More private than Kaanapali or Lahaina if you are looking for less touristy, serene environment, which is why we chose it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Painahimah
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua December 19th to December 27th. It was a wonderful trip! I shared a room with a friend and the beds were wonderfully comfortable. The bathroom is nice and large, and clearly well maintained. We never had issue with water in the shower running cold, even at peak times, and the toiletries stocked in the bathroom were absolutely amazing. I had to use lots of conditioner during my stay due to the salt water, and just left a note and a tip for the maid and was left with plenty to use and even take a bit home. Our room was the closest to the elevator on our floor, and we still rarely heard a peep out of anyone the entire time. Most of our room time was spent in blissful silence! The hotel looks and feels luxurious without being over the top. During our stay we got the "cabanas" by the ocean instead of by the pool and it was well worth it. Covered and very comfortable chairs, plus half a pineapple and a cooler with water and sodas were provided each day. The wait staff was absolutely wonderful, they were polite and courteous, and wouldn't bother you if you were napping or engrossed in a good book. All of the food at the hotel was lovely. We had the breakfast buffet a couple of times but after going to Longhi's in Lahaina we decided to make that trip each morning for breakfast instead. It was half the price of the buffet, and the crab cakes benedict should not be missed. There was also a Christmas Eve prix fixe dinner arranged that was fairly good. Our derver seemed to be new, he brought out completely wrong bottles of wine twice. (Ordered a red, he brough two different bottles of white before he realized his error). There was a power outage during our meal, but the employees managed it quite well. A five mile stretch of the island was without power for around 45 minutes, so my friend and I fled to our room to soak up the stars on our balcony. It was absolutely amazing with no light pollution. The beach has lovely, soft sand and wonderful views. It is a bit of a walk down to the beach but is worth it to take in the fresh air, enjoy the breeze, and walk off some of the calories from all the great food! They also have a golf cart that runs up and down hill all day. My only complaint is the bar and food service on the beach stops VERY early. The hours are 11a-3p, and we often wanted to stay at the beach until 4:30p to take everything in. Overall, I would most definitely go again.

Reviews.Title: “Service and Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Much2Learn
Reviews.Content: We snagged a great price online then upgraded after we arrived to an ocean view suite. It has been heavenly. The weather was cool and windy here yesterday, so we spent several hours on our lanai, protected from the elements but enjoying views of the pool and the surf. The spacious luxury of our room was fabulous. Every hotel employee treated us like esteemed relatives. Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday Week Review and Debunk”
Reviews.Author: LKB113
Reviews.Content: Reviewing anything over 1K reviews I always feel like is gilding the lily, but having just returned from Kapalua and baffling over a few reviews I feel like I'd like to put my own opinions out there. Take them or leave them! First the good, or rather a "I'm not sure how your experience could be so different" response to some of the posts I've read. Perhaps that'll even the field for those looking at recent reviews to make their decision on whether to stay. First the staff, were very attentive, helpful, capable, and in the case of the pool staff, waitstaff and bar staff really good humored. As for their age I'm sure some of them were in their twenties but none of them had any sort of 'better than thou' attitude, at all (can't say the same for our waiter at Merriman's though, which is not part of the Ritz). Listen I don't know whether they were all Hawaiian, because I didn't ask, I have friends (more than four!) I know from growing up who were Hawaiian, two were red headed and less than five feet four, pale enough to burn on a cloudy day, so I think it's just plain silly to just say the staff isn't Hawaiian. If you want something really Hollywood "Hawaiian" go hang out at the Hawaiian cultural center on Oahu and make orchid leis all week, I mean really... Secondly, "how much is this vacation going to cost?" (incredulously). It's the Ritz Carlton so, over and above your room cost, well...a lot. It's not Sandals. If you want all inclusive don't stay here. Conservatively, it's going to cost about 300.00 more a day without all meals on property, obviously. Thirdly, if you want to vacation somewhere that absolutely guarantees no wind and unchanging weather, try the moon. That said it was 'breezy' at the beach and one day out of seven at the pool. It sprinkled (that's even too strong of a word for it) once for ten minutes while we were there. It made me frown for a minute or two, not enough to ruin my vacation, but then again I'm not too sensitive. Wind factor - never enough that a half full paper cup would have been knocked over. Lastly, the beach. Is less than a quarter mile in 'paradise' too long or you to walk? Then the beach is too far for you. No serious mobility issues and able to walk for more than 4.5 minutes at a leisurely pace? Good, you're cool. As for the roughness of the water I will say this, the waves break really close to shore, so for wading up to your knees whilst drunk and with poor balance to begin with I wouldn't recommend. But as the waves break really close to the shore it's super easy to get past the break and swim around happily. If you aren't cool with a small wave break in Hawaii - find a place with a lagoon. People were snorkeling on the beach, does that give you a better idea as to how rough the water was? That's right, it wasn't. Oh yes, and every single night in the lobby there was a different entertainer. Ukulele, guitar, Jazz trio etc. Ok and here's my whiny part. The PGA tournament of champions was occurring at the hotel the first three days of our stay, and it actually was kind of an inconvenience. I really do think that hotels should have a policy, just as with construction, for when something like this is happening that they notify guests beforehand because it really does feel like you are crashing someone else's party. Not only that there was a back up consistently at valet and the shuttles were running about fifteen minutes late. Was relieved when they finally left. What else? Fabulous week! I would stay again, though would never pay the rack rate (or more than 450 for that matter). I especially liked the fact that there were less families though the resort was perfectly family friendly, very quiet, very relaxing. Though I hear over Christmas and School breaks it gets a little nuts, but that's to be expected. Oh and a final word of advice, fly into Kapalua if you can! 8 minute shuttle ride to the airport - and you only have to be there 30 minutes prior to departure on the way out.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Stay”
Reviews.Author: Trent C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted to stay at a luxury resort as it was our Honeymoon. She had heard of Unforgettable Honeymoons via the Dr. Phil Show. We inquired through Unforgettable Honeymoons and they recommended the Ritz. The price was a bit out of our price range but we decided to go with it anyways for the honeymoon experience. I had previously worked for 12 years at a 5 Diamond property in Scottsdale, AZ so I knew the expectations that we would experience. Upon arrival we were welcomed and Bellman (Ken) escorted us to the FD for check-in then he took us to our room and answered all of our questions fully. Our room was very beautiful although it didn't have much of a view. For our honeymoon we didn't have a room with an ocean view which was disappointing but we were at the various beaches everyday to experience what they all had to offer. We snorkeled almost everyday off Black Rock, Makena Beach, Napili Bay and Oneola Bay. A nice touch in our room upon arrival was that there was a note from our booking agent at Unforgettable Honeymoons and the Ritz, Welcoming us along with a plate of chocolate covered strawberries. Our package included the daily breakfast which was absolutely amazing. We were very happy with the availability of everything. They have pretty much anything you would ever want and if they don't have it, they'll get it for you. Plus the view from the dining room was beautiful as you can see the ocean in the distance through the pool palm trees. We used the Concierge services quite often as we booked a Luau, Zipline Adventure (unfortunately it got canceled due to weather), and Teralani Sailing to see the whales. They are very knowledgeable about local offerings and the best bang for your buck. It is a good thing we had a rental car because the Ritz is it's own little oasis. The Ritz is the most northern place on West Maui. In order to get to the other areas south of us it is a good 15-20 minute drive.

Reviews.Title: “Kid Freindly but still romantic enough with a gorgeous setting”
Reviews.Author: willhclark
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua twice in last 6 months and overall was satisfied with my stay. It's not the Four Season on Lania but is still nice getaway. Pro's: Beautiful lawns and beach (though it requires a healthy walk or golf cart ride to get to) They discourage drinking on the beach here but it's and very very nice pool area which most Hawaiin hotels, 5 star resorts, do not have anything even remotely approaching. Great Golf course and great neighborhood and the Hawaiian burialground nearby provides a nice cultural experience.Our server swam out to bring us drinks in the middle of pool numerous times. The staff is very freindly. Perhaps not freindly as as the Four Seasons but still very nice. The entry to the Ritz Carlton at Kapalua is not impressive and somewhat disorganized so they sometimes fail to properly greet newly arriving guests with Lei's and pineapple juice. But they offered to upgraded me to an ocean view at no charge since they had extra rooms available. The hotel is very kid freindly with a jungle gym by one of the pools but this makes it annoying if your a couple in pursuite of romance. Couple the horde of children with thin walls and you have a very noisy place but the breathtaking views, beach, pool, and other services made up for it. Our first stay was on a July 4th weekend which I'm sure accounted for the numerous kids and even then it was not intolerable. Dinner at the Banyan Tree was very good. 3 1/2 star...The portions were patheticly small but I really liked the bread and seasoning that came with it. The Chef has a unique style and the service ranged from excellent to rude. Our servers were great but the doorman nearly assaulted us when we apparently entered through the wrong door. The front door is in the back next to the bathrooms. Breakfast was good but chaotic and very noisy. Room service was very prompt and well done. Make sure to eat at Merrimans Resteraunt down the road for a true 5 star dining experience with fresh, locally grown ingredients and a breathtaking sunset. The building is dressed up like a Ritz and very well maintained but the basic construction of the building is cheap, with gaudy pastels, and thin walls which make it very noisy. This along with allot of kids which can detract from adult romance but it's still a great experience and for half the price of the Four Seasons on East Maui which has an inferior beach and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Is Not A Favorite of Ours...Either Is This Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: OahuHawaii
Reviews.Content: We LOVE Hawaii, though Maui is NOT a favorite. Too many mainlanders, west coast people, etc. You do not see any Hawaiians on this island for sure. Anyway, we stayed 5 nights. Kapalua is way north and does NOT have the best weather on the island. It is misty, rainy, windy, cloudy and overcast MANY days. Quite a drive from Kahalui airport...almost one hour. 2 lane road. Got there...it was nice and thought it would really be something special. Well, front desk check-in was a joke. Thought they were doing us some favor by waiting on us. Yeh know...20somethings who think THEY are fab because they WORK at a great location, store, etc. Hope we weren't like that when we were that age...well, we KNOW we weren't. Lobby is lovely with a most magnificent view of the Pacific Ocean. Our room was nice size and well kept, even though we had the least expensive room listed. Beautiful decor, bathroom was large with all the expected amenities. Very hot in bathroom though(no vents). Get down to what matters most...the pool and beach. VERY windy...almost so that umbrellas could not be put up. And, there were not that many umbrellas to be put up. Beach is very small with a handful of lounges...water is rough, something either of us would not venture into. And, it was aways from the pool area...they do have a cart that will take you. Walk back up hill would be pretty bad. Pool is tiered and quite lovely and large. But, there was no entertainment(music) or anything. MANY resorts in Hawaii have music poolside to make your time special...and for you to know you are in Hawaii. Sadly, not the case here. Came around with pineapple, wet towels, etc. All by 20somethings from the mainland. Food and drink were overpriced, even by Hawaii prices. Service was happy, but not fast. Most everything is a very good drive from here. Certainly, not a place to see alot. We enjoyed it, but we would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: Marfak
Reviews.Content: This was my 18th vacation on the Islands and my first stay at this hotel. This is in the top 4 of the places at which I have stayed and I would stay there again without reservation. (The other 3 are Kona Village which is being rebuilt, the Princeville on Kauai and the Hyatt on Poipu Beach on Kauai.) First of all, the RItz Carlton service and hospitality are on display 24/7. People here are genuinely nice, they are always smiling, and everyone on the staff always said "aloha" to us whenever we were in their general vicinity. Second, the rooms are very nice, very clean and very comfortable. Facilities are in tip-top shape. Third, the Club Lounge is fantastic and well worth the upgrade. The staff are kind, helpful and attentive. The food is amazing: we wound up eating dinner there for all but 3 nights because the food was so good. The various kinds of baked brie were to die for. Fourth, due to the configuration of the hotel the "ocean view" rooms only have ocean views from the lanai. No worries there. Open the sliding door and listen to the surf pound at night. Oh, and we saw whales from the lanai almost every day -- including a great tail flapping and breaching show one afternoon. Finally, the location is great: close to Slaughterhouse each and other nice snorkeling beaches, close to Kaanapali, and close to Lahaina. Yes, there is a walk to the beach. But you can sign out beach chairs and towels. If you are upset about walking to the beach stay at the Royal Hawaiian on Oahu. Not a problem for me. Yes, the weather can be rainy and windy. So on those days drive south as we did. No worries there. There are only two restaurants for dinner, both of which are great (but expensive) but there are many restaurants in the area and you could upgrade to the club lounge and eat there as we did. Bottom line: I give this resort my 100% endorsement. What a great vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in the world!”
Reviews.Author: Rebecca O
Reviews.Content: My family and I go here every year, we all love it so much. The staff is amazing and the hotel is beautiful. Right on the beach, golf cars take you up and down from the hotel. Dont miss the spa!!! Best massages of my life!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing vacation at Ritz - loved the Club Level!”
Reviews.Author: trmwilliams
Reviews.Content: I'm a little tardy with my review but wanted to post my two cents worth. The hotel and grounds are beautiful as everyone has said. The walk to the very nice beach is not that bad and yes, the weather can be rainy and windy. We were there in July and had light rain almost every morning but it blew out and then was pretty nice the rest of the day. We thought the rain kept things cooler than some of the other sunnier parts of the island. We stayed on the club level and we felt it was worth every penny. They have an extensive offering of food all day (breakfast, lunch, late afternoon appetizers and evening desserts). Also, all drinks, including alcohol, were included. If you wanted fancy drinks like Pina Colada's, etc. you had to get those at the bar downstairs or by the pool. Also, you can't take the alcoholic drinks out of the club (Hawaii law, I guess). The service in the club was amazing! The pool area only has a minimal number of chairs with umbrellas that you can use for free. You can pay extra for a cabana or mini-cabana but we didn't think it was worth it. The free locations are generally the first to go so be prepared to get up early to reserve them if you need to have shade. Just know that whatever you leave on the chair will probably get wet due to the early morning showers. Also, the middle section of the pool area is reserved for adults. We did see several kiddies get asked to leave by the pool attendants so it appears the rule is enforced. The other thing we loved was the shuttle to the surrounding restaurants. We used this many times and found it to be great. We never waited longer than 10 minutes for a shuttle and when you get close to finishing your meal, let your server know and they will arrange for the shuttle to pick you up. Another great thing to do was the zipline tour. Hubby and daughter thought it was a blast. You are able to walk from the hotel to the tour operator in less than 5 minutes and they even provided rain jackets for the tour so you didn't have to haul your own stuff. We would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quiet, relaxing, upscale trip. Anyone who wants a lot of activities and night life should probably go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxing, but not over the top”
Reviews.Author: AbiLP
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the first half of our honeymoon. We chose to visit Maui because we wanted to end our honeymoon in Napa and we wanted to have the option of adventure if we got bored with laying by the pool. Overall, we had a wonderful experience at this hotel. The bedroom and bathroom were well-maintained and very clean (which is, of course, to be expected at a Ritz). The style is very simple though, so if you're looking for a modern and trendy room, or something over the top with luxury, this is not the hotel for you. While planning our trip, we struggled with staying here or at the Four Seasons in Wailea. We thought the Four Seasons would be a little more decadent and "at-your-service." But when we learned that the Four Seasons shares their beach with the #1 family resort in Maui, we opted for the Ritz to have a more romantic honeymoon. While in Maui, we checked out the Four Seasons, and we were glad with our decision. The Four Seasons is in a "hotel row," and right next to a huge mall (even if it is high-end shopping, I don't want to vacation next to a mall.) We've heard the Four Season's has an adult pool and staff come around with frozen grapes, mist you water, etc etc. The Ritz did not have these services. We were certainly bummed, but it didn't ruin our vacation. We had a wonderful experience at the Ritz spa, that made up for the simplicity of the pool service. We did a couples package and we enjoyed every minute of it. Everything was very clean and the staff were friendly and knowledgeable. But, the real shining star was the concierge. We stayed on the club level and had our own concierge- they booked everything for us, gave us tips, maps, and even a CD to play on the Road to Hana that tells you when to stop and explains what you're looking at.
