They weren't too much help when we wanted to know where to get the best local food, but when we found out from our instructor at Maui Paddle Sports, they were extremely interested in getting a copy of our restaurant list in case anyone else inquired (apparently most people staying at the Ritz don't ask about the best food trucks for a mix plate). All-in-all, we had a vacation mixed with relaxation and adventure, and were very satisfied with our Ritz Carlton, Kapalua pick.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise with local flavor, excellent food and service”
Reviews.Author: cashindellus
Reviews.Content: We went to Hawaii for the first time and stayed in the gorgeous resort area of Kapalua, on the north west corner of Maui where you get the lush feel of Old Hawaii, rather than the Silicon Valley West feel of the Wilea resorts like the Four Seasons. Kapalua's weather is not quite as good as Wilea, but the wide open spaces and lack of crowding, and the huge resort property, made us feel we made the right decision. Fabulous Asian restaurant in Kapalua, Sansei, and we loved the shuttle service that goes around the area, up to a gorgeous hike in a rain forest, and to the world famous Plantation Gold Course where you can have a drink and watch the sun set. Very famous surfing spot is a 10 minute drive and we sat on the rocks and watched the surfers for one afternoon, and now reading Sue Casey's The Wave book in preparation for our return this March. Who says Hawaii is part of the U.S.?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: KLintheSEH
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. This resort is beautiful and well-manicured, as you would expect. The room was exquisite, although it was on the 3rd floor, it was actually ground level with the golf course. I found room service food to be over-rated and not worth the expense; ended up going to the bar for great coffee and light breakfast for less than $20. The waitstaff at breakfast at the bar were fantastic. The pool is nice, although there doesn't seem to be any enforcement of the "adult" pool despite posted signs. One of the reasons I'm giving the hotel 4 stars was that the service at the pool for drinks/lunch was very iffy, and generally not attentive. We did lunch at the beachside cafe several days and found the food there to be awesome. There is a beach that you can walk to that is nice; it does have public access so it can become quite crowded. I did not find the "walk" that others allude to here to be challenging, but there is about a 2-3 minute walk from the pool to the beach, or a 2-3 minute walk from the pool to the lobby. There are golf carts now that will transport guests up and down the trails. I thought the gym was amazing, particularly for a hotel; multiple cardio machines, weight machines, and free weights available. There were also yoga and pilates classes available that I did not take but were well attended. The shops were a bit snooty, particularly the art gallery/store and the women's boutique next to it-staff barely said hello let alone seek to assist, which is a stark contrast to the general warmth and welcome seen throughout most other parts of the hotel. We ate at Merrimans, which we loved; great food, ambience,etc. Outdoor seating right on the beach, highly recommend. We also went to Pineapple Grill one night, good food, very traditional, on the golf course/tennis courts. The trails around the resort (Kapalua) are great; some great ocean/wave views if you head along the boardwalk just outside of the hotel grounds. The most discouraging part of the stay was our experience at the bar in the evening; we had 3 people come over to tell us they would be back to take our drink order; then didn't. We had to basically stop the 3rd person and ask for an order; a 4th waitstaff actually brought the drinks and was not exactly nice. Definitely not what I'd expect from the Ritz, very bad customer service in that respect, which is why I'm giving 4 stars overall.

Reviews.Title: “Ready to go back !!”
Reviews.Author: shaun0063
Reviews.Content: We have been going there for a few winter trip now and each time it has been wonderful. I like it being away from from the little town , we rent a car and just love the fact that we can zip around awhere on the island . The hotel is beautiful and the staff is terrific. Food is at the high end, but you do not have to eat there its your choice. You should try it at least once to see for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “Just misses”
Reviews.Author: CAEB3
Reviews.Content: It's just not up to the standards of Ritz Carlton. When we checked in we were told that the room we had booked and paid for in full two months in advance was not avaiable. She was somewhat amused by the fact that she would be saying that to a lot of people that day. So, my daughter had to sleep on the chaise. It took them 2 days to bring a blanket and pillow. All the service just misses-we had to ask a few times for coffee at breakfast. Lunch at the pool came incomplete. I could go on but it was just disappointing. The golf however, was great and the concierge was terrific

Reviews.Title: “Great Property. Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: drosen85
Reviews.Content: We just landed back in San Francisco after an amazing stay at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. We stayed the week between Christmas and New Yearâ€™s. The most popular week of the year, obviously more expensive given the demand and 100% occupancy. Now for the reviewâ€¦ Unquestionably a five star review. Room quality, public spaces, pool, dining options. All top tier. Beyond that, letâ€™s get to the highlights and things that might excite you about staying at this property. 1. Since we last stayed here, the resort has gone back to Hawaii â€“ years ago, it was frankly too Ritz Carlton. The public spaces might well have been in Buckhead. The new dÃ©cor is casual, light, Hawaiian and comfortably elegant. 2. The latest addition added what are called â€œresidential suites.â€� These rooms are large two-room suites with nicely functioning kitchens (note: stop at Safeway or Whole Foods on your way from the airport for beer, Cokes, Maui potato chips and milk & cookies). For our family of two parents and two teen-agers, absolutely perfect size for comfort and privacy. 3. Itâ€™s worth it to get the breakfast package. The buffet at the Terrace is amazing, filling, and delicious. Youâ€™ll actually save money because youâ€™ll eat so much for breakfast that youâ€™ll skip lunch. (Always worth asking for a club upgrade in lieu of breakfast as it will add the afternoon cocktail snack as well.) 4. Donâ€™t be wary about asking for advice from the bellmen, pool team and concierges. They are knowledgeable and truly enjoy helping guests enjoy their stay more. In fact for those guests who are more independent, they seem to relish in their advice of secret snorkel spots and off-beat poke markets. Just because you are staying at a five star resort, donâ€™t be afraid to go native. 5. Special shout out to Clint at the bell stand. Awesome Dude. You are the best. I hope that you are rewarded a hundred times over for your amazing service. 6. OK, Kapalua is windy â€“ and the clouds that the trade winds bring in are a bit harsher on the property than elsewhere on the island. Bottom line. Enjoy, explore and find total relaxation in this oasis of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Romantic escape in paradise...”
Reviews.Author: SeattleSavvy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for a business-vacation getaway. The hotel is very nice but not over the top in decoration or elegance (like some Ritz Hotels) with the focus on the location with well manicured grounds, a private beach, golf course and nice hiking and running trails which we enjoyed every day we were there. There is plenty to do for couples and adults. Not the best choice for families, however. If we were with our children we would choose a different location due to lack of creative pool areas and kid centered activities. We were greeted in the usual Ritz way-classy and attentive. Our upgraded room had a large balcony overlooking the pool area with a view of the ocean and mountains. A lovely place to watch the sunrise in the morning while we drank our coffee (which they do need to improve on-in room coffee service lacked RItz quality) and watch the sunset at night.. Our room was clean and comfortable yet smaller in size for an upgraded club level room, with a chaise lounge and table w/ chairs. Not over the top like some Ritz rooms. The bed was dream like-I actually slept well it was so comfy. The granite/slate bathroom was very spacious and elegant with a separate shower, bath tub, and toilet area. The bath ammenities were generous and smelled heavenly. I actually purchased the lotion to take home! The housekeeping of our rooms was a little tardy-often it wasn't cleaned until 3 or so in the afternoon. The pools were clean and always had a lounge chairs available with plenty of towels and bar service by accomodating and friendly college aged staff. Definitely geared for adults and not kids...which was perfect for this vacation. The restaurants were good with different dining themes and menus which gave you choices from casual to more formal options. Staff was always accomodating and friendly. We went to the Spa for the hot rock massage which was relaxing with spacious areas to wait for your treatment, despite how busy it was. We were greeted in a professional manner and my massage was given by a massage therapist who has worked at this spa for the last 10 years, so you knew you were in good hands. Overall, we had a relaxing vacation in a lovely location and would return as a couple.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, bad location”
Reviews.Author: Jsfmiami
Reviews.Content: I'm presently staying at the hotel and after 3 days, here would be my top thoughts. 1. The weather here is always an issue. It's either very windy 24/7 or windy cloudy and rainy. According to locals, the hotel sits on the wetest side of the island. So much so that everyday you see tons of guest leaving with towels being given out at valet. Get 10 min from hotel and it's sunny. Go figure. It's like a black cloud is always over the property. 2. The food is bad. We've eaten allover the property including room service and it's just not good. Not to mention very over priced even for a Ritz I.e a waffle with butter $25. 3. Servic is ok, but it seems n many places that the staff just has a care less attitude. It's a very nice property considering the other choices on the island, but if you come get a rental car so you can leave for nicer weather and restaurants. If you are a roombody writing a book...you're fine!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place.....”
Reviews.Author: RJdreams
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the club level with my husband to celebrate my 50th birthday during late October.. It ranks up there as one of our best vacations! The staff went beyond to accommodate us, esp; the club level staff! We took advantage of their excursions through the Ambassadors and they did not disappoint. We experienced one of the best kayak/snorkeling adventures, highly recommended! My husband took advantage of the beach waters @ Fleming Beach and enjoyed body surfing. We love the fact the beach was not crowded at all, as if we had the beach all to ourselves and perhaps 15 others, if that many! Also, the location is close to many hiking destinaton areas as well as other small towns (Lahaina, etc.) which are only a few miles away. We loved the fact that the Ritz was isolated and away from the rest of the other crowded towns nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Snooooozzze....”
Reviews.Author: Midnitesongbird
Reviews.Content: We went here for our honeymoon in September, and seriously, it was so incredibly boring. It is really pretty and has nicely manicured grounds, but geeze...offer some entertainment! The staff was nice and we did the club level (highly recommend club-level, you'll save a ton on food and drinks, and this is the ONLY place we could mingle with anyone). I just found it to be situated in a very boring area and really wasn't thrilled. Maybe I'd enjoy it more in like 60 years when I want to go golfing and talk about chess and the stock market.

Reviews.Title: “YOUR DREAM COME TRUE.....TRULY MAGICAL!”
Reviews.Author: K8EDID
Reviews.Content: This property is so speciall that words are unable to share the true beauty of this magical location. The property is expansive and truly offers you the best of Maui from it's perfect location, to it's beautiful golf course, and amazing private beach! The restaurants on property are lovely yet extremely over-priced! There are many fabulous restaurants within a twenty minute drive so I would encourage you to eat off property! If you are looking for a truly 1st class property, that offers you the best of everything, then you have certainly found it with the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua! I have recommended this property to many of my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: minicooperdad
Reviews.Content: Went here with my wife and toddler. The rooms are very nice, relatively spacious with comfortable beds. We had a nice view of the golf course and well manicured grounds. We also stayed on the concierge level, which I highly recommend. I think it was about $100 extra per night, but it included alcoholic beverages in the Club Room all day, even mimosas for breakfast. There was breakfast lunch and dinner every day in the Club Room too. Well, let me be more detailed. The breakfast was on the continental side, but so much better than your average continental. There was usually one or two hot dishes each morning with a great variety of delicious pastries and fruits. Plus, excellent coffee, lattes, etc. Lunch was a small, but delicious spread, similar to the breakfast routine/layout. Dinner was basically an assortment of cold and hot apps (shrimp, tuna, cheeses, nuts, etc.). The chef would be in the Club Room each night preparing one hot item right in front of you. That would go until about 8, then at 9, the room would reopen for a small assortment of desserts with cordials, etc. Can't recommend it enough! The pool was very nice, but a bit dated. The location is delightful, but the resort does need a complete renovation in the coming years. The beach is on the property but about a 5-10 minute walk from the lobby - quite a beautiful walk though. The beach is very nice. There is a golf course next to the property and some residential townhouses. The walk along the ocean in front of those townhouses is breathtaking. The location is nice. It's about a 15-20 minute right to downtown Lahaina, which is well worth the trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent spot for relaxation and service”
Reviews.Author: MykeMan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 7 nights in November. Even hard-to-please people would have a difficult time complaining about this place, though the location means people who like being in the center of activity should avoid it. Location: The Ritz is located on Kapalua beach, which is about 20 minutes north of Lahaina and 15 minutes north of Kaanapali. It's a touch remote, but is worth it for me as this meant a much quieter vacation. If this are were Las Vegas, Kaanapali would be the strip with reams of people while Kapalua would be a beautiful ranch just outside the city. Service: The only complaint I had in this area was rectified. We had some really slow pool service one day, but when I stood up to flag down the waiter a managerial-type person ran up to me and took care of my order and then attended to those around me who also may have been neglected. Everything else was outstanding. Any questions were asked, and the staff gave me lots of local, inside tips for exploring West Maui. Room: Room was good, but probably if I had to pick a 'low spot' of the trip this would be it. It wasn't very soundproofed as I could hear people chattering in the hall and moving above me. The room had a great patio, but it unfortunately didn't have a light! When the sun goes down at 5:45 this is a must in my opinion. Otherwise the room was great. Nice big TV, great maid service, two free bottles of water everyday. Amenities: The pool here is fantastic. The middle pool is 'adults only', and I did see an attendant kick two kids out of it one day. The beach is extremely close....people who complain about the 'hike' to the beach are absolutely out of their mind. 3 minutes from the Ritz, tops. And it's a beautiful walk over perfectly manicured lawns. The beach itself (DT Fleming) is considered one of the best in Hawaii. It's sheltered so the wind isn't crazy, is nice and calm during low tide for swimming, but perfect during high tide for boogey boarding or surfing. The hotel is also serviced by a Kapalua shuttle, which will take you anywhere in the immediate area for free. This service is also on-demand, which is awesome. Whenever you want it, just speak to a nearby attendant and it will come scoop you up. Ditto for returning, as most of Kapalua seems to service the Ritz. Nearby Services: These were great. Staying at the Ritz is obviously expensive, and eating there only exascrbates this issue. There is a Kapalua 'General Store' about a 5 minute walk away that has a deli, grocery store, and liquor. Given the mini-fridge in the room, you can really make use of this. There's also an excellent Japanese restaurant near the General Store (Sansei), which has quality on-par with the Ritz but prices are about 50% cheaper. Overall this place won me over. It was my first time at the Ritz and certainly won't be my last.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful...if you don't mind the weather.”
Reviews.Author: mrsmichaelene
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spend a week in Maui. We spent the first 3 days in Kapalua at the Ritz and the last 3 days in Wailea at the Fairmont. The Ritz is a beautiful property with wonderful rooms. When we checked in we were instantly upgraded from a terrace room to an oceanfront room. Some of the oceanfront rooms are a bit of a walk from the lobby so if that is an issue make sure you specify the location. Every night we stayed there was a band or singer playing in the lobby so that you could enjoy dinner or drinks to nice music. Room service, concierge, and the maid staff were great. The pools were beautiful and there is a playground area and plenty of grass for kids to play in. In a 2-3 minute walk you can be at a quite, private beach. The scenery around the Ritz is green and lush. If you continue down the highway you can walk through a canopy of trees that opens to a cove where you might spot a few dozen dolphins. You can also stop about a quarter mile past mile marker 31 at the blow hole. All that being said, we found it hard to enjoy all that the Ritz had to offer with the constant wind and occasional downpours. If you have no desire to enjoy the pool or beach the Ritz is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “A DAY IN PARADISE”
Reviews.Author: summer096
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Maui for our Honeymoon in October 2011. We stayed for 8 nights and all 8 nights were perfect. From check in at the front desk, to booking activities and cabs with the concierge, the wait staff, to the maids. It was all wonderful service. People who complain about the "long" walk to the beach are either out of shape or lazy. It is not a bad walk at all plus you get a beautiful view of the hotel grounds and the ocean during your walk. The beach is wonderful, the sand was clean and soft and there are staff to help you with lounge chairs on the beach. When we laid in the sun we spent most of the time by the pool. The pool was refreshing and nice. We had lunch at the pool bar almost every day. A little expensive for drinks (mixed drinks are no less than $12 throughout the whole hotel) But they were delicious. The food was delicious. The Bento Box was our favorite and the Mahi Mahi Sandwich on Pita Bread was to die for. We adventured out and did the road to Hana and went to Lahina (great dining and drink specials) When we did the Road to Hana the Valet asked us where we were headed for the day and when he found out Hana he gave us a great CD that lead us through the whole trip and talked about the history and had great music. The staff really took great care of us. There is a little "General Store" that is a 5 min walk from the hotel. We loaded up on groceries for our room. We made our own breakfast in our room every morning and made our own cocktails in our room while we got ready for each night out. It did help us save some money. The Ritz is a clean, friendly hotel. People who rag on the Ritz and say the staff is too overwhelming and everything are just cranky people who will never be pleased. I have not one negative comment about our stay at the Ritz Carlton. I would recommend it to anyone. The Four Seasons is VERY far away from any of the activity or little towns near Kapalua. Kapalua is a beautiful piece of property and the Ritz Carlton is private and amazingly beautiful. We can't wait to come back to the Ritz and would never stay anywhere else in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: ebsoregon
Reviews.Content: I have never experienced such a high level of service! A very beautiful and understated hotel both inside and the grounds. We stayed on the club level and are still raving about the food, especially lunch and dinner (although they said it was not a full meal, we never could try everything they had available). My wine or champange glass never got empty before there was someone to fill it up again. Of course, this amount of luxury does not come cheap. And, on some days the weather was a bit windy and rainy. but, anything the staff could control, they did. My daughter and I had a fantastic relaxing stay and would come back in a heart beat. I would highly recommend Jodie, at the spa... And time at the pool with great drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: toothnet
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay. The views are amazing. The service is excellent. When I walked up to check in they welcomed me by name. I am still wondering how they knew who I was.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!!!”
Reviews.Author: Tracidanene
Reviews.Content: I work for the Marriott and have been fortunate enough to experience the different brands and locations Marriott has to offer. I have always been impressed by this company but I must say the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua has gone above and beyond my expectations. The staff is top notch and takes the time to understand your needs. No matter the time of day we always walk into a room with clean towels and folded clothes. The pool side service is impeccable. My husband and I will definatley return.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you expect while staying at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: deelovnco
Reviews.Content: My fiancÃ© and I stayed at the Ritz Hotel because our friends were getting married on the Plantation Course later in the week. I have worked in the hospitality industry for a while now and was very excited for my first stay at the Ritz. Our stay did not disappoint my expectations of the Ritz. The service is impeccable. We drove up and there was a greeter who immediately opened my door and said hello, then the actual bellman came over and assisted with our luggage. As we walked into the lobby we were greeted again this time with polished nut shell lays. We tried to check in but the room was not ready yet. The Front Desk (my specialty) hit all of the service standards perfectly! They then provided a map to head to the pool and relax. When our room is ready they will call our cell. From there we went right to the pool, walked over to the towel desk and they escorted us over to pool chairs and laid out our towels for us. Most of the pool servers were great throughout our stay! We had one who was a little bit snobby, no smiles or thank you can from her but I do want to throw a shout out to Dustin, he did an amazing job during our week stay! We walked into our room (the walk from the lobby to our roomâ€¦no joke was a 5-7 minute walk down one hallway. Luckily we still have young legs but if this might be an issue be sure to ask for a room near the lobby) which was tastefully done with dark woods and beach themed furniture. The bathrooms were very nice with a full tub and separate shower. All of the amenities were of great quality and placed well throughout the room. When our luggage came the bellman hit all of his service standards of explain how things worked and were things were located. He provided us extra hangers and ice on the spot. We also requested to have the daily paper delivered which was there every morning. A lot of the other wedding party stayed in the villas on the Kapalua grounds near the golf course while the bride and groom stayed in a stunning beach villa right on the water. It was a great plus for them to be able to use the Ritzâ€™s pool, beaches and services. All of the beaches on the property were stunning with perfect sand and views. Please note a lot of them have reefs in the bottom which make for an amazing snorkel trip but can be hard on the feet and body if you arenâ€™t expecting them. All in all this was an amazing hotel with perfect service! We enjoyed every minute of it.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: southerngal78
Reviews.Content: My husband and I attended a business conference and also celebrated our 30th anniversary. The grounds and view are stunning. The food is superb, and we enjoyed all of the dining venues. The mojito's are the best ever, and I'm now spoiled - can't find a comparable one. The rooms are well-appointed, with the usual luxurious Ritz Carlton bedding, which makes it difficult to get out of bed in the morning! The amenities are the best ever, and I adore the coconut-scented lotion. The pool and beach even supply sunscreen. The only downside is that the beach is a hike from the hotel, which sits atop a hillside, and can be windy.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort in a tropical paradise”
Reviews.Author: MrsSog
Reviews.Content: My husband & I enjoyed a weeklong stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. It's a beautiful resort with great food,spa, pool, beach and golf nearby. He played some golf while I enjoyed their spa. My hot stone massage was awesome! He said the golf at the Plantation course was one of his best ever places to play. We also went into Lahaina where there is plenty of shopping and some really cool restaurants. Relaxing & quiet. Oh, we both had massages down by the beach before we left. Nothing like the sound of the ocean for relaxation. Can't wait for an excuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “True Paradise!!!”
Reviews.Author: FA1982
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua in September for our Honeymoon. The resort is absolutely beautiful but something more impressive then the beauty of the resort was the service. The staff was so unbelievely attentive. The food at the resort was superb and all the restaurant recommendations that the staff made were incredible!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a great property!”
Reviews.Author: FlyDC
Reviews.Content: First time at the Ritz on Maui. Have stayed most trips at the Grand Wailea. Really enjoyed this visit. Hotel is in a great location in Kapalua with lots to do closeby. Good local restaurants. Didn't eat at hotel but had some drinks at the pool (kind of expensive, but it was a Ritz.) I'm Platinum in Marriott Rewards so was upgraded to a two room suite - which was awesome. Nice garden view with a stretch to see the ocean. Very relaxing. Was there for my 10th anniversary and they sent a plate of chocolate covered strawberries for us. (Yum!) Definitely a Ritz with service and style. Lots of nice amenities. Was fairly crowded but always able to get a good chair at the pool. Very windy by the pool - but not so much that it bothered us. Pool staff was helpful in setting up chairs with towels, etc. Would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible experience at the ritz”
Reviews.Author: cpattersongo
Reviews.Content: We have been there twice in four years and had the time of our lives. Never stayed anywhere so great. The best food we have ever had at the banyan tree. Everyone is so nice. Very quiet and private. Beautiful private beach, nice to snorkel. They say the whales come specifically there to birth their young and mate in the winter. Beautifully landscaped, welcoming, awesome bar, the best sushi ever, gorgeous rooms. If u go to Hawaii, you would be crazy to not stay at the Ritz. Experience it, its breathtaking. It Made our trip, twice.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in paradise”
Reviews.Author: 1301chadwick
Reviews.Content: Yes there is a lot of wind, and the Hotel is not in the middle of the hotel district, but overall I see that as a plus. The grounds are spectacular, the service is first class, thef ood is pricey, but very good and the over all experience was perfect. We enjoyed driving to other beaches and restaurants, but we were glad that we were not surrounded by hotels. We stayed in a two bedroom residential suite with two adult children and the extra space was worth the money. When there were minor problems they were corrected and everyone had the aloha spirit.

Reviews.Title: “Destination Club Ritz Carlton Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: VowRenewalTravel
Reviews.Content: The destination club of Ritz Carlton in Maui, Kapalua is awesome. The 2 golf courses are amazing, and of course the Ritz service and attention to detail is evident everywhere. 2 and 3 bedroom units are immaculate with dining room and living room and fully equipped kitchen. The pool is amazing and one of the finest beaches in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort and service!”
Reviews.Author: doll49NewYork
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua the middle of October. The lobby was beautiful, the check-in experience efficient and welcoming. The room was nice and well-kept. The pool area was expansive, good service, plentiful chairs and umbrellas. We were concerned about the wind, but it really was not a problem. Fleming Beach seemed too rough for swimming and with little shade. We took a 5 min. hotel shuttle to a great snorkeling beach. The shuttle service was efficient and drivers very pleasant. The restaurants were good, but not wonderful. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent honeymoon location”
Reviews.Author: Popgal
Reviews.Content: tucked away in the west side of maui, next to a beautiful golf course and residences with an awesome sushi place just outside (Sansei). Very quiet and peaceful location overall, with beautiful views and gorgeous beach. staff are very friendly. we rented a car so was easy to get to other parts of the island, but without a car would be difficult to get anywhere, unless you plan to just stay on the resort, which could be fine since it's quite beautiful. it's windy and waves on the beach are stronger this side of the island, but is a small issue and there's a shuttle that will take you to other beaches.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: Ramon F
Reviews.Content: This is a Beautiful hotel where nothing goes wrong, and if it did, they will probably fix it right away. If you think that a Ritz is expensive, you are right, but it's worth every penny. The food is excellent, the breakfast buffet is awesome, If you are a Burger type of person the Kapalua Burger is a must. The resort is in a nice semi secluded area of Maui, it is kind of windy sometimes. You will also find very good restaurants in the area like the Pineapple Grill, by the way, always make reservations, the area restaurants are very busy. If you are in a budget, as you walk out of the Hotel Property less than a half a block away you will find a very cool convenience store/Deli. They prepare very good breakfast sandwiches for about 5 to 6 bucks. they also have Beer, liquor and souvenir's at very good price. So go on, don't worry about the extra dollars you will spend on Hotel, the Ritz Carlton Kapalua is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Jae K
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua from the 5th to the 8th of October. Prior to booking this trip, I had done some research, and the reviews were very up and down and I now understand why. I will begin with the positives. The grounds and the rooms are beautiful. The issues are the location, which makes seeing the attractions on Maui difficult. This would not be an issue if there were more to do on the resort itself, but there are very few activities within walking distance of the property. The pools are nice, and they are open 24 hours, but the area is very windy. While there, I was unimpressed with the level of service. The house keeping service was not very thorough, the front desk personnel were not very helpful, especially during the check-in process, and the overall level of service was not what I expected from a Ritz-Carlton property. One particular example is that I left my vehicle keys in the room after checking out, and did not realize my mistake until reaching the Maui airport from which I was scheduled to fly to Oahu. I spoke with a representative in the loss prevention department, who took my name and information after locating the keys, and the gentlemen informed me that he would send my keys back to me. After waiting 18 days, I called the loss prevention department on the 26th and was put on hold while someone tried to figure out the location of my keys. After 30 minutes on hold, I was told that I would be given a call back. I did not receive a call back, so I called again the following day and was told that my keys had been sent to the mainland by mistake, and I would have them sent to me as soon as they were returned. I am not upset that the keys were sent to the wrong address. What I am upset about is that nobody bothered to inform me of this, and that I was not even given a call back as promised. As a military officer, it is not often that I have the time or the money to stay at a "5 star" hotel, but as a whole, I was very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, hotel was nice, but not as luxurious as you'd expect from a Ritz”
Reviews.Author: katiesue2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for seven days this month. It was definitely a nice hotel, we were greeted with leis and assisted with our bags right away after check-in. They also call to your room soon after to make sure you are pleased with everything and can request anything else you may need. Rooms were pretty nice and plenty of room. Beds were very comfortable and I love hotels give you a variety of soft and hard pillows! ;) Housekeeping came two times per day unless you hang up your do not disturb sign, which was nice for towels and water bottles. They also gave me new amenties every time which was awesome--shampoo, conditioner, body wash, mouthwash, lotion, etc. The service everywhere was always excellent, but honestly, I did not think the hotel itself was up to Ritz standards. It looked more like a Marriot or some other hotel chain that is nice but not quite luxurious. The pool was the only area of the hotel where I felt like I was at a Ritz-Carlton with upscale feel of it, and the Cabanas and waitresses bringing your drinks right to you. Also the spa was amazing! Quite expensive but it's the best in West Maui by far. Free use of the whirlpool, relaxation room/hot tea, steam room & sauna the whole day of your spa treatment. Definitely worth every penny. Staff was excellent. The downside is it's quite a walk to get to your room and the beach. It's a huge resort and since there are burial grounds between the ritz and the beach, they had to build a little further back. But minor inconvenience when you're in Maui it's enjoyable to walk around anyways. Another thing is Kapalua is super windy and sprinkles a few times every day usually. Also, the restaurants are all very pricy even compared to the already pricy Maui, so renting a car is a must. I've seen people on here complain about how far it is to get to Lahaina...but I'm thinking that's just laziness? We rented a Jeep wrangler so with the top down it was nice to cruise around and it's beautiful scenery everywhere, i can't see how anyone would complain about that! It only took us about 10 minutes to get to Kaanapali, and 15 to Lahaina where all the action is. The Gazebo, located 2 min from the resort, is an excellent place for breakfast. Also make sure you go to the Lahaina Grill. Don't be fooled by the name--best restaurant...steak, seafood, you name it! Overall, Four Seasons is way better if you are looking for luxury, but I love West Maui so if you're staying on this side of the island the Ritz is the way to go! Side note: I would not recommend bringing your IPad though as Apple products have problems connecting with their Wi-Fi...but at least it is free in-room Wi-fi :) I had to sit on the phone with IT for a half hour trying to get my Ipad hooked up because ipad's do not recognize the ritz's network for some reason.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch friendly service”
Reviews.Author: VTtravelers4
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Kapalua Villas and using the Ritz Carlton facilities. The service has been amazingly friendly. Food at the poolside restaurant was so ono, and complimentary sunscreen is awesome! Kids love the pool here. We may never leave!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale in great locale”
Reviews.Author: intheairLosAngeles
Reviews.Content: This is a typical lovely ritz. It does suffer from lots of hawainisms though. Excessive rule rigidity and high prices. AT checkin there was a fairly long line,only 2 people working the desk and i was told my room wasnt ready at 3:30p. The hotel was only 60% occupied that day too. I arranged a meeting here with 75 room nights. They could not provide club floor for the organizers, and over charged for any business related service. Internet in meeting rooms, and FedEx over charges were ridiculous. Rooms are great, location is great and adjacent golf is spectacular. The sushi restaurant attached to the lobby is extremely expensive and the food is just ok. Drinks at the bar a typical Hawaiian in that they are weak, wines overpriced. The hotel seems to be struggling Aa bit with this economy so a little extra for those that bring business meetings here would be a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough, but did they put on the Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: RaeannaManila
Reviews.Content: Technical difficulties at start, they couldn't find our reservation even though we had received several emails from the hotel. Fortunately we had a printout with the details. Rooms were nice, beds are comfortable, resort is large and centered around a variety of pools overlooking the ocean. Staff are pleasant, but casual in line with the island atmosphere and not formal like most ritz carltons. Nice beach, free wifi throughout resort for in-house guests. Checkout was a bit slow, and the charged rate was higher than the confirmed rate but they adjusted once the issue was raised. Overall generally good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Only visited the Aloha Bar for a drink...worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: Behindthescenes2
Reviews.Content: Had lovely view at sunset with pacific breezes swaying the palm trees in the horizon. Friendly waitress. Good drink. View and bar was worth the visit.

Reviews.Title: “The entire experience was amazing!”
Reviews.Author: Shay8ann
Reviews.Content: We had dinner at The Banyan Tree restaurant at the hotel and it was excellent! The price was very responsible for how expensive Hawaii can be. I live in Michigan and can spend the same amount on dinner that's not nearly as good. The room, view of the ocean and restaurants are amazing! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Best birthday”
Reviews.Author: DanielSFSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have traveled all over the world and have stayed at some of the finest hotels. While luxury is important, service is key. In this regard, the Ritz in Kapalua has succeeded with flying colors. We are here celebrating my birthday and the service has made this experience one of my best birthdays. Specifically, we were comped a VIP cabana at the pool, treated to a wonderful lunch with cocktails and treated with extreme kindness and attentiveness. Specifically I want to mention Kyle, Shannon and Margie who made our experience exceptional. They made their hard work look as if it was effortless and always had smiles on their faces. Just wanted to give a shout out to them and the Ritz in Kapalua for making my birthday one of the best.!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - Who ever can complain about this place is a giant baby”
Reviews.Author: DuffyNYC
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Ritz Kapalua as part of my honeymoon last year. It was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. My wife and I frequently stay at 4 and 5 star hotels, and the Ritz met and exceeded our expectations. I seriously do not get how fussy people can be on tripadvisor sometimes. The Ritz was everything I could have dreamed about for my honeymoon. Room: We had a partial ocean view room (which was pretty much a complete ocean view room in actuality). The partial part would be that we could view part of the grounds/pool area in the corner. The bed....ohhhh the bed. The bed in this room was the most amazing, comfortable bed ever. No joke, my wife and I have tried to 'recreate the Ritz bed' in our apartment. It is a giant fluffy cloud and it is heaven. As we are NY'ers and took a while to adjust to Hawaii time, I was up at 645 or 7am every day and really enjoyed sitting on the balcony, having my Kona coffee (which was so great) and staring at the ocean. Ahhh. Food: Yes, the food is expensive...its the Ritz, what do you expect. But I must say that every meal we ate there was so good! I still think about the Grand Marnier French Toast and Banana Pancakes for breakfast, the burger at the Beach cafe is so good, and i loved the maui onion dip and chips by the pool. After the first morning we ate breakfast at the Honalua General Store, which is literally on the other side of parking lot. It was a good way to save some money and the food there was actually really good. Same with Sensei Sushi down the road. Pool and Beach. The pool(s) are awesome and there is staff constantly attending to you asking if you would like drinks, fresh fruit, food, etc. The beach is absolutely beautiful and private. Every time I was there, I was one of about 4 people on the beach. It's cove-like...but still gets decent waves. You can see straight to Molokai and the water is crystal clear. Everyone is complaining about wind, which I never experienced once. It was not windy at all when I was there. Location: Yes, it is a long, hour drive to the airport. But, what I loved about Kapalua was that it was not on "the strip" of Kanapali or Wailea. I liked its semi-secluded location. It was a tad annoying as far as driving to Haleakula, or driving the Road to Hana....but we had rented a Mustang...and with the top down, I could have driven for 8 hours and not cared. If you want a sense of seculsion, the Ritz is the way to go (over Kanapali or Wailea hotels). The Ritz was pretty accomodating about our treatment for our honeymoon. We got free drinks and appetizers at the bar and, had we not booked the partial ocean view, we would have gotten an upgrade to that level. The concierge was great about booking tours/activities and making reservations for us. They had great recommendations. The spa was also incredible. We had a couples massage, and it was heaven. The rest of the spa is beautiful and the various pools, hot tubs and facilities are fantastic. Plus, i liked the pre-massage champagne they served us. Good touch Ritz! All in all, the Ritz was incredible. The room, the food, the pool, the beach, the service was all top notch. Do not listen to the fussy babies who complain about this hotel. If you are unhappy here, you would be unhappy anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING Stay in Kapalua!”
Reviews.Author: lucysuze
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui on our honeymoon and had an amazing time! The hotel was fantastic- beautiful grounds, and the staff was so attentive. We stayed on the club level and were greeted with a surprise bottle of champagne our first night there. Additionally, I needed to have something faxed to the hotel- the concierge was great about it and ran it up to our room (no charge). The pool was beautiful and there weren't many kids around, nor non-couples. Most everyone there seemed to be on their honeymoon too. The beach was super windy and the ocean was slightly dicey to go into but beautiful nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon??? Not treated at all like a 5* hotel?!”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie H
Reviews.Content: 5 STAR HOTEL???? I think not! I am so unsatisfied with the "service" i received while on my HONEYMOON during the week of September 20 through September 27th, 2011. I spoke with some very nice staff, specifically GARY and Heidi. They were wonderful! But other than that, Heidi informed me that my reservations did not show that my husband and I were on our honeymoon and we had booked a honeymoon package....Odd? Yes, very. The first evening we arrived, our flight came in at 5:45 and the rental car place had closed at 5; all of this was booked through the Ritz and guess what? We had to take a TAXI from the airport to get to the hotel?!?!?!?! what kind of service is this? no shuttle from the hotel, no knowledge of our rental or anything. That was the first sign of an "uh oh" to our week at "The Ritz". Their service is highly lacking! Back to the first evening; I was carded at the bar. I am sorry; I have a wedding ring on and I do NOT look 18. I am 28 and my husband is 34. I was carded, he was not. (we ordered separately from the same bartender) After traveling for over 15+ hours I just wanted a nice glass of wine and I get carded. BEWARE OF this "2006 best beach" award...it might be the best beach but the CONSTANT WIND is a complete turn off. if you plan on being a 'beach bum"....book your stay at the grand about 50 miles south of kapalua. Notice at the pools how there are NO umbrellas offered nor at the beach. It was ridiculous. The prices were high for everything, which is expected but $150 for a "Ritz Carlton" embroidered beach bag that would be able to carry a few items is completely ridiculous. I will never never never book with this ritz again. For 5k I felt cheated and I would have been happier to stay at a HOLIDAY INN!!!!!!!! I am so unsatisfied with this stay that I will be writing The Ritz and other companies as well. I recommend you DO not stay at this resort. EVER! I am sorry that this was MY one and ONLY honeymoon and I spent a week at this crap resort. This is no 5 star resort, its at best a 1 or a 2. Save your money and never stay at The Ritz in Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: StarWatcher
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for a few nights in September. It was very nice, relaxing. Alot of honeymooners and a very nice group of people there. The food was great, loved the pool. The hotel was very nice but felt a little tired, like it needs to be updated. We came from the Westin Villas which was very new and updated. The staff was very helpful and the grounds at the Ritz were just gorgeous. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, not impressed ande theft at pool”
Reviews.Author: stansnikki
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 7 day stay at the Ritz in Kapalua. Had high expectations for rooms and service which were not met. Had called prior to arrival to reserve 2 queen beds. Was assured we would have them. Asked at check-in if our room had 2 queens, & we were assured it did. Arrived at the room to find two full size beds. No other rooms were available so my husband & squeezed into a full size and our daughter had her own. Room was small compared to the Grand Wailea or the Four Seasons. One day it was obvious that the tub had not been cleaned since hair from shaving was still present all over the bottom of it. We were part of a conf and breakfast was provided -- horrible powdered eggs and othe BLAND offerings each morning. Towels at pool were thin and some were dirty. It was hard to get staffs' attention to order food or drinks -- they did not come to you on their own accord. Some days there was fresh fruit at the towel hut, sometimes there was not. When you would ask attendant about it, they would say, "We don't know if there will be any or not. They don't tell us." One morning I asked the front desk about transportation to the airport and wasn rudely told, "We don't handle that here, talk to the concierge." and they turned to the next person. Banyan tree has no view and the food is overpriced and bland (Merrimans down the street blew it away!!!!). Cannot swim at the beach -- waves / tide are very dangerous. Would never return. Four Seasons and Grand Wailea far out perform this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it--but a few drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: varitek
Reviews.Content: My wife and I went to the Ritz to celebrate our 20th anniversary and stayed in a club level room. We stayed 8 nights with one of those being free and we had a $500 resort credit as part of our package. We entered our room to find a bottle of champagne and some chocolate covered strawberries. A good first impression. The room, and king size bed, were phenomenal. Very clean, quiet and roomy. I've read mixed reviews of the club level, but my wife and I loved it. From a value perspective, you can't beat it. We had breakfast there every morning and lunch on most days. Free drinks are a big plus. At the pool, two Mai Tai's cost $25, so having a few drinks with lunch or at any time (e.g. Bloody Mary's for breakfast) can easily justify the additional cost. The place is windy. My wife and I found this to be a plus. It keeps you cool while under the hot sun. It does cause some sandblasting while on the beach so my wife and I opted for the cushioned chairs around the beach restaurant. Still had the wind but also had shade, no sandblasting and a waitress. Service was excellent all the way around. Everyone we met was polite and knowledgeable. Many of them knew us by name. Especially the concierge in the club lounge. Leslie was superb. I went for a run one afternoon around the property. I finished at the lobby and was surprised to be greeted by a staff member with a large glass of ice cold lemon water. It's the little touches that make a big difference. Along with everyone else, I too did not appreciate the "resort fee". If you don't use the wifi or the gym or park a car, you are essentially paying for nothing. Considering the price of the room, these services should be included. We liked the fact that the hotel is isolated as we visited "Hotel Row" in Lahaina and didn't like it one bit. We did visit the Four Seasons hotel for dinner one evening at Ferraro's. Terribly disappointing. My wife's risotto was like soup and you couldn't see anything as the lighting was terrible. Everyone around us was using flashlights so they could see their food. The Banyan tree was far better. Overall a very good experience and we would go back in a minute. Although travel from the east can be quite long.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Kids & a five star resort”
Reviews.Author: napaligirl
Reviews.Content: My wife & I just had a great time at the Ritz! We came with our two kiddos but the kids camp was closed so we were given the name of a nanny agency Happy Kids to use, we wanted to go on a sunset sail but we wanted romance so we called Happy Kids one call two hours later Sarah our nanny showed up with toys & Games, off we went, our evening was perfect the kids had a great time we had a great time. The Ritz treated us like royalty & since we travel to Maui for work we now know we can use Happy Kids anytime-they never close ! We had such a great time I just had to write about it! We will be back! Mark

Reviews.Title: “Sheer paradise”
Reviews.Author: samlab25
Reviews.Content: First I must disclose that we stayed 7 nights at the Ritz Carlton residences just down the beach form the Ritz Carlton Hotel. We have never had a more fabulous vacation. Kapalua is breathtaking. The views are simply amazing and I just couldn't get enough of the coastal trail. Service at the residences was top notch. Our two bedroom was amazing. The property was immaculate. The pool was everything you'd ever want in tropical paradise. At the Ritz Carlton hotel, our son participated in Ambassadors of the Environment (as he did at the Ritz Carlton Grand Cayman as well) and loved it. Great staff made it so fun for the kids. We dined at The Banyan Tree. The meal was very good and the staff was nice, but it left us wanting a little more from it. The hotel was nice, but I definitely preferred the residences. If you get the chance to go to Kapalua, I would highly recommend it. The most beautiful part of Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Hotel! - Lives up to the name!”
Reviews.Author: travelaydeebug
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose the Ritz Carlton for our honeymoon in Maui. We've been pampered by 5 star hotels before but felt like royalty here. SERVICE - Excellent! As soon as you walk near the front doors, you were greeted, offered a shell necklace, your luggage was transported on a trolley, and there was lemon-flavoured water. Everything was seamless! We were next in line at the check-in but there was only one staff (during peak check-in hours..4pm). Not a major problem, though we did have to wait a bit. We told them it was our honeymoon and they immediately upgraded us to a room with a better view. The staff were very friendly and provided us with restaurant/activity recommendations when we asked. CLEANLINESS - Excellent! Cleanliness is very important to me and the Ritz room and grounds were immaculate. The rooms were cleaned twice a day! ROOMS - Excellent! The room and washroom were quite spacious and the washroom had a large shower, bathtub, and two sinks. The floors were hardwood, which were mopped every day! The bed and pillows were very comfortable. Our room had a lanai which was very nice. LOCATION - Average. If I were with family/friends, I may not choose this hotel only because of the location. The reviews are true - it was a little windy in the area, making the water cooler (too cold for us to swim in). It is also an hour drive from the airport and 15 mins from another beach. There is a beautiful beach on the resort but to see the rest of Maui, you had to drive quite a bit. The location is great if you plan to stay on the resort property and it is very private/secluded (not rows of hotels). FOOD - Very good! Our first meal was at the pool bar. It was decent, but not worth the price. Every Tuesday night, they have a fixed price dinner by the beach. The cost was $35 per person and included a trio appetizer, trio entree, and a trio dessert. The food was very good and the view was amazing. Very reasonable price for a hotel dinner by the beach - would definitely recommend it! The breakfast buffet is a MUST - it's only $10/person more if you book in advance (with your room rate) but the cost is $30/person. It was the best breakfast I've ever had - they have an omelet station, pancakes/waffles/French toast, eggs, muffins, croissants, cereals, juice station, fresh fruit - pretty much anything you can think of for breakfast and it was so delicious! VALUE - It was not cheap to stay here but we booked the hotel with a "stay 4 nights, get one night free" promotion. There are only two 5-star hotels in Maui and the other one was a lot more expensive (but in a better location). Overall, the 5-start hotel is worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Club level?”
Reviews.Author: Avandeve
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed here on our honeymoon. We stayed here for 6 nights and loved every minute of it. The location was just perfect for us, away from all the big resorts, but close enough to travel anywhere. The wind was a welcome addition for us, it kept us cool during the hot august temperature. We ended up getting the club level room upgrade based on some reviews here and had some input to add. For $100 a night you get to use the concierge room which includes: 1. free drinks 2. dedicated concierge staff to talk to at any time about anything you need. 3. Food: snacks throughout the day(breakfast, lunch, midday snack, pre dinner snacks, desserts). My wife and I found that all of these things were nice but were not sure if they were worth the money. One thing that is not advertised is that you cannot take drinks out of the concierge room. We found that this was pretty inconvenient since we would have preferred to sip our fruity drinks in the privacy of our own balcony or by the pool. (there is a balcony in the concierge room, but with only a couple of tables so you have to be lucky to snag one) All of the food tasted great, but we decided that breakfast was pretty similar every day (we get tired of the same thing every morning 7 mornings in a row). Also, I like a little protein in the morning and the selection includes mostly carbs with some fruit. The concierge people were great, they were genuinely interested in what we were doing for the day and made great recommendations(make sure to ask where to stop on the road to hana). In our opinion we would not do the club level again. We would rather get a very nice breakfast somewhere and have a couple drinks on the resort for less than $100 a day. One thing we definitely would recommend is the Casabella - beach-side covered chairs that include water and a pineapple plate for $50 a day. You will want to make reservations prior to your arrival at the Ritz. It's nice to have your own space and shade right near the beach. As for restaurant recommendations: Pineapple grill- fantastic place walkable from the ritz, overlooks the golf course on one side and the ocean on the other. The food is outstanding. Roy's - one of our favorites- make sure to try the souffle and the warm tomato and onion salad Spago at the Four Seasons - a little bit of a drive, but well worth it Plantation House - really close to the ritz, lets you pick your fish and you preparation. Great view.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in paradise”
Reviews.Author: travellinggirl16
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here to celebrate our anniversary. The staff was friendly from the moment we arrived. Chocolate covered strawberries and champagne were sent up to us our first night. We stayed on the club level which was wonderful. The staff took the time to get to know you to provide the best possible service. The pool was beautiful and we always got a pool chair regardless of the time we got there. Yes it is breezy but it feels nice and I don't consider this to be a drawback. The beach is a short walk away but it is a beautiful walk. Again not a drawback. Even though the hotel isn't right on the beach it is perched up a bit so you have fabulous views. We can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star all the way”
Reviews.Author: Steve-Liz P
Reviews.Content: The resort was in an ideal location, removed from the hustle and crowds of Kaanapali but only a 10 minute drive away. Service was beyond exceptional and resort was absolutely immaculate. The upscale feel of this property makes it well worth the extra $$ to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Maui”
Reviews.Author: TouristMind
Reviews.Content: This is a GREAT Resort in Maui! I travelled with my wife and 3 year old kid. Resort has Spectacular views with private ocean access with a restaurant and beach towels. Ocean side Restaurant food is great (little expensive but worth it) and we eat there all our stay. water is very expensive here so go buy it in a small shopping complex next to the property, no shame in that because most of the people do that. 1. Book whale watching from the front desk, its affordable and we saw whales up close!! 2. If you are driving to HANA please do NOT make a LEFT turn after coming out of the resort! On the map it looks like a shorter distance to HANA but its very dangerous road to take with no U turn!!! it goes through a very treacherous mountain range with a risk of falling off the cliff in several places. Goto HANA only through the road that passes from the airport. Distance from the resort, its like touching the nose around the head BUT ITS SAFE THAT WAY! If you are travelling with children, I would recommend taking a tour bus to HANA, i will do that next time. They know where to stop. There is a lot of tropical fruit vendors everywhere in Maui, do not forget to grab some! Have fun at the beach most of the time and go to the rain forest if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you would expect!”
Reviews.Author: raphster
Reviews.Content: Having splurged on a ocean view suite, I was expecting an overwhelming experience... What I got was a luke warm vacation and a feeling of overpaying, WAY overpaying. First thing that raised an eyebrow when I arrived was that I was going to be charged for parking service? Ok, not part of the $700/night fee.... The suite was better than expected and capped off when room service brought up a complimentary bottle of champagne and a tray of chocolate covered strawberries as my wife and I were celebrating out 20th wedding anniversary. Attached was a warm note congratulating us and wishing us well. Little things do count! Pretty much downhill from there. Walked out on the balcony to check out our ocean view and there it was the pool! and if you looked way left past the other building you can see the a part of the ocean. Ok, I can still see the ocean, so be it, not like I'm going to spend my days staring off my balcony, even though I paid for it. After settling in we headed down to the pool, pretty small pools for a hotel this big. Maybe the beach is where it's at... where's the beach???? Just follow the path all the way around there for about 1/4 and it's right there!?!?!?!? WHAT??? beach front hotel and the beach is 1/4mi away? Yep, ancient burial ground between you and the beach!!! Ok, so the ritz provides a golf cart shuttle back and forth. word of advice, it's faster to walk then to wait for the golf cart which is never to be seen. Down on the beach chairs are not laid out, you can ask the towel person to bring the beach chairs down for you. nice service. Once on the beach the first thing you will notice aside from the fantastic view is the wind. The wind is non stop and I'm not talking a cool maui breeze, it's so strong that when someone walks by the sand that they walked on gets lifted by the wind and you get pelted by a mini sand storm. I was told it's not the weather and it is the norm for the northern coast of maui. The food was average at best, nothing to write about other than it was expensive, to be expected as you are staying at the ritz. The hotel charges a $25 daily service fee that includes wifi, pool towels, gym usage parking?? etc... which I'm ok with... but wait! parking i was told I had to pay for parking? sir that is valet parking you have to pay for, the service fee gives you the right to park your own car" raised eyebrow is now shaking my head. I then asked if they could print out my boarding passes for me, to which I was told I can do so myself in the business center... for a fee. Can someone remind me why I'm staying at a 5star hotel and paying $700/nite? If you want a true 5 star hotel in Maui, stay at the 4 seasons, too many negatives here. When we stayed at the 4seasons my last stay, I was greeted by name and a warm greeting by each staff member everyday. Here I was lucky to get a head nod. Pros Beautiful grounds Really nice rooms close to honolua bay (best kept secret for snorkeling) Cons so so pool beach too far away from the pool/rooms average food average/poor service for the $$ not worth the $$ brutal winds that become annoying very quickly nothing for kids to do, unless the kids are under 4yrs(own sprinkler pool) neither pro nor con location, quite out of the way - can be a long car ride past lahaina

Reviews.Title: “Got cheated by their ocean view room!”
Reviews.Author: peggy_teo
Reviews.Content: We have a personal coordinator from the hotel because my boyfriend is the platinum member of marriott rewards. So everything was liaised before we went there, telling them when we will reach and etc. We reached the hotel at 1pm and ok, the room was not ready. We entertained ourselves at the beach and got really tired but by 3pm, we weren't able to check in as well. Our so called personal coordinator was on leave and we did not receive a warm welcome like other visitors did. We got to pay 25bucks resort fee in order to use the facilities like pool, gym, internet; which is very absurd. Aren't those facilities come with the hotel room? No breakfast, and we also need to pay for the parking lot. What is worse, when we finally checked in to our so called ocean view room, we can't see the ocean becoz it was blocked by trees at the golf course. We felt so angry about it! So we complained to the reception and after some negotiation, they gave us a true ocean view room. The brochure said it is a 5 diamond rated hotel but I felt their services and response is just like a 3 star hotel. Shocked with Ritz Carlton quality of service. Location is a bit too far off but the beach is just good for children as there is no big waves.

Reviews.Title: “Everything I imagined”
Reviews.Author: missyk522
Reviews.Content: We ended the trip in Maui at this resort and it was the best decision we ever made. A Ritz-Carlton, very rarely disappoints but this one had quite a bit to live up to and it definitely did. From the fresh pineapple in the lobby,the helpful, friendly, staff, and the pristine grooming of the entire resort it was nothing short of breath-taking. It was not inexpensive, but definitely worth every penny, there was so much to do from the beach, the pool, hiking trails, golf ect... the activities were endless. The pool and jacuzzi were open all night and it was very family friendly. There were basketball courts, tennis courts, bocci ball, shuffleboard, a jungle gym, and tons of great golf. The only negatives to this resort is that it is a little difficult to get to any of the other areas in Maui. So, if you plan on seeing Lahaina or going to the other side of the island; you will need to rent a car and valet at the hotel is quite expensive. However, the good news is that you really don't really need to leave the resort area and they do provide a shuttle to take you places in Kapalua (there are some fantastic restaurants off the resort) The only other negative is that things close relatively early. After about 10pm finding any open restaurants is not easy. The highlight was that I left my flat iron there and didn't realize it. (Ladies will understand how devastating this is and how expensive a good flat iron is) When I called 2 weeks later, they still had it and shipped it back to me. I would receommend this resort to anyone, it was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort With Spotty Service and Small Bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: AttyOut2Sea
Reviews.Content: Overall, I do not think I would recommend this resort to anyone who is looking for a 5* hotel experience, but I think it is perfectly adequate (and, in fact, beautiful) for anyone who is content with a 4-star experience. The positives are mostly the views and the grounds. The decor of the room and patio was up to par, but the bathroom was vastly inferior to what one would expect at the Four Seasons (shallow tub, smallish enclosed shower) and there was not TV in it, which is surprising for a recently renovated resort. We had repeated service issues... most obnoxiously, the shuttle to Kapalua Bay beach, which had us waiting in the parking lot for about 20 minutes (we could have walked back in the time we stood around) and beach terrace lounge chair food & beverage service. After asking several times to see a menu, I finally called the restaurant from my cellphone and placed an order for delivery because nobody was coming by! As an aside, the breakfast buffet was fantastic and the gym was very nice. Overall, I would suggest they rebrand as a very nice Marriott instead of a low-end Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: wparton2
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the club level. Lots of good service and attention from the great staff. Pools were a little cold due to the shortabe of LP gas this past winter, but location is great. Food is excellent at the hotel but kind of pricy in the main location. Rooms are great.

Reviews.Title: “5 stars for resort overall, 2 stars for poolside Cabana service”
Reviews.Author: Garysgirl03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of our 10-night Maui trip. This was a fantastic resort and we absolutely loved it - we were extremely sorry to leave! The Kapalua area is breathtakingly beautiful, and the resort is stunning. We stayed at the Westin Kaanapali Villas the first week of our trip, and both of us agreed that arriving at the Ritz felt like we were on a different (and far more luxurious!) vacation, even though it was just 10 minutes up the road. With the exception of the poolside cabanas (more details below), we were extremely pleased with the service at this resort. The staff was super friendly and helpful, and really went above and beyond. This began with the wonderful front desk staff at check-in. We had booked an ocean view, one-bedroom suite, and upon arrival we were upgraded to an ocean view residential suite (one bedroom with kitchen), which was wonderful. The suite was spotless, beautiful, and well-appointed, and we loved the two lanais. Our luggage was delivered to our room within minutes of our arrival, and the bellman was very friendly and gave us lots of great tips for our stay. We were celebrating our anniversary on this trip, and they treated us to a bottle of champagne and a plate of chocolate-covered strawberries in our room, which was a nice touch. The spa was incredible - possibly the best massage I've ever had. Now for the cabana service. We had booked a full day cabana rental for $100, and our initial contact with our server was when he asked us early on if we wanted to look at a lunch menu. We had just finished breakfast, so we declined at that point. He then completely ignored us for the rest of the morning, though he spent lots of time catering to the couple in the cabana next to ours. We got the impression that they had been at the resort for awhile and "knew" this server, which is fine, but there was really no excuse for him to go to them on multiple occasions and then walk right by us without even a glance in our direction. I had to flag him down to order a daquiri. Service markedly improved after I told him (again after flagging him down) that we would be ordering lunch. We concluded that because we had initially declined the lunch menu (remember, it was not yet lunch time) he had decided that he was not going to get a big tip from us, so we were not worth bothering with. By the way, we have always been very good tippers, and we did indeed tip him the full amount at the end of the day. However, when we were already staying in a very expensive suite and shelling out $100 more for a cabana, I expected better service. That being said, the poor cabana service didn't mar our otherwise wonderful stay. We will return - hopefully soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: CatherineMSumner
Reviews.Content: The room was pretty nice, as can be expected at The Ritz. The pool seemed good, but we didn't really spend any time there, or really in the hotel. The location is a bit far away from things, so if you plan to stay more in the hotel, then that shouldn't be a problem. If you want to go to a variety of beaches, be prepared to drive. However, sleeping was a bit tough as the pillows are all soft, but if stuff like that doesn't bother you, don't worry about it.

Reviews.Title: “"Treated Like Royalty...Can't wait to come back!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon B
Reviews.Content: highly recommend!!! me and my wife were supposed to be on our honeymoon, but due to hurricane irene, our wedding was postponed but decided to still enjoy the honeymoon. first stop was in oahu at the hilton vacations club. day 2 our bag was stolen off wakiki beach with our camera, camcorder, cash, credit cards, licenses..etc.... hilton didn't do anything for us....however the ritz made a miserable trip into a fabulous and unforgettable honeymoon!! upon hearing about what happened to us, we were given free drinks at the bar and upgraded to an ocean view deluxe suite room. when we arrived to the room at night, 'unaloto taukei' aho- supervisor, had us greeted with a bottle of wine and champagne, chocolate covered strawberries, and a fruit and snack basket that lasted us the whole week. lastly, ehrn we went to the concierge, kaitlyn set up a spa and massage day for me and my wife to enjoy. the staff was always smiling and friendly. valet and bell service were always on point. the cleaning service was exceptional. i had the sign on my door to not disturb, and when i removed the sign hours later at night,i was greeted at the door with 10 cleaning personnel and management so that the room could be cleaned to ritz standards in matters of seconds. the grounds were absolutely amazing. and the complimentary breakfast buffet was delicious. they also provided a complimentary shuttle that picked me up from the airport and had golf carts and shuttles that took you around kapalua. this is by far the best place i have ever stayed at. i promise u will not be disappointed and will always remember your trip if you stay at the ritz carlton. ~ brandon

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ever ask for and more...”
Reviews.Author: foodloverindallas
Reviews.Content: The hotel and staff were spectacular. We have nothing but great things to say about the resort. If you want luxury, great service, and excellent food, come stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: USAbluegirl
Reviews.Content: We arrived the day of the Tsunami. Right after we landed we were taken to the Ritz Carlton. We were suppose to stay at another hotel for the night but we were anxious and wanted to get to safety. Although there was a lot of nervous people around, checkin was quick and easy. Although we were not registered til the next day we were able to get into our club level room that evening. The club food was wonderful all day. Breakfast always included both hot and cold items. We did not eat out except for one evening. All of our meals were in the club lounge and we never felt deprived. We were also very pleased with the drink selections. We had the opportunity to try several mixed drinks along with beers and wines and it was awesome due to being included in the club lounge package. We also met great people and staff members there that helped us plan adventure outings. The view from the club lounge was also great. Husband used the gym and said it was satisfactory. We used the spa and it was pretty good. Overall it was a trip that we were glad we took even though things started put pretty scary.

Reviews.Title: “Not luxury, better alternatives out there.”
Reviews.Author: Gskiba
Reviews.Content: We were there over week between Christmas and New Years. Didn't care for the property or hotel. Poor value and very put off by loud band that played till 2am on nye that kept guests from sleeping and was playing for largely a local crowd.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Lorne_Alexandra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our stay at this property. The weather was quite warm, so the breeze made it possible to spend our days outside. The staff was helfpul and welcoming. The gentleman who checked us in gave us his card and suggested that we could contact him directly should we need anything at all. He proceeded to send us champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary. We stayed on the club level, and I would highly recommend this. It was as though we were at an "all inclusive" resort. Plus, we had access to 3 concierge at all times. They were tremendously accomodating and helpful. The beach was lovely! We enjoyed the Banyan Tree on the 50% off wine Wednesday, which was a great deal! The spa was an excellent experience, my husband insists that it was the best massage he has ever had. I liked the fact that the couple's massage was not charged a premium, so we were able to enjoy our massages together in a lovely outdoor room for the same price as having individual massages. We stayed at the Fairmont before coming here, and had we done this in the opposite order, it seems unlikely we would have left the Ritz! I would highly recommend this property!

Reviews.Title: “A slice of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: MickyDionisio
Reviews.Content: We had a one bedroom suite with a kitchen. The suite overlooked the pool and off in the distance was the Pacific. The Ritz owns DT Fleming beach, which is private and phenomenal. There's a bar right on the beach where you can catch some rays then hop the ocean. Since it was a private beach, it's not crowded whatsoever with plenty of room to breathe. There constant staff in golf carts willing to shuttle you around the resort. There's an amazing hiking trail that starts from the resort where you can hike north quite a way. In addition to the trail there's also a great golf course. Mind the wind though, it can cause some insane slicing (that's my excuse). If you rented a convertible, which I recommend, the grocery store is a just a couple minutes drive so you can stock the kitchen in your suite. Overall, the service was exceptional - from reception to bell hops to valet. The suite is everything to expect from the Ritz. It was an exceptional stay! Can't imagine doing it any other way.

Reviews.Title: “What else but the best!”
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the property for two days from Aug. 31 and Sept 1. The Ritz is a destination property. It's far from many of the other 5 star properties but in my opinion worth the drive. We have stayed in many of the other Ritz properties around the world but I would say this one is one of the most beautiful. The view of the ocean from the veranda is breath taking. The staff as always is well trained, friendly and professional. We were out most of the day so we didn't get a chance to eat on the property with the exception of a late snack salads and wine down by the pool which was excellent. Would go back but for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “Reset the soul”
Reviews.Author: prob125
Reviews.Content: This was the second stay at this property in over ten years and i must say the beauty remains the same. It is an hour drive from the Maui airport (OGG), but the drive is scenic and comfortable. Very little signal lights and the traffic flow is constantly moving. you will have the option to stop roadside and take a dip in the ocean by many of the water stops along the way. When you get to the property, you will be greeted by a wonderful staff that are standing by to assist you. The veiw of the ocean from the lobby is tranquil and will definitely put you in vacation mode. The pools are good sides and they even added a section for kids. The standard deluxe room is a good sides and has the amenities your looking for including a dvd player. The property has a couple of restuarants that will cover all the taste buds.
