The Terrance offers an excellent breakfast spread and the Hostess is very attentative. The hotel offers a shutltle a mile from the hotel that includes extra restuarants. The property is surrounded by a championship golf course. The food is pricey, but there is a general store a walk away from the lobby that offers all the eatary you desire at a reasonable price. Check that out and stock you room before spending six dollars on a coke. Access to the beach is a walk or golf cart ride down the hill. The beach area is about 1/3 lengths of a mile and shared by locals, but everyone is polite and just enjoying the beach. Once you leave this property you will be relaxed and ready to start your hectic life again. However, you will have an extra hour ride back to the airport to remember the relax times you had at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Maui splurge - but worth it!”
Reviews.Author: 4boys4me
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Club property in Kapalua with our 4 boys. The service was amazing - very attentive, full of great suggestions for dining/snorkeling/excursions, etc. They only have one restaurant open during the day, as the condos have full-sized kitchens, but the food was great. Poolside service was fantastic and they have the softest, coziest towels ever! But the best part? The ocean view! Sit at the lower end of the pools and look out over the wide expanse of lush green lawn with manicured shrubs and palm trees swaying out to the best view of the ocean! I highly recommend it for anyone stressed out by life. We were able to stay here through our Abercrombie and Kent Residence Club membership, which I also highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Lo949
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz on a family vacation with his parents, sister and brother-in-law, and brother -- with separate rooms, of course! We stayed for 4 nights and it was pure pleasure! When we checked in, we were offered an upgrade on the spot to an oceanview room. Super excited, but the view of the ocean wasn't that great. Actually had to step out onto the balcony and turn fully to the left to see the ocean, but oh well. The grounds are nicely kept and the personnel was extremely friendly and nice. I do wish the pools were a tad bigger. There are three separate pools, with one designated only for adults, which I loved; however, it was always crowded so we had to hang out at the kids' pool every so often. One thing I love the most about the Ritz is that it basically has its own private beach and is not shared with any other properties -- like those of the Grant Wailea and Four Seasons in Wailea, so it doesn't get too crowded. The walk is easy but they offer shuttle service if you don't feel like walking that day. We ventured over to the Grand Wailea to see what it was all about and boy, was that place crazy packed! We loved how the Ritz was a bit isolated from the other resorts. The Grand Wailea looked a bit outdated. We also ate at the Plantation house (eh) and Sansei (great!), which are practically next door. Also highly recommend Kapula Adventures for ziplining fun! Overall we all had a great time and loved the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Vacation paradise for our 25th!”
Reviews.Author: Tracey S
Reviews.Content: We hotel had the trip of a lifetime to the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua for our 25th anniversary. The hotel is beautiful. We were welcomed by Grace at the front desk and were treated like special guests. She was a delight thoroughout our stay. We were upgraded to an ocean view room which was a wonderful surprise. They provided us with a chilled bottle of champagne to enjoy on our private lanai. We loved the buffet breakfast--had it every morning. Kudos to waiters Kevin and Julie and Jose, omelet chef extraordinaire! It is nice to treated so well, called by name, and just made to feel special. The spa experience is not to be missed. Thank you to Yvonne and Jennifer for their exceptional pampering. Loved the Beach House--best mai tais we had on Maui. Couldnt say enough about our trip--it was indeed paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Hot!”
Reviews.Author: Teresa32490
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton at Kapalua in Maui. We were disappointed in the amenities we used. The gym is very small for the size of the resort. I didn't feel it was as clean as it could be. As usual, most people do not use a towel on the equipment. Therefore the equipment should be wiped down fairly frequently. I never saw any one doing that in the 4 days I used the gym. The gym is also missing various free weights which I like to use. The exercise balls all needed to be pumped up. Finally, the crossover cable machine was very old and rickety and difficult to use properly. I also used the adult pool to swim laps in the morning. It was so murky that I could barely see where I was going. I understand about sunscreen, but it was the adult pool and in the morning it should be crystal clear to start the day. Needless to say we were disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “grew to love it over the week”
Reviews.Author: emptynester_11
Reviews.Content: did 3 nights at ritz, followed by 2 nights at rented cottage in hana, then back for 2 days at ritz. our first time in maui and we think we did it right. our impression riding from airport to ritz was initially disappointment - it looked a bit like cancun to us. nondescript highway through hotel zones with big buildings and mega resorts, condos lining the beaches. but after day of staying off the highway as much as possible, avoiding crowds and experiencing the spectacular nature of the place, we fell in love with maui. we are east coasters who love the caribbean and our east coast beaches...but our daughter recently moved to LA & we cashed in alot of points so 8 days in maui was doable. we spent time in LA on either side of the maui trip - big plus for trip covering that kind of distance. couple of ritz kapalua tips - we upgraded to concierge level room first leg, then to suite not on concierge level on second leg of stay. concierge room is nice for treats and drinks throughout the day/evening, but hey, you're in maui, you don't want to be spending time in the club lounge or in your room when the sun is out or setting. we felt that to take advantage of the concierge-level perks you were too tethered to the lounge during peak sun hours. the suite, however was beautiful and worth a splurge. if its a choice between the concierge level or the suite garden view, and the upgrade is similar cost and in your budget, i would opt for suite - esp for special occasion. view of golf course is great - private and beautiful landscapes with ocean in distance. beautiful terrace for breakfast or apres beach. also, dont be discouraged if the weather looks lousy - it changes alot during day and also could be completely sunny if you take short drive to another beach. Or, do 15 min walk over coast trail to kapalua bay -snorkeling there so easy and fun and it does seem to be sunny even when clouds over the ritz. you can rent chairs and snorkels at kapalua bay by the hour, just bring couple towels from the ritz. merryman's restaurant there on that cove - gorgeous setting, highly recommend you reserve for a sunset table there for dinner one night. our favorite spot was the ritz beach bar in late afternoon. friendly bartender and a few chill patrons, good musicians playing on terrace, great cushioned lounge chairs & sofas under the palms, overlooking spectacular cove (fleming beach i think), fun drinks and tasty burger type snacks. can't beat this spot for prolonging a day in paradise. the ritz concierges are very good at setting you up for a snorkel trip (we loved 1/2 day on allie nui (?)), really enjoyed the luau even though it is kind of a corny tourista thing to do. concierge is best resource for restaurant menus and reservations. also - buy "Maui Revealed" - guidebook with great suggestions for exploring. if you have car (we recommend one for the duration of stay) get out and explore esp close-by spots. (dont bother driving all the way to wailea, its more of the same and lot of driving on featureless highway). check out short drive north of ritz -the honolua bay (i think) is very cool snorkeling spot you access though a short hike. and the blowhole another couple miles north of that is cool to check out. definitely take the hike right from the grounds of hotel along the coast, & cliffs between ritz and rest of kapalua. as for hana - it is spectacular. the road there is gorgeous and its only a little taste of what's ahead. however, would not recommend doing it if you just drive to hana & back in same day -too much car time and not enough fun time. only suggest doing the drive to hana if you stay a couple or more days there. off the grid and sights that are off the charts. we rented a cottage based on tripadvisor recommendation and it was lovely. spent 2+ days exploring the area and fell in love with it. wished we did another 1-2 days in hana. no nightlife, eat at roadside foodstands (suggest cafe romantica, buddah bbq just across from romantica). diiner at hana hotel very expensive and very forgettable. hana is not about the establishments or meals, its about the place. eat well at lunch at roadside places or burger at hana ranch and have low expectations for dinner. spend your time in hana exploring - its really not to be missed. and if you do make trip to hana from ritz, time it so you stop for early lunch at mama's fish house in pai'a on the way to hana.

Reviews.Title: “One amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelerZV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ritz Carlton Kapalua in year 2006 and loved everything about it. It is one of those places you should definitely stay! Ritz Carlton is always one of our choice when we travel abroad because of its high class services, concierge, food and its locations. The pool, the beach, room, breakfast, customer service were five stars. During our 10 days stay we rented a car and took a big island trip. Hotel customer service prepared wonderful picnic basket for us and recommended places must see. They work with tour agencies who pick you up and take you around the island. Again the tour agencies provided first class service. I know this was an expensive vacation but it was worth it! At the end of our 10 days visit we went home with great memories, we will definitely go back when our kids are older!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: VALovers
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got a fantastic deal for the Ritz through travelzoo last June. This hotel really lives up to the Ritz name. The pool was fantastic and the beach was within walking distance from the pool area. The waves are humongous and a bit harsh at this beach so I wouldn't recommend going in for small children but since my husband loves waves this wasn't a problem for us. The location of this hotel is a bit far north so it's not easily accessible to anything futher south and especially the Road to Hana so make sure you factor in an extra 45-1 hour for any activites you have south or east of here. Breakfast at the Terrace Cafe was included in our room rate and it was fantastic! I wouldn't recommend dinner here though, the service was really slow and it took us over an hour for our appetizers to come out. Overall I'd recommend this hotel for anyone who just wants to relax and get away from it all but if you want to be in the middle of action I'd recommend staying somewhere further south on the coast.

Reviews.Title: “fourth visit”
Reviews.Author: lwmjr
Reviews.Content: this is a beautiful property, and the plantation golf course is my favorite course in the world. [yeps, said it, my favorite]. spent 4 days at four seasons in wailea, then 5 days at the ritz. i accept one pays more and expects more at the four seasons. this time was more noticable the difference between the two. the ritz, and this is also a comparision from 3 past stays, just seemed under staffed. less folks by pool. took longer to get rooms tidied up. the concierge lounge [great staff], just had less food to offer. [we have stayed on 4 ritz concierge floors in last 12 months. this was the least stuff offered]. this is a beautiful property. [better than four seasons]. it was noticable to all of us that they were cutting costs. charging for in room internet? at these prices?

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: JStanzione
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Club level rooms, and the conceirge- Leslie and Victoria were so sweet and helpful! They helped us plan our road to Hana trip, and gave us great ideas for restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharkalark
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just went here for our honeymoon. This hotel was pretty fabulous. I definitely suggest the club level. It's more expensive but you get food and alcohol all day and the costumer service was great. Only downsides: if you don't like sun here is very little shade poolside and oceanside. To have all day shade the hotel makes you rent a cabana. The least expensive is $100 a day and the only thing that really comes with it is shade. If you want to bake, this shouldn't be an issue for you. The only other thing was that there were a lot more families than I anticipated. I thought a fancy hotel would be mostly adults. Not a huge issue it just surprised me.

Reviews.Title: “Only place to stay on Maui...”
Reviews.Author: LF_wife
Reviews.Content: I have been to the Ritz at least 3 times and have enjoyed each stay a little more. The hotel is gorgeous, the lobby breezy and elegant with views of the ocean. The pool area is expansive and beautiful. The only potential downside is the slight walk to the actual beachfront, as the hotel is perched on a large hill. Otherwise, great food, great service and elegant accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel with Great Views”
Reviews.Author: Floli1211
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend decided to get away for a week and we decided to go to Hawaii. At first we were concerned that the hotel was to far away from everything else but when we got there we realized that this was much better than the other resort/hotels. It's very very secluded and there's a small beach but it wasn't crowded and the pool is amazing and so was the view. We were upgraded to the ocean view room and the view from our room was amazing. Some complained that you couldn't see the ocean but we saw it pretty clearly. It's not as close as the other resorts but we still got to see the ocean and the sun setting on the ocean, it was gorgeous. When booking the Ritz definitely book the club room. The food there was good and they are always stocked with delicious goodies. The concierge desk in the club room was also very helpful. They were able to help us book some excursions and they gave us some places to go check out (a local rib shop and a local park that isn't well known to visitors). Our room was clean and when ever we were in it when the cleaning ladies came by we would ask them if they could come back to clean it and they would. The beds were extremely comfortable. I would definitely stay at this Ritz again. Everyone was very helpful and nice and it was definitely worth every penny we spent. The only thing is that it is far from a lot of the other hotels. So when booking definitely make sure you either have a rental car (Hertz has a station at the Ritz so you can pick up your car there and drop it off there as well) or make sure that what ever excursion/activity you booked, make sure they come and pick you up out there. You'll most likely to be the first people to be picked up and the last people to be dropped off. But it's not too far away so when booking definitely consider the Ritz. Best hotel I've stayed at!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Resort. Service just ok.”
Reviews.Author: takemet0paradise
Reviews.Content: This is a top notch resort. The only little thing that drove me nuts was a small detail. Housekeeping kept forgetting to leave creamer for the coffee, which you figure after staying there a week they would know what you use. I had to ask for it almost every day. Sometimes they forget the little details, but no biggie. Restaurants are top notch. My husband and I had the best romantic dinner at the Banyan Tree. Service was awesome there. I would probably go back. Kapalua is very relaxing and refreshing, which we really enjoyed. The best thing in this resort is the Spa. It's really worth your money!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, Beautiful, Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mom2boys
Reviews.Content: Just spent the first 9 days of August in Maui. The first 5 at the Ritz and the next 4 at the Grand Wailea. The property at the Ritz is beautiful. It is the only hotel around so you don't feel like like you are staying on hotel row. We had an oceanfront room with a view of DT Fleming beach. DT Fleming is picture postcard perfect, not crowded and one of the only beaches we visited in Maui with a lifeguard. Our room was gorgeous, hardwood floors, granite counter kitchen with high end appliances and a separate bedroom. Yes, it is windy but we felt like like that helped us feel cool in the midday sun. Yes, it rained for 20 minutes every morning before 8 a.m. but the winds kept the rest of the day sunny and beautiful. We also spent a morning snorkeling with a naturalist from the Jean Michele Cousteau program at the resort and it was a highlight of our trip. Very nice program - highly recommend. Dinner at the Banyan Tree was one of the best meals on the island. Don't miss Honolua Bay just down the road - great snorkeling. Loved the Kapalua area, the mountains are green the water is blue - in Wailea things were burnt out and dusty. Wailea is completely different and it just depends on what you are looking for. We stayed at the Grand Wailea and our kids had a blast at the waterpark but we were longing for the Ritz. Wailea is much like Kaanapali with crowded beaches and hotel after hotel. So glad we did not go the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, scenic”
Reviews.Author: vanholt
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I just returned from a week at this resort. It is a lovely setting with high standards of service. Pros: setting is lovely and scenic, staff, especially valets and maids, are very accommodating and attentive, location is tucked away from the hustle and bustle and congestion of other resorts on west Maui, rooms are well-appointed, including comfortable bed and luxurious linens; modern exercise room; resort shuttle is always available to various parts of Kapalua; good restaurants in the area of the larger resort and adjacent towns (Napili, e.g., but not the Ritz restaurants, which are over-priced.) Cons: Kapalua weather is unpredictably rainy and very windy; resort is not beach side; long hotel layout makes for long walks to and from room along dark, tired hallway rugs; the hotel does not enforce adult only pool rules; the particular clientele can be crass and noisy at pool and loding walls are thin; ocean view rooms can mean only a corner view of the water from the lanai; a bit sterile and lacking in the feeling of Hawaii heritage.

Reviews.Title: “You can believe the hype... it's all true! AMAZING!!”
Reviews.Author: atravelersrt
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our honeymoon in April in an Ocean View Suite. RC staff communicated with me well in advance of our arrival, booking dinner reservations and spa appointments for us. It was nice to feel pampered even before we arrived. The hotel was very easy to find and it feels like a secluded paradise once you enter the premises. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful but also laid back, which contributes to the relaxed atmosphere. We had a complimentary goodies waiting for us in our room because it was our honeymoon. They go out of their way to make you feel at home. The room itself was enormous, with first rate amenities. There was a WALK IN CLOSET, and a balcony that ran the entire length of the room. The view was spectacular, overlooking the 5 pools and the ocean! My only complaint was that the soaking tub was a bit small. Otherwise, perfect accommodations. The food and service were both lovely at the Banyan Tree restaurant, particularly the steak. The best meal we had was room service for breakfast, placed out on the lanai. We had chocolate chip macadamia nut pancakes, omlette with goat cheese and pesto and fresh POG (pineapple orange guava juice) and kona coffee. It was $$ but the experience was well worth it. Overall, this hotel is perfect for anyone who wants to relax, be pampered and shut the rest of the world out. Service here was great and what you would expect from a Ritz Carlton. I would go back today if I could!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection... Perfected.”
Reviews.Author: R A
Reviews.Content: First I should probably say that I've never felt the urge to write a review for any hotel I've stayed at before. Most of my hotel stays in the past have been monotonous- as if there were standards across the hotel industry in five star hotels of which most hotels simply meet and choose to not overachieve. After checking out of this hotel, I must say that the Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua refines the five star hotel experience. Seriously, I've stayed in properties of the same echelon all over the world, and none of them match the service here. ARRIVAL AND CHECK-IN Upon driving up to the hotel, you feel a sense of comfort and hospitality. We arrived at 11 AM, and no sooner had the car come to a full stop were everyone's doors opened and luggage placed on a bell cart. Then, we proceeded to check in. Our receptionist Johnny handled everything absolutely smoothly. We had arrived five hours before check-in time, but he was quick to accommodate us. We were originally booked in a One-Bedroom Ocean View Residential Suite, but he kindly upgraded us to the Ocean Front Suite. Our room wasn't ready, so we waited a while, and ended up going off-property for lunch. When we returned, Johnny apologized for our suite not being ready, and offered us drinks at the Alaloa Bar (a must-do on arrival!). Within thirty minutes, a manager located a suite and assigned us keys, having our luggage escorted to the room. An upgrade and free drinks... they sure know how to keep me happy :). THE ROOM I think the name describes it all... the suite was spectacular. Despite the fact that it was a long hike to the room, it was worth it at the end. Upon walking in, a foyer with a golf-course view was waiting. Exotic hardwood floors filled the bedroom and living room, and both bathrooms were cladded in mosaic tile and limestone. You could tell that no expense was spared here. The views from the bedroom overlooked the entire golf course, and the living room had an expansive corner balcony with sweeping views of the ocean. Best. Hotel. Room. Ever. THE SERVICE Like I said before, service is unparalleled. My only qualm is regarding pool service. I arrived at the hotel after checking-out of the Grand Hyatt Kauai Resort and Spa, where the staff meticulously looked after every guest at the pool. There seemed to be a lack of staff at the pool in the evenings, and the fact that towel service stops at 5 PM is a little ridiculous. The Grand Hyatt has 24 hour service. DINING We only ate breakfast on one day at The Terrace Restaurant, which was absolutely delicious. The belgian waffles had fresh fruit, and the mediterranean omelet with pesto sauce was a unique twist on traditional breakfast. Very good indeed! THE GROUNDS After staying at the Grand Hyatt (which has the BEST hotel grounds), the simple three tier pool and single hot tub seemed pathetic. Granted, had I come to Maui first, I would've fallen in love with the grounds. No matter how simple, they were meticulously kept. THE LOCATION Kapalua is at the end of the island... meaning that not much is close (sightseeing wise). The area is very exclusive and gorgeous, though. ADVICE Dine on Front Street in Lahaina. All the restaurants were good, and most had live music. Most people advise not to drive past Kapalua on Highway 30... don't listen to them. The sights were amazing... more breath-taking than the Hana Highway (waste of a day, that was...). Also, whether you're just coming to Maui or to multiple islands, book using a vacation package on Expedia. I saved approximately $2600, which means that I paid the standard room price for a suite!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros & Cons”
Reviews.Author: MIOL2
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to the resort but the first since the renovations. PROS: Lovely hotel especially since the renovations, like the flow of the property in that there is plenty of space for everyone with a lot of privacy, maid service was great, staff very accommodating for the most part, quiet, relaxing, beautiful pools and beach. Attention to detail - they sent up a bottle of champagne and strawberries for my birthday - nice gesture! Cons: Food quality slipped. I have always said they had the best burgers beach side than anywhere else I have been....not anymore. Looks like they stopped doing there own. They also had a golf cart shuttle service up and down the hill for the beach, we only saw that on one day. Front desk - Gentlemen at check in was personable but not accommodating at all and had absolutely no followup to my questions at check in. Servers seem to work on tips pool side because they asked us every 20 minutes if we needed something...maybe they should add those flags to the side of the lounge chairs as not to disturb you all the time. And finally for my biggest pet peeve and why I may think twice about returning....on 2 separate occasions at breakfast in the Terrance Restaurant I was completely ignored by 2 different female servers. They addressed my husband by name and removed his plate and offered him more but NEVER served me or addressed me. My plate was only removed once we put it in front of him. He was presented the bill and thanked. Older female staff should be trained to understand that service is not only for the one perceived as paying the bill, it should be for everyone! Besides most women now, like myself, earn as much as their husbands.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suites, but the extras make it a questionable return destination”
Reviews.Author: SHGee
Reviews.Content: Don't mind paying for a 5 star location and hotel but an extra $25/day (resort fee) and $100/day for a 4 person cabana is a bit over the top. "Clincher" was a charge for $24 for three small bowls of white rice at the hotel's signature restaurant. Still- a fine resort and recommended for a relaxing visit.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: dallastripster
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the Club Level the last week of July, 2011. The property was absolutely amazing - fabulous pools, ocean, walking trails and rooms. The Club Level service was truly wonderul. Leslie, Charlotte, Athena and Laura met every need we ever had. They served us special drinks, made reservations for us, and generally treated us like family! We highly recommend the club level. As others have mentioned, the pool does get windy. We rented cabanas on the days were at the pool a lot ot minimize the wind. The cabanas were $100 a day and came with a cooler of drinks and a tray of fresh pineapple. The swimming pool was pretty chilly, but it didn't seem to bother the kids! Our group did a snorkeling/photography program through the Ritz that was really good. We also enjoyed the lei making class. The beach at the Ritz was great for boogie boarding! Overall, we loved the Ritz at Kapalua and we cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: Grandvaux
Reviews.Content: Upgraded on arrival. Reasonable prices in restaurants with option to bring in food or dine outside hotel premises. Very friendly staff. Great waves on beach.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Travelmom76092
Reviews.Content: Spa was divine. Best massage and facial that I've had in a very long time!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!”
Reviews.Author: BPtravels26
Reviews.Content: Our second time to Maui, this year with a 6 mo baby and grandparents. Last year had a wonderful time staying at the Four Seasons in Wailea, but found ourselves driving up to Kapalua for dinner a few times, quite a trek esp at night. We found both hotels are high quality in terms of service and amenities. Pros: 1. Location-close to everything! Lahaina, Fleming beach, snorkeling, shopping. Not to mention Merriman's, Sansei, Lahaina Grill, and Gerard's. 2. Snorkeling/Beach-love the complimentary shuttle from the hotel to Kapalua Beach. Don't forget to grab some hotel beach towels from the valet. There is some shade but you can rent the gear, chairs and umbrellas there. You call the shuttle when you're done for pick up. We paid $75 for 4 adults to snorkel for 3-4 hrs. While there is a bit of a walk down from the hotel to the public beach, they will set up chairs for you and there is a small grassy section the left and right of the beach restaurant (owned by the Ritz) where you can lounge in the shade and still walk to the water for swimming. It's not as fabulous as the beach service as FS but good enough. The waves are a bit rougher and it's at times windy but for the most part, still lots of fun! 3. General Store-this place is great! both as a cheap alternative for a homestyle lunch/afternoon snack and for souvenir shopping, they are now an affiliate of ABC stores. Within 3 min walking out of the hotel lobby, stroller friendly. Cons: 1. Hotel Restaurants: We ate at both the bar, the beach, and Banyan Tree. While the food was pretty good, you are definitely paying a premium for convenience rather than fine cuisine. 2. Spa: We were pretty disappointed with our lomi lomi couples massage. The spa itself has renovated facilities so it's very plush and luxurious, esp the women's quiet room/ jacuzzi area. However, the couples mssg takes place in a small hut that is right near the pool area, not totally secluded and you don't even hear the ocean, instead there's a mechanic hum from the hotel fans/machinery or kids playing. The lomi lomi felt a bit gimicky, esp for the price. 3. Weather-this part of maui is known for being windy and rainy. We were there for 5 days and it did rain on/off either early am or late at night. It didn't really affect any of our planned activities but it wasn't as warm and constant compared to Wailea. Of note for traveling with an infant, we had a pack and play set up in the room and we did fine! The kitchenette has a microwave for sterilizing and a nice big fridge/freezer for storage. They even included dishwasher detergent, sponges, coffee maker, toaster. We ended up ordering take out from Sansei our last night and ate right at the dinner table in the comfort of the suite.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: honeykim11
Reviews.Content: Everything about our stay at the Ritz-Carlton was perfect. The grounds are gorgeous. The hotel itself reflects Hawaiian culture & the beauty of Maui, specifically in the oil paintings and sculptures by local artists. I loved the on-site art gallery. I was concerned about the temperature at this time of year; but with the constant breezes and occasional extremely fine, light mists (even when it's sunny), the temperature was refreshing and very comfortable. It was sunny most of our stay there. I have never seen such beautiful ocean views (compared to Florida, Bahamas, Grand Cayman.) You have the beauty of fir trees/lush mountains, as well as the ocean. As for our room: immaculate. Wonderfully comfortable beds/pillows with down comforters. Daily cleaning and replenishing of anything needed. Staff was superb. We loved Cynthia, our concierge; she helped us map out our 6 days perfectly so that we did fun local things (biked down the volcano; surf lessons, and a luau;) but had plenty of time for just exploring and relaxing at the gorgeous pool or down at the beach. There is also a fabulous spa. The Honolua Store is a short, beautiful walk on property and has everything you might need, including extremely reasonable souvenirs, grocery items, a coffee shop, and cafe. We bought snacks, drinks, and cereal/milk for the room (we had a mini-fridge and also a room safe, which we didn't find until we left. :) There are two airports on the island and I booked my flight before realizing there is an airport much closer than Kahalui (sp?;) which is a 50-minute drive. There is a MacDonald's up the road with prices similiiar to home. Bought my daughter a real ukelele and my son an awesome skateboard; they carried those back on the plane, no problems. This was such a phenomenal vacation for us. We highly recommend the Ritz-Carlton at Kapalua Bay!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: kiwizoe
Reviews.Content: We own a time share on Maui and always go a day or two ahead and stay at a resort. This time we choose the Ritz since this is close to our condo in Kahana. My only real complaint was that I had called several times in the last few months and requested side by side rooms for our group of 7. While we were assured at check in we had adjoining rooms but we actually did not. I felt like this was a minor request that should have been honored. We were on the same floor but not that close. We had a view of the golf course and again I felt like given the lack of guests that a pool view would have been nice. The resort was pretty empty (based on the few number of guests that we saw.. or didn't see). I can't comment on the staff since we really didn't see any of them. Rooms are nice with balconies. The beds weren't as comfortable as I expected and they way they made the bed with extra sheets underneath you was strange. The extra sheets got twisted up during the night and were uncomfortable to sleep on. The fitness center is awesome and immaculate. The buffet breakfast (I had 2 complimentary breakfasts included in my package) was extremely expensive... $30.00.... so for the 13 yr. old in our group big waste of money. The grounds are gorgeous and well maintained. The pool is nice but if you are coming with kids consider the Grand Wailea since it has a guge pool with slides and waterfalls. I'm compairing the two since we stayed there before. Next time we go to Maui we will go back to the Grand Wailea. Fabuous pool and it is closer to restaurants and activities not inside the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room, huge property, good location”
Reviews.Author: SteveGGGG
Reviews.Content: On my first of hopefully many trips to Maui, we stayed here. Stayed in a residential suite and the room was about the best I've ever had: well decorated, big, fantastic! The room included a $500 spending allowance, so we enjoyed eating at the Pineapple Grill and other restaurants on the property. The entire property is huge as they have a van take you around to restaurants and local beaches. The beach you can walk to is a bit rough, but there is a place to have a light lunch there which is a superb setting with the view of the ocean, which is right there and Molokai in the background. The van will also drive you to Kapalua Beach, which is excellent, especially if you want to snorkel, but don't want to get too depp. i snorkeled there in 3-7 feet of water and saw more than a dozen varieties of fish. For those who want to venture out a bit more at this beach, one snorkeler told me he saw more variety among the rocks on left side of beach than he did during a snorkel trip to Molokini. There is even a more calmer area for snorkeling (I was there in the summer) if you continue north on Highway 30, Honolua Bay. The pool areas in the courtyard of the hotel are not anything special. The water is bit too cool and the areas are too open - not enough foliage and trees if you want shade.

Reviews.Title: “Great honeymoon spot”
Reviews.Author: steveandash
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here in February 2011 and we were not disappointed. It is a little out of the way but Maui is so small it didn't really cause an issue. The price difference to stay here vs. the Sheraton or Marriot was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach in the Islands”
Reviews.Author: barking1RedondoBeach
Reviews.Content: Always stay here or Napili Kai when in Maui, this is more fancy but share the same beaches. Best part of the Island yet far away from the crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon heaven”
Reviews.Author: qlk0107
Reviews.Content: My husband and I lived it up at the Ritz for 2 days out of our 2 week honeymoon and it was definitely a highlight. The grounds and pool are gorgeous. Since it is situated on a hill there's a perfect ocean view too. (Although not great for seeing a sunset.) The staff were so accommodating and always smiling. Seriously, there are no grumpy people here! The spa is pure luxury and the perfect way to spend our last morning. Overall, the Ritz lived up to its reputation and you get what you pay for, which is a small fortune. :)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty resort, very windy”
Reviews.Author: Krissykoala
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely property. My husband and I stayed in a Club level room which was absolutely fabulous! The food and beverage presentations were phenomenal. Overall, we had a relaxing stay, but the Ritz is far from everything and it was super windy the entire time. I loved the big hammocks and the view. Service was not as great as other Ritz Carltons, but it was fine. We prefer to stay in Wailea, but the Ritz was relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “OK, the attitude here is super LAME!!!”
Reviews.Author: mauirocks
Reviews.Content: We have been to Maui about 9 times. We travel a lot and I have only written two reviews both positive, however this one is not. We always take our two kids 8 and 11. We have stayed all over the island, the Westin, the Sheraton, Kaanapali Alii, among a few others. We decided to stay here because it is right near some very nice beaches, Kapalua and Naipili Bay and we got to use my husbands point from work travel. So I will start with the good, there is good food all around and the beaches are a shuttle ride away, 5-7 min. The Valet and bell guys could not be nicer or more helpful....in fact if it were not for them this hotel would get 1 star from me. They should be promoted to management! They definitely balanced out the fact that we ran into so many women ( i hate to say it because I am one) who were anything but nice. I felt like most the time they had a distinct flavor of us not wanting to bother them. That is a nice seq-way into the bad---the women who is the "head valet" was not nice at all. In fact she was rude. We stayed five nights, after several attempts on out part to try to be nice she just could not be bothered. Asking her for towels for the shuttle to go to the beach was super uncomfortable, it was almost as if she was so irritated that she barely would give any eye contact. I actually felt sorry for her, I know that customer service is hard, but come on!! I find this really annoying, considering the amount of money we shelled out for this hotel. Not only that I live in a very touristy place (San Diego) so I know about tourists, yet I never give people attitude just for being a "tourist" super LAME!!! There are other instances but I wont make this any longer. Another thing about this hotel was not a favorite of mine was the pool or the lack of it. It was probably the lamest pool I have been to at this level of hotel. I feel like this hotel is for older people who like to golf? It is super windy so there were barely any people at the pool ever. I mean windy, like grab your hat and any book you might be reading. Along with that, the attempt to have a kids area is lame as well... We planned our vacay for half up in West Maui and the rest in south Maui at Grand Walilea. (which you should do!) So we left and I realized we left our camera. Our 1000 dollar HD sony camera, I call the hotel when we got back yesterday and the security officer grills me about my room number and then tells me well it doesn't matter anyway no on has turned that camera in. OK> well as of now I have a call in to the manager and I am hoping to receive a call saying they have my camera. I will let you know. I think at this level stealing from guest should be highly unlikely, that's what I am hoping for. My advice, if you are older and you like very windy pools and dont mind attitude for the thousands of dollars you are spending stay here, if not stay somewhere else, but dont miss those beaches!!! Its too bad too, I really wanna like this place, but the people make the difference. Once we got to the Grand Walilea we got no attitude, in fact everyone was so nice. Not once did I feel I was getting the stink eye!! I know its pricy but its worth it for me.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the splurge!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruchik81
Reviews.Content: We went to Maui for the first time and decided to stay at the Ritz Carlton on Kapalua. Location: First and foremost the location is amazing. It's a little isolated from the more developed part of the island and that adds to it's exclusivity. Being surrounded by 4-5 beautiful beaches adds to it's aura. DT Fleming is right on the property and is heavenly. I highly recommend doing the Kapalua trail which is a little beyond the hotel. Service: The concierge service was excellent and prompt. We had one service mishap when on the very first night our room service order had to be given twice and it finally arrived 2 hours after we ordered it. But the food was good and they took it off our bill. Apart from this the service everywhere was superb. Property and Room: We had a partial sea and golf course view and it was beautiful! We could see the island of Molokai across the sea. I even caught a rainbow one morning after the daily morning shower, which is like a regular feature in Kapalua. The room was spacious, clean, well decorated and comfortable. Overall the property is very well developed with a sprawling golf course, spacious pool (though we didn't spend much time there - world class beaches were close by, remember?), tennis courts etc. Food and dining: On site there were quite a few options food. We only sampled the fare at The Terrace - good, solid breakfast/brunch and Banyan Tree - classy and loved the pea soup but not my entrÃ©e so much. But the location and feel at night is very relaxing. Spa: This is probably one of the best spa experiences I've ever had. Good enough for me to forget the 25 minute delay in the beginning. I appreciated the emphasis on relaxing, no rush to throw you out and the facilities available. My favorite - the exclusive, clothing optional hot tub for women which looked as if the room had been cut out of lava rocks. I had an excellent masseuse who was very careful since mine was a prenatal massage. Snorkeling: I wanted to mention my husband'd experience with the City under the Sea snorkelling excursion available by Ritz Carlton. Since this was his first time and he's not the best swimmer around so we wanted a guided service. The excursion was memorable for him. He was the only person taking the excursion that day so it was like a one on one experience. Kevin - the instructor was very knowledgeable and he took us through a presentation about reefs, how they are formed and the dangers facing them along with the wildlife there. He was an excellent guide and took some great pictures for us too. I would like to add that though I didn't go snorkelling I had gone along with them to the beach. He was very attentive especially after knowing that I was pregnant and included me in all the other activities. Environmental Consciousness: We appreciated the hotels efforts towards environmental consciousness and preservation. This was reflected everywhere. From their Ambassadors program to the room service. IMPORTANT WARNING: Please don't follow your GPS while driving from the airport to the hotel. It will take you through the unrecommended, dangerous and very narrow route through 340 via Honokohau. You should take 380 and come via Lahaina. Though the former route is beautiful it gets really treacherous at times and it's okay if you're prepared for it, but not after a 13 hour flight when you think you're in the middle of nowhere. The Ritz should mention this on their website. Overall a truly amazing vacation. I would return anytime!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels for honeymooners”
Reviews.Author: cvrao
Reviews.Content: It's so calm and quite, at the same time the atmosphere is highly romantic, The staff is friendly, and caring

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: Doug1314
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton's name and reputation speak for themselves, but it was a surprise to the level of service that we received. The staff was always helpful and went the extra yard. The property was drop dead gorgeous with several restaurants onsite. It is Maui, so it is very expensive. They have a beautiful pool with many levels and the beachside is not to far. The atmosphere is family friendly, but is great for singles as well.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: tea_323
Reviews.Content: we spent our honeymoon here. the atmosphere is relaxing with a touch of class. you walk to the beach, and there are hammocks along the way. the only negative comment i have to make is there's no cabanas or chairs on the beach... that's a major disappointment... restaurant is great, staffs are all friendly, room is well kept... it lacks luxurious feeling compared to four seasons, but makes up with casual elegance.

Reviews.Title: “"If you want to feel super spoiled!"”
Reviews.Author: TravelFoodPhotoOhMy
Reviews.Content: I've been to many Ritz-Carltons but have never stayed in one. Found myself having to take a last minute trip this past January. Once there, they gave us a complimentary up grade to a suite. I loved our room so much it felt like a home more then a hotel. Kitchen had build in dishwasher, refrigerator and huge dining table that I ended doing a lot of work off of. There was 2 balconies, nice living room, walk in closet and the bedroom had the biggest king size bed I've ever slept in. We still joke today how when 2 people are sleeping in it, when you reach over, you can't touch the other person. I even loved the bathroom with the huge tub, separate shower and closet for the toilet and the best part was the bath products from "Lather!" I was so happy because I use Lather products at home. In general it makes me happy to know I'm using products that are not bad environment but even more so that I'm on an island. Being at the Kapalua Ritz was one of my best hotel experiences.

Reviews.Title: “probably won't go back”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen123000
Reviews.Content: We made our reservations 6 months in advance. When we arrived we requested a King bed. the woman at the front desk said We were getting 2 Queens. She said there's no guarantees. { kind of rude]wHEN WE GOT OUR "ocean view "room you have to walk out on the lanai and turnto the right to see any ocean. The beach isn't very nice either. The pool was nice, but drinks are over priced. The highlights were the car Valets. Always helpful and very nice. "But the one thing that saved our stay was our morning breakfast. The morning hostess," Nohelani" was fabulous. Her kind and lovely way made our mornings a joy. That's someone they should promote. Quite an asset to the hotel. The "K"s

Reviews.Title: “Hawaii 5-0 Birthday Celebration”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_5-0_11
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from our first visit to Hawaii visiting the island of Maui. We were there to celebrate the 50th birthdays for me and my husband. When we first got there, we decided to upgrade from 1 guest room with 2 queen size beds. At first we had asked about getting a second room but Davison, the young man at the Reception Desk that was helping us suggested we consider the one bedroom suite with a pull out sofa. The upgrade was less expensive than getting 2 separate rooms. Talk about customer service, he was terrific and he really took his time with us. We asked him to add a roll away bed which was no problem and no additional charge. Housekeeping took care of setting it up later that night. The suite was unbelievable. We had a beautiful ocean view from the balcony off of the living room and a view overlooking the golf course from our second balcony in our bedroom. Both views were great and the suite could accommodate me and my husband and our 2 teenagers. The roll away bed worked for our teenage daughter. The sleep sofa was not as comfortable for our teenage son so we set up the chaise lounge in our room for him to sleep. It was a comfortable option. And there were 2 bathrooms in the suite which definitely worked well for our family. By the way, the moisturizer they provide is the best I have ever received while staying at a hotel. My husband even liked it. Prior to leaving for our trip, I had sent a request through the hotel's website mentioning we were coming for our 50th birthdays and were interested in getting reservations to see a luau. Cynthia in Concierge took care of the luau request and then some. When we got back to our room one night after dinner, we were greeted with a bottle of sparkling wine, chilled glasses and a plate covered with shredded coconut and topped with chocolate covered strawberries with a note written in chocolate on the plate wishing both of us Happy 50th Birthdays with a birthday card from the ladies and gentlemen of The Ritz Carlton Kapalua. What a surprise! The other people working the Concierge Desk were also terrific. Mary was very informative. We also were given excellent dessert recommendations from one of the gentleman. They all want to help make your stay memorable. Housekeeping was wonderful the entire stay. I hope everyone tips them well while they are there. They keep the rooms looking lovely and stocked with bottled waters, coffees, etc. The condiment packs provided for the coffees and teas do not include a lot of Sweet & Low and my husband had mentioned it to one of the sweet housekeeping ladies. She loaded up the tray with more than enough Sweet & Low packets so my husband was set for the week. The valets were friendly and quick. They were very pleasant and helpful when they would offer suggestions to us as we would head out for the day. And would greet us with smiles and questions about how our day had been on our return. The grounds are beautiful. My son and I went running a few mornings. Sometimes we took the Coastal Trail which has an amazing view and had a great breeze and our last morning we also ran over to the Plantation Course about a mile away. I can see why the PGA has played there. The entire family used the fitness center during our stay. They have a lot of equipment and machines. It is open around the clock. At 7:00 am most of the elliptical machines and treadmills are being used so you may want to time your visit. There is also a restroom/locker room area which is convenient and nice. There are numerous restaurants. We ate breakfast a couple of mornings in The Terrace Restaurant. They have a wonderful brunch. The fruit is fresh and sweet. The gentleman making the omelettes does a terrific job. We also ate dinner at The Pineapple Grill over by the Bay Course around the corner and at The Plantation House over by the Plantation Course up the road a bit. Both experiences were delicious. And Aaron at The Plantation House brought us out Brownie Sundaes with candles at our birthday dinner with a signed card from the staff at the restaurant. Nice touch! For those times where you do not want to spend a lot on a meal, the Honolua Store within walking distance of the resort has meals available. We went for breakfast and lunch a number of days. It is very good and very reasonable. You can also buy sunscreen and other goodies. It is definitely less expensive than the shop in the hotel for those types of items. The pool area is nice. There are 3 pool levels. The middle pool is the adult pool. There is a kiddie pool and 2 spas available too. As others have mentioned, there are cabanas available to rent and some shaded chairs available. The first day at the pool we had Dustin helping us with towels and food. He was very attentive. Other days, however, some of the pool staff had been more involved helping the cabana people since the people renting cabanas are paying money for the use of them. Oh well. The food and drinks at the pool area are tasty. Try the homemade chips and salsa - delicious! The D.T. Fleming Beach is right there. It had been voted Best Beach in America in 2006. Yes, you have to walk to get there. If you want to get a cart ride, they will provide it for you. The walk was very nice. My son enjoyed the beach more than the pool. It is probably the cleanest beach I have ever seen. We had an oceanview suite so we had quite a walk from the lobby to our hotel room. The walk was good exercise and after some of our filling meals we really needed the extra steps to work off our food. And more importantly, the view was worth it. Our room also overlooked the area that they hold their wedding ceremonies at so we watched a number of weddings during the week. This is the resort to come to if you want to relax and be pampered. If you are trying to come to Maui on a low budget, you may want to check out other hotel options. Yes, this is a five star resort and yes they should provide excellent service. The people that work here are all pleasant and actually seem to like what they are doing and where they are doing it. It definitely seemed more apparent at this resort than others I have stayed at over the years. When I was first planning this trip I had hoped for a relaxing vacation. My family and I definitely had a wonderful experience while staying at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua and would like to thank the ladies and gentlemen that work there for making it possible.

Reviews.Title: “Really gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: cpapa84
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel back in April for the second time. It is GORGEOUS!! I mean, really gorgeous. As soon as you walk into the lobby, you get hit with this feeling of calmness, serenity and cool air.. and the watermelon infused water doesn't hurt :) I'll go with the positives and negatives: Positives: -Like I said.. totally gorgeous -You get the unique benefit of being at a secluded resort while also having other food options available nearby, because it's part of the Kapalua resort. I LOVED LOVED LOVED the Village Cafe and Sweet Shoppe, which was not in existence during our first stay. It had gorgeous views and was a perfect place to go for breakfast - delicious food, great atmosphere at a fraction of the cost of the Ritz Carlton. We also got takeout for dinner from there one night and brought it back to our lanai, which was great. The sushi place in Kapalua was also very good, and I probably had the best meal of my life (no joke) at Merriman's. All of this stuff is either in walking distance or you can hop on the Kapalua shuttle, which runs very regularly- so you don't have to worry about drinking and driving. I really liked being able to come and go from the resort like this. -Staff was great. There was an early 30s-ish (I think?) man who worked at the pool who was just the nicest person and was coming around and talking to everyone to see how he could make their stay better, etc. I remember seeing him talk to some of the other people around us and thinking that he must know them personally because everyone was clearly enjoying their conversation, but then he kept moving on to each group and came to talk to us. He gave us all of these great tips for the island and probably provided the best customer service of any hotel employee I've ever encountered, anywhere. I really wish I remembered his name because he was so fantastic and honestly would make a great manager.. if management is reading this, I believe that he is married with a young son and his wife is part Persian. Not sure if that narrows it down at all. He really should be recognized. -This kind of goes along with #2, but you are also really close to Lahaina without being at a tourist trap. We went down to Lahaina a few times and it was super easy. -The wind: you would not think this would be a positive, but it created a great breeze in the hot sun. Kapalua is a very windy area. Negatives: -The pool situation is a problem, but, they are definitely making it better. When we stayed there the first time, we were not super happy with the fact that there were no umbrellas (I have very fair skin, and will fry in the hot sun despite SPF one million). I guess because of the wind, they couldn't put traditional umbrellas up and your only option was to rent a cabana for $$$. By this visit two years later, they had installed a couple of metal hut type umbrellas (sounds weird but they were great). It was still an issue trying to secure one in the morning and we saw people fighting. However, according to the pool staff, they are putting more of them in this year. They are also FINALLY designating one of the pools as an adult's pool, which should have been done a long time ago. There was no adult's pool during either of our visits, which was such a pain! -If you come during school break, beware. I don't know exactly what the deal is, but there is some relationship between the Ritz and some (all?) of the Kapalua resort, meaning that people staying at the resort can come use the Ritz amenities like the pool. This was not such a big deal when we came in April but our first trip was in July and it was just out of control. SO many kids everywhere. -Major lack of water pressure in the showers. Not sure what the deal was with this but it was hard to wash your hair. Tips: -I don't think you need to rent a car for your entire stay, but you definitely are going to get bored if you go more than a couple days without a car. All you can really do is eat, swim, and golf if you don't have a car. Self parking is free. -FLY IN TO WEST MAUI. We did this for our second trip and wow, what a difference. Otherwise, it's a pretty long ride from the airport. I recommend Island Air. -Don't stay here if you are going to stay in the cheapest class of room. There are plenty of hotels where you can do that and still wind up with a perfectly fine view. Here, you are literally facing a wall. It is well worth the price of an upgrade. You don't necessarily need a pool or ocean view, but the view of the wall really ruins the experience. We had a pool view our second time around and it was so much better. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay and hope to come back again when the pool situation is sorted out!

Reviews.Title: “They charge you $10 for self-parking”
Reviews.Author: katethegreat54
Reviews.Content: We never even made it inside for a drink in their lounge because they ask for $10 to self-park. Don't get me wrong, sometimes parking lots should charge. But this is a huge, empty lot. They are soaking their guests and deterring others from checking out their facilities. We will just have to guess as to how nice the place might be.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: STAR1231
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Ritz Kapalua, we initially stayed in July 2009. After this trip, we will be staying only at the Four Seasons Wailea. I traveled with hubby and my 6 month old. The service was terrible. The front desk manager, Zach something or the other, was not helpful at all. We were given a tiny room with a boring view, mostly of our neighbors. The AC in the room was not functioning properly and there were insects (probably because we were on the bottom floor). I tried contacting Zach stating explicitly that I have a 6 month old that I didnt want bitten by the pests and asking him what we could do to get a more comfortable room, but he did not return our call. Mind you, I was not asking for a comped upgrade, we wanted to pay. This Ritz is not worth it, please stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “First trip to Hawaii. Fell in love with the Island and the Ritz-Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: electricpickle
Reviews.Content: Overall, this resort is Amazing. I will make this simple. We literally just got back from our honeymoon last night after 6 nights. POSITIVES: Service: From the Bellhops to the valets to housekeeping, the entire staff was always welcoming, bright-eyed, and willing to serve. Accommodations: 5-star. The room was beautiful. It was an ocean view and we spent many an evening on the balcony sipping on a tasty beverage. The bathroom had a separate tub from the shower which was nice. It was exactly like something you see out of a movie. Grounds: The grounds are GORGEOUS! The ocean is a little walk to get to but really nice. There are tennis and basketball courts which was awesome and the pools and hot tubs were perfect! LOCATION: Away from the hustle and bustle of the other resort towns which we loved. Everything is within driving distance and we drove up to other areas on a daily basis. NEGATIVES: #1. Unless you are lucky enough to have a room close to the lobby there is quite a hike to get to your room. In general this won't be an issue unless you are traveling with somebody who is elderly or has trouble physically exerting themselves. #2. The beach is a little bit of a walk from the main property. There is a well lit path and they do offer a nice cart back and forth but I didn't mind the walk in the least. #3. THE FOOD IS REALLY EXPENSIVE AND SO IS THE SPA. We didn't eat at the hotel one time. We bought groceries and ate at some great places around town like, Round Table Pizza, Mai Tai Cafe, there are tons of options so before you drop a couple hundred dollars on a meal check out your options. THINGS WE DID THAT MIGHT INTEREST YOU: Golfed at the Bay Course: If you are staying at the ritz you can golf this world famous course for under $200. WORTH IT! Parasailed: You can do this as a pair for $130 total. We did it through West Maui Parasailing and would recommend them. Nice because it only takes an hour of your time. Attend a Luau: We went to the Feast at Lele which was $213 total for the couple. Great experience! Fantastic 5 course meal, great entertainment, and alcohol is all included in the price! We would do this again. Road to Hana: Look it up and do it! MAKE SURE TO BUY the CD that guys you through the trip. It's only $19.99 and you can get it at a bunch of different places, just ask. I know that we looked on Travel Advisor and used alot of the comments we found to make our decision to stay here. This is a great atmosphere for both couples and families in our opinion. A LOT quieter than the other "resorty" options but still possessing the amenities you expect from a 5-star resort. Out.

Reviews.Title: “It is just an above avg room for app 600 dollars a day”
Reviews.Author: para0074Msp
Reviews.Content: Just winding our big 3 wk long Hawaii (Maui, Big Island, Oahu) tour. Hotel is highly over rated. The pool is OK. Just three pools each 3-4 ft deep and oddly shaped. Those poolside cabanas in the picture do not be deceived by them; they are 100-300 dollars a day. There are only two free shady umbrellas that accommodate 4-5 people per pool and they leave most of the guests roasting by the pool with absolutely no shade unless they pay. It is OK to spend a little more in Hawaii. But Ritz rips you off in an outrageous way. They have only one dinner restaurant and every entree is at least 40 and up. We ended up taking most of our meals at Sansei Japanese restaurant, which is at a walking distance to Ritz. This is a very good restaurant and food is worth the price (appx 150 per a very good dinner). The next two outrageous things are; 1. the resort does not have a self operated laundry; you would be paying 10 bucks to get your panty washed. 2. We wanted to print some routs and internet access in the business center is 0.78 cents a minute and I don't know how much a print out is (this was not like five star to me). So if I really think without any clutter, all what we got is a very mediocre room for 600 dollars a day. Do not be deceived by the picture of the pool or how pompous the name Ritz Carlton sounds like. In my opinion that is all what they have. Again, that is just my view (but many of what I have mentioned above are facts). There is no direct beach access from the resort. You can walk down in the property to the beach but the sea in this area are too rough to enjoy (even there is a public warning next to the public parking lot to the beach). Remember every beach in Hawaii has to have public access by law. So you can access any good beach regardless of you stay The breakfast buffet is nice (30 bucks per person). I think one can enjoy the pool (if you are crazy about the picture of it) and the breakfast both by just visiting the resort without breaking the bank (may have to check with the hotel on this).

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: emac747
Reviews.Content: I was impressed. We booked through priceline and got a great deal. We arrived early and the room was not ready until three, but the front desk provided us a fitness key to change and spent the afternoon by the pool/beach. Service was excellent. We are getting married in Maui next year and will be back at this hotel next year. Be ready to spend some money though, hotel room svc, and poolside bar is pretty pricey.

Reviews.Title: “paradise found”
Reviews.Author: jaye116
Reviews.Content: Just back from the Ritz. Service, grounds, food, and rooms were great! More quiet on this end of the island as opposed to the many families found down on Wailea end. Drinks and food seemed to be somewhat expensive though. Stayed on the concierge floor ( 8 & 9) where breakfast, lunch, and snacks were provided along with free drinks- wine, liquor, and champagne. Very relaxing around the pool and beach. Golf great at Kapalua courses- bay and plantation.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Value”
Reviews.Author: travelblog3
Reviews.Content: Beautiful property, friendly service, food was good, all was overpriced.

Reviews.Title: “I should have known better”
Reviews.Author: people2people
Reviews.Content: If you like large - could be anywhere in the world hotels - you may like it here. This was our second stop on our Hawaiian holiday. We visited Maui 25 yrs. ago on our honeymoon - didn't like it then & still don't. Don't get me wrong, there are nice things about the island and most people love it. The Ritz-Carlton is just big & sterile. We had a nice large suite, very clean & comfortable - nothing spectacular. The staff was nice... The pool was enormous... The beach was AWFUL... A long hike from the hotel to find a beach w/ waves so strong that you could not even wade in. No lounge chairs - who wants to go to an island and sit at the pool? Not me. And the wind!!! Unbearable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great nearby snorkeling”
Reviews.Author: sunfun18
Reviews.Content: Not a great start: We arrived at the Ritz Carlton at around 4 am our time from the East Coast (but 10 pm local time). We were extremely tired from a very long flight. The woman at check in was busy with another customer and it took her at least 20 minutes to check them in. After that she stepped into the back room for about 10 minutes. We couldn't believe there wasn't anyone else at this enormous hotel available to help us and that this woman couldn't try to get to us sooner. When she finally did check us in, there was no porters to help us to our room. The woman gave us directions which involved many turns and there were a few different elevator banks. It took us 20 minutes to find our room. By this time, we were exhausted and frustrated. Things got better quickly: The room was extremely nice. It was a one bedroom suite overlooking the ocean. It was very dark with the black out curtains and very quiet. It was easy to fall asleep and stay asleep. The room was clean and nicely decorated and the bed was very comfortable. The only negative was some of the lamps in the room did not work, which made it a little dark. We also had two bathrooms which was a huge plus. Service lacking: We didn't find the concierge desk to be overly helpful. We asked them about various activities and the response was not overly helpful. It is good that we were with a group and didn't have to rely on the hotel for our activities. Pools, Ocean: The hotel is very large, but was only half occupied. This was the weekend after the Tsunami and many people had cancelled. I imagine it would have been much more crowded otherwise. It was not hard to get a seat by the pool. We never sat by the ocean. It was a long walk to get to the beach. The pools are very large and nice. There is adequate shade. The attendants are helpful, but not annoying at all. It is very pleasant to sit by the pools. Food: We only ate at the restaurants for breakfast and lunch, which were all very good. There are a number of nice restaurants nearby too. Hiking trails: From the hotel there are a number of marked trails for hiking. These are very nice and worth doing. Also very worth doing is the coastal walk over to the next beach which has a bay with incredible snorkeling. This is a must do. They rent equipment at the beach and you can charge it to your room. Boat excursions highly recommended: We also took a snorkeling trip and a whale watch. These trips were through the "Hula Girl" company and I can highly recommend them. We spent a very long time with a mother whale and her baby and it was incredible. Shopping: We took a trip into the nearby town of Lahaina. This is also something I recommend. It is a nice way to spend a few hours and do a little shopping.

Reviews.Title: “Best vacation ever”
Reviews.Author: TommyJim
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ritz Kapalua for a week in April as part of a company sales incentive trip. Simply put, it was as close to a perfect hotel experience as I've ever had. If you're going to take the time and spend the money to travel all the way to Hawaii, you want to make sure you treat yourself to the best. Having been to Maui several times, trust me when I tell you Kapalua is where you want to be. And if a hotel is in your plans, this is the one to choose. The rooms, food, service and hotel grounds were universally exceptional. My only regret is after six nights at the Ritz, we chose to spend the last two nights at a more expensive hotel in Wailea area. After such an incredible experience at the Ritz Kapalua, the far more commercialized and noisy Wailea area was a disappointment. Wailea reminds me a lot of what the Kaanapali area was 25 years ago. The hotels are new and incredibly scenic, but they failed to deliver the real Hawaii vacation experience we were after.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel to stay at, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: nycgurl22
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights on our Honeymoon in November 2010. Rooms were nice, beautiful pool area, spa was wonderful (had a couples massage), fitness center was great, food and drink selection = great (The Banyan Tree Restaurant was out of this world!!!! great food, great service, do the tasting menu. Also Sansei was amazing! Beach house, great for lunch with a great view) Service was really sub-par. Some of the bartenders were really nasty, the whole billing system was really frustrating (used a debit card instead of credit card and they kept charging it), concierge was OK (had an issue with the timing of a snorkeling trip, he told us the wrong time and we missed it and were not refunded). We visited the Four Seasons during our stay, next time we will stay there instead of the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room, not so great service”
Reviews.Author: ShirleyWilloughbyOH
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Ritz, having been there 7 years ago. We like staying on this side of the island and Kaanapali is too built up. Kapalua is nice and quiet, but it is so windy there, you can't even sit at the pool or beach. Plus the Ritz (which is now owned by Marriott) makes you sign up for beach chairs and makes you, the guest, carry them down stairs to the sand. They do not set them up for you. And they only have 12--they have how many rooms and they have 12 beach chairs? Unbelievable. We were upgraded to a residential suite, perhaps because we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. Plus there was a huge goodie basket with chips, cookies, chocolates and fruit and a plate with chocolate-covered strawberries with a "Happy 30th Anniversary" written in chocolate--it was very nice and we really appreciated it. The residential suites are great. They took 2 guest rooms and made one of them into a kitchen/dining/living area. It's convenient to have a frig, freezer, microwave and room to spread out. The dining table was especially handy--put all of our stuff there that we would take with us each day so as not to clutter up the bedroom. The bathrooms were large as well. It's just too bad about the windy conditions, the 'sock you for everything' mentality--$25 daily resort fee. For what? The privilege of parking your own car and carrying your own beach chair--if you can get one? Maui has gotten too built up, so we won't visit again. And really I have no other recommendations as there isn't any hotel, in my opinion, worth staying at.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Kapalua area and secluded Northwest coast”
Reviews.Author: cpmayor
Reviews.Content: Kapalua is far from the rest of the island but that's what makes it nice. Don't miss the drive to the North which offers more interesting oceanside scenery than the road to Hana!

Reviews.Title: “Great and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: NormalHeightsGirl
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place to get-a-way and relax. Beautiful property, not crowded and an easy walk to D.T. Fleming Beach. It is the last resort at the northwest side of the island. Although it is within 15 - 20 minutes from tourist areas, it feels remote and secluded. The room was spacious and very well maintained. We will be coming back! A few tips: In May, it was rather windy and the area gets more rain than the resorts a few miles to the south. But, the rain showers did not last long, and the rain adds beauty to the area. Be sure to walk down to the small rocky peninsula, located just west of D.T. Fleming Beach. There you will find the Dragon's Teeth, the Kapalua Labyrinth, and great views of the resort and the beach. Take your camera. Best macadamen nut pancakes in the world at neighboring Gazebo Restaurant located at the Napali Shores Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Luxury”
Reviews.Author: ksNOLA
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the condo/time shares. Our 2 bedroom condo was absolute pefection...gorgeous furnishings, huge lanai, amazing view, plentiful seating and so on. The pool(s) just available to condo residents were so beautiful and peaceful. The wait-staff around the pools was the same daily so we built a relationship with them. The beach access is not directly by the pool so we didn't spend any time there (horrible....I know :)). You must eat dinner at Merriman's which is in walking distance, along the beach. The work-out facility was surprisingly small but still very nice. The spa was large and also very nice. There is a juice/snack bar in the spa which we visited after each of our work-outs. The resort dining is minimal. The only negative I could find about Kapalua is the proximity to shopping and dining. If you're planning a vacation to Kapalua you must have a car and be prepared to drive about 20 minutes to the more touristy parts of the island. if you are looking for a secluded vacation and maybe eating your meals at home this is the perfect spot. We like to eat out and shop so it's a little far for that.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Simply one of the best 3 hotels i've ever stayed in (and i've stayed in 300+!)”
Reviews.Author: FruitBat01
Reviews.Content: I went the the Ritz Carlton with my husband on a work sales incentive trip - but we extended our stay. Quite simply it was AMAZING! GO HERE NOW!!! the setting, the view, the room (we had a suite room) the food, the service, the pool, the food (! it was that good i'll mention it twice!) the cocktails! Not cheap - but you get what you pay for in life and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - i'm not sure if we'll ever make it back to Hawaii again - but if we do - i'll demand we stay here. It was excellent. Proper 5 star. I cannot think of one thing that wasn't perfect (other than Hawaii being so blinkin far from the UK!)

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and luxurious hotel with efficient friendly service”
Reviews.Author: LynJeffs
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week and enjoyed every moment. It's a beautiful hotel which is luxurious, extremely clean and really well maintained. The staff couldn't do enough to make you feel welcome and make sure you get the most out of your stay: We were upgraded for the latter part of our holiday for our wedding and recieved a bottle of campagne and chocolate coated strawberries on our last night: a nice touch. There are several fantastic restaurants nearby with a courtesy mini bus running back and forth to take you there and pick you up if you fancy a change from the hotel restaurants (very pricey) The pool is wonderful with plenty of sun beds and it's just a very short ( and pretty) walk down to the most gorgeous beach ever: DT Fleming beach. The beach was never over crowded and the water was gorgeous for a swim. Sometimes it was a bit breezy but it was a warm breeze and we actually welcomed this on warmer days. We got married here and had a perfect day rounded off with a superb meal at the Banyan Tree. Kapalua is breathtakingly beautiful and I honestly can't fault this super hotel. Go there and enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “It was the highlight of our trip!”
Reviews.Author: vkelterborn
Reviews.Content: Such a beautiful hotel! The location was great, the service was awesome, and they even had an activities center where we learned to stand-up paddle and snorkle! I think the activities center was called the Cousteau Ambassadors of the Environment... such a great and unique offer the hotel provided. Anyway, I will be staying at the Ritz every time we visit Maui. Loved! PS: The spa was first-class too :)

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time, thanks to Club Level Leslie and Athena!! And concierge Jerry!”
Reviews.Author: InaMay123
Reviews.Content: I took a solo birthday trip to Maui. I stayed across the entire island, and began my trip with the resort side at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. My Travel Agent was amazing and booked thee best room for my on the club level. If you are going,t he Club level is a great value! Totally worth the extra cash from the OPEN BAR and food items they serve throughout the day alone. But what really makes it special are the concierge people there who help you. I met a few, but the two that i saw the most were Leslie and Athena. I dont have their cards on me at the momnent so I dont have their last names handy, but no matter. They were not only attentive to the needs of all the guests, but they also genuinely cared for us, asking tons of questions, sharing their own stories and experiences. They truly made everyone feel special and treated everyone as an individual, not some factory assembly line of guests. They are truly amazing go see them! And tell them Ina said hi!! :) Other than that, the Ritz itself was a great resort to stay in. Kind of secluded from the other places like Ka'anapali but if that is what you're looking for, its the way to go to.
