The grounds are Beeeyoootiful of course. but if you want some action, head over to Ka'anapali around the Whalers Village area and walk around if you'd like to see more people than those who are only staying at the Ritz. Still its a great place to stay. I would also however hghly recommend heading over to Hana and Kipahulu as I did and staying there for awhile. THATS the real Maui. Totally a retreat away from the city, paradise. What an adventure!! Hope this all helps, enjoy your trip! Mahalo and Aloha!!

Reviews.Title: “Yeah it's nice, but we expected more...”
Reviews.Author: Stones7
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and felt a little disappointed, not so much that we felt the need to complain, or rant on TA, but for the money we paid, we just expected more. The property is nice, well maintained, the grounds are perfectly manicured, and the pool area looks beautiful. The view of the ocean through the lobby when you first walk into the hotel makes you feel instantly relaxed. But the hotel is massive. It really doesn't seem it when you drive up, but our room was towards the lower end of one of the wings of the hotel (which is sort of a horse-shoe shape, with the lobby area in the middle) and we were amazed how far we had to walk when we first checked in. Our deluxe room was on the small side for the price paid and we only had a partial ocean view - the view was mainly of the pool area. But despite the fact it was quite close to the pool, the planting around the lanai made it feel secluded. I must admit I personally loved the chez longue (or day bed) in the room, and wished I could move it outside so I could spend a few hours relaxing on it, whilst reading, especially as the chairs on the lanai weren't great for that. But generally the room was comfortable, well decorated and was actually fairly quiet considering the size of the hotel. Our main problem with the property is the size; and therefore the sheer numbers of guests. There were queues to check-in, and queues to check-out, and there were several corporate events taking place at the hotel - including one that required the closing off of the majority of the pool area for most of one of the days whilst we were staying. The staff didn't seem particularly well prepared to deal with the numbers, or perhaps there just wasn't enough staff. This was particularly noticeable by the pool where the loungers which had any shade went very quickly, and so most people were left with a choice of lying in the full sun, renting a cabana or doing something other than relaxing by the pool. Noticeably the cabanas were largely empty. We also found that getting pool-side drinks service seemed to be very hit and miss. The other place where the numbers of guests caused problems was at breakfast. Our rate included breakfast, and so it seemed did a lot of other guests. There was frequently queues to be seated for breakfast, sometimes stretching back 30-40 guests, and snaking up the stairs towards the lobby area. This meant a wait most mornings, and some mornings we simply gave up waiting. The number of guests also made personal service very difficult for the staff. Even the staff who we did regularly have interactions with would not be able to remember us one day to the next. Our expectations of a luxury resort are not just for top class amenities or a comfortable room, but also for the service to match, and this is where the Ritz-Carlton fell down badly for us. The one major exception to this was at the Banyan Tree - the on-site restaurant where we ate dinner on one evening. That was excellent, and should be used as an example by the hotel management as to how to do it right. If you are considering this property as a honeymoon destination then we would issue a note of caution. The hotel seems more suited to families, than it does to couples. Perhaps use the facilities such as the spa, and eat at the Banyan Tree; but for romantic couples time stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “The only Ritz in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: mciordan
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1BR suite, which was very spacious, with 2 large balconies, a refrigerator, toaster, plates and a microwave oven. There is no cooking top (as if one would need one :-) Kapalua is a wonderful place, away from the tourist area , (Lahaina) very rugged and full of natural beauty. The DT Fleming beach is one of the most beautiful out there, but be advised that it is a public beach ( although is so isolated, I've never seen it crowded) so there is no chair, towel or drink service.Also there is no lifeguard on duty. Service is great at the pool- just as expected from a Ritz- and if you arrive on a Saturday, there are a lot of kid toys being passed from departing guests. One last thing I wanted to mention, as a FYI: there are no Bulgary amenities in this Ritz, they have their own " island brand" , very fitting,I guess, but I was not a fan. Also, there seams to be a bit more precipitation here,i n Kapalua than few miles S, in the resort area, but it does not stick around for too long. We enjoyed the sushi place, but make sure you make reservations , especially on the week-end, is a very popular place on the Island. The other restaurant, we did not care for- the bar by the pool serves decent lunch fare.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to celebrate Anniversary!”
Reviews.Author: Helenc0
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived we were very comfortable. The staff was helpful and booked whale watching and zipline tours. They recommended amazing restaurants. The restaurants on property and nearby were excellent. We had a car but they provide free transportation to restaurants nearby. The pool and grounds were beautifully kept and relaxing for walking around. I am looking forward to staying here again. Wifi in room allowed us to plan our day trips.

Reviews.Title: “It's a Ritz with okay service”
Reviews.Author: DebbieGoshen
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here several times over the years and this year the property didn't feel any better or worse than previous stays. I have often had issues with the wind, but felt lucky this time. I have also had issues with the weather in the hotel area. Several days my husband and I drove to Lahina and the weather there was much nicer than at the Ritz. I can't blame the Ritz as they only picked the location. The staff at this Ritz aren't as wonderful as the staff at other Ritz Carltons. I talked to some of the staff and I know they have been addressing the problem. The service at the Ritz in the Grand Cayman, Laguna Niguel and Los Angeles has general been a step above this property. I won't say it isn't good, but I'm happy to try other properties on Maui in the future.

Reviews.Title: “If you can't decide between the Ritz and the Four Seasons, pick the FS!!!”
Reviews.Author: moorech1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at both. The Ritz after 4 nights at the FS Wailea. Night and day difference in service, rooms, etc. Don't get me wrong, the Ritz is a nice hotel, but it is HUGE compared to the FS and seemed very "Marriott-like". At the FS, service was prompt and professional, they knew your name and we felt well taken care of. At the Ritz, they tried, but it wasn't consistent. And although the hotel was recently renovated, it seems like they ran out of money and couldn't provide all the 5 star touches like the FS. We had intended to stay there 3 nights, but left after 1 to go back to the FS. Save yourself lots of worry and anxiety and stay at the FS if you are looking for a top notch, relaxing and romantic vacation in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lilsie
Reviews.Content: We visited the ritz with our 8 month old daughter and stayed in a residential suite for 5 nights. We have been to Maui before and have stayed at the four seasons and the fairmont. Although the four seasons is amazing, in terms of value for money and traveling with an infant and location the ritz is perfect. The suite was very spacious, modern and clean. The pool is huge and service was impeccable. Most of all we loved the grounds and the beach side location. We much preferred it to wailea. The restaurants were impressive, lots of options, we found the pool side and beach side cafes great and we had a great meal at the banyan tree. We also discovered a great little store behind the ritz were you can purchase breakfast and lunch. It's so cheap in comparison to hotel but I'd highly recommend it. There is also a great Japanese restaurant behind the hotel which gets pretty busy so make sure you book. We will definitely visit the ritz again!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect romantic destination”
Reviews.Author: GreatTraveltime
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Kapalua defines the word service. Once you enjoy the club level experience, you will never choose otherwise. The value and service of the club lounge makes it difficult to leave the resort. Now that I am home, I wish that I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “First Class Resort”
Reviews.Author: Momo3032
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from our stay at the Ritz Maui. Let us be the 1st to say that this stay at the Ritz is not a "stay" it is an experience. We had the opportunity to stay in a Club Level Room which while not the largest room is what you would expect from a Ritz. The extra money that it costs to stay in a Club Room is WELL worth it. Five food offerings a day which are both on the healthier side as well as down right tasty as well as Top Shelf booze which is all free and included in the Club Room package saves hundreds of dollars. On top of that- the staff in the lounge are the best in the business (Laura, Leslie, and Valerye are as good as they come)! The views from the pool and on the resort are amazing, the location can be a slight concern as the sun is not as consistent as in Wailea but still good, and the area around Kapula especially between mile marker 32-40 rival the road to Hana. Also the guide books well sell against Kapaula HOWEVER no more than 5-10 min away is more of a social area than what you can find in the Wailea area. In closing, the Ritz Carlton Maui is a first class resort where everyone from the valets to the front desk know your name and care about giving each guest a first class experience.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: natalie-homewood
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the ritz-carlton Kapalua on our honeymoon, and from the moment you arrive you feel like you are staying somewhere special, not your normal average hotel or resort. Recommend booking a suite if you can... they are huge! and if staying for a week its nice to have all that room. The bed was so comfortable I had the best sleep ever! The resort has free wifi, I read on here before I went that you get charged for it, but was glad when I found out you don't! They do however charge you to use there own computers. The staff at the hotel are great, really helpful and very friendly. At the start of our stay we went down to the concierge desk and one of the ladies helped us plan all the things we wanted to do while we were there, from restaurant bookings and taxis to car hire and whale watching, everything was booked for us! We spent a day at the spa, and had a couples massage.... it was amazing! came out feeling so relaxed! Restaurants on the resort- we ate at most of them (apart from The Terrace) our favourite being The Banyan tree, this is there signature restaurant and also the most expensive! but I think worth the money... we saved that experience for the last night of our stay, and had the best steak I think i've ever had (The Snake River Kobe Beef). The Pool cafe and beach house are great places to go for lunch, my favourite being the beach house because of the view! I would NOT recommend the Kai sushi restaurant, over priced and the food was not good at all. I found the sushi was nothing special and the tempura to be very very greasy! If you have a craving for sushi I'd recommend the Sansei Restaurant which is about 5 mins walk from the hotel, some of the best sushi i've ever had! Another restaurant near the hotel it Merrimans, this is also a great experience, a bit on the pricey side but worth it! There is a store right next to the hotel called the Honolulu store, this was really handy, we stocked up our room fridge with plenty of snacks and drinks! and they have a deli counter so you can get breakfast or lunch there, at a lower price than the hotel. The Kapalua resort put on a free shuttle bus so you can get to places like the Merrimans Restaurant, the Kapalua Beach, the golf courses and the Kapalua West Airport! which was great as we flew into this airport from Oahu, and when we landed just used the free phone to call for the shuttle, and it arrived within a few minutes and took us straight to the hotel, so no hassle of trying to get a cab! The beach at the hotel is great, very quite as there aren't any other big resorts near by. For snorkelling Kapalua Bay is best and you can hire all the gear there and even charge it to your room, you can also hire umbrellas and sun loungers there. Kapalua as a resort area is very quite, very green and unspoilt, I preferred it to other built up areas. We will most definitely be going back for our wedding anniversary's in years to come! :)

Reviews.Title: “All I can say is OMG - This is Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jthanv32
Reviews.Content: I must highly reccomend the Ritz Carlton in Maui. It took my breath away.. this is a dream stay. I went with my wife a couple of years ago and daydream of going again. The Hotel is located on the Pacific Ocean, the ambiance is tropical and dreamlike. The staff is beyond amazing. The showers are amazing, the robes are relaxing, the oceanside massages are glorious and the FRUIT in your room each morning is so good!!! The Hawaiian juices are unlike any others you've ever tasted and you get it free all day in the lobby. So.. get up and GO to Hawaii

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Resort away from all the buzz”
Reviews.Author: chrisaman
Reviews.Content: Went for our honeymoon and had an outstanding time. The room was beautiful with nice hardwood floors a great bathroom. The shower had a nice rain shower head and was very relaxing. The view from the balcony of the ocean and Molokai were wonderful. The bed was nice and soft and the bedding was very comfortable. The staff was very friendly and always said "Aloha" when walking by. The room was always very clean after the housekeepers were done. My favorite thing about the hotel was the location. It was away from all the millions of people. We went to Kannapali one night and was very happy we did not stay there because there were just way too many people. Kapalua is much more quiet and homey. Kannapali and Lahaina are a short 10 minute drive away which puts you close to all the buzz but far enough away to be able to escape it if you want. The cons of the hotel would definitely be the price, the walk to the beach, and the wind. The hotel is worth the price that it costs to stay there however the restaurants are not. $40 a person for a breakfast buffet is way too much and it is just an average breakfast buffet. The beach is about a 5 minute walk down a pretty large hill. I could see how the walk would deter people from going. FInally, every afternoon it gets a bit windy here. The wind is definitely a nuisance and can detract from your stay. However, the pool is fabulous and while there we sat about 100 feet from the Jonas Brothers. If I went back I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for a Relaxing Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: LChang1212
Reviews.Content: We absolutely loved the Ritz Carlton Kapalua! It was a bit of a remote location, but that was exactly what we wanted (about 15 minutes north of the much more crowded and active Ka'anapali Resort area). The rooms were excellent with beautiful decorations and a super comfortable bed, with great bath amenities (first hotel I've ever been to that even provided little bags of Woolite so you could wash your swimsuits :) ). The hotel is set up on a hill a bit from the beach, but that was perfectly fine with us because it made for even better views of the water from the rooms. The walk down to the beach is about 5 minutes, and it is a very nice walk on the way down in the morning. It was a bit hot and a little steep in some areas on the way back up in the afternoons, but they do offer a golf cart shuttle if you're willing to wait for it. We usually walked it because the shuttle was inexplicably absent a majority of the time. It is nice and breezy (if not all out windy) most days because of the trade winds that hit this side of the island, so even though it hit the low 90's often, it never really felt too incredibly hot. The beach itself was a very nice, secluded beach area. It is a public beach, but most of the people on the beach were from the Ritz. They do offer lounge chairs and towels (no umbrellas) that you can take down to the beach at the Ritz property beach entrance (or the staff will carry them down for you if they're there, which they usually are not). You cannot, however, have the chairs on the beach when the "High Surf Advisory" flags were out. We were there 6 days, and the flags were up for 4 of the 6 days. The waves were very strong those days, but that made the beach a lot more fun for us. I would recommend stopping by one of the surf shops on the way to the hotel and renting some boogie boards if you plan to go in the water. The waves could be extremely dangerous and suck you under in a flash if you don't have something to hold on to. This is definitely not a good wading beach for small children. As far as drinks go, the beach is public, so you can bring your own instead of paying $12 for a mixed drink or $7 for a beer at the pool. We stopped by a Super Kmart right by the airport and picked up a $15 soft tote-bag style cooler bag, beer, rum, diet coke, snacks, and water for the week (yes, they actually do sell liquor at Kmart, which was news to us). The bag also came in handy for the Road to Hana. We just donated it and the rest of the beer to another couple by the pool on our last day. We also often walked up the street from the hotel to the Honolua General Store for meals since it was much cheaper if you just wanted a quick bite. They have a coffee shop small deli restaurant near the back of the store that offers breakfast, sandwiches, burgers, and pizza. They have a coffee shop, a small grocery area, and small deli restaurant near the back of the store that offers breakfast, sandwiches, burgers, and pizza. The staff at the general store was extremely friendly (with the exception of the lady at the coffee shop who was downright surly for some reason). We also ate at the great Sansei Sushi restaurant by the General Store for dinner one night (definitely get reservations in advance for this one as the wait can get very long). The only hotel restaurant we ate at was the Beach House restaurant that is right above the beach. It was pricey, $50+ for 2 for lunch without drinks, but the setting was worth it. It is completely open air, covered by palm trees, and has an awesome view. Overall, our stay was incredible. The only things I think they could do better would be to offer better coffee and coffee-makers in the room, and please, please please put some kind of weather stripping or something under the room doors to prevent so much noise from getting into the rooms (the patio doors were thick and did a good job of keeping out noise from that direction). We ended up stuffing a towel under the door, which helped somewhat. The coffee makers were truly awful. It's been a long time since we stayed in a less-than-premium hotel, so I don't know what's the norm for other hotels, but these were the worst by far. The one-cup coffee bags make an extremely weak cup of coffee if you fill the coffee maker with enough water for 1 cup of coffee (it also spews steam and water everywhere). I finally started running the maker once with one bag and half filled with water, and then repeating the process for the second half of the cup with the other bag. It seemed to spew less mess everywhere too when there was less water in it. It's a good thing my husband doesn't drink coffee! The rooms were very loud...thin walls, huge gap under the door to the hallway. We also specifically requested a quiet room, and were given a room right above the playground and kiddie pool, and a hammock that parents very rudely allowed their children to use as a playground at 8 am. We just kept the same room and dealt with it because the view of the ocean from that location was great. I figured there wouldn't be that many kids making a lot of noise, but I was wrong. There were A LOT of small kids for some reason, which I really didn't expect at such an expensive hotel. I love kids and really wouldn't have minded them so much if their parents hadn't allowed them to run shrieking through the halls and on the playground before most people had even woken up. That was very inconsiderate of the parents, but that is hardly the hotel's fault!

Reviews.Title: “A Taste of Paradise”
Reviews.Author: sumort
Reviews.Content: OMG We have just returned from paradise! This hotel is really very beautiful, its huge but not impersonal. We loved the room, although we had only booked a terrace room, it didnt matter as the room was huge, and very well proportioned, loved the extras, like having a bath and a walk in shower in the room. The floor was of dark wood and this was very beautiful against the crisp white sheets...which were changed every day!.. I loved the day bed, and relaxed on there frequently. The balcony was large and overlooked the golf course. However there are no lights on any of the balconys so it is impossible to sit out there in the evening, which is a shame This was a very relaxing holiday, food and drinks were expensive...but we expected that, from a 5 star hotel. We had a lovely meal at the Sweete Shop up the hill, and the village store was good for drinks and a hearty lunch. We didnt have a car, so found the trek to get anywhere a little long winded, a trip to Lahaina took over 90 minutes each way, but that didnt really matter as it was nice to go somewhere different, as the resort is so large its difficult to get off it if you want to. The resort fee covered a hi speed internet connection and the resort bus, I was glad I took my laptop or I think I might have been a bit miffed to pay for things I didnt use, and as for it covering the self parking...where else were you going to park?? The only real problem I had with the hotel is that the poolside loungers (very clean, well attended, nice towels and sun lotion, water always available) there are 2 yes thats right 2 umbrellas! The first day I sat out in the sun early in the morning and got burned after an hour, and I was wearing factor 20...much higher than I usually wear. Because there was no shade around the pools we had to go back inside. Its a good job the room was so beautiful we didnt mind spending a lot of time in it. You could BUY a cabana if you wanted to, but after spending so much on the holiday itself, we couldnt afford to do this, neither could many people. In these days of skin cancer and sun protection I would have thought that they would be more proactive about this. All the staff were helpful, friendly and attentive, always taking the time to say aloha to us, and the concierge couldnt have been more helpful and chatty. All in all this was a fantastic week away, as part of a longer holiday in other parts of Hawaii and San Fransisco. I would go back like a shot given half a chance, and if you can afford it you should go. A very memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Review for spa”
Reviews.Author: Jordan7T
Reviews.Content: It's fabulous. Â Very attentive, great amenities, very knowledgeable staff and very welcoming. Â I was not staying at the hotel, but they treated me like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, relaxed and warm service”
Reviews.Author: Drmomtravel
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel to stay in. The pool is large and beautiful, the beach is lovely and a very easy walk to get there, the club level amenities and service were superior. The best snorkeling is just north (Honolula Bay) and south (Black Rock). My advice is to first rent a house in Hana for 2 nights for breathtaking views and hikes and then come here to relax.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous place but Service very ordinary”
Reviews.Author: C123W
Reviews.Content: The grounds, pool and beach were devine. Rooms lovely, albeit a little small. For our stay, I pre-booked a Cot or Crib as they are called. It was not in the room when we arrived. We reminded staff when bringing our bags up. Another hour, another phone call reminder before we went to the pool. Another two hours, another phone call reminder before we went to dinner. Still not Cot when we returned from dinner, which meant our 2 year old had to share our bed. Not acceptable! We asked to speak to the Manager and received a call from the Assistant Manager who apologised and finally sent up the Cot. How hard can it be????????? The signature restaurant is totally over-rated. For a $65 steak, my husband received a few strings of wilted spinach with it. Go to Lahaina Grill- fabulous food!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Songbird811
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the first week of March, 2011. It was one of the best experiences ever in a hotel. The room had great views, the help was very friendly and went out of their way to accommodate us in every way. It's a beautiful place with gorgeous grounds and pools. It's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Wedding and Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: yazhismith
Reviews.Content: The two of us came to The Ritz-Carlton to elope with the Enchantment package. I don't know where to start - this was the BEST holiday of our lives. The wedding coordinators are a phenomenal team of professionals who made sure our entire stay was PERFECT and took care of every little detail of our entire stay. They even helped me dress since we didn't have anyone with us and gave us great gifts and treats - We were truly touched. And Lava Point is the best place to get married if you have a small party. The backdrop of the sunset and the ocean... breathtaking We got to stay in a gorgeous club level room with a good view of the ocean. Spacious, very comfy. Housekeeping was immaculate! The In-room dining staff are also amazing. They took care of all our little requests including fresh coconut delivered to the room every day. They also organized our private dinner on the beach - complete with decorations and music and the most amazing butler service. It was the perfect way to end our wedding day (and i think these folk also decorated our room while we were at dinner with flowers! What a nice touch!) The beach was awesome as well and I have to say anyone that says this is a gruelling walk could probably do with a bit more exercise. It was 5 minutes at the most and a lovely stroll. We also rented out the pool luxury cabanas for 2 days. GREAT service from the attendants (also catered to all our special requests like a special order of ahi poke!). These people know how to make you feel special and they seem to really enjoy their jobs too. We also ate at ALL the restaurants and loved every single one of them. The Terrace Breakfast Buffet is to die for and the Banyan Tree Kona Lobster and Kobe steak are the best we've ever had. And Oh My God - the SPA is to die for everyone! Have Kyra do your nails and Eva do your hair and makeup. This is the best spa I've ever been to. These ladies made me feel like a queen for hours before my wedding And also not disappointed with the concierge service and the shops! And special mention to security who came to our room at 11pm to give my dear husband aspiring for his headache We are coming BACK every anniversary!!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort but remote locale”
Reviews.Author: LD2232
Reviews.Content: My husband joined me for a business trip in April 2011 and we found the resort to be beautiful and luxurious with top notch service and all the amenities you could need. We had a group rate as part of my conference so we were lucky to not have to pay the listed prices which are steep to say the least. A couple of things to point out that I had read and found misleading in travel books or other reviews - much is said about the beach not being right in back of the hotel - that due to burial grounds, the resort had to build up higher and there is a shuttle you need to take to the beach - that is inaccurate in our opinion - honestly, we laughed when we got there - there is a charming pathway down to the beach from the pool area with stunning views that only takes a few minutes by foot. For those who don't wish to walk it, they offer a golf cart-like shuttle to bring you down and back up again. The beach is gorgeous and easily accessible. One other stand-out for us - we started our vacation earlier in the week at the Ka'anapali Beach Hotel about 10 - 15 minutes away. We had taken a cab to the Ritz (cabs are extremely expensive) - when we arrived, I realized I forgot some clothing in one of the drawers. When I asked the Ritz the easiest way to get down there, they told me they could go down and pick up the items from the hotel and have them delivered to my room at no charge! This type of attention to detail and service is what one would hope for from this type of high-end resort and they certainly did not disappoint. And the hotel has a cultural specialist named Clifford who was awesome! He spoke at our meeting about the Hawaiian culture etc. and his words were truly inspiring - the hotel has him on their channel on the tv as well so you can hear more about where you are and the history of the Hawaiian people. In addition, from the housekeeping staff to the receptionist to the bartenders, we found the people working there very warm and positive - they went out of their way to make you feel special. One day it started to pour outside by the pool and lots of guests ran for cover under some of the covered areas - the hotel staff came around offering drinks, towels etc. the entire time. Just top notch. The only critique (if we can call it a critique - really more a personal choice) of the hotel is its location - to some, they love the remote feel - it's at the northwest corner of Maui in Kapalua with truly spectacular views etc. - for those who want to stay at the resort the whole time, it's lovely. But if you want to be closer to other options for dinner and nightlife, restaurant choices you could walk to etc., you may want to consider a different location. Or, definitely rent a car to help you get around. If you have a car, it's no problem at all. But without one, you are pretty much stuck with very expensive food at the Ritz (e.g., $20 hamburgers - insane delivery charges for room service on top of that), very expensive cabs ($25-$30 cab to Ka'anapali Beach area - $30-$35 to Lahaina) etc. There are a few nearby choices that the Ritz will shuttle you to for no charge (Plantation House being one of them - FANTASTIC views and meal). And right next to the resort entrance is a charming little general store with all sorts of items to buy to keep in your room (fruits, snacks, cheeses, wines, breakfast, lunch) - we didn't find it til the last day - wish we had known. Definitely take advantage of it to save a bit of money. One other thing we were disappointed in is that the pool/beach is gorgeous and we wanted to have drinks one night in the hot tub while watching the sun go down - but because of your location, you can't see it from the entire pool area. It's on the other side of the resort. Just an odd thing - coming from Ka'anapali Beach/Lahaina where the sunsets were all easily viewed from all of those resorts - just bummed we couldn't watch from where we were. Again, not a real negative - just disappointing. Overall, a lovely place to stay - albeit a bit remote and very steep prices.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel - Great Views - Sprawling Grounds”
Reviews.Author: NeedRelaxin
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel during annual business function. Beautiful Hotel and grounds. Great service. Expect to pay Ritz-Carlton prices for food and drink. Location is pretty much last hotel on western side of Maui. Great golf courses. Takes around 7 hours from this location to do "Road to Hana" - 2 hour drive to go up Volcano. Staff is excellent. Again no free wi-fi but that is being picky. Very large Hotel so bring your walking shoes! No real nightlife have to go 25 minutes to Lahaina or next village down. Nice lobby bar but that closes down pretty early. Spa treatments(massages) were fantastic. Spa was small but you really do not want to spend your time indoors anyways!

Reviews.Title: “This is a First Class Resort staying on the Club Level”
Reviews.Author: Libuska42
Reviews.Content: As someone who has traveled to Maui and Kapalua on numerous occasions I can honestly say this was a "First Class experience". This resort is fantastic. We recently stayed for 12 days at the resort celebrating our wedding and Honeymoon. The property is beautiful, and the staff is absolutely wonderful. I highly recommend staying on the Club Level especially if you have a family. The Club room offers five small meal presentations along with drinks and cocktails available throughout the day. The concierge staff is "top notch" and caterer to all of your needs. They are very friendly, professional and great with small children. The food quality was good, and they offer premium quality wine, beer and liquor at no additional charge. They truly made our wedding, honeymoon and vacation special and relaxing. We will definitely be going back next year to celebrate our 1st anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “excellent experience for all”
Reviews.Author: jimmysunami
Reviews.Content: great hotel ,great location, great staff. The club room was a great experience like having your own butler.and the surronding grounds were great walking trails,beach, golf, pools.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort”
Reviews.Author: stilrfan
Reviews.Content: Friendly and helpful staff. We were upgraded from Deluxe to an oceanview room with 2 queenbeds. Good breakfast buffet was included with the travelocity package. The Aloha lounge has excellent views of the resort pool and ocean plus has live music every evening. The Banyan tree and the beach side restaurants were good. Hotel offers free shuttle to Kapalua resort area and the Pineapple grill is another good local restaurant. Hotel rooms were spacious and well appointed. Housekeeping staff attended the room atleast twice daily. They charge a $25 daily resort fee that pays for self parking and wifi internet in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel--request sunset view side!”
Reviews.Author: JMP10910
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to spring for the Ritz Carlton Kapalua for the second half of our Hawaiian honeymoon last October, and were thrilled with our choice. We started our vacation on Kauai at a very small boutique hotel, so I have to admit that at first I was a bit overwhelmed by the large size of this hotel and by how many people were there. My husband on the other hand was drooling over the gorgeous and luxurious property from the first instant, but it really only took me a matter of hours to feel the same way. We booked online using AmEx points for part of our stay and had nabbed a deal on one of the â€œresidential suites,â€� but I would advise going for a regular room or suite as opposed to residentialâ€”who needs a kitchen when you are staying at the Ritz?? One other recommendation I would make when booking is to note the fine print on the website that â€œocean viewâ€� rooms are partial ocean view, and very partial at that, meaning that many rooms (depending on which side of the hotel you are on) only have a view of the ocean if you poke your head off your lanai and crane to the right or left. Make note of this and request a room on the â€œsunset viewâ€� side of the hotel, or at least in the inner horseshoe rather than the mountain/hilltop view. I say all this because I did not notice this disclaimer, so when we arrived and checked into our ocean view residential suite, I was initially disappointed by the darkness of the room and when I looked out our windows to a hilltop covered in mostly dead grass. While the room was stunning and immaculate, I just couldnâ€™t get over the contrast from the spectacular ocean view/sunset view room we had just come from at a hotel on Kauai! After a few minutes of observing my trying not to pout, my husband marched us back down to the front desk to inquire about other available rooms, where a very friendly employee described a couple other options to us and gave us a key to go check out another (non-residential) suite, which incidentally was GORGEOUS! Ten times more light, absolutely massive, and completely stunning. We were in love with it and so happy that they had been so accommodating to switch us over at the same rate. From this moment on, our stay was fantastic! We sampled pretty much all of the resort dining, and loved it all! We had amazing sushi at Kai our first night, and even though it seems everyone there is on their honeymoon, our waitress made a big deal about us being on our honeymoon and brought us free desserts after our incredible sushi binge. We also had a pretty good lunch at the Beach House CafÃ© (that spot was more about the view than the food), and even the food we ordered poolside for lunch a couple times was really tasty. We are very thankful that we didnâ€™t discover the Terrace breakfast buffet until our last day, simply because it was so amazingly delicious that we probably would have left 10 pounds heavier had we discovered it earlier. The General Store on the hotel property was extremely convenient, and we ended up eating affordable breakfast sandwiches there a few mornings, and also stocked up the fridge in our room with alcohol, sodas, and snacks. But all of the dining experiences paled in comparison to the Banyan Tree. We went for a splurge dinner and not only was the setting spectacular, but our waiter gave us the best service of any server we encountered our entire time in Hawaii. We decided to spring for a 4-course wine pairing menu and every bite was perfection. A truly great highlight of the trip! In addition to all of the on-site dining, there were other fabulous restaurants nearby, including Merriman's on the Kapalua property (ongoing shuttle from the hotel) which you definitely need to try, and make a sunset reservation! The staff was incredibly friendly and professional, true to the RC reputation, and the concierge we worked with was very helpful. We booked a snorkel day cruise and a luau based on her recommendations and loved them both. The grounds of the hotel were immaculate and the pool was a beautiful place to spend a lazy day soaking up sun. Overall a wonderful experience in a beautiful setting!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely horrible stay!”
Reviews.Author: sakndk
Reviews.Content: I booked our stay with the Ritz over 9 months in advance, seeing it was our wedding/ honeymoon....along with paying several thousand dollars in advance to secure our room. Well, I called them 4 days prior to our arrival to confirm the room we requested....we didn't want any surprises. We were assured the room we requested for our wedding/honeymoon was ours. Upon arrival 4 days later, we were told our room was given away to someone else! The young woman at the front desk didn't know what she was doing. They definitely put a dent in the start of our wedding celebration. After battling with the front desk and management, we were comped one night and given a tiny credit for the spa. I would have much preferred the room we reserved. No, they did not arrange for us to be in the room we reserved. The staff was callous and sloppy. The rugs throughout the hotel were dirty. We were privately told by a staff member, on the side, that this is a common problem and there are many complaints because of the front desk forever screwing things up. We were woken up early in the morning by someone running around above our heads...part of our original request was having a top floor room...we got a ground floor room. Will will never stay at the Ritz again...we'll gladly spend our money at the Four Seasons from now on. This was by far the poorest service we have ever received at any resort. But this will not happen again. We are done with the Ritz. It's definitely not what it used to be in the past. If you're accustomed to staying at moderate hotels then I suppose you would think this is a wonderful hotel. But we are accustomed to 4-5 star resorts and this severely paled by far. We won't ever return to the Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua. It's very low class now.

Reviews.Title: “Jot down for your bucket list. It's that good!”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: There are no superlatives to describe our anniversary weekend at the Ritz. Although, it it was dark, cloudy and rainy, nothing was gloomy about the experience we had. I'd like to commend the Ritz management and especially, Nathan Decker for helping us provide the "magic." From our first interaction with Clint, the valet, I knew we were in for a treat. Thanks, for the Kama'aina love. Kai was the stage of our first dinner. It's a quaint little restaurant on property; not noisy and crowded like the "chain" sushi places. It was just the right atmosphere to get our weekend off right. A little live jazz circulated in the background as we enjoyed our meal. On Saturday, we participated in the one hour (complimentary) walk around the property, with Monica. It was a great way to get the juices going and work up an appetite. Also, you see a lot of nice views from around the Bay (bring a camera). Afterward, we decided to order some room service for breakfast, as it was only 9:00 am. You want excellent room service? Ask for Daniel. This gentleman knows what 6-Star Customer Services means. Thank you, my friend, for the delicious treats throughout our stay! Next, we indulged in a wonderful 80 minute couples massage at the Spa (why does the time always seem to fly by?). Amy, thanks for the deep Lomi Lomi. I needed that. Hope you've recovered. Dinner on property, at the Banyan Tree, was very romantic. We had a picture window all to ourselves and saw a faint glimpse of pink (sunset) within the ominous clouds; encouraging positive thoughts for our last day. My wife placed our breakfast order on Saturday night and requested (off menu) corned beef hash for me...I had a hankering. Unfortunately, it was not available, so I settled for bacon. Oh, well! The next morning at 6:30 am, Daniel knocked at our door. Low-and-behold, he had my corned beef hash for me! He made it happen because he wanted to take care of us on our special weekend! This man is a gem (and thank you to the chef). 8:00 am tee time on the world-famous Plantation Course, where I hit some spectacular (chipping to the top of bowl-shaped greens and having the ball roll 30 feet in the opposite direction, to three feet from the hole-twice! ) and some NOT so spectacular shots. The main thing is I was able to spend this special time with my wife AND in between the blustery wind and driving rain, we were treated to playful whales breaching and many memorable photo ops. Folks, bucket list the Ritz-Kapalua. We can't thank the Ritz staff, enough, for making this anniversary a most memorable one!

Reviews.Title: “The best week of my life! THE place to stay on your honeymoon.”
Reviews.Author: AmyJindra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had such a relaxing time at the Ritz in Kapalua. The room was large and fully furnished with a huge comfy bed and tropical decor. The views were amazing on the property. The ritz knew it was our honeymoon and gave us upgrades and outstanding service with a personal concierge that helped plan our itinerary. Looking at other resorts on the island it was definately the nicest hotel with a great pool, beach and golf cour.se on their property. Leslie Lessnau made it extremely personal and we will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Maui family”
Reviews.Author: FitzTraveller
Reviews.Content: We looked at the Ritz, and thought that we could probably find a better rate somewhere on the island. After a frustrating couple days of research; we relented, and booked at the Ritz. What a great decision... no kidding, the whole time we were there, we'd find ourselves saying..."This is worth it", and we've booked our reservation for next year! The staff are sincerely welcoming, and accommodating...not too overwhelming. I'd love to know how they screen people for employment. We stayed on club, and Leslie in charge, with Laura, Athena, and Anthony truly made us feel like family.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Lauri1
Reviews.Content: There's a reason that this hotel is rated very highly. It is FANTASTIC!!!!! I agree with the person that mentioned that it was kind of hard to get drinks delivered quickly - but it didn't really bother me. Everything else was absolutely FANTASTIC!!!!!!!! Expensive and well worth every single cent!

Reviews.Title: “Flawless holiday - Perfect place to stay!!”
Reviews.Author: LeeLane L
Reviews.Content: Absolutely perfect week at the Ritz-Carlton. Perfection in a place to stay is a first for us. We have only great things to say about this place!! The location, the staff, the cleanliness were all absolutely perfect. If this review is short it's only because everything was so so perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Boders
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in a residential suite (booked through Costco) and loved every aspect of our stay here. Our room was almost 1000 sq ft and very spacious. Large kitchen area -- table seats 6, coffee maker, dishwasher, microwave and fridge. Flat screens throughout, very modern overall, big family room and master bed/bath. Housekeeping comes 2x's/day and everything appears new and is very clean. Enjoyed some drinks in lobby bar and great dinner one night at Banyan Tree. Nice pool area, but we spent most of our time in the beach -- the waves were amazing! I look forward to coming back sooner rather than later -- we loved it here. The only two negatives I have are minor but I'll mention them anyway......we could tell the people above us had a toddler as we could hear them running around every morning. Fortunately the times we could hear all the running wasn't very late in the evening or extremely early in the morning but still annoying all the same. Lastly, often hotels use flat sheets instead of fitted sheets and just tuck them in. This was the case here and it was really annoying because the sheet kept coming out throughout the night and bunching up. I know this may just be a personal pet peeve of mine. =) Can't WAIT to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Kapalua club level”
Reviews.Author: bigtimeramfan
Reviews.Content: We have booked the deluxe ocean view, club level, in June. Can anyone tell me in which wing and/or where this type of room would be located on the property? We will also be there for the Kapalua Wine and Food Festival. I imagine the property will be at or near capacity. Any ideas on how to manuver through the more desireable events? Lil anxious

Reviews.Title: “Nice, not up to the name...”
Reviews.Author: Southwicknr
Reviews.Content: On our latest trip to Maui we stayed at the Ritz Carlton. Our party of four had rented the two bedroom residential suite. The grounds and rooms were nicely done. I'd rate these areas 4.5 stars. What we were a little surprised with was the lack of amenities. In our room we had no books or manuals describing the services offered- we were expecting night life info, maybe daily or weekend offerings, snorkeling info, tennis, golf or any special dinner options. Nothing. We were surprised they didn't have a luau, fire dancers .... They had a stage by the beach but it was never used. I'd rate amenities a 1.5 Staff overall seemed nice. We had a nice waitress Nohelani she was very nice. I'd give her a 5 rating. However I personally had a poor review on pool staff. It costs to have a lounge chair under an umbrella or very basic cabana? At $900 a night? It also took 15+ minutes to get a beverage. Seems they could be quicker with my cocktail. And let us under an umbrella because maybe 1 out of the 10 cabanas were rented. At the pool I also had a pool server come up to me and ask me to put my bottle of Corona in a plastic cup. No problem. He then stated only cocktails purchased at poolside can be brought to the pool. He finally states" do I make myself clear?". I nodded. In retrospect I should of seen the general manager, and made myself clear that my party spent over $1500 on beverages during our visit and I want to make them clear on this point. I'd rate that a 1. Overall I'd rate our stay at the ritz a 3. They have great property, they just need to improve their customer service offerings.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton saved our vacation!”
Reviews.Author: gastravel
Reviews.Content: I rarely leave reviews but in this case I feel quite appreciative for the Ritz Carlton. We flew 4000 miles to Maui for a conference that was being hosted by a hotel in Lahaina. The room was just not what we were used to so the next morning we called the Ritz Carlton and were booked into one of the residences , which is a very luxurious 1 BR suite with LR. I think it was about 900 square feet. We've stayed at RC before, but this was an absolutely fabulous. As usual, the hotel was luxurious but understated if that makes sense. My wife relaxed while I drove the short distance to the conference daily, and I enjoyed coming into beautiful Kapalua from the frantic pace of Lahaina after my meetings. Thank you RC for saving our vacation. The remaining 7 nights in Maui were absolutely fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to get engaged”
Reviews.Author: inisha
Reviews.Content: My fiancee planned our engagement here with the team at the Ritz and it was the most amazing experience of my life. My fiancee is amazing for doing all of that, but he was really appreciative of how helpful the staff was in working with him to execute the perfect engagement. When we checked in one of the greeters kept me occupied with beverages and looking at the hotel so he could make sure everything was in order. They upgraded us to a great room. For the actual engagement he basically set up a bit of a scavenger hunt for me around the property, leaving a rose at every stop and the hotel set it all up, clues and all. The entire staff acted really casually as I was walking through my scavenger hunt, even though they were all in on it, and afterward were so excited for us. They setup a private cabana with a champagne toast, flowers, choc strawberries, and then more of that in our room too. Since we're both vegetarians, they worked with him to create a special menu for our dinner at the restaurant on site (which is amazing btw) and then the chef personally came out and congratulated us with dessert! If you ever want to do something special for someone, it's quite possibly the perfect place. These guys know how to execute events, and do it with grace, style and perfection. Thank you Ritz for celebrating our engagement with us.

Reviews.Title: “A luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: rajeshprem
Reviews.Content: * Excellent suite, amenities, bed and view. * Furnished lavishly with more items than necessary. * Ultra comfortable bed. * top of line appliances. * 2 TVs in different rooms with DVD players. * 2 Lanais. * Very comfortable furniture * Excellent restaurants * 2 room cleanings per day. excellent staff. Kapalua is an excellent upscale area with well taken care surroundings. It gives a feel of luxury when you enter this estate area. It is clean and pristine. Negatives: * The only thing we didnt prefer is its a bit away from the action. We would have preferred this resort to be at a more crowded beach such as Kaanapali. The resort is at DT Fleming beach which is really good but secluded. if you're preference is that, you'll love it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place!!”
Reviews.Author: alter666ego
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, beautiful location and awesome service.. well atleast in most of their restaurants (try to avoid Aloloa lounge if you are hungry, they take forever to get you the food)... pool service is excellent.. the beach is very very good.. we went there for our anniversary and thoroughly enjoyed it :)...

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. Not worth the price.”
Reviews.Author: Meg_CA
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 7 nights here in January (2011), and we were both a bit disappointed with the quality of the experience provided by the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. If you're accustomed to luxury hotels and resorts that pay careful attention to detail and provide outstanding service, I strongly suggest that you consider the Fairmont or perhaps the Four Seasons. The bottom line is that there is nothing particularly exceptional about the level of service, quality of accommodations, or the range of amenities offered at the Ritz Carlton. To be fair, the hotel is relatively pleasant and the staff is helpful, but not any more so than what you would expect from a Westin, Sheraton, or Hyatt (which don't have the reputation of Ritz Carlton, and are usually a lot less expensive). Overall, I was disappointed with the upkeep of the hotel. The 2008 remodel touted on the hotel's website was selective at best. Beyond the main entrance to the hotel (which is modern and comfortable, and provides a favorable impression), one will quickly notice years of wear and tear (shabby, worn out carpet, and doors and trim in serious need of repainting). The rooms have definitely been remodeled, but I thought the furnishings were on the cheap side. For example, the laminate floors (!) in our room were already severely scratched, and a couple of the planks were lifting from the subfloor. The cleanliness of our room also left something to be desired: lots of scary looking mold in the shower, and inconsistent vacuuming and dusting by the cleaning staff. I was also a bit surprised that I had to leave a note for the cleaning staff asking for replacement soap and shampoo. If someone had bothered to clean the shower during my 7-night stay, I suspect that it would have been obvious that our supply needed to be replenished. For a three or perhaps even a four-star hotel, these sorts of things might have been easily overlooked. But my expectations for luxury hotels are much higher, and sadly, the Ritz Carlton falls way short.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and expensive hotel”
Reviews.Author: saopaulo36
Reviews.Content: I felt like I was dreaming... What a place! Ritz Carlton Kapalua is an espectacular beach hotel! The natural beauty is incredible. We stayed in a room on the first floor and the varanda opened directly to the gardens and the swimming pool. We could also walk to the beach from the room in 5 minutes. Service is good but could be better for the price. Another comment is that with a Ritz Carlton price, they charge for the tent and the chairs in the swimming pool! Unacceptable and unkind... No need to do so! The rooms are big, clean and nice with a beautiful bathroom. The location is 30 minutes driving from the Lahaina (city) and 50 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nononsense_329
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel, wonderful room. the restaurants are excellent. The staff is polite. The services are good, but I was hoping for better service since it is a five star hotel. One complain I have is that we could be given more information (tips and guides) about the hotel and surroundings when we first checked in. I only found out about their beautiful walking trails after I read this forum, which is on two days before we checked out. We brought our college kids with us and had to use sofa bed in the living room. I was hoping they would turn the sofa bed into sofa during the day and only open the bed at night, but they never did.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely worth every penny spent here”
Reviews.Author: lana0203
Reviews.Content: Spent a week here with my family ( two children older than 17). beautiful location and hotel. Rooms were nice and the two queens were big enough for a family of four. Nice fitness room with plenty of treadmills and weights here, no waiting. Staff was great. We booked the club level and they were all very attentive and helpful. Highly recommend this option if you can. Not only are they helpful with everything but there is good value in the food in the lounge. You definitely do not need to go out for breakfast or lunch. The food served was very good. Did not eat at all the restaurants there but they were very expensive and therefore I can't comment on the value of these. The Terrace restaurant was good but not great. I would recommend eating nearby at Merrimens or going to Lahaina. Many options for great for close by. I would definitely go back and look forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry to bother them. It's not like other Ritz Carltons.”
Reviews.Author: TVnewschic
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I went to the Ritz Carlton Kapalua for the second half of our honeymoon after getting married at the Four Seasons Hualalai and spending several days there. The Four Seasons was sublime. The Ritz was the complete opposite. The pool area and the view were so artificial we could've been at Disney World, not in Hawaii. No one cared to get towels for you at the pool; garbage, food and dirty towels from the previous day at the pool were still lying on tables and chairs the following morning; the beach requires a golf cart to get to, and chairs are only on a grassy knoll overlooking the beach. It's not really an ocean to swim in just admire from a distance, I guess. The food and wait staff were awful. The breakfast would have been ok if we were at a low level Disney World resort, but alas, we were not. And it took 3 waitresses at the bar about 20 minutes to figure out we needed water and menus. While at the Four Seasons, every single employee seemed genuinely happy to help, but at the Ritz, everyone seemed bothered when you asked a question or they just ignored you. My husband and I managed to eat a snack and get drinks in the Club Room without any staff member even saying, "hi," to us. And this is supposed to be the Club Level with extra special attention given to guests! As for the golf, we golfed the Plantation course which was like golfing at a nursing home. Needless to say, we called AMEX and they promptly got us out of this hotel and into a much better one, Grand Wailea, so the rest of our honeymoon wouldn't be spoiled. I've stay at Ritz Carltons all over the country and in Mexico and was shocked by this one. I don't know if I'll ever stay at one again. Has the service gone downhill because Marriott bought them?

Reviews.Title: “Number One”
Reviews.Author: GolfRocks1972
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here and once again they exceeded our expections. My husband got food poisoning at a nearby restaurant. The staff here went out of their way to assist us, contacting a physician, extending our stay and helping with all travel changes. If visiting the area this is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: pdxster
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua on Maui for 5 nights in January 2011. We were upgraded to a partial ocean view room, which was very nice. The room was spacious and tastefully decorated, and bed was incredibly comfortable. The bathroom was very large and luxurious. My only complaint about the room would be that the walls seemed a little thin, as you could hear your neighbors and folks out in the hall, as well as the upstairs neighbors who apparently enjoyed sliding furniture across the floor as a form of exercise. The resort's grounds are beautiful. It has a very large pool with landscaping around the sides of each section, which makes it a bit more private and quiet. The two hot tubs are also surrounded by landscaping and were never crowded. The beach is just a short walk from the pool area. The hotel doesn't provide beach chairs, but they don't mind if you bring hotel towels with you. The staff at the Ritz were all very nice and friendly. The resort had a different live music act every night near the bar, which I really enjoyed. We didn't eat at any of the restaurants on site, except for appetizers at the bar along with cocktails. The food we had was very good and the portions were more generous than we expected. We ate at several of the restaurants in the Kapalua area, including the Plantation House, Pineapple Grill and breakfast at the Honolua Store. The hotel has a shuttle which will bring you to spots around the Kapalua complex. The gym looked well-equipped, and there is a separate studio where yoga and pilates classes are offered in the mornings. I had planned on attending one of these but, never made it. To sum it up, we had a very lovely and relaxing stay at the Ritz-Carlton and would definitely recommend it to other travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Warning!!! Watch your belongings!”
Reviews.Author: VBFortWorth
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at the Ritz back in March 2010 for a conference. It is a beautiful property with amazing views, but please watch the staff. I had a pair of hot pink "She's Back" Lou Goutin shoes that I paid over $1000 stolen along with a designer purse. Our bellman was the only person that saw me and my husband pack them in the bottom of a ABC drugstore bag. He arrived at our room immediately after my husband called the front desk to request a bellman. I had everything ready to go except my shoes and purse that I had purchased a few weeks before our trip to wear out to dinner the night before. He over heard my husband say, "I would not put those $1000 shoes and designer purse in that bag." The bellman was standing right next to me, and I say his eyebrows raise, but I did not think anything about it. I did not pack them in the suitcase since I thought they would be safer flying next to me on the way home. We flew first class and my bag was never out of my sight, except for the holding area that the bellman carried our belongings to prior to us leaving for the airport. The security at the Ritz claimed that they did not see anything happen on the security cameras, but we found out that there were no security cameras in the area were our bags were being held. It was very odd that we got home with everything except my expensive shoes and designer bag, and it was stuffed in the bottom of the drug store bag with t-shirts and small trickets for our kids and grandson. Everything else got back home just fine. Interesting!!!!!!! Shocking experience.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Maui. Romantic Ritz”
Reviews.Author: azypather
Reviews.Content: Let's get my only complaint out the way. Plain white bed linen without decent cover makes a room look unfinished so walking into my room, I was decidedly underwhelmed...after all this is The Ritz!! Bar that one moment, the rest of our stay was magical. We stayed on the club level...best $100 upgrade ever! 5 Meal presentations per day and an open bar...does it get any better than this? The concierge staff are the best. They were warm and friendly and made us feel at home. The Hotel and grounds are spectacular. Pools and jacuzzis were immaculately maintained. A short walk down to a secluded white-sand beach with full service. Everywhere we went we were greeted with a warm ALOHA! I could have spent the entire vacation just there but Maui has so much to offer. The location is a little out of the way which is both good and bad but the buzzing resort town of Lahina is a just short ride away. Alas, I am now back in Memphis. We went from 80F on Saturday to 22F on Sunday. But the memories will sustain me until I return!!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz was nice but disappointing”
Reviews.Author: dwierck
Reviews.Content: If you are a golfer then you will love this property, if you want the "Hawaiian Experience" then stay elsewhere. Overall the staff was average at best other then the front door/valet staff. They seemed to be the only ones that cared enough to actually provide us with a Ritz Carlton sort of experience. I would have much rather stayed in Lahaina or on the other side of the island. The restaurants were just OK, and not worth the inflated prices, especially for breakfast. The beach was a short walk from the property but pretty disappointing. Most people hung around the pool which I wasn't interested in since I can do that in AZ most of the year. It was full of screaming kids whose parents didn't seem to care. I would suggest saving money and staying somewhere else. Our first choice was the Four Seasons but they were sold out, our next trip to Maui will not be to the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service and wonderful facilities.”
Reviews.Author: Phidelt71
Reviews.Content: We stayed on the club level for 5 nights and had a wonderful time. The service in the club lounge is well worth the added cost. The staff were incredibly professional and did a great job making us feel like we were part of their little family.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Beauty!”
Reviews.Author: SiberianVoyager
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Kapalua resort in October 2010 for 11 nights and enjoyed every moment of our stay! It's a fabulous property in a very secluded location with an outstanding service. Upon arrival, we received a free upgrade to a picture perfect view of the resort, pool and partially ocean (I called in advance and asked for it). We also used a concierge and room services and both were helpful and prompt. A couple of island trips and restaurant reservations that we booked based on the concierge's recommendation were to our complete satisfaction. Our room was always clean and there were no shortage of towels either in the room or at the pool area. There are actually three beautiful infinity pools that provide incredible view of the ocean and near by cliffs and hills. We liked the food in all restaurants at the resort. The most memorable were perhaps dinners at the Banyan Tree with a breathtaking views of Pacific and Moloka'i (come before dark to see it). Scallops and dungeress crab appetizers and grilled Ahi with foie gras on top were to die for! Service was impeccable. Now, to be perfectly honest, since I personally do not like to swim in the pools in general (I prefer ocean), I was surprised that the Ritz Kapalua did not offer a swimable beach on premises. There is a beach for surfers with a part of it supposedly open for swimmers, but the currents are too strong and seemed to be rather dangerous to swim there. However, were were offered a free shuttle to a nearby (5 minutes drive) Kapalua resort that had four wonderful beaches where we spent most of the day swimming, snorkeling and sunbathing. It was actually interesting to explore the area by a shuttle bus and a bit on foot. The area is beautiful and offer less expensive dining options, for example Gazebo cafe. Also, I would agree with other reviewers that the Kapalua bay area is quite windy, but many might enjoy breeze on a hot summer day - so consider this when you plan your visit. I would certainly stay again in the Ritz Kapalua!

Reviews.Title: “Great option for families - ultimate comfort and ease”
Reviews.Author: ValuTraveler
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas Day and had the buffet dinner at The Terrace. Our 5 month old was acting up so it was such a relief that the restaurant was inside the hotel and we could run up and down to the room as needed. The staff were so understanding of our situation and still gave us one of the best tables overlooking the resort. The food was amazing!! There was variety but everything was still quality, and the service, impeccable. The hotel is very close to Kapalua Beach, which is so clean (great for babies) and has great snorkeling. We were beginners and the staff at the rental hut were very friendly and knowledgeable.On the resort, the toddler pool was a godsend. It was our first time introducing the baby to a pool and the 1.5 feet depth and lukewarm water helped us to do it successfully. We rented a car while staying at the resort which was nice because we had the freedom to get away anytime. Kapalua is about 20 minutes from the nearest "touristy" area, Lahaina. We ate mostly there, but did try the Honolua General Store on the property one night for dinner. It's a 5 minute walk from the lobby and they have everything you need for your stay. The only reason the rooms got 4 stars was that the walls are not quite soundproof so sometimes after the baby was asleep at 8pm, there was noise coming in from our neighbors celebrating. Not a huge inconvenience but just noticeable.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and relax”
Reviews.Author: VacationGuruGuy
Reviews.Content: To keep it simple and to the point ... this place is beautiful. I am looking forward to my next visit to Maui and I will definately be returning to the Ritz. The rooms are amazing. The property is gorgeous. The staff was always eager to help you. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “BEST PROPERTY ON MAUI!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tboz1976
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay (Dec. 10 - 18) at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua and it was 5 Star all the way! We have been to Hawaii (Maui) over 15 times and won't stay anywhere else going forward. Ka'anapali is nice but very touristy. Wailea is wonderful but the hotels are getting old and the value just isn't there. I know many people prefer the Four Seasons and I am confident the FS does an excellent job however Wailea does not offer the seclusion that is Kapalua. The SERVICE: Top notch. We were greeted with shell necklaces and guava and nothing but smiles. The bell service was prompt, friendly, and worked hard. There is free parking on-site so we did not use valet services. Hospitality/check-in desk staff were all friendly and helpful . Wait staff, pool attendants, maid service all incredibly friendly and helpful. They would all smile and greet you every time you passed. The pool/beach staff was prompt and always made sure you had a drink in your hand. We had two maint. issues in our room and the maint. staff responded within 5 minutes of our call. The HOTEL: 3 years ago the property spent $160 million dollars in giving itself a face-lift. The spa is second to none, beats the Ritz-Carlton Bachelor Gulch which is hard to do. Treatments are expensive and there is a $20 day charge for the spa if you do not get a treatment but it is well worth it. The spa is spacious with gender specific spa essentials (hot tub, sauna, relaxation room, teas, etc.) and includes a uni-sex jacuzzi in the common relaxation area. The lounge/bar area is clean/modern and staffed with friendly/eager hospitality employees. The restaurants are outstanding if you are willing to pay for it. We had a 2 bedroom residential suite which comes with three balconies, kitchen, furnished family room, and 2 well appointed rooms. Spacious, clean, modern! The AREA KAPALUA: This property is isolated and quiet which is perfect. Ka'anapali and weilea are crowded and busy where Kapalua is quiet and comfortable. It sits just 10 minutes from Lahaina so you are not far from the action. There is a scenic 3.5 mile round trip coastal trail that heads south from the RC property and is excellent for walking/running. The weather was amazing. It was warm, barely a breeze, and NEVER a rain drop throughout our stay. There is a general store a few steps up from the front entrance that has tasty local favorites for lunch and breakfast along with a coffee house and groceries. A few steps up from the general store is the areas best ethnic restaurant - Sansai. From 5:30-6:00 every night (reservations recommended) they serve up all food items for 25% off. After 10:00pm there is half off bar menu. If you are a sushi fan, do NOT miss this. All in all an excellent stay and we WILL be back. Isolated, quiet, 5 star hospitality in a 5 star setting. You most likely will see celebrities as we had quite a few while we were there yet the hotel does an excellent job treating everyone as equals. For the price point and overall value, this is the BEST PROPERTY ON MAUI!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay with adult children”
Reviews.Author: f00lme0nce
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two bedroom suite for four nights arriving Thanksgiving day. Staff could not have been more delightful! The rooms were spacious with all the expected amenities, including a large living room and fully equipped kitchen with a giant island with bar stools. Our spa services were top notch. The service at the pool and by the beach was excellent. But our favorite thing was stopping in the bar early in the a.m. for a coffee/latte to take on the Kapalua Trail, a 1.75 mile one-way walk along the cliffs past the other Ritz Carlton properties. What a way to start each day. We travelled with our adult children, who took advantage of the zip-lining adventure that departed from the property. The Ritz Carlton is known for excellent facilities and service with a friendly, relaxed vibe. This property delivers!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: takeinthesites
Reviews.Content: I travel alot for both work and pleasure and get to experience fabulous hotels around the world. But, nothing compares to the level of service, style and relaxation that is The Ritz Carlton -- Kapalua! My husband and I were traveling with our 6mo old baby and they went above and beyond to make sure we were comfortable. Also, the food at KAI and Banyan Tree -- AMAZING! We're already talking about how we can make this a yearly trip. Thank you Michelle and Steve for helping to make our trip extra special. Mahalo, The Murphys.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: CyndySuWho
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd year we have stayed at the Ritz and are never disappointed. It is a beautiful property. The pools are lovely and they even have a small pool for toddlers. The only issue we had this time is the sliding doors to the balcony were easily opened by our 3 year old and had no lock. We called the front desk and they had someone come up right away to put a slide lock on the top of the door - perfect! We would absolutely recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in paradise.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFamily72
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for our honeymoon and had the most relaxing and pampered experience. The pool was amazing! The private beach was perfect! Food was top notch! The only complaint I have is my wife asks me all the time... "When are we going back?!"

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, service wasn't up to what I would expect of Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: ampersandi
Reviews.Content: We had a nice, but not over the top stay at the hotel - after going back and reading reviews, I would agree with the fact that the resort is off the beaten path and that I really don't have much memorable to come back with. Service was spotty - the few bright stars were outshined by issues such as taking over 45 minutes to get a burger at pool side restaurant, waiting over 1.5 hrs to receive entree at in house restaurant (to which I was told they would have to check with the manager when I informed them that I would not pay for the meal - he never came by the table and we left), receiving very warm $150 bottle of wine at hotel bar (come on, if your serving premium wine, don't serve it at warmer than room temperature and then offer to chill it once you recognize that it is too warm...), taking over 20 minutes to get a pool side beer... All in all, I felt as if the staff really didn't care about the guest experience, and service was on their time, not ours - not what I would expect from this tier of property (and they were only at 60% occupancy, so it wasn't as if there were extreme demands on the staff...) The property is beautiful and relaxing with nice amenities - food decent (nothing to write home about) - we didn't mind the wind - towels are provided for the beach, but you cannot bring the chairs onto the beach. If you're someone that demands service, I would probably look elsewhere. If you're someone that wants quiet and doesn't mind chasing down your food/drink after waiting a bit, then this will probably work for you. For the cost, I would temper my recommendations to my friends. This is my first stay on Maui, so I can't say if you would receive better elsewhere. Final notes, if you do stay here, save yourself the $18/day valet and self park - the self park is the next parking row back from the valet. Additionally, we ate a the Plantation House (?) just up the street - decent, but again, nothing memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, Stupendous”
Reviews.Author: texasyaya
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at the Ritz Residence Club and then moved to the Hotel for 4 nights. They are both fabulous. We were on the club level for the hotel and the food was astounding. Breakfast each day in The Terrace was great with a sample of that days special smoothie. Room was a suite with large bathroom and overlooked the third hole of golf course. Residence Club was a large three bedroom, 3.5 bath. Fully furnished kitchen, gorgeous kitchen, Pool was incredible. Staff was wonderful at both places. I cannot

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not memorable”
Reviews.Author: BootsandScoots
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was under a perpetual cloud. The big joke was that it was built on sacred grounds, only to find out that it actually was built on burial grounds. The Hotel is on the windy side of the mountain so it was blustery quite a few of our 9 days there. Travel a few minutes away to Lahaina and nothing but sunshine. For a five star hotel, I thought it lacked a few of the amenities that I have become accustomed to having. A complimentry coffee service in the lobby would have been nice. There was coffee in room but we had to shake the maid down daily to get enough cream and sugars. The rooms are roomy as we had 4 people and managed well, using the balcony as a getaway area. The grounds are well kept and the staff was helpful if called upon. All and all it was a nice stay but nothing stood out as a memorable display of excellence.

Reviews.Title: “Thank You Cathy at SaveonAloha.com”
Reviews.Author: willmorgan1
Reviews.Content: As always, I found the best rate for the whole trip using Cathy at SaveonAloha.com Just when I think I found a cheaper rate myself using the internet, Cathy always does better. Her tips and recommendations and her thorough knowledge of the islands really helped land me and my partner at the right hotel and in the right location. Thanks Cathy!

Reviews.Title: “away from it all”
Reviews.Author: nikkibeach1212
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz for 6 nights. When we arrived we were greeted with beaded leis. Our travel agent informed them that it was our 35th wedding anniversary. Despite arriving before check in time, we were promptly escorted to our room, which overlooked the golf course. To me this hotel is "a golf country club". We had to call an hour later for our luggage to be brought to our room. Guest services then gave us a complimentary chilled bottle of champagne in honor of our anniversary. The empty overturned bottle in the ice bucket stayed in our room for 4 days.
