The room ice bucket which I thought was a fixture in the room was always taken by maid service and never replaced, so in order to get ice we had to call housekeeping on a few occasions to bring an ice bucket. The grounds of the hotel are impeccably maintained. The pool area is lovely, however the cushions on the chairs are stained and gross. A few chairs are broken too. The private beach is within walking distance from the hotel although it isn't that close. An employee in a golf cart asked us if we needed a ride to the hotel from the beach. We declined. There aren't any beach chairs to sit on at the beach. The only ones I saw were lined up on the grass overlooking the beach. If I wanted to sit on the grass, I would sit in my backyard! I never asked if I could bring the chair to the beach, as my husband and I decided to venture to other beaches. I must say that the restaurants in and around the hotel are all decent and there is a shuttle that takes you to a few outside the hotel area, that are maybe 5 minutes away. Cabs outside of the area to other hotels 15 minutes away are $20-$25 one way. There are no large hotels around the Ritz that you can have dinner or experience any type of nightlife. The hotel is secluded. The staff at the hotel: front desk, concierage and valet attendants are friendly and helpful. The hotel is quiet. There is no nightlife at all, aside from a guitar/singer a few nights in the bar area.In fact at 945 one night my husband and I were the only 2 at the bar. The bartender informed us that "it's always this way here." It is quite windy at the Ritz, I guess because it is higher in the mountains. If you are looking for a quiet place to stay and just relax, "away from it all" the Ritz is the place for you. However if you are looking to stay at a more upbeat hotel stay in Kanapali, where it is a little more lively with a line of hotels, shops,a variety of restaurants, music and better beaches. The Ritz is definitely "off the beaten path".

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Xpert37
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton is simply an awesome place to stay in Maui. The hotel has everything from private beach, pool, golf course to tennis courts. The grounds are beatifully and meticulously landscaped, the rooms are clean and comfortable. We were there for only two nights in October and upon arrival, we were immediately upgrade to king-size full suite with ocean view terraces. The hotel is impeccable and the services are top notch. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “It couldn't have been any better....”
Reviews.Author: smrobin01
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the resort after dealing with airlines and airports for 18 hours. We were tired, beat and ready to rest. As soon as we arrived, the valet took our car, baggage took our luggage, and within minutes, all of the staff in the hotel seemed to know our names. We were checked in quickly, all of our questions were answered, and off we went to our room. We stayed at the hotel for a total of 7 days/nights and not once in all of the encounters with the staff (and we ran into a LOT of them), were we ever treated poorly or unprofessionally. The food was excellent. We ate there for breakfast several times, also lunch and dinner. The service was always top-notch and ready with informed suggestions for either meals or wine selections. By the end of our stay we couln't find anything to complain about and I do mean anything. Sorry we didn't post any photos, but the photos provided by the hotel are a true representation of the resort. Our only "complaint" is not really a complaint but more of a caveat, eating at the resort can be very expensive (breakfast $60 for two, lunch $100-150 for two, and dinner anywhere from $150-300 for two). But, this is Maui and prices here tend to be high.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: Ox190
Reviews.Content: I was fortunate enough to win a trip through work to stay at the Ritz. It was hands down the best hotel experience of my life. The staff was outstanding all the way through. FIrst we checked in, walked to our room and they had mistakenly put us in a room with one king size bed. I had asked for a room with 2 queens. I called downstairs and they sent a bellhop up with keys to our new room and he moved the luggage. All of the restaurants on site were outstanding. The breakfast buffet is unbelievable. We spent 5 nights there and I didn't want to leave. If you have the money it is most definitely worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful from start to finish!”
Reviews.Author: SveiksMichigan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for 6 nights and enjoyed every minute. We were there as part of a company rewards program so much of our week was paid for. The staff were incredibly friendly. Our room was cleaned at least twice a day. We always had fresh towels and clean linens. We had breakfast in our room several times and the service was impeccable. Food was so delicious and plentiful. The buffet breakfast in the lower level restaurant was delicious and offered a huge array of food including asian fare. We enjoyed the pool area and the comfortable lounge chairs. Unlike other reviews we had staff members offering to take food and drink orders. We also had staff asking us if they could get us additional towels. One day a staff member walked around with complimentary skewers of fresh pineapple for anyone at the pool. I enjoyed the Hawaiian music that played in the background at the pool, too. The beach area was simply beautiful. A staff member carried out 2 lounge chairs to the beach for us. He also walked me to the restrooms when I inquired where they were (right by the Beach House Rest.). The Beach House restaurant was a perfect setting for a casual lunch. The view cannot be beat. We purchased several meals from the Honolua Grocery store. This was the only place where we came across cranky people. The people at the deli counter looke annoyed each time we placed an order and never said 'thankyou'. It would be good to have a vehicle to get to LaHaina or sightsee around Maui. We enjoyed the zipline adventure with Eco Adventures and horseback riding at Iron Wood Ranch. The Wailea spa at the Ritz was classy and again everyone was friendly and very welcoming. Sansei was a nearby restaurant that offered good food and a nice discount before 6:30pm. Overall, we would definetely stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relatively secluded location on Maui."”
Reviews.Author: Supertravelmom2
Reviews.Content: We were upgraded to a residence suite which included a kitchen and dining area. It was very comfortable. The beach on the property was beautiful, but the ocean was dangerous for the kids to play in. Good service. The General Store on the property is a good deal for casual meals and snacks, especially if you have a suite with food heating and refrigeration amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, amazing, amazing!”
Reviews.Author: ONuallin85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came to the Ritz-Carlton in Kapalua for our 25th anniversary. We were upgraded to a one-bedroom residential unit, that was perfect for us. The entire resort is incredibly beautiful. Everyone here is friendly, welcoming, and helpful. We ate at both The Banyan Tree and The Terrace Restaurant. Although pricey, the food was really delicious and the service outstanding. My husband played golf at both courses at Kapalua. I shopped, read, and used the fitness center. The pool is beautiful, and the beach is a short walk away. It all made for an incredible anniversary week.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Location”
Reviews.Author: Cinthia22
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton was the perfect place for our honeymoon. We wanted peace and quiet and that is exactly what we got. It is located in a very secluded area, but not too far from restaurant and night life. My husband loves to golf so getting a discount to the Plantation Course was a perk. The hotel staff service is excellent and everything is perfectly cleaned and organized.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded, Lush Green Paradise -best value on Maui for luxury”
Reviews.Author: belindatravels77
Reviews.Content: I stayed here last July on a special wedding anniversary trip with my husband. I was hesitant to stay at a big chain hotel like this, after spending my honeymoon on a private Fiji island, but I took the advice of my travel agent Renee Meyer, who owns Unforgettable Honeymoons, who is an ace at this and extremely well traveled. When we drove from the airport to the Ritz we were a bit worried because things looked fairly dry and barren and we saw one hotel lined up after another like miami beach. I didn't see the beautiful green lushness I expected. But low and behold, as soon as we got into the entrance to the Ritz we saw the brilliant green we were looking for, as we drove in we became very excited, because we knew that the Ritz was no ordinary hotel. The view from the lobby was incredible, looking out we saw other Hawaiian islands, amazing pool area, and a lovely long stretch of private looking beach!!! our room was outstanding, hard wood floors, incredible marble bath. Then the club lounge, wow, that was fantastic, a lady named Athena greeted us and we felt like royalty. She went above and beyond. the club was great, free breakfast, free drinks, tons of goodies for lunch, appetizers before dinner, it was practically an all inclusive. We grabbed cold waters on the way to our hikes, had romantic glass of wine before dinner on the terrace, all part of their CLUB experience. this I would highly recommend!!! the beach at the Ritz is fabulous, long, and very secluded with no other hotels around, this is very private. We watched sea turtles every night bob their heads above the water, an entire family of them at the end of the beach. We had a great dinner at Banyan tree, and a wonderful couples massage in our own bungalow/ cottage. the spa is top notch, EVERY person who worked at Ritz said hello to us every where we went and they smiled and asked if they could help us. this is truly the best place to stay on Maui. Before we left out agent had given us some free coupons for discounts at some great restaurants in Maui, I would recommend Dukes, David Pauls Island Grill and Pacificos. also Annebelle and warrens magic show is a hoot and well worth it. I cannot wait to go back to the Ritz Carlton Maui

Reviews.Title: “Spend the $$ to stay on Club Level at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: MarketTime
Reviews.Content: Spend the extra money to get the Club Level rooms. You can virtually eat three light meals per day in a private club room with drinks all day long. Food is great. Exactly the balanced, great nutrution meals I would eat every day at home (if my home had a Club Level) With prices at Kapalua or even Kaanapali restaurants we saved a lot of money. Great, great service too.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, secluded luxury”
Reviews.Author: krazyk9
Reviews.Content: We decided to splurge a little for our honeymoon, so we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton. The day we arrived on Maui, the highway to the west end of the island was closed off due to a forest fire, so the R-C put us up for a complimentary night at the Grand Wailea - it can pay to book with a 5 star hotel! Some main features about the Ritz: Location - it is located at a relatively remote part of the island, in the northwest section. Pretty much the only way to get anywhere is by going directly south, then east toward central Maui. The highway to the north is pretty rough, and only for the (very) adventurous. It's also on the windiest part of the island. However, there are no other hotels nearby, so it's relatively secluded, if you like that sort of thing (which we do). Grounds - elegant and beautifully maintained, and not so over the top or touristy as the Grand Wailea. The property also has a lot of acreage - there are several tennis courts, a nature center, a huge pool, small trails, several restaurants and eating areas. One of the executive chefs has started a very ambitious garden on the grounds with the goal of growing enough to supply the restaurants without needing to rely on food flown in from the mainland. He happened to be there while we were poking around and gave us a quick tour of the place himself. Rooms - we had the partial sea view with king bed. The room and bathroom were fairly spacious, and we had our own lanai (balcony) that overlooked the pool, but you could also see the ocean and mountains very clearly. The view was gorgeous, especially when breakfasting on room service on the balcony! (Which had great selection and was absolutely delicious by the way). Beach scene - the closest beach is the DT Fleming. This is a pebbly/coarse sand beach with vigorous crashing waves, due to the wind. Still swim-able, but not without some signs indicating what swimmers might be at risk for. Not the greatest for peaceful sunbathing - save that for the pool. Restaurants - We really wanted to try Banyan Tree, but all the R-C's restaurants are open only on certain days of the week. We didn't realize this and never got a chance to eat there. But we did try Kai Sushi, which was pretty good, classic sushi. Service - excellent, couldn't ask for better service. Keep in mind though, we are pretty independent folks and like to strike out on our own, so we don't depend on concierge service at all. Overall, we would probably come back to the Ritz. My spouse definitely would, but I would consider staying on Southern Maui just for a different experience (calmer, sunnier beaches). We couldn't have asked for a better stay on our honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews - amazing experience!”
Reviews.Author: LauraCain
Reviews.Content: My sister was married at the Ritz Carlton in June 2010 and we had 9 people total staying at the hotel. Upon arrival, my significant other and I were upgraded to an amazing suite - 2 bathrooms, hardwood floors (granted, fake hardwood floors), living room, large lanai - it was amazing! The staff are all extremely friendly and the grounds are immaculately kept. The pool is quiet with plush lounge chairs and you never feel crowded.The view from the hotel of the ocean is spectacular, and DT Flemming beach is lovely and not crowded. Our favorite part of the day was having Mai Tais at the bar down by DT Flemming and we were frequently comped drinks. One recommendation is to to eat up the road (a few minutes walk) at the General Store for breakfast versus in the pricey hotel restaurant, which was perfect for us. The food was good and more reasonably priced and you can even charge purchases to your Ritz Carlton room. We left the Ritz Carlton after the wedding to go to the Hyatt on Kaanapali and it was a real disappointment after our experience at the Ritz. However, wouldn't recommend this hotel for children. The ages of our group was 23-55 and for us it was perfect. We cannot wait to go back someday!

Reviews.Title: “You pay for the name and nothing else”
Reviews.Author: EdisonTraveller
Reviews.Content: Quite disappointed. They barely met expectation. Did not upgrade even with 20% occupancy. We told them we were on our honeymoon. I had called them and told them that also. Asked if they could do anything special,like chocolate or flowers in the room etc. However was not given any special treatment given the event. We stayed for 5 days. Staff does not greet when you come out, pool side service was inadequate unless you book a cabana. Does not let you park in the valet only parking when the lot is 90% empty!! Even the hotel is away from all the action. It really in the west of maui. Most places to see are quite a drive from here. Go for the Four Seasons. Good Location, great service and goes above and beyond. And all this for a price less than that what you pay at Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlisonEssex
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Ritz as part of our honeymoon visiting Hawaii. As soon as we entered the hotel we were greeted like royalty, as we were on our honeymoon we were upgraded to a nicer room with a better view which was a nice touch. The rooms were spacious, very clean and modern. The food at the hotel was out of this world......but expensive!! Really depends what your budget is but some days we would pop to the store a few mins walk away to grab a sandwich or some snacks, there is a great deli counter and they sell all sorts of food. There are many resturants on the resort and there is a free shuttle bus that takes you to these. The Sushi place is AMAZING! As well as Marimans (think thats how you spell it) My favourite food was a place called Pinapple Grill...actually one of the cheapest of the resturants but i found the food amazing! the spring rolls were exceptional!! One other place worth trying is Roys which is a 10 min drive from the hotel. Great food, great service and well worth a visit. We didnt hire a car whilst we was staying here and looking back i think we would if we ever returned. We only done 2 day trips whilst we stayed here and both we travelled by taxi which was $30 each way. The Hula Girl boat trip is one we would reccomend to everybody, the boat is STUNNING, staff go out of their way for us and we really didnt want the day to end....great trip!! The staff at the Ritz went out of the way to help us and make our honeymoon perfect.....if we could go back we would in a flash! I would reccomend this hotel to couples, honeymooners, or anyone who wants a pure relaxation holiday full of amazing memories

Reviews.Title: “5 star hell”
Reviews.Author: metalmaiden
Reviews.Content: After seeing the Hawaii golf tournament at the Plantation and having a wonderful experience at the Ritz Carlton in Boston MA we decide to spurge on a couple days stay at this 5 star Maui hotel. We even went with their club level service. Our arrival was nice with a lei greeting, a cool towel and valet parking. It stopped there. At the desk we were told we had to play a resort fee---which included free self parking and use of the pool. The valet parking we had just gotten was another charge. If we wanted to use the gym and spa amenities that would be another charge. If we wanted to take any classes (yoga, etc.) that would be another charge. And the list went on....Our room at the club level was nice with a view of the golf course but the air system was musty and mildewy and cause an allergic reaction from my husband. The toiletries had a very unpleasant smell. The club lounge was lovely! The food there was out of this world! We spoke with the chef. It seems that they have hired a chef just for the club level food. I can't say enough about how wonderful the food was! With appetizers and a cocktail in our bellies we went to down to the pool area. It was 5:30ish and there were no attendants around. There was not a towel to be found except wet, used ones strewn an chairs all over the pool area. We hopped in the whirlpool which felt very nice but looked like it could use a bit of cleaning. We had scrumptious desserts and nightcaps in the club lounge and retired where something in our room bite me and on rising the next morning I had numerous welts on my body. That morning when we returned to the pool area at 9am the same used towels were still on chairs all around the pool. We also noticed in the light that the chairs were absolutely filthy! Dirt spots and oil spots. There was only one single stand open to get towels. There were no chair covers just an extra towel (too small) to use on the chair. No suntan lotion. No water. No poolside attendants. There was no life here. All the other vacationers seemed to be gloomy and sad. No friendly hellos or smiles here. We decided to check out a day early and I must say the front desk was very accommodating to our request. I can't at this time recommend this hotel---but they do have superior food in the club level lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven on earth-worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: DesertRatTravelgirl
Reviews.Content: This hotel has it all. Great location, great views, awesome rooms. We upgraded to an ocean-view suite and it is worth every penny. The suites have a sitting area so you can sit in the living room and watch TV/read without waking your spouse. We also had a huge balcony on our suite with nice patio furniture which allowed us to read or eat outside. The hotel is magnificent. Beautifully kept, friendly staff and breathtaking views. The hotel sits on a hill overlooking the ocean and you can see the waves crash on the cliffs below. There are 3 pools that are open 24 hours a day and a fully-equipped gym also open all night. There is a $20 resort fee that covers your parking, gym, pools and high speed internet. Remember-this is a five-star hotel so the food here is a bit pricey but honestly, you donâ€™t' spend all that much more than you would at a nice restaurant down in Lahaina PLUS you save yourself a 40 minute drive. There are no microwaves in the rooms so leftovers are not a possibility. One way we found to save a few bucks is to take our dirty laundry to Alii Drycleaners down in Lahaina for wash n fold service. instead of paying the hotel $250 for our laundry-we paid Alii Drycleaners $45 for 15 lbs of laundry and it was done the same day. This hotel is located on a far end of the island away from the hustle and bustle of Lahaina so if you are in to the bar scene every night-this may not be the hotel for you unless you don't mind taking a 40 minute cab ride. If you are a honeymooner or a couple who likes awesome views, good service and serenity-this is it!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bad reviews not deserved!”
Reviews.Author: CraigsTandD
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for one week this September, and have to say that the negative reviews for this hotel are misleading. We've travelled extensively, and while this certainly isn't a luxury hotel of the type you would find in Hong Kong or the UAE, for Hawaii it was first rate. Our only complaints related to the number of service staff, the fact that poolside service didn't start until 11:00 AM, and that the location of the hotel is pretty remote. On that last note, having the hotel somewhat removed (like a 15 minute drive to the closest big village, Lahaina) was also a bit of a relief in terms of getting away from the hoards of American tourists that are of the loud, my-grandma-bought-me-this-t-shirt-in-Hawaii type crowds. The facilities were nice (spa, pool and gym included) and the breakfast restaurant (though typically pricey for the Ritz) offered a nice entree into the day.

Reviews.Title: “If I had known a little more...we would have stayed else where.”
Reviews.Author: FayeLaurel
Reviews.Content: Long awaited return to Maui and recv'd a great package price that included the Ritz. Went with husband and our two boys 9 and 7. It is a beautiful hotel with beautifully appointed rooms. Staff seemed very friendly and we appreciated the sm. fridge in the room. Some great perks: If you are a runner/walker - great private grounds, gorgeous views and paths to stretch your legs! Also, the hotel shuttle can take you quickly to one of the best bays on the island to snorkel - Kapalua Bay. Walk in the water about 10 feet, float in about 3 -4 feet of water and you see beautiful fish. Safe and enjoyable. Can rent some sand chairs there too. Where to eat for daily survival: Everyone walked over the the golf store/restaurant (Kapalua Store?), just a minute walk ...you'll see it on the way into the Ritz...sits on the right and has red siding with a big deck...situated next to the cute chapel. This store/cafe is your lifeline! Prices are normal!!!! Food is great for bkfst/lunch...coffee, latte's..! DO NOT DRINK RITZ COFFEE...5.00 a cup and it really sucks. Trust me. Nice dinner out: Then you must have dinner at Marimums (this is how you pronounce it, but I can't remember the correct spelling). It is situated on Kapalua bay and you will have the dinner of a lifetime. We took our children and the kids menu was amazingly affordable!!! The rest of the menu, was higher but worth it! Downside if you have kids above 2 years old. The pools were a bore. 4 feet deep and...well....not much else to say. We would be out and about snorkeling, boogie boarding all day and I was looking forward to a cocktail and my book by the pool. The wind (every single day, every single hour of the day) was blowing so hard, I had to struggle to keep the book open. My boys, after about an hour, were a bit bored of the 4 feet pool. Pool side service was always humerous. We could see lots of people working the grounds, but never anyone around to provide anything. Towels? Better wait until 10:00 AM and bring your own after 4:30 PM - EVERYTHING remotely linked to the outside pool area (food, drinks, towels) are over at that time. It's wierd. So, as much as I'd hate to say it, we will stay somewhere more family oriented despite the rumor that the Ritz is family friendly now. It's really not. Honeymooners - enjoy! Those with little tiny toddlers - enjoy! There is a new baby pool, small but nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome.”
Reviews.Author: ElCesarViaja
Reviews.Content: Actually I stayed in 2009 but this web didn't let me do put it. The Ritz is the Ritz. Great service awesome facilities, nice golf pro shop. Kiddie pool is fantastic. The beach is not legally private, but it is an small bay just shared with the neighbor resort. Food excellent but pricey. There is an alternative plaza south of the hotel with some local bread shop and a Supermarket. Nothing in walking distance, rent a car or plan well your shuttle schedule.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECTION!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kingnapes
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay at the Ritz and it was exceptional. I've been blessed to stay at top resorts around the world including all of the best resorts on Maui. I would put the Ritz Carlton at the top of the list. If you want a perfect, peaceful vacation, this is the place. We had a Club Level room and the service was superb. If you can afford the extra money, the Club Lounge is beyond description. Even though it costs more I would say we saved several hundred dollars in the long run. We ate most of our meals in the lounge. Two days before my arrival I was the victim of credit card fraud. I can't tell you what level of frustration this caused, but the gal at check-in was beyond amazing in making everything work out. It was an on going process and she went above and beyond in handling all of my issues with American Express. You will love this resort. Yes, it does get windy at times, but it didn't hamper our activities and it keeps things bearable. I would highly recommend the Ritz and we can't wait to go back. As mentioned I've stayed at the Four Seasons and the Grand Wailea and the Ritz is now at the top of my list!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel - Superb Service!”
Reviews.Author: Meem7
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with friends for almost a week. It surpassed our expectations by miles! The service was the best we have seen in a while - everyone was very friendly, accommodating, knew our names, went above call of duty many times. We had 2 babies with us under 10 months old and one day while enjoying a poolside cabana, one of the pool employees surprised us and set up a portable crib in the cabana for us!! We loved the food at Kai Sushi and we watched the sunset several times...the best was at Merryman's Restaurant. The Ritz grounds are spacious and beautiful, the spa is wonderful and we took advantage of the co-ed tub and lounge! There is plenty of space to find privacy and we never had trouble gathering chairs at the pool. We walked up to the General Store a few times which has great food for a lot less expensive than the hotel. We stayed in a Residential Suite which was incredible!! Two patios, full kitchen (except a stove) dishwasher, refrig, freezer, toaster, blender, place settings, salad spinner...it was like being at home! Great cozy Ritz Carlton bed and luxurious bath. Many reviews speak of the wind....this is the only downfall. Its location on the island is very windy. The weather was still warm but noticeably cooler than the Wailea side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “THE BEST HOTEL IN MAUI HANDS DOWN!!! GREAT FOR COUPLES!”
Reviews.Author: Time_Traveler101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best in Maui hands down! Before booking a trip with this hotel, I was debating between Ritz-Carlton, Four Seasons and Grand Wailea. I chose Ritz because of its overall value and my familiarity with the Ritz Carlton tradition of elegance and opulence. I was never wrong in choosing this hotel. I booked an ocean view Residential Suite and it was fantastic! I strongly recommend this hotel OVER Four Seasons and Grand Wailea, especially if you are a couple with no kids travelling. I visited Four Seasons and Grand Wailea but was never impressed! The pool in Ritz Carlton is way better than Four Seasons and even the beach in Ritz is great. Ritz Carlton is close to other beaches, among others is the Kapalua beach which is a great snorkeling site. Forget booking a trip to molokini or lanai, try this beach instead and you will save money and motion sickness (it was a bit wavy when we went there). The hotel offers free shuttle to Kapalua beach which is great for snorkeling. You could rent snorkel gear right there and charge it to your room account at Ritz (bring your room key). The Ritz Carlton is also next to a Catholic church with a shortcut right from the hotel free parking area, making it appear that the church belongs to the resort. In front of the resort is a store offering breakfast and lunch and this is very cheap place with great food, if you don't want to pay the $30/person buffet breakfast at the hotel. Other reviews mentioned the hotel location being windy; well, it was a breeze, not too windy which was actually good because it refreshes you; not sticky or humid. I visited the four seasons beach and it was more wavy for my taste than the beach in front of Ritz Carlton! It also didn't rain much when I was there. Kapalua area, where the hotel is, is secluded and ideal for honeymooners, lovers and those who want privacy. I saw some couple with kids, but not much. Overall, I love Ritz Carlton! The place has a sushi bar, lounge, the famous Banyan Tree restaurant, a beach restaurant, etc. YOU WILL NEVER GO WRONG WITH THIS HOTEL, FOR THIS IS THE BEST IN MAUI, hands down!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Fiji25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for ten days. On arrival we were greeted with big smiles and leis. They upgraded our room without us even asking. The pool is fabulous and the staff are incredibly friendly and personable. The hotel grounds are beautiful and imacculate. The walk to the beach is only a few minutes (at a slow pace) and often there are staff on carts offering to drive you anyhow. The view of the ocean is breath-taking and DT Fleming beach is lovely. It's not nearly as busy as the other beaches in Lahaina - it feels very private. Relaxing by the poolside became one of our favourite pass-times at the Ritz. The poolside staff are extremely helpful and entertaining. It is windy in Kapalua, but this just helps keep you comfortable. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. We were very sad to have to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't suit our honeymoon, but lovely for families”
Reviews.Author: JeanetteDC
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Kapalua is a beautiful place. The landscaping is lush, the three blue pools are beautiful, and the spa is amazing (you must go here!). If you are mentally prepared to stay at a larger hotel (I'll get to this later), this is the perfect place for you. The beach is a little bit of a walk downhill from the resort, but it is beautiful and perfect for swimming. The food at Kai is average (if you like good sushi) but the views are great if you can get a window table. The Terrace bar is a nice place to hang out. Order the Tempura shrimp appetizer. This was delicious! So as I mentioned before, you must be mentally prepared to stay here. This means it is a bad idea to stay here if you are coming from Kauai and loved the peacefulness (and romance) of this island. It is not peaceful at the Ritz unless you go to the spa. I was not mentally prepared for the thousands of people and thousands of their screaming children at the pool (and everywhere). For us, it was not a great environment for our honeymoon, at least until after 10:00 when all the kids went to bed. We wish we had gone to a more remote part of the island and stayed at an inn or rented a house with a quieter setting. I honestly would not have pegged the Ritz as someplace you would bring your kids, but I was totally wrong I suppose!

Reviews.Title: “It's doesn't get any better than this...”
Reviews.Author: bigbadbevo
Reviews.Content: First of all- any of you who reviewed this place anything less than 5-stars, I want to live your life- right now! This resort is hands down amazing! I've stayed at a couple of other Ritz Carlton properties and I was very impressed but this property takes it to a whole other level. Let's get the obvious out of the way- yes, it's expensive but Maui is expensive in general. Location: Kapalua- yes, it's a little further out on the W-NW side of the island but it's by no means in the middle of nowhere. Distance-wise it's not at all far but when you factor in the traffic and road construction it may seem like a bit of a haul- it really isn't. If you have to sit in any traffic, this is the traffic you want to sit in! There are several dining options on the property and in the Kapalua vicinity. Two phenomenal golf courses, spa, various little shopping boutiques, etc... the sort of stuff one would expect at a resort. Because of it's location, you get some weird weather anomalies like brief rain showers, some cloudiness- but don't despair it clears up in a few minutes. It's also a little windier. None of it bothered me or seemingly anyone else I came across while there. The Property: This place is spectacular from the moment you walk into the semi-open air lobby. It's wide open to the back terrace which overlooks their pools and beautifully landscaped grounds which seem to flow into the ocean. It is literally a window to heaven. The service is impeccable and the lobby staff is very approachable and service oriented. We were fortunate enough to get an upgraded suite although we had to wait 20-30 minutes for the room to be ready. While we were waiting, we wandered onto the terrace to get a closer look of the aforementioned views, got a couple of drinks and an appetizer. The drinks and food were good and honestly, I could have been drinking water and eating SPAM and I would have been happy. Sitting out on that terrace is an experience in and of itself. Once we got to the room I was floored- I knew it was an upgraded suite but I didn't expect to be staying in suite that had to be almost 1000 sq ft with two balconies... after booking a regular room. It was very nice appointed with nice furnishings and even had a mini Sub-Zero fridge/freezer! I've stayed at some very nice properties but have never come across a SubZero in the freakin' room. Everything else in the room was in-line with the high standards that one would expect from a Ritz property. The room was clean and everything smelled fresh. No musty, "hotel" smell or nauseating flowery air fresheners here folks. I am very particular with the cleanliness of my hotel rooms and I had no qualms with the room. The staff there is extremely friendly, accommodating, and very open to offering suggestions as well as guidance to the property as well as the island itself. The bell hop gave us some awesome local dining suggestions and the concierge service will get you anything you want and get you to wherever you want to go. Equally as important- they are adequately staffed- no waiting for anything. Instant gratification is GOOD. Surprisingly, this property is very kid friendly. Normally, properties of this caliber are very stuffy and treat kids like a virus. Not here. They have a keiki check-in before you get to the actual check in desk! They have a full on kids activity program and facilities for the kids. We did not have a kid with us but would not hesitate to bring one. Okay- if you have to find fault with the supermodel, here it is- it's a little pricey even relative to Maui standards. The aforementioned drinks and appetizer (2 fruity cocktails and an order of pot stickers) albeit VERY tasty was like $55 w/ a nice tip. And yes... the breakfast buffet is $30 and as much as I love breakfast and theirs in particular- $30 gets you a lot of eggs and fruit! I also requested items that were not on the buffet but was not charged for them. As others have mentioned, there are some additional costs in addition to the room such as a $20 daily resort fee (towel service, sun block by the pool, WiFi, shuttle service to nearby beaches, etc...) , $18 nightly valet (free self parking is avail). If you wanted to do this place on a budget you could but why?!? All in all- I would do it again in a heartbeat and would not hesitate to recommend it to others. Factoring everything in, it's definitely the best hotel/resort accommodations I have encountered. The fact that it's in Maui only further adds to this property's appeal. This place NEEDs to be on your bucket list!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, fabulous, fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: susan222
Reviews.Content: We are a huge fan of Ritz Carltons, and have stayed in Philly, Laguna Niguel, DC and Dallas. This one rates tops! The service was spectacular, the rooms are beautiful, the view can't be beat -- I could go on forever. There was little mishap with our keys when we checked in and they needed to come to our room several times. I offered to save the lady the trip and walk the key down to the front desk myself, but she wouldn't hear of it. She insisted I just start relaxing and promised it would be taken care of promptly -- and it was! Stay on the Club level if you can -- we were there with our three daughters, and ate breakfast in the club every morning. It was delicious and well tended. We also had some lunches there as well as pupus at night. There were cookies available all day for the girls. The Terrace Grill is the main restaurant and was great! I did not expect that level of food from a large hotel restaurant. If you can get a reservation, make sure to eat at the Banyan Tree -- especially on "Wine Wednesday" -- absolutely delicious. I agree with the reviewer before me. We drove down to Kaanapali one evening for dinner and were so happy we weren't staying there. It is a just one long line of hotels and mobs of people. Kapalua is quiet and secluded. A wonderful, wonderful resort!!

Reviews.Title: “Disregard all reviews but mine. I just got back. This hotel is heaven.”
Reviews.Author: hesseLa
Reviews.Content: Trust me. I've been to so many hotels in Maui. From Motels to Time Shares, I've stayed in all levels of residence. If you have the money and can afford this hotel, and you want to stay in West Maui, do yourself a favor and stay here. Everything about this hotel is fantastic. The service is exceptional, the rooms are fantastic (though i hope you are out exploring the island). Do this, book a room here, then go walk around the Sheraton or any hotel on Kanapali....then come back to the Ritz. It's like visiting a bad mall or amusement park where the Grisswolds (sp) stay and then coming back to the gates of heaven. Kapalua is a 10 minute drive to Lahaina and thank the lord, because the Tourist Mob stays over there, or Kanapali. The privacy and seclusion this hotel offers, if you are looking to stay in a resort, is second to none. Highly recommended. Again, disregard all review. I wrote this on 8/23/2010, just returned from a week there. It's total paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, information breakdown.”
Reviews.Author: ignatz23
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other R.C. properties and the 4 seasons in Wailea I have to agree with other posters about higher expections. On one hand you have a beautiful property,lovely beach,good food .But on the other hand I was expecting more.Of all of the R.C. personell the bellman were the most effiecent.What does that say about a 5 star property. Trying to find out daily activities was a chore.Calling for a complimentary newspaper was problematic.Oh yes it did finally arrive on the last day of my stay.I feel the staff just needs to be retrained.Maybe a new manager.All in all maybe its because of the economic downturn and everyone is overtaxed.I would stay at the property if the price was right.Kapalu is truely outsatnding.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz-Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Greetings_from
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and location. We have been to Maui before and stayed at the Four Seasons. They are both awesome but after debating it for the 11 days we were there, we feel the Ritz-Carlton edges out the Four Seasons Wailea. Taking the lead from the other post I just read I will list the pros and cons. Pros *Ritz Club Level - You pay extra for the room, but we feel like we saved tons of money on food and drink. If you don't have the "free" club, you either have to drive somewhere or eat at the hotel restaurants--which can be expensive. You are also not stuck eating huge buffet breakfast every morning--the light breakfast option was great for us. *Ambassadors of the Environment - Great kids and family programs. We took advantage of three of them. One as a family and two others just for the kids (ages 8 & 10). They were all great. *Beach was nice and clean. *Shuttle to other beaches and locations on the property. *Gym was great, lots of equipment and amenities. *"Dive In" movie was fun and a unique experience. Cons No chairs allowed on the beach. Surf was really fun, but kind of rough. My kids helped me write this review and we came up with mostly the same pros and cons!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Cinci_travel
Reviews.Content: Our family of four just returned from a 14 night trip to Kauai and Maui and spent our last 5 nights at the Ritz Maui. This was our second trip to Maui; the first was 6 years ago and we stayed at the Fairmont in Wailea. The Ritz and all of Kapalua were beautiful. The lobby welcomes you with wonderful Hawaiian decor and a magnificent Pacific view. We had a one room suite which was perfect - our kids (13 and 11) slept in the hideaway; we had a luxurious king bed. The rooms were new and well appointed. The beach is lovely (I don't get people who complain about the size - this is Hawaii, not Hilton Head). It is a hike, though! The pools are also very nice, but the wind was strong every day. The grounds are pure Maui - green and gorgeous. We have stayed in several five star hotels, including the Ritz in Cozumel, and we didn't feel like this one came close to matching others in service. At check-in, we asked for the hideaway to be made up for the kids and came back from dinner to find our bed turned down, but not even sheets for the hideaway. We had four or five instances where we asked for something and it never came or we had to call again (nearly every time we made a request). Whereas other Ritz Carltons have luxurous terry sheets that the pool staff make up for you on lounge chairs, cool cloths for a hot day and pitchers of ice water, these amenities don't exist at the Ritz Maui. We found the personnel polite and kind, but just not what we expect for the kind of money one spends at a Ritz Carlton. While we haven't stayed at the Fairmont since 2004, there was simply no comparison - the service there was truly 5 stars. On a side note, we had a dinner at the Pineapple Grill in the Kapalua resort and the service was absolutely atrocious. They made several errors during our dinner and not once apologized or acknowledged the problem. Our entrees took over an hour to arrive. The food was good, but our blood was boiling by the time it came, so the whole meal was ruined. All in all, a beautiful place, but better service can be had elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend!!”
Reviews.Author: khuang01
Reviews.Content: We highly recommend this place. We stayed there for 6 days. Here are the pros and cons based on our experience. Pros: 1. Rooms are spectacular...very spacious, well kept, and quiet. 2. Staff are super friendly and goes above and beyond. 3. Pool is awesome 4. Views are awesome 5. This is a perfect place to get away and relax Con: 1. Beach area is small but pretty private 2. They charge a resort fee 3. Need more hammocks around. They only have one.

Reviews.Title: “Quite place with nice beach”
Reviews.Author: sm111
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at Ritz Carlton, Kapalua. It was a peaceful setting. The DT Fleming beach is like a private beach. At sunrise we went for a walk along the beach. You can also stroll along the rocky shores. The beach has nice gentle surf unlike Kaanapali where the surf was hurling rocks at us and the beach had a steep slope. We had a 2QB room. The beds were comfortable and there was plenty of space around the bed. We also like having morning coffee at the Lanai overlooking the pools. If you want to avoid the crowds, enjoy a quiet day and don't mind the occasional light drizzle, this is a terrific place. If you're going there know that restaurants close at 9pm and you have to order room service after that.

Reviews.Title: “Really a Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: kandd1963
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were really looking forward to this trip. He has been working long hours and a restful week at a Ritz beach resort seemed like the perfect vacation. Most summmers we spend our vacation out of the country and do lots of sightseeing. The location is beautiful. The golf course, pool and beach are lovely as well. Unfortunately, the pool and beach are not very welcoming. The wind blows relentlessly at the pool. So much so that they do not have umbrellas. The strong wind can blow your drink or book away and the sun is hard to escape. If you have stayed at other Ritz beach resorts you will miss the pool and beach services also. At the pool, an unhappy staff member may bring you a drink. At the beach, no drinks or towels will be brought to you. Chairs and umbrellas are not allowed on the Ritz beach. Chairs but no umbrellas are allowed on the grassy area above the beach. There is a bay close by where you can rent chairs and an umbrella. We stayed on the club level. The food options were quite nice. Worth the extra price. The staff was very nice. The strange thing was how dirty the hallways were. The carpets on the club level looked like there had been some kind of flooding. It made you feel like they sure were not worried about your impression. Based on some other comments about this, it has been this way quite awhile. Mowing the greens at 5:30 am was cruel also. Overall, I would say this is not acceptable for a 5 star Ritz. It felt like a large nice Marriot or Hyatt. That would have been ok for $200.00 a night but for over $700.00 no excuse. K and D

Reviews.Title: “Good Business Conference experience-Except for the Banyan Tree”
Reviews.Author: Royzee
Reviews.Content: Was part of a major conference here for 6 nights. My Department was one of the "sponsors" of the conference. First the good: - Great meeting rooms and meeting staff - Very nice ( but not Great) hotel rooms. Extremely clean with great service at least twice a day. - We hosted a cabana by the pool one afternoon with Mango Ice tea, soda, water and Hawaiian Shave Ice. Other conference sponsors had Cabanas with specialty tropical cocktails. Excellent service by the staff - event was a big success. - Grounds are fantastic: multi-pool complex or walk (or ride) down a gently sloping hill to a well kept ocean beach with decent (but not huge) waves and a picturesque sandy beach. Excellent golf courses very nearby. - Fitness center was also good - free weights, weight machines and many treadmills, and several bikes, although 5 of the 6 elliptical/cross-trainers were not 100% functional at any given time ( no music or TV, no elevation, etc.). Now the bad: - We hosted a diner for about 35 people at the 5 star Banyan Tree restaurant on-site. We had selected a pre-set menu with the restaurant staff ahead of time. During the function, the waitstaff, on their own, decided to add an item (surf & turf) that was not agreed to and was priced above anything we agreed to. Additionally we ordered the " wine by the bottle as it is used" option. We witnessed the waitstaff filling wine glasses in front of children, empty seats,etc. We had three tables of about 12 people at each in one room. Service timing was weird: table 1 got their appetizers , then 15 minutes later table 2, then 15 minutes later table three - and the same for salads and the entrees. At the end of the night after their unecessary, continuous wine-pouring, we probably left 3 bottles of expensive wine in glasses on the table. Finally the bill got messed up. The amounts the restaurant charged on our receipts were lower than the amounts they had put on my Mastercard ( I had to call Mastercard several times). We did finally get everything resolved satisfactorily over the next two days with the help of the Ritz Accounting Dept. If I had to do this again, I would make it very clear that only the items on the pre-set menu were to be offered; let the guests order wine or drinks by the glass; and make sure I had an extra $10,000 in my credit-line to pay for the meal. Or better still go somewhere else ( i.e. Merriman's). Overall, the Banyan Tree experience was a negative and suprising ( for the Ritz) 2-day blot on an otherwise excellent conference and hotel experience.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ted63
Reviews.Content: Great service, excellent food and drinks, relaxing pool, all surrounded by the most beautiful place in the world, kapalua maui. If you've never experienced maui it is a must, and the only way to do it is at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. Wither you get a golf course or ocean view room it will definitely not disapoint.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Maui honeymoon - a surprisingly affordable splurge!”
Reviews.Author: Faxgirl
Reviews.Content: In May, my hubby and I enjoyed 8 magical nights in Maui â€“ a perfect honeymoon. We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua. Since we rely heavily on Trip Advisor Reviews, I hope the following info will be helpful to youâ€¦ BOOK THE BEST DEAL Before you book your trip, shop around on-line. We found lots of â€œdealsâ€� through honeymoon travel agencies, but we opted to book direct with The Ritz once we determined the same offer was available. We figured this would give us a greater chance of scoring upgrades if theyâ€™re available. We considered doing an island hop (Maui and Kauai), but we opted to stay the full 8 days in Maui. Spending an entire day relocating just seemed like a waste. Next time, weâ€™ll focus on a new and different island. Unless you have 2 full weeks, I recommend staying in one place. There is plenty to do and see in Maui. COST We wanted this trip to be really special without breaking the bank. Ritz-Carlton service is top notch with resort amenities to match. I did a cost comparison analysis of another hotel with a rate of around $300 per night. When you consider that a dining budget of $100 pp each day is conservative for Hawaii, it was more than worth it for us to go with the $595 per night Club Level rate. After all, breakfast, lunch, appetizers, snacks, desserts, and drinks (cocktails, bottled water, soda in Club Room only) were included â€“ there is no way we could have bought all of that we had for under $100 pp. The $500 resort credit kind of made it feel like we were on an â€œall inclusiveâ€� package, but without sacrificing quality service. For an 8 night stay, we paid about $4500 (that includes resort fees, taxes, and $500 resort credit). Bargain! Car rental costs average at $50 per day + tax â€“ so figure about $500 for a mid-size sedan. Donâ€™t forget to factor in food, drinks, activity costs, gas, and souvenirs. Outside the resort, we spent about $500. We could have reduced that by splurging a little less on the non-essentials. The Zip Line activity cost about $100 pp, but was so worth it! We bought the $20 Road to Hana driving tour CD from the Shell Gas Station (very popular). Snorkeling is free if you have your own gear. Actually, there is a lot to do in Maui for little to no cost. That said, dining and tax rates are higher than we expected. A few of our favorite activities happen to be freeâ€¦ lounging in the hotel hammock, observing sea turtles and whales from cliffs near our resort, driving along the coast line, live music in the lobby, snorkeling, etc. For the two of us, we spent a grand total of just under $5500. That includes: King Club Level accommodation at Ritz-Carlton Kapalua, all food/drinks, activities (couples massage/spa day, snorkeling, zip line, Road to Hana), gas, souvenirs (a painting, tiki statue, t-shirt, post cards, 2 state park fees, etc.). Additionally, we paid about $650 pp for round-trip airfare from Virginia to Hawaii. We booked this trip 5 weeks in advance. PACKING FOR MAUI We packed our own snorkel gear, water shoes, and shorties (wet suits). I highly recommend you plan your trip with the help of the travel book â€“ Maui Revealed. Itâ€™s a must have! Study it in advance and take it with you. Other than the obvious, pack your sneakers, backpack, fleece jacket, and GPS for your day trips. There will be plenty of free maps and brochures to collect upon your arrival. PLAY IT SAFE Generally speaking, my impression of Maui is that itâ€™s pretty safe. The people are very friendly and welcoming. That said, you should be aware that parked cars at overlook points are common targets. Donâ€™t leave valuables inside. Either lock them in your hotel room safe, or carry them on you. We didnâ€™t have a problem, but the broken glass in parking areas acted as a constant reminder. If you plan to snorkel or swim, consider the risk of leaving your expensive camera (and digital memories) on some random public beach. We left our digital camera at the hotel on snorkel days. Next time, I plan to buy a disposable water camera â€“ itâ€™s cheap and no one wants to steal it. Three additional quick words of cautionâ€¦ 1) Swimming â€“ ocean currents can be surprisingly strong. When in doubt, donâ€™t go out. 2) Hitchhiking is actually illegal in Hawaii. 3) Female Solo travelers must exercise good common sense. Google â€œMissing in Mauiâ€� - Sure bad things happen everywhere but the relaxed, friendly culture of Maui makes it easier to dismiss common rules of safety. TRANSPORTATION You will definitely need a car. Reserve ahead via phone or internet â€“ I recommend Enterprise. You donâ€™t have to provide your credit card for reservation. You also donâ€™t have to pay extra for the 2nd driver (for married &/or co-habituating couples). Other companies often charge and extra $10 per day for 2nd driver. Regardless of your choice rental car company, you will need to exit baggage claims and turn right, left around the kiosk station. Hop on your designated shuttle. The shuttle to Enterprise took less than 20 minutes. When we arrived, they offered us complimentary bottled water. We ended up getting the only mid-size car left â€“ a Chevy Malibu. Not bad â€“ it was a good rate and decent size. I didnâ€™t feel like the guy was overly pushy with the up-sale. Very efficient, professional, and friendly. LATE NIGHT ARRIVAL We took a direct flight from LAX to OGG (Maui). It was late. We were tired and hungry. In case youâ€™re wondering, you will find a few fast food restaurants just off of Hwy 30 closer to Lahaina (youâ€™ll pass this town on your way to Kapalua). Drive time from airport to Kapalua is about 45 minutes. Look for a Taco Bell, Pizza Hut, Panda (on your right). Lahaina Mall (also on left) has a small food court (Orange Julius, pizza, Chinese, etc), but closes around 9pm. There is a grocery store and ABC store on street side. Canâ€™t miss it. Drive a few miles, and you will see Mc Dâ€™s (left side). LATE NIGHT CHECK-IN When we arrived at the hotel, the valet helped us unload our bags. My husband parked the car. Staff greeted us with Kukui Nut Leis. Bellman delivered bags to the room. Our reservation was for King Garden View Club Level. We were delighted to find that we had balcony overlooking the golf course w/ a partial ocean view. I must admit, our room initially seemed sort of small. It was nice, but not as spacious as I thought it would be. A mini-fridge was a pleasant surprise. Bathroom was nice â€“ soaking tub, separate shower, 2 sinks, and private toilet closet. King bed was very comfortable. We requested extra pillows the next night. The room was very immaculate and clean. CLUB LEVEL PERKS The Club level is the only way to go. Room key access required. There are two computer stations w/ free Internet (you can check your email, print boarding pass, and look up area attraction info). A full spread is offered for breakfast and lunch. Heavy hors d'oeuvres are plentiful each evening. Chef Corey is AMAZING. Since Iâ€™m vegetarian, the concierge manager always made sure I had plenty of food to choose from. We actually ended up canceling our dinner reservations on several evenings because the appetizers were so deliciously filling (at least for me). On those evenings, we hopped over to Aloha Mix Plate for my husband to grab an extra bite for dinner. I enjoyed dessert. Cocktails, soft drinks, cookies, fruit available almost all day (closed for a couple hours each afternoon). Try the Kapalua Punch â€“ itâ€™s festive and refreshing! The club level concierge manager is there to answer questions, offer suggestions and she will even make dinner/activity reservations for you. This is a perk of the club level, so take advantage! The staff was so friendly and accommodating. I did notice one guest couple that seemed rather persnickety, demanding and somewhat rude to the staff â€“ that couple didnâ€™t seem to experience the same warm, over-and-above service that we did. Polite manners and genuine appreciation go a long way in earning you extra perks. One staff member even offered to pack us a complimentary picnic cooler for our day trip to the â€œRoad to Hana.â€� DINING Dining can be pricey, but thatâ€™s parts of the vacation experience, right?! Ask the concierge or check out the reviews in Maui Revealed book. My favorite dining experience was Chef Coreyâ€™s creations in the club lounge. Other than that, I loved Lahaina Pizza (upper level) which is a deep dish style pizza. Yum! Tons of restaurants in that area â€“ very historic. On the other side of the Lahaina Cannery Mall (drive around the block) you will find Aloha Mix Plate â€“ a casual restaurant on the water. My husband became a â€œregularâ€� during our week long stay (Note: itâ€™s not vegetarian-friendly, but the staff is Very Friendly). I ordered dessert and a drink from the bar. Take-out is a great option if you donâ€™t feel like lingering. OTHER RESORT AMENITIES Our package deal included a $500 resort credit. We dined at Banyon Tree the first night (ambiance was nice, but the food just wasnâ€™t appealing to us â€“ itâ€™s not bad, just not a place we would try again). The remainder of our credit was spent at the day spa (couples massage) and resort gift shop (sun screen & aloe vera). Somehow we totally missed the art gallery shop on the first floor until the last day. A little pricey, but nice to look at. A walking trail goes from the resort to Kapalua Bay. You can also take advantage of the hotel shuttle. The resort offers a bunch of other activities, but we didnâ€™t participate in those. MUST SEE ATTRACTIONS Haleakala Crater, Iao Needle, Lahaina historic village (see the famous Banyon Tree), drive the Road to Hana (full day driving tour â€“ self guided; buy CD), Pools of Oheo (aka: 7 Sacred Pools). Overall, Maui is magical. It was the perfect place for a romantic honeymoon. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Hen-nyTN
Reviews.Content: We have visited the Ritz Carlton Kapalua many times. As always, on our most recent visit the service was wonderfully warm and professional and the rooms lovely and extremely comfortable. The staff in the club lounge, led by Leslie, were very, very helpful and friendly. On this trip we visited both of the other, much larger resort areas on Maui, which emphasized to us how unique Kapalua and the Ritz are. We appreciated even more the peace and serenity of Kapalua, and the many opportunities to savor the gorgeous environment.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down the most luxurious, best hotel I've ever stayed at.”
Reviews.Author: JetLagQueen
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at many four and five star hotels/resorts but the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is the nicest, most luxurious, classiest place I've been. I'm afraid I've been spoiled for any future vacations because I'll always compare any hotel to the Ritz and come up short. It is certainly the gold standard for service and amenities. Twice a day room housekeeping, feather bed mattresses, huge bathrooms. I was surprised by how quiet the place was. We never heard anyone in surrounding rooms and when we sat on our lanai (next to the third fairway of the Bay Golf Course), we never once heard any other hotel guests. The pools (3) and spas (2) were not crowded. The ocean views from the pool areas are fantastic. It never got too hot (84 degrees all week) because of the constant breezes off the ocean. The Terrace Restaurant (in the hotel) served delicious dinners and the Pineapple Grill Restaurant (on the Kapalua Resort property) served the best meal I've had in years (I work as a Director of Food Services, so I have high standards for meal preparation). My only complaint is the $20 per day "resort fee" that is added on to the daily hotel rate (not mentioned in the Expedia web-site price) . Why not just include it in the daily rate? The good news is that there is no parking fee and the parking lots are very close by the front of the hotel. If you are looking for a quiet, low-key, luxurious resort/hotel, this place can't be beat. If you want a place where the kids can run and scream (i.e., Disneyland type), I'd recommend the Maui Hyatt in Lahaina. My husband learned to scuba in the Ritz-Carlton pool and then went with the instructor to the beach and spent about an hour looking at the giant turtles and tropical fish. There's also a hotel spa (expensive - $170 for a 50 minute massage).There was nightly live music in the lobby/lounge area. Overall, a very relaxing, opulent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ahh, the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ruffian99
Reviews.Content: I wasn't quite sure what to expect from the Ritz after reading all the reviews, but WOW am I glad we decided to stay there instead of on Kaanapali beach. The extra cost was worth it times two. First impressions on Maui (after visiting Kauai) were that it was much more commercial, busier and far less beautiful than Kauai. But when we got to Kapalua, we felt that things finally slowed down again. And the scenery was MUCH prettier than we passed on the drive. The hotel itself is gorgeous, isolated and peaceful. Our room was very nice with an extremely comfortable bed and upgrade to ocean view. The staff was very attentive and the facilities were all just beautiful. The weather was good (a little rain in short showers that passed). The food options were a little expensive but all delicious and you can't beat the views! We would stay here again in a heartbeat--and in fact, would NEVER consider staying in most of the other places we had considered for this trip after seeing the Ritz!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel stays we've ever had.”
Reviews.Author: EscapeFromLA
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I went for a week in July when it was really hot. Kapalua, luckily, was a little cooler than most of the areas we visited. The hotel itself was amazing and the staff could not be better. I know there were some reviews that said they were somewhat indifferent to the guests...we did not get that at all. Everyone was helpful and super nice. The concierge ladies were extremely helpful, especially since my boyfriend had a broken arm and we needed good recommendations on what we could do with that. Our room was spotless and very inviting - the bed was extremely comfortable, as super-finicky sleep people, we were very well rested after every night. My only nit-picky part was that we did not get the free breakfast buffet every morning, like it seemed most of the guests had. I guess that's the price we pay for getting such a great deal. Nevertheless, it was easy to get our own food at grocery stores and restaurants off-site. I cannot recommend this hotel more. We would not stay anywhere else when we visit Maui from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort... when not completely full”
Reviews.Author: allendbd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 5 days from the 5th to the 10th. The hotel is amazing and very beautiful. We stayed here last year as well when it was only 1/4 full. The service was much better last year when they actually knew your name. They were at almost full capacity this year so the service wasn't quite as good, but still pretty exceptional, I'd rate it 2nd behind the 4 Seasons resort we stayed at in Lanai, that review is to follow. We had a club level room, it's the same room you would have booked but you get acces into the club room where they have an open bar, and 5 differt food offerings throughout the day it was discounted on Expeida so we took the chance. We could have had a 1500sq/ft suite if we didn't get the club level. The drinks and concierges there were great especially Athena. If you plan on spending your whole day in the club room it might be worth it, but if you just want a few cocktails and some snacks it's not the best option, and the food was ok but not exceptional. As with any high end resort in Maui it is very expensive $12 for a small plastic cup Mai Tai. I do love this resort and the pool and beach are amazing. If you've saved your pennies it'll be worth it, but we do plan on trying the 4 Seasons In Maui, we had dinner at Spagos there one night and that resort looked amazing as well.

Reviews.Title: “I can't wait to return over and over again! Just totally AMAZING in every way”
Reviews.Author: jmodgeqt2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I came here for our 6 year anniversary in June and let me just tell you THIS is the place you want to stay! It is a gorgeous resort! Upon check-in we were greeted very nicely with a upgrade to a one bedroom ocean view suite. I found the decor to be very modern and clean, just the way I like it! The room was so spacious and our lanai was just beautiful, overlooking the pool, ocean and some very pretty foliage. I have very high expectations when I travel and expect to be catered to at the Ritz, and we were not disappointed. We stayed at one for our honeymoon and we were blown away, so I can say I definitely was looking for the same here. I was definitely a little nervous due to some of the negative reviews I had read before we arrived. None of the things that I was worried about ever happened to us and we stayed for 8 nights. The spa was great, I only used it the first day for one small treatment. The young lady that did my treatment was so professional and also wrote down some great recommendations for us while we visited. The pools were uncrowded and we never had one problem finding a lounge chair to reside in, or had a problem with getting towel service. Service was a little longer than normal but it is MAUI! They move slow! The beach is about a five minute walk down but for us it was not a problem. We are outdoor type people and those things never bother us, so if you are the type that does not like walking this may bother you. I personally found the fact that there was a running trail all the way over to Kapalua beach pretty awesome. Some amazing views all along the trail including another pristine beach. We loved it and it got us up in the morning to exercise, which is something I hardly ever seem to do! This was such a plus! The weather is slightly more windy, and cloudy but I quite enjoyed the cool breeze and a couple days the clouds were much needed for my sunburned skin! The Kapalua area is more secluded and pretty far away from Lahaina or Whaler's village but again for us, this was a relaxing, peaceful get away. I loved being so far north and let me tell you that we are usually the life of any party. We loved Maui so much we actually extended our stay by 4 days and stayed on the north side of Ka'anapali for that part of the stay and while the beach is very pretty there I still much preferred Kapalua for the seclusion and peacefulness vs the overcrowded shopping mall area. I didn't travel that far for a tourist type vacation. I can go to a lot of places on the mainland for that. We never had one issue with our room, towels, or cleaniness. Our room was meticulous and we always had more towels than we could have ever used. Even when we tried to conserve and hang all of them up, they always removed them and replaced them with clean towels. We had a small fridge in our room that we took full advantage of the whole time by stocking up on beer, alcohol, mixers and snacks from across the street at the Honolua store. We made all our own drinks in the room by filling 16 oz empty water bottles up and then packed them in a beach bag and took them down to the beach or pool. We would go to the bar or grab a waiter and get glasses of ice and just throw them a couple of dollars for tip. It saved us a fortune!!! We never had dinner on property because there were so many other options available to us, but we did have breakfast one morning in room and that was 40 dollars for a kid's menu breakfast and ate lunch twice at the pool. The food we did have was all good but pricey. We split burgers and that was enough food for us. I suggest eating breakfast and lunch at the Honolua store. Have the crab cake, eggs benedict! OMG delish and it was 6.95!! Also try the happy hour sushi at Sansei! Best tuna carpaccio in the world! We also ate at the Pineapple grill for our anniversary, this was the only place I was disappointed in unfortunately, mainly because I wanted al fresco dining and this felt more like a country club all inclosed. It wasn't all that romantic. They did have an amazing lobster bisque and great pineapple upside down cake. Merriman's is ASTOUNDING!!! We ended up celebrating our anniversary again another evening because of the view of Molokai and Kapalua beach. They have what's called the point and we spent several evenings here watching sunsets and drinking wine. The food was wonderful and so was the service. One last note on our checkout I called down the day before and asked for a late checkout as our flight didn't leave until 9:00. She had set us up for another room to check into in the morning since we had the free upgraded suite but to our surprise she called us in the morning and told us we could stay in our suite until 6:00 in the evening. It really made our trip special since we did not want to leave, in fact I should probably credit her with the reason my hubby and I decided to extend our stay 4 more days and the only reason we did not stay at the Ritz for that extension was to check out Lahaina and Whaler's village for a comparison for our next visit. It truly was a trip of a lifetime here and I cannot for the life of me see how anyone could ever say a bad word about the Ritz! It is a beautiful place with beautiful people that if you are willing, will bend over backwards to take the ultimate care of you! Thank you Ritz for making our trip so special!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and elegance, but of course at a price”
Reviews.Author: AndyTheGameInventor
Reviews.Content: We spent the last 5 nights of our honeymoon here and had a wonderful time. We paid for club level and were upgraded without asking to a club-level suite (I was planning to ask, but didn't have to). The room was wonderful. There were 2 or 3 small things wrong with the room, but a quick phone call to the desk set it right, and fast. Housekeeping was terrific. Everybody seemed to know our name without being told. I came down to the desk to get change the day after I checked in, and the clerk, who had checked us in the day before, addressed my by name without being prompted - and this place has about 450 rooms! One evening I went to the gift shop to buy sunburn cream. The shop had just closed, but I knocked on the door and the clerk immediately let me in to buy what I needed. I can't say that we used many of the hotel services other than the club lounge - which was wonderful. As others have stated, dining at this hotel is very pricey, but if you have the club lounge, you basically get great food included in your room rate - they don't call it lunch and supper but trust me, it's plenty and it's good. Grounds were beautifully maintained. You can valet park for a fairly steep charge ($18/day) or self-park for free, which we did, but it can be a 5-minute walk to the car. Also, as others have mentioned, the beach is a 5-10 on-property walk away, and it's downhill, which of course means uphill on the way home. (Hint: from the beach, walk into level 1 in the #1 wing, and take the elevator to your room. If you're in the #2 wing, take the #1 wing elevator to floor 7 and walk across to wing #2 - much less climbing!) I highly recommend a car if you're staying here, since distances are quite long. However one day I went to do laundry a few miles away and the hotel courtesy van happened to be there dropping a guest off and later returned to pick her up. They're big on service. In a humorous moment, I was carrying a somewhat heavy ice chest down the hall and the housekeeper (a lady about half my size) asked if I needed help carrying it. Honeymoon or not, I'm not going to saddle her with that weight to carry. :) It's beautiful, it's luxurious, it's expensive, and of course it's Maui. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “What an amazing property and incredible staff”
Reviews.Author: RockiesRogue
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the RC Kapalua for a week in late June of 2010. We were impressed from the moment we arrived on property. There was a Huge wine and Food Festival going on on property that we did not participate in, but we never felt lost in the shuffle of the group. The room we had was a residential suite with an ocean view. It was beautifuly appointed and had everything we needed for our two year old son and my wife and I. It was nice to have a place to store snacks or share a meal when we didn't feel like going out. The front desk staff was friendly and accomodating, the concierge was knowledgeable of local area attractions for a family and offered great dining options both on property and off. The front drive and bell staff blew us away with their over-the-top service. They offered toys for my son to play with on the beach, informed us of the free shuttle that takes you around the area and when that was taking too long one morning, drove us to the beach themselves in the hotel car. The staff at the restaurants were great and made dining with our son an easy experience. Overall the trip was a relaxing one, which was exactly what we wanted. The Ritz provided the ambiance for us and anticipated everything else to fill in the blanks. I have stayed at a few Ritz-Carltons over the years and this one will stand out in our minds for many years to come. We can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful, don't believe the whiner's complaints”
Reviews.Author: CTSirTravelsAlot
Reviews.Content: First, stop believing the overly negative reviews from people. They complain about the wind. OK it is windy, but there was only ONE day when it was really gusting and beach had a red flag warning. So it's windy, find something else to do. The beach is too far....waaaah! It's probably about 5-6 city blocks from the lobby. Forgive my non-PC self for saying it, but most Americans could stand to walk that far and back and lose a little weight. Also, the beach (D.T. Fleming) was perfect. Only rivalled by our experience in Hana of Hamoa beach. As for lounge chairs, they are at the beach in a small grassy area. You are asked not to bring them down to the beach. Big deal. If you want a beach littered with things/people, then stay at one of the Ka'anapali beaches. The main reason for staying here was to AVOID that. We didn't eat at any hotel restaurants, but I would highly recommend Pineapple Grill (though I was disappointed and slighlty confused they had no al fresco dining) and Merriman's. Definitely go to Merriman's, if for nothing but sitting out on the "Point" and enjoying Happy Hour (which is actually 2 hours from 3-5). Service at the hotel was impeccable. We were upgraded to a 1 BR residential suite uopn arrival. Room was nice and housekeeping very good. All-in-all a wonderful property in a beautiful, secluded (read: away from the masses in Ka'anapali) spot in Maui. Would return in a heartbeat. P.S. If you are going to spend some time in Hana, don't waste your money on Hotel Hana Maui. Rent one of the properties from Hana Paradise Cottages. We rented the Bamboo Cottage for 2 nights and the cottage was very clean and nicely appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Best place I've ever stayed! Romantic and beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: preciouslizzy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our anniversary and 4th of July in Maui. The Ritz is so beautiful. Despite the misc. complaints, I stayed there anyway. I am so glad I did. The resort is so beautiful, breathtaking and elegant. We were greeted so nicely by all the staff and even received a hawaiian necklace upon check in. We had an ocean view suite and saw the beautiful sunrise every morning from our balcony. The resort is very big but the beach is just a 5 minute walk from the main pool area. The beach is very private as you only see guests of the Ritz. The concierge was so helpful and booked all of our events that were first class, all we had to do was show up. I do have to advise you that the ocean view was a side view but it was still beautiful. I believe they also have ocean front rooms available. They played live soothing music in the lounge area. Tips: Grab your breakfast and lunch at the store on the resort and save your money for a nice dinner. Dinner on the resort can be pricey but it's expected when staying at the Ritz. Last but not least, I read about the wind and was somewhat apprehensive. It is a little windy but most of the island is, because of the trade winds. There's a reason why it is the surfing capital! The wind is a nice warm breeze, don't worry you will enjoy it!

Reviews.Title: “Out of this world!”
Reviews.Author: Suz032
Reviews.Content: We visited as part of our honeymoon. The accommodation was excellent and the service was fantastic. We didn't have to lift a finger! What a beautiful setting and a great shuttle bus can take you anywhere in the Kapalua vicinity. Was superb.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected from a Ritz Carlton - disappointing”
Reviews.Author: FamilyVacation15
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at four hotels in Maui: Westin, Grand Wailea, Hyatt, and now Ritz Carlton. By far, the Ritz was the worst experience of all of them. The restaurants all have super slow and poor service (our 3-year-old waited an hour to get her chicken nuggets). The beach is far from the rest of the resort, and there are no lounge chairs or umbrellas offered for the beach.
