The pool is very boring compared to the other hotels' pools and the children's pool is tiny with small waterfalls being the only feature. On one of the last days, we discovered a sewage leak in our room after coming back from the pool. Waste water was backing up through the drains and seeping through the floorboards. After calling the front desk, we were told that they were very busy and would get to us eventually. Only after we talked to the engineers and demanded to talk to the desk manager did they move our rooms. We think that for the other rooms down the hall they didn't even bother to advise the guests of what had happened and just tried to clean it up before they returned. Overall, I would not recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families with young kids. This is not what I would have expected from a Ritz Carlton and I will think twice before booking another Ritz Carlton property.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment...”
Reviews.Author: SavvyG
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed at the Ritz for 6 days in May. We have stayed there several times throughout the years and had wonderful experiences with no complaints whatsoever, so we were really looking forward to another fabulous stay. Unfortunately, that didn't happen. The poolside servers were unfriendly and had scowls on their faces; two wake-up calls we did NOT request; both carts that take you up to the hotel from beach were out of service - on the same day - how about putting a sign out that informs you of this BEFORE we headed down the hill?; a horrible massage at the spa; a charge for wine that was added to our hotel bill, which we had not ordered (it was removed). Positives? Beautiful ocean view room and gorgeous spa. Sure this is a negative review but you expect much more from a Ritz. Where is the impeccable service the Ritz is known for? Save your money and go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect family vacation”
Reviews.Author: CRtor
Reviews.Content: We booked a 1-bdrm suite (we were poolside which provided an excellent view of the ocean that hadn't been mentioned when we booked) and were pleasantly surprised by the amount of space; the lanai could fit 10 comfortably. Well-maintained, impeccable grounds, exceptional staff (particularly Anthony and Mike G). Secluded, yet plenty of dining options and activities. Great gym. Our daughters (6 & 8yrs) had plenty to keep them busy and were elated with the place, meanwhile it's low-key enough that adults can relax. There is a marine sanctuary approx 5 miles from the resort (Honolua) that has incredible snorkeling once you hike through a few minutes of rain forest - an experience on its own. A bit further down the road is a popular ocean "geyser" which shouldn't be missed. So yes, as others have mentioned, the resort is a bit off-piste, but that was precisely what we were looking for. Also highly recommend Air Maui's heli tour of the volcano/waterfalls - and our pilot Capt. Kirk, who provided excellent commentary. In terms of luaus we enjoyed the Feast at Lele. Dining options are not cheap on the island, and the resort is no exception. There are deals if you look for them though. A four minute walk from the lobby to the local General Store fed our family of four for less than $25. In terms of on-property dining Pineapple Grill was our favourite (resort shuttle will take you there). Views everywhere are stunning. We have been to Kauai a few times and frankly didn't expect Maui to compete...ideally our next visit will include both.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Staff and Beach, Ok Location”
Reviews.Author: blondiemurc
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying that this hotel is really beautiful. The staff is very friendly, the grounds are beautiful, the pools are super clean and the beach is really amazing. We rented one of the private cabanas for the day and that was a real treat. The kids really loved it and the service was superb. We do believe there are two downsides to the location though 1) the hotel is pretty north on the island so if you want some off property options, you need to drive to Kaanapali or Lahaina and this is also where most of the activities (i.e. parasailing, snorkeling, surf lessons, etc.) are located and 2) it is VERY windy. There is no protection against the wind anywhere on the property so the wind just blows through the entire place. We stayed in a 1 bedroom suite which was very nice. The kids slept on the pull out couch which was perfect for them. There was plenty of room for all of us and it was nice to have a completely separate bedroom. There is also a small fridge and freezer as well as a microwave. The fridge was very nice because it allowed us to get some sodas and snacks to keep on hand. The gym was really nice too. It has a beautiful view and the staff was very friendly. There is also a nice inclined hill for sprints on the right side of the property by the basketball and tennis courts. It made a nice outdoor workout and provided an amazing view while working out! We would recommend this hotel for sure and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A little too fancy...”
Reviews.Author: MLQuock
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is wonderful and everything you'd expect, except for a few things... - Seems very catered to golfers...nightlife and other activities are slim to none. - Not ony are the rooms expensive, so is EVERYTHING else, including breakfast, toiletries, snacks, room service, etc... - The layout is weird...we got lost trying to find the room, and then lost again trying to head back to the lobby... - The location is a bit remote and far off from any kind of city life, so if you don't have a car, you're stuck there. PROS: -excellent service -rooms are clean and beautiful -bathroom is huge -resort is quiet and good for relaxing -complimentary resort shuttle to take you to the different restaurants on the resort Wonderful place, but I wouldn't stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: kristinesalmon52
Reviews.Content: To celebrate our 39th anniversary we splurged on the Ritz-Maui.Room was small, but nice bed. The lanai overlooked a hammock that had screaming kids from morning until late evening so we couldn't sit outside. Poor service at the bar/restaurant, towels were not replaced after housekeeping, no help at pool or beach area, had to call far too many times for little things like turndown. Nothing to welcome us. No flowers, nothing special. Have stayed at other Ritz-Carlton's I loved. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Property, Service and Environment”
Reviews.Author: pdx503wx
Reviews.Content: The Ritz - Carlton at Kapalua was one of the three best hotels my wife and I have ever stayed in. The staff was exceptional. We were unable to get to the Ritz from the airport due to the a fire along side of the highway. The management helped out by getting rooms for everyone at near by resorts. When we did make it to the Ritz everything went perfectly. The property was beautiful sitting right along the shore with a wonderful pool and beach access. The resort offered two of the best meals we had on our whole trip. The Banyan Tree and Kai were both great meals with staff who were informed and took care of every need. The Ritz & Kapalua were so nice we extended our stay one extra day just to get more sun by the pool...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing and Romantic”
Reviews.Author: NapoleonCat
Reviews.Content: My husband took me there for a surprise weekend trip. We stayed in the Residential Ocean View Suite that included a spacious bedroom, a handsome calabash table large enough to seat at least 6 people, and a private lanais overlooking the pools and ocean. As an added bonus, our suite was on the 8th floor and had a perfect view of the wonderful Hawaiian sunset. Surrounded by beautiful views and luxuriously groomed grounds, the hotel is peaceful, relaxing, romantic and yet family friendly. As the trip was very short for us, we spent a lot of our time lying by the pools and on its beach. The service at the restaurants was warm and attentive. The food was very good (the food at the Four Seasons seemed better to me, but itâ€™s been awhile since I was last there so I could be remembering this wrong). The famous brunch had an abundance of food and definitely, a not-to-miss for the experience. We took advantage of the hotelâ€™s location and drove through the winding Hwy 340, visiting the less populated areas in Northwest Maui. Being only a short distance from Lahaina, the hotel offers great access to this charming busy town. If you are planning on staying in West Maui, I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little off the beaten path, you can find relaxation here but you have to work at it.”
Reviews.Author: djrhoffman
Reviews.Content: After coming from the Hotel Hana-Maui I was a little shocked at the size of the rooms. I have only stayed in one other Ritz Carlton (in Miami) and this one felt less elegant. My husband and I were looking for relaxation during our babymoon and we got some of it but we also got a lot of families and loud children and mediocre service at the restaurant. I think this would be a great hotel to return to with kids but for a honeymoon, babymoon or other romantic event, you might want to look elsewhere. I loved the proximity to Lahaina which was the highlight of the trip. The days mostly start overcast here and then turn to sort of sunny before raining again in the evening so if you're looking for a dry Maui beach vacation - go to Wailea. I will say though that the spa was excellent. Great amenities and services. I had one of the best massages of my life here (and I get massage about every 2 weeks) so that is really saying something. Couples massage in the hale is quite relaxing even though you're actually in the middle of the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Um...why no upgrade for us?”
Reviews.Author: JP1152001
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for our 14th anniversary, in late May 2010. The hotel had been apprised of our special event, and we requested an upgrade but was told none were available. I am disappointed to read that several couples - who I presume based on their comments and other postings on this site are straight couples - visiting around the same time we were there were "surprised" with substantial room upgrades when checking in, even though they were not there celebrating any special anniversary. Could it be that a same-sex female couple checking in to celebrate their anniversary are not offered the same courtesies that a man/woman couple celebrating nothing in particular are afforded? I realize we're always asked twice about bed choice when they see us ("You really want just one king bed?") and we've come to expect being shown to the worst table in any restaurant unless we ask for a better one. But it would be nice to be offered some of the perks that straight couples seem to be offered left and right at 5-star hotels, especially when we're there for an anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Maria_Lopez_9
Reviews.Content: If you're going to a Ritz, don't be expecting to save cash. Honeymooners delight. Awesome breakfast buffet for $30 (they'll even make you anything off the menu you ask for!). We were upgraded to a suite - enough room to entertain 8! One drawback - dining on the property was pricey and we had to drive down to Lahaina for cheaper eats (~20 mins). PERFECT for couples!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Maui Experience!”
Reviews.Author: DiaryofNDJ
Reviews.Content: On our 5 day trip to Maui we wanted relaxation and a beautiful resort - the Ritz Carlton Kapalua delivered that and so much more. The only resort on the island that could rival this hotel is the Four Seasons, but I found the Ritz to be cleaner, newer, and have much more space (Disclaimer: I did not stay in the Four Seasons, only had drinks there and toured the grounds). We were immediately upgraded to the 1-bedroom Residential Suite, which was an unbelievable surprise and made our trip even more special. I was able to enjoy a view of the ocean, walk 2 minutes to the pools, and have my breakfast and lunch on the lanai overlooking the property. Yes, the wind is a little strong at times...yes, this part of the island has the occasional rain shower...and yes, the prices are a little high - but none of these things even came close to dampening the trip. I would stay in this hotel again without question!

Reviews.Title: “Suite Great for Family”
Reviews.Author: 3Reedys
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Residential Suite, which was perfect for us with our young son. The hotel is beautiful with excellent pools, including a kid's pool. The Ambassador of The Environment Centre provides great guided snorkeling trips and hikes.

Reviews.Title: “BE CAREFUL, THIS HOTEL IS WAY UNDERSTAFFED”
Reviews.Author: LarryandHolly
Reviews.Content: BE VERY CAREFUL, three different service incidents in 5 days, not the â€œRitzâ€� way, especially when the room rates have not come down accordingly. When I expressed the concerns one employee admitted that â€œthey were experiencing problemsâ€�. Food (sandwiches) taking an hour in the pool for lunch, drinks did not come together but 30 minutes later, charges for in room not deducted after their own front desk employees confirmed verbally that they would credit and a couple more stories from us and other couples that attended with usâ€¦ On top they tried to charge a movie and another $80.00 item.. The management team here is clearly focused on achieving their revenue/bookings and cost targets while compromising the old Ritz way... On top they're also making their great staff look bad as they have to face the customers. Folks, I donâ€™t have time to post but had to do it for this stay and will get the word out as broad as I can, shame on the management staff at this hotel, Ritz corporate needs to review this one and I'll make sure a letter goes to them also.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty on Maui”
Reviews.Author: Piper044
Reviews.Content: Wonderful, great location, great service, great spa, great food! Yes, it is very expensive, but it is worth it. We island-hopped to the other locations, and this one was the best. Prepare your wallet, but also be prepared to enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “An Amazing Anniversary Experience”
Reviews.Author: TravelDiva529
Reviews.Content: My husband and I arrived at the Ritz Kapalua and were warmly welcomed. The front desk staff was extremely nice and accommodating - even after I had an issue, which they patiently helped me resolve. The bell staff was very friendly and everyone at this hotel had a wonderful "Aloha" each time we saw them. The room was beautifully furnished and I feel that we got what we paid for. We were on the club level - which is absolutely worth the additional money, in that the food and beverages are good and plentiful and the hospitality is unmatched. Leslie was very invested in our stay and spent time with not only us, but she was always engaged with the guests and she was a wonderful representation of the Ritz. The hotel had a fantastic jazz band on Sat evening. This is the perfect hotel for a wonderful romantic experience. It does rain, but it only lasts for about five minutes and we saw at least 6 rainbows. It did not dampen our experience at all. Amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Perfection in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: LetsGo0508
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Maui was just perfect! We arrived around 9 pm, exhausted and jet lagged, and the staff couldn't have been more accomodating. I asked for a room upgrade (no harm in asking) and they were able to bump us up to a partial ocean view on the golf course. We spent the next day at the pool where we were able to get a cabana for free since it was a slow Monday. Yes, it was windy but I'm not going to blame that on the Ritz. The hotel was beautiful and clean, and the staff was always so helpful and kind. We didn't eat on the property b/c we knew how expensive it could be. We did frequent the Honolua Store a lot, since the food was cheap and good. It's only a 5 minute walk. We stopped by other properties, and my husband and I both agreed that staying at the Ritz was the right choice. Nothing else compared in the area. We stayed for 5 nights and checked out on Friday. They gave us a late checkout since our flight wasn't until 10:30 pm. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “OK and windy”
Reviews.Author: Gotitall
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel to stay in. I like the Ritz for the level of service and personalization. In Hawaii, its especially good as families with children generally do not stay here and you can always get a seat by the pool. VERY WINDY and hard to lay by the pool, so escaped to nearby beaches that are protected by the cliffs. Kapalua Bay Beach is a good one, there's also Napili and Hanama Bay. Can walk to several of these. So many good hotels on Maui its hard to recommend this one because of the wind, but I wouldn't say no to going there if had to! Great spa! Got a scrub, massage and manicure there. The manicure lasted for over a week. Great gym and yoga classes.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel in maui”
Reviews.Author: jcnem
Reviews.Content: I decided to book the ritz for my honeymoon using the amex travel services and couldnt have asked for a better trip. We got a free breakfast every morning(buffet lots of choices), a resort credit and an upgrade to a partial ocean view. The room was a good size, clean, with a nice balcony attached overlooking the golf course and some of the ocean. All the bars were great, typical drinks cost around 12 dollars which for a 5 star resort I thought was pretty good. THey tasted good and you didnt need many to feel like you were on vacation! THe pool itself was nice, very quiet and relaxing and never really super busy. As far as the restaurants go, my wife and I went to the banyan tree for dinner on "wine wednesday." The staff was really nice, food was good but I thought it was way overpriced. We did have a great dinner and they did not rush us, but there are many other great restaurants close but that have better prices. You are really paying for the scenery and service at the banyan tree. Beach bars and the main lounge are great for a drink and some sandwiches or light fare. If you dont want to pay the resorty prices, you can walk to a few restaurants close by(sansei is awesome sushi, and a little general store that serves breakfast and lunch) In all the hotel and vacation was great, definitely rent a car because the resort is around an hour away for the airport. Front street is a great place to go down in Lahania which is 15 minutes from the ritz. Great local restaurants and bars in that area. Oh and make sure you do the ziplines in kapalua, its a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz service shines on club floor”
Reviews.Author: YYCjetsetter
Reviews.Content: On our honeymoon my wife and I decided to stay at the Ritz-Carlton for 3 of the ten nights we planned to spend in Maui. The resort is nestled nicely in a very large village type area with many beautiful views of the west Maui mountains and of course the ocean. Upon arival we were greeted with a very welcoming smiles and an eagerness to make us comfortable from the moment we arrived. The valets and bell people were very helpful and offered very good in site on things we were planning to do and things that we didn't know about snorkeling spots,quiet beaches ect. The rooms were beautiful newly renovated with a modern Polynesian style to them. We did decide to stay on the club floor which was an absolute treat. The breakfasts were continental with usually a warm item or two good coffee and a cappuccino maker and wide selection of teas. Lunch time were sandwiches, fruit and light snacks. In the evening the hour d'ouveres were really good a lot of fish and veggies a cheese plate and drinks(which are served all day). The service from two specific staff members Leslea and Gerry who seemed to genuinely love what they do and it showed. The worst thing about the club floor for us was the morgue like atmosphere the other guests gave off you had a better chance of seeing a dolphin in the three tiered pool then a smile on someone's face which really brought down the atmosphere a lot. As far as the location it is secluded which cuts down on restaurant choices but there are still great ones in the area. As far as value the significant difference in price compared to other hotels I didn't feel it was two to two and a half time as good so thats were that rating came from. I would not recommend to anyone under say 40 or that likes to smile and laugh.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING STAY”
Reviews.Author: srlaries
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in Maui for 11 days moving around the island staying at 3 different hotels and The Ritz-Carlton was by far our favorite. The staff was awesome and the beach was fantastic. We love the location on the property and our 4 year old had a fabulous time at the kiddie pool and the park. The only thing that I was dissapointed with was the spa. My prenantal massage (Mother's Day Gift) was $195 for 50 minutes. The hotel includes gratutity which I was not thrilled about. I have been to far better spas worldwide with cheaper prices. Aside from the spa, the hotel was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular property”
Reviews.Author: KristinBATL
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a five night stay at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. It is the most stunning property I have ever stayed at! The photos do not even do it justice, When you walk into the lobby and look out over the terrace, the view of the pools, the palm trees, the flowers and ocean is breathtaking. I chose this location because it was away from the other hotels (which may be a negative to some people). It is peaceful, serene, and tranquil, exactly what I needed. There is a gorgeous beach just a walk down the property, and i watched the sunrise each day at this spot. There are also chairs in this area to escape the pool atmosphere if you'd like. The concierge and valets were very helpful with all of my questions about activities. You can book most activities on the island directly through the hotel. Keep in mind these are "a la carte" as far as pricing, and none are free. This is the case no matter where you stay on Maui, though, so go for the best! The rooms were beautiful, clean, modern and spacious. Service was impeccable from the restaurants to the cleaning staff. There are several restaurants on the property. You cannot expect to stay at a Ritz Carlton and have cheap food. In the hotel, the breakfast was excellent, and the bar had delicious food at a lower price than the other choices. The cocktails were the best I had on Maui. Again, Maui is expensive in general so go for the best! There are several other choices within walking or free shuttle distance from the hotel. We especially enjoyed Sansei and Pineapple Grill. There is also a general store type place with a deli for breakfast and lunch. Make sure you take the shuttle to Kapalua Bay, as the snorkeling is wonderful. I would recommend renting a car, as there is no free shuttle service to Kanaapali or Lahaina, and taxis are expensive. I went through Hertz directly rather than booking through the hotel and got a much better rate. We were able to have the car delivered to and dropped off at the Ritz easily.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel......Pricey Drinks and Food”
Reviews.Author: travelebefuninthesun
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we wanted to experience one of the nicer hotels on the island and we got a good rate ($322/night) when we stayed. Most of the reviews we read on trip advisor are very accurate. Upon check in they upgraded us to an ocean view room even though we only paid for the basic room. Most of the rooms their have only a limited ocean view due to the layout of the hotel. The service at the hotel was very good from the Valet, Front Desk, and most Servers. The grounds are very nice and the Ocean view from the pools are unbelievable. The hotel is about a 3 minute walk to the beach so do not expect to be right on the beach like some other places but the walk is quick and they even provide a golf cart ride free of charge for you if you prefer. The rooms were very nice and the maid service was up to parr. Like other reviews stated the pool deck can be very windy but in Hawaii even a strong wind is not that cold. There was a few times where we had to wait longer than expected to get drinks in the outside pool bar area and they were not even that busy but other than that all of our service experiences were great. Kevin at the Terrace was great! The hotel is for the most part by itself so there are only a few places to walk to but if you do decide to stay here you should definitely go to "The Gazebo" for breakfast and get the macadamia and banana nut pancakes. Also even better than that is "The PIneapple Grill" Best restaurant I have ever been to. The pineapple upside down cake is a great desert and the fish and steaks there are great. Overall I really enjoyed this hotel. The only negative I have is that even though we got a good rate I forgot that the food ($20 omelet) drinks ($12 Pina Colada) and activities (my girlfriend paid $15 for a yoga class) would still be pricey but I guess that is what you should expect at the Ritz or any other five star resort. This and the 4 Seasons are the only 2 Five Star resorts on Maui. Please do not hesitate to contact me if you have any questions because I am just like you and like to do my research before I commit to spending my vacation and money at a place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: mrod4444
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the ritz in New Orleans(club level) and also in Puerto rico(not club level) Now I know why i love staying at the Ritz Perfect perfect perfect I was in Honalulu it was ok hotel the outrigger and after Maui I went to the Marriott Kona what a mistake nothing can follow The Ritz I definatly will returne

Reviews.Title: “Heaven”
Reviews.Author: FitzTraveller
Reviews.Content: If I'm staying at a 5 Diamond property; I expect the best. After all I'm paying for the best. The Ritz Kapalua far exceeded even my expectations. I could go on about the grounds, the pool, and general ambiance, but that should all be a given... and it was all there in abundance. What sets this place apart was the customer service. The people working here take a sincere pleasure in their jobs, and it's felt. And I'm talking about everyone from the front drive, to the gardners, to the woman that hands out towels at the beach. We had the pleasure of staying on the club floor. The women up there were welcoming, but not intrusive... very delicate balance... accommodating, and more than helpful as we navigated adventures for each day. We stayed in Feb, and I'm writing this in April still jagged by our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but was expecting better..”
Reviews.Author: HamSandwich
Reviews.Content: overall, I had a good experience at the Ritz in Maui but I was a bit disappointed and my rating is closer to 3.5 but not 4 stars. Nothing is wrong with the hotel but it definitely wasn't a luxury hotel. The rooms were spacious and nice; the service was great; my wife had a wonderful time at the spa. The beach is good for body surfing and swimming but there are no beach chairs available. As indicated by other reviews, the beach is a bit of a walk but that didn't bother me. The pools were just alright - nothing spectacular but we spent most of our time at the beach. Proximity to golf was great but during our stay the greens at the Plantation Course were being aerated so I opted to play the Bay Course. Nothing to complain about but nothing stood out either.. If you want luxury on Maui then stay at the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “What a let down”
Reviews.Author: Matttttttttttttt
Reviews.Content: We just spent a week in Maui splitting our time between the Sheraton and the Ritz (had a wedding to attend at the Ritz). Even ignoring the price gouging, I was very disappointed. Compared to the Sheraton, the staff was less friendly, the views were less interesting, the distance to the beach was farther, and the price gouging was worse. On the flip side, the room itself was nicer than the Sheraton (with the exception of the bed which wasn't level at the Ritz). I travel a lot, so I am used to the outrageous hotel prices. But when my wife got a mani/pedi for $150 and it was worse than she could do herself, that is just plain offensive. When we checked into our "Deluxe Ocean View Room", was a little surprised that I had to lean over the railing and look left with binoculars to see the ocean. And with the window open, you certainly couldn't hear it. The Sheraton was right there and most rooms have direct ocean views. I was looking forward to this stay expecting the much higher price to command a much nicer (or at least somewhat nicer) experience. Not so. Plus, the weather in Kapalua was consistently worse than Ka'anapali (sp?).

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Kapalua delivers - as expected”
Reviews.Author: Ryan G
Reviews.Content: We just got back from an awesome stay at the Ritz Kapalua and we could not have been more pleased. Food, service, views, cleanliness, activities, etc. were all awesome. We had to call paramedics to our room for a very sick infant in the middle of the night and the service that night from the hotel staff (in addition to fire and medical personnel) was above and beyond. The Ritz employees offered rides to/from the hospital, an escort to/from hospital, and then they followed up all the next day. Throughout the rest of our stay, staff would always ask "How is Baby Bella doing today?" as we walked around the property. They really cared, and we felt cared for. We also loved the Jean-Michel Cousteau Ambassadors of the Environment program. We attended two: the hike into the rain forest above Kapalua, and the 'Mapping of Hawaii'. Both were very informative and I was so happy to learn what I did. I actually felt bad for the guests who come to the resort and never bother to learn about all the cool facts, culture, plants, animals and resources all around them. I would advise all people staying at the Ritz to check out the Ambassador of the Environment progrmas and find a program that interests them. When staying at the Ritz, it is nice to not be on 'Resort Row'. I liked being tucked away from the madness of rental cars, surfing lessons every 20 feet, cabana boys, and overprices shopping centers. Highly highly recommended if you want to relax on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “A horribly disappointing exchange of value & miserable service.”
Reviews.Author: HawkeyeMac
Reviews.Content: I have the perspective of staying at least seven different Ritz Carlton Resorts around the world and I feel I have enough experiences to make a judgement. In short, save your money and don't get sucked into the so called luxury experience. To start, the hotel concierge provided incorrect information as to when the infamous Plantation Course would under go aeration. I twice made phone calls to confirm that the course would be suitable for my days of travel & stay at the Ritz. Upon arrival I was informed that the Plantation Course was being aerated and the greens fees were $235. I had to play because I flew 5000 miles to experience it. I've played all over the world and do yourself a favor: buy tickets for whale watching if you want great views of water and whales breaching. Wailea is a much better exchange of value for the golf experience. I am a true golf junky ,trust me. My mouth waters every year in January when they play the SBS tournament. When I got to the course for my tee time, they informed me that there was also a slight construction project going on that day. They dug up the back 9 for irrigation. I was playing in between tractors and workers who were clueless I just paid good money to play this course. When leaving the property, be sure to review your bill carefully. I had purchased a package that included all the breakfasts and they somehow double charged me along with other charges that I charged to another card. The attention to detail at this property is very poor and probably due to the "relaxed nature" of the locals who seem to be sleep walking. I just can't recommend this place ever. To go further, the coffee was cold 3 of the 5 days and tasted like it was sitting in a metal pot all day long. Seriously, how do you mess up coffee? Resort fee of $20 per day. Why? Everything on this trip was prepaid and I find this fee a nickel and dime fee. Just add it to the room charge or whatever. There is only one Ritz that I will ever revisit and that is in Ireland. Maybe the rest of the Ritz Carlton clowns should go there to learn how to run a real luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The setting trumps the luxury of this resort.”
Reviews.Author: sitesea
Reviews.Content: We had to wait 45 minutes beyond check-in time to get into our room. Our partial view room overlooked the golf course with the distant ocean. It was quiet and private on our lanai. The room was nicely decorated and comfortable with an ample bathroom. The room and the grounds were clean and well maintained. I can't compare this to any other Ritzes but to compare to other 5 star hotels I would rate this 4 stars. There was nothing exceptional- it was just very nice. The pool area was disappointing in that the chaises were often littered with wet towels which might languish until the next morning. There were numerous children who had the run of all the pools. The service was pleasant but average in our restaurant, bar and poolside encounters. We had very good lunches in the beachside restaurant with fabulous views of the coastal scenery. There are many places to hike around the hotel and we enjoyed hiking on rough trails as well as the paths of a former golf course. There are jungly mountainside and open coastal trails. A trail guide is available at the concierge. The coastline is very rugged and windswept, the property is planted with tropical pine trees and the views of Molokai make a beautiful, scenic setting. We enjoyed the walk to the beach, but some folks chose to take a cart ride. The setting is peaceful compared to busy Kaanapali or Lahaina, and both are easy to drive to from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious relaxation!”
Reviews.Author: vaibella
Reviews.Content: Pool service, top notch! Housekeeping, top notch! Bellmen and concierge, top notch! Spa- best ever, especially the after treatment where you are given a hot neck pillow in the relaxation. Room was pleasantly quiet- must be their new cushioned wood floors. Many families but the pool area is so large that it didn't disrupt our stay. Lobby bar, late night, short staffed, only complaint. Will never stay anywhere else in Maui again- if going for complete relaxation and low key travel. Food and Beverage- excellent! Oh and fitness center was awesome, staffed from 5am also, for all your needs. And a great value, booked through Expedia with United flights.

Reviews.Title: “McRitz”
Reviews.Author: Clark033
Reviews.Content: This hotel had a lot of issues with it, some of which wouldn't bother me in a hotel which wasn't supposed to be a luxury hotel but certainly are major strikes against paying any kind of a price premium for it. - Extremely indifferent staff. People frequently seemed bored or unhappy to be there. I'm outgoing, so I'm pretty used to being engaged with folks. I don't even mind deferential distance. This was just indifference. We had a waiter at the pool who was continually looking around bored for the minute he was taking our order, others who just seemed unhappy or unwilling to help us with any kind of problem. - Noise. Our room was over the golf course, and they start grooming with power equipment at 5:30 AM. Every day. Within 100 feet of the window. Shut the windows in this hotel, and you might as well be in Cleveland. - Decor and layout is bland and unoriginal. The restaurant didn't even have outdoor seating of any kind. - No direct beach access, or beach services. If you want a beach towel, they will loan you one, but you have to haul it to the beach yourself. There is a shuttle, but we spent 1/2 hour in a parking lot waiting for the ride back to the hotel. We could rent a chair and bill it to the room, but it wasn't through the Ritz and it wasn't included in the $20 a day "Resort Fee" they will stack on top of the bill. - Concierge seemed unwilling or unable to help booking anything that wasn't part of the resort. When asked for restaurant recommendations, one could only name two restaurants, both within the extended resort. (And even then, they couldn't get a table; we walked in to eat at the bar and got seated in two minutes.) When we wanted to book a dive tour, another concierge informed us that is was too late and all of them would be closed. We called from the room, and got it done no problems. Overall, there are a lot of less expensive options in Maui that will be a lot more fun, and better ways to spend your money if you want to go all out. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service Ever!”
Reviews.Author: VactionAllTheTime
Reviews.Content: I suprised my bofriend with an eight-day stay at the Ritz at the end of January 2010, and it was one of the best vacations ever. The weather was beautiful and the hotel was fantastic. Our room looked onto the golf course, and we had georgeous sun on our patio every day. The pool was my favorite. Not only was it relaxing, but we had the best service ever. I want to thank the staff at the pool because they saw to our every need: drinks, snacks, chaise set up/ towels and they even asked if we needed magazines. Jake was especially helpful, serving us the best mai-tai's on the island. Service could not have been better. And even though there were children playing in the pool, they were not distracting while trying to read because the pool's waterfall blocked unwanted noise. The concierge staff did a great job too, suggesting restaurants and excursions; they answered the phone and returned calls promptly. Brunch on Sunday was well worth it too. I highly recommend this hotel. My boyfriend and I are well seasoned travelers, and we both thought the Ritz was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Hambug
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Ritz! The room was great - I loved the hardwood floors and the dark wood furniture. The shower water pressure was great, the bath products were nice, and they replenished our towels twice a day (once with regular housekeeping and once with turndown service). All hotel staff were friendly and helpful, including the catering staff. The setting was spectacular, the pools/hot tubs were great, and the poolside bar made tasty drinks but were not speedy. It was very windy and rained a few times - to be expected that far north. The beach had very strong surf during our stay and was not safe to swim in - Kaanapali beaches are better for that. We had fun playing shuffleboard on the lawn, and there was also a bocci ball court and some hammocks scattered around. The Honaloa Store is right next door and is great for affordable breakfast, lunch, souveniers, groceries, alcohol, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the high price.”
Reviews.Author: LVDDS
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from our stay at the Ritz, and we are already missing it. We expected wind and rain at the location, and were not dissapointed. Rain and wind came, and went. The rain last 10- 15 minutes, then it's sunny and beautiful. The location is quite upscale and was very accomodating towards my 2 year old daughter, We stayed on the club level ocean view room, and was very pleased. The view from the room was GREAT. We left the door open the whole time to experience the clean air and the sound of the waves rock us to sleep and wake us in the morning. My 2 year old daughter loves the pool and the guest around the facility were super nice to her. The concierge service on the Club level room was superb. She accommodated all our needs and provided great tips on what to do around Maui. Drinks and food were plenty as the staff constantly asked if we needed more drinks or warm milk for my daughter. The guests there were very friendly, well at least the ones on the Club level room. There were some who were uptight, but overall, good people. Made some good friends there. You will not be disppointed staying at the Club Level room as well as the Ritz. I'll try to upload some pics soon.

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular setting but mediocre service and food. Visit the beaches here, but stay at FS Maui.”
Reviews.Author: ncinaz
Reviews.Content: On our recent trip to Maui we couldn't decide whether to stay at the Four Seasons or the Ritz so we ended up splitting our time between the two hotels, spending four days at FS Maui and three at the Ritz-Carlton. First the good news: The setting at Kapalua couldn't be much more stunning. D.T. Fleming beach and the other easily accessible beaches at the Ritz are rugged and beautiful. The hotel's grounds, lobby and rooms are also attractive. The Beach House restaurant has a wonderful setting and slightly better than average food and service. The bad news: Service was mediocre at best. Granted, we were coming from the Four Seasons, where service was warm, outgoing, and generally flawless, but we expected service to at least be at a four-star level at Kapalua. No such luck. The front desk attendant, whose English was difficult to understand, immediately pulled out a rate sheet when I voiced my displeasure about our room, which was in an unfortunate location and had no view. Despite the availability of better rooms (FS Maui automatically upgraded us to an executive suite), the front desk decided to play Let's Make a Deal and brought out the rate sheet to try to extract more $ for a slightly better room. We did eventually agree to pay more for what they called an Ocean View Suite, but there was hardly any view of the ocean. Whereas every staff member you pass at FS Maui greets you warmly, we were greeted with indifference at every turn at the Ritz. Maid service was laughably inept, with dirty dishes left in the room and no shampoo or soap in one of the bathrooms. Servers and hosts at the restaurants were generally glum, with one hostess greeting us with an extended yawn. The level of warmth and sophistication in the food and service at FS Maui is miles ahead of the Ritz's. Other assorted miscues: The dressing room at the gift shop is an office with no mirror; We ordered the same movie twice and had technical difficulties both times (the charges were removed); Concierges were poorly informed (the timeshare salesperson knew the property better); no water was available from the bell desk upon leaving the property. When we made our reservation, the reservation agent asked the name and age of our son and whether we would need a crib (we did). But on arrival, a crib was nowhere to be found. At the Four Seasons, not only was the crib in place, but so was a free stuffed animal, free bath toys, infant bath supplies, and sponges that spelled out our baby's name. What a difference! While the Four Seasons is not without flaws (the location isn't particularly beautiful), we looked back at our four days there fondly and look forward to returning. We won't be back at the Ritz again and the brand's image has been sullied for me.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: VanesI
Reviews.Content: Loved the Ritz! The property was stunning..clean, modern, and very good service! Loved the little touches by the beautiful pool such as water coolers so you can have a glass of water when needed, sun tan lotion by the towel service if you forget your lotion, pineapple tasting when sitting by the pool, and you can grab as many towels as you want! The location is a little windy but that is great when it is really hot outside! The pool is kept at a great temp so that its never to cold...actually feels like a lukewarm bath! The rooms were spacious and well kept! Enjoyed room service as we really liked the menu it offered. Got a free breakfast which was fantastic as well! Over all had a great time at the Ritz! Will be using their hotels in the near future!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Top Notch Service, Secluded Location, So So Weather"”
Reviews.Author: Arctic-R6
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz to celebrate our 5 year anniversary. We loved the hotel and staff and would highly recommend it. The grounds are gorgeous, the staff very friendly, and the location very secluded and quiet. Kapalua is very upscale and surrounded by golf courses and high end condos. The area is plantation style, with wide open spaces and large trees poised on sloping hills above the many small crescent shaped beaches. It is very different from other Maui areas. If you are going here to hang out full time at the hotel, walk around, sit by the pool or the beach every day in the hopes of roasting in the sun, this is not the place for you. You will be cold and bored. It is more cloudy & windy here and there is little to do (unless you golf). We are very active and love moving about all day, then returning to the quiet calm of the Ritz at night for a peaceful rest on the very comfy beds. We only sat at the beach/hotel here one day, the rest was hiking, snorkeling various beaches, and exploring the island. So this hotel worked well for us. Itâ€™s not fair when some people rate the entire "hotel" poorly based on weather. The hotel is fantastic. We have been to Hawaii in February many times, and you have to accept the fact that the weather this time of year is always changing, everywhere on the island. So, get in your car and drive, find some good weather nearby

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: aimeesan5
Reviews.Content: For our honeymoon, my husband and I wanted to stay somewhere very special. The Ritz Carlton exceeded all our expectations. We stayed in a suite and we were able to make our own breakfast every morning - never went out for breakfast! The staff was amazingly nice, and the food was incredible, no matter where we ate. The extra $20/day was well worth it, so we didn't have to pay for parking, internet, gym, etc. We went to Kapalua Bay for snorkling and did all sorts of amazing things. The fact that the Ritz is on its own beach and property was so nice because you feel like you have the place all to yourself. We went to all the other resort towns and visited many of the hotels and every one of them paled in comparison to the Ritz. We were so thrilled with the hotel, the room, the staff, the service, the spa, the quiet atmosphere, we felt like we had the place all to ourselves. I would go back in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane bay”
Reviews.Author: JohnMinneapolis
Reviews.Content: We had nothing but rain and wind all week. Drive 10 minutes south to Lahaina and the weather was beautiful. I would recommend staying at the Westin unless you are into rain and gale force winds. The Ritz does however offer a $18 2 egg breakfast and a $12.50 pina colada.

Reviews.Title: “stunning hotel”
Reviews.Author: smoothie78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in dec09 for part of our honeymoon. From 22nd Dec to 29th Dec. I spent a stupid amount of time trawling the hotels on Maui for one that id like for our honeymoon as I prefer boutique hotels like on mr & mrs smith website. However I soon realised these doesnâ€™t really exist in Hawaii. I decided on the Ritz Carlton. And it didnâ€™t disappoint. This really is a beautiful hotel. We arrived (about hour taxi ride from airport by the way) after a really rubbish American Airlines flight from LAX. word of warning for everyone its a 5 1/2 hour flight and its really a budget airline its like easyjet which is fine for short trips but it was so cramped on this plane, no food served or drink or anything unless obviously you pay and the trolley is a rare sight!! There no TV apart from those really old ones on the ceiling which showed elf!! Anyway just wanted to let people know Back to the hotel. It really is bliss. We decided to stay in a club room which is more exp but does have this amazing club room you go to. It serves great food all day. Breakfast, lunch, afternoon tea, snacks all day and little canapÃ©s in the evening. It also serves wine, cocktails, spirits, champagne, beer soft drinks anything all for free. So basically we ate in one of the restaurants about twice on the whole trip because this club room is so good. We were having champagne at breakfast, wine at lunch, afternoon cocktails so on and so really got our moneys worth out of it. I highly recommend. Oh also the staff in there are so so friendly. There are also free papers and internet access on x2 computers which was handy the wireless also works on the iphone too. Hotel pools were beautiful; the guys would set you beds up for you. The beach was also amazing although the 15/ 20ft waves on Christmas day were fun until I almost drowned so watch out they are huge down at the beach. The room was massive, big TV, massive bathrooms, big balcony oh and they gave us free chocolates and champagne in our room on arrival. Staff v attentive, friendly. Restaurants great Maui is great island v much recommend. This hotel has to be one of the best we have ever stayed at around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility with Good, but not Great Service”
Reviews.Author: highhandicapper
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review from the balcony of our room as we prepare to pack up and head for home. We are completing a 5-day, 4 night stay. IMPORTANT NOTE - if you are renting a car from the airport, do NOT follow Google Maps' advice to take the highway on the north shore - it is an incredibly windy road that narrows to one lane multiple times (so you constantly have to look out for other cars and pull over to let them through), on which you can only crawl forward at about 15 mph. The twists and turns run along the coast, but go on for about 15 miles - and thus at 15 mph, you are winding back and forth for about an hour. My wife and I were both car sick about halfway through the drive and were just praying we would reach our destination soon. Google sends you on the shortest distance, but trust me, take the other route (the main highway) - you will get there about 20 minutes faster and much happier. LOCATION: As noted by numerous others, Kapalua is on the northwest end of Maui, about 15-20 minutes away from Kaanapali and Lahaina. The little village of Kapalua has a small grocery store and a few restaurants (which are a short walk or a free shuttle ride from the hotel), which provides a bit of diversity from the restaurants in the hotel. ROOM: We found a great deal through American Express Travel, and paid about $430/night for a one-bedroom ocean-view suite (normally about $995/night). The room is fantastic - two full bathrooms (the master bath is enormous), lots of closet and storage space, a very large balcony with a beautiful view of the ocean and a large living room. Big plus is that there are plasma TVs in both rooms and there is actually HD service (as opposed to just stretching out a normal definition picture) - which was great for watching the Winter Olympics (strange dichotomy watching skiing while in Hawaii). SERVICE: Here's where I thought the hotel was lacking a bit. Not that the service was bad - everyone is friendly - but there isn't that crackerjack attention to detail and immediate jumping out of their way to make your stay better in any way possible. We've visited a number of Ritz-Carlton and Four Seasons properties, and this one is a bit more laid back when it comes to service. It isn't the end of the world, but to be honest, a significant amount of kissing up is kind of what we've come to expect when paying the premium for a Ritz-Carlton. FOOD: We dined at the Banyan Tree (very good!), the Pineapple Grill (solid, but not exceptional), Sansei (overrated sushi - tendency toward overpowering flavors), and the Terrace (breakfast buffet, which was average). SPA: I had a respectable hot stone massage. I do highly recommend the steam room - it is infused with eucalyptus, and was remarkably refreshing. I'm not usually a fan of steam rooms, but this one was a great experience. The spa staff was well-trained and friendly. GOLF: I played the Plantation Course. Imaginative course with some spectacular views. Wide fairways - ridiculously quick greens. I was annoyed that they don't allow you to walk the course. FITNESS CENTER - Well appointed, with a variety of cardio machines, free weights and weight machines. For whatever reason, this room isn't kept cool through air conditioning, so it's a bit of a sweat box. Also, there was no attendant stationed in the room - other Ritz properties have had an attendant who walks around passing around water, cold towels, etc. Again, not something you NEED at your gym, but it really is a nice touch. POOL - Large pools were nice, and have a great view of the ocean. The towel attendants don't set you up with a chair - you just grab a towel and claim your own seats. This becomes a hassle when the pool is crowded, because they don't have knowledge on whether someone has left for the day. Other Ritz properties have employees who will find you a location. Also, there are NO UMBRELLAS at the pool, so those who are sensitive to the sun or heat have to hope for the very few seats that are shaded by trees. Drink attendants are friendly, but difficult to track down. Last call for food/drink is at about 4:15PM - which seemed a bit early to us (the pool is open 24 hours). MISCELLANEOUS: $20 per day resort fee - in return, you get free self-parking (valet parking is $18/night) and free wi-fi. OVERALL: It's a great property, with all of the facilities you would want. My one caveat is that the service level is only "fine" and not "amazing".

Reviews.Title: “Good but obnoxious guests”
Reviews.Author: MaydayNG
Reviews.Content: The property was beautiful and quiet, unlike the Westin which is more lively. The service and room was very good. Our only complaint was many of the other guests at this hotel who were pretty rude. You'll have to ignore how other guests try to walk through you (as if you're supposed to press yourself against the wall so then can pass you in a hallway), don't thank you for holding a door or elevator, and give you bizarre looks.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel I've ever stayed at. it's...”
Reviews.Author: posterboy881
Reviews.Content: best hotel I've ever stayed at. it's right on the ocean. there's a huge cascading pool in the courtyard. plenty of places to dine, shop and drink.

Reviews.Title: “what great service!”
Reviews.Author: cdvmanhattanbeach
Reviews.Content: I recently returned from a business meeting at the Ritz Carlton-Kapalua Maui. I've been to Maui on three occasions in the past and have stayed in Kaanapali, Wailea and Napili. However, the Ritz Carlton, by far, was the best experience, and it was directly a result of the wonderful, attentive service of all the employees. It started with the Bell Desk, and continued with the front desk, concierge desk, bartenders, and waiters. Kapalua is somewhat on the off beat path, as it is located on the north western most part of the island, away from the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali and Lahaina. It is a great place for those who are looking for more quiet relaxation, or for those who love to hike (there are numerous hiking trails nearby). It has its own sand beach, a great pool, a golf course (though I don't golf) and a reasonably nice fitness gym. It is great for families. The poolside drinks were great. Another great feature was the concierge desk. They were extremely helpful in making reservations. They arranged beachfront reservations at restaurants and a whale watching cruise (whale watching was spectacular and is a must in the winter months). We went on a two hour cruise, in a small 50 ft motor boat (ideal as it allowed us to be easily mobile). A car rental is essential. There are not a lot of other restaurants nearby, and no

Reviews.Title: “Best Honeymoon Ever”
Reviews.Author: loverottwielers
Reviews.Content: We had such an amazing stay here the winter before the renovation started. Everything we needed was right there on the grounds. The hotel staff and location really made our stay perfect. The staff crossed all the t's and dotted all the i's and then spelled the whole alphebet:) They let us know about local events, places to go- up to what they'd be doing for their liesure time. We got a room that overlooked the ocean and a historical cerimonial plot. The airline lost my luggage:( But the Ritz tracked it down and were very accomidating to my every need concerning my lost luggage. We spent time in the pool, jaccuzi,on our lani,as well as shopping and one of the best beaches the be on in Maui. I couln't have had a better trip. Thankyou to staff members Phillis and Dennis who made our stay feel like we were a part of all the wonders of Kapalua. We were relly close to everything *(but still very private place) The Billabong surfing competition, mercades golf opener, Lahins' wonderful shopping and dining. I love it and will be back:)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous resort!”
Reviews.Author: RoLo822
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at the Ritz! I was a bit worried about the "overcast & rain" that many people have mentioned, but we luckily didn't have any less-than-perfect weather. This resort is beautiful, quiet, and first class all the way. Exactly what I expected from the name. The grounds are perfectly maintained , the fitness center is well-equipped, and the rooms were very comfortable. I got the best massage I have ever had & I also loved the steam room at the spa. There is DT Fleming beach that you can walk to from the pool area down the hillside. It is secluded and not crowded at all. You can also take a longer walk (or the shuttle) to Kapalua Bay for a busier beach & great snorkeling. We did both snorkeling & scuba diving at Kapalua Bay & there were plenty of turtles & other sea creatures to entertain us. We ate at Kai in the hotel, but found Sansei right down the road to be much better for sushi. We had remarkable beach front dinners in Kaanapali & Lahaina at Leilani's & Pacific 'O. Great food at Roy's too, (although there is no view here), and of course, Mama's Fish House in Paia. Mama's has THE best views of anywhere on the island, it is really spectacular! It's a great place to go for lunch rather than dinner, as there isn't a sunset view. We went on our last day in Maui on our way to the airport. We also did some awesome scuba diving with Lahaina Divers & thought they were great. We dove Lanai & had an awesome experience. Also did a Trilogy catamaran scuba trip to Molokini Crater & had a great time. I would also recommend that if you are going to rent a car, use the "name your price" option on priceline.com! I did a low-ball bid of $23/day for a convertible & got that price :) The only thing I didn't love about the Ritz was the layout of the buildings. The resort is built on an angle into the cliff side and is a little confusing to navigate due to the incline. For example, what is the 4th floor on one end of the building is the 1st floor on the other end. Just takes some getting used to, but I'll admit I got lost more than a few times ;) I would certainly stay at the Ritz Kapalua again, it was really spectacular overall. A real gem!

Reviews.Title: “In addition to being a beautiful property and a relaxing vacation, the service was outstanding.”
Reviews.Author: The_Wackys
Reviews.Content: This property has to be one of the more beautiful properties we have stayed at. It is beautifully landscaped and tastefully designed. The staff members went out of their way to make sure our stay was none other than specatular. We enjoyed the private beach lagoon, its tranquil setting and the walk to it. The bartendars and restaurant wait staff tended to our every need. It was the relaxing recharge and reconnect we needed. We look forward to when we can return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, beautiful rooms, great service”
Reviews.Author: laabis
Reviews.Content: I don't know how much I can add to the other reviews. The service was first rate from the time we entered the hotel. Our suite was enormous with two large bedrooms, bathrooms and a lovely sitting room. The bathrooms were completely modern with elegant marble, shampoos and soaps. We had a mini kitchen with coffee maker, toaster, cups, glasses, refrigerators, etc. The furnishings were new and nice. The art was nice but non-descript. The location is beautiful sitting in a large property near the beach. There are lovely views of the ocean and the stretch of beach that the hotel occupies is gorgeous. The swimming pool is lovely and accommodating. I like the Kapalua area. There are numerous restaurants and it is nice being out of busier places like Kaanapali and Lahaina. We ate at the Japanese restaurant in the hotel and loved it. This is a very nice hotel. By the way, the two golf courses are second to none with amazing views.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Oasis”
Reviews.Author: TruthBroker
Reviews.Content: Although I travel frequently, and consult tripadvisor.com when I do, I have never before felt compelled to submit a review of my own until my recent stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. My wife and I celebrated a wedding anniversary with a seven-night stay at this hotel. Simply put, this property is in a league of its own. For other couples weighing their hotel options in Maui, here are some quick observations that I hope you might find helpful: Location: The Ritz Kapulua is located in... you guessed it, Kapalua. For those unfamiliar with Maui, Kapalua is a village located in the northwest side of the island, about ten miles or so from Lahaina - one of the main activity areas in Maui. While Lahaina and the nearby hotel zones (e.g., Kaanapali) are somewhat crowded, Kapalua is decidedly not. It is a very well planned village with lots of open space. The hotel and the nearby private villas are surrounded by three top-notch golf courses and, of course, the ocean. With respect to the latter, there are essentially three distinct areas in the village (and readily accessible from the hotel): (1) a swimming beach located about a quarter-mile from the hotel, (2) a scenic rocky-shore area, and (3) a protected bay perfect for sunbathing and snorkeling. A walking path connects all three areas. I have seen the swimming beach described as small; this seems inaccurate to me. The beach struck me as plenty large and it was never remotely crowded during our stay. The bay area has a concession stand where you can rent snorkeling gear and other equipment, all at a reasonable price. Kapalua also has a number of great restaurants (apart from those in the hotel itself), including an excellence sushi joint (Sansei) and a steak/seafood place with an incredible view (Merriman's). The only downside is that Kapalua is a little removed from the nightlife scene in Lahaina and its surrounding environs. Though the Ritz provides a shuttle to anywhere within the village, the shuttle does not run to points outside of the same. If you plan on imbibing responsibly in Lahaina or elsewhere, plan to take a cab. The Ritz has a private cab service that is reliable though a little expensive (about $70 roundtrip from the hotel to downtown Lahaina). Grounds: Everything you would expect from a Ritz-Carlton. The lobby is open and spacious and has a great ocean view. The pool area is large with plenty of beach chairs. The crew in the pool area is very attentive as well. Rooms: The rooms are big and well-appointed, even by Ritz standards. But take note: the hotel does not sit directly on the ocean, so getting a room with a great view of the ocean will prove somewhat difficult. Food: The Banyan Tree is among the best restaurants on Maui. The pool cafe serves up pretty solid lunch offerings. And the Beach House, located right at the swimming beach, has a great menu with an unbeatable view. The breakfast buffet at the Terrace Room is fantastic. The complimentary breakfast smoothies served to each guest is a nice treat as well. Spa: I have been to a number of Ritz properties and this was the most well-appointed Ritz spa I have seen to date. Great relaxing areas and a wide range of Hawaiian-centric services (along with the basics). Service: Terrific in all respects. The concierge was very helpful in terms of activity planning. Tips: The pool towel service shuts down at around 5:30 pm, though the pool and the hot tubs are accessible 24 hours a day. If you plan on heading down to the pool area in the evening, you might want to grab a few towels during the day. Also, make reservations for the restaurants as soon as you have your plans in order, as the best times fill up quickly. I would highly recommend a sunset dinner at Merriman's. Finally, be sure to plan for a trip to the swimming beach. The Beach House restaurant has fairly limited hours; if you need snacks or drinks when the the Beach House is closed, you'll be in for a rather long, uphill walk to the pool area. And note that you cannot bring the Ritz lounge chairs onto the beach itself. If you strongly prefer a lounge chair while sunbathing, head over to the bay area, where you can rent a chair for the day. All in all, we could not have enjoyed our stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalau more!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: tulsaradman
Reviews.Content: The staff at the Ritz-Carlton were very attentive and helpful. The property is beautiful. The resort amenities are outstanding. Previous reviews indicated that this resort has quite a bit of wind. It was windy one day out of the seven we spent there. This did not detract from the experience and actually the cool breeze was refreshing while swimming at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “The best vacation we ever had. Ritz Carlton, Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: SonnieBoy1
Reviews.Content: My Wife & I Travel extensively for Business & pleasure. Our trip to Maui was the best experience in the 25 years of traveling that we have done. From the time our plane landed on Maui you could feel the excitement in the air & it coutinued our whole trip. The airport & car rental locations were very easy to find & get around in. Our drive from the airport to the Kapalua, Ritz Carlton Hotel was filled with many stops at look out points to watch the Humpback Whales. When we got to the Hotel we were met by a friendly helpful staff. Our suite was beautiful & had great views of the pool & ocean. We could hear the Pacific Ocean waves hitting the beach from our balcony. The Hotel had excellent resturaunts, with each having their own flavor & amboyance. It also had educational programs to teach you about the islands. The program, "Embassadors to the Environment" was very informative. We went on hikes, snorkeling, whale watching & star gazing. Each program started out with a class that was given by a friendly, well trained staff professional. You could tell that person loved their job but especially loved teaching others. We then went to the activity where the staff person coutinued the program with hands-on activities. We always felt safe & learned how, "All things are connected." We went to a presentation called, "Sense of Place." & later that evening went to a show called, "Ulalena", both activities were very moving. Our whole trip was an experience the we will never forget & would highly recommend to anyone. We are back home now & are sharing our experiences with everyone that we come in contact with. That is how much our visit to Maui has touched out lives.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty grounds, very comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: sunflower12
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights as part of an anniversary trip prior to moving down to Wailea and staying at first the Four Seasons and then the Marriott. The best part of the Ritz Carlton are the comfortable rooms. We were upgraded for free to a residential garden suite. It had a separate bedroom, a huge bathroom, a dressing area, and a kitchen living area. Both the bedroom and the living area had lanai/patios with very comfortable seating. The kitchen area had dinnerware and flatware and a large table to eat it which was nice if you just wanted to be indoors. The hotel is very secluded so if you're looking to get away it's a good location. It's a quick drive to Ka'anapali and Lahaina but VERY far from anything else on the island. The breakfast buffet was lousy, after the first day we decided to drive to the Sheraton Maui for their breakfast as we had stayed there a year earlier on our honeymoon and liked it. I wouldn't waste money on the breakfast here. The general store that you pass on the way into the property is fabulous. The name is misleading because it' s more like a small, gourmet grocery store. The food they prepare there is cheaper and much tastier than the Ritz so definitely try it out for breakfast or lunch. The pools at the Ritz were okay, but not fabulous. I would say the Sheraton, the Four Seasons, and the Mariott all had much better pool areas. Pros for the hotel are free self-parking which is not far, free internet access, and a really nice fitness room (unfortunately you have to pay $15 or more for classes at the fitness center such as yoga unlike the Four Seasons which offers classes for free). Overall, a decent stay but we would chose to stay elsewhere on a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully Appointed Room, Grounds & Pool-lacking a little in Hawaiian Aloha”
Reviews.Author: Gregsfinds
Reviews.Content: When we arrived we were upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite-that made our stay! Always clean, great kitchen and sitting area. We have been to Hawaii several times and although this is a beautiful area, we felt like it lacked the Hawaiian Spirit. At some points we didn't "feel" like we were in Hawaii. PROS: Clean Room, Secluded Area, Quiet, Concierge Staff GREAT!, Food at on-site restaurants was pricy but delicious CONS: Pool Attendants were inconsistent (some very friendly others as much), Not on beach-if that is what you are looking for, lack of evening entertainment (not much of a night life) The Kapalua area is special and one of a kind! Loved the Honolou General Store next door and the beauty of this part of the Island. Great restaurants in the area!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: wahoo96
Reviews.Content: Can't really say anything bad about this place. I like it because the decor/feel is not what you'd get from a typical Ritz. The wind was occasionally an issue at the pool, but I suppose I'd prefer that to it being boiling hot! It also had one of the best hotel gyms i've seen personally. The place does encourage kids, so if you're looking to avoid that, that would be the only reason not to book (and even then, its not like the kids are running wild).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Honeymoon Locale”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMurphys
Reviews.Content: Absolutely great hotel and location for honeymooners. We were greeted by welcome staff and given Kukui Nut Leis. We reserved a Garden View Residential Suite and it was amazing. Everything looked new and all the furniture and furniture/materials were high end. There is a large table in the kitchen, a small bar on the side wall where the refrigerator(hideaway, top access) is located and a long counter where the sink microwave and dishwasher are located. The living room has a comfortable couch, two sitting chairs and a big flat screen tv. The living room has a balcony connected to it. The bedroom has a big flat screen tv, ipod alarm clock radios and the king size bed is very comfortable and soft. I have problems sleeping in hotels if the bed isn't comfortable and I fell asleep each night with ease. There is a small hallway leading to the bathroom and closets and has a small dresser for clothes and to set items on top. The bathroom has all marble with a separate toilet area. Service to the room was great; clean up during the day and turn down service at night. Also, anytime I needed anything(kitchen items, towels) they sent someone to our room within a few minutes. The pool has tiered levels and the service there is outstanding. There was always an attendant around for service(drinks, towels, food). The wind actually made the pool more enjoyable since it was hot outside. Beware though, because the wind can make you so comfortable you don't realize you're getting burned. The beach is beautiful, however the wind makes it unbearable to lay out and relax. The wind whips up the sand and blows so hard that it actually stings any part of your bare body. Also, your towel and anything else on the sand will be covered in sand in seconds. The water is great for body surfing. If you want to reserve a cabana with a tv just make sure to do so ahead of time, especially for a Saturday or Sunday. We went during college football season so all the cabanas were reserved before we got to the Ritz. The hotel parking is located right next to the hotel. We self parked almost everyday and made the very short walk to the hotel. We ate at the Banyan Tree once and had a couple small meals at the Alaloa Lounge. The service and food at the Banyan Tree was very good. It was hard to get service at the Alaloa Lounge at night; waitress staff would disappear for several minutes at a time. There were acoustic performers some nights at the Alaloa Lounge . The food and appetizers were okay at the Alaloa Lounge and I believe it was made from The Terrace kitchen. We did not eat dinner at The Terrace, but breakfast was amazing(pricey). The hotel is located in a secluded area, however, Lahaina is a short drive away and has a lot of activites, shopping and dining. I was pleased to learn that Lahaina had a sports bar to watch some college football games. We went to the The Drums of The Pacific Luau. The food was okay, but the fire knife dancer was very cool. The show was fast paced. Our server was great and loaded us up with alcohol. We got a gift certificate for a wedding present to Mama's Fish House and it was THE BEST meal we had our entire stay in Hawaii. Everything is caught and served fresh. They even note on the menu who caught your dinner. I do not recommend making the complete trip past Hana if you have a passenger in the car. The roads are EXTREMELY bumpy and the trip is long. With that being said, I will say that the views are absolutely spectacular and the best on the island. I can't say the same for my wife(passenger). Hamoa Beach located just past Hana is the most beautiful beach I've ever seen. I believe it was listed #5 on Dr. Beach's list this past year. If you are looking for a place to relax with 5 star amenities, then the Ritz is your place. If you are looking for nightlife and a bunch of hotels right next to each other, then look to Ka'anapali.

Reviews.Title: “8 days in heaven!”
Reviews.Author: SG425
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua for our honeymoon in November 2009. Everything about our stay was wonderful--the accommodations, the food, and the service. We had reserved a Club Level room for our stay but were told about a month prior that the Club Level would be closed; were instead compensated with a suite and a daily resort credit. The popular Banyan Tree restaurant was closed for renovation during our stay, but the Terrace restaurant was a wonderful substitute. Breakfast every day was delicious, albeit pricey. We ate at the Ritz-Carlton's sushi restaurant Kai--but actually preferred its sister restaurant, Sansei, located on the resort grounds, as it was delicious as well as reasonably priced. We enjoyed a great lunch at The Beach House restaurant with a wonderful view of the beach and ocean. Our room was beautiful and the service excellent. We enjoyed a wonderful couple's massage at the Waiha spa--it was worth every penny! We enjoyed the pools, the bar, the beach--everything about our stay was wonderful. We loved that the pools and hot tubs were open late as well. The only complaint I have was one day when it was raining, there were really no options at the hotel for lunch, as the only lunch options are the pool cafe or the Beach House restaurant, which are both only accessible outdoors. The hotel bar was overwhelmed trying to accommodate hungry guests and service was slow and confused. Service at the bar was also not as friendly and accommodating on other occasions as it could have been. Otherwise, everything was wonderful. The Ritz-Carlton is the perfect honeymoon spot as it is in a secluded area with a private beach--far away from the "resort strips" that populate the other main areas of Maui, which are filled with families and kids. You will need a car to venture south to shopping and other desired areas, but the Ritz-Carlton does provide free parking just a short walk away. The beach is about a 5-minute walk from the hotel and is much smaller than in other resort areas, however it is only accessible through the Ritz-Carlton so it's as private as you will find in Maui. We hope to return to Maui one day and if we do, we will only stay at the Ritz-Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pkhanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our last week on Maui after spending the first few days at the Four Seasons Waleia (see my review). We stayed here with our 3 young children (ages 10, 8,4). Overall its a completely different experience than Wailea. In Kapulua, there is a lot of wind, but no less sunshine. So if you like it hot, stay in Wailea. if you like it breezy, Kapulua is a great bet. The Ritz is a beautiful hotel. The rooms were beautiful and had nice hawaiian accents. I ended up getting two adjoining rooms, one for our kids. The staff was very courteous and helpful, the grounds impeccable, and overall, just a very pleasant hotel We were in off season and had a great deal. The golf also was dicounted for Ritz guests and was spectatcular. My 8year son had a golf experience he'll never forget. The beach was nice but water is rough.The pool was nice, not great. Because of the wind, there are no umbrellas so that was unfortunate, but I got a decent tan. The kids activity center is lacking (compared to the Four Seasons over the top Kids center), but my kids were busy doing everything else. I was skeptical about the Ritz's pricey Jacques Cousteau discovery centery, but my daughter liked it. I still think its a huge waste of space for the hotel and they could do so much more exciting things with it. Food was very good (ate at the hotel sushi restaurant) and breakfast was typical fare (but good). I also did the spa/facial thing on my last day and thought it was very nice (brand new spa). My wife really liked it too. Overall, awesome hotel, great golf, beautiful views, my kids loved it, the history of the hotel/grounds - plus the little general store just off property - made this place intriguing and special. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: khalsa13
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, room was spacious and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Tropical Dreamtime”
Reviews.Author: oregonguy1954
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua in the late fall of 2009. It was simply the best vacation we have ever had. The island of Maui amazingly fun. While seemingly infinite opportunities are available for visitors, the island retains vast undeveloped, wild areas. The Ritz is located close to Lahaina where shopping, dining, nightlife and outdoor recreational activities abound. Kapalua is about ten miles north of Lahaina and a bit cooler, much less crowded, and more off the beaten track.
