We took many of our meals at the resort, and without exception, every item was prepared and served perfectly. The view from our lanai was of the multi-level, palm shaded, cascading pool with private cabanas. Beyond the pool, undeveloped land, sacred to the ancient Hawaiians, stretched to a rocky shore washed by the Pacific Ocean swell. A sandy beach, famous golf course, a peek of the world class surf of Honolua Bay, and the island of Molokai rounded out the view. The staff of the hotel always greeted us with a smile and â€œalohaâ€�. Their genuine concern for and attention to our needs made our stay a perfect Hawaiian vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Our new favorite place to stay on Maui!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sdnwildcat
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua! Six years ago, we stayed at the Four Seasons when visiting Maui. We had such a great experience at that hotel we decided to stay there again. To mix things up, though, we started our trip out with two nights at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. It was off season, so we got a really good rate. My husband asked for an upgrade (it never hurts to ask, right?), as it was an anniversary trip-- and we were generously accommodated with a beautiful two room suite: Hard wood floors; kitchen; two balconies; great flat screen televisions (yes, there was more than one!); amazingly comfy king bed; nice shower, etc. All this at no extra cost, PLUS we also received complimentary daily breakfast and a daily $130 resort credit (which could be used for anything on site, including valet parking or those dreaded resort fees). Oh yes-- and we received two complimentary appetizers at dinner our first night in honor of our anniversary...... In short, the value at this unbelievably beautiful hotel was fabulous! And it is a beautiful hotel, located on a private cliffside area of the island. The grounds are impeccable; the pool is very nice, and everything was decorated so beautifully for an island Christmas. Other positives: The service was wonderful! Everyone was so friendly and accommodating, and every effort was made to make us feel at home. The food was also delicious. I cannot say enough about the breakfast buffet-- fresh omelets and waffles, delicious bacon, fabulous pastries and fresh fruit-- and they made a point of stressing that if there was anything else they could make us in the kitchen, then that would be considered part of the buffet. Indeed, we saw one gentlemen happily dining on fresh fish for breakfast. How much did we enjoy the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua? After two days at the Ritz-Carlton, we were scheduled to finish our trip at the Four Seasons, but after several days there, my husband and I decided to spend our last days on Maui back at the Ritz-Carlton. Not only did they welcome us back with the same package (and complimentary appetizers) we enjoyed before, but we got upgraded to a suite again-- this time with an ocean view!!!! I hope that we will someday make it back to Maui. And I know that when we do, we will be spending our time at the Ritz-Carlton!

Reviews.Title: “Would love to live here!”
Reviews.Author: Ernie_Raffles
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in December. We were upgraded to a suite and we were very happy with our stay. The hotel is beautiful and the staff were exceptional. A round of golf at Kapalua is pricey but well worth the experience. Dinner at the Banyan tree is great but the real hidden gem is the Pineapple Grill at the Bay Course. This restaurant has a great atmosphere and wonderful food. The rooms are very spacious and well appointed. There's a resort fee for around 20 bucks but that includes parking and hi speed wireless internet. Kapalua is a little more remote than the rest of Maui. If you're looking for a quiet, relaxing resort, than this is the place. Truly 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Out of the Way But Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: BlueSpinnaker
Reviews.Content: We flew out to Maui for a scuba diving vacation and chose the Ritz Carlton based on stays at their other properties. We were not disappointed with this hotel. The Ritz Carlton is located in Kapalua, in the north/northwest part of the island. The drive into the hotel from the main road, at night, is beautiful. Cook pines, tall and straight (whose trunks were used for sailing ship masts in the past, which we were later told) line the driveway and are lit up from below making for an . The architecture of the hotel itself is quite nice too, understated and elegant with a tropical feel. The chirping tree frogs, whose evening calls you will become familiar with during your stay, add to that tropical ambiance. Self-parking is free but the lot is a walk to the hotel so we opted to valet the car at a charge of $18/day. The valets were great - they became familiar with my name and car and were always upbeat and pleasant and quick to take or deliver your car. The common areas of the hotel are very nicely decorated. There is a feeling of quality in the furnishings and the the areas are kept up quite well. A huge balcony off the lobby overlooks a reflection pool below as well as the ocean in the background. We enjoyed the excellent view with drinks from the lobby bar as our bags were sent on to the room. It was a long day - a 12 hour flight to Oahu, a connecting flight to Maui, then a 45 minute drive to Kapalua, and those drinks were really needed to help us unwind. We opted for a mountain-view room, which was less expensive than an ocean view room, but were pleasantly surprised that we were able to see both the ocean and the island of Molokai from our lanai. (BTW, be sure to check the Ritz website for promotions and, if you have a AAA membership, ask about those rates since the savings can be substantial, more than enough to cover the cost of a 1-year AAA membership. Besides, you can use the AAA card to get discounts on your car rental (we got a Jeep Wrangler from Hertz at a nice discount) and for many attractions in Hawaii (Blue Hawaiian Helicopter tours, etc, and elsewhere). Our rate was a buy 4 get the 5th night free. The room itself was slightly above average in size (440 sq ft - think of a room that is 21x21) with a walk-in marble & stone bathroom that had 2 sinks, a tub, a shower stall, and a separate toilet enclosure. The decor is definitely tasteful Hawaiian in nature and featured wood floors throughout the room, quite a difference from the fully carpeted rooms that you normally find in hotels. We had a king bed that had a large, pillowy comforter with a mattress that was firm and comfortable - there were no divots in the mattress as is common in hotels that haven't updated in some time. I believe the Ritz underwent a full renovation fairly recently so you will be hard pressed to find old or out-of-date accessories to mar your stay there. The grounds at the Ritz are huge. The "area" itself is shared space, there are rental and owner-occupied villas further down from the hotel (the Kapalua Villas) as well as a small shopping center and private residences. The actual grounds of the hotel are well kept - lush plantings provide the desired tropical atmosphere, and towards the beach you will find an ancient Hawaiian burial ground. This area is sacred and are restricted from pedestrian traffic - a bit eerie but interesting in that the hotel made it a point to preserve these spaces as they built the hotel complex around it. It is a downhill walk to the beach area - not a short distance, to a beach that is fickle. The weather here is WINDY, very windy, it seemed to be windy/breezy almost all of the time we were there. As a result it is hit or miss regarding a suitable and safe day to enjoy the beach since the surf and undertows can be an issue. I have seen pictures where the surf is calm; perhaps it was the season we visited that contributed to the rough conditions. The north shore apparently experiences much more wind than the rest of the leeward part of the island (something about the eastern winds wrapping around a volcanic peak and hitting Kapalua) so it is just part of what to expect from the area. We didn't get to go in the water during our visit but the view is beautiful, and there is a restaurant (the Beach House) right down there that serves a great lunch menu and has an unbeatable view of the beach. Take the hotel's golf cart shuttle back up to the hotel as the walk uphill on a full stomach is not an easy one! As I mentioned, this area is windy and so your hair will be all over the place and the swimming may be affected. However, it certainly kept the mosquitoes away. A negative aspect of this hotel, while not against the property itself, is the location. It is at least a 30 minute drive to the main attractions that Maui has to offer - the luaus, the shopping in Lahaina, and much to my disappointment, a very long drive at 4:30AM to Wailea where we had to catch our boat for the ride out to the dive site at Molokini. We had dinner in Laihaina almost every night (we did eat one night at the hotel's signature restaurant, the Banyan Tree - good service, great food (the seafood dishes are excellent - very fresh), great view, very expensive though) and the drive back to the hotel, after a big meal, suffering from the jet lag/6-hour time difference, made for a tiresome ride back each and every night. I sometimes envied the people who were staying at the hotels in Lahaina - calm beaches, walking distance to everything, but in the end, if you can work through the drive back, you'll appreciate the seclusion and elegance of the Ritz. If you are a golfer you will love the courses that the Ritz has access to. I played the Plantation course where they play the PGA tour championship every year (Mercedes Championship I believe). It winds through the sides of an extinct volcano, has forced carries over gullies hundreds of feet deep, and offers a spectacular view of the ocean from many different holes. It's a challenging course but one that you will never forget. The pro shop is very helpful and can arrange for rental clubs (I didn't haul mine there for just one round) and anything else that you may need for an enjoyable round of play. In summary the Ritz Carlton Kapalua is an excellent hotel/resort that is deserving of its 5-star AAA rating. The people who work there are friendly and helpful, the common areas and room were very tastefully decorated, the upkeep of the entire hotel and grounds were excellent, and the atmosphere cannot be beat. Overlook the windy conditions and the distance from the major attractions of Maui and you'll be happy you chose the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome all around”
Reviews.Author: glory4
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to Maui for the 2nd part of our Hawaiian adventure. We stayed at the RC for four nights and did not have one complaint! The location is amazing, away from the crowds and fast food restaurnts yet, close enough to drive there in 10 minutes. We stayed on the pool level, facing the golf course and enjoyed our location immensely. The pool here is beautiful and pool service was top-notch. We ordered drinks from our attendant and they were always brought cold and promptly. The beach here is not a bad walk away! Yes, it is a five minute paved walk from the pool area, but when the winds picked up in the afternon we were grateful. Because, when it was windy on the beach, it was still at the pool. We ate breakfast every day at The General store and loved it! It was nice to be able to have a simple and easy breakfast that didn't break the bank. We ate dinner at Sansei one evening and recommend it highly! Just make sure to have reservations. We also ate at The Terrace one evening and were upset that we hadn't spent more meals there! Our server, a lovely Italian gentleman, really went above and beyond. The only mediocre meal we had was OFF the resort at Merriman's. We would not suggest dining there! Overall, it was the PERFECT trip. We had no rain, light breezes and quiet nights. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Yes, people.”
Reviews.Author: lizinrome
Reviews.Content: If you check the website frequently, you can get some really great packages. The package we booked (the Reconnect package) includuded a large resort package, and a marvelous buffet breakfast for two, making it about the same price as the other area hotels that are... not the Ritz. You get: private beaches, a great pool with a view, golf course, concierge who is beyond helpful, many dining options, lovely room, and employees everywhere telling you Aloha. Love, love, love.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the Ritz Maui”
Reviews.Author: Jonvilliers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Kapalua (Maui) for our 25th wedding anniversary with our children and our oldest daughter's husband. We stayed on the club level, which was well worth the upgrade price. However, note that paying for the ocean view is not really worth the price, at least not on the club level--our daughter and son-in-law had the club level without ocean view and had a comparable ocean view to ours (both sides have a partial ocean view). The hotel service was impeccable, everything we would expect from Ritz and the grounds were immaculate. Interesting that very few people wandered past the pool to the beach area (DT Fleming is an outstanding beach), which was another highlight. We self parked, which worked out fine for us. We had our 25th wedding anniversary dinner with family and friends at the resort and it worked out wonderfully. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Mega-resort atmosphere rather than Ritz experience”
Reviews.Author: biskopen
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Ritz on Maui. Stayed there for 5 nights in a ocean view room on the bottom floor. Great to drink coffee and read the paper while listening to the winter waves crashing. Food was good overall, at the Beach House, in the upscale Banyan Tree, in the Terrace and even the lobby bar, and the Sushi restaurant was exceptional. The grounds are fabulous, and were during low occupancy levels great. Service and welcome was not what you would expect from the Ritz. This was the 11th Ritz location we stayed at, and it landed firmly on the 10th place on the Ritz list. The hotel had the feeling of an older Marriott resort, big and impersonal. The bed was horrible, I would have thrown out the sagging mattress years ago. The tub was stained, rusty and dirty, so we had to forgo the in-room soak for the jacuzzi by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here... It's Beautiful!!!”
Reviews.Author: luxetravels
Reviews.Content: We came across the Ritz Carlton by default. We originally booked our stay down the road in Napili Bay. We lasted 1 night there as it is more for the 80+ year olds. We searched a few hotels, The Westin (which we love as a hotel) and The Sheraton. The reason for not staying at these hoels is that we wanted to be away from Kaanapali and the amounts of people. We drove into the Ritz... walked in and that was it! We stayed for 3 nights. I must say, whoever did the interiors and fitout of this hotel has done the most amazing job. Besides that, we found the service exceptional. The people very friendly. and the Japanese restaurant/bar is the best I have ever had. One thing we miss.. is the Honolua Store, up the road from the hotel. We had breaky there every morning. It was great!! The Ritz is a must... it's pricey, but it sure is worth every cent. I understand the reviews about it not being Ritz Carlton quality. But lets get real... It's not Paris.. It's Hawaii. It's going to be different.. but in a good way!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously fantastic...and oh SO FRIENDLY.”
Reviews.Author: BUNNYBOYFLOHIO
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed for 6 nights and 7days... From the minute we arrived, the friendliness of the valets, reception clerks, concierge(s), food service people,housekeeping staff, spa staff, shop staff.....everyone connected was superb! This was what we had expected the Ritz Carlton to be, and it surpassed our expectations. We have stayed in others, and this hotel exceeded all others....yes the location is somewhat isolated, but we loved that. It is windy in November with regular rain showers and kind of puts a damper on the pool but 10miles away in Lahaina--bright sunshine... We definitely plan to stay here again next year, it was fabulous...

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at the Ritz...”
Reviews.Author: jayliu
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 5 fabulous nights at the Ritz. We got a great package from a travel agency which includes the breakfast packages highly recommened, if not, it's $71 including gratitute and tax. Pro: excellent concierage service, they were able to book us based on our requirements. Very knowledgable about the activities available on Maui. At the time of check in, the front desk staff is very friendly and enthustic. The water in the poor feels warmer than it looks, it's very comfortable for this time of the year. Also there two hot spa pools at either side of the pool. Very few people are using it. Business center: provides FREE boarding pass printing, highly recommened! Staff : are all very friendly and attentive. Breakfast buffet: the frenchtoast bread pudding is awesome. Too bad we only had it once during our stay. The valet Clint is very friendly and knowledgable about direction , make sure you ask him for beach towels. Room: the residential suite is large, with a living room/breakfast area, and a seperate bedroom. Very nicely decorated in Ritz fashion. Pool: It does have a beautiful three tiers pool, it's not extravegant. If you are looking for something spetaculr, go else where. Cons: Location: if you are first time in Maui, you probably will not want to stay here, unless you want to stay near or close to the hotel. It was our first time in Maui, so we like to explorer the island, and each time we have to drive 45 min from the Hotel to the airport area and on to other attractions. i.e. road to hana, sun rise on the mountain ( room of the sun) it gets tiring very soon, unless you enjoy the driving the same road over and over again. However the drive is nice, and scenic (during the day) There are very little street lights on Maui. Signs are also very minimal (local laws) Other thoughts: It is windy, but not cold. We enjoy a cool breeze from our lannai. The Breakfast area sometimes will have fruit bugs buzzing over the fruits, so it can be improve upon. Breakfast buffet changes daily, however, only about two dishes changes, all others remain the same. Breakfast buffest can have more Asian dishes, currently only have Miso soup, and Steam White Rice (which are very good) and some vegetabe dishes availble. Hardly enough. Overall, we truly enjoyed our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: khass2
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is all that I expected and more. The accommodations were spectacular and the service was fantastic. The spa was decadent. i look forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: mecclest
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ritz Kapalua for 4 nights in July (after 3 nights at the Paia Inn - see separate review). We loved it, but I can see why some reviewers haven't been so keen. Here are my pros and cons: Pros: -Location: Kapalua is a beautiful, quiet, scenic resort community. It has a few great restaurants, and lots of beautiful nature trails. Merriman's is the Hawaiian restaurant of your dreams. Stunning oceanfront location, airy and tasteful decor, and delicious, locally sourced food. Sansei had great sushi and a fun vibe. The ocean trail that starts right next to the Ritz is really something - we spotted sea turtles and a seal in the water, and a family we met said that they always see whales during the winter. -Hotel: I really liked the decor - dark woods gave it a very classy feel. We had a standard room facing one side of the pool - it was large, comfortable, and spotless. The tiered pool is beautiful, and there are also a couple of jaccuzzis. The fitness center is very nice - I never made it to an exercise class, but they had quite a few (for a fee). We did self-park - only a couple of minutes walking. We also had the breakfast buffet every day (bc of Amex Platinum) - it was delicious and extensive. -Go to the "And Then There Were None" special presentation!!! It's a short lecture and film presentation (~1.5 hours total) by a wonderful woman who teaches at a local school. It's all about Hawaiian history - I learned so much, it was really a highlight of our vacation. The hotel doesn't advertise it much, but you can find out when it is on their website or by asking the concierge. Why did I love it so much? Because I got the distinct sense from our first few days in Maui that the locals weren't happy about the tourists - one of the first things I noticed was how many "keep off - private property!" and more aggressive signs there are when you're driving around. This presentation helps you see where that hostility is coming from - the grandeur and tragedy of the Hawaiian people's history. Back to the hotel! Cons: -Hotel: it is a little worn around the edges - for example, the elevators are really dark, and the wood in them is chipped. Kind of creepy. -Beach: there aren't any hotel loungers right on the sand - they're up on a little grassy hill instead. The beach itself is pretty nice, but with the wind it's not very comfortable to be on a blanket (sand in the eyes, etc) -Service: the pool and beachside servers were pretty indifferent, the breakfast buffet waitstaff varied in their quality daily, but everyone we spoke to at the front desk, concierge, and valet were really friendly and helpful. -Location: if you want hot-and-sunny, Kapalua is probably not the right choice for you. It's windier and more tempestuous than the southern coast of Maui. But it's gorgeous. So if you can get a good deal, I'd definitely go for it. We loved it. I'm happy to answer qustions about the hotel, or about Maui activities - diving, golfing, Haleakala, the Road to Hana - we did it all!

Reviews.Title: “A little paradise”
Reviews.Author: tifa2276
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Kapalua was where we spent the latter half of our week long stay in Maui to celebrate our anniversary. We wanted to immerse ourselves in total relaxation after jetting around Maui and doing a bunch of activities while staying in Kihei the first half of the week. It was wonderful and luxurious without being too over the top. A top notch Maui resort! The Ritz Carlton is located in the Kapalua resort complex which is an area north of Ka'anapali and houses luxury hotels & condos, golf courses, and restaurants. The grounds around the whole complex are beautifully maintained and lush. The ritz Carlton is one of the first complexes you see when you turn in on Office Rd into the Kapalua resort. We had booked our room through Amex Platinum to take advantage of a special room rate, which included an upgrade, breakfast buffet each day, and a 100 USD resort credit. Upon arrival, we were given necklaces made of polished kukui nuts, which are black and shiny. I liked them so much more than fresh flower leis as a) these last! and b) flower leis make me itch. Check-in was a breeze. They upgraded us from a standard king room to a pool view king room, and they gave us a coupon for free appetizers at their lounge for happy hour to celebrate our anniversary. Sadly we did not use these as were weren't really around during happy hour. The funny thing about this hotel is that the Lobby is located on the 6th floor since it's set against a cliff, and there are guest rooms on the floors above and below, so even though we were staying on the 5th floor, we would have to press the down arrow for the elevator. It could get confusing but you figure it out pretty quickly. The gym is on the lobby level, and the spa is on the 4th floor. The pools and ground/beach access is via the 1st floor, although you can technically walk down the stairs from the spa to the pool area pretty quickly. Our room, 2517, was nicely appointed, about slightly larger than a standard king hotel room, and it had hardwood floors which I loved. The bathroom is huge and has a soaking tub, separate toilet and shower stall. The shower was small though. The hotel recently underwent a renovation so you can tell that things were nice and new although the building itself is old. The renovationed decor was very modern but still kept a Hawaiian/Polynesian vibe to it, especially in the artwork used throughout the hotel and rooms. The room came with an empty fridge which was great, flat screen tv, dvd player, 2 robes, coffee maker, and regular toiletries you'd expect from a 5-star hotel. (they were all ritz carlton brand and smelled kinda like a spiced latte, I didn't care for it too much but we brought our own stuff anyways). The pool is nice and large, with 3 "levels", a kiddie pool, and 2 jacuzzis. The only drawback is that the main towel kiosk is located on one side of the pool and you'd have to walk around the 3 levels just to get to it if you happened to be on the opposite side. Sometimes they would leave clean towels on an empty stall on the other side but I only saw it in the mornings. There are covered cabanas you can rent for the day (not sure how much it was), and spa cabanas also line the pool area in case you'd like an outdoor massage. There was never any problem finding pool chairs at all. The beach at the Ritz is great for surfing and boogie boarding, the waves are very large. If you are not a good swimmer, I woudl think it's kind of scary. It was definitely not a "snorkeling" beach. It makes for great pictures though! If you walk down past the pool and swing left through the golf course, and go towards the water, you will find an area known as "Dragon's Teeth". It's a bunch of jagged lava rock formations that you can take a short hike on and the waves from the ocean create these neat, but very large splashes on these rocks. I am not sure what the specific geological name for these are, but it was a lot of fun seeing how large and how high each wave was going to be. I recommend walking in something sturdier than flipflops since the rocks can be jagged and slippery, but it was pretty cool. Nopt for the faint of heart though. If you like tame tame water, I recommend driving down to Black Rock in Ka'anapali in front of the Sheraton, as there are a ton of fish, sea turtles, etc over there. However there are a lot of tourists snorkeling so it can get annoying. The areas at the Ritz Carlton were never crowded. Breakfast buffet was good each day. Had a nice selection of stuff, and you can order eggs benedict or coconut mac nut pancakes to order. There was an omelet station, breads, cereals, fresh pastries, hot food stations that changed daily, and cheese, fruit, juice, etc. The hot foods would include portugese sausage, eggs, bacon, biscuits, and they would change it up each day. The papaya there was sooo good! Eat it with a twist of fresh lime! We didn't try other restaurants in the hotel, but we did drive a bit further down the road in the Kapalua resort to go to Merriman's, which is a restaurant by the water, food was very very good, although service was a little slow, but we didnt' mind. However, they thought it was too slow so they took the 2 entrees off our bill! that was 100 bucks off! It was super nice of them, and we were not expecting it at all. I highly recommened Merriman's! I went to the Wailua spa for a facial and massage since we had the 100 dollar credit. It was wonderful. They use eminence products which are divine and smell amazing. It's expensive, but the credit made it worth the money. If I didn't have a credit I might have just gotten 1 treatment. I got the berries and cheeries facial and the stuff smells sooo good. I have to buy me some of their products! The spa changing room has all the ameneties you need. They have an all-female steam, sauna and jacuzzi. There is also a shared jacuzzi in the waiting area but you need your bathing suit for that. Overall, an amazing stay at the Ritz. Service was amazing but not in your face. The only thing is that it's a bit secluded and far from other areas but I think people go there for that reason. It's only about 20 minutes from Lahaina though so we went there for dinner twice. It is pretty far from Haleakala Crater and Hana so if you plan on doing those sights, you might want to stay closer to Kihei or Paia for a few nights and then a few nights on West Maui, which is what we did. I'm glad we did this as we could just spend the few days we had in Kapalua relaxing! p.s. the Honolua Store across the street sells cheap breakfasts, tasty plate lunches, picnic supplies, groceries, and other sundries in case you wanted something lo-key and casual and not $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel shame about the beds”
Reviews.Author: EmmCeeAustralia
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights at The Ritz. Wonderful location. We had an Ocean View room and it was right at the end of the hotel which meant a lot of walking but it was no problem. Our only issue were the beds - They are suppose to be comfortable, but not for us, I ended up sleeping on the day bed as it was harder. The beds are far too soft and we both had sore backs. We also both ended up with a mysterious rash the day after we arrived and it is slowly leaving now that we have left. The Banyan Tree Restaurant was closed for reservations which we were disappointed about and limited a little our choices at the higher end. The 5 day unlimited golf deal for $399 is great value. I really don't agree with the resort fee as you don't get anything for it. Although they do offer free self parking so we considered the charge for the parking.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, service was incredible”
Reviews.Author: Cmbecker
Reviews.Content: From the valet service, front desk, sales and concierge desks, dining ... all services received were excellent. But I have to say what actually amazed and SOLD us on the property was the exploring with Jean-Michel Cousteauâ€™s Ambassadors of the Environment program. This had to be the best day in Maui. Traveling with an 18 year old niece who is fixed to her cell phone and FACEBOOK ... this exploration was awesome. The team involved ... hats off! The price may seem steep this year BUT to experience and enjoy the waters ... "just do it". Shuttle to the bay, wet suits, snorkels and the digital camera included. Lunch when you get back and then a CD of gorgeous fish, family and music delivered to your room ... well it is definitely one of the highlights that will always be experienced over and over each time visiting Maui. Only wish that more resorts shared the excellent staff of Ritz ... until we meet again ... Kudos and thank you so much for making my niece's graduation trip memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!”
Reviews.Author: luvtravel36
Reviews.Content: From the moment we checked in, we had an awesome experience at the Ritz Carlton in Maui. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The concierge were able to make some great recommendations. The hotel has beautiful views of the ocean. You can even walk down to the beach. In the afternoon, they even served fresh pineapple at the pool. The only negative was that the hotel was a bit out of the way. It was a decent drive to go anywhere off premises. Other than that, the hotel was awesome, and we would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing honeymoon at the best resort on the island.”
Reviews.Author: dmbRJR
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got through with a 7 night stay in Maui and absolutely loved this resort. Prior to our trip, we were going back and forth between the Ritz, Four Seasons, and the Fairmont. We decided to settle on the Ritz since they were offering us "Club Level" access to their lounge for free drinks, snacks, etc throughout our trip. A few weeks before we left, the Ritz notified us that they were eliminating the club level since the resort goes through a slow period during the months of October and November. This almost caused us to change hotels but the Ritz came through by upgrading us to a 900 SF room with a kitchen (refrigerator, garbage disposal, microwave, sink, dishwasher), family room (Plasma tvs with DVD players), two balconies, full bedroom and bathroom (shower, tub, and seperate toilet). They also reduced our hotel rate by $1,500 and gave us a $500 resort credit. The hotel is located in Kapalua which is roughly 20 minutes away from Lahaina (main downtown area), 15 minutes from Ka'anapali (shopping, restaurants, hotels), and an hour from the Wailea and airport area. The location is somewhat a plus and a minus. You are nice and close to Lahaina and Ka'anapali which is where we spent a majority of our time. However, it is really far from Wailea (we never even made it there) and ways from the start of the road to Hana, Haleakala National Park, and airport. We had a car and managed to get place to place with no problem. What the hotel lacks in location, they pick up in being a beautiful secluded resort. The resort is absolutely huge! You enter by driving in through a private drive to the hotel and pass by their exclusive golf academy/training center, and one of their golf courses. The hotel is extremely clean and very modern. The hotel staff is great and the pool and restaurants are amazing. After reading the reviews, it appears most people complain about two things: the cost of Maui and the location of the beach at the Ritz. To be honest, my wife and I did not find Maui to be all that unreasonable. If you are from a major city (NYC, Chicago, LA) you will find the resort and dinner prices to be similar to a nice evening in the city. We stopped at a store and packed our room with some snacks, beer, and wine and that saved us a few bucks. You can also use the "Corner Store" which is located on the grounds to pick up some items. The store has a full grocery area, coffee bar and snack shop. The prices were the most reasonable of anything we encountered. As for the beach, it is set away from the pool and a short walk down a hill. However, once you arrive it is essentially private and remote from everything. It's not crowded and is almost like your own private beach. Overall, we loved the Ritz and would stay again. On a return visit we might visit Wailea since we never visited that area of the island and it is home to some nice resorts. As for Maui, the food is unbelievable on the entire island. We are from Chicago and were blown away by how good everything was. We loved the burgers, fish, and fresh vegetables. Must stops are as follows: - Mama's Fish House - Lahaina Grill ... and some other good places we hit included: - Basil Tomato - Hula Grill As for activities, the road to Hana is not as great as we envisioned. It's essentially a long drive on winding roads with some stops along the way. I highly suggest renting a Jeep Wrangler. Not the type of trip you want to do in a Mustang or rag top. We enjoyed the ride down the Volcano, surf lessons in Ka'anapali (I suggest a private lesson), and the Old Lahaina Luau. I didn't get to play any golf due to two stress fractures in my foot. P.S. If you choose to do the sunrise Volcano bike road I highly suggest bringing ample clothes to watch the sun come up. It was like a Chicago winter on top of the mountain. It was 40 degrees with a 40 MPH wind. It was freezing!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Nicest Hotel I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Would_Rather_Be_Home
Reviews.Content: I am pretty picky about hotels. The was the nicest hotel I have ever stayed in. We went there on our Honeymoon last May 2009. From the moment we arrived to the time we left we were waited on hand and foot. The pools were awesome and the beach was spectacular. Every morning we had the beach to ourselves. I would loved to stay there again. I hope I can splurge like that again someday. My only real complaint was the prices of drinks and food there at the hotel. Just two drinks were $35. I would suggest if you are on a budget going down to the Honolua Bay general store and stocking up on snacks and groceries. Breakfast for the two of us there in the hotel was about $65 a morning. Granted to can have just about anything your hearts desire for breakfast, but the general store made a mighty fine breakfast for us regular humans and it was under $10 ea. I highly recommend the pineapple hamburger. Dinner at their restaurant is a min $200 per person. We did that the last night we were there. I was a nice experience. The other thing could be a plus or minus for people. It is set on the outskirts. It's about 10-15min to the restaurant area of town. There is no, "I am going to grab something and come back" kind of thing.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort, beautiful grounds”
Reviews.Author: mmsull2
Reviews.Content: We visited the Ritz in Kapalua for our honeymoon and couldn't have been happier. In typical Ritz style, the service was nothing but exceptional. Our room was spectacular, a huge suite with a great view of the ocean. Kapalua is beautiful - I've spent quite a bit of time on Maui and I love the seclusion of the area. You really feel like you are getting away from it all here. Plus, the views are incredible. The times we've been there, we've lucked out with weather, but I know at times it can be rainy. The pool area is great - since it is tiered, it feels more private, like you get more space to yourself. The atmosphere is calm and relaxing. The beach is a short walk down from the hotel (there is a shuttle, but who doesn't enjoy a little stroll in Maui?), and it is a great beach. Compared to hotels in Kaanapali, the beach is fantastic. It is a big white sand beach, and the water is gorgeous. It feels much more private compared to the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali, so it depends on what you're looking for. Overall, we love the Ritz in Maui and we will return again and again (as a matter of fact, we already have another trip planned. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous in every way!”
Reviews.Author: jsmile70
Reviews.Content: It was our first trip to Maui so we really had no idea where we wanted to stay. Luckily we came across a really good package deal (airfare + hotel + rental car) that placed us in the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. The hotel was simply breathtaking. From the Aloha welcome (with Kukui nut necklaces!) to the efficient service we received from everyone throughout the hotel, I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone looking to visit Maui and wants a place that's not too crowded.

Reviews.Title: “Just booked another vacation at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: Missika
Reviews.Content: This will be our 5th visit to this wonderful property, it is our favorite hotel in all the islands. Location- Kapalua is unmatched, and the beach is spectacular Hotel- Beautiful, on par with other RC properties Service- Very Good, maybe a tad 'relaxed'' but you are in Hawaii Pool area- Very nice Rooms- Spectaular after the renovation. I love the new floors Shuttle- Great for visiting local restaurants Dining- Excellent but pricey Possible drawbacks - Steep walk down to the beach -as another reviewer said, I too noticed a crowd with their own 12 pack (of like Old Milwaukee?) at the pool. Personally, I think that crosses the line. That needs to be kept at their room. However that was the exception, and it happened once the last trip. -The main restaraunt no longer is open air. This was the only let down from the renovation -I miss the complimentary lobby coffee. Now you must make your own in your room, or wait at the bar for coffee to be made Tips- Plantation House for breakfast Sansei early bird and late night specials Take advantage of resort activities if you have children Price your vacation on the Ritz Carlton website- you now can get a great airfare to go with your hotel

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Service, Beautiful Grounds, and Best Location on the Island.”
Reviews.Author: gabrielled05
Reviews.Content: Well in planning our honeymoon my husband and I knew we wanted to go to Maui, so we began to look around, read reviews, and get input from our travel agent. We had never been to Hawaii before so it's a little hard to plan and know where to go when you have never been there before. I actually began to read reviews on this website regarding many hotels on the Island but we had decided on Either the Ritz Carlton or the Sheraton (which we heard were both very nice. After reading reviews on this website I was quite flustered and confused because some people said good things about the Ritz and some said bad things. BUT in my experience... I have never stayed at a place so beautiful, or had better service, or had been treated so wonderfully as I was at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua! The location of the Resort was perfect because it would be in the upper 80's and because of the ocean and mountain breeze you wouldn't even know it. There would be clouds from time to time but it would be a refreshing break from the sun for a minute. I would highly recommend this Resort to anyone!! I hope all enjoy like My husband and I did!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel - not the best location”
Reviews.Author: Tripstaken
Reviews.Content: You probably wonâ€™t find a nicer more up market place to stay than this, maybe the Four Seasons? The rooms are great, quiet and mostly have decent views, although you want to be located as far as you can get from the lobby for the best views. If you are staying mostly on the west side the hotel is better than anything thatâ€™s not in Wailea, but if you are going east, itâ€™s a haul. The pool was great, but in tough times, itâ€™s a surprise that they are still going with the $15 cocktails, but more of surprise that they get served watered down in plastic tumblers. Buy your alcohol at the next door Honolua Store and head to the beach for your own cocktail hour, HS is also good for breakfast if you donâ€™t mind roughing it on the picnic benches. The coastal trail that starts right near the hotel is a complete gem, going a few miles. See separate review for Banyan Tree restaurant, its outstanding, but I was surprised that their $50 per person special wasnâ€™t noted in the room, and the restaurant menus werenâ€™t there either, I found them on a website ??

Reviews.Title: “Too Far from everything!”
Reviews.Author: peppersboi
Reviews.Content: This hotel was lovely with beautiful grounds but was in the middle of no where. It is the perfect hotel if you like staying at the resort the entire time. It is perfect for business conventions and golfers. We moved to a different hotel after 2 days because it took over an hour to get to Wailea and Makena beaches as well as 30 minutes to get to Lahaina. Plus compared to other Ritz resorts this was not up to par with those. However there was a nice bellman by the name of Byron. I would not recommend this hotel if you plan to spend time seeing the sites of Maui because of the drive. It took 45 minutes to an hour to reach the hotel from the airport. Hana and Haleakala are on the other side of the airport in East Maui. Plus there is a $20 resort fee. It seems all hotels have a resort fee.

Reviews.Title: “Do we already have to leave?”
Reviews.Author: bhs73
Reviews.Content: We went to celebrate our 10-year wedding anniversary and it was just wonderful. Great deals because of the economy as well. The only blip was a little bit of a service problem by the pool. One particular employee was not very nice / helpful. Everyone else was great.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cbrokmei
Reviews.Content: I just got back from the Ritz and the only word I can use to describe it would be disappointing. While the property is very nice, the rooms are only so so. Readers should not discount the wind. I cannot understate how much it howls on this side of the island if the tradewinds are up. We're not talking a light breeze, we're talking about winds that made it impossible to sit by the pool so if you are people that want to sit by the pool at your hotel you should not stay here. I found the restaurants to be pretty poor which isn't surprising for hotel restaurants but disappointing nonetheless. Kai was bland. The quality of the fish was only ok, and the menu was limited with no inventive rolls to speak of. The brunch at the Terrace restaurant was overall quite good, but there were little fruit flies over everything which shouldn't occur at a top line restaurant. Finally the service. This is what I was most disappointed with since this is what the Ritz is known for. No one went out of their way. We asked for good restaurant recommendations and their only suggestions were on property which is pretty frustrating. We got water the first day and then no water the rest of the time there, when we asked the front desk why they said the policy was to only provide it upon request. For what is supposed to be a top line service oriented hotel I thought this was pretty cheap and it infuriated me to no end because I've never had a similar response at any comparable high end property. Overall I would recommend that people stay someplace else either in Kaanapali or Wailea

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort and llovely staff”
Reviews.Author: mmilgrom
Reviews.Content: The Ritz in Kapalua is a fantastic vacation spot. The resort is spacious and secluded - worlds away from more touristy corners of Maui. The entire Kapalua complex is a serene and beautiful paradise. The food on the resort and up the road is lovely, and the convenience of the Honolua general store is great. The service is great. Golf is unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: “a relaxing getaway...”
Reviews.Author: missnatalie
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. On the day that we arrived it was very gloomy and raining so we were a little disappointed. Forunately, we greeted graciously at the airport with the Ritz shuttle and also again at the hotel with the concierge offering beverages and lei's. This hotel was a nice place for us to relax. We did not rent a car since our main goal was to lay out by the beach or the pool. We did end up taking a cab to Lahaina one night to walk around the shops which was fun and it was only about a $40 cab ride round trip. The rest of the time we spent around the resort and at the different golf courses. I was a little disppointed by the selection of food since a majority of the restaurants mainly served seafood. But, the market just across of the hotel was great in offering a selection of options at afforable prices. I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a place to go to relieve your stress and relax. If you wanted to stay at a place with more of a nightlife I would recommend staying in Kaanapali or Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “BY FAR THE BEST HOTEL ON MAUI!”
Reviews.Author: generika
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Ritz was the best experience we had in Maui. The location is amazing (and not too windy like some reviews say) The breeze was wonderful! I would say 90% of our trip was sunny and there was only one morning when it was raining. The rooms are GREAT! We got an ocean view suite and we had the best view of the ocean. The restaurants are TERRIFIC! I really have nothing bad to say about this hotel. STAY HERE! Youll love it! Oh and there arent too many children running around, it is VERY peaceful and serene.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal all-inclusive (almost) with kids!”
Reviews.Author: bombaymark
Reviews.Content: We spent 8 nights in Aug at the Ritz and got a club level room. Typical Ritz class and quality rooms. The pools are nice but not as much fun for kids (5-15) as the Grand Wailea or some others. The club lounge is outstanding - the food is great (little bite-sized pieces for kids and adults), the drinks are excellent (wide range of choices), and the service is fabulous. The beach is a short 5-7 min walk away. We will be back for more.

Reviews.Title: “Not so Ritzy......”
Reviews.Author: abbiehass
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on our honeymoon for 5 nights. I had read previous reviews regarding upgrades and most people had no problem getting a free upgrade. When we arrived they said we could upgrade but for a fee. We decided to go take a look at our "ocean view" deluxe room. There was a giant palm tree in front of our balcony and you had to lean over the balcony to see the ocean. Not my idea of an ocean view. We decided to upgrade to a suite. It was very nice but we did pay for it. No one ever recognized that it was our honeymoon (we had just come from the Hyatt in Kauai where they sent champagne to the room, discounts for the restaurants, a free cabana). We received nothing at the Ritz. The pool was okay. Nothing special. There was no adults only area and there were quite a few families with kids running around and screaming in the pool. The staff at the pool was very nice as well as the valets. I got a spa treatment which was nothing special either. I have friends who have stayed at the Four Seasons in Maui and RAVED about it. If I were to take another trip to Maui I would not come back to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel -- Great Location -- Just plain Great!”
Reviews.Author: MattNVegas
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is located away from the other towns on Maui. The property is quiet and clean. The view from the large pool is absolutely breathtaking. Within a 5 minute walk is a beach that is well off the radar of most travelers. The drive to the property from Kahului is about 45 minutes, but well worth it. If you want privacy and seclusion from the rest of the world...the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, romantic and luxurious hotel with great service - highly reccomend to”
Reviews.Author: spw1234
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married on 9/5/09 and left for Maui the next day. Our flight did not get in until about 9pm and by the time we got our car (highly reccomend getting an SUV) and made it to the hotel (We were at the Ritz from 9/6 to 9/13 and it was one of the best vacations we have both ever taken. Upon arrival we were given lei necklaces and upgraded to an ocean facing room on the ground floor which had a patio and looked out at the ocean and pool. The room was very nice and comfortable. Only downside was that we were on the ground floor so we could not leave our curtains open to the wonderful natural sunlight. Our package included the breakfast buffet and I highly recommend you getting this included in your package if possible. Without the deal, breakfast buffet at the hotel for 2 people was approximately $70 per day. We found the staff to be incredibly accomodating and kind. One thing is be sure to check your bill at the end of the stay. My husband had ordered a rose petal turn down service with champagne and strawberries, but unfortunately they forgot the roses! I saw that they had charged us for the roses anyway, and once we let the front desk know they were very apologetic and fixed the issue immediately. We did not really hold back on this trip given that it was our honeymoon so we ended up visiting the spa at the Ritz twice. The service and amenities were wonderful. We got a couples massage in a private cabana which was really relaxing - the blinds were opened so you could hear/smell the ocean. Once you book a service at the spa you have access to their steam room, sauna, hot tub and relaxation rooms. The spa staff was very friendly/knowledgable and the facilities were very clean. My husband got very burned the first day we were in Hawaii and he got an aloe wrap on our first visit, which really helped calm his skin. They also gave us a container of the aloe scrub for him to use the rest of the week. The beach by the Ritz is great because it was beautiful and was not crowded or dirty. My husband and I are pool people so we spent most of the time by the pool which was fantastic! The Ritz also offers programs for guests. For example they have the Jean-Michel Cousteauâ€™s Ambassadors of the Environment program which allows guests to explore the natural beauties of Maui (snorkeling, hiking, etc.) with the guidance of experts. I think it also highlights the conservation efforts of the hotel which was an added bonus. We were able to to tour the vegetable gardens at the Ritz and see how many of the produce used in their restaurants are grown on site. The experience was education and it was very interesting to see how the Ritz was able to cultivate empty land and put it to good use. The only downside of the Ritz is that it is a little further away on the island, but we really enjoyed that it was a bit secluded and we had rented a car so we were not too concerned. Additionally, the Ritz is about a 10 minute drive from Lahaina which is a cute town with a ton of shops and great restaurants. All in all we could not have asked for a better hotel or honeymoon location. We loved the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Our upgrade was the cherry on top!”
Reviews.Author: bum621
Reviews.Content: My wife, our 3 year old daughter and I decided to end our trip on a high note by staying at the Ritz. When we got there our rooms were not ready, so they put us in an upgrade. We went during the off-season so I don't think they were that busy. When we got to our room, were we treated to a nice surprise. We were upgraded from a Terrace Room to a Pool/Partial Ocean View room in the Residence Tower. It was basically a 1 bedroom suite! It had a kitchen sink, nice large island table, microwave, dishwasher, good size fridge, 2 LCD TV, 1 King, 1 Sofa/bed, a large master bath and 2 private balconies. What more can we ask for. I don't know what the going rate for this room, but it definitely made our trip a lot more comfortable. Now that we got a taste of a 1 Bed Suite, I don't think there is no turning back. In terms of the facilities, it was nice, clean and well maintained. It didn't feel busy. I think half the hotel is a Ritz Residence, hence the feeling it wasn't a full-service hotel. It felt like something was missing. Nice Gym! For light meals, snacks ... I suggest you take a 2 min walk and visit the Honolua Store. Best Local Food we had on the Island. A lot better and fresher than Aloha Mixed Plate and a lot tastier than Okazuya & Deli Honokowai. Breakfast was around $5-$7, Lunch $6-$9. This is where the locals go. Also for Dinner we went to Merriman's (shuttle service provided by the Ritz) ... good food. They work with local farmers so the menu is every so changing. If you can get a deal for the 1 Bed Suite ... definitely check this hotel out. DT Flemming Beach was nice and quiet as well. If you're looking for a party, this is not the hotel to go to. But if you are seeking a beautiful resort without the hustle and bustle of vacationers, this is the hotel for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dont' stay anyhere else!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 120709a
Reviews.Content: We came across the Ritz Carlton by default. We originally booked our stay down the road in Napili Bay. We lasted 1 night there as it is more for the 80+ year olds. We searched a few hotels, The Westin (which we love as a hotel) and The Sheraton. The reason for not staying at these hoels is that we wanted to be away from Kaanapali and the amounts of people. We drove into the Ritz... walked in and that was it! We stayed for 3 nights. I must say, whoever did the interiors and fitout of this hotel has done the most amazing job. Besides that, we found the service exceptional. The people very friendly. and the Japanese restaurant/bar is the best I have ever had. One thing we miss.. is the Honolua Store, up the road from the hotel. We had breaky there every morning. It was great!! The Ritz is a must... it's pricey, but worth every cent.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Blissful, and Breezy...”
Reviews.Author: psillywilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed a 10 days at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. We had our wedding there on July 16, 2009. Everyone who we ran across who works there was so very friendly to us.. We stayed in the Ocean Front Suite overlooking the ocean.. The evening time we will see from our suite beautiful sunsets and hear the howling wind. The pool was gorgeous. We ate at The Banyan Tree located on the Resort grounds, the food was excellent. We ordered in room service and the food was great. We took nice strolls along the resorts pathway, and the landscaping was goregous with beautiful flowers, trees, ocean, and mountains all around us.. The spa was absolute heaven. Free parking not a far walk at all. Very nice golf course. Overall, we loved it we are going back for our anniversary. I hope I helped you in your decision and you are able to experience somewhat or even a better experience than we did.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Grounds! Great Updated Rooms! Kapalua Rocks!”
Reviews.Author: akboxak
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from our trip to Maui. We really loved our time on the island. The Ritz is set in the well manicured Kapalua resort development. The grounds are lush and beautiful. Many tropical plants and flowers. There are beautiful trees throughout the property. Here are some of my thoughts. 1. Many people have remarked on the wind on this part of the island. Kapalua is windy. It starts as a breeze in the morning and then really kicks up. I found the wind rather refreshing. It kept the humid, heat at bay. 2. Kapalua was wonderful. Lush, beautifully maintained, and peaceful. I didn't mind that it was a bit of drive from the other resort areas. We came to Maui to get away from it all. 3. Make use of the General Store. The food was good and well priced! Nothing like spam masubi in the morning. 4. The food is great but expensive. Eat at Kai. Try the macadamia pancakes at the Terrace. (Better than at the Gazebo, but more than twice the price!) Merriman's was also tasty and had a great location. 5. Service. Service was inconsistent. Great in some areas and not five star in others. For example, at the pool area, there were many occasions when we had to set up our own chairs. This never happens at the Four Seasons where they would bend over backwards for you. But, then again they did send up some complimentary chocolates to our room. The resort may be understaffed. You need to seek out the right staff and be sure to tip so that you are on the radar! 6. Rooms-We stayed in a residential suite. What can I say? Truly top notch-Sub-zero pull out fridge and freezer, Villeroy and Bock dinnerware, Henkels knives. Bed was very comfortable. No complaints whatsoever. 7. Spa- My wife had a spa treatment of a massage and body scrub. The spa itself is top notch-lots of special extras like heated spa robes, eucalyptus spa room. But the actual treatment itself was somewhat lacking. You would expect more from a $230 treatment. 8. Fitness center-Very nice with top of the line equipment and a gorgeous view of the pool area. 9. The Beach. There was a shore break surf warning everyday but if you swam out beyond the shore break, the ocean was lovely. All in all, this is a beautiful resort with many wonderful things to offer. Kapalua is our preferred destination in Maui. Hope to return in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymooner Escape”
Reviews.Author: SLeeker
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful hotel! At check in we were upgraded and a gift was delivered to our room as we are honeymooners, although I hear they upgrade on a regular basis. Got a deal on our room through AAA, so check there for lower rates. Hotel is gorgeous, service was great, we loved the location too. Its about ten minutes past Lahaina but we loved being further down the road from resort lan where the hotels seem to be on top of each other. The beach was great and swimmable. Even the wind you see people talking about in other reviews was great because it made it not feel as hot, it was never too much and nothing ever blew away because of it. We ate elsewhere for lunch and dinner because you could easily spend a fortune on food here, but there are so many great places to go just make sure you rent a car (Lahaina Grill and Plantation House!)

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel in a different part of Maui | Also stayed at Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: CarZin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our honeymoon. We also stayed at the Four Seasons for a longer duration, and as many people staying at this type of hotel are also looking at the Four Seasons, this might be a good review for you as a means of comparison. I'll start by reviewing the hotels on its on merits: 1) The price is pretty good. USE YOUR AAA CARD. Big discounts (enter AAA in the promo code). You can get a AAA card for about $20. The savings for our regular room were about $50 a night. We ended up paying $255 a night after taxes for their least expensive room. 2) The rooms are VERY well appointed. All marble/granite bathrooms, large flat panel TVs, nice hardwood floors, and very comfortable beds. We actually got upgraded to a garden view Residential Suite (seems to happen a lot at this hotel). REALLY NICE. 1000 sq foot room, with an extra flat panel, large table, drawer style dish washer and refrigerator. I saw the regular rooms and also thought we would have been very satusfied had we not been upgraded. The tub in our room was regular, with no jets. 3) Staff was very friendly. We made friends with one of the concierge's at the hotel that made our stay very enjoyable. I highly recommend calling the concierge before you arrive, get acquainted and be very nice to them, and they will make your stay much better. They should be the people you tip the largest of all when you leave. 4) The reason I gave this hotel four stars and not five really has a lot to do with the beach service. There really isnt any. You stop by a towel stand on your way to their nice but small beach, and thats about it. No chairs available, no umbrella. When you come to Hawaii you want to be able to spend some time watching the ocean, but most of us dont want to be cooked. Not having chairs and umbrellas available means a lot less time by the ocean. We also found out that they once offered snorkel equipment, but stopped when the economy got tough. A real bummer. They have a shuttle the the beach next to them that rents scuba gear, but I hate having to go off property for something like that. The pool is very nice, but again, lack of umbrellas unless you want to plow down $250 a day for a cabana is a big turn off. 5) Weather: I need to note that this location seems to be particularly windy. VERY windy. It takes some getting use to. The clouds that form around this hotel also seem to be threatening rain, but rarely do. For this reason, if you plan on wanting to sit by the pool and the beach to get tanned, the wind and sky conditions could prove challenging. 6) Location: There are some very cool things to do in this part of the island. If you keep driving up 30 past the hotel, there are some awesome snorkeling beaches, and this one place just before 30 turns into 340 (a glorified one lane road) at the top of a cliff that you can climb down the side of this cliff and jump in these awesome tide pools. The waves crash all around the volcanic rock and splash water into this pool area. Definitely worth going down. If you continue on 340 (tight road), you will get to a little village where they sell the best banana bread I've ever had. We were advised to stop when you get to the art gallary (15 mins past the village) and come back, and the road gets even worse, and the natives arent particularly nice. There is some golf in the area, a disc golf course, zip lining, and tons of other activities in the Kapaula Adventure Center just up the road from the hotel. We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. For our level of activity, this was the correct stay. The area has some very cool things to do in it, but we would have gotten bored if we would have stayed there anymore than 5 nights. Direct Comparison to the Four Seasons on Maui: 1) The Ritz is half the price of comparable rooms at the Four Seasons. We liked our room much better (furnishings and overall room feel) at the Ritz 2) We were not upgraded at the Four Seasons 3) The Ritz has a resort fee of $20 a day, and the Four Seasons has none 4) The Ritz has plenty of self parking. If the Four Seasons has self parking, I didnt see it, and we had to use their valet ($20 a night) 5) The availablity of inexpensive food doesnt really exist at either hotel. 6) The pools at the Four Seasons have free cabanas (very nice) where the Ritz has only cabanas that cost $250 a day. 7) The beach at the Four Seasons has complete service (minus alcohol) including free umbrella/chair/table setup where the Ritz only has a towel service 8) The Four Seasons has free snorkel gear (first hour) when the Ritz has none on site. The snorkel site at the Four Seasons is top notch when the site near the Ritz is not very good. 9) Both hotels had excellent concierge service 10) The Ritz has a much bigger pool than the Four Seasons, however the Four Seasons has a small exclusive pool available only to adults (called the Serenity pool) 11) The Ritz includes Wireless access when the Four Seasons charges another $10 a day for access (that really made me angry at over $500 a night). 12) The Ritz has much more abundant sporting courts (including a full sized basketball court and at least 4 tennis courts). The Four Seaons has two tennis courts (synthetic grass which is nice) and a ball machine you can rent. 13) Beach access is a walk with the Ritz, when it is close at the Four Seasons 14) More things to do within closer proximity of Four Seasons compared to Ritz 15) The Four Seasons has a cool game room with shuffleboard/ping pong/pool tables/xbox 360s. Super nice. And the gym they have is also very very nice equipment. I cant really compare this to the Ritz, as I didnt see any of this on the property. In summary, we spent 3 nights at the Ritz and 5 nights at the Four Seasons. I feel like we saw the entire island this way. If I were going to advise people on their stay, then I would recommend a similar configuration on their stay. The Ritz would have gotten 5 stars with better beach and pool side service. Otherwise, top notch. Definitely give this place a try.

Reviews.Title: “Would go back in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: hikingnut
Reviews.Content: What a treat! My wife and I celebrated our anniversary here and savored every minute of our stay. From the moment we walked in and to the very last minute of our stay, we were treated with some of the most outstanding customer service I have ever experienced. The rooms were elegant and romantic, the spa was incredible (couples massage was amazing), and the food was delicious and filling. The pool was beautiful and the views of the ocean were outstanding. Our only regret was not staying longer. Well worth it if you want to splurge on yourself.

Reviews.Title: “not a ritz carlton quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: sapanvi1503
Reviews.Content: we supposed to stay for 4 nights but checked out after 1st night...this is not Ritz Carlton quality hotel....rooma are too congested and a small bathroom..do not waste your money. westin villas and there are many better hotels than this in the same area.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking Scenery”
Reviews.Author: imikm
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very happy with our stay at the Ritz in Kapalua. When we first checked in, we kept comparing it to the Four Seasons Wailea which we had been to twice before. The rooms at the Four Seasons are more spacious and the beach is better and there is more access to shade (umbrellas) at the pool and beach there. However, once we were upgraded to a one bedroom suite and we mellowed out, we really came to love the area. It is more removed than staying at other areas of the island but you really feel like you are away from all the hustle bustle which we liked. If we wanted the action, we drove to Kaanapali which was only 10 mins. down the road. Definitely try Merriman's at sunset. Very pricy but worth the wonderful view at dinner. The views and landscape on this part of the island were so beautiful. Not typical because there are a lot of pine trees but the feeling was very rustic and green. We don't recommed DT Fleming beach because it was rough and windy. Try Kapalua Bay - the hotel provides a shuttle and you can rent chairs and umbrellas there. The lack of shade by the pool was likely due to the wind - umbrellas would surely be blown away. Although the wind kept things cool, my kids were sunburned and couldn't escape the sun so we had to go in from the pool early for a few days. We loved the General Store for morning coffee and breakfast. So quaint and reasonably priced. All in all, we came to love the resort - we felt away from it all, the service was great, room was clean and beautiful, and the scenery breathtaking!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: sundance59
Reviews.Content: This is a very good resort. The rooms were very comfortable, the pool was great and so was the beach. We had breakfast included in our package in it was excellent each morning. I suggest they should invest in some commercial quality toasters as they had 3 cheap toasters (plastic ones found at places like kmart) for use and there was a line to get toast as it took so long to toast the bread. My wife and I both had Spa treatments costing $600 between the two of us. It was very expensive for what it was and frankly not worth it. The decor and feel of the spa was great though. Overall, It was a very nice stay at the resort as expected.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: ROKChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect for your Hawaiian get away! We had an ocean view and enjoyed the property, as it is newly renovated and well maintained. The beach is a very short walk from the hotel and chairs are available just off the beach. The restaurants are expensive, but markets are in driving distance of the hotel. We very much enjoyed our one week stay at the Ritz Carlton and hope to visit it again!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a Ritz.”
Reviews.Author: thchicago
Reviews.Content: There is a reason why this property only has a 78% rating. This is one of the lowest-rated Ritz Carlton properties in the world. As I have had many previous positive experiences with the Ritz, I will try to be as fair as possible when describing our stay at Kapalua to future travelers. I don't normally write reviews, however, I was so disappointed by our experience that I felt compelled to fill in others of what to expect from this property. From my personal experience, I agree with the low ratings for the following reasons: - When we arrived at the front desk, our first impression was disappointing at best. The staff was untrained to the point of absurdity. The front desk attendant took a personal phone call while checking us in. The manager, Vany, was dismissive to the point of being insulting. They gave us conflicting information on pricing of club level access, and in the end, they decided their club level access was booked until December, according to Vany. Right....we checked on our computer once we settled in, and surpise, surprise, club level access was available online....hmmm. - The ocean view suite that we booked was a room that faced a mountain with an ominous cloud hovering over it all day. About one quarter of the resort faces this mountain and you can only see the ocean by standing on the most outward corner of the lanai. If you do decide to book here, please avoid odd numbers in the residential wing, as it will look onto Mordor (please reference Lord of the Rings if unfamiliar.) We truly questioned how such a depressing view could exist on Maui. I went back to the front desk to ask for an ocean view suite with a view of AT LEAST the pool, and they said they were completely booked. Uggh...we suffered for a few more hours and went back to the front desk to speak with a new attendant. She must have liked us, because she was able to find an ocean view suite with a pool AND ocean view for us the next day. -Once we arrived in our new room, we were much happier with our view. No longer depressed, we made our way to the beach. It is a beautiful beach, however, there is no food or drink service available on or near the beach. (Please note: They do offer food and drink service at the pool.) - We eventually made our way to the bar and were again surprised by the lack of "Ritz Carlton" service. The bartender was stressed out and asked "Can I help you?" in a tone that implied anything but....The wait staff seemed stressed and not so friendly. And in response to another reviewer regarding tips improving service, we are generous tippers (20-35%) and this did not help... - At other Ritz properties, we have always been greeted by name, and that did not happen here EXCEPT for the Terrace Restaurant for breakfast. They provided GREAT service and reminded us of what "Ritz" service means...I know that sounds a bit ridiculous, however, when you spend money on a five star hotel, you expect five star service. - The location can be considered good or bad depending on what you like to do. If you plan to stay at the resort for the extent of your stay, then it will work well for you. The food at the resort is good, a bit over-priced, but reasonably so. If you like to go to different restaurants throughout your stay, it may not be the best location. Most restaurants are a 15 minute to 1 hour drive, and that can be really expensive if you plan to take a cab. If you drive, obviously, you cannot have more than a drink or two...We took a cab from Kapalua to Lahaina (about 15-20 minutes) and it was $45 each way. In essence, we paid $90 to have dinner outside of the resort. It can get very expensive.... Positives - The grounds are beautiful and well-maintained. The rooms are nicely appointed and clean. - There is a GREAT sushi bar called Sansei within walking distance of the Ritz. It is excellent!!! - The beach is amazing! - Nice fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act In Maui”
Reviews.Author: hdblue
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spend four nights at the Ritz in Maui for our vacation. The hotel absolutely lived up to expectations. The service was first rate. Everyone was very friendly and helpful and not the fake smle type friendly, it is obvious that everyone enjoys what they do an they take care of the customers very well. Our room was fantastic. We booked a residential suite and its was comfortable, classy and functional. The room like the entire hotel has an authentic hawaian feel to it. The suite has a wonderful meeting table next to the living room that is perfect for gathering and meeting after a day at the beach. The living room and bedroom both have large screen flat screen tv's after your done outside. The living room has a couch and chair and there is a balcony off both the living room and balcony to relax on. I truely enjoyed the balcony off the living room with a wicker love seat where you can unwind while listening to the ocean. The bathroom is huge and the bed is fantastic. The climiate control works great, keeps everything cool. The three terrace pools are wonderful. There is never a fight for a chair, always plenty available. Most of the kids stay at the other resorts so the pool isn't packed with them. The attendants provide you towels and drink when you need them. I read other reviews about the walk to the beach, I really don't know what the big deal is. It is a five minute walk down the hill where you get to really enjoy the hotel landscape on the way to the beach. It is NOT a five mile hike. The beach is wonderful, clean and there is plenty of space for you to lay your claim on your own spot. We only ate breakfast at the hotel but it was wonderful and yes, it was very expensive. From what I found though, everything on Maui is very expensive so you just kind of plan on it. The breakfast buffet is awesome though and I LOVE the coffee (kona) so much that I brought a couple of bags back with me. Overall, this is one of the best vacations I have had in a long time. Everything about the hotel was wonderful and relaxing. The housekeeping to the front desk staff are wonderful and truely made it a wonderful experiance.

Reviews.Title: “THE Honeymoon Resort on Maui”
Reviews.Author: TheEngros
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent weeks searching for wonderful resorts to book for our honeymoon. We read many reviews on Trip Advisor for the top resorts in Maui, and I must say, not all of the reviews are accurate. From the moment we walked in, we absolutely enjoyed the pampering provided by our courteous and respectful staff. I called ahead to have some roses and champagne waiting for us on arrival, as it was our honeymoon, and I wanted my wife to feel like the princess that she is. The Ritz, knowing of our celebration, upgraded us to an amazing ocean view suite on the top floor. Amazing. They also decorated our room with a heart of local flowers with a box of chocolates placed in the center. Lovely and thoughtful. Every member of the Ritz staff, from Steve the valet, to Ryan the pool concierge, to Maria the housekeeper, treated my wife and I to the highest levels of customer service imaginable. Precisely what you expect from a Ritz property. As such, I must strongly disagree with any negative posts on this site, and give my highest recommendation to anyone who is considering this property and appreciates five-star service in paradise. (As a reminder, tipping goes a long way in properties such as this, and frankly, is par for the proverbial course. Perhaps the detractors do not understand this.) Our only critique of this property is that during our stay, there were way too many children in the pool, and it made for a bit of a distraction while trying to rest. Although uncharacteristic of the Ritz brand, we attribute that to the new residential properties for sale at the property. Perhaps a rule of no children in the upper tier pool should be considered by management. In summation, my wife and I are avid travelers who have experienced some of the greatest properties in the world, and we are considering purchasing a property at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua to visit annually. Needless to say, we recommend this site without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome awesome stay at the Ritz Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: davidcotyalex
Reviews.Content: The one thing Iearned on this trip is nothwithstanding the brialliance of this site one needs to take heed of critical comments and - unfortunatley - take them with a grain of salt I think. Both this resort - and the Feast at LeLe - were absolutely perfect - a sentiment that seems to vary with some travellers met with misfortune. One thing is for sure about a lot of the negative comments on the Ritz the Resort has absolutely nothing to do with - the weather and the public beaches. It is astounding to me how many of the complainers stumble onto an island and a Resort without having done any research whatsoever on the destination - you know what glad the sand blew in your face at DT because your negativity is not what this place is about in any shape or form. Go to Long Drug and by a couple chairs and a cooler - rent a car because yes you are in Kapalua and yes Lahaina is all of 10 minutes away - and a beautiful drive as well - how can you COMPLAIN about this fact???!!!! Hilarious. And yes it is WINDY in Kapalua - deal with it! Kapalua is also isolated and lush with greenery and trees imported to the island - it you want commercially manicured landscaping sure go to Wailea where they pack the hotels onto small sites and on top of each other - if that is to your preference you aren't going to fare well in Kapalua.
