We spent time at Napili and Kapalua Bay beaches - both beautiful and very calm - a totally different experience from DT yet only like a half mile apart - again I just get some people! As to the complaints about service - too bad because we had a great time there as well - again pick up the phone and make contact with the Concierge before you go - we established a wonderful relationship with Kristine who proved to do a phenomenal job - but it didn't stop there - the entire door and bell staff were awesome - they would bend over backwards for you - and they are front and center so not sure how you miss that - housekeeping was fine/thorough and turndown was missed one night even after we called but on this I wasn't too concerned - again if you are having a great time the fact that your towels were not picked up in the eve isn't that big of a deal. Back to Kristine she introduced us to Island nanny and the Owner recommended Leslie as our babysitter for our ten year old boy - she was absolutely phenomenal and we affiliate her with the overall service of the Resort and in Kapalua. Thanks Leslie!!!!! We found room service exceptional and consistent - we would order for breakfast every day - because we don't like QUEUES! Jeez some people.........We thought the sushi restaurant was superb - the Chef has been there for years and does a great job - again if you want hordes of people and a "scene" go to Sansei - for us Kai was perfect. We didn't eat at the Terrace and Banyan Tree was good if not a bit disappointing. We found the service at the pool fine - again a bit busy but good for them - we rented the cabanas because for me we are on VACATION so I am not getting hung up on things - if you want quality I have learned sometimes that costs a little jack. We found the food and beverages quite good at the pool. The Beach House restaurant was also wonderful. Both my wife and I had treatments at the Spa - I ended up going back for a second message which I odn't normally do - it was very well designed adn the service excellent. Finally I would like to extend kudos to Lee at the Golf Academy - he was great in facilitating lessons for our boy and getting some good tee time on the Bay Course - he had a blast and the service outstanding. And one more comment on service - in case you haven't picked up a paper in the last year we are in a very down economy - I read in the local paper this is the worst summer for tourism in Hawaii since reporting started in 1987 - so yes maybe again it isn't the end of the world if your tv doesn't get fixed expeditiously - perhaps that was a message from above that you shouldn't be watching television in such a wonderful place. So the hotel obvioulsy is trying to make due - the Expedia crowd was certainly in evidence and having that many transient guests in that large of a facility pushes it to its seams. Again my suggestion on service is drink a mai tai and chill. What I also cannot understand the unwillingness to go out and explore - we aren't huge on that front but did at least venture out to what Kapalua has to offer - we found the Pineapple Grill very good and Meriman's exceptional - definitely need to book a 6 or 6:15pm table to catch the sunset - just perfect. And as stated above - the Feast at LeLe was fantastic - the food while yes a lot! was very very good - they went to the trouble of grilling some chicken for our 10 year old so don't get the complaints on that - anyway what was totally unexpected was the quality of the dancers - just great - all in all a wonderful evening. So in summary we had an exceptional visit to Maui, Kapalua and the Ritz-Carlton. I have stayed at Four Seasons around the wolrd and am a frequest visitor of One and Only's Palmilla in Cabo - I would rate this experience - in its totality - as one of the best family trips we have ever had. From the snorkeling to the natural beauty - to the golf to the beaches to the pool - we were completely immersed and relaxed. We would highly recommend the Ritz Kapalua provided that maybe you open a book, take a gander at the net or pick up a phone prior to your arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Not a bad stay -but not Ritz Carlton Quality”
Reviews.Author: ArmoVacationer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Maui Ritz Carlton for a week. The resort charges $20 a day per room resort fees which covers parking,Wi-FI, gym use and some other services. The grounds are well maintained; but, the ocean at the beach is some what wavy and far from the main hotel buildings. The area is windier than other areas of Maui. Also, there are no lounge chairs or umbrellas at the beach outside of the hotel property. The room service and housekeeping was less than excellent. For example: upon arrival, our room's TV was not working; it took hotel three days and three requests (from us) to get the TV fixed. Furthermore, some of the equipment at the Gym was broken. Otherwise, I would say that overall services are about the same quality as Hilton or Marriott hotels.

Reviews.Title: “No longer a Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: thecoopersCheshireUK
Reviews.Content: We had an Ocean View Suite, it was very good and all you would have expected of an RC, BUT the hotel itself is not of Ritz Carlton Standard, we have stayed in several around the world. For Ritz Carlton Standard you have to go to Dubai or Barcelona as examples. This was like a holiday resort hotel- we stayed 3 years ago in Jameirah Beech in Dubia - to try it.Never again!- we went straight back to the RC in Dubia for the last 2 years.This RC was as bad a the Jameirah Beech! The food is poor the service in the Terrace a joke, you queue for dinner and B'Fast, the quality is applaing. The Japanese restaraunt is Ok and the Banyon Tree good but very very high cost and NOT value for money.There is no shaed at the pool unless you pay $100 per day! Poor "duty of care" to the clients.We would not book here again, unless we understood prices were down ( but not the issue) or service was up.Defiatly not value for money.The cost of the food is ridiculous a family of 3 $5-600 per day if you are on the resort. Just eatern in the "Terrace" like a Cafe @ best cost $220!. Sorry Ritz Carlton got to do better than this.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! One of the best hotel's in Maui ;-)”
Reviews.Author: BMH-CT
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, for my 40th Birthday! The service was outstanding..and staff was very accommodating. We loved our room and the space in the room was a plus + including the balcony. Upon arriving, they had such a smooth system in place the welcome was A++++ . When I worked for airline I had the pleasure of going through a leadership training at the Ritz! it was such a wonderful experience that I said I could not go wrong booking my reservations at the Ritz... I truly felt special! Thank you Ritz.... The buffet was exceptional! Sushi was outstanding at the Ritz! Staff always smiling ;-) The Ritz Carlton is the "Gold Standard' of Hospitality...!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with room”
Reviews.Author: skiers4
Reviews.Content: The rooms ( suites) are very large and give ample room for a family of four. This vs. the usual running into one another at most "suite" hotels. The redo that this hotel did was all first rate - the food at the restaurants was excellent as well

Reviews.Title: “Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: maratom
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding. We just spent a week there and I don't have a single complaint. The service, amenities and resort were exactly what you expect from a Ritz Carlton. We stayed in a suite overlooking the ocean and pool and it is perfect for a family with children. We have a 7 and a 4 year old and it was so nice to have a small refrigerator, freezer and microwave. The pool area is very windy, but it keeps the heat away. We also rented cabana suites by the pool which included a television, ceiling fans, stocked refrigerators - they were heavenly! The beach area is small but is great - not too crowded. The Banyan Tree restaurant was my favorite restaurant on the island after Mama's Fish House. The breakfast buffet at the Terrace was also fantastic. We will definitely be returning! Great trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location, beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: LAGinagirl
Reviews.Content: We were fortunate enough to stay for 6 days in an oceanfront club level suite. The property is spectacular, as is the entire Kapalua resort area. The gals in the Club were terrific - they went above and beyond the call of duty to make sure that our stay was as comfortable and complete as we wanted. We took most of our meals in the Club, as they were delicious and there was enough variety that both my husband and I found more than enough to choose from. We were greeted upon initial arrival by name and with a lei greeting - nice touch. We'd been emailed prior if this was a special occasion (it was: both our honeymoon and first anniversary) and were pleased that they not only remembered, but we were upgraded to an even better room than we'd reserved. Kapalua's weather is wetter and breezier than several miles away in LaHaina. If this is an issue for you, you might want to consider another location. We loved the showers ... actually welcomed them. The shuttle service to the other Kapalua sites is very convenient. We were able to self-park our car (for free) and then shuttle around the resort w/o worries about either parking or imbibing too much. The hotel is situated on a hill or cliff: Oceanfront rooms aren't. Rather, there is a beautiful lawn and then a protected Hawaiian burial site before the water/cliff. There's a winding path down to the beach - a nice stroll - or, if you're up for a bit of further walk, a great path to Kapalua Bay and terrific snorkelling. There is different nightly entertainment in the lobby lounge, which we took advantage of every evening sipping Mai-tai's and drinking in the spectacular views.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort, Friendly helpful staff, perfect vacation”
Reviews.Author: collpopp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently traveled from the Philadelphia area and spent a wonderful week at the Ritz in Kapalua. We are married just under 18 years and within the past year, we both turned 40. We decided to take a "couple trip" without our teens. The resort is simply beautiful. The concierge (Leslie) and other employees on the club level welcomed us daily with genuine smile's and interest in making our trip unforgettable. Leslie helped us select two off site free snorkel areas that were amazing. It was like snorkeling in an aquarium. We did take a fun boat trip to Molokini , but felt the best snorkeling was at kapalua beach. The hotel van provides a free shuttle or you can walk the 1.7 miles along the coastal trail. Leslie also provided us with great advice and lent us a guided CD and cooler to use for the drive to Hana. The trip/drive to Hana is currently best to do on the weekends due to road construction. We also did the sunrise bike tour down Haleakala with "Cruiser Phil's" . It was fun and we both felt very safe with our guides ( Lisa and Jay). The evenings on the club level were also very pleasing. Our evening concierge was Erin and the Chef was April. There were lots of great food and wine selections. The club level provides full complimentary bar service with each of the 5 daily food spreads. After a evening drink or two and experiencing the great food we usually stayed put at the resort and enjoyed our evening meals at the hotel restaurants. The on-site restaurants that we enjoyed the most were the Banyan tree and the the Terrace. Our favorite dinner outside of the resort was at KIMO's in Lahaina. Great food and bar/wine selections along with amazing sunset views. Prices were very good. Lahaina also has very impressive art galleries and cool little shops. Tips- bring or rent snorkel gear. Pull over and hop in the water when you notice other swimmers or snorkel boats in the area( Honolua bay). Drive around and enjoy other areas of the island. Each area is a little different. No need to overpack, we lived in bathing suits, cover-ups, flip flops , and casual wear. All the dressier evening wear came home never being worn. The sun is very hot and strong, so the breeze at the resort is refreshing. We were there eight days and only had one afternoon with less that favorable weather. Overall everything was simply perfect. We would love to return someday.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Vacation We've Ever Had!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasMrshowell
Reviews.Content: My family and I travel quite frequently. We usually stay at a Ritz whenever we can. But this Ritz absolutely out shined them all. Our room was so beautiful. We had an ocean front suite with two terraces. The view was breath-taking. Everything was exceptionally clean. The staff at the hotel was probably the friendliest I've ever encountered. From the valet guys to the concierge staff, I couldn't walk by without someone saying "Aloha, Mrs. Howell." And they were sincere! Mark at the beach cabanas took care of us everyday and was so sweet to our children, bringing them fresh pineapple whenever they wanted. At the Terrace restaurant (which was fabulous,) Amy was our waitress almost every morning. She became our wonderful friend. My son would hug her every morning . The concierge staff was also exceptional. Cynthia was so professional, helpful and sweet at the same time. The spa was also phenomenal!!!!!! It was beautiful and everyone was unbelievably accommodating. Yvonne did my nails and even helped me with a fashion emergency!!! She was so kind. We also loved the Banyan Tree Restaurant. Delicious!!! Nick was our waiter and we loved him!!!! Arlyn helped me everyday at the boutique! She was so cute and funny! We also did so many activities off property that were great. Ziplining at Kapalua Adventures, surf lessons, parasailing with UFO. We went on a dinner cruise on the Island Star that was amazing. We went to the Feast of Lei Lei Luau that was soooo much fun and delicious! Overall, it was paradise in paradise!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I'd live there if I could”
Reviews.Author: Alonatart
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed at. The staff was amazing, the room was beautiful and the grounds were inviting and lush. I loved every minute of my stay and hope to go back in years to come. I will always stay at this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: JH11793
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a week at the RC Kapalua and had a great experience. Here are our pro's and con's from our stay. Pro's Rooms: Were large, well decorated and well maintained. We didn't have an ocean view room, but had a view of the golf course and the ocean nevertheless. Rooms have small fridge, coffee maker and decent sized balcony. Views: Hotel is situated on a hill--lobby, pool and most rooms have fantastic views. Aesthetic: Decor is great, landscaping, furnishings, etc. all well maintained and attractive. Service: Staff was all very friendly and helpful. Every staff member passing in the hall makes a point to say "aloha" and smile. Waiters at pool, valets, etc. were all prompt and friendly, but not intrusive. Beautiful beach: Short walk from the hotel, down the hill is DT Fleming Beach Park. Great beach; it's public, so no lounge chairs or waiters on the beach, but a gorgeous large beach. Can get windy in the afternoon though. Family Friendly: Fair number of families with children (but not clearly not overrun with kids); small kiddie pool with waterfall that was perfect for toddlers and a small playground. Activities: Decent, well maintained gym, tennis courts and a basketball court. Guests: Not overcrowded when we visited. Hotel guests were a mix of families and couples, some younger, some older. Most guests were pretty laid back--no loud or rude complainers, cell phone yakkers, screaming kids, etc. Wouldn't recommend it for singles though. Value: Overall, I thought this was the most important since we got a great deal on our room, basically paying less than what I've paid to stay at a Marriott or equivalent on the mainland. Cons: Food prices: It's tough to justify $40 entrees when family dining and there weren't any other options at the hotel. Not to fear though since there are a few options nearby and Lahaina was only about 15 minutes away. The food is supposed to be great, but we never ate at the hotel. My recommendation for the hotel is to leave the expensive places as is, but offer a cheaper option at the Beach House (the more casual place by the water). The Beach House was only open for lunch and then only offered $17 burgers and sandwiches. Drink prices were actually not that bad--less than $5 for a beer and $8 for a mixed drink or $12 for a "specialty cocktail". Distance to the beach: The hotel is a few hundred yards up the hill from the beach, so there's a little bit of a walk. There's a long golf cart to take you up and back. It's an easy walk so you don't really need it. I actually liked not being right on the beach since you had better views. Not much around: The RC is at the tip of Maui and "civilization" runs out just up the road. It's also pretty quiet at night. That being said, it's not that far to drive into Lahaina for the night and there's lots of places to eat, bars, etc. there. Again, this wasn't really a "con" for us since we enjoyed being away from the crowds--especially after walking around Kaanapali for a bit. Overall, I would say it was a great place to stay. I agree with the other reviewers who said that it is not quite 5-star, solely because of the really small things--like no little chocolate on your pillow, etc. If you want to pay another $200 a night or more for that, good for you. If I had paid top price for the room, maybe I would think differently, but having gotten a good rate, I was quite happy and would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, some improvements needed”
Reviews.Author: KKDFCARLSON
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 nights at the Ritz. The property is beautiful and the proximity to great snorkeling a plus. We stayed in a residence suite and the extra space was terrific as was having the freezer/fridge drawers. Have stayed at the Hyatt and the Fairmont on Maui and would rate the Ritz better than both but it is a very different experience. Also would not consider this Ritz on par with the Atlanta or San Francisco Ritz that I have stayed at in the past. If you are looking for non- stop activities the Ritz would not be the best choice. If you are looking to relax in an amazing setting then this is the place. Comments on other reviews about the valet parking (don't bother for the cost), the lack of service at turn down and the small details in housekeeping and maintainence are all true. Ritz needs to elevate its game if they really want to be a 5 star hotel. The staff is very eager to please and friendly however. Kapalua is so relaxing, away from the crowds and plenty of room to get away from every one and every thing. If you are looking for the very best resort in Hawaii- consider the Four Season on the Big Island- truly the best resort I have ever stayed at. Pros: Location, larger rooms (residence suites), friendly service, Excellent food at Kai and the Terrance and the Beach House. Cons: Small details in service, housekeeping and maintaince need to be improved for this to be a true 5 star experience. More information on hotel and activites at check in..

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing in Paradise!”
Reviews.Author: Julz_8
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from our 1st Anniversary trip to Maui. We stayed 6 nights at the Ritz and 3 nights at Hotel Hana Maui (see review posted there). The Ritz was fantastic! We enjoyed an Ocean View Club Level Room for our stay. If you are able, I highly recommend staying in the Club Level. Not only are the staff members helpful and cheery everyday, but the food and beverage services received with this package make the trip 10 times better! From 8:00am to 8:00pm, you enjoy drinks - including cocktails - each day in the lounge. They have 5 food presentations each day: breakfast, lunch snacks, afternoon tea, dinner apps, and dessert. Aside from the food, the pool and beach facilities are great. The pool staff, especially Anthony, were very accomodating and non-intrusive. They came around often to check on drink orders or food/snack needs. Around noon, an attendant comes around with cold fruit on a platter to cool you off. Very nice indeed. So the weather... maybe we just had fantastic weather, but it was sunny and warm everyday. It did rain over night once, but as we understand it, it rained elsewhere on the island as well. There is a breeze but for us, we enjoyed it. Otherwise it would have been WAY TOO HOT. The Ritz is the place to go if you want to escape from the chaos of your daily life. If you want to relax and unwind. I would stay here again and again! Cons: -You have to pay for exercise classes ($15 for yoga, pilates, cycling) - No umbrellas at the pool - Not much to do at night -- need to drive to Lahaina or Kanapali

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!”
Reviews.Author: wr943
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from a week at the RC in Maui, and it was truly our best vacation to date. We stayed in both a deluxe room with a great view and a residential suite. I will start this review with the only con that I have and that is in the deluxe room if it has an adjoining room it can be noisy and you can hear the room next to you. That said, we had a very loud party next to us and the hotel took care of it right away. The room itself is very nice and would have been perfect but for the adjoining room. The suite, however, was unbelivable - I highly recommend the upgrade as it is not that much more expenisve. The hotel grounds are the best on Maui, very expansive and well kept. It was fun just to walk around and soak up the place. The pool is was gorgegous and seemed to be well kept, I will admit that other than walking around the pool I did not spend much time there as I have a pool at home and came for the ocean. DT Fleming beach was a lot of fun and was never crowded like K-ali and Wailea. It was clean and the beachhouse is right there for a beer and food. Another interesting item was the Ambassdors of the Earth program. I must admit I was really surprised by this program and they haves some really unique and interesting programs that I highly recommend. We ate at several of the restaurants at the RC and each of them was great. I really didn't think they were that expensive as some people have said. Kapalua itself if great, there are some really good restaruants - pineapple grill, sansei, honula store for lunch etc. Not to mention gorgeous views all over the place. The service at the RC was great especially the valet. They know the island and can give you great tips on where to eat and what to do, take advantage of their knowledge. The coincerage was good and provided excellent service. I agree with previous posters in that the service is just right if you want more service they will serve you or if you want to be left alone in a tropical island they will do that. I higly recommend the RC and can't wait to go back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Kapalua is the way to go”
Reviews.Author: MD4now
Reviews.Content: Honestly, I really think the internet is great for people who love to gripe about everything. My Wife and I recently stayed here for our honeymoon and were absolutely floored by the Ritz. I was also floored by going back and looking at the reviews that I had read prior to our arrival in Maui, toilet paper complaints, really? We checked in and I grabbed a Kleenex and it was the last one, so I called housekeeping and I swear thirty seconds after I hung up the phone, a knock at the door and Voila, two boxes of Kleenex from a happy member of the Ritz staff was waiting outside the door. The Kapalua area of Maui is absolutely wonderful and the Ritz got the gold when they purchased that property years ago: quiet, secluded, scenic, golf, beach, sun, the views from the restaurants and grounds of the hotel, amazing. (Also for golfers they have been running special of all you can golf for like 400$ for 5 days, if you are an avid golfer take advantage, plus guests get free club rentals). Take a walk down by the chapel near the shoreline of the Ritz and you can walk on ancient harden lava rock right out side the hotel, plus take in some great scenery. We could not have been happier with the room and hotel. I thought the staff went out of their way to engage you if you wanted but also could tell when you wanted to be left alone. We didn't even have a suite or club level room and ours was wonderful, at first I was a little leary because we faced the golf course to the west but every evening getting to sit on the Lanai and watch the sun set behind Molokai island made it worth it. Plus the added bonus of being on the opposite side of the pool means it is so quiet when you are on the Lanai. Actually everything about the Ritz was quiet and relaxing, we soaked up the sun everyday at the pool and beach and never once had an issue finding a chair or towels (granted tourism in Hawaii is down 50% so this is the year to go and avoid the crowds). And I am still a little confused how people who were there recently, as my wife and I were, could complain about lack of shade, first off: the pool area is surrounded by Palm trees and we actually were looking to find a non shady spot, second: it is a pool area??? if you needed shade try the lobby or your room...jeez Third: it is a tropical island in the middle of the Pacific, there was on and off cloud coverage that provided relief from the sun all day long. I almost thought it was too perfect. You would get a good 30 minutes of sun and then 15 minutes of shade to cool of for a few, that cycle would repeat all day long, throw in the occasional spritz of rain... perfect. The food and restaurants are pricey but it is the Ritz and it is Maui if you are looking for cheap hit Florida or Mexico, (I remember that being the biggest complaint that people had: Value) If you don't want resort fees, pricey menus and drink items, I believe there are cheaper hotels on the island, have at them. But after staying in K'pali area three years ago, which was nice, the Kapalua in the Ritz are in a league of their own. I would like to pass along the tip of stopping in at the Honolua Store adjacent from the Ritz for cheaper coffee, lunch, and snacks throughout the day. Many people suggested that and it is the way to go if you are concerned about money, (though if you are I am not sure why you are at the Ritz). Also up the road in Napali there was a grocery store, stock up on drinks and snacks there if you don't want to pay ritz prices. We did. And no one ever said a work about bringing drinks to the pool as long as they were not in a glass container. Obviously the normal people who stay at Ritz/Four Seasons type hotels are willing to pay up. While there we read an article that a certian supermodel pays 14k for a massage three times a week... I am actually still laughing at that one. But my point is that yes the Ritz is pricey but we had a wondeful time staying in a secluded area of Maui and feeling like a movie star with staff always calling you by your name etc. If you are budget driven stay elsewhere, if you want to splurge. Make your reservations now. Our only Cons regarding the Ritz were that for as much as you do pay I think they should be a bit more vigilant on fixing the pool chairs on a regular basis some would have issue staying put in the middle positions. Our Pros: Location, Pool, Room Comfort, Free WiFi, and FREE computer use in the business center for those doing Flight Check In and Boarding Pass printing, Free WSJ and Local Paper near Concierge, empty fridge that you can stock yourself or have them do it. Clientele (even the other guests were nice, I do not remember running into "that annoying family or couple" that it seems you run into when you go on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Breath Taking and Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: OhioLoving_it
Reviews.Content: To the staff at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua, Maui. I enjoyed my; stay from the 14th through the morning of July 18th at the hotel. The rooms were beautiful and the house keeping staff did an excellent job providing us with clean towels more than once a day. They were always very pleasant very polite. My daughter especially liked the smell of the shampoo. The view from our room was breath taking. We especially loved the ability to walk out of our patio doors to the play areas and pools. The pool area was very nice, and the water very clean and clear. We enjoyed the attentiveness of the pool staff. They always seemed busy making sure that there were clean towels and chair covers or asking guest if they wanted a cold drink of water. Everyone was treated equally and felt special. I had another guest tell me how much she enjoyed LaTeah and how sweet she was. She said LaTeah brought her some mangos from her tree at home. LaTeah removed the seed, sliced them and brought them to her on a plate. My stay at the Ritz Carlton made my stay in Maui very special. My sister treated me to the spa, a first for me. the staff were very kind and went out of the way to meet all of our request. It was a day that I will never forget and will always cherish. I would like to end with letting you know that the grounds were excellent, one of the prettest I seen in Maui. I could sit on my patio all day an look at the beauty, Thank you again for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “When can I go back?”
Reviews.Author: LeslieV
Reviews.Content: I love Maui. My fiance and I love it so much we are getting married in Maui! In March, we stayed at the Ritz, and it was the best experience. The service was wonderful, the sights incredible. I felt so lucky to be there for a week. I really didn't want to go back home.

Reviews.Title: “I would stay there longer”
Reviews.Author: DoingYouAFavor
Reviews.Content: Ok we stayed for one week in july and we both enjoyed our time here immensely. The hotel was great with clean and nice rooms. Pool and beach were never crowded and relaxing. The weather was nice with rain in the morning and few showers in the afternoon nothing that lasted long. The wind was a little annoying the first day then you get used to having it and it actually allows you to stay in the sun for longer since it cools you down. The club level is the way to go with its friendly staff, free drinks, and snacks all day. The walk to the beach is pleasant and not the long, why people complain is beyond me. The cons: The bed was terrible, left both of us with bad lower backs even made us sleep on the floor one night. The food was ok at all the places at the hotel, nothing great.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: beechlovr
Reviews.Content: Stayed 8 nights for our honeymoon. We absolutely loved it!! I will keep this review very brief; Pros- Location. We drove all over the island and I would absolutely stay on the west side of the island every time Room- very clean and comfortable, we were upgraded to a partial ocean view. Pool- wonderful service, great pool Beach- a pleasant 5 min walk to a spectacular beach cons- food and drinks- very expensive, even for Maui no shade at the pool unless you rent a cabana spa- VERY expensive. I called a local massage spa and they were booked but sent a therapist to my room for 1/2 the price. massage was awesome!! all in all, our honeymoon was awesome and we were very pleased with our choice of The Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Fan-Fabulous!!!”
Reviews.Author: talah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I do not have one complaint about our 10 day stay at the Ritz! From the moment we arrived and stepped out of the car, the valet attendants knew our names, and rushed to assist! Every single employee was exceptionally friendly, and took care of each and every need. The pool, grounds, and Hotel are all exceptionally kept, and tended to. I have read some of the bad reviews, and I dont know if we just very lucky with our stay, or maybe just some people are a bit too picky! We thought it was marvelous, and will return next year! Our corner room was beautiful, with gorgeous views of the ocean, grounds, and mountain side! We ate breakfast every morning at the Hotel, and was the perfect way to start our days! The concierge desk was always the most friendly, and so helpful, and booked every activity for us! We also ate at the Banyan Tree there at the Hotel, and had one of our favorite meals next to the night at Mamas Fish House! Just excellent service, and delicious Food! Love the salads! Well there you have it, like I said not one bad thing to say!!! Just perfect! Okay, one, just a warning, it is up North, and by the sea, so you do have some winds! But we thought it added to the feel! Enjoy You Trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from the Spa”
Reviews.Author: critic9
Reviews.Content: My husband I had couples massage at the Spa. It was the worst experience. The spa itself was just okay. But the service was horrible. The therapists dropped rocks on the floor- which was annoying. The room was cold. They did not even know how to work the whirpool tub. It was not relaxing at all. For all the money we shelled out, it was such a disapointment. It's not worth it.

Reviews.Title: “The New Club Residences are Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: travelerwithtaste
Reviews.Content: We are staying at the new Club Residences that opened here a month ago and wanted to say they are top quality all the way. Beautiful views of the bay, Lanai and Molokai right off your huge lanai, fully equipped kitchen, granite countertops and huge bedrooms can't be beat. As the property is still new, it is not at all crowded and you will have the pool area to yourself - completely unlike the hotel where you have to claim your spot early. While the residences are pretty remote from the hotel area, there is a shuttle that comes around regularly and will take you around the resort. If you don't have a vehicle you will be limited on restaurant choices, though what is near here is excellent. The only food available right in the residences is the normal pool food during the day and a small beach club which was very expensive and a little underwhelming. The new spa just opened a few days ago and is very nice. Usual prices to be expected from a Ritz spa. Not all services available yet but has a nice work out room. While they are still doing plantings around the property, it is already beautiful. Can't avoid the gorgeous views no matter how you try. There is wireless internet and a safe included, laundry rooms in the units, and there is a little common area on the first floor that has coffee available in the morning. We traveled with our teenage son and the two bedroom unit was more than adequate. We could really spread out. If you are looking for relaxation, great views, and to be left alone, this is the place! Service was impeccable. Very polite, friendly and professional. We had a problem with the air conditioning one day and within minutes of our call the man was at the door to fix it. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “What can I say...it was AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Pancakebakealot
Reviews.Content: So before I begin I must say that I have been labeled by my friends and family as a hotel snob. I'm very picky when it comes to hotel rooms. Our last stay in Maui, my hubby and I stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani and really enjoyed our stay, but this time we wanted to be closer to restaurants and shopping. I hate reading long reviews so I'm simply going to list the positive and the negative. Positive: - Resort pool stays open 24 hours. - Room service is 24 hours. - When we arrived, we were greeted with a Kukui necklace and water. - Front desk upgraded our garden view suite to a partial ocean view garden suite complimentary. - Rooms were beautiful and decorated with dark wood. We had a living room, bedroom, 2 flat screens, ipod docking station, 2 lanais, etc. - Price was just right through Expedia. We paid $2,350 for our room, airfare, and car rental. - About 6 miles from Whaler's Village. This is a positive because I don't like staying where it's too crowded. - Kapalua beach was awesome. Negative: - Food and drinks are ridiculously expensive. We paid $57 for 2 cheeseburgers, 2 fries, and one soda. - The attendants at the pool are not as attentive as I'm use to. - I'm not sure if this is a negative, but it does get windy at times during the day (not always). I didn't mind because it was hot, however I know some may not enjoy the wind. So as you can see, the positives far out way the negatives. We loved the Ritz Carlton Kapalua so much we will be going again next year. All I can say is try it, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Samdooby
Reviews.Content: Aloha! Okay so the wife and I stayed at the Ritz June 9th-15th to celebrate our anniversary and attend the Kapalua Wine and Food event. Now the wife and I have stayed at 5 star adults only resorts and 1 star European communal bathroom sharing hotels and everything in between. Just a side note, if you are used to the way other Ritz employees treat you on the mainland and such do not expect that here. People that work here are not going to kiss your okole, instead they opt for having a genuine caring attitude of getting to know you and being friendly. That is the true meaning of "aloha"-being friendly and genuine, not being pretentious and fake... Grounds: Nicely maintained, not overly flowery or tropical. The Ritz sits on a hill overlooking the ocean. Very beautiful and serene. The pool area is three tiered, has lots of seats, very nice. Private cabana run $150 for a regular cabana and $250 for a cabana suite. Suite comes w/ fresh fruit, fridge, flat screen TV, Ipod friendly radio, couch, fan, very nice... Beach: Beach is located about 1/4 of a mile down a hill from the Ritz. Nice beach, white sand, good waves, kid friendly. The Ritz provides a golf-cart transportation to and from the beach for people who donÊ»t feel like walking. NOTE: There are no beach chairs or anything on the beach but the Ritz has a little area where chairs are provided... Room: The room was lovely. Very beautiful, flat screen TV, marble, real wood, fridge, the whole nine yards. Bathroom was spacious and nice. Also I highly recommend you get the club level and all its perks. Well worth it, drinks and pu-puÊ»s were delicious, concierge was extremely friendly and helpful, perfect for people who do not want to sit and eat a massive meal but can fill up and be satisfied. The Club Level is definitely worth the extra dinero... Dining: We ate at the Banyan Tree Restaurant and it was wonderful. Great food, nice ambiance, went our of there way to make our dining experience perfect. We also had drinks and pu-puÊ»s at the Alaloa lounge and had some sushi. Good food, nice drinks, no complaints. Oh yea, had the breakfast buffet, typical breakfast items, omletes to order, nothing to complain about here... Weather: Now this seems to be a point of content for many people. First off, it can get a little windy. BUT not a cold wind or annoying wind. It is welcome especially when the sun is out and it is hot. Second I have heard people saying it rains constantly in Kapalua? HUH? That was not the case. I mean, come on, you are in the middle of the Pacific, it might rain, heck it might even be sunny!! DonÊ»t let all these people scare you from staying here, you would be doing yourself a grave mistake. Kaannapali and Wailea are mega resort areas where you will be elbow to elbow with all these tourists and their kids while here at Kapalua it is secluded but has many perks and beauty that Maui has to offer. 20 minute ride into Lahaina, beautiful setting, amazing resort. Take a chance and come on down and enjoy what the Ritz has to offer... Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “They had me at "Aloha"”
Reviews.Author: chermanator
Reviews.Content: We just spent six fabulous nights at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua and it was magnificent. We stayed in one of the residential suites that was bigger than my first apartment! Beautiful furniture, two flat screen tvs, a bed that you just want to sink in, two balconies, and all the appointments that you would ever want! The staff at this hotel are great! We loved Cynthia, our favorite concierge! So helpful and fun! The property is stunning, and we drove around the island to check out other resorts. The Ritz is definitely the best! The hotel offers a free shuttle to and from local restaurants which is ideal if you don't want to have a few cocktails and worry about driving! Leave the driving to the shuttle drivers! We don't have children, but there are some kids there, but they have a designated pool for kids. If you're like me and don't want to hear parents screaming at their kids, or vice versa, then you will be fine in the adults only section. Oh - there are no umbrellas by the pool so if you are not a sun lover, you should be aware. You can rent a little private cabana, however, and they come with lounge chairs, towels, and a cooler of sodas and water. The pool attendants are very friendly and make sure you have everything you need! Enjoy the magic!

Reviews.Title: “Warm winds, wonderful wine, great location”
Reviews.Author: TheOCIronMike
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter and I had just five days in Maui, but we made the most of it at the Ritz at Kapalua. the location--off by itself within the thousands of acres of former plantation now groomed as gardens and golf course, is in my mind what is most special about this resort. You feel far from the crowds at Kanapali and Lahina. It was usually breezy, sometimes windy each day, but only one day of misty rain, and much sunshine in between. In addition to lounging by the pools and on the beach, we visited zipline at Paniholo Ranch and hiked with Maui Eco Tours to the freshwater pools and falls on the Hana side. We recommend both. Food started with Mama's Fishouse, my wife's longtime favorite, and our new favorite, Merriman's on Kapalua Bay. If you don't see the wine you want, ask sommolier Cass to check his private selection for you. Merriman's mayhave the best view on Maui, and the food was superb. All in all, a fabulous location and hotel. We'll be returning.

Reviews.Title: “the best of the best”
Reviews.Author: nuggetshow
Reviews.Content: we checked in for 14 nights on June 8th ( yes were still here). we are staying using marriott points so i was hoping at best to get an upgraded view from the mountain view booked. We were upgraded to a residence suite without even asking along with an ocean view. The decor is first class, built in sub-zero along with 2 LG 42" lcd tv's. The staff has bent over backwards to honor any request. The work out room is world class as is the pool. The beach is about a 5 minute walk from the main pool area but again is world class. We were also given tickets to 2 events at the kapalua wine festival that was taking place last week. Even at the going rate of $800 for the room we have, when you figure the sale price is $900K its not a bad deal. The down side is parking can be a pain unless you valet and the pricing for food and beverage is high even by ritz standards. Figure on $10-$18 for drinks and $18 hamburgers at the pool. That said if your looking for deals you wouldn't pick this hotel anyway. If your looking for a special vacation where the staff goes out of their way to make you feel special this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Nenebird2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five days at the end of a 10 day trip to Maui in the first week of June at the Ritz in Kapalua. It is a gorgeous and relaxing although maybe it was just less busy due to time of year. It is definitely a larger hotel and not a cozy get-a-way like other places we stayed in Maui but amazing if you're going for a resortanyway. There are three beaches nearby and all are beautiful and no other hotels. A bit of a hike down as the hotel is set back but we liked having some room to roam and not being on a busy stip like Wailea or Kaanapali. Huge, manicured grounds and three pools with good service. Nice rooms, good service and variety in food at the hotel and all around the resort (basically a secluded neighbourhood with the Ritz, some private villas and golf courses). We loved Honolua Store, a casual and cheap option for lunches and snacks and Sansei for sushi! It's very close a to a bunch of hiking trails (West Maui Mountains not Haleakala) and secluded but still only a few minutes drive to Napili and about 15-20 to Lahaina. One downside is that Kapalua area has a distinctly higher chance of clouds and sometimes rain. I read the stats beforehand and it didn't really affect our trip but you will see that it can be cloudy at the Ritz and bright and sunny in Lahaina. - usually passed quickly and we didn't mind a bit of a breeze and shade but if you want non-stop sun, you should consider this. We also spent a lot of time away from the hotel during the day. Nice amenities in the room , very friendly staff, excellent gym (pretty spacious, clean, good equipment) and resort shuttle to take you around the grounds if you need it. It seemed kid friendly without being too busy or loud for couples or singles looking for relaxation and fun.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: David E
Reviews.Content: On Friday 5 June 09, we left Phoenix at 10:50 and arrived on Maui at about 1:55 local time (6 hours). We rented a convertible, but upon leaving the airport, the sun was so warm that we had to put the top up to shield us. It was a very beautiful drive to the hotel. The road was one lane for probably the majority of the 31 miles to the hotel. We took TAâ€™s advice and took the longer (in distance) southern route and skipped the alleged cliff driving. Steve welcomed us very warmly and normally on arrival. No drippy fawning stuff. I always feel sorry for the poor folks who are forced to do that. We skipped the $18 valet as we almost always do. In this case it would have been more ridiculous than usual since it was a very short walk from the parking area. In the few minutes it took me to park the car and walk the very short distance to the reception counter, my wife had us checked in. She was a little disappointed however for the lack of information. But we soon found out why. The receptionist motioned to a gentleman named Rob to pick up our bags and take us to our room. It took about 5 minutes to walk/elevate to our room and all the way there Rob gave us a load of information on the hotel, area and restaurants. He spent at least 5 minutes more after we got to our room rapid firing information to us and pointing out places to go/see/do. We are value oriented and not the Ritzâ€™y type and so we generally stay in above average accommodations on a good deal. Normally itâ€™s a 5 spot for bringing our bags up. Being that this is the Ritz, $10 seemed appropriate. But after getting such very good information (in fact I had to make myself stop asking questions so he would go, because I wasnâ€™t sure I could remember half of what he already told us) I began to wonder if $10 was enough. We are in room 2314, which is on the third floor, but from which we can step out on to the green at the 4th hole. Very cool since you normally get hurt if you step off the patio of the third floor. The room is beautiful and huge. Within the 10â€™ entrance way there is a sitting bench on the left and then a large closet. On the right is a nice guest bathroom with a shower. The entrance way opens into a 21x16 well-appointed living room with everything you need including a 42â€� flat TV and an empty refrigerator - thankfully. If you have a laptop, bring an HDMI cable so you can hook it up to the TV. The 10â€™ window/door gives you a great view and lights up the room. Then you enter into the large 18x16 bedroom through double glass doors with a large, beautiful and very comfortable bed, large nightstands and another 42 flat panel TV which sits on a large dresser; a sitting chair and table in the corner, and another 10â€™ window/door which gives you a great view and lights up the room. Both rooms have a nice patio outside the door. Then through the bedroom entrance way to the bathroom is a large walk-in closet with an organizer and room for everything, and includes an ironing board and an iron. To the right is a sitting area with large desk and chair. Upon entrance to the bathroom is a large double sink counter. To the left behind a door is a large toilet area and to the right behind a door is a bathtub and a roomy 42â€� shower. All furnishings appear to be authentic Hawaiian (not that I would have a clue). There is no hint of anything dirty, grimy, moldy, old or worn and no smells whatsoever. The ambience is pure Hawaiian comfort. We booked this room through Costco Travel. $2244 includes: $54 trip protection covering everything, 8 day rental of the convertible through Alamo, 5 nights in Garden View 1 bedroom suite, $500 hotel credit towards anything charged to the room. We will add pics later.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful rooms, good service, incredible views”
Reviews.Author: Lainba
Reviews.Content: We loved our room. Finally a room big enough to really unpack everything for a week long stay. Service has very good, not as outstanding as other Ritz Carltons, but the location makes up for any flaws. The beach is downhill from the hotle and there are no lounge chairs, nor service on the beach. But there is a bar/restaurant beachfront. We attended large group events, which were excellent both in the organization and the quality of the food and beverages.

Reviews.Title: “not quite 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: staccatoprince
Reviews.Content: everything in the lobby and restaurants is ornate and opulent- the service is attentive without being stuffy. there's a lovely open view of the pools and the ocean from the lobby. mahogany, fresh flowers. hallways are open & airy to rooms. restaurants are totally expensive & not really worth it but this is kapalua not kaanapali you don't have that many other options. they offer plenty of diversions some complimentary which is nice, the rooms are spacious the bathrooms even more spacious. the buffet breakfast was something out of this world. everything from poached salmon & exotic fresh fruit to miso soup . now, the bad. kapalua is a spot that's cloudy 2/3 of the time which means the lovely opulent pool isnt fun. it rains year round. not all the time, but twice during my week there. also, the hotel is perched up on a hill and it's about a 1/3 mile walk down to a beach that's nothing special. stay somewhere in ka'anapali you'll be happier

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!! This hotel is amazing. Highly Recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: pstrauss00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing; the room, spa, level of service, food, everything. The service was outstanding and everything about the hotel was 1st class. I booked the residence section of the hotel which is a 1 bedroom/1 bath suite with two balconies. It has a dishwasher and refrigerator but no stove. I highly recommend getting the cabana at the pool, which makes it enjoyable in hot weather. Location is awesome because it is secluded from other hotels but just a 10-15 minute drive to Lahina. I'm at the hotel now but will be sad to go home in two days..

Reviews.Title: “A real review...”
Reviews.Author: beeradley
Reviews.Content: OK...Here's the deal. Some real tips you can use. I have been reading the reviews on this property for about 6 months leading up to our vacation to the Ritz on May 14-19. Bottom line, very, very good. Property is clean, modern, quiet, full of amenities and the service is awesome. Here are a few tips: At check in they will upgrade you right away without asking if the hotel is not sold out, and from what I've been reading they rarely are. We had booked a standard deluxe garden view room, value $495 a night. Upon check in they said "We have good news. We've put you in a deluxe 'ocean view' room" value $625 a night for the same room, but just on the "inside" of the property overlooking pool. There really is no true "ocean view" as the whole hotel is set way back from the ocean. That sounded great to us, so I asked what it would take to upgraded even further, say, to a suite. Well, they are obviously ready for this conversation with all of their guests because the gal checking us in pulled out this nifty price chart for all rooms. She pointed to our "new" upgraded room and the price was $625 a night. If we wanted to upgrade further we would have to pay the difference for the next level of room. We wanted a suite, but the price was $745 a night for an ocean view suite. But that's when i noticed something. The price for a "garden view" suite was less ($525) than than the room they had originally upgraded us to! In other words, we could get a suite for less than the deluxe room just because is wasnt an "ocean view". Well, I couldn't believe that a regular room was going to cost more than a suite, so I asked if I could see both rooms before I decided. They were very accommodating and I checked out both rooms. No comparison. Suite wins all the way. The suite was facing the outside of the property which just happens to be a beautiful golf course, and we could still see a bit of the ocean. It was was quiet and TWICE as big with a separate living area and two bathrooms and two showers, and the lanai is huge. The ocean view that the hotel keep selling is very limited at best. Don't be fooled about the whole "ocean view" thing. Trust me, you want one of these suites. It was awesome. Next tip; Valet parking. Valet parking cost $18.00 per day. But I found out that you only get charged that amount if your car stays overnight with the valet. In other words, if you come an go all day long and use the valet each time it will cost you nothing but the tip. At the end of the day, just self park your car and start the whole process again the next day. Side note: it is kinda lame how many spaces they take up for valet parking. Completely unnecessary. Lastly, take advantage of the Honolua store. It right there outside the front doors, and they have everything from breakfast to wine. Great selection and very reasonably priced. We never ate at any of the restaurants (way too many awesome places all over Maui) so we didn't have any sticker shock when it came to our bill at check out. In summary this place was awesome and the isolation is what we come to Maui for. If you want to be close to things, stay in Waikiki.

Reviews.Title: “Our New Favorite Maui Location”
Reviews.Author: K1334L
Reviews.Content: My new husband and I spent our wedding week at the Ritz and were absolutely thrilled with the whole experience. My parents and a few other wedding guests also stayed at the resort and loved the understated elegance of the hotel and the grounds. The rooms are beautiful and the hardwood floors make the rooms feel clean and warm. We loved the staff members, especially the pool servers, who were incredibly friendly and fun to be around. We have been to Maui multiple times and prefer the more laid back vibe of Kapalua. Although Kaanapali and Wailea are great and have nice resorts, the atmosphere at the Ritz was much more our speed. If you are looking for a relaxing, pampered time away from many of the tourists, this is the place. After spending time at Wailea hotels in the past, the Ritz was a treat and we much prefered the fact that it was less crowded and much greener than most of Wailea. Plus, even over Memorial day, it did not feel overwhelmed with guests. The Honolua store is a great place to grab cheap breakfast and is within walking distance to the hotel. That being said, we found the prices at the Ritz's restaurants affordable compared to resorts in Wailea and the food was excellent. We never had to fight for a pool chair (like we have in the past in Kaanapali and Wailea) and generally had a portion of the pool to ourselves. Let me tell you, after being jammed in on a plane for an 8 hour trip to Maui, the relative lack of cheesy tourists fighting for seats at the pool was incredibly refreshing. Also, the maid staff was excellent. Our room looked like an entirely different place after they came and everything was organized, yet also easy to find. Overall, this place was a surprising gem after reading other reviews and reports about Kapalua's poor weather. We were in Kapalua for 2 weeks and saw no wind or rain and were thrilled with the absolutely beautiful views. Maybe May is the right month to come! As a side note, we married at the Plantation House restaurant and had our rehearsal dinner at the Pineapple Grill, both FABULOUS places in Kapalua to eat and our favorite food on Maui. We will definitely be coming back to the Ritz, especially if their rate specials continue. For our money, we would rather stay here than anywhere on the island outside of Hotel Hana Maui and in comparison, the Ritz is MUCH closer to any desired ammenities than Hana! In sum, the Ritz is understated elegance at its best. Its relative remote location compared to other more popular locations keeps it feeling like a peaceful retreat from overcrowded West and South Maui. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: ipos4767
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. They have taken the old Ritz concept and turned it upside down. This hotel is very very casual.We like a hotel with no stuffyness. Everyone very friendly. Service was fine. Rooms very nice and grounds are beautiful. If you like casualness and rlaxed location you will love the Ritz. Kapalua itself is a stunning area.Restaurants around are very good especially fish at Plantaion House. Good walking trails everywhere. Go enjoy yourself in shorts and a tee shirt.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sjmann
Reviews.Content: This was the first time that I have ever stayed at a The Ritz Carlton Hotel and I hope that it is not my last. The Ritz is located in Kapalui which is about a 10 minute drive from Lahaina. Its lovely and quiet and relaxing. Everything I was looking for. We worked out at their fitness center and played tennis at their tennis courts. We swam everyday at the pool. We were too lazy to walk to the beach. We had a suite on the 9th floor and the room was amazing. Lots of space and spread out, even though it was just us 2. Go to the sushi restaurant Sensai, but make dinner reservations because we had to wait an hour. It was worth it. The dragon roll and the roll with the Hawaiian ahi was my favorite. Please order the fried icecream its delish!! Its also big so share with someone else.

Reviews.Title: “A must for anyone visiting Maui”
Reviews.Author: super99
Reviews.Content: We absolutely Loved this hotel. The staff were wonderful, the hotel itself is beautiful and the beach in front is amazing. For young or old couples, young familes or corporate trips this is a fantastic place, the only people who may like more noise are teenagers (but the surf right on your door step would probably keep at least half that group very happy). Coming from Wailea (which is also Gorgeous) we thought this part of Maui was especially beautiful. The drive to the north of the hotel (and I'm worried to share this for fear of it losing some of its charm) is unbelieveable, easily a rival, if not superior to the Hana drive. And the blow hole is a must (check the tides and times though to make sure you're there for the action).

Reviews.Title: “The extra expense is worth the peace of mind”
Reviews.Author: chillisgone
Reviews.Content: Its always fun and often mystifying to read reviews of places you have just come from-in fact were there at the same time as other reviewers. So, with that in mind, we stayed at the Ritz Carlton May 12 to the 22nd. We are late 50s, a couple, who've been to a fair number of places around the world and stayed in hotels/condos/inns/homes/tents, etc. We are not Ritz kind of people; probably more B&B types and New England/suburban NYC types for background. We found the Ritz to run like clockwork, with an ease and a "pizazz" that more pretentious hotels lack. We were there for 10 nights and we were just downright impressed-its that easy to say. All of the reports we read here about a cat on luggage, dust, noise at the pool, walking too far to the car and assorted mind numbing comments are just that-was it the hotel, their mates, the trip as a whole that created those curious memories? Is that what we base our travel plans on? Our take-we booked through amex platinum plus (no winner here in this scenario nor for that matter the seemingly indecent "bait and switch" tactics? of United Airlines-now there's an important issue that you will fall afoul of that should be addressed) and got a good room with an upgrade, breakfast, late checkout etc. and the 5th night free. Excellent deal. The staff was totally responsive, friendly, knowledgeable-well trained. Spend 10 days at a resort, smile, communicate, make reasonable requests, acknowledge the assistance and you will see the operation in its best and worst light. This outfit had it all. Really. The grounds are spectacular, pool, layout-this is Hawaii at its best. The included breakfast was buffet style and they would prepare something other than the buffet for you-the prices in Hawaii for food are astronomical and at the Ritz, that and beyond. The included breakfast, though was the best deal in town. As an aside a pint of milk was $3 at Safeway-on sale-get a Safeway card-and locals shops at Costco (there's one on the island) or grow their own. Certainly the food at the hotel is first rate but of course you pay for the experience. But back to the Ritz-if you want to see madness, hear good old cursing out loud, smoking everywhere, public drunkeness and havoc in general, there are a string of very well known chain hotels five or so miles down the coast-this is all West Maui. I'm all in favor of partying-I've done my share-but if you are looking for quiet, efficient, upscale relaxation then the Ritz is the place. The pools, vegetation, service and (sorry, lack of screaming kids) make this place a delight; if you check out their deals you may be surprised that it is not that far off from what that 800 room hotel with the small pool and noisy elevator (and likewise guests) has to offer. The shuttle at the Ritz should be looked at as a means to curtail transportation expense but probably you will want a car. Now, it can be windy there as any location will be in that spot on each Hawaiian island. Also, the weather can be more changeable than the southern areas of the island-but that's hot, dry and sunny always-very, It is separated from the collective inanity below, two beaches up is superb snorkeling, two beaches below peaceful crescent beach of world renown. We don't frequent hotels like this one, we don't play golf, eat $150 meals at the hotel's restaurant, or drink $15 drinks poolside. We were even a little uncomfortable carrying a Ritz bag we got, to the pool-but when we saw and heard the legion of kids at the other hotels-after traveling 15+ hours we knew we could stand a little "ego reversal" at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Unforgettable Weekend at The Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: Hawaii_Beach_Fan
Reviews.Content: After a couple of very busy days of work on Oahu, I hopped aboard a short Hawaiian Airlines flight to Maui for a long-overdue weekend at The Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua. Arriving around 9:00 p.m. on Friday night, I was very happy to check-in and locate my room: a One-Bedroom Residential Suite that was truly exquisite, with a kitchen and dining area, fridge, microwave, two spacious lanais (balconies), two large flat panel, hi-def TVs, a living room and separate bedroom. In a word: amazing. I spent an hour on Friday night on the lanai with a beer (okay, it was two!), snacks, a full moon and the warm Kapalua breeze. Saturday morning dawned a little rainy, but the rain ended by mid-morning and as things dried out I strolled down to D.T. Fleming Beach, one of several in Kapalua. On my way back up to the resort, I stopped by the "Ambassadors of the Environment" center and learned about the growing list of eco-related activities they offer. There are planned outings for adults, kids and families. Buffet breakfast at The Terrace Restaurant was outstanding...a huge selection of breakfast items (I ended up going back for one-too-many helpings) and a very friendly staff. By mid-day, it was time to get to the beach! Took a long swim around the bay, then body-surfed for a while in some fun conditions. Soaked up the sun, then enjoyed a burger at The Ritz-Carlton's Beach House grill which overlooks the beach and seems very popular with guests. Later in the afternoon, I visited Whaler's Village in Kaanapali for some Aloha shirt shopping, then headed back up to Kapalua to catch up on some work and just enjoy my room. Sunday morning was Mother's Day, so I spent some time on the phone with my mom and mother-in-law from my lanai while savoring the views. Watched the Lakers lose badly in a playoff game, then headed back to the beach for an hour of stand-up paddle surfing and some snacks. Later in the afternoon, I lounged around the Ritz-Carlton's pool (the pool area is terraced, with three connecting pools), then walked next door for some fish and chips at the Honolua General Store, which may be a "best kept secret" as the food is really good and very reasonbly priced. All in all, the weekend at The Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua was just what I needed - a chance to really relax, recharge the batteries, and experience the incredible Kapalua resort and the impeccable Ritz-Carlton service. Outstanding...can't wait to go back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - met expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Weluv2travel360by360
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to celebrate our 9th wedding anniversary with a six day trip to Maui at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. Our children stayed behind. Prior to our trip, a hotel concierge reached out to us to ask if we had questions. Unfortunately, the conceirge did not really provide us with advice on how to reach the hotel from Kahalui airport. There are two options: 1) an apparently short route along the northeast coast, or 2) a longer route through some of the bigger towns on the island. Wanting to get to the hotel as quickly as possible, we chose option 1. About 30 minutes into the drive we discovered that option 1 turns into a one lane road. Not one lane in both directions, but one lane total - zigging and zagging around several hundred-foot high cliffs without gaurd rail. We were twice literally one second away from a head on collision at a bend in the road. Only after arriving at the hotel an hour-and-a-half later, did the person who greeted say we should have taken option 2. A little late for that. IMO, if a concierge is going to contact a guest prior to the trip, they should fully explain both options of getting to the hotel. Other than the very start of our trip, the hotel and activities on the islands were really outstanding. Upon arrival at the hotel, we were greeted with a nut/seed lei. Although the staff never greeted us by name, the employees always appeared upbeat and happy we were there. We had a standard room mostly overlooking a par-3 hole of the golf course, although on clear days a beautiful view of Molokai and the Pacific were available to our right. Our room was in very good condition as a result of a recent (within a year or two) renovation. Hardwood and tile floors, separate mosaic-tiled shower, luxurious bedding. All things that you would expect at this price point. Kidding aside, the only minor complaint about the room concerns the ultra-poor sound-proofing between the toilet area and the rest of the bathroom. The rest of the hotel is what you'd expect - incredibly landscaped and picturesque, yet very welcoming and pleasant. The pools are nice, but not really designed for asthetic appeal. We went to the pools twice for a total of five hours, and I was able to doze of both times. As stated in other reviews, there is a bit of a walk to the beach (which is a bit underwhelming), but the path is winding and along landscaped areas. We did not play tennis, but the courts looked to be considerably neglected, almost like ten-year-old public tennis courts. In contrast, the golf course looked well maintained. A quick comment about the resort of Kapalua. It kind of reminded me of being in a National Park, but not necessarily in a great way. The public resort buildings look very lodge/cabin-like. Basically, they don't really look upscale at all. Also, resort paints alot of thier public buildings in this awful reddish pain that reminds me of old National Parks from the 70s. They probably need to re-address the master plan of these buildings. While in Maui, we ran pretty hard (lots and lots and lots of driving): Day trip to the Big Island - drove to National Park, walked to the end of the road, took a helicopter tour over the spewing volcanoe, saw lava flowing, ate dinner at Seaside Restaurant (which came recommeded from multiple distinct sources). Drove about half of the road to Hana and saw counteless waterfalls and vistas of the coast. Too bad that focusing on driving really robs the driver of enjoying the views. Drove up to Haleakala for the sunsert and to see the stars. We were virtually the only ones there! Priceless and aside from the small National Park admission fee, practically free. Drove down to Wailea area and went to "Turtle Beach" to swim with the turtles. Walking to the beach, we ran into a couple from Poland who boasted about just seeing several turtles. Minutes later I very nearly drowned... and we never saw a single turtle. Took a sunrise sail with Trilogy to Lanai'i and did some fun snorkeling. I recommend doing this if you want an easy day of adventure. Went to Lahaina and Whaler's Village in Kaanapali for gift shopping. Overall, we had a wonderful trip, and based on our personal travel experiences, I would rank this hotel somewhere between 10th and 15th all-time.

Reviews.Title: “All I have to say is "AMAZING" and so worth it.”
Reviews.Author: Jean6
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have stayed at. The rooms, the view, the staff, location, etc were all wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon at Ritz-Carlton Kapalua!”
Reviews.Author: IL0VEtravel00
Reviews.Content: We went to Big Island for the first 5 days of our honeymoon and saved our stay at The Ritz Carlton Kapalua for the 2nd half our trip February 4-9th because I had a feeling it would be hard to beat. The Ritz Carlton Kapalua did not disappoint. I work for an online travel company traveling to many resort destinations in North America and stay at amazing places. I wanted to surprise my husband by planning some activities and I worked with several of the concierges before we arrived who were all helpful and wonderful to work with. Once we arrived, they made us feel welcome and executed our excursions with ease. All the staff throughout the hotel were friendly and helpful in anything we needed. The resort is beautiful. Great dÃ©cor in the main areas and rooms. The hotel is a U shape with several pools in the center. Great views of the deep blue ocean and white capped waves along the coast. They also have a nice private beach and there were great waves. We ate dinner at the resort several nights and enjoyed the ambiance and food at each one. We had lunch one day at the restaurant overlooking the beach which was a nice casual and tasty lunch. The room was very spacious and well appointed with nice wood floors that you donâ€™t often see in hotel rooms. The bed was very comfy! I often stay at nice hotels but one thing that is hard to find is good energy. The lobby always had a â€œbuzzâ€� and positive energy from all the guests. There was live music every night in the lobby which was really enjoyable. We went to the nearby Kapalua Adventure Center for the zip line and â€œbig swingâ€� adventure. It was a fun 4 hours complete with great views and plenty of information from the guide about the area and local traditions. We also drove around the island thru upcountry (great winery!) and up to Mauna Kea Summit. There are amazing views not just at the top but the ride up and down the mountain too. One thing that was very surprising and interesting on our visit was all the different climates around the islands. Depending on which side of the island you are on and also the elevation. Another day we went on an all day boat trip with Captain Woody at the conciergeâ€™s suggestion. We wanted to spend the day at sea but not on a mega touristy boat. This was perfect for us. He takes 6 passengers (in our case -3 couples) plus another staff member. It was a great day- we saw whales (it was in season), dolphins, snorkeled with turtles and lots of fish. The passengers let Woody know what theyâ€™d like to do and see- there is no set itinerary for each trip. He goes places depending on what everyone wants to do to find the best things to see and do. The last day we got a couples massage before our trip back home. They have a fabulous spa and we had one of the best massages ever (and I get massages often). It was a great finish to a memorable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Relaxing Getaway”
Reviews.Author: vtgambler
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in a â€œresidential suiteâ€� at the end of April. We decided to splurge for the Ritz on Maui since the portion of our trip on Big Island was paid for. I canâ€™t say enough good things about this resort. Room: The suite was huge. Bedroom was spacious with big bathroom and closet. The main portion of the suite included the kitchenette, dining table and 2 couches. There were 2 lanais and even though we had a garden view room there was a great view of the ocean from the front lanai. Appliances/amenities: Two 42â€� flat screens, fridge, freezer, microwave, blender, dishwasher, coffee maker & plenty of dishes/utensils. Housekeeping did a thorough job and replaced towels and toiletries 2-3 times a day. By the end we had about 50 shampoo containers. Only complaint here was that our room was the first in the hallway next to some sort of utility closet or storage room so sometimes we could hear employees in there from our bathroom or bedroom. This was only during the daytime. Grounds: The setting is gorgeous. Everything is green and lush. The mix of palm trees and pine trees is interesting. Needless to say everything is well manicured. The place reeks relaxation. Beach: Was pleasantly surprised with the beach here (DT Fleming). Soft sand entry and clear water. There was pretty decent surf the days we were there and it seemed popular with boogie borders. Itâ€™s about a 5 minute walk to the beach from the pool but if youâ€™re really lazy they have a golf cart to shuttle you back and forth. There is a bar/restaurant down on the beach. One complaint was that you canâ€™t use the hotel chairs on the beach only on the adjacent lawn. Pool: Very nice and the drink service was good. Nice padded loungers and no hassles obtaining chair covers and towels. The pictures on the hotel site are pretty accurate. Yes drinks are expensive but exactly the same as the major Kaanapali resorts. We actually spent more time at the pool then we usually do in Hawaii because it was so relaxing. Restaurants: Ended up not eating on the property. Had considered Banyon Tree for one night but it was closed the night we wanted to go. Only other dinner option is a Sushi place that is not our thing. Service: Everyone was extremely pleasant and helpful when required. They also stop to smile and say hello whenever you walk by. We had no bad interactions with any staff members. It was quite a shock to the system for someone who lives in the northeast! General thoughts: 1) Some posters had noted that itâ€™s a long walk to the self park area. Completely not true. It took about 3 minutes from the lobby. 2) As others have pointed out, the Honolua store next door has affordable food options for breakfast and lunch as well as snacks, soft drinks, alcohol etc.. 3) The remoteness of Kapalua has been overstated by a lot of people in my opinion. You might feel like youâ€™re a million miles away from everything (exactly what we loved) but there are several restaurants within 5 minutes in Napili and Kahana. It also took us a grand total of 9 minutes to get to Kaanapali. 4) Maybe we got lucky with the weather but it was perfect the 4 days we were there. Apparently it hadnâ€™t been so good the week prior. 5) We used the fitness center a few times. Decent for a hotel but not out of this world. Canâ€™t wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Loacation. Very Expensive Dininig.”
Reviews.Author: OCTraveler06
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our second stay at this resort in the past year. This is a beautiful resort, thanks mainly to the location. While we were there we read an article in the Maui Newpaper stating how hotel bookings on Maui are way down. The GM of this Ritz is quoted in the article. Hopefully he checks these ratings. The food prices at this Ritz are OUTRAGEOUS. $50 for a Casadia, Mojito, and a Glass of Ice Tea. Breakfast Buffet $28, if it was good it might be worth it. However the choices were very limited and the food had obviously been sitting for quite some time. As some of the other reviewers said, I too heard several complaints from guest because of the outrageous food and drink prices and staff members spending more time telling you what they could not do for us versus what they could. Park your own car. Valet parking is $30 per day. Another outrageous expense.The hotel reserves the first 5 rows of parking for valet. Four and a half of them were empty our entire stay! The GM needs to take a hard look at these issues and perhaps if he makes some changes he could book a lot more rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous stay.”
Reviews.Author: BeakerTX
Reviews.Content: The room was clean, comfortable, and just what we expected. The location was great, with several dining options at the resort, and many others down the highway. The staff was very accommodating, and of course the views were spectacular. The only complaint we have was the food at the Thanksgiving buffet in The Terrace restaurant. $90 each for a buffet that was not much different than the local Luby's. There were some fancy options and plenty of variety, but culinary execution was average at best. The rest of the meals were great, and mostly worth the price. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: CraigJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the RC Kapalua for 4 nights beginning of Apr - overall very good experience. The property is newly renovated so the rooms are great - well appointed good size lanai, separate tub/shower, double sinks, everything you would expect from RC - we chose the B&B pkg/garden view and really got a partial ocean view (none of the rooms has a good ocean view b/c the resort is set back from the water as an ancient Hawaiian burial ground was discovered during construction and therefore the hotel was built behind this area. Beach (Flemming) - very nice - beaches are public in Hawaii so the hotel shares with an adjacent park...loungers are a bit back from the sand on a grass area, but very close. Only used the pool one day, was fine - multi tiered pool with full food/beverage service.
