Food was quite good overall - lots of choice at breakfast and quality was high...We at at the lobby lounge twice - was casual, decent wine selection and high food quality. Didn't eat at the Banyan Tree. Staff very service oriented and professional - overall service level was very high - nothing really negative to say about this property - really enjoyed ourselves and will like to return and will recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Most Gorgeous Place On Earth-Thank Goodness I Ignored Some Reviews”
Reviews.Author: MLPMorse
Reviews.Content: I had been somewhat hesitant to stay at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua, given the numerous negative reviews...THANK GOODNESS I stayed anyway. My husband and I had one of the best vacations in a long time and it is thanks to the Kapalua Ritz. Upon arrival we were greeted with enthusiasm and then were upgraded from our bargain Terrace Rate room not once, but twice to an ocean view room on a high floor. I did not expect an upgrade and it was given graciously. Our room was well appointed and beautiful. The amenities were great and sheets were of very high quality. The pool and the grounds on the hotel were beautiful and well run. We never lacked for service at the pool and then attendants rushed to provide us with chair covers and beach towels. Initially we were disappointed that the middle level of the 3 tier pool was out of service, but by the time we got up the next day the pool was running perfectly and beautifully. The area by the beach was great too...which brings me to the best attraction at this resort...the surroundings. Kapalua, Maui is honestly one of the most if not the most beautiful place on earth. The resort is situated in such a way to take advantage of the vistas. We watched an amazing sunset from the 5th hole of the golf course, adjacent to a native Hawaiian burial ground completely alone. Unreal in it's beauty. The restaurant prices are steep, but all the food was tasty. The good news is that within walking distance is the Honolua Store which is cheap and tasty. The service in the stores, concierge stand, bell men, valet and check-in were top notch and of the typical Ritz Carlton quality. I would and have already recommend the Ritz Carlton Resort in Kapalua to all. I am already trying to figure out when I can get back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Well done Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: jelloj1369
Reviews.Content: Maui is paradise. This place is just awesome. We had a residential suite on the ground level and it could not have been more perfect. We were able to walk out our back door each day...to the pool, ocean, meals, etc. If you can score the ground level rooms, you will be very pleased. It was quite windy, but you need that wind to keep you cool. While and the pool and ocean, we had nothing but sunshine, and that wind helped tremendously. The staff as a whole was awesome! The pool/cabana guys and gals were so friendly and wanted to help you any way they could. They are great resources on what to do and how to do it. The Ritz being the Ritz...its darn pricey. But, you only go around once right. Definitely take advantage of the Honalua store which is all of a 5 min walk from the hotel and is VERY reasonable on EVERYTHING they sell. We like to have a few cocktails at the pool and we learned very quickly that the ones served poolside are not cheap. We got around this by buying some liquor and mixers at the Honalua Store and used the tumblers from our room. Perfect! I was disappointed in the breakfasts...or the lack of selection. Not that i couldn't eat the Maui Gold pineapples all day (they are amazing! Low acid, twice the vitamin B, etc, and are only grown on the west side of Maui), but it would have been nice to have something else to choose from rather than the usual bacon, eggs, sausage, etc. My suggestion is to go to the Honalua Store once again. Thier full menu of breakfast, lunch and dinner items give you variety not found in the hotel. That being said...the restaurants were great for dinner. Kai was very good as was the Terrace. Didn't get to the Banyan tree...but heard good things. As others said, the hotel is not next to several other hotels. It is set apart from everything and sits back about 200 yards from the beach. This makes the walks you take absolutely breathtaking. When you do have to rent a car, we went down to Whaler's Village and found nothing there (strip mall). Lahiana is another story. This place actually has some local flavor and feeling. We spent some time there hanging out and people watching. This place can be packed at times when cruise ships are docked...so fair warning. Head north to Pa'ia. You will hear others talk about this place. Its the "hippie village" on Maui. Lots of cool places and people. We ate at an EXCELLENT flat bread pizza place along the main drag. Pa'ia was a nice place to hang out. Lastly, we did a helicopter tour with Blue Hawaiian. This was worth every penny. We took the Hana/Haleakala tour and had Gernod as our pilot. Dude was out of control with knowledge! He knew it all! The pics we got were great and the experience was unforgettable. Anyway, Maui is awesome. We came back to find snow in kansas city. can't wait to get back to the islands. aloha.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect honeymoon destination!”
Reviews.Author: JHS76
Reviews.Content: It has been nearly a week since my husband, Justin and I bid farewell to Hawaii and our romantic getaway, but we are still in a honeymoon state of mind thanks to the Ladies and Gentleman who work at The Ritz-Carlton, Kapalua. We had high expectations for our stay at this gorgeous hotel and every one of them were not only met, but far exceeded. From the warm welcome provided upon arrival to the beautiful rose petal turndown on our bed, we were wowed at every corner from the very start. We couldnâ€™t have asked for a better experience...and the Club level accomodations are a must. As a guest staying in on the Club Level, you have access to the The Club Lounge; which boast tremendous views over the property (which is breathtaking) and the food is excellent. Every morning, we enjoyed a continental breakfast outdoors on the balcony followed by an afternoon snack and glass of Reisling wine; which is my favorite. We induged in a couple's massage in an outdoor treatment room which was not only romantic, but relaxing and a great way to kick-off our honeymoon. Following the massage, we were treated to champagne which we enjoyed in the outdoor hot tub. We ate a majority of our meals at the hotel. The food quality and service was outstanding and ideally located; so we saw no reason to really venture elsewhere. The best meal we ate during the entire vacation took place at Banyan Tree, the hotel's upscale restaurant overlooking the ocean. The seafood dish I ordered was fabulous. We also had the pleaure of snorkeling together for the first time through the hotel's Ambassadors of the Environment program which was educational as well as fun. Linda, the Naturalist/Guide was a wealth of knowledge and a joy to be around. I would strongly recommend the resort and destination for honeymooners who want a romantic and luxurious locale to spend their first days and husband and wife...

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise!!”
Reviews.Author: abw2008
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for one week at the Ritz Kapalua. From the moment we drove in to the Kapalua Resort, we knew we had found paradise. We rented a car for this trip because we knew we would want to explore the island. We quickly discovered that once we left paradise, we couldn't wait to get back. We took the ferry to Lanai to look at both of the Four Seasons resorts. While the resorts were very nice, we didn't care for the island. In fact, we only stayed for a few hours because we couldn't wait to get back to Kapalua. The Ritz has service that is beyond compare. The Valet knew our names when we arrived simply by asking us where we were from. When we checked in, we were pleasantly surprised that they had upgraded our room from an Ocean View Suite to an Ocean Front Suite. Our Suite was absolutely GORGEOUS! I am a neat freak. This room exceeded my expectations. There was a large fresh fruit basket and welcome note waiting for us. The view from the living room balcony was of the golf course and the ocean. From our bedroom balcony, we had peaceful golf course views. When you stay at Kapalua, they have a FREE shuttle service at your disposal that will take you anywhere on Kapalua that you'd like to go. The Plantation House is several miles away and it sits on top of a hill overlooking the golf course, ocean, and a distant Lanai. We HIGHLY recommend it for ANY meal! We especially loved the breakfast. (Grand Marnier French Toast with Bananas) Contrary to what many have written, you do NOT have to spend $30 for breakfast at the Ritz. That is just for the all-you-can-eat buffet. The buffet IS worth it if you do it. We just chose to mix it up a little bit. We also went to the little store that is within walking distance from the hotel. (I forget the name) The food there was terrific too. There were quite a few locals there every time we went. Pineapple Grill gave us the BEST service of any restaurant and the food was divine. Merriman's was wonderful too for both service and food. There is a sushi restaurant there also that is pretty good but probably our least favorite of all of the Kapalua restaurants. (Yes, the shuttle will take you to ALL of these places.) Another place that the shuttle will take you is to the trails. Visit the nature center at Kapalua to get trail maps and sign a waiver. You can either walk from the nature center to connecting trails, or you can have the shuttle take you to the top of the mountain, past the Plantation House Restaurant, to the Arboretum. We hiked several connecting trails back to the resort which was approx. 7 miles in total. The next day, we decided we would hike from the resort back to the arboretum. (7 miles again) The shuttle picked us up and took us back. There are many trails you can hike with many different distances. Some are even paved. We encountered all different ages and athletic abilities on the trails. The pool was exceptional. They do not come by to get drink orders from you every 5 minutes so you're actually able to relax. We had NO trouble getting great chairs any of the days we were there. Fleming Beach is beautiful. The water was a little cold for our liking, but the atmosphere is extremely relaxing. There is a Ritz beach hut there also so you are able to have drinks and service while you are there. We didn't have kids with us so we didn't need to use the kids club, but it looked super nice. The gym is AMAZING! There is lots of cardio equipment with personal televisions. There are free weights as well as circuit training. The room is HUGE. You shouldn't have to fight for equipment at any time. My husband and I plan to revisit Ritz Kapalua annually. There are no words to describe how incredible we feel about this resort. If we had to do our honeymoon over again, there is no question that we would do it here. By the way..the wind was wonderful! When you are laying by the pool and it starts to get too hot, that wind provides a cooling breeze. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Everything and more...(except the weather)”
Reviews.Author: J_and_T_WI
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua from 2/28 - 3/2/09. We had been on the Big Island for a week and decided to finish our stay in Hawaii with a 3 day stay on Maui. My husband and our son and daughter-in-law and daughter and son-in-law booked a package with 2 free breakfasts each day along with a round of golf each day and $150 in spa credits each day. The wonderful started at check in where we were upgraded to Ocean Front Suites. The rooms were spotless and beautiful with views of the ocean that were incredible. The staff was very friendly and accomodating with suggestions for dining and making sure that we had everything that we needed for our too brief stay. The weather was not teriffic - extremely windy (darn those trade winds!) cool, and rain on and off the whole time we were there, but we still had a great time! The first full day the guys played golf at The Bay Course (my husband says it was a fantastic course and he would definitely love to play it again) and the ladies worked out and then did a spa day. The spa was fantastic - beautiful, relaxing, rejuvenating and we enjoyed all of our treatments without exception! Staff again could not be more accomodating and friendly. The second day was pretty rainy and although the guys enjoyed playing the Plantation course, the rain won that day! We had breakfast in The Terrace Restaurant which had a wonderful buffet with everything you could imagine to enjoy for breakfast. We had drinks and lunch in The Alaloa lounge (The Ahi Cobb salad was absolutely delicious!) If we had had more time I would have liked to have dinner at The Banyan Tree, but we did go with suggestions from staff and had dinner one night at The Pineapple Grill (great drinks - coconut martini - yum!) and at Jameson's one night. (Fantastic fish entrees!). The last night we went into Lahaina and had dinner at Cheeseburger in Paradise - fun! All in all, we had a great time at The Ritz. The views were spectacular and even though the weather was not the greatest, we even got to go in the ocean and fight with the waves a little while with boogie boards. The rooms were beautiful, loved the bathrooms and showers and the beds were so, so comfortable! We were definitely spoiled and my husband said that they sure knew what they were doing giving us the upgrades, because we WILL be back and we WILL want the ocean front suites again! Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, but windy and rainy”
Reviews.Author: eberhardbrockmann
Reviews.Content: The location is the best on Maui! We enjoyed it very much. But : You need a rental car, because the location is not in the heart of anything besides relaxion and golfing. For brekafast take the HONOLUA store (two minutes to go). Due to the weather-conditiones we were not able to swim or enjoy the pool area very much (only for some hours). The room service was during the whole stay extraordinary poor, because we missed every day decoffinated coffee, tea and other things... The golf courses are pretty much too expansive for hotel guests, since it is on a rainy/windy day the only possibility to spend the day in thr resort. My resume: excellent location, not the best weather conditions on the island (windy and rainy) need a rental car, but enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Scenery, privacy, service...can't be beat.”
Reviews.Author: geno31
Reviews.Content: We were at the RC Maui three weeks ago, and couldn't have been better pleased. Can't believe that a recent reviewer offered an opinion based on a November '06 stay. Three years ago! Much renovation has been done since then, and the improvements are obvious. The rooms are just gorgeous, and although most of them don't have an "ocean" view (as the hotel is about a quarter mile from the "ocean," the scenery is gorgeous from almost any perspective above the first floor. We found the food great, but, as others have said, quite expensive. We didn't resort to finding the nearest McDonalds , although their egg biscuits are great. All in all, a great visit.

Reviews.Title: “Make sure a few things have been taken care of before staying here...”
Reviews.Author: opinion8dla
Reviews.Content: I noticed that some others had posted reviews from the distant past and had to share my family's experiences. We stayed at the Ritz Kapalua in November, 2006. I know ages ago - but I'll never forget this stay - and we haven't stayed in a Ritz again since then. Room number one was supposed to have an "ocean view" - it instead had a view of a plot of mud and workers noisily building a stage. The manager told me that "ocean view" rooms don't necessary have a view of the ocean. Room number two also didn't have a view of the ocean but I gave up on that battle. It did have ripped carpeting running the length of the room, a hole in the wall and black mold throughout the shower. I didn't want to complain again, but after my toddler tripped and I would only shower with shoes on, we asked to be moved 24 hours later. Room number three was an upgrade to a junior suite (which was a nice accomodation)but unfortunately still had the prominent black mold in the grout of the stark white marble and there was terribly stained carpet throughout. I continued to wear shoes in the shower but didn't feel like packing up the stuff and moving again. A couple of days later, I decided to try the spa out for a relaxing massage - and I hope it's been upgraded as well. At the time, there were two showers and a line of women 5 deep in front of each of the two. When I finally got into the shower - it reminded me of the shower at the local public pool - you know, the leaky fawcet, dingy tile and the kind where you want to wear your flip flops just in case. I kept asking myself - "this is a Ritz?" So, if you are planning on staying here (and despite our disappointment with the property - the golf is truly world class) - make sure your room is clean, take a look at the women's spa before booking any services and don't expect a five star experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice!”
Reviews.Author: JillyMcWilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 2 weeks at the Ritz Kapalua in December 2006. We rented a convertible at the airport on arrival (STRONGLY suggest) and drove to the Ritz. Check in went smoothly. The hotel is beautiful. The room was very nice, a decent size, with a balcony facing the pool. The bed was UNBELIEVABLY comfortable. The Ritz uses these amazing feather bed toppers that I just can't seem to duplicate at home no matter what I buy.... The pool was fabulous with fairly decent service. My only complaint about the hotel is the beach. There really isn't one...You have to take about a 5 minute walk to get down there and it's kind of a small, rocky area. The pool did make up for it though! The restaurants were good, but expensive. We took the car out every morning for a drive around the island. There is a McDonald's about 5 minutes down the road from the hotel so we would drive up there for breakfast and our morning coffee. The hotel is fabulous and, of course, five star - but it is kind of set apart from everything on the island. Nothing is walking distance in Maui, so get a car. Lahaina is right down the road, as is the strip of hotels on the busiest beach in Maui. The Grand Wailea and Four Season's are on the other side of the island. Overall, we had a wonderfully, relaxing time here. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful location, weather and all!”
Reviews.Author: cleopat
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week at the Ritz! We were there for a company/client trip with a small group. We have been to Maui before and knew that this area was more windy and rainy than others. Despite the wind and sporadic rain, we had a wonderful time. The views from the resort are incredible. There are many walking trails and hammocks overlooking the ocean! The service was outstanding, we were always greeted pleasantly, and the room was very nice. We had an upgraded room on the 7th floor (lobby is on the 6th due to the sloping hills) with a gorgeous ocean view. The room was very clean and comfortable. It is the Ritz and was expensive; be sure to check wine lists before ordering as I described the type of wine I liked and was served the most expensive glass. My mistake but I was tired after arriving and didn't check the prices! We did not use the spa and spent little time at the pool but it was wonderful down at Fleming beach, even with the wind! It is just a short drive to many other beaches and we enjoyed lots of them. We did drive the west 30 highway to Kahului. It is much like the road to Hana (my husband said he would never do that again!) but it was an adventure! As for food, there are many options aside from the hotel itself. We only had appetizers in the lounge (which was very loud in the evenings). For breakfast you can take a two minute walk up to the Honolua Store and get a great breakfast for $6, eggs and all! The store has everything including coffee, groceries, wine and gifts! The Cafe Kapalua is also reasonable and very good. I loved the mango smoothies! Another great spot for breakfast is the Gazebo in Napili. The wait is worth it! For dinner, you can take a complimentary hotel shuttle to Pineapple Grill, Merriman's and The Plantation House. All of the wonderful sunset dinners we had were delicious but my favorite was at Plantation house and that was not at sunset. It was the best meal we had during our trip! Yes, it was windy and we were rained on a couple times but we sat and watched the whales from our lanai, relaxed watching the waves and sunsets and had a great week.

Reviews.Title: “great room and private beach but not centrally located”
Reviews.Author: DoubleLane
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week via NWA package deals including airfares, hotel and rental car. Weather-wise, we lucked out every day during our stay. Every day it was sunny at 77 to 81 degrees with pocket showers sometime. Less windy at the hotel in the morning. So, we go to the beach first thing in the morning. The water is warm and smells very clean. The beach has no seaweeds or star fish like you would see along FL ocean side. The hotel is good for someone who plans to stay put using its facilities. Our room got upgraded to Deluxe by the front desk. Didn't ask for it. I guess it might be due to our late check-in around mid-night or due to the room availability. Also, we were lucked out with rooms next to us and on top of us. No noisy neighbors around. That doesn't mean the room is well-built with a noise cancellation system. One time, I could hear loud and clear the lady next door talking on the phone during the day. Luckily, she disappeared since then. By the way, the lobby is located on the 7th floor. Make sure you get the floor as high as you can (tower 1 has 8 floors and tower 2 has 9). It is far from many other attractions. Luckily, Maui is not a big island. Wherever we go, it takes 20 or 30 minutes except Hana and the Haleakala Summit. We did not try any of its restaurants. If you like to know my favorite eating places in Maui, read my reviews under restaurants category. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation of Our Lives!”
Reviews.Author: melanierc23
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from our trip to Maui. We stayed in the Ritz-Carlton for 5 nights and loved every minute of it. After a very long flight/day, we checked in at around 12 AM (5 AM EST) and were nicely suprised to find that our room had been upgraded from a Deluxe Room to a Residential Garden View Suite. The room was amazing and the view of the garden/pool area was breathtaking. I really do not understand how anyone could give this place a poor review unless they are entirely too high maintenance. Every inch of the resort is spotless, with a newly remodeled decor complete with hardwood flooring, huge mirrors, and 40" HD televisions (one in the living area and one in the bedroom). We didnt use many of the services; however, at our daily visits to the pool, the staff was very friendly and attentive. There were some children but the place didn't seem to be overrun by them. The best thing about the hotel was its location. It wasn't located in a strip of busy hotels, it was set apart from them. The drive into Lahaina only took about 20 minutes. If you want a hotel that caters to partying/nightlife, this isn't the place for you. The hotel is very quiet near dark, with wild nights taking a backseat to romance and relaxation. We will definitetly be staying here again! PROs: Beautifully decorated, lush landscape, comfortable room, quiet and relaxing CONs: A little pricey: the computers in the business center could be used for $.75 per minute/5 minute min., 8 ounce drinks at the oceanside bar were $12.50, etc. This is the Ritz-Carlton however, so be prepared to pay top dollar. WARNING: From the airport take the route that runs around the south side of the island thru Lahaina, not the route the Google suggests around the North side, definetly if you are coming in after dark. The road is extremely dangerous to drive, with some sections only one way right on the edge of cliffs (no guardrails)--no joke--and the route through Lahaina is much quicker!

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: MissAdventure11
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua on Maui for 12 days in January. This was primarily a business trip, but I managed to fit in a few days of relaxation. The hotel is located on the Western side of the island, making it highly vulnerable to the winds that come off of the mountains. It is not well-sited and does not afford it's occupants a good opportunity to enjoy the little bit of sun that pops out, mid-day. The pool area is adequate, but the lounge chairs are utilitarian and the towels thin. Not what you'd expect from a Ritz. No cold towels offered, no spritzing. Quite a step down from what I am used to. The overall service is poor. After befriending some of the staff, I learned that the Ritz had recently laid off approximately 20% of its staff. Not wise, when they were expecting a group of over 800 for almost ten days in January! Front desk was outstanding; very helpful and friendly. This is where the expected Ritz attitude ended. Bell desk staff were unfriendly, bordering on rude. They had a general air of indifference, which I attributed to being short-staffed. I saw the same four guys all week, even when several hundred people were departing for various tours. Still, no need to take it out on the guests, who are responsible for your tips! Restaurant outlets are mediocre, at best. Limited menus, unpleasant and unattentive waitstaff. But the usual high prices you'd expect on Maui. Food quality was good, but not outstanding. Rooms were quite nice, although some were tired, considering that this property supposedly just underwent a multi-million dollar renovation. Again, not what I have come to expect from a Ritz. In general, there is an air of indifference with this property, which I have never seen at another Ritz (which I frequent in my business). I would not recommend for a group, although a leisure traveler might enjoy the scenic location during a warmer time of the year (think April-October). One last note: Kapalua is rather remote; the better beaches are in Wailea and in Lahaina, which is anywhere from 30-60 minutes away. It is also a good 45 minutes from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Don't trust google maps!”
Reviews.Author: hardeights
Reviews.Content: First of all, don't trust Google Maps to tell you how to get from Kahalui to the Ritz in Kapalua. They will send you around the wrong side of the volcano and while technically it is "shorter" it will take you an extra hour, and you'll be driving next to 10,000 foot cliffs the entire way. The hotel was very nice, the grounds were excellent. The staff was also wonderful. My only complaint, if you could call it that, were that there were LOTS of kids. If you are going for a romantic getaway, there are better spots in Maui. Unless your idea of romance involves lots of children :) Also, the Ritz tends to be in a more weather-y type area in Maui. Because of the two volcanoes, some parts of the island are just cloudy and wet a lot. The Ritz part (Kapalua) is usually cloudy. But 20 minutes south in Lanai, it's usually sunny.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Coordinator at the time -- completely useless!”
Reviews.Author: eekthetripsinaweek
Reviews.Content: We had a house in Maui at the time, so we only booked an evening at this hotel when my sister's wedding reception was held there. They spent over $60K for the festivities at this hotel, and since I was the matron of honor, the rest of the girls at of the bridal party and I wanted to do a little dance presentation, shall we say, the Hukilau Song for the newlyweds. We wanted to do something goofy! Anyway, I asked the Ritz's Wedding Coordinator (hired solely to make this event a success) for song lyrics, as well as to give us instructions on how to do the hula hand gestures. The flake just handed me a lyric sheet (1-1/2 hours after my request) and told me she didn't know how to do the hula hand gesture thing. To native Hawaiians btw, this is like grade school stuff. She was a local, and certainly the Ritz had hula programs even. Couldn't she even make an effort? As for the hotel, no big deal. Boring and stuffy as usual.

Reviews.Title: “expected more”
Reviews.Author: Rane
Reviews.Content: Nothing to remember. Like standard Marriott with better furniture and colors. Very expensive. The staff try to be polite only because management says they have to. The pool area is beautiful and very large but nobody takes care of used/empty chairs. In the afternoon there seem to be no vacant chairs although people have already left. This northern part of the island is more windy and rainy than southern.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Property & Unparalleled Staff”
Reviews.Author: London_UKSam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the RC for 6 nights and were extremely impressed. The property is beautiful and the staff were truly exceptional in anticipating our every need. Having stayed in many RC's before, we felt very much at home and enjoyed the super service that is on offer. The rooms and suites are beautifully appointed, the scenery is absolutely stunning and the facilities are excellent. More than anything, the eagerness of the staff to make our vacation memorable shines out. Of particular note was the excellent restaurant offerings, with the outstanding Chef Mark and his team making our stay a culinary delight.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality for a High Price”
Reviews.Author: JuJuSnap
Reviews.Content: The grounds of the Ritz Carlton Kapalua were lovely and pleasant to stroll around, which was a good thing considering the state of our hotel room. We had a reservation for an ocean view room and ended up on a ground floor room with a partial view. The first day we checked in, we found two very large mosquitoes on our walls. That evening, we found another insect in the bathroom that looked like a cross between a cockroach and a beetle that eventually escaped through a large crack in the wall just under the sink area. The following night, the same type of insect appeared again, this time about the size of a dragonfly. A very strong moldy smell permeated throughout the room every time the A/C was switched on. The bedding was very damp and also smelled of mold throughout our three night stay. The drinking glasses in the room were also very dirty with lipstick prints still visible on the rims. We could also hear the people in the room above us using their bathtub. The noise of the water running was so loud that it sounded like it was coming from our bathroom and consequently woke us up. While the Ritz maintained nice scenery and a friendly staff, the conditions of our room were unacceptable, especially considering the rate. Problems listed above should not exist in a three star hotel, let alone a five star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “If you like rain, stay here....the only negative about this fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fabfinds
Reviews.Content: Well.........the first few days of my trip, I would have said stay away at all costs...we had three straight days of rainy/windy weather but the sun ended up peeking out at the end of the day. Then we had two solid days of rain, so it was movies and shopping but paying what we did that was not what we had in mind. Then finally we got a good string of weather, while they said the weather was not typical you have to bear in mind that it is winter, and while some rain is likely, there was a strorm system that had moved in from California. That put a big dampner on my trip, no pun intended!! The lobby is OK, wasnt' super impressive but the hotel gets much better beyond the lobby. The hotel itself is beautiful, not the most beautiful ritz we have stayed at, but the location, the way its perched high on a cliff overlooking the ocean and the pool are all specatcular. The rooms are nice not over the top, comfy beds, nice bathrooms. One thing that made me crazy was they have a full length mirror in the bathroom and one tiny bathroom above the minibar and that is it. So when there are two or three people trying to get ready at night, it was super inconvenient since we were all vying for the same mirror in the bathroom, why they didnt' put a nice sized mirror in the room mystifies me. The staff couldn't have been nicer/friendlier, truly goes out of their way to help. Breakfast was good a nice buffet or typcial menu, for family of five runs about $150 including tax for buffet. The pools are really beautiful and getting a chair is not crazy as it is in other hotels, though on those nicer days, they filled up fast. Great beachside and poolside casual reastaurants for lunch. We had stayed at the Grand Wailea last time and this is much smaller, more intimate, we went back this time just to take a look and it felt more like a convention center at the Wailea just in how huge it is, coming back to the Ritz was nice. The rain is the major negative. The Banyan Tree restaurant in the hotel was very mediocre, so wouldn't necessarily recommend, we went for their special new years eve dinner and wasn't thrilled especially compared with the excellent meals we had at just about every other restaurant we ate at. I think this is a great hotel, on the last three or four days when the weather was wonderful, I must admit I realized how beauitful it was and how special of a place it is. BUT you must realize this is indeed the rainy side of the island, it is much higher and tropical sparadic rainshowers are not at all unusual. You must expect them and if that doesnt' bother you , then this is an awesome property. I think knowing what to expect weatherwise at the time you are going is important so you know what to expect. In any case, it is a beautiful place.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: izziechicago
Reviews.Content: It's an amazing resort. From the moment that we arrived the staff was very polite and tried to cater to our every need. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. There aren't a lot of dining options on the property, but if you do choose to eat onsite the food is excellent. This is the rainy side of the island and so it worked out that we planned some activities in the morning elsewhere. Just be sure that if you book a snorkel tour that you book it from the closer harbor - Lahaina - which is only 10 min away. We booked our tennis at the Kapalua Gardens next door and were still able to add the charges to our room. They have a pro shop and offer lessons. They're extremely nice. The beach can be a bit windy by the Ritz and they don't offer any lounge chairs or umbrellas right on the sand. The Ritz area is in the shade and a few feet above the beach. It's still a nice beach and we really enjoyed it, but just don't be expecting a cabana right by the water. The resort is about an hour away from the airport and if you arrive in the daylight it can be a very scenic drive along the water. And, if you arrive at night, it's a long drive after a long flight. (But, still worth it.) Overall, it's a quieter resort than the ones down in Wailea and even when it's at full capacity it still doesn't feel crowded. The grounds were immaculately kept and it's great to see that the resort encourages recycling. We really enjoyed our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrace restaurant - terrible service, luke warm food”
Reviews.Author: Bigjim1962
Reviews.Content: We stopped in at the Terrace restaurant for their plantation buffet, on a Saturday morning. It was a great looking place and we had high expectations. But we were ignored from the start, terrible service, slow, 10 minutes for coffee, never asked for water, never asked for coffee refills for decaf, never told how the buffet worked and then had to wait another 10 minutes for our bill afterward. The food was luke warm at best, cold sausage, runny eggs. It was a terrible experience. Save your money and hit a buffet at a less upscale establishment, you will be treated a lot better

Reviews.Title: “a true ritz”
Reviews.Author: travelinsc
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Ritz Carlton. The hotel is magnificent and we have never experienced such incredible service before. It was so lovely that it was hard to drag ourselves away from the hotel. Our ocean view room was more comfortable than home! We were blown away by their daily breakfast buffet at the Terrace restaurant. We loved the Banyan Tree so much that we ate there 3 times! The Spa is out of this world. We enjoyed a couples massage in one of their outdoor private garden hale rooms. The Hawaiian grotto areas with heated whirlpools, eucalyptus infused steam rooms, and cedar saunas were a nice transition after our massage. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel we have ever stayed in! They sent us champagne and truffles for our honeymoon, which was a nice surprise!

Reviews.Title: “Bad part of the Island”
Reviews.Author: Sonia100
Reviews.Content: If you are used to staying in nice hotels, you will be disappointed by the Ritz. It's not nearly as nice as other Ritz properties around the world and the food is pretty mediocre.. They apparently renovated the propertyrecently, but the decor looks cheap. Also, if you visit Maui during the winter months, this is definitely not the place to stay. Because it is close to the mountains, there is a lot of wind and rain and it has been consistently about 10 degrees cooler than the closest city, lahaina (a 15 minute drive).

Reviews.Title: “Really Nice Hotel in a Nice Quiet Area”
Reviews.Author: d0orman
Reviews.Content: This place was great. First of all October to about February is the rainy season in Maui, so if you are going during this time you are going to get rain. We were there in May and it did not rain a single day. The Ritz is a great hotel with great service and a great pool. Most of the beaches in Hawaii are rocky, so you are not going to get the white sandy beaches as you do in the Caribbean. I also recommend renting a car because there is so many things to do on Maui, but most of them are far apart. Also it's nice to just drive around the beautiful landscape. Here are some activities I recommend. Scuba Diving - Google Maui Sun Divers and you'll get one of the best instructors on the island. It was our first time diving and Bob was great The volcano - this was an awesome drive Hanna Highway - good if you like stopping and hiking through the rainforest

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great for golfers”
Reviews.Author: Poutyblonde
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua in November 2008. Great hotel, wonderful staff and the best workout room I have seen at a resort. Pros: -Newly renovated rooms -Great price through expedia that included a $250 resort credit -VERY VERY clean (I'm a clean freak) -Great pool area, didn't mind the wind -Beautiful beach -Short walk to Honolua General Store - great for taking a break from resort food prices. For breakfast we had $6 Molakai Sweet Bread french toast -- it was the best! -Excellent seafood buffet on Sunday evening -Great workout room with view of the ocean -Interesting Hawaiian historical location - We were told the hotel was moved more inland so it wouldn't disturb ancient graves. Had signs around the location so guests could learn more. Cons: -Couldn't swim in the ocean at the beach, but that was because the surf is high in November. Fun to watch the surfers and body boarders. There is a great beach minutes down the road for swimming - Napili Beach. -Location was great for golfers, but we don't golf. We enjoy south Maui for snorkeling and it's about a 45 min. drive. Just a personal preference. We got to see Samantha Brown from the Travel Channel film a segment on the hotel, 2009 Island Paradises. Now we'll be forever searching for when it airs.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service and surroundings”
Reviews.Author: Alan856
Reviews.Content: Ok, it rained for half the time that my large group (400) were there, but the hotel had no control over the weather. Avid golfers still braved the courses. The hotel seemed to spare no effort to keep us all happy. All day we were greeted with smiles and a cheery "Aloha". Three times I asked for help and it was provided immediately. No member of staff ever said "No". Once a front desk clerk asked to be excused while she fetched the article I requested. She was back before I finished my short conversation with a companion. All hotels could learn service from this hotel. When it rained, staff moved two major events, scheduled for the beach, to the protection of Aloha Pavillion. I've no idea what our group paid for the rooms, but I can say this hotel offers Grande Lux service. The total experience is one I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Beware of Hidden Costs!!”
Reviews.Author: aznfoos
Reviews.Content: The service was nice and the hotel just good. It wasn't quite the Ritz experience that I expected and paid for. The beach is shallow with hard coral that scraped your hands and knees..don't try to surf here. The strong undertow of the water will tumble you more than once an hour, so expect more injuries. The pool was nice, but the hotel's alcove around it only allowed sun into the sun tanning areas between 10am-4pm before the walls blocked it. Above all, becareful of the hidden costs here. There is $20 resort tax/day, $13 exercise room tax (whether you use it or not), $18 valet service (that we were not aware of so we tipped $10 each time on top), and ~$20 transient accpoodation tax. It was a nice stay, but not the luxurious Ritz experience that I was expecting and paid for. I thought the Sheraton Maui was nicer and more price-appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Ritz”
Reviews.Author: NyctravelRN
Reviews.Content: This is one of the nicer Ritz resorts we have stayed at. The rooms are all newly decorated (Dec 07) and well appointed. Decor is hawaiian without being overdone. Hardwood floors, marble and top of the line linens, as should be with a 5 star resort. Maui only has 2 five stars and the Ritz is a great choice. The location is on the northern side of the island, which according to our eco-guide happens to be the wettest part of the island. But with that said the scenery is lush and amazing. Mountain views on one side of the resort and ocean on the other. The beach is public (as all are in Hawaii) and a downhill 5 min hike. There are not chairs on the beach so bring a towel of you want to lay on the sand. The water is very rough, lots of wave riders! There is another beach, Kapalua, just a few minutes drive (take the shuttle) where you can snorkel and swim in a cove. The pool is large, separated connected by waterfalls. The poolstaff is friendly and courteous. We rented a deluxe cabana and watch the VP debates. The sun does disappear around the pool by 4 pm blocked by the west side of the resort. Our only disappointment were the restaurants at the resort. They were overpriced and not up to the Ritz standards. So we enjoyed room service and went to the several really amazing restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel Maui experience”
Reviews.Author: M247
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 8 nights in October 2008. Overall we had a great time, enjoying pretty much all the hotel had to offer. Having stayed in a Ritz-Carlton before we knew what to expect and in Maui it didn't disappoint. What we liked: - Customer service: this was excellent throughout our stay. All the staff are really friendly and helpful. They are laid back and unintrusive, exactly what you want on a vacation. From the Leis on arrival, to free water during turn-down and free pineapple by the pool, this really made us at ease. - The room: they automatically upgraded us to a suite which was great. Plenty of room for a couple with alot of space on the lanai (two balconies) to relax and stare at the beautiful scenery. We had a fridge and freezer, and all manner of other items should you want to partly self cater. Not our thing but the option is good. The room was very clean and well looked after. - Banyan Tree restaurant: we had dinner here twice during our stay and both times the food was high quality. Being from the UK, since the pound has fallen against the dollar I'm not sure I would rush back to Banyan Tree on its price. When we went ($1.8 to Â£1) it was reasonably priced for a good restaurant. - Breakfast: We had breakfast included in our package so saved $70 per couple per day. Probably wouldn't have it if not included. But since we did we really enjoyed the selection and good service. Maui Gold pineapple is great. - Beautiful grounds: The grounds are kept immaculately and provides a really relaxing setting. It was quiet when we went partly the time of year but also the recession hitting tourism. Apparently Hawaii tourism is down 20-25% according to the local news. Also the Ritz hotel is very private and secluded, unlike Kanapaali which has hordes of people who can walk in or out of your pool area/hotel. In fact it is encouraged by the hotels to show off their facilities! - Pool: On balance we liked the pool. Different tiered pools and plenty of space. You can swim anytime you want since it never closes. There were several elements we didn't like (see my didn't like section). What we didn't like: - Windy: A recurring theme in people's reviews. Yes, it is windy at Kapalua. Apparently the trade winds blow pretty much all year. Pop 15 mins down the road to Kanapaali or Lahaina and there's very little wind. It's a tough call, for some the wind might drive you nuts if you like calm surroundings. For us, it was only an irritant rather than annoying. On the positive it does help keep you cool in the Sun. - The Beach: This is a marginal decision. The beach itself is not too crowded and soft sand. But if you fancy a swim the break is quite steep and the waves tend to crash onto the shore rather than roll. Not really the type of sea you want for relaxing swimming. - No shade: Again, this was an irritant rather than something to mark the hotel down for. There are no sun umbrellas and so very little shade. If you want some shade it's going to cost you $70 for a two seater shade, $100 for a plain old Cabana and $250 for the luxury cabana with LCD TV, ipod dock etc. We found areas by the pool where the palm trees were more dense and so offered some more shade. But be prepared to chase the shade during the day if you are not a sun worshipper. We would recommend: - Sansei Sushi restaurant - Located near the entrance to the Ritz, we went here a few times for sushi. Very good quality at a reasonable price. Said to be the best sushi on the island. Remember to book or be prepared for a 30 min wait. - Eat the fish: Maui has some of the best fresh fish we have eaten and fully recommend taking advantage of it. You can buy sushi grade tuna in supermarkets! - Hire a car: This was really useful for getting out and about. We heard taxis are not cheap and buses can take forever. - Visit some of the other beaches on the island: such a Kanapaali. It's a much busier beach but you can see why. Very flat and calm sea with a beautiful sunset view. - Temptation Tours: We did the Hana picnic tour with these guys. Had a great time with some absolutely stunning scenery (think Jurassic Park - some scenes were shot here). They really know how to look after you. One tip, the road is winding and can make you travel sick. Be prepared if you're partial to a little queasiness! - Honolua store: If you want to grab a cheap bite for lunch pop to the Honolua store just by the entrance to the Ritz. Good quality cheap traditional Maui food available. Well, that's it from me. So the hotel gets 4 out of 5 just because of the few irritants. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay with the Ritz-Carlton and recommend Maui as a fantastic, beautiful place to have a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Reminiscing of Destination Wedding and Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: buckeyetravelgirl
Reviews.Content: Planning a trip to Tahit for a early anniversary celebration and looked at the Ritz reviews...thought I would write one while I'm in that mindset. The ritz is beyond compare! It is absolutely lovely with the beutiful gardens and flowers! The pools are absolutely amazing! The beach is very private.Never had a better experience with customer service anywhere! The rooms are what you would expect high end and comfortably furnished. My husband and I dined many times at the Banyan Tree and on our wedding night the staff set up a table for the two of us down at the beach for a private dinner...beyond romantic.I hope to return for our 10th wedding anniversary in a few years...my visit was in 2002 post 9/11 but I can only imagine it is even nicer with the remodel. If anyone has any questions regarding a wedding feel free to email. My wedding and pictures were beyond beautiful I would be happy to suggest professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: LisaLuOhio
Reviews.Content: We debated booking rooms at the Ritz Carlton, Fairmont or Four Seasons. What won us over is the fact that the Ritz was recently remodeled and that they were offering a free night's stay plus breakfast. You have to love that! The hotel lobby is just beautiful, the staff welcoming and most accomodating. We were upgraded to a room with a better view by Kim (without asking) and it's just beautiful. The wood floors, furnishings, etc. are all lovely. The grounds are immaculate and just beautiful. Yes, it can get a little windy, but it didn't bother us. LaHaina is about 20 minutes from Kapalua and there's plenty to do and lots of restaurants to choose from. The breakfast buffet has been wonderful, delicious and the staff so nice in the morning. We can heartily recommend the Ritz and hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did!

Reviews.Title: “Down grade this property to 3 1/2 star but not bad”
Reviews.Author: yreme
Reviews.Content: We have been a long standing fan of the Ritz Kapalua, last year we stayed at the Four Seasons while this hotel was being remodeled and were looking forward to getting back to the Ritz. We are frequent guests of both chains and our young children are as well so the family expectations are high. Our impression of the remodel is that the money was spent in the lobby (think Vegas goes to HI) the residential suites and the spa & fitness area. The rest of the remodel was pretty poor for example the "wood floor" rolled in our suite was already buckling. The Ritz Kids program has gone away at this property when we asked for baby shampoo for the room they sent us Four Seasons baby shampoo. The dining is very limited so make sure you have a car to dine off property. The Banyan Tree which was one of our favorite restaurants has a new chef who could use some continued time at culinary school. The sushi bar is fine but across the parking lot is Sensei which is better. The only other restaurant on property open every day is the lobby bar. Nice new cabana's with TV and Mp3 players good for football on the weekends. They want $250 per day but if you are there for any amount of time they will discount to $100 or even nothing, depending on the tip you give. The staff us as with all Ritz very accommodating and we appreciated their efforts. We did have club level access which was a must due to the limited dining options. For recreation the ropes course and zip lines are a lot of fun. Golf can be a bit slow; we walked off the plantation course after 5 hours and just on 15th hole. We spent three weeks there and doubt we will return. It is unfortunate because this has been a favorite property of ours for so many years. It just appears that many short cuts are being taken it could be because the property is not owned by Ritz just managed by them. If you are going to this property I would recommend staying on club level and limiting your stay to 5 days max.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BermudaTraveler1
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed for 7 nights at the Ritz Kapalua using Marriott rewards points. We had an excellent experience. We had booked a regular room but were upgraded to a two-room suite with a full kitchen and huge bathroom/changing area. This was fantastic as we stocked up on breakfast foods & were able to eat in the room some days (you don't always feel like a full hotel breakfast after traveling for 2 weeks). Our hotel stay here ended a 2 week trip to Hawaii, also visiting Oahu (staying at the Hilton) and Lanai (staying at the Four Seasons Lodge at Koele). All of the public areas and our room were very well done at the Ritz. Also, all of the servers/employees we encountered were excellent. The only small negative we saw was at the pool area - basically, if you want shade, you have to pay to reserve a cabana or umbrella chair which range from $75-$250. This seemed like a rip off. No one seemed to be using them either. There are no chairs on the beach - the hotel has a small section for chairs kind of overlooking the beach - it's not as nice as the pool(s) (which is one of the best we've seen). The hotel seemed quite empty - probably due to the timing our our trip (Oct.). We ate at the Pineapple Grill & Plantation restaurants - both easily accessed via the "on demand" resort shuttle. We also tried Sansei (walking distance). My husband participated in the 3 day golf school at the resort which he liked a lot. Lahaina is a very easy 20 min. drive away - lots of dining/shopping choices there.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise in Maui”
Reviews.Author: Hodge42
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first ever trip to Maui, Hawaii. We selected the Ritz Carlton, Maui as we have heard so much about the Ritz Carlton and their recent multi-million dollar renovation. We went in with very high expectations and were amazed when they were able to far exceed our expectations for our entire 9 day stay. From the moment we walked in the door and they placed the traditional Hawaiian Ley around mine and my wife's neck as they called us by name. Our room was fresh and clean and over looked both the Kapalua Bay course with views of the Pacific and neighboring Hawaiian Island, Malokai. This was only the beginning of the excellent and personalized service that we received during our stay. We stayed on the club level and experienced the 5 meal services per day which was abosolutely an outstanding culinary experience (thanks to April) from their fabulously fresh crossiants with a huge variety of fresh fruits during breakfast to their terrific fresh fish, shrimp or beef selections during the dinner hour. Each meal service presented a different entree option as they presented a sampling of their amazing food for us to taste. This may not be intended to be your meal, but I will say if you stay long enough to try everything and have a cocktail or two in the process, it can easily be all you need for the evening especially if you cap it off with their many dessert offerings (best carrot cake I've ever had). The service on the club level is personalized by the terrific team of Leslie, Erin, Albert and Kong all getting to know your names and genuinely caring about you during your visit and by the time we left, we walked away feeling like we made 3 new friends. We did dine in a couple of the restaurants on site, our favorite was the Banyan Tree which is located outside the hotel with views of the Pacific Ocean. The food was awesome, my wife had the Mahi Mahi and I chose the Chef's Special beef selection that melted in my mouth. Once again the service was expectional and personaized thanks to Nick who made sure our experience was unforgettable. Other highlights included the outstanding exercise facilities (was great to look at the Pacific while working out), lounging by the beautiful pool with very attentive serivce from everyone, loved the samples of the smoothies and flavored shaved ice. I had the best Kona coffee and great conversation with Cindy in the hotel lobby breakfast area. And lastly it was great to be able to walk to the beach, swim, snorkel, watch waves crash into the rocks and watch surfers all without having to leave the grounds. The Ritz Carlton has a new program called the Adbassadors of the Environment program and at the suggestion of Erin one of the concierge in the Club Room we went on a snorkeling tour and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Our tour started with about a 30 minute presentation of the Ambassadors program and why the Ritz Carlton believes so much in educating their guests about the environment as well as many pictures of some of the fish and Sea creatures we may encounter on our tour. Then a short 5-minute shuttle ride to Kapalua Bay where we were fitted for our fins & mask. We had our own personal tour guide, Jaclyn who stayed within feet of us while we were in the water and continuously pointed out and named the fish, sea turtles and many other amazing sea creatures we were seeing among the coral reef within a short distance from the shore. After a fabulous picnic lunch which was provided with our tour, we returned to the Ambassadors of the Environment room back at the hotel where we were immediately able to review the hundreds of underwater photos we were able to take with our waterproof digital cameras that were provided with the tour. Then perhaps the entire highlight of the tour and vacation was the DVD put to music that they made for us which had many pictures that we and our guide Jaclyn took during our trip. This DVD has pictures and memories that are priceless and exceeded our expectations of the entire snorkeling trip as I cannot begin to express the feeling I had while viewing it over and over again. This trip was made possible by the terrific and knowledgable staff at the ambassadors program which included, Jaclyn, Amanda, Kepo and Ashley Carrol who is the Director of the entire program. I would highly recommend it to adults and children alike as it truly is an educational and fun experience for everyone. Thank you to everyone at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua for making this the best vacation we have ever had and for giving us priceless memories we will never forget for our second Honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Just simpy great”
Reviews.Author: greasyregs
Reviews.Content: There is no need for me to repeat the many positive reviews of this hotel other than to say that I agree. What really stands out is the incredibly gracious and friendly staff. Sure it is expensive but you get what you pay for. It is refreshing to be treated by employees who are seemingly so sincere in wanting to make your stay a great one. The Ritz Carlton has figured this out and it added so much to the enjoyment of our stay. One comment about the wind on this part of the island. Yes it was windy but for us not in the least negative. In fact, it was refreshing.

Reviews.Title: “Destination Wedding at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: wannabeguide
Reviews.Content: Our son and daughter-in-law were married and honeymooned at the Ritz last month. I cannot say enough good things about the hotel staff and outstanding service we received. When we arrived we were greeted with bead leis and taken directly to our Residential Suite room which had a very distant ocean view. When I questioned the "ocean view" the bellman called the front desk and secured another room for us with a much better view. The bride and groom had reserved an ocean front room and were upgraded to a spectacular suite with kitchen, living room, bedroom and huge terrace overlooking the water. Soooo romantic for them. We had scheduled a cocktail party in the bar area for the night before the wedding. I worked with Lani, the Food & Beverage Manager, through emails and phone calls and was a bit nervous since we had never met face to face. However, when we arrived there was message from her saying she would be off the night of our party but that the bar manager had everything arranged. She even left me her personal cell phone number in case there were problems, which there weren't. The bar manager also called me to confirm everything. The bar at the Ritz has a little area with a terrace off to one side that is sort of private and they set up these buffet tables with the wonderful appetizers we chose (sliders, shrimp, california rolls, mushrooms, cheese plates, etc.). They assigned two waitresses exclusively for our party to serve cocktails and our 2 hour party ended up lasting about 4 hours. It was perfect. The day of the wedding the bride, her mom and I went to the spa for various treatments and to have our hair and make-up done for the wedding. I have never had my make-up done, but thought I'd give it a try. Irma did our make-up and I would definitely recommend her. We had champagne brought in and spent most of the day using the spa facilities. When you book a treatment you can spend the entire day at the spa, using the jacuzzi, sauna, steam or meditation rooms, etc. What a special treat. The wedding was at sunset and, although it did rain, the clouds cleared and we had a double rainbow for the ceremony. The wedding planner thought of everything, including umbrellas. We walked from the lawn to the restaurant for appetizers and cocktails and then went into the restaurant for a lovely dinner. They had set up two tables for us, again off to the side, and we also had two waiters just for our party of 26. The tables were beautifully set and the food was scrumptious. We especially enjoyed the lobster set atop risotto. Yummy. We loved everything about the Ritz. The rooms were spotless, the breakfasts to die for (included with our room) and the staff made you feel like they really wanted you to enjoy your stay. Yes, it's a little more expensive, but worth the treat and, if we ever go back to Maui, we will stay at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding resort”
Reviews.Author: lovintheritz
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to make it clear that this resort is amazing! We read some reviews that made us doubt our choice before we left, but when we got there, we realized those reviews were all wrong. The service was excellent, and the people working there were very kind and helpful. One of the concerns before we left was the wind. We found out that we were happy to have the wind. It cooled us off when the sun was fully shining. The greeting we received when we got there was warm and friendly. The walk to the beach was not bad, and it is paved down to the actual beach area. It is kind of a private beach too with no public access. The resort even has a cart driving there and back, so we didn't walk every time. The rooms were wonderful. Yes, the Banyan Tree restaurant was a fine dining experience. The resort is separate and secluded, unlike other resorts that are 10 minutes away from Kapalua. They also keep the grounds immaculate and beautiful. Can't wait to go back...

Reviews.Title: “What a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: golfdreamer
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua to see the newly renovated hotel and were not disappointed. The completely redesigned lobby area, updated rooms and spa were a delight to experience. We were pleased to find that the personnel we encountered, from the valet, bell, front desk, and concierge to the management , have maintained the 'Aloha Spirit' which made this visit so memorable. We are looking forward to the next opportunity we can visit Maui and stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Hawaiian Paradise”
Reviews.Author: finetraveler0
Reviews.Content: The newly renovated Ritz Carlton is absolutely stunning! It's an amazing setting, the plantation course, the pool - or should I say series of pools linked together with small waterfalls, the open balconies with a beautiful breeze, the grand lobby and of course, the immaculate rooms. You know you've entered a special hotel when you're greeted at the door with the "welcome home" statement This is not your typical Ritz, it's way better! My husband and I split our vacation between this resort and the Four Seasons and I would have to say that I like them both evenly, but the rooms at the Ritz way surpassed the FS rooms. Avoid going during peak season, as there will be lots of kids. Also, this side of the island is windy, but I wouldn't let that get in the way.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: hansolo11
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a ten day stay at the Ritz-Carlton in Kapalua. We stayed in an ocean view suite with a king bed on the 3rd floor. The property is gorgeous and the room was immaculate. The staff was very helpful and courteous. The bed was probably the best hotel bed I have ever slept on. The room also had a very comfortable chaise lounge that my husband wanted to bring home with us. We also enjoyed having an alarm with an iPod dock and complimentary wireless internet. My only major complaints with our stay were with the restaurants and the maid service. First of all, when we arrived, we discovered that the only restaurant open for dinner was the very pricey Banyan Tree. After asking the concierge, we were told the sushi bar was open (I do not like sushi) or that we would be able to order food from the lounge menu. It turns out the Terrace Restaurant was only open for dinner on Sunday and Monday evenings, and the other casual restaurants closed early due to unpredictable weather. I finally was able to find a salad to order to eat at the Alaloa Lounge. But at just under $20 for a salad, I was a little underwhelmed. One other evening, we ordered food from the room service menu. It was good food, but pretty pricey for what we got. We paid over $130 for appetizers and main course, no drinks. After that experience, we made it a point to eat our dinners off-site. The other complaint was that turn-down service sometimes arrived so late that we had already gone to bed. Granted, we did turn in a little early, but twice they came after 7 pm and once after 8:30. Otherwise, we had no issues at all with housekeeping. Our room and bathroom were always immaculate. We used the valet parking service just once, on arrival. It was efficient and convenient, but we didn't want to pay the extra charge so we self-parked the remainder of the time. The pools are lovely and there are ample chaise lounges around the pools. But pool towels seemed a little difficult to locate. We could only find one cabana handing out towels, even though there were several scattered around the pool area. And finding a place to put them in afterward was also a challenge. We ended up just leaving them on the chairs. The beach directly in front of the hotel is very nice and secluded, although it is just a bit of a walk down the hill from the hotel. It isn't too bad, though, and definitely worth it. If you're staying in West Maui, the Ritz-Carlton is a great location. I would recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Wow What a Place!”
Reviews.Author: WestCoastMog
Reviews.Content: We were at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua for a wedding. Our stay there was outstanding. The renovation is beautiful ....lobby, rooms and new spa! Employees from management to all workers were extremely helpful and we were always greeted with a warm aloha and addressed by name! At the Ritz Kapalua your needs are always anticipated and the staff genuinely wants to please! Our wedding planner was a delight to work with and our rooms were all well appointed with great housekeeping services twice a day! The Club Lounge was always well stocked and the food was delicious with a great staff there as well. Needless to say I would go back there for another Maui vacation or better yet another wedding there :)

Reviews.Title: “Wedding/Honeymoon of our dreams!”
Reviews.Author: JustMauid082908
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our wedding/honeymoon from Maui and the experience was so great, we wanted to share! We had been in contact with the Ritz wedding coordinators for months planning our wedding. They were always attentive and responsive to our needs and desires. Every request we made was handled smoothly and easily. The day of the wedding went wonderfully and many of our out-of-town guests felt it was the most beautiful wedding they had attended. This was in large part due to the hotel ambiance, the service of the waitstaff during dinner/dancing, and the quality of the food and presentation. Following the wedding, we spent another two weeks at the hotel for our honeymoon. While there, we had "club" level access and enjoyed the multiple food presentations the hotel offered throughout the day. The "club" employees were always friendly and anticipated our needs, knowing that we enjoyed certain breakfast items not always on display. Despite the items not being out, they were always provided to us in a friendly and relaxed atmosphere. We were in two different rooms during out stay. The first was a gorgeous suite that easily accommodated the bride and bridesmaids on the day of the wedding. For the honeymoon, the two of us shifted to a standard room with a king bed overlooking the three-tiered pool and pacific ocean. We loved it! The housekeeping staff were always polite and non-intrusive. We valeted our car the entire time we stayed, and within the first three days of the honeymoon, when the staff saw us heading out the front door of the hotel, they immediately ran off to grab our car. No waiting. Overall, the hotel is beautiful, having just completed a major renovation. The wood work in the lobby is stunning and the new bar area in the front lounge is gorgeous. We also took advantage of the newly renovated spa throughout our trip. The massages were wonderful and the salon did great work. Our only complaint is that a lot of the noisiest gardening work was being completed around lunchtime, and it was difficult to really relax by the pool with all of that taking place. I guess it has to happen sometime though, since the grounds are so lush and well manicured. In general, the hotel is a stunner and the staff couldn't have been more friendly and accommodating. We will definitely be returning to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Not puttin' on the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: nextstop_somewhere
Reviews.Content: This is not the Ritz that you're used to! The location on Maui is not great, it's extremely windy and frequently rainy, there are other places that are much better. Unfortunately this property only has one pool and although it is large, it is very crowded. The worst part for us is that it was filled with loud children whose parents didn't seem concerned with who their children were bothering. If your plan is for a nice romantic getaway, this is not the hotel I would recommend. The restaurants are nice, the food is good, but it is not a resort-type location, it is simply a hotel. If you're looking for Ritz quality, keep looking, there are finer locations for the money in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Just nice, not excellent”
Reviews.Author: yanka7
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed at Ritz for one week in the end of August. It was our second trip to Maui. Everything about the hotel was nice. Just nice, not excellent. We had the ocean front residential suite. The room was spacious and clean. The view from the balcony was great. However, reading the reviews (and considering the prices) I was expecting more from the 5 star hotel. The hotel grounds are well maintained, but simple. We donâ€™t go to Maui from LA to lay by the pool, but the pool area was nothing special either. The beach in front of the hotel was decent, but not very inviting. Service was OK, not perfect (minor issues with housekeeping). We got an excellent help from concierge and had a great time with various activities outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “nice Hotel, but way too much"Special Event" band noise”
Reviews.Author: Racer356
Reviews.Content: Sayed here for our anniversary. Let me say that the hotel is very well presented, and the recent renovation ( maily decor and addition of a new Spa) is great. No real complaints about the service, it was typically RitzCarlton and pretty darned good. There were a few erratic moments that seemed strange ( like a bathrobe disappeared from the room, along with all but one bathtowel, while we were at the pool ???), and the coffe service for the "in room" machine was always an adventure to see what ( regular or decaf) and how many " one cup" packages were left each day, but these were minor and not really important. The rooms were lovely and service great. The thing that REALLY bothered us was the constant live band noise from special events at the beach each night.. Apparantly, during the May to Sept. months in particular, there are wedding receptions, outdoors at the beach restaurant, almost every night. They typically take most of the day to set up, practice a bit during the afternoon, and start in for real at 4:00-5:00PM. The bands' are live and LOUD, and impose themselves loudly on the whole hotel until around 10:00 PM each night. I fully understand the economics make groups and receptions a necessity, but 6-7 nights a week from 3:00 until 10:00 is just too much for me .Other guests alerted me to this problem almost immeditley after check in, commenting about the "rock concert" they had to endure the night before, I thought they were exaggerating -- wrong!! The bands are typical wedding set ups, with drums and bad singing , and masters of the art of LOUD . Usually, they aren't even that good!! If your idea of a good time here is to hear the ocean once in a while while sitting on your balcony enjoying a glass of wine while watching the sunset, you are probaly flat out of luck!! Nice hotel, good service, but LOUD LOUD LOUD!! Not much relaxing listening to hawaiin music. Also, while smoking is prohibited throughout the hotel ( I thought) a fair number of people smoke on the balcony, and especially near the special events. No one seemed to do anything about it. By the way, we had dinner at the Banyon Tree, which, while expensive, is pretty good. The whole atmosphere is very elegant -- until the bands start ( they are quite close by) and overwhelm the atmosphere. The staff jokes about how the special events are "holding the place together" so I suspect it will be a cold day in Hades before they clamp down and control this -- if they even want to! Be warned!!!

Reviews.Title: “BreathTaking”
Reviews.Author: babibirdee
Reviews.Content: A few things I LOVED about the Ritz were the pool - or should I say series of pools linked together with small waterfalls, the balconies and the view (there is no such thing as a bad view), the food was AMAZING! We had a picnic under the stars on the resort one night, and a luau another night - which were both amazing experiences. The property sits a few feet off of the beach, requiring you to walk a path down to the beach. It was a delightful walk, great view, very relaxing, people were friendly, beach was never crowded. The rooms were very clean, but every now and then the staff would forget to fill our requests. -The Suites were huge - bigger than my apartment! If you ever get an opportunity to visit this place - DO IT! I am dying to go back... ps. very romantic

Reviews.Title: “WOW WOW WOW”
Reviews.Author: julie-bugg
Reviews.Content: I cannot stress how magnificent this property is! My husband and I stayed here for 11 nights in August and were just blown away. I have nothing negative to say about any part of my stay in this hotel. I have always stayed at The Four Seasons but the new and improved Ritz is most definitely giving the Four Seasons a REAL run for the money!

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous resort!”
Reviews.Author: JeffSta129
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a fabulous long weekend at the Ritz! The hotel looks fantastic after their renovations-- the rooms are definitely a classic yet elegant Hawaiian style, yet you know you are at a Ritz-Carlton. The three-tiered pool is great, although there is not a separate adults-only pool which would be nice. Cabanas are available, and there is always someone around to bring you a cocktail. The spa, which opened in June is GORGEOUS! Its a huge facility, with a co-ed indoor/outdoor lounge and hot tub, and the men's and women's lounges feature sauna, steam room, and a hot tub set in what looks like a Hawaiian cave. Like most Ritz-Carlton's, the service level is what makes this hotel truly shine. From the moment you arrive and receive your welcome lei, the staff is always there to take care of your every need. For a more personal touch, I highly recommend the Club Level, which has a private club lounge featuring 5 food presentations daily, free liquor, and a club concierge. The service on club is so personalized, and it is really the most memorable part of the hotel for me. You develop a relationship with the club concierge staff, and by the end of your trip you are sad to say goodbye. Highly recommend this property-- everything is right there at your fingertips: beach, pool, golf, tennis, fabulous dining... You could have a wonderful vacation and never leave the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Carlton is #1 on Maui”
Reviews.Author: EvanPSP
Reviews.Content: We've traveled to Maui every summer for a long time and have stayed at the Ritz Carlton more often than not. The Ritz just completed a 180 Million renovation of the entire property and it looks amazing. This hotel is a magical place; the physical renovation was more decor than structural so the base of the hotel is the same, and the new design is beautiful. If you are looking for luxury, got to the Ritz Carlton, period. After a week there, we didn't experience one tiny thing that wasn't fantastic. The service, which is always high at any Ritz Carlton was superlative. Every person, Every Encounter, Every Time. The food service, and specifically The Banyan Tree, was out of this world. If you're looking for the ultimate Hawaii vacation, the Ritz Carlton is as close to a guaranteed level of satisfaction as you can get in travel. The people are great, the property is great, the food is great and the service is out of this world. We travel a great deal and the Ritz on Maui may be one of the world's best resort properties.

Reviews.Title: “Forget reading the old Ritz Carlton reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Luxurytravelgal_8
Reviews.Content: Forget the bad reviews . . . the Ritz is FABULOUS! My husband and I are in our early thirties and we just returned from a week vacation celebrating our 5 year annniversary. We read some of the older reviews and were hesitant to book our room here, but many of them were written before the $160 million dollar remodel!! Make sure you look at recent pictures of the rooms . . . they all have flat screen t.v's, ipod docking stations, marble bathrooms, and hardwood floors. The Ritz is a great combination of luxury and solitude, but within a short driving distance to activities, shopping and restaurants. The property is expansive and beautiful. Since we have a child at home, we were looking for a peaceful place to relax without having to deal with wristbands and fighting for a lounge chair at the pool (like some hotels in Kaanapali). The service was unbelievable- every single staff member greets you in the hall and calls you by name in the restaurants. The maid service was prompt and came twice daily.
