The hotel also sent us complimentary chocolate covered strawberries for our anniversary. The free poolside pineapple and smoothie samples were a nice treat. Some nice perks of the hotel were free self-parking and a mini fridge in the room. There is a free shuttle which comes on demand and will take you around the Kapalua area. Right next to the Ritz is the Pineapple Grill and Sansei . . . both were excellent! We had the breakfast buffet included in our room rate and I highly recommend doing it that way . . . it included tax and gratuity (about $65 per day). We had a couples massage in an outside cabana and that was amazing too. The spa is completely renovated and is a tranquil sanctuary. Some of complaints I read before we went were: 1) No cushions on the lounge chairs- that problem is solved. There always seemed like plenty of chairs for everyone too. 2) Very windy- it is windy but my husband and I found it to be refreshing when we were poolside (it was about 87 degrees when we were there). 3) Poor service- I don't know how people could say that??!! My husband and I are pretty high maintence and we thought everything was excellent. 4) No shade- Most of the pool are is sunny, but there are some shady chairs around the pool and down by the beach. There are also cabanas and two-person umbrellas you can rent . I personally wouldn't want too much shade or else I wouldn't have come home with a nice Maui tan! We recommend this hotel for families too. There is a small tot lot and a children's pool. Rafts were available for the pool. There are also children's activities and childcare available. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great stay at the RITZ”
Reviews.Author: podsk
Reviews.Content: My family including two kids, age 7 and 9 stayed at the Kapalua property from July 27 to August 2. I was somewhat concerned about some of the bad reviews on this Ritz, but as I have never had a bad experience at any Ritz before, I went ahead with the booking. Prior to arrival, I exchanged several emails with the concierge who arranged for a shuttle from the Kapalua airport, made several restaurant recommendations, and suggested several local child sitting services. During our stay our family didn't find one member of the staff who wasnt friendly or who didn't go out of their way to assist us in any request. On arrival, we paid for an upgrade to the club/concierge floor. This was supposed to have only a golf course view, but just past the 5th hole of the bay course, our room overlooked the Pacific and the island of Molokai. The views were spectacular. My only gripe about the balcony was that there was no outside lamp or light. Daily food presentations are available throughout the day on the club floor, and these were excellent. In the evening, there was even a chef cooking beautiful appetizers which tasted as good as they looked. The rooms have been recently redone and are very spacious. A flat screen TV and DVD player was in the room as well as a small fridge. Surprisingly the rooms have wood floors with some area rugs, and are very tastefully done. The grounds are beautiful and the pool area is quite large with three seating levels. Several comments have been made about the uncomfortable chairs. I am happy to say that cushions were installed during my visit and the chairs are now quite comfortable to lay on for an hour or all day! We didnt splurge on the covered canopy but if you are going to spend the whole day at the pool, it may be worth the $150 my wife was quoted. Personally, I didn't come to Hawaii to lay around the pool all day. The beach is a bit of a hike down a long hill, but there is a golf cart shuttle available. I played golf once on the plantation course and the views of the Pacific were spectacular. If you stay on site, club rental is included. There is also a free clinic on Thursday afternoon at the academy. Book it early. As noted the resort is on the north end of Maui and it can be a hike to get to get to parts of the island. I highly recommend a car rental if you plan to see other areas of the island. Hertz had our car waiting and we only had to sign for it at the concierge desk. There is great snorkeling nearby at Honolua Bay. My family and I highly recommend the Ritz Kapalua if you plan on visiting Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable Experience”
Reviews.Author: mhgone
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just had the pleasure of spending 5 nights at the Ritz for our honeymoon and we both can't stop gushing about our wonderful experience. Both the hotel itself and the staff are a 10 out of 10. The hotel is fabulous and everything is immaculate. The rooms are stunning and extremely well kept. The lobby and overall grounds are perfect and immaculate. The pool is also amazing and open 24/7. Also if you are into fitness, the gym is top notch. The service was even better than you could imagine. Everyone from the maids to the pool attendants to the concierge were extremely pleasant and helpful. Everyone was genuinely friendly and "seemed" to enjoy what they did. We did not eat at the Ritz aside from their breakfast one morning. While very pricey ($70 for 2), the food was excellent and it's definitely worth it to splurge. If you are looking for a cheap breakfast option, the Honolulu store offers great breakfast for cheap in addition to having a ton of other high quality low cost food and beverage options. The place is awesome. We did try a few local food options. I would not recommend the Pineapple Grille as the food was decent but very expensive. I think you could find better values. I would recommend the sushi place (Sensei) but make a reservation as it's PACKED. The only slight negative about the Ritz is the location as it does take time to get to the South or any other "tourist" destinations. For my wife and I, we did not care since we spent all of the time on West Maui. Also if up for an adventure, drive up the North Coast as it offers better views then the Road to Hana. However have plenty of gas and be ready for a VERY challenging drive through mountain cliffs. I would recommend the Ritz to anyone looking to splurge as it's pure luxury!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ritz experience”
Reviews.Author: skclkc
Reviews.Content: This stay was for a 20th anniversary. We have stayed at this property before and were very curious to see the new renovation. While I loved the decor of the hotel before it was updated, I have to say that I did like the new look as well. I describe it as being classic hawaiian. The Terrace Restaurant looked great and was expanded to accomodate more people. The rooms are nicely appointed with premium linens and furnishings. We were graciously given an upgraded room in the Napili wing. The front desk staff are truly the most accomodating folks you could imagine . The hotel seems to have retained most of its long term valued staff and that tells me a lot about the way things are run there. The Banyan Tree was much better than I had remembered it to be. Be aware that although this restaurant is pricey, the service and food are worth the expense. If you like dining early, there is a wonderful fixed price menu. The servers are top notch and most have been with the hotel for some time. My husband and I always book a breakfast package and this is the way to go. The chef on duty will make omelets to order and cheerfully accomodate any special request. This hotel is expensive but is located on one of the most beautiful parts of the island,. The property has an uncrowded resort feel that you just don't get in Wailea. The beach restaurant serves a wonderful lunch. The staff there is also friendly and they go beyond the norm to serve guests. If you enjoy and appreciate fine service and don't mind paying for it, this is the hotel for you. I consider it an excellent value over what I have seen on other parts of the island. We toured the new spa and it looked wonderful although we are not spa people. The new exercise facilities are nice but we chose to do the outdoor activities with the fitness staff. This stay was just amazing. How could it not be with such a beautiful property and extraordinary staff? There are a few finishing touches being put on the hotel due to the remodel but they did not affect our stay at all. The Ritz is located close to wonderful snorkeling and hiking. The concierge desk will help with any questions related to activities. Although we did not bring children, the hotel seems to have moved toward being more family friendly with evening beach dining and other kids activities. A new kids pool was added. The grounds are beautiful and full time gardeners work dilligently to keep all pristine. I recommend this hotel to anyone fortunate enough to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, now better than ever”
Reviews.Author: Hen-nyTN
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua since it opened, and have always been very pleased. We just returned from our first trip since a total renovation. We love it more than ever. All of the improvements to the hotel are beautiful and they make the rooms even more comfortable than in the past. In addition, the resort has added hiking trails and "wilderness adventures" that we found unique and wonderful. Best of all, most of the warm, friendly and always helpful staff have returned. We can't wait to return also.

Reviews.Title: “Hands down..best hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: HoneydewPorsche997
Reviews.Content: We were in Maui for 8 days during the 4th of July week. for my husband's medical conference. However, this is the second time we have stayed at the Ritz (3rd time we've been to Maui). We had the garden view suite which was a view of the pools plus partial view .The Ritz was recently renovated earlier this year. I was throughly impressed with the new decor. Everything is new and clean! Dark hardwood floors now line the suite instead of carpet. Nice deep mahogany side tables, dresser drawers, flatscreen console, and cabinetry. We had a king bed which also included a comfy chaise lounge that was next to the balcony. Amenities were definitely a plus: featherbed, feather pillows and goosedown comforter, flatscreen, DVD player (my son was happy when we were able to plug in the Backyardigans and Little Einsteins), Free WI-FI, Bvlgari toiletries (soap/shampoo/conditioner),Iphone plug-in alarm clock, coffee maker, small fridge, and maid service (2/day). Did I mention this place is CLEAN ??? :) The fitness center and the spa were renovated as well. We had the breakfast buffet every morning in their restaurant: Omelette/Egg and waffle station, Japanese breakfast (rice, miso, etc), ,Fresh fruit station, Cereal/Yogurt Station, Toast station, JuIce station, and other meals made to order. The staff was courteous and extremely friendly. Every time we walked by a Ritz staff we were always greeted with a warm smile and a friendly, " Aloha". The gem in this facility is the exclusiveness of the beach and the beautiful view of the Kapalua Bay by the pools. There are several pools with varying depths suited for all ages. We had a fab time by the kiddy pool which had a nice waterfall and various water features. You definitely don't feel like you have been "nickled and dimed" here. Noone bothers you here. Staff knows you are here on vacation and wants you to relax. Self parking is FREE. Valet is available. It is the ultimate relaxing and private secluded resort you will find in Maui. The Ritz is appropriate for honeymooners, couples, and families with young kids. Also the beach is in walking steps from the hotel. Towels are provided for at the end of the walkway. One thing I noticed is this hotel suits ppl of all ages. There are activities for all ages. There are trails around the hotel to go for walks, golf courses nearby, and great little restaurants nearby (Sansei, and the general store). You definitely won't be sorry when you check into the Ritz-Carlton. It is the best hotel in Maui hands down. And yes..we will be going back to the Ritz the next time we return to Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Just a bit short of the usual Ritz experience...but not much”
Reviews.Author: Alphatraveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two weeks and overall we had a great time. One criticism was the housekeeping which others have commented on. Having to ask multiple times on a couple of occasions to get beds made or items for the room isnt Ritz Carlton. Even though we rarely ate on site the couple of times we did were either poor value for money or just really average quality. Would we go back, yes....could they do better, also yes.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort!”
Reviews.Author: bobkat1955
Reviews.Content: This is First Class resort all the way! World class service, very clean,and just simply beautiful! It's pricey, but what the heck! The beach is wonderful, and if you want to scuba or snorkel the shuttle will take you to nearby Kapalua Bay. It's wonderful, calm water with lots of visibility and marine life. We have traveled extensively and have to rank this resort at the top of the list.

Reviews.Title: “High marks for this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Audrey3091
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived at the Ritz Carlton Hotel in Maui, we can truly say we experienced the best in service and accommodations. After an 11 hr. flight to Honolulu the evening before, we had to take another flight to Maui on June 5. We were tired and jet lagged. It just so happened that the Manager, was at the check-in desk; he greeted us and made sure we were set up satisfactorily during our 6 day stay. We were upgraded to an 1100 sq. foot suite with 2 baths and 2 balconies - oceanfront. It was unbelieveable! Every night there was turndown service, and towels were replaced twice a day. I never had to ask for a thing. Just fyi, my husband and I travel quite frequently every year and we never rough it. We work hard in our own businesses and hope to have a restful and luxurious room without breaking the bank. Going to Hawaii was less expensive than going to Europe with the way the dollar has been declining recently. This was a great alternative. During our stay at the Ritz, we felt like royalty. Many of the staff knew our names and always asked if we were OK. At the pool, the waiters looked after us regularly. Although there was a walk down a hill to the beach area, if you needed a ride up or down, there was always a golf cart available with a chauffeuer. We never had to ask for a thing. I was quite amazed at the great service. The restaurants at the hotel; The Banyon Tree specifically had the most delicious tuna I ever ate. Service was impeccable. I was spoiled and now everything pales to the food we ate in Maui. Breakfast was included with our accommodations- it was always fabulous. I was trying to be selective in order to watch my waistline. I was easily able to eat good and healthy without compromising taste. The staff always knew how we liked our beverages and brought everything to us on a timely basis. Also the hotel had a gratis shuttle to Kapalua Bay where we snorkeled. This was a wonderful experience and would highly recommend the Maui Ritz Carlton to anyone looking to have a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Look no further !!!”
Reviews.Author: Briandw
Reviews.Content: Ultimate luxury at one of the most beautiful beaches in the world. If you want true luxury, look no further. It offers everything you expect at such hotel; great service, true hospitality, smile and quality. If you can afford $100 more per night, don't go to average nationwide hotels but try Ritz Carlton Kapalua. It's the best Ritz I've ever experienced as well. Here's one downside of the hotel, of course. It's far from convenience. It takes almost an hour from Kahului Airport and 15 minutes to Lanai. No restaurants nearby. Only restaurants in the resort area, which are expensive. I highly recommend rent-a-car and stop by at Wal-Mart(5 min. from Kahului Airport) on the way to hotel. ABC stores are in Lanai downtown, but you'll pay about 20-30% more than you do at Wal-Mart.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: fly2288
Reviews.Content: Before going to the Ritz, I was a little nervous based on some of the reviews, but I should not have been worried. It was wonderful. Yes, it is a little bit farther away from the action. Yes, it can be windy and a bit chilly on the beach or at the pool. BUT, neither of those were problems. Being farther out meant more privacy, fewer people, and more peacefulness. It's an easy enough drive to the beaches and shopping in Kaanapali and Lahaina. We found those areas to be fun to visit, but crowded and more "touristy" than relaxing. As for the breeze, it was nice to have that to cool us off. Other areas of the island were extremely warm with NO breeze. And the "walk" to the beach is a paved path down the side of the hotel. No big deal. Be sure to take advantage of the shuttle to check out other beaches and restaurants in the resort. Great views all over. Also, make the drive to the beaches north of the resort. Honolua Bay is amazing for snorkeling and the walk down to the beach is full of beautiful trees and plants. The people who worked at the Ritz were great, especially the valets. Our room was upgraded upon arrival, a few minor issues ( really squeaky bedroom door) were resolved immediately, and restaurants were very good. Our meal at the Banyan Tree was fantastic, and we are big restaurant goers. Eat the mango chutney at the breakfast buffet! Our only wish is that they had an adults only pool area, as teachers on a honeymoon, we wanted to try to avoid the kiddies. Overall, lots of pool space, so not a huge problem.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kapaluaNewYork
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in several luxuray resorts and hotels all over the world. This is by far the most incredible hotel I have experienced. If you want an incredible vacation or honeymon please stay here. My only regret is that we are only here for 5 days, we are vising other islands. My bride and I are celebrating our honeymoom at this property. At her insistance I paid paid stay here in leiu of using points for a free stay at a near by Hyatt. (best move I have ever made). This is my only honeymoon. This is an outstanding property with first class service and amenities. If you are a Ritz Carlton patron you will not be disappointed. This is a 5 diamond property for 5 diamond guests. We have an ocen view residential suite that included a free 4th night and a $250.00 meal credit. I suggest you book at the Ritz Carlton site directly. The suite has a full kitchen and state of the art appliances and kitchen tools. We did not plan to cook but with the fridge and microwave we have the luxury. The pool, beach, golf, spa, and views are truely paradise. My wife swelled with tears upon first entry to the suite. This a 5 star luxury facility and is exteremly accomodating. I can not imagine a more wonderful resort. The best sicky buns at breakfastI have ever had. We flew into West Maui Airport and the hotel sevice van was waiting before we had our bags. One last thing I did read many reviews and from what I have experenced this resort is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Take your breath away...Ritz Carlton Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: maran17
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from an 8-day trip to the Ritz Carlton Kapalua, Maui. I have stayed at Ritz Carlton Hotels before, but I must say this one took my breath away. From the moment I first arrived the hospitality was incredible! From the valet, the front desk and the bellman, I felt like a welcomed regular VIP guest, where everyone knew my name! The staff was so friendly, knowledgeable and always went out of their way to make my day perfect. Upon check in, the front desk gave me running maps, hiking trails and a daily activity sheet. They also informed me of the different nightly specials in the hotel restaurants. The concierge recommended some of the most fabulous island activities that I have ever done. They would easily take care of dinner reservations and book activities. The grounds were breathtaking. They have a private beach that is so peaceful and romantic. All of the trees and flowers looked and smelled like heaven. The hotel was so amazingly beautiful, with dark wood, air smelling of Hawaiian flowers and open windows so I could feel the fresh breeze. Everywhere I looked, had the most perfect view. A favorite way to start my mornings was by going for a long walk around the spectacular grounds. Talk about relaxing! Brunch was never a bore with fresh papaya; omelets made your way and fresh fruit smoothies, different everyday. The pool was so captivating; I was in it any chance I got. The service was incredible, rolled up towels as pillows and tasty pina coladaâ€™s. There are three separate pools plus a very grown up kiddy pool with their very own waterfall. :> For a relaxing way to end the day with a magnificent view, I would sit in the outside lounge overlooking the pool. Delicious food, tropical drinks and live music were just a few feet away. The housekeeping staff was very on top of things. I began to look forward to the nightly turn down service where I received the Ritz one page newspaper with the 'Hawaiian word of the day', fitness schedule and hotel info/updates. Basically to sum it all up, this was one of the best vacations ever! It was largely due to the Ritz Carlton hotel and staff. Thank you so much! I would absolutely recommend that everyone go for a visitâ€¦at least once! ;>

Reviews.Title: “Vacation of a Lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Kim61779
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Kapalua for 10 days on our honeymoon in April/May 2008. It was the best vacation we have ever had. I'm reading some of these bad reviews of the hotel, and laughing to myself. Some people can find something wrong with just about everything -- even a five star resort in Maui!! I can honestly say that it was worth every penny, albeit many pennies! But you get what you pay for. My husband and I were blown away by the service -- from the bell staff, to the pool crew, to the lounge bartender, to the maids. I felt spoiled the entire time I was there, to the point I was embarrassed to be taking cold washcloths off silver plates and complimentary pineapple slices at the pool. We made friends with the pool staff, and they took care of us every single day. We were on a first name basis with them. We were getting invited to parties that they were attending on their days off -- kind of funny. We were involuntarily upgraded to a residential suite upon check-in. We didnt know what to do with all the space. We felt so comfortable and at home. If we wanted to, we could have cooked a full-course meal in our stocked kitchen, but we just didn't feel like cooking on our vacation. The only thing I didnt have was an iron, but who cares! My husband was, for some reason, overly impressed with the complimentary Bulgari bath products. Granted, they were nice, but he was a little too excited. I guess we're just easy to please. The pool was not overcrowded -- we always found great seats. They were working on tiling some of the pool waterfalls the week we were there, but it wasnt the end of the world. The spa was not open at the time, but it looked like it was going to be pretty cool. One thing that I have to recommend is getting the breakfast package. The daily prices arent cheap. We wound up with a complimentary breakfast package through our travel agency, and it was such a money saver. We went for a late breakfast every day around 11:00 and basically stuffed our faces. It held us over until dinner everyday, so we were only buying one meal a day.The meals aren't cheap, but you will never have better seafood than in Hawaii. My husband went into withdrawal when we got home after having had salmon and eggs benedict every single day. I was a big fan of the omelet station. I wasn't too crazy about dinner at the Terrace. The menu was kind of limited and pricey. The Banyan Tree was delicious. They were having half priced wine bottle specials when we were there, so we definitely capitalized on that. The sushi restaurant, Kai, was nice. I'm not a huge sushi fan, but my husband enjoyed himself. The weather was 84 degrees every day were there, and the biggest 'problem' we had were two really windy days at the end of our trip. We got over it. The pool staff actually hooked us up with a free cabana because there were hardly any people at the pool on one of the windy days. We paid $250 (yikes!) for a full day cabana rental so that my husband could tell all his friends that he watched the NFL draft poolside in Maui. I, being the new and accomodating wife, gladly went along with the fully stocked, fan-conditioned, plasma tv cabana. I kind of felt snobbish siitting in one of the seven cabanas that sit slightly up above everyone else at the pool, but I enjoyed myself. It was our week to splurge! The hotel has a complimentary shuttle service to various different places within Kapalua. I highly recommend the Plantation House for sunset dinner. I'd pass on the Pineapple Grill, except for maybe eating a quick bite off the bar menu. We heard great things about sandwiches at the general store, but we never made it there. We were so comfortable at the pool that we didnt spend too much time down on the beach, so I can't comment too much on that. The view of Molokai from the resort is beautiful. Kapalua is in a great location, about a 15 minute drive from the touristy Ka'anapali and Lahaina areas. Off-site recommendations: Haleakala bike tour (28 miles downhill after watching the sun rise at the top of a volcano), and the Old Lahaina luau. This luau is much more authentic than the others. I wasn't overly impressed with the food there, but it was just about the experience. Pacific'o restaurant in Lahaina was delcious and romantic. The Road to Hana is something you have to do just because everyone does it, but it is a long long day of driving. We chose to ride it ourselves instead of with a tour bus just so we could pick and choose what we wanted to stop and see. We enjoyed the Seven Sacred Pools and the Black Sand Beach the best. One more thing -- if you are renting a car, drive around the southwest side of the island when coming from the airport, as opposed to going up and around the northwest side of the island. I thought I was taking a shortcut when looking at the map, and we wound up on poorly paved roads basically dangling off the cliffs for 20 miles while trying to steer clear of locals that just buzz past you. It had all the makings of a bad start to the trip, but we survived. Summary -- go there. It's expensive, but worth the money. It's hard to beat this place. I loved it. I'd go back tomorrow if I could.

Reviews.Title: “BOOK YOUR VACATION THIS MINUTE!”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie H
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I returned from a 9-day stay here last week. The property is spectacularly beautiful (which I already knew), well-maintained, and the staff was stupendous. I simply can't laud them enough, from the maids to the Terrace breakfast waiters to the valets to the pool staff. All were very friendly, professional, and immediately accommodating. I merely had to whisper and our needs were met. The remodel is unbelievable. The hotel is now the only 5-star property on the island. I stayed here prior to the over haul and the decor was all old world luxe (and getting worn) -- now it is hip, Hawaiian, and brand-spanking new. Our Residential suite was awesome -- 900 sq ft with 2 balconies, lovely furnishings plus refrigerator, freezer, blender, microwave, sink, dishwasher, martini shaker (you name it), etc. The bathroom was large and lovely. The products were by Bulgari. Two large flatscreen TVs, wireless connections, and an Ipod player/charger completed the picture. (I think there was a DVD player too.) The pools are wonderful and if you feel super self-indulgent, you can rent cabanas that have large screen plasmas (they were full almost every day!). DT Fleming Beach was rated as the world's top beach in 2006 (I believe). I spent about 3 hours in the water everyday. One day, a pod of dolphins (at least 20) came through and were swimming quite close to me. One kept jumping and twirling in the air. It was amazing!! The property has some wonderful lava formations just off the golf course (near the beach) very worth exploring and there are hiking trails with terrific views up in the hills behind the hotel and zip lines too. You can ride the shuttle up and walk or run through a Koa forest (initially) all the way back to the hotel -- probably about 8 miles in total but mostly down hill (watch your footing). The iron men and women among you could run it uphill for a harder workout. (My daugher who is 20 and rows varsity college crew for the Ivy League {can you tell I'm a proud mom?} did part of it and pronounced it a "decent work out.") The gym is well-stock with recumbent bikes, ellipiticals, treadmills, machines, and free weights. There are a number of classes and very fit instructors. A brand new fabulous spa is opening its doors any day now -- I heard from a PR person who took the tour that it is amazing. Re food: The Banyan Tree restaurant (on the property) is my favorite restaurant on Maui -- forget the very over-rated Pacific'O in Lahaina (it was expensive and so mediocre that the woman at the table next to us stormed out). The Banyan Tree has been consistently excellent over a long period, despite the change in chefs. It's expensive but if you love fine cuisine, worth every penny. Check and see if the unique musical group, Ranga Pae, is playing. The Terrace buffet breakfast was fantastic!! Book it with your package, otherwise it costs around $70.00 for two, with tip and tax. We only had to eat one other meal per day. I stocked our fridge with yogurt, etc. (Right now there is an incredible package on Expedia for every fourth night free and breakfast included. It is so worth it!!! I splurged on one of the residential suites and was delighted.) There is a Sushi restaurant on site and a beautiful lobby bar that serves until late. I didn't try either because my daughter, the athlete, has a very particular diet and doesn't drink. But they looked great and I heard good things. Room service was good (my daughter, a picky eater, kept talking about the pizza). Down by the beach, there is another restaurant that serves tropical drinks and burgers, etc. There are beach chairs and a towel station nearby and it is a great place to position yourself for lounging all day. One caveat: Kapalua is windy. It blows around the entire property which is quite large. I personally liked the wind (I've gone to Kapalua for years) -- it never gets unbearably hot, like it can in Wailea where all those fancy hotels are jammed together with lots of tourists. We opened our balconies at night and the wind blew through and refreshed us. So, walk on the beach, frolic on the beach but position yourself up on the shore near the restaurant -- it's an idyllic spot and you are sheltered there (shade and wind-wise). There are two others beaches within walking distance of this property -- the wonderfully tame Kapalua Beach and Oneloa Beach. The latter is practically deserted because people walk down to it and it looks entirely reefy, it's not -- walk to the other end and there is sandy bottom. No shade though. The property is close to Lahaina and Kaanapali and very close to Kahana and Napili -- where other good restaurants and beaches can be found. I cannot recommend it highly enough. Book your trip today!It is a very different experience than touristy Kaanapoli. PS If there is a sailor among you, you must go for a sail on America II. If the trades are blowing, you'll have the ride of a lifetime versus the other boats which usually motor or barely put their sails up. On the return portion of the sail, we were literally surfing down huge rollers. It was wild!! Prepare to get wet!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Customer Service Imaginable - Don't Believe Anything They Tell You”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler310
Reviews.Content: I made a hotel reservation online, and received a Confirmed Reservation for an Ocean Front Suite, described as and "Ocean front suite with full view of the Pacific Ocean from the guest room". I then made plane reservations and other plans based on the room's promised availability. When I arrived they told me that, despite my Confirmed Reservation, they had given away my room to someone else, and gave me a room with a view of the opposite building and a concrete pool area. I told them this was completely unacceptable. They just said "I'm sorry" and did nothing to correct the problem. No manager ever returned my call or contacted me. They were completely non-responsive. To add insult to injury, upon returning home I find they have charged my credit card $5,000

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: TheNewALG
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent our honeymoon at the Ritz Kapalua and it was perfect! After seeing the other places around I can't imagine staying anywhere else... Customer Service: Everyone here was SO sweet! Maybe it's just laid-back Maui, but all the people were exceptionally attentative in helping us get everything we needed to our exact preference. The consierge service was amazingly friendly, candid and right on. My husband jokes because I still remember everybody's first names! Beach: The Ritz beach is great because it is set apart and very pretty. We ventured into Ka'anapali and Napili one day - bad choice. They are crowded and not as scenic. Food: This was one of my favorite parts. I am particular, and found all the food here outstanding - even the pool bar and beach bar. Every options was imaginative, inspired, and we didn't have a single "ok" meal during our stay. Our waiter at the Banyon Tree was informed and helpful. Pool: The pool was never crowded because there is so much space. The staff was very attentive with drinks, food and towels. Room: Our room was gorgeous and had anything you could possibly need. The re-design was awesome, and our room was exceptionally clean.

Reviews.Title: “A Ritz in Name Only”
Reviews.Author: Fiveoclockcaptain
Reviews.Content: A lovely location, beautiful grounds and rooms. Inept service, overpriced and overrated food service and nickel/dime mentality. 1. Grounds/Property. Kapalua is truly beautiful, the whole development is manicured and peaceful unlike the more commercial developments of Kaanapali. 2. Rooms. Fully renovated and up to the standards of a five star property, although the fairly industry standard nonsense of "ocean front", "ocean view" and "mountain view" are exploited to the maximum here as no room is really ocean front since the property is about 1/4 mile from the shoreline and the entire property is angled away from the ocean. Our "ocean front" room required neck straining to see a slice of blue. 3. Service. We found the property to be understaffed at the pool, valet and in the restaurants. It was a very quiet week and it appeared that a lot of people were given time off or were laid off. We had asked about a good beach for snorkeling at the valet desk, we were told that Kapalua had its own beach that we could get to by shuttle, we were told that it was part of the hotel complex. When we arrived we found out that it was no longer part of the Ritz' charging program so we were unable to get chairs, snorkels or anything else as we had no money. In addition, towels were not available at all, the valet had towels and never offered us one. Needless to say we turned around and went to the valet, who said, "sorry, I wasn't really sure how they were set up, I've never been there myself" - two hours of premium vacation time down the drain. 4. Restaurants. We invited guests from off property to dinner at the Banyan Tree. Again, a beautiful venue, but things were obviously lacking. In this case the food was, as our guest described it, "Elfen", portions were obscenely small, really, really small. Of course the prices were substantial for miniscule portions, truly laughable. The food itself was truly delicious, but it would have cost $1,500 to get a full meal for four. We called for a pizza when we got back to our room and our guests stoped at McDonalds on Rt. 30! The breakfast buffet was passable when compared to other properties of similar price, but somewhat hidden cost as it is included in many room rates. The best opportunity for food at anything like a fair value is at the Honolua Store. The sushi restaurant was mediocre, overpriced and lacked any kind creativity or specialness that you would expect in a Ritz property. 5. Pool. Deserves its own category, it was like a carnival in its absurd prices, lack of shade for less than $75 for a mini cabana chair and over priced and extremely limited service. It was beautiful, despite being away from the beach and very, very windy, but was something of a tourist trap within the hotel. Many other properties on Maui offer better value. We also stayed at Four Seasons Hualali and it was pure paradise - it took everything that the Ritz made a mess of and made it perfect. Simple things like cold bottled water for free, amuse buches in the restaurants, smiles on the employees and lots of gracious amenities at the pools. Unless it's a great rate, I'd stay at one of the Kaanapali properties like the Westin or the Hyatt, although busier areas they offer better value.

Reviews.Title: “gorgeous views, great room”
Reviews.Author: jbirdb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were at this resort for five nights in May '08 and had a wonderful time. The views of the ocean are breathtaking. One of the things we found to be most impressive was how the management handled a relatively minor problem. I called two days before our visit to inquire about ongoing construction (no), refrigerators in the room (yes) and availability of boogie boards on site (no), but the phone went unanswered twice in a row. After letting the phone ring more than 50 times, I emailed a message detailing my frustration. Within 20 minutes, the executive rooms director called me, apologized and answered my questions. Upon arrival, we were upgraded to a suite, compliments of the executive rooms director. It was a beautiful room with a full kitchen, dining room, living room, bedroom, with patios outside both the living room and the bedroom. We stocked up on breakfast and lunch items, so we'd be able to maximize time on the beach and by the pool. Honalua General Store, on the premises, is excellent for stocking the room. We spent morning coffee on the patio with the colorful birds and ocean breezes. We had dinner at Plantation House just north of the hotel. It's high above the ocean on a golf course, with sweeping ocean views and killer sunsets. The food was excellent as well. It reminded us of Sea Watch on Wailea, and found out it is owned by the same restaurant group. Pineapple Grill on the Ritz's golf course was also excellent and has half price appetizers after 8pm. Dollies Pizza in nearby Kahana was recommended by every local we asked, and it was perfect on an evening where we wanted to stay casual and bring leftovers back to the room. Really delicious. Sensei, right next to the Honalua store, was fantastic. Great sushi. There's a branch in Oahu too. Snorkeling was the best on Kapalua Bay, and the Ritz shuttle will drop off right there. It's in the same parking lot as the Sea House restaurant and if you didn't know where it was beforehand, you would miss it, so be sure to ask for a ride. I walked back to the hotel and it was a really nice seaside walk, less than a mile. All in all, great mini vacation and wonderful resort. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Relax at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: EireGirlSF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz five years ago in a resort view room, which overlooked the grounds/golf course - lots and lots of greenery. We, therefore, had no problem booking a resort view room this time also, but we ended up being escorted to an ocean/pool view room - a very nice surprise. I'm not 100% certain but, due to the layout of the hotel/resort, I don't think you could end up with a room that overlooks the car park or anything unsightly. I mention this because I've read reviews from travelers who stayed in other hotels and their "resort" view did mean looking out at the car park. I found our room to be spacious, especially the bathroom (double sinks/separate bath and shower), and loved the wood floors and the slightly more modern take on the traditional Hawaiian resort decor. The balcony was spacious too. There was a flat screen TV, but we got the best use out of the Ipod docking station. There is a $20/day resort fee. However, the car park (for self-parking) and wireless high-speed internet access in your room are free (presumably because they're already covered by the resort fee). I know the weather in Kapalua is a frequent discussion point. I'm fair skinned, so very hot and/or humid weather is not for me. For that reason I found the wind/breeze refreshing. It kept the temperature manageable for me (mid-80s the entire week we were there) and made for a pleasant day by the pool. There was no rain while we were there. Breakfast was included in the package we purchased, so we had the breakfast buffet everyday. The Belgian waffles are my favorite, topped with macadamia nuts and coconut syrup! Tip - unlike the last time we were there, you have to actually ask your server for the coconut syrup, but make sure you do because it's not to be missed. As it was a buffet, the only other thing our server was responsible for was bringing us coffee and juice but, for some reason three of the six days they forgot our juice order and had to come back and ask us again - I did find that a little odd considering we were at the Ritz. We didn't use many of the hotel services - we always parked our car ourselves in the self-parking section and we didn't use the concierge. I did notice that there wasn't an iron in our room (even though there was an ironing board), but upon calling housekeeping one was brought to the room in less than 5 minutes. FYI - The new spa facilities are not finished, so I was disappointed not to be able to check them out. They're due to open in June. They also have a gym that gives you a view of the pool area while you work out. It seems busy first thing in the mornings, but we had it pretty much to ourselves the two afternoons we managed to work out : ) We booked the Ritz because we found it very peaceful and relaxing the last time we were there and we had the same experience this time.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to call home in Maui!”
Reviews.Author: amandatx
Reviews.Content: Ritz: Beautiful property. Would definitely recommend. Hubby and I in our 30â€™s and stayed from 3/10-3/17. I thought the location of the property was well situated. Rented a convertible Sebring car through Dollar and drove all over the island. Less than 5 minutes to Napili, about 10 to Kaanapali and about 15-20 to Lahaina. Took us about an hour to get to Wailea. We liked the seclusion but since we live in a big city with tons of traffic, a 20 minute drive was a piece of cake. Outdoors: Loved the cascading pools. They do have a small kiddie pool but kids do still swim in the bigger pools. It was not an issue when we were there. Lots of lounge chairs so we didnâ€™t have any trouble getting one, but they are terribly uncomfortable! They did have floats available in the pool as well. It was very windy at the pool some days and drinks did get blown over. It didnâ€™t bother me very much, but I could see how this could be a negative for some people. The weather was very nice while we were there with only one quick shower. Grounds were very well kept and there were beautiful flowers and plants everywhere. The beach was a little way away from the pool area but not a big deal. Walk down and then get the golf cart to bring you back. Beach: This was my one â€œgripeâ€� about Maui. I overall prefer the beaches that we have visited in the Caribbean and Mexico. I didnâ€™t like that the hotel had no loungers or service on the beach. It seemed that people brought their own chairs to the beaches. We did that later in the week, but it was very different than our typical â€œbeach vacations.â€� We also visited Wailea, Kaanapali and Napili beaches. Room: There was a convention there for part of our stay and our room type was not available so we were upgraded to a suite. We loved the room and the space. The kitchen was well stocked and we made breakfast in the room several mornings. There were lots of drawers in the room and closet area for storing clothes, etc. It was a very comfortable place to be. The view was of the grounds. Hotel Restaurants: We ate dinner at Kai Sushi at the Banyan Tree and had a very nice experience at both. I preferred Kai because I felt it was more relaxed and I liked the menu better overall. Service: The valets were all very friendly and called us by name. Check-in was great and everyone we encountered throughout the hotel would give you an â€œAloha!â€� The only spotty service we had was by the pool one day. Maui Excursions: Paragon Sunset Sail/Whale Watch-Really fun crew and sail. Basic snacks and any kind of drink you could want. We saw a whale breach and did the performance sail back to the dock. Kapalua Adventures-We only got to do 2 out of 4 zips because they said the winds were too strong. What we did get to do was lots of fun and awesome scenery but I didnâ€™t like that we had to ask for refunds. I think the company should have offered it before having to ask since we didnâ€™t get the complete experience. Shopped at Whalerâ€™s Village (ABC has practially anything you need), Front St in Lahaina and in Wailea. Some very unique finds and also lots of stores that you can find in many malls throughout the U.S. Drove to the top of Haleakala and had lunch at Kula Grill. Highly recommended. Was very glad we didnâ€™t do the biking. The roads were a little narrow and winding and cars and bikes shared the road. I enjoyed driving it ourselves in the convertible. Other Maui restaurants: Feast at Lele-Our favorite night in Maui. Most of the food was really good and liked having our own server and table. The show was lots of fun to watch and we took some great pictures! Hula Grill-Fun for sunset cocktails and appetizers. Live music and fun to meet other travelers. Kimoâ€™s-Quick service. Had to wait about 30 minutes for a table, but nice bar area. Had Caesar salads, fish and bread. All very tasty! Pretty casual. Honolua Store-Cheap breakfast and lunch in walking distance to the Ritz. Also a good place to get snacks, wine, etc for the room. Kula Grill-Neat place. Reminded me of how Hawaii probably was many years ago. Great pizzas, salads, wraps. Sea House in Napili-Had a nice lunch here. Service was pretty good. Fish and chips were great. Right on the beach. DÃ©cor in the restaurant was a little dated, but who cares when you have the great view outside. Lahaina Grille & Oyster Bar-Ate inside the restaurant because the rooftop deck was fully booked. Had an appetizer tray which we enjoyed, but nothing spectacular. Ferraroâ€™s at the Four Seasons-Went for lunch. Great service and lobster roll was awesome!! Overall: I am very happy that we were able to visit Hawaii and Maui. We typically like to try different places to visit and Iâ€™d like to see some of the other Hawaiian islands. From Texas, Hawaii isnâ€™t the easiest place to get to and we prefer going to the Caribbean. We did have a great trip, though and I would not hesitate to recommend Maui or the Ritz for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend for Weddings”
Reviews.Author: carnalicia
Reviews.Content: While I didn't stay at the Ritz on my trip to Maui, we held our wedding ceremony there in April and it was fantastic! The wedding planner (Kristina) was always quick to respond, very professional, and helpful. We planned everything over the internet so we were worried about how things would come together, but it was even better than I could have imagined. The gazebo ceremony site was beautiful with spectacular views of the ocean and mountains. The flowers and setup were great, especially the guitar player and the conch blower we had during the ceremony. The photographer they set up was amazing and we love all of our photos! The pool was pretty nice, could use a few more trees around it but we enjoyed laying out, bar service was good too. The salon was a bit overpriced for the hair and makeup, if it wasn't for a wedding I would have felt ripped off. However, they did a great job and everyone looked fabulous. The only downside is the weather, it is windier and a few degrees colder there than further down the island. However it wasn't enough of an inconvenience to make it at all unpleasant and is a welcome change from the massive cookie cutter resorts in Kaanapali. Loved the hotel, loved the wedding and would definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Bad area for good weather”
Reviews.Author: Jimgloria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set back from the beach. The weather is just too stormy, rainy and cold for us (Kapalua)

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, terrible customer service”
Reviews.Author: GoHerd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz April 19-26. To start it is a beautiful hotel. The setting in Kapalua is very nice. The renovations made recently appear to be a good investment. The pool area is very nice however there is little to no shade if you are looking for some around the pool area. The weather in Kapalua is very hit and miss. Unlike Wailea where they get less than 10 inches of rain a year, Kapalua gets a significant amount of rain and wind. The first three days we were there the tradewinds were whipping around bringing rain and clouds. The last four days the tradewinds shut down and it was sunny hot. The good thing is if it is raining in Kapalua drive 10 minutes south to Kannapali and it will be perfect. You just have to plan your days at the beaches accordingly. Now onto the service issues. The service is just flat out bad. I am not a huge service customer as I perfer to park my own car and get my own towels, but a hotel like the Ritz that prides themselves on service and charges big $$ for it, the Ritz Kapalua completely misses the mark. The bellman took 2 hours to get luggage to our room after I discovered it sitting in the lobby not being watched that whole time. When we checked out I gave them a two hour notice because I did not want a repeat. They were late. We passed them in the hall after waiting 1/2 hour past the time I asked them to come. The pool for the most part was unattended. The housekeeping was OK. There were issues with the bathroom not being that clean. You had to call and tell them exactly when you would be out of your room or they would let your room sit all day until they finally got there. We only ate at the Terrace restaurant for breakfast which was OK but not worth the $60 for two people not even close. For breakfast, we had two other reservations at Ritz restaurants but cancelled after the breakfast. The Honalua General Store right outside of the hotel is the way to go for breakfast. The Plantation is a great restaurant for dinner but very expensive. It is about 2 miles from the Ritz. Up on the hill. The beach at the Ritz is nice but the water is not nearly as clear or smooth as Kannapali. It does have three lifeguards that just kind of hang out, it is a public beach as are all Hawaii beaches but fairly quite for a public beach. There is a $20 a day resort fee at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not the average Ritz Expierence”
Reviews.Author: Billupc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 10 years ago and the expierence was much different. Upon check in, we were taken to a room that over-overlooked a green that was under construction. There was heavy equipment present so we could not open the door as the noise was loud. The front-desk was indifferent and thank goodness for Jon, the Super bellman which got us a 1 brd suite instead. If not for him I would have been very upset with the staff responce. Before we went I knew they were completing construction as I spoke to the desk and they assured me they were completed. Once I got to the pool after check-in, we shared it with on-going construction with power tools cutting tile, very annoying for the relaxation of the pool! The pool chairs are very neo-modern but very uncomfortable to sit in. Most of the staff did not greet you when they passed as what I am used to from this caliber of hotel. We played tennis and the courts are in much need of repair and may not have been renovated as of yet. The tennis pavilion was unstaffed and looked abandioned. I would say they have a lot of things to work out before I wouuld go back and spend the kind of money they are asking for. This hotel seemed like a Marriott instead. However, the bed was GREAT. Before this hotel, we were at the Fairmont in Wailea and would highly recoment this as it is the closest to the 4 Sesons we have found.

Reviews.Title: “at home away from home”
Reviews.Author: lafayettetraveller
Reviews.Content: We wanted to relax and enjoy the area. From the first day we arrived, we were treated by the staff as we were the most important guests at the property. There are so many different ways to enjoy this hotel By the pool, by the beach, golf is just a short distance away, We had lots of choices where to eat at any time, fine dining at the Banyan Restaurant, where we were pampered and assisted by magnificient service . The Chef made his prescence known several time as well as some of his staff. Pool staff were constantly checking on any needs we might have. The lounge servers were excellent as much as the casual music we enjoyed as the sun set. Our room was very comfortable with ample space to relax, and all the technology required. we are now suffering of vacation withdrawl and cannot wait to go back. Experience it yourself. Highly, highly recommend you try this hotell

Reviews.Title: “The Ultimate Fun Family Getaway in Maui”
Reviews.Author: allysonCalifornia
Reviews.Content: We recently spent almost 10 days at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua and it was heavenly. I traveled with my husband and our two little girls and it was a fabulous trip. We stayed in one of the hotel's residential villas and the room furnishings and amenities were just lovely. One night we dined at Banyan Tree which is just breathtaking and the food is delicious. We also had a great dinner one night at the hotel's Terrace restaurant... The girls loved the beautiful beach and the swimming pools were a huge highlight. They probably could have spent all day every day by the pool sipping smoothies! The concierge team did a great job..they arranged for us to go horseback riding at the Ironwood Ranch which was a great adventure...and we also experienced the new Kapalua Adventures which was a real treat! My husband and daughter went rock climbing, did the ropes course and even explored their new zip line adventure....it was awesome and well worth it! We are planning our return trip now....you really can't go wrong staying at the Ritz Carlton!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel nice - weather is awful!”
Reviews.Author: arthurelliot
Reviews.Content: I don't think I can adequately emphasize the weather situation at the Ritz in Kapalua. While the hotel itself is very nice, the weather is enough to ruin a trip there. We were there about 4 days for our honeymoon and it was windy and/or rainy every day. Even on sunny days, the wind woudl blow the book out of my hand. On morning, we woke up to clouds/rain and departed for our surfing lesson in Lahaina (15 min south). It was totally sunny in Lahaina when we arrived there! We wish we would have paid more attention to what the guide books say about the weather in Kapalua - we likely would have stayed elsewhere. While the Ritz had great rooms and nice facilities, they didn't really do anything to make us feel special (and they knew it was our honeymoon). We had just come from the Hyatt in Kauai, which sent us complementary champagne twice during our visit there. Something like that at the Ritz would have been nice.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: sadiesmomCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua and it was a wonderful experience. The results of the recent remodel were beautiful. Staff members were extremely friendly and helpful. We spent most days by the pool, as the beach was windy. We enjoyed brunch most mornings and ate our first night and last night at the Banyan Tree at the Ritz-Carlton, which is excellent. I didn't want to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, not the vacation we had expected from the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: MDoc13
Reviews.Content: Not given the room we had requested even though reservation made 8 months prior. Confirmation calls to ensure we would get our room request (two adjoining rooms) made 2 months prior to arrival. We were instructed to call back after the opening of the newly renovated property, which was done one month prior to our arrival and we were ensured that we would be able to have adjoining rooms. We got to the property late on a thursday evening and were assigned rooms that were not together. The reception clerk stated "you will be staying in these rooms for the duration of your visit" in a rather direct tone and proceeded to hand us our keys. Upon trying to explain the efforts made to ensure the correct room assignment, I was told that all the adjoining rooms had been given out and that I should have paid more for a suite but those were not available now anyway. No effort was made to even give the illusion that they were going to try to find a way to fill my request. (By the way, request means no guarantee even if someone says differently over the phone) Now since this was a business/vacation trip and I brought my 15 month old son and paid the way for a nanny to help while I was away at conference, I certainly wanted to have some proximity to the other room. Needless to say that didn't happen until 3/4 of my 8 day stay was up. I was unhappy about the outcome but upset about how it was handled. I called to the front desk after check in to voice my dissatisfaction. I was placed on hold for 20 minutes. Another time hung up on. I called back to speak with a manager and was instructed to call at another time. The manager was polite but did nothing but apologize. There were other problems too, In- room DVD did not work and engineering couldn't fix it. It took 2 days to figure out how to get the DVD to play on the TV through their entertainment system. Finally had to rewire from behind TV to DVD with an RCA cable running across the entertainment system to make work. Apparently all of the DVDs were not working right, they were taking them out of the rooms as we were leaving the property. In- room alarm clock not reset when rooms cleaned. Alarm went off at 3 am on first night. New alarm clocks so engineering did not know how to set. We were told to just unplug and use wake up call. If you walked halls late at night, other rooms had alarms going off. Ice machines were removed from our entire floor because they were not working They had to send someone to another hotel to get a crib because they were all out (I "requested" one but apparently those are first come first serve as well) One phone in the room was not operational Room service was inconsistant. One day the fruit plate was huge the next skimpy. Fruit plate is better later in the week. I ordered breakfast in the room every morning, timing was off on delivery. Ordered out from onsite restaurant (Pavillions) Part of meal was left out. Had to go back to get it. Bellman 20-30 minute wait Pool service is scant. If you want a drink, you are better of to get up and get it. Charges were placed on the bill that were not supposed to be there. I was charged double for valet. Construction still happening during day. Work out facility OK, no mens/womens changing rooms. One common locker area and one bathroom with shower in it. If you are looking for steam rooms or sauna or private changing area, not at Ritz Kapalua. Overall, the experience was full of little slips and mishaps that individually might be no big deal but together do not constitute the 700+ $/night charge. This property was not , in my opinion, ready to be open and certainly not performing at the level of what I would expect at a Ritz Carlton. There were failures at every category of service which makes me question their employee training and the management overseeing the operation there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet corner of paradise”
Reviews.Author: CAKatie
Reviews.Content: In February we stayed 8 nights at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. Although it was after their major remodel work was completed, there was still some construction going on during our stay. Most of it was unobtrusive and should be finished by now. The staff was stellar in anticipating needs, using our names and being helpful with graciousness. Our first room was near the lobby and some of the ongoing construction, so we asked to be moved. There was not a question asked. Although they could not move us that day ("We are fully committed this evening"), she promised to call at 9:00a.m. the next morning with our new room., and she did. So we didn't lose any of our vacation time, the bell staff moved our bags and things from one room to the other while we were out for the day. The property is beautiful and quiet, a nice change from the frenetic pace of Ka'anapali and the business of Lahaina. The sushi restaurant in the lobby smelled a little fishy, but I was told the food was very good. The breakfast buffett in the terrace restaurant is excellent and the egg chef took pride in knowing what the various guests were fond of eating each morning. We enjoyed the casual fare at the Beach House restaurant, and the fish tacos were outstanding. The pool area was still undergong changes when we were there. It's calm and a beautiful setting. It's both adult and family friendly, but I was disappointed the three pools are all in the same area. It seemed, though, that families went to one pool and adults without children went to one of the other two, so all could get what they wanted from their pool time. Overall we had a wonderful time at the Ritz Kapalua and were able to achieve complete relaxation in this quiet corener of paradise. Isn't that what it's all about?

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place”
Reviews.Author: krisBrighton_England
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Kapalua, what a wondeful setting, the best of Hawaii I am sure. We were there for a conference and holiday, so a very sociable time. The rooms were beautiful, spacious and I would say all well positioned. Beds and pillows, so comfortable. All staff very friendly and the hotel facilities are great. Nice pool, 3 seperate on a tiered level. The beach is a bit of a walk ,5 mins downhill and although there is a shuttle/buggy, it is unclear when these run. The stars at night are so clear as there is no light pollution. If you want a restaurant nightlife within walking distance there is nothing, sio be prepared to drive. Great Restaurants at Kanapali and Lahina. 10/15 mins away. Whilst this is an expensive hotel and one we were very happy to Pay for. You always have that sense that the last possible dime is being squeezed. A resort fee of $20 per day is payable for use of the resort which in effect you stay in. And lots of local taxes adding anothing 10%+ again on top. My children had a smoothie each, you are talking Â£6 each so whilst eating in is very good , if you have an extended stay with the kids it is expensve. Across the car park is a shop called the Honolua store, which does a great breakfast and all day snacks. Saves a fortune!!!! Maui is beautiful, drive up the Volcano, its worth it. 2 hours each way on a very windey road.

Reviews.Title: “Remodeled Rooms are Gorgeous!”
Reviews.Author: TravelOpportunist
Reviews.Content: The Ritz remodel was highly successful. The interior designer they used turned a standard hotel room into a chic, hawaiian-inspired masterpiece. Teak wood floors, honed stone bathrooms and gorgeous teak louvered his-and-her closets. Even the table lamps and burnt orange chaises were beautifully selected to add designer-punch to the room. I got a lot of ideas for my next home remodel. Every hotel on Maui should tour these rooms to understand what a tastefully designed room should look like (that means you, Grand Wailea!) The new refrigerators were so convenient to hold waters, fruit, wine, etc. Bedding was top notch. Bulgari toiletries were of the highest quality. Every morning we went to the lobby to have complimentary Kona coffee (they put away the coffee at 8am so you need to get there early) and read the WSJ and local paper. Then it was off to the Fitness center which is among the best we have every experienced. Like all hotels on Maui, food and beverage prices are outrageous at the Ritz. Best mai-tai's on the island but you will pay $12.50 plus tip for about 4 ounces of liquid nirvana. Add a burger and fries to that and you are looking at $35 for a quick snack at the pool. My only complaint is they need to designate an adult's only section at the pool or for one of the jacuzzi's. While relaxing in the jacuzzi one afternoon, I was treated to a mother who decided to change her daughter's dirty swim diaper under water. Several other parents brought their bare bottomed toddlers into the jacuzzi with them to spend some "quality time" together. Yuck! Servers at the pool were easy to get but I felt the pool boys could have done a better job of removing abandoned towels and other litter. Mostly I just saw them hanging out in the pool shack. Other than that, we had a lovely and very relaxing vacation at the Ritz. To really appreciate The Ritz, you need to stay at the Grand Wailea. Wow, what a difference. I'll post a very different review under that section. One word to the wise, if you are looking for a room with solitude, do NOT allow them to place you in a room that begins with 26 or 16. This is the level that all residents of that wing use to get to the elevators. All day/night you will hear extremely loud groups walking the hallways and discussing their plans and adventures. Some people prefer the pool view but there you will hear music until late in the evening. We preferred the golf course view as we were looking for pure relaxation and serenity. Important to have a strategy when you check-in.

Reviews.Title: “yes it is pricey ....but...”
Reviews.Author: Beverley-Diane
Reviews.Content: OK I agree it is expensive but what a rush to stay there. This Ritz is in a class of its own. The staff have the right attitude which is "to accommodate whatever the guest wants" and to do so with a smile. It is the old story you get what you pay for. We also stayed at the Hyatt and although somewhat less money the Ritz was far superior for the $200 per night difference. The biggest difference was in the littler things ie water free, fruit free, snacks with drinks -free. It is worth the extra splurge to upgrade your room, but all the rooms are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite Resort Experience!”
Reviews.Author: luvbostons
Reviews.Content: If I could live at any resort it would be The Ritz Carlton in Kapalua!! My husband and I just returned from our 'babymoon' and we loved every moment. The hotel is amazing! The rooms are beautiful, well decorated and very spacious - and the wood floors are fabulous! The lobby, shops and restaurants are also beautiful. The staff was very helpful, prompt and extremely friendly. We spent a good deal of time at the pool and even though it was spring break, we always found great seats in the sun and the shade. I love the three-tiered pools - fabulous! I also liked the breeze that would blow - so I never got too hot - natures' air conditioning! We also went to three beaches at The Ritz and in Kapalua - each was gorgeous. My husband took advantage of the new gym and I enjoyed the great yoga studio. I was actually in the studio doing my own stretches and the instructor came in, saw that I was pregnant, and offered me some great tips on new pregnancy poses - love that! When you go - you must have the banana-macadamia nut pancakes at the Terrace Restaurant - yummy! Also, you should try Banyan Tree - the views and the food can't be beat!! Oh, and I can't forget The Spa - even though it is still undergoing a renovation, the hotel has a temporary spa on the 9th floor that is very, very relaxing and my pregnancy massage was incredible! Also, the whole development of Kapalua is outstanding - my husband tried the zip lining and loved it... he's played golf there before and rates the courses very high. It is so easy to get around - the shuttle takes you everywhere! I can't wait to return - I wish it were sooner - but no more flying for a few months!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location”
Reviews.Author: vsharp
Reviews.Content: Staying at any Ritz is always a nice experience and the facilities at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua were beautiful. The pool was beautiful and our view from the balcony was great. We actually sat on our balcony one afternoon and watched whales for hours. How many places can you do that? However, when we arrived after about 12 hours in the air and another hour or so in pouring rain driving from the airport, we were informed that our "Club Level" lounge had just closed. Even though we paid full price for the Club Level that night, they did not even give us a free drink. A little disappointed there, but everything else was pretty nice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous location, poor service”
Reviews.Author: grazipat
Reviews.Content: Spent spring break at the Ritz for six days. The hotel is gorgeous and newly renovated and the location is spectacular. I can't say enough about how beautiful the cascading pools, the beach, the small town of Kapalua and the hotel rooms were. However, the service is not on par with other Ritz locations as well as the fact that though they are as or more expensive than the Four Season's Wailea the Four Seasons completely outclasses them on service and attention in every aspect. Check in was confusing to the employees. The pool is horribly serviced. There was always a lack of towels at the pool and at the beach, and on top of it the pool lounge chairs were not cleaned up or opened up for new sunbathers throughout the day. If someone used the lounge chair their chaise cover and towels were left to lay there for hours thus giving the impression that there were no chaises available throughout the day. At five o'clock the attendants started going around collecting towels and straightening up where at the Four Seasons which we have stayed out several times as well as for two days prior to our arrival at the Ritz, the chaises and pool were well attended and kept neat and clean. Drink cups and pieces of pineapple and food dishes were left to linger. Granted, it was spring break and the hotel was full but this was unacceptable. There seems to be lacking a level of middle management at the Ritz Kapalua thus the workers are not kept on their toes or held to any standard. Also, the winds are wicked up at the Ritz--called the Kapalua Winds--the south side of the island is warmer and not so windy. The beach is a good walk but they have a cart that drives guests up and down from the beach if you don't want to make the walk. The breakfast at the hotel was good but not great, instead we walked up to the little general store right outside of the hotel and had breakfast there which was casual and much cheaper. All in all, I would go back because it is so very beautiful there and I would hope that service improves. Also, when checking out we called way in advance for a bellman to take our luggage and after several reminder calls to the bell service they were still a half hour late in getting our luggage. I think they need a new management team and mission statement at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What I didn't know...”
Reviews.Author: tryin2chill
Reviews.Content: What I didn't know is that the Ritz Carlton is extremely windy and quite chilly. Therefore my family really couldn't enjoy the pool or the beach. When I say windy, I mean sitting by the pool at 2pm and towels are blowing into the pool, your drinks are blowing off the table, you're wet and wrapped in a towel trying to stop shivering. The pool...not heated and while my children and many other children wanted to get in the water. I as well as many other parents didn't want to get in. It was just too cold and everytime you moved a rush of cold water went past you. When you stepped out of the pool you would freeze. It felt terrible not at all like a tropical pleasure. I called and complained and was told the pool could only be heated to 82 degrees. They never did heat it up, the water was frigid. For what we paid I think we should be comfortable in warmer water. As far as service, it seems there laundry service has a gliche because there never seemed to be enough clean towels. Poolside towels were always in short supply. In our room we always had to ask for bath and face towels. I used our laundry bags 2 days in and they were never replaced. We had to ask for an iron, but we did keep it for the week. Room service was all over the place one day you would get your order in 30 minutes and then there was the absolutely unacceptable 1 hour and 40 minute wait. The employees I found to be very friendly...that being said the service was not that great. I found I had to make a lot of concessions and excuses for things that would go wrong. I was always having to say"that's okay". Like riding up the elavator with housekeeping and her cart of dirty laundry because the service elavator was broken...that's okay. Or to the poolside waitress for telling me their espresso machine was broken so I would have to wait another 30 minutes for my coffee...that's o.k. Or the hotel engineer that said the cable box on my t.v. was on the fritz so I couldn't watch my program...that's o.k. Which is why I rate my overall experience "OKAY". As far as being a Ritz Carlton, I just don't see it. I mean the rooms are newly renovated so of course they're nice, not spectacular, not at all roomy. To me they are just clean and unworn. The look of the hotel is very understated and needs more finness and finishing touches. Or maybe the look they were going for is some kind of fusion of Eastern simplicity mixed with South Pacific ambiance. What ever it is, it didn't take my breath away at all. It was sparse and cold like the rennovation went over budget . My eyes needed more to focus on to relax me. The reception desk and lobby didn't make me feel welcome or inspired. If your going to stay at the Ritz then you want to be able to stay there and have 100% of your basic vacations needs being anticipated and filled, luxury being fulfilled at whim. I found most of my comfort and fun and relaxation off the property. That says a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Ritz I'm Used To”
Reviews.Author: Kanorth
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ritz for a business conference and came in a few days early for some "R&R" before the conference. The hotel is lovely and the staff were friendly and accommodating; but this Ritz still needs some work. A few things to point out: 1. Iron and ironing board were not included in the room. We had to ask for one and so did other guests that we spoke with. This is unheard of at any hotel, let alone a Ritz! The bathroom did not include Q-tips and cotton balls - that's a small thing I know, but its something that has always been included in other Ritz properties. 2. We never knew what to expect from housekeeping. Some days we would get 3 bath towels, other days 2. Some days we did not get face clothes and other days we did not get hand towels - why??? 3. The beach is awful - only way to describe it, and not up to Ritz standards. You cannot sit on the beach with a lounge chair/umbrella or get service on the beach. It is unkempt and the reason indicated is because it is public. We went to Kanpali and the Westin and other hotels had chairs, etc on the beach, so I really don't know what the issue is; but its a shame that you're in Maui and can't enjoy the beach!! 4. The lounge chairs by the pool are uncomfortable - there's no padding on them. This is very unusual and we have never experienced this at other Ritz properties. The concierge was extremely helpful with dining suggestions and car rentals and activities. The front desk, bell men were also very helpful. The free shuttle to the other areas of Kapalua were great and made it easy to get around. The Plantation House is a great place for breakfast and dinner. The view is amazing. We enjoyed our stay and the price was right as we received the conference rate for the nights we paid on our own; but the Ritz needs to get on the ball and step it up to bring this property to the same standards as other Ritz properties. I don't think its worth the full price at this point.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: meredith0301
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our honeymoon at the Ritz in Maui. It exceeded our expectations. We stayed on the Club level. This is the way to go! The food was wonderful and amazing! The drinks were wonderful. Our first morning we were offered a momosa to celebrate our honeymoon, which is included. The rooms are beautiful! We could see awesome mountain views to our right and the ocean to our left. They were always cleaned well. Our coffee pot and shower doors were always cleaned. It is farther away from the action, but we loved this aspect. Just depends on what you are seeking. Kapalua is the most beautiful part of the island. Our only dissapointment was the Banyon Tree. It's a beautiful restuarant, but the food is not worth the price. My husband hates seafood; so he ordered his favorite meal, a filet. He was highly unimpressed. I ordered the fish which I did like. The local beer is wonderful if you like good beer (we're not a bud light, etc. fan). Everyone greeted you with Aloha and made you feel at home. The service in the Club level was amazing! They know you by name, wait on you hand and foot, have great restaurant and activity suggestions, and are extremely sweet. We were spoiled! It was a luxerious honeymoon we will never forget and we are looking forward to our next stay.

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in Maui”
Reviews.Author: LosGatosRealtor
Reviews.Content: We usually stay at the Kea Lani but after reading recent reviews we decided to try the newly redone Ritz Carlton. It was stunning. The rooms are now in a Tommy Bahama style and make sure that you try and get room 2647, it has the best view. The beach there is realy beautiful and hardly any people. There is a great casual restauarant on the beach and there is an incredible restaurant called the Banyan Tree. It was so good that we actually bought the chef a drink. If you are looking for low key, this is the place. If you have kids, they may prefer the Grand Wailea with the slides. Beware, this place is expensive. If you like martinis they were $17.00 made with the good gin. The best Mai Tai's that I have ever had. While there make a reservation at the Plantation House for sunset plus the food was exceptional. Dinner at The Lahainna Grill is also a must. The only recommendation I would make to the Ritz is to have more tiki torches (I love those at night)

Reviews.Title: “fab”
Reviews.Author: bigredjohn
