Reviews.Content: We spent five nights here in late February and early March, and the place is fabulous. Yes, it's expensive and the beach, while fine once you get there, requires a long walk or a cart ride, which they readily provide. Also, the hotel is further from other island attractions locations than other hotels. But pool area is wonderful and the hotel is quiet, gracious, classy, and relaxing. We had one problem, the in-room safe didn't work at first, but they quickly fixed it.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best 5 Star”
Reviews.Author: Mike H
Reviews.Content: Its the Ritz-Carlton in Maui, need I say more? Amazing guest service staff anticpated my every needs. I used to work for the Ritz-Carlton company so I knew what to expect. Each time they greated me by my name which to me goes along way. I even recieved a complentray upgrade to the Club Level, 3 meal presentations per day and open bar. The hotel, wow words dont describe how you feel when walking around this propety. I lived in Maui for a year and know what I wanted the hotel to be and it went above and beyond. The pool, was spectaular, So huge, lots of room and a great vibe with guest, and a few locals that sneak in.. shh... And the best part Honolua Bay is right down the road for the serious surfers!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great new style- Serivce not there yet”
Reviews.Author: Muntz73
Reviews.Content: Currently at the newly remodeled Ritz. Will post pictures upon my departure. The rooms are amazing. This property has done a great job in satisfying the older Ritz-Carlton guest that has been with them for years while making it feel more modern with a more modern flair and new technology in the rooms to attract a younger crowd like myself. Upon check-in we were asked to verify our rate. When the rate was $250/night higher then our confirmation we were asked to show our confirmation which I did. I thought that would be it. The next moring we had a message on our hotel phone asking us to again provide the front desk with a copy of our confirmation in order to prove our rate. I took great offense to the fact that the Ritz asked me to "prove my rate." It was squared away after that. We reserved an ocean view room in the honeymoon package which included complimentary valet, resort fee, $200 food/bev credit, champaigne, photo albumn, etc. We were upgraded to a "Residential Suite." This is the way to go. These suites are 850 s.f. with a kitchen, living room, large bedroom and large bath. The kitchen has an awesome huge eat around granite bar top, approximately 6'4'. It is really awesome. Suite features Sub Zero pull out drawer dishwasher, refrigerator/freezer. It was very nice to bring your own food and drinks to your room. Suprisingly, many guests had their own food and drinks at the bar and the resort had no issue with it. We saved a ton by doing this. I would highly recommend anyone looking at a regular room to compare the price for the Residential Suite. You will likely save the price difference plus more in the savings of food and drinks. Recent posts have mentioned loud noises at the pool due to construction. All of the construction appears to be gone as we didn't have any construction noise during our stay which started on Feb 22. Housekeeping is not up to par with a Ritz. The coffee pot was not cleaned for 4 days. The shower door (as previous poster mentioned) appeared like it had not been cleaned in months. I just got the feel that the did a quick cleaning by fluffing pillows, etc. Amenities were not consistently replinished daily. The Spa will not be in its own facility until mid May 2008. Currently they are on the 9th floor of the hotel. Currently there is not access to steam or sauna. The services are provided in empty hotel rooms. Since much of the spa experience is the atmosphere and ability to use steam and sauna I felt as if the spa should have offered a discount on services until they open their new facility. I scheduled the Men's package for $395 which included a 50 minute massage, a 30 minute peppermint scalp and foot massage at the same time with two therapists, and a facial. When the schalp massage started the foot massage therapist didn't show up. When I went to check out it was on my bill. I brought it to their attention and the clerk asked if I wanted it removed from my bill. Of course I did! He said there was a schedulding conflict. Poor excuse. I brought it to the GM's attention and they comp'd the entire service as well as offered a complimentary massage to my partner and me. I was satisfied with this. I have stayed at the Four Season in Maui previously. The Four Seasons is smaller and seems to be more friendly. The Ritz is a much larger property and you don't get the personalized service that we did at the four Seasons. Overall, I liked the property, however, will likely go back to the Four Seasons next year since they have just remodeled their rooms also. I would say a solid 4 starts but not up to the service the Ritz Carlton is known for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Smoothcat
Reviews.Content: Very Beautiful Hotel. Wife and I went for a convention stayed 9 nights. We had a suite overlooking JT Fleming Beach. If you can afford this it is the way to go. Pool area nice but bar closes early. Certain areas showing age. They were closing for a multi million dollar renovation shortly after we left. Bring a bag of money because you will need it. A round of golf at the Plantation course is a must. Maui is the most beautiful place I have ever been. A better lower priced option would be the resorts at kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “not 100% sold on ritz kapalua”
Reviews.Author: rwctraveler
Reviews.Content: Well I will start with the positive: The tri-level pools were great, plenty of lounge chairs and attentive service with drink orders, the beach was very nice and not far from the hotel, the Terrace for dinner was very good, my requests from housekeeping were met promptly, room service both mornings came right on time, the bed was comfy, the room decor including flat screen tv was very nice, the valet guys were quick to bring the car around, enjoyed the complimentary shuttle to take us to restauraunts within Kapalua and the best was that the hotel had upgraded us to the club level, which made a huge difference! The staff in the club lounge were excellent, and the chef's offerings were wonderful and gourmet. The negative: The glass shower door looked like it had not been cleaned prior to our arrival and during our stay ( I noticed 3 greasy fingerprints near the top right corner that were there before we arrived and stayed throughout our time in the room), because of the new renovation, there was fresh wall paper in the room and bathroom, but the toilet paper holders had wallpaper glue all over the metal (husband thought it looked like dried throw-up until the housekeeper explained it was wallpaper glue) why that was deemed exceptable at a ritz-carlton is beyond me, the AC unit was importing musty air into room when turned on, room service got wrong juice order one morning (not a big deal, but worth noting). The lobby terrace bar had the weirdest chairs, they had really high backs which completely blocked the beautiful view from anyone sitting behind them, and they were the most uncomfortable awkward chairs. I would most likely not return to this hotel, I would go back to the Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “1st class all the way!”
Reviews.Author: Hallsmenthol
Reviews.Content: The view was gorgous, the rooms were large and comfortable, the food was excellent, the drinks were delcicious, the beach was beautiful, the exercise room was great, and the service impeccable! We were there Feb 7-12 and had a blast. I hate buffets as a rule, but the breakfast was fabulous! The Banyan Tree was a little overrated( and over priced-as are most restaurants on Maui), but still good. They did not have the pool cabanas finished and were still doing small maintanence-enough to drive me from the pool area one time, but nothing major and it did not bother me enough to affect my review. When I return to Maui one day I would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not finished yet...still under construction!!”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvlr75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for a week in mid-late January. The hotel had been closed for renovations and just reopened around Christmas. The rooms were spacious, clean and nice, with flat screen tv's, great bedding, lovely bathrooms. Sound insulation is sub-par though - I could hear things from adjoining rooms and from the hallway quite well. The pool is very nice (though doesn't get many hours of sun this time of year), and the fitness facility is excellent. However, I experienced dismal service, much below what I would expect for the ritz carlton name and for the price. When I arrived at the hotel (well after the stated check-in time), I was told that the room was not ready, and that it might be an hour or so before it was cleaned. No gesture was made to acknowledge this problem (not even a drink at the bar or something), even after I politely expressed my dissatisfaction and asked if there was anything they would be willing to do. After traveling over 12 hours, this was not a pleasant arrival. There were also little things wrong with the room - there was no lock on the patio door, and the lock on the actual room door did not work. No one came to address these problems even after I nofied the front desk on the second day of our stay. Also, little inconsequential things - there were no ice machines on our floor due to construction, the alarm clock was out of batteries, the room safe was locked on our arrival, one of my room keys was not keyed correctly - these were all little things in themselves, but the entire experience left me less than impressed. More importantly, the grounds were not finished yet, and there was construction noise and work vehicles outside our room most of the day - not exactly great for the vacation mood or view. All in all, I wouldn't stay there, and especially not until the construction is completely finished. Maybe they just need time to work out the kinks, but I wouldn't recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “A Mixed Bag...”
Reviews.Author: bakdds
Reviews.Content: ... Fabulous location/property. Valet/baggage/check-in was chaotic and took longer than it should, though. Not the greatest first impression. And our room wasn't ready, even though we arrived after their check-in time. They were, however, quick to comp us a drink and appetizer while we waited (very nice, and tasty). When our room was finally ready an hour or two later, it was lovely- but they gave us a room with a strong urine odor (Eww!) and an unappealing handicapped bathroom set-up (which we didn't ask for or require). Getting another room took a few more hours but, to their credit, they comped us with another round of drinks and appetizers (delicious). Our replacement room was as lovely as the first (without the odor, plus it had a fantastic bathroom), but now our luggage was misplaced! So, even more time and aggravation getting settled. Again, they comped us- this time for drinks, wine, dinner, and desert (another great meal). So, a mixed bag; all the troubles shouldn't have happened in the first place- especially at a Ritz-Carlton. And it was stressful- not a great start to what was supposed to be a relaxing/stress-free vacation. But they did do what they could to make it right, which was definitely appreciated. And their comps were offered, not asked for, which was a nice touch that saved the day.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Windy and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Ihearthawaii
Reviews.Content: Just stayed at the Ritz Jan.19-24 with a group. Mostly it was wonderful. Group check in took too long, think it was because of technology issues. Had a person take you to your room & point out areas on your way. It is rather a large hotel, but easy to get around. All the redecorating from the recent renovations were very beautiful. They were still doing some renovations while there. We saw landscapers, painters in and out, carpet layers, furniture stacked to be delivered, etc. They did their best to keep things out of the way of customers. The worst was at the pool after most of the group left. They were building some kind of cabanas and noise was very annoying. We ended up moving down to the beach to get away. The rooms were nicely redone (a little sparse on furniture). Loved the new tiled separate shower with rain type spout. Had great water pressue and temps the whole time. Always plenty of towels and refreshed in the evening. Two towels for each person at the pool and the attendants put them out for you too. They had plenty of good service for drinks and even brought fresh pineapple around while at pool. Great food & service any place we ate. Weather was probably the biggest negative. Very windy (tradewinds) and cloudy which we were told was pretty typical. If you drove a few miles south to Kaanapalli or Lahaina it was 10degrees warmer. They had a nice type of general store you could walk to just off the property with a very reasonable deli which we appreciated. My husband golfed at the Plantation which was wonderful with the most gorgeous views. Lots of walking up and down hills could possibly challenge some. If you don't rent a car it is very costly $120 to get to Lahaina for shopping or other activities. They do not have transportation to airport either which is another expense. Better off to rent a car and return it and yourselves to the airport. Once all renovations are done this would be a great place to stay especially if you like a quieter hotel. If you want to be closer to action I would suggest you stay in Kaanapalli or Lahaina area. The staff were all helpful and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Oops - A little too early!”
Reviews.Author: tripchoice
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location but hotel had only just reopened (prematurely), staffing was ramping up and construction/landscaping (read noise inside and out) was ongoing. Pool area not fully open (only one pool at the time we were there and too noisy from ongoing landscaping), and main restaurant not yet open - neither was spa (due to open in May). Completed rooms were pleasant, as were the staff. I would suggest waiting a few months before staying here, otherwise you won't see this hotel at its undoubtedly best. Fly in to West Maui airport - it's only 5 minutes away via hotel shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, cant go wrong”
Reviews.Author: docjennings
Reviews.Content: Its the Ritz! Everything is fabulous; the room, the service, the food, the pool, the ocean....... I could elaborate, but my husband and I stayed here for a couple nights on our honeymoon and it was everything and more. There is a reason the Ritz is the Ritz!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Aloaloa Lounge”
Reviews.Author: 35000ft
Reviews.Content: The Aloaloa lounge is the brightest lounge on the planet, way too open, no concept of space utilization to create a place to meet, drink, etc....Drinks were below average but when paying Ritz Carlton prices they were awful. The musician setup was poor, acoustics poor. Service was pretentious. Not a place to go for a good drink or good time on Maui. Both the bar and sushi bar were practically empty on a Friday night, which was probably not a new occurrence. Star struck guests will continue to give high ratings solely due to the name, but rest assured any traveler with standards would consider this resort overpriced, stuffy and unimpressive. Not recommended.

Reviews.Title: “It was very good”
Reviews.Author: Buyer2007
Reviews.Content: For sure it's a great hotel. Very nice and clean. The staff was more then great and helpful. Great room, great view great everything. But who needs to hear all the good stuff? it's the bad stuff that I look for in a review and see if it's bad enough for me not to stay or if it's not or wont mind it and stay there. So yes to get the point across, the hotel is just amazing. Now for things we didn't like. The hotel is just wayyyyy too big, it took about 20 min from our car to get to our room, YES it's that big. Even though we had an ocean view room, it took us a long time to get to the beach, and that's because the hotel is on a burial ground, so they had to place the hotel back which made it an even longer walk to the beach. We stayed there for 5 nights, and it wasn't cheap so you do the math. One thing I have to say though, you must try the water in the gym, amazing. So if your looking to spend few days in a really really nice place and you don't care about the island or activities this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton - great as usual”
Reviews.Author: OlyaDallas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location, beautiful grounds. Incredible hospitality, Ritz Carlton rarely disappoints. Has a nice Hawaiian touch in service and room decor, which is great for a large chain like that. I was there for a corporate event, and it was as smooth as it gets. I'm sure vacation stay would have been as comfortable and a lot more exciting!

Reviews.Title: “probaly the best hotel ive ever stayed at in my life”
Reviews.Author: peter99ba
Reviews.Content: i loved staying here! the hotel grounds areperfect,clean as can be. tropical. the lobby is awesome. the food is great. loved the pool. its like dying and going to heaven! i wish i cango back there tomorrow. i think about the place almost everyday since ive been there. if youcan go here by all means go there. the ebach is far from the grounds but you can get a lift anythime. the beach is small and cozy. the gym is nice and so is the tennis courts.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: klone23
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful stay. The location is perfect if you plan staying on the western side of the Island. Close to Lahaina and just a short walk to the ocean. I stayed in a standard room and had a beautiful view onto the multi-tiered pool. Staff was helpful and got to meet some of the Roxy's women's professional surf team who were competing in the Van's Triple Crown surf competition nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Maui - doesn't get any better than this”
Reviews.Author: Mary_Phila_PA
Reviews.Content: Doesn't get any better than this. Phenomenal service, view, room, and food. I've stayed at numerous Ritz's and this one really outshines the rest. I would recommend to anyone looking for accomodations in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “A few nights at the ritz”
Reviews.Author: reddytotravel
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton was a beautiful place to stay. Fortunately for us, we got a discounted rate to stay, well below the average posted on the website. The room we got was on the golf course side, unfortunately, the ocean view rooms were all booked. We also got a chance to look at some of the suites that our friends were staying in. The rooms were very clean, but in need of a little bit of updating. Our carpet had an iron burn in it, and it was a little worn out by the sliding doors. The bathroom was very clean, which is the most important. I found the actual common areas of the hotel to be spectacular. The grounds were just stunning, and secluded - always nice when you are on a romantic getaway. The pool was just awesome. A few minor points that bothered me - there was no available shade by the pool without paying an additional $75 for a "tent", per day. I found this to be excessive, and since I am fair - I could only stay for a short period by the pool. I find it a shame that a high end hotel like this would charge for shade.... The food at the restaurants on location were very pricey. If you missed the morning free coffee (until 8 AM), then the cost was about $3 per coffee. I paid over $7 for a muffin and a coffee. Also, we had a glass of wine and a Rye and Ginger in the pub at night, and it cost us $21. Many of the people who stayed with us, would opt to eat at the local "market", which was much cheaper - but much greasier. The employees were absolutely friendly and very nice. Since they are closing for the summer for renovations, I can only imagine how spectacular this resort will end up being.....

Reviews.Title: “nice property”
Reviews.Author: tickettoride
Reviews.Content: We stayed here a while ago and just getting now to making my review.If you want to be out to the far side of Maui and away from the strip hotels and the traffic of town this is the place. First we were put off by the room they put us in that was musty and cut into the hillside (first floor) They did move us and the second room was great wilth a lovely view.I didn't particularly care for the Key West decor in the rooms.This place is filled with incredible art (paintings) and the staff wonderful.The food is great as well.By far my favorite was the breakfast room and its lovely view over the pines to the ocean.So in conclusion if golf is your thing this is the place to be.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel of My Life”
Reviews.Author: jhefs
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the Maui portion of our honeymoon and it was everything we could have asked for and more. The location was perfect, not right in Lahaina, but slightly north in Kapalua. At first I thought that would be a negative, but it ended up just great. I do suggest flying into the smaller airport for Kapalua if possible to avoid a long drive. That worked out really well for us. Overall compared to Lahaina hotels, the Ritz t was less crowded, more pristine and the golf course views and grounds were fabulous. There was great snorkeling nearby and Lahaina was a relatively short drive for dinner at night. Rooms and service were, of course, impeccable. I HIGHLY recommend the butler drawn bath w/rose petals, I think it's called the Romance Package or something like that. The concierge desk is so accomodating and helpful booking excursions or with info. It's expensive to stay here, but you get what you pay for - it is a fabulous experience. If it is a once in a lifetime trip and you can swing it, definitely stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: Katoblitzo
Reviews.Content: If you have the ca$h to splurge - this is the place to stay in Maui!! From start to finish this place was a class act. The rooms were spacious and very clean, staff was ultra friendly, and the food was just unbelievable. My husband and I honeymooned at this hotel and had a wonderful time. The restaurant at the hotel is phenomenal - they provided a wide variety of things to try and everything was delicious. The location is the only drawback - it's a hike to get to it... but it's well worth it! Great golf course, great views, great beds... I highly recommend the Ritz in Maui. If you have the chance... this is the ONLY place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “really nice place”
Reviews.Author: mr_hand
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Ritz due to the Hyatt being overbooked so they put us up here. We stayed in a one bedroom suite which was really nice and it overlooked the golf course. We ate dinner at the bar/restaurant that overlooked the pool/ocean. The food was good and the view was great. We also ate breakfast at the buffet and it was excellent - definitely try the coconut syrup on the pancakes! The pool was very nice at the hotel but there isn't really much for kids at this hotel. I'd recommend it for couples though because it wasn't really crowded and the ocean views were great.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Property and Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: KOK1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from the Ritz Carlton Kapalua after spending 9 nights there for our 10th Anniversary. We had a wonderful time and were very pleased with the hotel overall. First, letâ€™s dispense with some of the incorrect comments on this siteâ€¦the hotel is beautiful and in a beautiful setting. Rooms are not disgusting, just a little dated. Service to us was excellent, save a couple of small last day attitude problems. The pool was large and deep enough (5.5 feet at the center of each of the three pools). There are not wind barriers everywhere â€“ just a few that are discretely placed between the first and second tier pools. The weather was not horrible all the time. During our stay, we had one day of drizzly weather (thankfully the day we left). The rest of the time, it was sunny and breezy. The food at breakfast was very good. The Ritz is closing for an extensive 6-month renovation period at the end of June 2007. However, several things are worth mentioning. My wife and I were very pleasantly surprised by the level of service at the Ritz. Most employees we dealt with were pleasant and accommodating. Some went beyond our expectations. A couple didnâ€™t live up to Ritz standards, but thatâ€™s bound to happen anywhere. Our package included an upgrade to an oceanview room from partial oceanview. When we arrived, we were shown to our room, close to the end of the Napili wing, by Michael, a 13 year veteran of the hotel. The only ocean view from the room was from the balcony, off to the right. When we asked what other possibilities existed, Michael immediately checked with the front desk. He showed us one alternative, but when we didnâ€™t like that one, he told us to sit tight in our first room until he called us with other options. A few minutes later, he called and stated that we could move to a direct ocean view room on the end of the Napili wing the next day and stay there for the rest of our stay. The view from the new room was amazing (see photos) and made our trip. Michael didnâ€™t have to accommodate us in this fashion, but he went way above the call of duty to please us. We wonâ€™t forget that. Our package also included a daily breakfast buffet. We thought the food was quite good, though the choices were a bit limited. Nevertheless, all the basics were there, and we were able to order fresh omelettes and Belgian waffles, and eat as much amazing Hawaiian pineapple as we wanted. Unless you want to throw money away during your trip, however, make sure that your breakfast is included in your rate. The bill for two buffet breakfasts tops $70 otherwise. Also be sure to check your hotel bill upon checkout. Twice we were charged for breakfast by mistake (something I saw on other reviews). They will adjust the bill if you mention it, however. The view from the Terrace Restaurant, where breakfast is served, is wonderful, overlooking the pool and courtyard of the hotel, with the blue Pacific beyond. Yes, the rooms were somewhat dated, but clean and bright. We didnâ€™t see any disgusting stains. The bed was a little soft for my tastes, but comfortable. The carpet was fine. Keep in mind these carpets are probably walked on with wet, sunscreen plastered feet on a regular basis. Luxury carpet is not something to expect in the tropics. We felt lucky to have any at all. Many hotels, such as those in Mexico, only use tile in the rooms, which I hate. We were told by an employee that the renovation, which begins at the end of June, will make the rooms approximately one and a half times their current size. The hotel is also redoing the entire pool area to try and compete with the likes of the Grand Wailea. Thatâ€™s a tall order, especially for the space the Ritz has. We think thatâ€™s sad, because the pool was better than we expected. It was deeper than others reported on this site, ranging from about 3 feet at the edges to 5.5 feet in the middle of each of the three pools, and the atmosphere with the palm trees, waterfalls and landscaping was relaxing. The water was not too cold, either. Two nice, though very hot, Jacuzzis were pleasant as well. We were there the week before and through Memorial Day weekend, and never had a problem finding lounge chairs. As far as the wind is concerned â€“ yes, it can be pretty windy. Our first three days there was a light breeze. We were wondering what all the complaining was about. Then the famous Kapalua winds kicked in and for the rest of our trip, there was a steady 20-30mph wind, with higher gusts, through the entire area during the day. It was occasionally annoying at the pool (especially when you wanted to wear a hat), but by no means ruined our trip. We went to Fleming Beach (in front of the hotel), Kapalua Bay Beach, and Kaanapali Beach. Surprisingly, we liked Fleming beach the best. In our opinion, Kapalua Bay is overrated. If you are a die hard snorkeler, you may want to check Kapalua out because of the volcanic rock offshore, but the setting right now is awful. The Ritz is building its â€œpartial ownershipâ€� resort at one end of the bay, and 3-4 cranes, along with construction noise, tower over the beach, destroying the touted â€œidyllicâ€� view. Kapalua was also quite crowded â€“ probably because itâ€™s written up in tour books as being one of the best beaches on Maui. The surf was also a little rough while we were there. We left after about an hour. Napili Bay, a short walk through the Napili Kai resort from Kapalua Bay, is much bigger and in our opinion more beautiful than Kapalua Bay. However, neither Kapalua or Napili seemed good beaches for shallow swimming. The sand drops off rather sharply, with resulting waves that can knock you around. We also checked out the north end of Kaanapali Beach, north of Black Rock. A good place to read a book, but again, not for shallow swimming. We saw an elderly couple get knocked down and almost out into the water by the waves. I and another person had to help them up. Fleming Beach was never crowded, and had a nice area in the center where you could wade out and enjoy the gentle waves without running into rocks. Areas at the edge of the bay, which have some volcanic rock, are supposedly nice for snorkeling. A couple of other items are worth noting: the Hawaiian slack key guitar series at the hotel is excellent if you enjoy different kinds of music. The music is not the typical Hawaiian steel guitar (â€œBlue Hawaiiâ€�), but Hawaiiâ€™s own folk music with performers playing guitar and singing in Hawaiian language. Second, for our 10th Anniversary, we booked two tickets on Volcano Air Tours. Stay away from this tour operator! Despite the claims (which we double checked by having the Ritz call them to confirm), there was no air conditioning on the plane, most sights are only visible on the right side of the plane, and the engine noise was deafening even with headsets on. At $400 a ticket, it was a huge disappointment and basically ruined our day. Because of the constant dipping and steep turning of the plane, both my wife and I got sick during the flight (along with at least one other passenger), everyone was sweating, and the pilot, Captain Bill, had the audacity to play his own bandâ€™s music through the headsets and ask for tips at the end of the flight! Credit to the Ritz and Front of Office Manager JoAnne. We told her of our experience the next day and after the operator refused to grant any concession, she promptly removed the operator from the hotelâ€™s list of recommended activities, AND credited us for one of the tickets since they had booked it for us. Another example where an employee went beyond the call of duty to please us. Our only negative comments about our stay at the Ritz have to do with the restaurant prices. We only ate breakfast there since it was included in our package. The other options on the immediate property were the Lobby Bar, the Terrace and the Banyan Tree. Our first night there we were tired and only wanted something light to eat. The Lobby Bar charges $20 for hamburgers and wraps (along with the Terrace). We couldnâ€™t stomach such prices and ended up driving to get dinner down the road in Kahana â€“ something we didnâ€™t feel like doing after 12 hours traveling. The menu at the pool bar is also very expensive. However, you can ask for the kidâ€™s menu (itâ€™s usually hidden!) and order very good chicken fingers with fries for $7. We did that twice and were happy. The Banyan Tree looked great, but again, the prices were ridiculous, even for Maui. $40+ for entrees, $10 for side items and nearly $15 for desserts is just taking advantage of people. Although other good restaurants on the island arenâ€™t much better price-wise, thereâ€™s a limit. We wouldnâ€™t have been able to enjoy our dinner knowing it cost so much. Our best meal was actually at one of the cheaper restaurants: the Hula Grill (beachside section) at Whalerâ€™s Village in Kaanapali. Their crab and macadamia nut wonton appetizers were awesome! Also try the firecracker fish â€“ as good as any of the more expensive fish dishes on the island. Plus a great sunset if you get there on time. Plan on a 45 minute wait for a table. Other restaurant recommendations: Plantation Grill is nice for lunch or dinner (killer view). Pineapple Grill, Royâ€™s, and Kimoâ€™s were also good. Didnâ€™t like Leilaniâ€™s much (tough steaks), except for the view. Pacific â€˜O was good but pricey. Finally, Old Lahaina Luau is fun, but a little expensive. Overall, we werenâ€™t blown away by the food on Maui. Nothing made us go â€œWow!â€�, except the wontons at Hula and the chocolate soufflÃ© at Royâ€™s. Enjoy the Ritz this month, but plan to eat out if you want to save money. Four stars only because the rooms are a little dated and the restaurant prices are too high - otherwise it's a five star property. We look forward to hopefully returning in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, superb staff and an amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Kelly3475
Reviews.Content: My stay at Kapalua was absolutely amazing. Everything was beautiful, especially the view and grounds, I was in awe every time I walked outside or sat out on the lanai. The staff was incredibly hospitable, always offering a kind smile and â€œalohaâ€�. The valet staff was particularly gracious with suggestions as well as assistance getting around. The property was perfect for everyone, families, couples, or on a trip with friends. I would reccommend to anyone visiting Maui and would definitely return. The location is great too, private, yet very close to nearby towns like Kahana and Lahina, great places to check out, but I would suggest staying in Kapalua- the experience and location of this Ritz far exceeded my expectations. A perfect vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Very Special Place!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: PhotoNYC
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 days at the Ritz Carlton! I do have to say I was a little bit un easy staying here because I have always found the Ritz to be very stuffy. Superisingly this hotel was anything but stuffy. It was very airy and relaxed yet you still recieved the amazing service that the Ritz always provides. The hotel was decorated in a 1930's colonial hawaiian feel that was very relaxed and airy. Alot of out door indoor spaces with incredible views. The rooms are due for an update but were very spacious and clean. The beds were heaven and the bathroom was huge with seperated bathtub and shower all in white carrera marble. Every room has a balcony which either over looks the amazing grounds or the ocean (you can't loose either way). The hotel has an amazing pool that is has three different levels. I am not really a pool person so I did not spend any time at the pool but I did notice the size and the beauty of it. The beach was incredible about 500 hundred yards of private beach that had crystal clear waters and powder sugar soft sand enclosed by beautiful volcanic rocks and cliffs. There are lounge, chairs and cabanas with service at the beach which is very nice. You also have 2 of the best snorkeling coves in all of Maui on both sides of the resort which were absolutely breathtaking. There are 4 restaurants on the resort which were all fantastic especially the banyan tree!!!!! The Town of Kapalua is incredible!!!!! It reminded me of a little camp ground with pine trees and redwood cabins with stores, shops and restaurants. Kapalua resembles if Santa Cruz or Bolder Colorado were in Hawaii this is what Kapalua would be. Very charming incredibly beautiful and had an extremely special feeling. The Ritz is a huge resort and the grounds are enormous but I found it to be very private and very personal. You rarely saw anyone unless you were at the pool. I really enjoyed my stay and would recommend anyone to stay here!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: kjbuffy
Reviews.Content: As has been mentioned countless times, I too was very skeptical of staying at the Ritz. I booked our reservation about 4 months before our weeklong stay from 4/27-5/4. For the last 4 months I have jumped on here frequently to see the updated reviews on the Ritz as I wanted to make sure my honeymoon was as good as it could be. I noticed that it seemed people either loved it or hated it....no in between. I was worried but decided to keep our reservation anyway as I am always skeptical of how accurate these reviews really are. I am glad I did. I believe that it helps to know a little about the type of person that is giving the review in order to understand if the review maybe would apply to how you look at things. That said, my wife and I are 27, are both professionals, and have been fortunate enough to have traveled quite a bit for both work and play, and have stayed in some pretty nice hotels and locales. We wanted a romantic honeymoon spot that was quiet (i.e. not loaded with kids), that was fun, and also classy without being uppity. I am the guy who likes to see things, but likes to spend most of the time relaxing on the beach with a drink in my hand. My wife is the sight seer who has to be on a schedule and wants to see and do every possible thing she can. We are also "foodies", i.e. we love to try new food and restaurants. Therefore, we wanted a vacation that gave us lots of options. The Ritz and the island of Maui fit this need perfectly. The experience started off rocky at first. When I checked in I was told that they had upgraded us to an ocean view room but that the upgrade would be $140/nt extra. I was hoping to receive a complimentary upgrade as I have read that they do this quite a bit for honeymooners. My wife and I went and looked at the room and really enjoyed it (not to mention the rose petals they had laid out for us on the floor and all over the bed when we walked in!). However, we decided that paying that much extra per night was not worth it. The good news was, I worked with Maria at the front desk and after allowing me to look at a few different rooms to see what I liked they ended up moving us into a room that was in the exact same spot as the ocean view room we had previously, except it was on the 7th floor instead of the 9th.....and it was complimentary. I was very happy with it. The Ritz also gave us a photo album to put all our honeymoon pictures in which was a nice touch. Grace at the front desk also waived the $20/day resort charge for us, as a honeymoon "gift." After check-in, all went smooth. Our bell hop, Byron, was awesome, he gave us all kinds of info, and even called up a restaurant in Lahina that he used to work at, from our room, and got us a reservation for that evening. Nice touch! As far as the rooms, here is my take. The partial ocean view room we were in was fine, except for the carpet. We were on the lobby level (7th floor) of the hotel....and our carpet in the entry way to the room was very dirty around the baseboards and opening to the bathroom. It looked bad, and definitely not what you would expect from the Ritz. However, the rest of the decor and room was great, bed was comfortable, lanai was nice, bathroom was very spacious and nice. TV's are old, but they are fine, work just like any other TV, and like others have said, who cares...you shouldn't be watching TV in Hawaii anyway!! The front desk seems to be very aware that some of the rooms have terrible carpet, because as I was checking in and looking at different rooms the front desk girl would constantly ask room service over the walkie talkie, "how are the carpets in that room?" They seem to understand that renovation is very needed and try to avoid putting people in those rooms that are in bad shape. And it sounds like those people who are able to stay in the Club Level rooms have had no problems. If you don't like the room, just go to the front desk and tell them to move you....they are more than accomodating. Also, with regards to housekeeping...we had no problems. They did a good job, were friendly, even thanking us for the tips we left them each day. My wife accidentally broke a bottle of makeup/moisturizer she had brought along and left it it pieces on the counter in the bathroom because she still wanted to use as much of it as possible. We came back to the room one day to find a note sitting besides the broken makeup bottle from housekeeping apologizing for breaking the bottle and offereing to replace it for us, and they didn't even break it! Other than the carpet in our room, everything else about the Ritz was great. The staff was all nice and curteous, the concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable, the pool was great (huge, not overcrowed, nice breeze) and the beach and beach restaurant were nice (try the pulled pork sandwich at the Beach House). The beach does get a rough surf, so I wouldn't recommend it for little ones, but then again, I wouldn't recommed the Ritz for families with kids anyway. I loved the location. Yes you are as far northwest as you can stay on Maui, but it is a great location. You are a five minute drive (at most) from Kaanapali and 10 minutes at most from Lahina. It is a windy at times in Kapalua, but it was also windy when we were in Kaanapali or Lahina. It rained a couple of days for about 5 minutes, and other than that the weather was great! The Kapalua resort is very nice, and quiet. You have Kapalua Bay which is calm and a great swimming and snorkling spot, and also DT Fleming Beach in front of the Ritz which is better for boogie boarding and surfing. By the way, the walk to the beach is no big deal, it is a 5 minute walk, at most from the hotel lobby. It is just down the hill from the pool, by the basketball and tennis courts. There are also some great restaurants in the resort as well, not to mention the golf. Vino (Italian tapas), and Sensei (sushi) are a MUST. Both of these are located right up the hill from the Ritz...easy 2-5 minute walk. We also ate at the Plantation House at the Plantation Golf Course. Amazing. Unbelievable sunset and views looking out over the course and then the ocean and Molokai island in the distance. Make sure you make a reservation for about a half hour before sunset...it is well worth it. I would also highly recommend playing the Plantation Course if you are a golfer.....$195/person if you are staying at the Ritz...$130/person if you play after 2pm. I am a 15 handicap and still loved it. I thought it would eat me alive, but it was actually very enjoyable. Well worth the money. I would also highly recommed going to Lahina to eat and shop. We ate at a few restaurants in Lahina that we loved, Kimo's, Pacific O, and we went to the Feast of LeLe Luau which is on the beach in Lahina (highly, highly recommend this luau for couples...it is expensive, but they put couples at their own table. The food is awesome, they keep the drinks coming, the show is entertaining, and the view of the ocean and sunset can't be beat...it is also put on by the same people who do the Old Lahina Luau). We were very glad that we chose to stay on the west side of Maui as opposed to the south side in Wailea. We have a couple friends of ours that honeymooned in Wailea a year ago, so we made it a point to go over there and check it out. Wailea is nice, but it is very crowded, and has the "resort feel", i.e. very touristy, nothing else to do really accept stuff at the resorts. West Maui just seems to have more to do, be more authentic, and it has Lahina which is really the only town with nightlife. Another friend of mine is honeymooning in Maui this October, and we recommended to him, based on what we saw, to either stay in Kapalua or in Kaanapali (either the Hyatt or Westin). Overall, I would definitely recommend the Ritz to honeymooners who want a quiet, classy place to stay, but also be close enough to awesome restaurants, activities, golf, beaches, and nightlife. Would would stay there again in a heartbeat. And after the renovation this year, the place should be even more amazing, and take care of the few small problems with the hotel. (I have noticed that many of the reviews quote different time frames for the renovation....the correct time frame is July-December...they hope to be done by X-mas). If you are planning your honeymoon for Spring of '08, I would definitely think about staying at the Ritz. Feel free to ask me any questions you have, and I will try to help as much as possible. Hope this helps some of you out there. Mahalo!!

Reviews.Title: “Should not be called a Ritz....”
Reviews.Author: luv_travel_13
Reviews.Content: I was very disapponted with this Ritz. Seriously, it should not be called a Ritz and it's definitely not a 5 star hotel. The rooms were horriblly out-dated; the curtains had holes in them. They had no cover on the comforter - disgusting. We checked with housekeeping to see if they forgot to put it on and they said no that's the way they do it...they put a blanket on top of the comforter but no cover. Oh, the TV was literally from 1970; it is seriously the oldest TV I've ever seen in a hotel...it was ancient. The service was average, nothing special. The grounds were big but again nothing out of this world. The pricing of food, etc. was ridiculous and the food was bland. At a buffet, they mis-labeled a meat as beef and I ate it but we later found out is was PORK - which I do not eat for religious purposes. I was very angry obviously. They apologized but that's it; you would think they would comp a meal for such a serious error, especially for a five star hotel. Anyway, there are a lot better hotels in Maui - avoid this one. Oh, the location is not great - it is kind of in the middle of nowhere. If you like more action then again do not stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Caring staff, amazing vacation spot”
Reviews.Author: BrWo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton at one of the busiest times--Christmas through New years--and must diagree with some of the reviews. The rooms we had--two adjacent--were in perfect condition. The bathrooms were nicer than the Pierre New York and the decor--though at the point of beginning to need an update --was quite beautiful and immaculately maintained. Room service and room cleaning were perfect. The public areas are very much Ritz-Carlton/Four Seasons standards. Elegant and constantly maintained. The beach is a very short walk away and we loved the beautiful pools, putting green and great restaurants. The Banyan tree, however, is an absolute standout--book an early seating to see the sunset. Like all properties there are downsides. At busy points the service in the Terrace Restaurnat at lunch and dinner, or the lobby bar, or the pool side, could be slow. But I was on vacation and not watching the clock! Terrace breakfast was a different matter--very attentive. Be warned, there is more wind and rain--but that is not the fault of the hotel . Conceirge desk was also worth mentioning. I can only imagine how much better the resort will be after renovation Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Very Positive Experience Overall”
Reviews.Author: Leighsah
Reviews.Content: We just came back from a 3 night stay at the Ritz. We go to Maui every year and usually stay in Kapalua at the Ritz. We love the Kapalua climate and peaceful, serene setting over some of the other areas in the island we've stayed like Wailea and Kaanapali. Those areas tend to be warmer and sunnier but busier (i.e. crowded). Overall, we had a wonderful experience. We booked a club level room, but were switched to a different floor after seeing the view from the only available room on the 8th floor. When you book a club level room, you aren't guarenteed an ocean view. We still had access to the club amenities so it worked out very well. The view from the room we ended up with was fantastic and overlooked the golf course and ocean. It was very secluded. Most staff were incredibly pleasant and helpful. John the bellhop was great. Club level concierges Lindsay and Kimberly were very friendly. They were gracious hosts that made us feel like we were hanging out in our living room. My husband and I actually stopped by to say goodbye to them before we left and one of them actually gave us a hug before we left. We loved the five different food presentations each day and the endless tropical drinks. The Ritz offers a bunch of free classes like how to make a lei, hula dancing, sarong tying, yoga, Maui meditation and I actually went to some of them this time. Most people don't go so you end up getting a one-on-one class. The BEST thing I did was go to the "Sense of Place" class which features a cultural advisor (very knowledgeable and super nice) who shows the documentary film "Then There Were None" and discusses the history or Hawaii and specifically the significance of the Ritz location. I would also highly recommend booking a reservation at Sensei. The sashimi is amazing and the mango crab salad hand roll was great too. As other reviewers have stated, the rooms are somewhat outdated. I believe we were told that it had not been updated in 15 years and the decor in the rooms reflects that. Also, we did encounter some similar experiences of ambivalent/not overly friendly staff - particularly at check-in and at the pool. It wasn't negative - just not what we've come to expect at the Ritz. Since we have been there before, we know that they did not welcome us in the same way they did in the past (offer us punch or water, etc). We missed some of the nice little touches they use to do in the past. For example, at the pool they use to give us Evian spritzes, little pineapple samplings, and staff regularly would check if we needed anything. Not this time. It's probably because of the closing. I think the attitude of the staff depended on their personal circumstances because the staff members that were friendly were looking forward to the closing so they could travel. Others maybe were bitter about the closing for 6 months and it showed. Overall, the staff at the Ritz were better than almost everyone we encountered during our subsequent stay on the Big Island. Looking forward to seeing the improvements next year. We will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Closing down in July and service is reflective...”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGolfers
Reviews.Content: We read the reviews prior to our stay, and were expecting a dated room...We were not expecting to have personal items taken from our room by housekeeping while we were in the club room enjoying cocktails at sunset. This property is closing down in July for renovations and all of the employees attitudes reflect their future loss/lapse of employment. The rooms are in need of updating, but as another review stated....the room was dirty, smelly, and one side of the king size bed was so badly broken down, my husband rolled out of bed several times in the night. A few employees were nice....but most seemed bitter because of their upcoming loss of employment. The pool is very plain..and the breakfast buffett is very limited compared to other resorts. .....and they automatically include gratuity for everything...not just room service or parties of 6-8 more....we were only a party of 2. I believe the employees automatically include gratuity because they know their attitudes are not worthy of tips .... Overall, it feels like a sinking ship....and the principal of missing property from our room caused us to check out early and move to another resort on the island. We were told by several employees who were aware that our personal property was missing from our room ...that a manager was going to be in contact with us.....But a manager never contacted us or even made an effort to express how unacceptable this was. We will be contacting corporate Ritz to report that something was taken from our room during the nightly turn down service......the property could care less. Go elsewhere.....might be nice after renovations..but we are very hesitant to go back. Kapalua is nice though, especially if you are a golfer....we played the Plantation course and were blown away....but skip the ritz.....stay at one of the Kapalua villas...or somewhere else on the island ...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but stinky rooms and terrible service!”
Reviews.Author: FloridaLuvtotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz-Carlton from April 23 - April 29th. I was excited to be staying at my first Ritz. However, my excitement quickly turned to disappointment. Upon entering our room, we were overcome by an awful musty odor. The decor was not only terribly dated, but dirty as well. The carpet was stained and faded. I heard the hotel is going to be closing for renovations and none to soon. The staff and the service were a huge disappointment. We would come back from excursions at 3:00 p.m., in the afternoon to find our room had not been cleaned. When the room was cleaned, the trash was not emptied or the bed was made, but the bed spread was lying in a wad on the floor. I had to ask two days in a row for wash cloths. They had our check out date wrong and we had to call twice and then go to the front desk to finally get it fixed. Upon leaving, we phoned the bellman and asked that they come up to get our luggage. After 20 minutes, no one had showed and we ended up dragging our luggage down ourselves because we were afraid we were going to miss our shuttle. The grounds are nice, the pool and beach are lovely, but the rooms and the staff are awful. My husband and I have traveled all over the world and we were dumbfounded by the treatment we received at this supposedly five star hotel. Save your money and stay somewhere else!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Hawaiian Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Raszsch
Reviews.Content: Wy husdand & I stayed at the Ritz for 6 nights, 4/24-4/29. The grounds were immacluate, rooms were well appointed. The entire Kapalua area just takes your breath away. This is truly a world-renonwed resort. (There was a cheese platter delivered to our room the first night - for no apparent reason. It was from Guest Services telling us to enjoy our stay!) The whole resort will be getting a facelift starting June'07. Yes, there were some paint chips, peeling wall paper, tiles off the pool - but these isses were few and far between. (All rooms will be re-done w/the re-hab, as well as the entire pool area - we hear there will be a children's pool area). Although some aspects were outdated, we felt that our room price made up for that (buy 5 nights, get the 6th free & a $250 food/bev voucher). I'm sure one the resort re-opens the room rate will double. All of the food we had on site was great, and the service was never lacking. The concierage was amazing and helped plan all of our excursions. The golf was out of this world - both the Bay and Plantation courses are worth playing (Ritz guests get a discount on tee times). Overall, we had a wonderful & picturesque Hawaiian vacation and will return to Kapalua and to the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Property”
Reviews.Author: cstauffe
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned from 10 days at the Ritz in Kapalua. We were a little concerned about some of the negative comments posted on tripadvisor, but after our stay, I have to wonder if the guests with negative comments were staying at the same resort? We stayed in a Club Level room that was absolutely gorgeous facing the Bay Course and ocean. The decor is classic Carribean......I read a lot of reviews complaining about the dated furniture......but what was in our room never goes out of style. True, the TV is old......if you watch a lot of television and need a new plasma, you will be disappointed. We try to watch as little TV as possible on vacation.....so it was not an issue for us. In our opinion, the Club Level is the only way to go.......it is a Ritz within a Ritz and offers highly personalized and friendly service. The entire Club Lounge staff was outstanding (especially Erin, Leslie, and Albert.....thank you!). They were there for anything we needed and surprised us with several in-room gift amenities that made our stay very special. The food and drinks were excellent. The multi-level pool is beautiful. It is big enough so you can always find a quiet spot in the sun or shade to read. True, it is slightly windier than in Lahaina/Kaanapali, but we enjoyed the cooling ocean breeze. Every morning my wife visited the spa to work out which had a lot of great amenities. A special thank you to Linda for the gift she sent to our room for my wife's birthday. Also, DT Flemming beach was awesome. We had a great time playing in the surf which was pretty big on a couple of the days. The walk down to the beach is less than 5 minutes. While we spent most of our time at the pool, everyday we would take a quick break, run down to the beach, and go for a swim. The drive to the big resort areas in Kaanapali and Lahaina is no more than 10 minutes. While fun for a few hours, these areas are extremely crowed, and we were always glad to get back to the solitude of the Ritz. Bottom line: If you are looking for a brand new room, plasma tv, pool with water slide, next door tourist shops/restaurants, and large crowds of people.......the hotels in Lahaina/Kaanapali and Wailea are probably best. If you are looking for top rate service and friendly staff, beautiful grounds, fun surf, and most of all peace and quiet......a Club Level room at the Ritz is the best spot on Maui.

Reviews.Title: “terrible”
Reviews.Author: deriko
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrible. Save your time and money, stay away from the Rtiz in Maui. My husband and I wanted to plan a romantic getaway for our anniversary..we immediately thought of the Ritz. We hadn't been to this particular Ritz, but we had stayed at others in California. We were shocked. Check-in was painfully slow, very strange considering we were the only people checking in. Then there is the room, or should I say rooms. The first room we were given was dirty, the sheets were stained. I understand the hotel is dated and needs renovation, but there is a difference between dirty and dated. We asked to change rooms. An hour later, we were in a room that smelled of urine. We again found ourselves waiting, this time for an hour and a half. The third room had terrible stains on the carpeting. We asked to cancel our reservations. Of course, this took another hour. This hotel is not a Ritz, it's not even a Ramada, it's more like a Motel. I will say this, the grounds are beautiful...Too bad the rooms and staff need to be changed. If you are planning a trip to Maui, stay at the Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative reviews!”
Reviews.Author: jwskooz
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the negative reviews, I was a little hesitant to keep my reservations at the Ritz. I have to say that I'm glad I kept my reservation for we had a wonderful time here. This was my second visit to the hotel and I can't say enough good things. When we arrived we were upgraded to a beautiful suite over looking the golf course and ocean. The room was very nice and well kept. Yes, you can tell the room needs some updating - but still exceeded our expectations. The grounds of the hotel are beautiful and the location is perfect. While we were there, we had perfect weather. Not one rain drop. The staff was excellent and had the typical Ritz five star service. I would stay at this resort again without hesitation... Especially if you want to avoid the crowds of most every other resort on Maui --- this is the place to go. Ignore the negative reviews here. It's a five star resort and has the AAA rating to prove it. I have to laugh at one reviewer comparing it to a Ramada... obviously that person has never stayed at a Ramada. It's no Ramada --- it's the RITZ!!!

Reviews.Title: “Read the reviews and was cautious, but glad I stayed at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: JLFERG
Reviews.Content: I just returned from the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua and I had a fabulous stay. My husband and I were there for a wedding of friends and we stayed on the club level. The food in the club was mediocre but the drinks were great and the concierge staff in the club is second to none. In fact all of the hotel's staff offers excellent service, which is what you expect from the Ritz. We weren't disappointed. The location is ideal, especially if you fly into the West Maui airport (just a few miles from the hotel). And each morning we saw a sea turtle, dolphins and whales off shore from the nearby lava rocks. The beach was beautiful, the sunsets and sunrises colorful, the location couldn't be better. The rooms themselves could stand some updating as the dust ruffles and wallpaper are looking old and tired, as is the carpet, which is why I am rating this hotel above average as opposed to excellent. I'd stay here again in a second though.

Reviews.Title: “Ok but not the best Ritz”
Reviews.Author: x2fr
Reviews.Content: This is an overdue review but wanted to share it anyway...stayed there for 3 nights for a wedding. Overall, it was nice but didn't feel like a Ritz. Location-wise, it's not easy to get to, about 20 minutes from Lahaina. You have to drive out of the hotel area to get anywhere. There's not much around the Ritz except the golf course, a small beach (often windy/breezy). The staff is very friendly, efficient and provided us with good service. The grounds are beautiful although felt a bit too "manicured" and you don't really feel that you're in Hawaii. Rooms are spacious, well-appointed but seems a bit dated, like an early 90's style. The bed didn't feel like what I remember Ritz beds are--comfy, plush, and very indulgent. Overall, I would recommend it ONLY IF you get a good deal (like less than $200 a night otherwise, I think you can find better places that have better location).

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: rickchurch1
Reviews.Content: My family and I visited Maui during spring break and were a bit hesitant about staying at the Ritz Carlotn. After reading the reviews, it seemed as though folks either loved the hotel or hated it. As we walked through the front doors to check in we were greeeted with flower leis and juice. After a long flight, with 2 kids, from the mainland, this was a welcome greeting. After making the hotel reservations through American Express Fine Hotels and Resorts Program, we expected to have the amenities described by AMEX. Upon check in, we were politely told we would not get the amenities as we were staying on the Club Level floor. I was obviously angry about this, the manager Mr. Philip Hoy offered to call AMEX on my behalf. Within moments of being inthe room, Mr. Hoy phoned and relayed AMEX has errored, but he would offer a suite upgrade on the tail end of our trip and an extened check-out. Mr. Hoy handled the situation with style expected from a hotel like the Ritz. When going to Hawaii, folks must expect a slower pace and not be upset when things don't come quickly. The folks working on the Club level at the Ritz were terrific. Many thanks to Kimberly, Erin, Kong and Leslie. If you can swing it, do the Club Level. With kids, the price is offset by the amount you save on things like water, soda and milk! Expect some quicrly things with the property, such as no towels on the beach after 5pm. After the long flight to Maui, all my kids wanted to do was hit the beach, but with no towels to be found, the water had to wait! The weather at Kapalua is a bit rainy, but to catch alot of sun, pack up the car and drive 5 minutes down the road towards Lahaina. Many fellow travellers have commented on the worn out look of the hotel. I have had the pleasure of staying at several Ritz Carlton properties and yes, this hotel needs a little work, but it is very nice and folks need to remember it is a golf/beach resort! Overall, we had a great visit to the Ritx Calton Kapalua, and Maui. Highly recommend to families and couples alike!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Honeymoon Ending!”
Reviews.Author: zerns
Reviews.Content: We started our honeymoon with 3 fun nights on busy Oahu and then came to Maui for our last 7 nights in Hawaii. From the minute we arrived at the Ritz Kapalua, we felt like we had finally started the romantic honeymoon we desired. Yes, we noticed that our room needed a bit of updating (carpet mainly) but we immediately loved the bathroom because having a separate shower as well as a tub/shower combo made getting ready twice as fast for us. We had breakfast every day at the Terrace and while a buffet, it's wonderfully done. We still talk about our great breakfasts there, overlooking the pool and the ocean. The only other Ritz-related restaurant at which we dined was the Banyan Tree and it was quite good, too. Despite the warm weather this time of year, it WAS very windy both near the pool and on the beach. In fact, we spent more time at Kapalua Beach just south of the hotel (where you can also get towels with your Ritz key) and there is GREAT snorkeling there, too. Save some money and drive to the Napili Plaza to rent snorkeling gear at Boss Frog (there's also a Maui Coffee Shop here - try an iced toddy with their pineapple upside-down cake). We had a difficult time deciding upon which resort to stay but after driving around the island to Wailea and Lahaina, I believe this place made the most sense for us. It's secluded but this is what we wanted. If you want shops within walking distance, you might want to look elsewhere. After booking a couples massage, the spa representative (Julie) sent champagne to our room. Nice touch. Overall, we loved it here and are planning to return on our 5-year anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Love the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: bkeller
Reviews.Content: This is our third trip to Maui and our second stay at the Ritz. We were a bit leary of staying at the Ritz after reading some of the reviews. We are very glad we ignored the reviews and came back to the Ritz. This hotel is without question the best hotel. The staff and the service can only be described as "Ritz Quality - second to none." Kapalua is more peaceful and quiet than Ka'anapali. The weather is also cooler. While it rains more in Kapalua - the rain is brief and as the locals say "no rain, no rainbow." Wailea is beautiful - but the hotels are very close to each other. A very similar situation as Ka'anapali. Ka'anapali is growing rapidly - construction is everywhere. This may be good for the economy, but we miss the quieter days of Maui. If you want a peaceful stay on Maui - stay at the Ritz. We were able to see 3 whales from our beach cabana. We can only imagine how beautiful the Ritz will be after the renovation. We will back next year - and we will never stay anywhere other than the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “More like a Ramada Carlton”
Reviews.Author: Mroth
Reviews.Content: This place has great common areas...but the room is much more like a Ramada roadside...it is a shame that Ritz lets them fly it flag....AVOID

Reviews.Title: “SUPERB! Ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen!!!”
Reviews.Author: LadyCFO
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a perfect vacation at the Ritz Carlton, Kapalua. For those of you considering the Ritz Carlton Kapalua, you're right on! The Ritz offers a beautiful, romantic environment coupled with phenomenal service that no other hotel in Maui will be able to hold a candle to. Location, location, location! First of all the Ritz is located in the heart of Kapalua, an upscale area of Maui, surrounded by lush golf courses, and multi-multi million dollar homes. The drive into the resort makes you feel like you're going to THE RITZ! Kapalua itself is like a self contained town, it offers a complimentary shuttle to any of it's fine dining restaurants, and golf courses, just moments away from the Ritz itself. For the nights when you want to venture out into the more populated areas of Maui, the historic and popular town of Lahaina (known for it's nightlife) is only 10 minutes away, unlike Wailea, where its off on it's own, far away from any real nightlife. For my trip, I booked a club level room, which was the icing on the cake. The club level offers a private lounge, private concierges, and 5 complimentary food presentations daily, ranging from breakfast to dessert. The food is marvelous, presented so beautifully as you would expect from a Ritz. There is not another hotel in Maui that offers this same level of service. Between 6:30 and 10:30 they offered coffee, fresh fruit, bagels, toast, lox, pastries, juice, cereal, and bacon! Between 12:00 and 3:30 they offered gourmet sandwiches, pasta salads, green salads, beautiful desserts, and crudite. In the late afternoon they offered a variety of fruit drinks and teas and of course the famous Ritz Carlton cookies. Early evening they offered crab claws, oysters, variety of baked brie, cheese, crackers and so much more. Late night they offered cordials and sweets. The menu changed daily, but was always refreshing and high quality. If there was ever anything I wanted and didn't see they made sure to bring especially for me. Throughout the day they also serve whatever drink you wish, from coffee to tea, to bloody marys. The staff would even send you on your way with a plastic cup filled with your favorite cocktail. The club lounge even has a computer with internet access for your convenience. The club lounge staff is INCREDIBLE. The Ritz Carlton's motto is "Ladies and gentlemen serving ladies and gentlemen" and during my visit it was just that! I must commend Leslie, Kim, Kimberly, Kong, and Albert for their excellence. They always remembered my name, remembered what type of drink I liked, and were so genuine. They mean it when they would say "it is my pleasure!" Any night I wanted to venture out for dinner, they offered their recommendations on restaurants, and even made the reservations, arranged the transportation, and always checked in the next day to make sure I was satisfied. Any activities I was interested in, they offered phamplets, and their recommendations and once again, arranged it all! WONDERFUL! The club level is worth every penny - the exclusivity of it made the whole trip! The resort itself is also top notch. The gym is perfect and up to date. The spa is tranquill. The common areas are very authentic, and rich. The grounds are kept very well! The pool and jaccuzzi were beautiful, never crowded or uncomfortable. I don't care what others might have said about the wind, but it is welcomed! It is so hot and humid in Hawaii, but in Kapalua there is a very nice wind that makes the hot and humid weather tolerable and pleasant. I don't think I could enjoy myself poolside very long if it weren't for the wind. I know a lot of people on Trip Advisor bash the Ritz because of the wind, but it never impeded my enjoyment! The restaurants are fabulous as well. You must try the Banyan Tree restaurant located in the Ritz. it is the best restaurants on the island! It has goregous views of the sunset and ocean, and the food is marvelous. Jojo the head chef even came to my table and introduced himself. Ranga Pi, the live entertainment are so good I even purchased one of their CDs before I left! As you have read, I enjoyed every moment of my trip to the Ritz Carlton. It offered everything I was looking for: tranquility, great food, lush accomodations, excellent service, and beautiful weather! I have very high standards, and would recommend this resort to my best friends, and associates. If the Ritz is this great now, I can't wait to go back after it's renovation! Happy travels everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely disappointed”
Reviews.Author: lovemypup
Reviews.Content: I will begin by saying that I changed my travel plans to leave two days ahead of time to avoid a storm where I live. I was, however, thrilled at having an extra couple of days to stay on Maui since I have been wanting to stay at the Ritz here for a number of years but never had the extra time to do so. That said, I am certain that people will disagree with my review of this hotel, and I have been trying to decide whether or not to write it. However, this site is designed for people who have all kinds of experiences, and perhaps at least one future reader will be able to avoid my experience here. I will start with the positives: (1) Beautiful setting--Kapalua is quite beautiful and removed from the "hustle-bustle" that is becoming Maui. But, if you do stay here, it is not a very convenient home base for any of the island's many activities. (2) Free self-parking--definitely good to avoid the $18 valet fee by parking it yourself. I never had a problem finding a relatively close spot. (3) Polite service, but I would not characterize it as warm or friendly; they are doing their job, but not with much caring or enthusiasm (4) Comfortable furniture in room and on lanai; very nice bathrooms with prerequisite separate toilet room, shower stall, and tub; GREAT bath amenities Okay, now the negatives (please stop reading here if you are squeamish): -On my third morning I decided to wake up at 3 am and head up to Haleakala for the sunrise; I didn't have to check out until 4 pm to move down to my hotel in Wailea (The Four Seasons, which I reviewed separately under their name), and when I returned to the hotel (around 11am), I went to lay down for a nap. There was a feather from the featherbed sticking me, so I pulled back the sheet to take the feather out. What I found was a dirty, stained (with yellow stains) mattress cover with hair (not mine) on it. It was absolutely disgusting. I cannot imagine a housekeeper seeing that and still making up a bed over it. The sheets are not that thick, and I was nauseated looking at what I had been sleeping on for two nights. I called down to get a manager to come to the room to look at it. Both the housekeeping manager (Robert) and the front desk manager on duty (Richard) both came to my room. After showing them the mattress pad, I told them I was amazed to find such a dirty and stained pad at a hotel like the Ritz. I told them I could not understand how a housekeeper could make up a bed like that. To their complete credit, they agreed with me, and offered me a credit for one night's stay. They also offered to get me another room to take a nap in (which I declined), and then offered to remake my current room, which I also declined. They then very kindly escorted me and my luggage down to the checkout area, and waited with my things while I checked out and got my car. I have to say, they handled the problem beautifully, but I still cannot get over the fact that it happened to begin with. This was not a little piece of hair in the corner of a bathroom. It was a dirty and obviously stained mattress pad that they saw every time they made up the bed. Yuck. -Other negatives: -There were a couple of billing problems (which they promptly corrected when I pointed them out)--I was charged twice for the same day of internet service--which is NOT included in the "resort fee," and I was not credited with my meal credit under my travel package -Pool area is pretty loud, and the sound travels since the hotel buildings surround it on three sides -Restaurants: The Terrace Restaurant and Beach House are a little disappointing, and the Banyan Tree restaurant is inexplicably closed on Sundays (and Mondays--which is more understandable) So, under what circumstances would I recommend this hotel? Honestly, it is in a beautiful setting, but I cannot fathom the level of ineptitude (or just plain uncaring) that it takes to make up a dirty bed. So, if you are prepared to check your mattress pad when you check in, you will likely have a 100% percent better experience than I did. For me, however, that image will certainly stay with me for a long time, and I cannot see myself ever returning.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: PATravelingToo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz the first week of February for a week. We had a GREAT time! It was just the 2 of us, as we left our 10 month old daughter back home with my parents. We were definitely looking forward to a vacation as just the 2 of us-to relax, get some sun and enjoy Maui. This was our third visit to Maui-previously we had stayed at the Hyatt and Westin in Ka'anappli-but have always found it to be too noisy and 'busier' then Kapalua. We arrived at the Ritz ahead of schedule-checked in with no problem-cold juice and a lei greeting. We were shown to our room right away-garden view-very nice view though. The rooms are good-decent size, but I agree with others that the room decor is lacking-and not as 'plush' as one might expect. Okay-the king size bed was soooo comfortable-loved it! The hotel was very nice-the staff was excellent-always asking if there was something they could do for us etc...We used the concierge on several occassions: to book a few tee times at the Plantation course, dinner reservations and scuba reservations. They were quick, efficient and helpful. Parking was easy-unlike our stay at the Westin last time (2 years ago)-there was plenty of parking (at the Westin-there were several nights when there was NO parking available). The beach is a quick walk down a hill-very very easy. There are golf carts, but we preferred to walk. The Beach House should stay open longer-but we often got dressed for dinner and took a drink down to the beach and no one said anything to us. Maid service was twice daily-always timely. We had a great time at the Ritz-I do think this is less 'plush' then the other Ritz's we have stayed in-but we had a FANTASTIC vacation and would recommend the Ritz to anyone looking to enjoy Maui at a great property with a reasonable price and a bit removed from all the hustle and bustle.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away”
Reviews.Author: ALKDVS
Reviews.Content: What a disappointment! This property is, sadly, is an indication of what is happening to the Ritz Carlton brand. It is best avoided. The hotel will be closing in a few months, for a total refurbishment, and it is not coming a moment too soon. The rooms are tired, but more than that, the staff is checked out. They are nice, to be sure, but they don't get service, not even a little. We ended up having to change rooms (because of the smell that other guests have written about) in the lower floor rooms. We were also charged this $18 daily fee, which other guests have also written about, and told we could get free coffee. Of course, they don't tell you that it disappears at 8 am, when most people are coming down. But that's OK, because it was lousy! The pool and beach service was atrocious, in that no one cleaned up towels after people had left, and the staff were more interested in talking among themselves, then in serving the guests some mediocre and overpriced food. I have stayed at the Four Seasons and Hotel Hana-Maui on this island, and both of them beat this place easily. Management was something more than indifferent but only barely. If you want a luxury experience on Maui, don't stay here--there are better places that get both service and luxury, and with better amenities as well. I have not felt so aggrieved in a long time. But there was one saving feature: the Banyan Tree restaurant, which was overpriced, but which served great food with wonderful service.
