The other restaurant is best avoided, along with any recommendations that the concierge might provide. You'll do better with a good guide book.

Reviews.Title: “Tired and not up to snuff”
Reviews.Author: sfimporter
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay at a Ritz - pass on this one. This was my third trip to Maui - and my ninth trip to the Hawaiian Islands overall. By far, this was the most disappointing resort I've stayed in. Everything about this resort screams - we're not doing well, and we know it. I hear they are about to undergo extensive renovations - and they need it. It makes me wonder if the "good" staff have moved on to greener pastures as the renovation period approaches. The resort feels as if the wind has been knocked out of it. The architecture of the place is so uninspired. There's really only one viewing area of the ocean and the horizon - the lobby bar. And once you sit at a table, the terrace bannister obstructs most of the view. The "Beach House" area is somewhat of a joke. Since the hotel had to work around the ancient burial ground that was on the property (and boy do they downplay the fact that there are hundreds of bodies there) - it's quite a hike to the beach. This would be the place you'd think you'd like to stay to see the sunset - perhaps while sipping a Mai Tai. Unfortunately they shut the Beach House area down at 5p.m. And even if you wanted to walk back to the lobby bar and bring a Mai Tai back down with you - the sunset isn't spectacular as the sun just dips behind the hills - nothing as dramatic as the sun setting into the ocean which you can see from many other resort areas on the island. And don't forget the WIND. It seems as if they couldn't have chosen a worse place to build a resort. There are wind barriers everywhere. Add to that the mundane service and the little touches like pathway lighting being burnt out and it all adds up to a disappointing choice. This is literally the least Hawaiian hotel I've experienced on the islands. Take away the tropical print fabrics in the rooms and you could really be anywhere. And that's not what I want from a Hawaiian vacation. I am so thankful that we changed our seven day reservation to just two nights in order to take the drive to Hana and stay there for a few nights before finishing up at the Hyatt Ka'anapali. I hope this review helps others. My advice is to pass on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK overall”
Reviews.Author: momfromcalgary
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Ritz-Carlton in Maui from Jan 27-Feb 5. My husbands conference was held at the hotel and we always enjoy staying at higher end hotels for a "conference rate". We booked a suite with an ocean view. I must say our suite was huge and fantastic. The view of the ocean was spectacular and the bathroom off the bedroom (there was another room separated by double french doors) was huge-way bigger than mine at home!!! Our kids (3 yrs and 6 yrs) slept in the other room. I know that this property will be closing in July for 6 months to renovate-it really needs updating. The 3 pool are small -they could use a water slide. The ground are huge but it seemed they didn't have the staff to keep them up to the Ritz standard. The staff was friendly and helpful One thing-if you don't like wind and enjoy the beach, the location of this property is not for you... The beach is a fairly short walk down a hill (water was rough). The location (north Maui) gets more rain and wind. The best place for weather is South Maui-Wailea and Kihei...

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz Carlton Maui”
Reviews.Author: aristophanesny
Reviews.Content: Amazing property located in a great area of Maui. Just for background, we are a young family, with two children ages 6 & 5. We do not have "throw-away" money but we do like to vacation well. We have stayed at numerous RC's, 4S's, etc worldwide. After reading some of the negative reviews on this site and then staying on the property, you will wonder to yourself, "did these people stay at the same resort?". Granted, the resort is due for a renovation (newer furniture, tv's, etc...), which is coming in July. The hotel will reopen for Christmas. That said, it was not "falling apart" or "aged and ratty" as a few reviews claim. In fact, it was very clean with twice daily maid service. Although I promised myself I would not go to Hawaii to stare at the corners of my room and public areas to see if the carpets were frayed, or search for coffee stains, I did anyway, and after 9 days at the hotel, I did not find any stains, but did notice in the corner of my room that a small section of the carpet was starting to look a bit worn. I can't believe I even took the time to write that. Seriously, the place is not falling apart, in fact it is very nice. The renovation will only enhance the quality of the rooms. Here are some thoughts by section: 1. The beach. DT Fleming beach was voted the "Best beach in America of 2006" by some guy named Dr. Beach. I do not know who Dr. Beach is, but I will say, the beach was beautiful. Big, fun waves were excellent for body surfing/boogy boarding. The sights and sounds of waves crashing, along with the views and the sandy beach were amazing. I would not take my daughters in the water on some days because the waves were pretty big. Kapuala Bay (right next door) is better for young kids and snorkeling. Some reviews claim the hotel is far from the beach and say negative things about the beach. Again, here is where I pause and say "where were you staying ? The hotel rests on top of the hill overlooking the ocean, which creates stunning views and is a very short walk to the beach. If you had too many "lava flows" the night before, they have a golf cart/shuttle that will take you to the sand from the pool area. As an added bonus, on the first morning of our visit, we all woke up ridiculously early (East coasters) so we decided to take a walk to the beach. On the way down, we happened to see whales breaching in the ocean. Amazing. 2. Pool. Very nice, big with multiple levels, beatiful views. Pool service was good. The renovation will include an area designated as a "kids pool". Good idea. Although we never had any issues, I always looked for a spot away from sunbathers or people relaxing in the pool. Because the pool was big enough, I never had a problem finding an area to play with my kids. Tip: Unless the hotel is crowded, don't bother with the cabanas. 3. Grounds/Location/Weather. I thought the location was the best in Maui. A big resort with tremendous views and beatiful landscaping. Other activities were mini golf, bocce, shuffleboard and great tennis club. The gym was roomy (for a resort) with plenty of machines. Spa was very nice. Resorts in kaanopoli, Wailea and other areas are either "cookie cutter" or right on top of each other. Kapalua, to me is one of the nicest areas on Maui. Maui, like much of Hawaii, is a bit over-crowded and over-developed. It was nice to be in more quiet, remote area of the island. Kapalua also has some of the islands best golf (PGA Mercedes Benz championship is played in Kapalua every January). No crowded boardwalk. Don't get me wrong, it was very nice to visit kaanopoli, we were just glad to return to Kapalua. We also really enjoyed Lahaina. Definitely rent a car and explore the island (we did on an overcast day), especially north of the hotel. Lahaina was about 20 minutes away due to traffic and lights. As for the weather, we were there for 9 days. One day was not good (light rain/overcast). Another 2 days were a bit windier, but still able to swim/sit outside. Other days were postcard perfect. 4. The room. We stayed on the club level, room 2829. As mentioned above, the room was fine and maid service was excellent. It was large enough for two double beds and a roll-away. The four of us stayed in the room and were fine. Bathroom was big. The patio was big and we were lucky enough to have a magnificent view of the ocean and pool grounds. Note: Stay on the club level. It is worth it. Leslie, Kimberly and the other concierges in the club were awesome. Food was great and the staff were very helpfull in making arrangements. We ate at the club for breakfast and lunch. Usually stopped in at night for a drink/app before going out to dinner or after dinner for drink/dessert. During the day, it was a nice place to go for a drink or light snack. My girls loved the cookie jar. We ate off property for dinner otherwise, excpet for one night we went to the Banyan Tree for our 10 year anniversary dinner. Robert, our waiter was great and the food was very good. 5. Service. As mentioned above, the club level service was outstanding as was our waiter at the Banyan Tree. Check-in and check-out were fine. Lei greeting and tropical juice at check-in. If you havn't figured it out yet, we really enjoyed our stay and can not wait to return to the Ritz Carlton. We really had a great experience and I am truly baffled by some of the negative reviews on this site.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RMC2007
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the Ritz while in Maui last week. I have to say that we had an excellent experience overall. The room was nice & big...a little out dated, but very clean! They are renovating starting in July- so that will take care of the out dated decor. The bathroom was really pretty...all marble with 2 Ritz bathrobes for us to wear. The bed was so comfortable, which is something we find important. Everyone that works there are super friendly; they go above & beyond in customer service. The restaurants in the hotel are expensive, but it is the Ritz, right? People should expect that. Besides, there are restaurants in the area. We recommend this hotel for the following reasons: great service, beautiful grounds/pool area, comfortable beds/large rooms, ocean view & great beach! The Ritz ia already an unbelievable place to stay, so I can only imagine how awesome it will be once the renovations are complete. Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Stay Somewhere Else.....”
Reviews.Author: CACaliforniaGirl
Reviews.Content: I am here in my room at the Ritz Carlton as I write this review. Unfortunately, I ignored warnings and kept my reservation. My list of disappointments is way to large for a hotel that should be so much more. First of all, there is not any "in-room" coffee. So, we had to go to the Lobby area to get a cup of their "Complimentary Coffee" that is part of the 18.00 per day service charge. Needless to say, walking into the lobby at 6am for coffee is not joyful. All the guests were scrambling over a coffee set up. The hotel is run down as they are closing in July for a complete renovation. So, expect everything including the Pool Lounges to be aged and "ratty." We have about 40 large spider webs in the trees in front of our balcony with large spiders in them, which is a little creepy and distracting. The views are terrible, we have a peek a boo ocean view. No sounds of crashing waves or sunsets or any of the wonderful things that make Hawaii so special. The Service Staff have not been properly trained in the true meaning of "service and hospitality". They are proficient but don't expect any special treatment. They have a pool with 3 levels, one of the levels should be for Adults only, but instead their is alot of children. Which is fine, except if I was "honeymooning", I would hope for a different atmosphere. I would suggest for the RC Managment Team to visit a Four Seasons in a crash course on Service, Style and Operations. One visit to a Four Seasons will make anyone realize how disappointing this hotel is.....I hope in December when they re-open that everything is turned around. But given the off water, way north location I still would not suggest it to anyone unless they bring "very special service" into the equation. They should be bringing complimentary otter pops by the pool, evian spritz's, cucumbers, fresh fruit and service levels to that level with a name like Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “First time at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BFulkerson
Reviews.Content: We stayed from 1/17/07 to 1/23/07 room 1405. The resort grounds are top notch. The grounds are the best in Maui. The rooms however were not maintained very well. Our carpets were dingy, decor was dated and staff forgot to leave items such as soap. I have read other reviews that stated the food was great. We ate at the Terrace restaurant each morning and I will say that the middle of the road. The buffet was the same every day. The only thing that changed was the type of pancakes (banana, nut, plain) and the type of sausage. The staff was nice but not overly welcoming. If we went back to Maui I would not stay here again until the reno's are complete (supposed to start soon). Oh, this resort is NOT baby friendly. They offer a great pool but suited for adults. Absolutely no pool for babies. If you have kids under 6 stay somewhere in Kaanapali, Hyatt or Marriott. We ended up crashing their pools so our 2 year old could go swimming.

Reviews.Title: “Prefer the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: SAS-7
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz from December 25th to the 31st. We booked a garden view room and the room was fine. There was no musty smell that others have complained of on this site. Yes, the rooms are outdated and they are in need of remodeling. The bathrooms were fine too, but if you stay on the ground floor, they keep the sink drains closed for a reason, so just remember to close them again. They have small refrigerators in-room, but no mini bar. The in -room safe is keyed, so you have to take the key with you everywhere which is inconvenient. The pool area is really large which is nice, but the service at the pool was bad. Not nearly enough servers and you do have to wait a long time for drinks. Also, it can be hard to get someone to help you find a place to sit and the pool area does get really crowded. On one occassion, someone went to get us towels and set up our chairs and just never came back. The Terrace Restaurant was overpriced and not worth it. If you want a good and inexpensive breakfast, just walk over to the Honolua General Store and get breakfast there. They had eggs, waffles, pancakes, etc. This seemed to be where the locals in the area had breakfast and you can sit on the deck and eat there for $5 per person. Also, you can order sandwiches to go for a picnic lunch at Haleakala or in Hana. The Banyan Tree was excellent and the service there is what you would expect from the Ritz. We had drinks in the lobby bar one night and the service was horrible. They were completely understaffed and the atmosphere was lacking also. The salon area is really small, but Sarah did my pedicare and was really nice and very friendly and did a great job too. The concierge desk was helpful with activities and booking dinner, but they do not seem to have the discretion of employees at other high level hotels. We ran each morning and the hills in area are challenging. There are a ton of trucks rumbling through there though, so be on the lookout. Other than running, we never heard any construction noise though. Overall, the level of service was disappointing and just not what you would expect from the Ritz. We stayed at the Four Seaons on our last visit to Maui and you just cannot beat their service. However, this is probably the second best place to stay in Maui as the location makes up for it. It is 10 minutes from Kaanapali and 15-20 from Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Secluded-Except for the Massive Construction”
Reviews.Author: webkat
Reviews.Content: Really not up to Ritz standards, except for the price. Overall there is a lackadaisacal attiitude amongst the staff. The hotel cat, named Carly, seems to be more motivated than any of the front office staff. Property is extremely expensive, which was completely expected, but the service and amenities really don't justify the price. One could literally die of thirst waiting for the pool staff to acknowledge your existence, much less bring you a ten dollar plastic cup of Stella. For the environmentally minded, there is no indication that the Ritz Kapalua has heard of recycling, much less global warming. The food is top notch, albeit expensive, but in the Ritz's defense, most food in Kaanapali is expensive and far from top notch. It doesn't say much for the signature restaurant(The Banyan Tree, extremely over rated by Frommers) that the room service menu outperforms consistently both in quality, variety and timeliness. We booked a suite for Xmas 2006, departing 30 December. The Suite is nicely spacious, two bathrooms, a nice afternoon sun exposure on one of the golf fairways with a peekaboo ocean view. Beyond the fairway is a road that serves as the main construction highway for the timeshare development going on. The rumble of semitrucks is deafening and for those who like to jog along the road, this is completely unsafe. At Christmas the hotel is booked beyond capacity and the fighting for lounge chairs around the pool is fierce. Considering the amount of children under the age of 6 using the pool, I seriously would not recommend actually going into the pool. the bathroom closest to the pool should not be patronized without shower sandals and disinfectant. The gym is better than most hotels, but most cruise ships have three times the equipment. The stair access from our floor to the pool deck has clearly been used as a public urinal, as well as the odd room service delivery. As far as luxury hotels in the islands, the Mandarin Oriental Kahala on Oahu is hands down a better expenditure. This property is not anywhere near Ritz standards.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton in Maui, Great Service, Great Pool, Great Golf Course”
Reviews.Author: worldlytraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed 4 nights at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua from Dec 11-15th. We had a room overlooking the Ocean, and we found our stay to be a good one since it was right before the Xmas (busy Season). We were greeted with a Lei, and Juice when we arrived, escorted to our rooms, and service all around from Concierge, to bell service, to housekeeping was excellent. We had an Oceanfront room, with a nice balcony where we can eat breakfast, or just have a drink. The negative was that we had to walk a long way to a separate elevator to our room, but we were fine with it. Also, this Ritz is a little dated, and is going to go through a 100 million dollar renovation in July 2007. The pool is amazing, and the Banyan Tree restaurant was the one I advise on property. We Went to Vino's(italian), and Sansei(sushi) but we did not find them as good as the Banyan tree...Sansei was overrated, and you can find better sushi. Vino's had good appetizers, and wine list, but main dishes were average. Service wise and Food wise Banyan Tree was the best, and Vino's, and Sansei were lacking. We had no issues getting dinner reservations, but I advise if you go during busy season to book weeks ahead of time. Overall the Ritz was a great location, good service, but a little dated...I'm sure the renovations will make the place amazing...For the rest of Maui we loved Mama's Fish house for Lunch(skip dinner) make reservations for lunch, and watch the ocean, wind surfers, and that was the best place we had a meal...Lunch was around $200-250 but worth it... Other tidbits from our stay is to do the Circle Island Helicopter Tour which show you the whole Island about $600 for 2 people for about 65 minutes and you get to see the whole Island. Pacific Whale Watching Tour from DEC-April was awesome. 2 hrs on the boat looking for Humpback Whales, also good way to see the a Part of the Island. We say 3-4 Whales, and it's about 30 bucks per person. For Golfers play at the Plantation Course(where the Mecedes Championship is played) and have Lunch there, it's not pricey, and they have a good menu. You also get a good view of Kapalua Bay from this location. I'll definitely be back at the Ritz after they finish the renovations...

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples!!!”
Reviews.Author: AdamPaz
Reviews.Content: Top notch service, but not the best choice for small children. The hotel's staff is extremely attentive, and the facilities are beautiful. Visiting with two small children, when the weather was iffy (3 of 6 days) there wasn't much to do except travel to other parts of the island. There are two beaches, the better of the two (in the winter) being the protected Kapalua Bay, which you take a shuttle to get to. In the summer, the waves are much smaller, so you can use the beach right off the hotel, which is closer, and you can easily walk to. The food is terrific, although not inexpensive. Other reviews complain about the furniture and maintenance, but I have no idea what they were talking about. The facilities were fine, and well maintained. The lobby is spectacular, and a wonderful place to have a drink or read a book. If I returned, it would be in the summer, not the winter, and without my kids.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Location”
Reviews.Author: RoColorado
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton was isolated from the rows of hotels on the other parts of the island, so it was quiet and restful. The beach was quite a walk down the hill and the surf was rough here. I have heard that was typical, so we watched the surfers and did not swim at Kapalua. We used the beach when we moved to a hotel at Wailea. The rooms were spacious and comfortable. The health club which was located in the spa area was very well equipped with Cybex equipment, and elliptical machines, etc. There was no excuse not to keep a workout routine. The spa services were costly. The pool was very nice, surrounded by tropical landscaping. We were happy to have a car, as we thought the food was overated and there were fine restaurants 5-15 minutes away by car. The concierge services were very good, as they helped my husband book scuba trips before our arrival during a very busy week. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to take advantage of pampering and relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience overall (11-28 through 12-12).”
Reviews.Author: A02
Reviews.Content: First off, I completely agree with the reviewer a couple posts below - this is definitely more of a 4-star experience, but a very solid 4 at that. We stayed at the Ritz over a period of about 2 weeks. We had our wedding at the Sacred Hearts Mission (next to the Honalua General Store), our reception in the Anuenue Room, and stayed there afterwards as our base for our Honeymoon. Our Deluxe Ocean View room (4th floor) was in great shape. The bathrooms were in good order, clean, and very large (separate shower stall and shower/tub). The TV was hilariously old, but worked fine. It's one of those things where you expect something nicer... but the reality is that for as much as we actually watched the TV while there... it simply didn't matter. We appreciated the decent-sized mini fridge that was empty for us to keep drinks and such that we bought at the General Store. It easily fit a six-pack of beer, 6 bottles of water, some food, and a decent sized Gatorade. There was only one small bleach stain on the carpet, but wasn't noticed until a few days in. I did get a complimentary room the day of the wedding to get ready in on the 1st floor (facing out) and I will say there was a noticeable difference in room quality â€“ even the hallways were darker and less inviting. Contrary to earlier reviews, we were given 2 bottles of water at least twice a day - sometimes three. The staff cleaned our rooms a minimum of twice a day and were extremely friendly. We had robes in our room as well. Towels were replenished/replaced fully every time they were in the room. Overall, I was VERY happy with the condition of the grounds and the hotel itself. The Christmas/Holiday decorations were stunning to say the least. The concierges were great every time we asked a question or made a reservation. The lobby greeter always said hello to me each morning. The lobby bar attendant was prompt the one time I sat there looking for a drink - and very friendly. The pool staff was excellent both days we sat out there - coming around every 30 minutes asking if there was anything we needed. They also came around with fresh pineapple every couple hours. The pool bartenders we encountered on both days were very talkative and happy. They were more than happy to order a sandwich only available at the beach grill and send it up. The beach grill was relaxed and offered decent service. In fact, there was only one bad employee we encountered the entire trip. My wife loved Joy - who ran the bracelet and lei making classes... she was genuinely happy to be there and you could tell. We saw no trash in hallways more than an hour or so. The putting course is fun for what it's worth (surface is more like fairway than green) and the bocce lawn was maintained well enough. The walk from the grounds to the beach is a 5-10 minute walk at most, but is all up - or all down. They had a convenient shuttle cart taking people up and down that we saw others taking. The beach was nice. By far, it was the best boogey-boarding beach we encountered on the trip. For pure sun worship - nothing is better than we saw at Big Beach - south of Wailea. The spa was very nice (as well as the gym). I had a sports massage and a signature facial and was very happy with both - especially the facial. The only Ritz establishments we dined at were the Pineapple Grill and Vino - and we were happy with the experiences. Vino is definitely more casual (atmosphere, not the food) than you would expect - which was honestly nice. Sansei was decent, but mobbed every night. Sushi there was only above average to me (except the Onaga... wow!). Please be sure to eat at David Paul's in Lahaina. The Honalua General Store is fantastic for a simple breakfast. For couples interested in honeymooning or having a wedding here - we had nothing but a MAGNIFICENT experience. Maria, our coordinator was superb with everything and made us feel as though our small wedding of a dozen people was as important as a 300 person wedding. The food at the reception was hands-down the best food anyone has had at a wedding. The entire staff that helped or was involved was wonderful. I know it's been said a bazillion times, but it's worth mentioning again. The Ritz is really out of the way from most things you will want to do while in Maui (if you're into doing the touristy things). It's windier and will drizzle more often there, so keep that in mind. You WILL be driving a lot to get places. The advantage though is that it is remote, and very quiet. There were only 2 days where the weather was noticeably bad during our stay. I've also experienced places MUCH nicer than the Ritz, but that's not what we were looking for either. I pretty much think your experience will boil down to this: If you are going to stay on the property for most of everything and expect to be pampered non-stop - you WILL be disappointed. If you want a warmer beach with calmer waters and a much warmer (temperature) experience â€“ Wailea might be a better choice. If you're looking for a top-flight experience overall with relaxation in mind and a great, unpretentious staff - the Ritz is for you. We were very happy with the experience and would go back again. As a last note: We also heard that the Ritz will most likely be shutting down for 4-5 months this summer/fall and opening again for November/December to undergo a massive renovation (something like 80 million dollars).

Reviews.Title: “NOT a 5 star hotel...a well executed 4”
Reviews.Author: woods1966
Reviews.Content: The fact of the matter is, this is NOT a 5 star property. Anyone rating it as such, hasn't stayed at 5 star properties. Regardless of its current condition and execution, by design of the resort and level of service, the Ritz is a 4 star establishment. The physical property, furnishing, service, accomodations, etc. are all very good in design and intent, but not best in class. That's not a criticism of the hotel, it's simply a fair assessment of the property based on years of travel for both business and pleasure at US and international 4 and 5 star hotels. So, with a level set that this is a 4 star establishment, here's my review: Rooms: Good size and lanais are well done. Furnishings and carpet are very dated and in poor repair. Furniture was damaged with hinges and handles missing or broken, lamp shade liners in many areas torn, carpet feeling it's age. Room features, were, frankly, lacking and surprisingly poor. No in room entertainment except very old tube televisions...no stereo, dvd, etc. No in room self coffee service. No in room honor bar. Very small and marginally useful in room refrigerator. Bathrooms were spacious and well designed...but clearly designed a decade ago. Functionally, fine. Bed, adequate, other furnture, also showing it's age. Lanai furntire, stricly low rent. Hotel Facilities: Pool...in good shape and well staffed. Clean. On site restaraunts...Banyon tree is superb. Bar in the hotel is laughable...airport bars have more ambiance. Beach, very nice and with good food and drink service at the waterfront. It is a 200 yard walk...if you can't walk that far without complaining, you've got issues. Beach is fine for lite swimming and body surfing, the left edge (as facing the ocean) is more shallow for an easier time. Workout facility, etc...all adequate. Services: Pool...good. Plenty of staff and good, courteous service. Housekeeping...no complaints. Food service, quite good to excellent. Banyan Tree is a real find...superb. Staff is generally courteous and very helpful. Our best scuba was an unsolicited recommendation from a young man at the pool who was checking out towels. Management: This is where the resort needs some work. On nearly every walk through the hallways going point to point, there were the occasional empty bottles, cups, brochres, whatever. That is NOT an acceptable level of property management at true 5 star resorts. Upon checking, 1 person in our 4 person party was greeted and presented with a lei...again, a fundamentally basic property management/guest services issue that should NOT get screwed up. Conceierge...courteous but on two occassions provided downright incorrect information regarding local beaches...that's, again, a staff management/quality control issue. Overall, the experience was 90% positive, WITH the proviso that your expectations are for a 4 star hotel. If you're expecting a 5 star property, your expectations will NOT be met. We would return with the expectation of paying a 4 star rate for the stay until substantial updates are made to the property, largely in the area of accomodations (furnishing, in room extras, etc)...the staff is doing a good job, but management needs to focus on the details. In terms of location, the Ritz is removed from other parts of maui, which is good for getting away from 'it all'...but does make driving to dinner off resort quite an experience.

Reviews.Title: “Our first and probably last stay - Take the kids to the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: partyofour
Reviews.Content: We are a family of four, 2 adults 30's-40's and 2 children, 3 1/2 and 5 years old. We booked our trip to the Ritz Carlton Kapalua to celebrate our 6th anniversary. We used Marriott Points for our stay which covered our room and tax but not the daily resort fee of $18 or the $15 a night valet parking. This was our second trip to Maui, we stayed in Wailea at the Four Seasons last summer. We did a lot of comparing between the Ritz and Four Seasons during our stay. The Four Seasons always came out on top. The Ritz was only at 39% occupancy while we were there from Nov. 28th to Dec. 3rd. We had almost constant rain from the evening of the 29th until we left on the 3rd - sometimes light sometimes torrential downpour! We got rained on at the pool, rained on at the beach, rained on during the Christmas Tree lighting, etc. We had to leave the resort every day and travel toward Wailea or Makena (loved Big Beach - gorgeous!)just to get some sun. If you're coming to stay here definetly rent a car, we almost didn't and boy would we have regretted that decision! I'll address the main complaints that I read so often here on Trip Advisor. The musty smell - we could definetly smell it when we got off of the elevator on the 5th floor a couple of times, no problem in the room or anywhere else for that matter. Did the smell ruin our vacation - no! Rooms needing renovation - Our room looked great to me. It was in no way dingy or dirty or falling apart. The bed was very comfortable and the furniture was in good shape. The bathroom was marble with a seperate tub and shower and double sink vanity. The room was extremely clean and kept that way throughout our stay. Yes the TV is old, couldn't even hook up the kids portable DVD player to it. With all of the rain we did watch TV more than we though we would! There were also 2 refrigerators in the room and not much closet or drawer space for a family of 4. I did peak in at a few rooms that housekeeping was cleaning and noticed some rooms with ugly peach carpet that did need to be replaced. It does appear that some rooms have been slightly updated and some have not. We saw different carpets, drapery and bedding in other rooms down our hall, none of which was very appealing - we lucked out! For those of you who are waiting for the renovations they are coming soon. We were told by several employees that an $80 million dollar renovation will begin in late July, with the entire resort being shut down from July - December. This is just word of mouth from the staff not the GM so who knows what the actual plans are. The long walk to the beach - It's a paved path that gradually winds down a hill to the beach, it's not a steep incline. It took a few minutes at the most to get to the beach. It is not a walk that will wear you out. There are golf carts to take you down to the beach and back up if you prefer not to walk., you won't need them. The beach is clean, and beautiful. Lounge chairs are set up above the beach, not in the sand itself. The Beach House Grill restaurant also sits just above the beach for food and drinks. Because of the weather we only got one good day on the beach in front of the resort and it was not crowded at all. Waves were small but signs were up stating that the shore break was dangerous. My kids had a great time playing in the water. Lack of service at the pools - We never had a problem with service when we were at the pool. There were several servers that made rounds frequently to take orders for food and drinks. We had some great grilled fish sandwiches and pineapple-strawberry smoothies at the pool. Expect to pay $18+ for sandwiches and burgers, $8.50 for non alcoholic drinks, and $12+ for alcohol. Kids meals were $8+, typical resort prices, but everything we had was very good. There were always plenty of towles and someone to set up cabanas and chairs if you needed them. We had reserved a cabana for our entire stay but again because of the weather only ended up using it for one day. The cost for a cabana is $75 for a large white cabana that seats 4 people. You also get a cooler full of sodas and water and a pinapple plate. You have to let one of the pool guys know that you will be returning to the cabana if you plan to leave for any amount of time otherwise they'll clean it up and give it to someone else. I found that kind of annoying - when you're paying to reserve the cabana it should be yours for the day. Unless the resort is extremely crowded or you have a need for constant shade (there are no umbrellas around the pool) you can definetly skip the cabana. Too many kids at the resort - Not while we were there. There were only about 15, I think we met them all at one point or another. When we went to the pool we tried to go where the other children were so the adults around the other pools could really relax. Again, the hotel was only at 39% occupancy so i'm sure there are more kids at other times. I have kids and I will be the first one to tell you that this resort is no place for children. When the weather is bad there is absolutely nothing for the kids, or anyone else for that matter, to do on site. The information book in the room states that there are movies and activities planned for rainy days- we called to inquire as to what was available and were told that they had nothing scheduled! Great! It wasn't like this was some light rain, nor was it the first day of rain. There is actually a swingset just in front of the resort pools, but it too was usless in the rain. We walked down to check out the kids club which was held in one of the basic hotel rooms - it was tiny - we walked in and walked right back out. The cost for kids club is $70 per child, children must be 5 years old or you have to accompany them. You also must make a reservation 24 hrs in advance. Food at the resort - Yes it is expensive with a capital E. Because of the time change my kids were up at 4:30am each morning ready for breakfast which meant room service. The room service menu is extremely limited, and they only offer lunch and dinner selections for kids, there is no childrens breakfast menu. Pancakes and sausage with hot chocolate and orange juice - $23, pancakes a la carte - $20, waffles with whipped cream and strawberries - $21, croissants $10, side of bacon $5, etc. Breakfast entrees ranged from $20 - $28, they had the typical breakfast fare. Kids meals for lunch and dinner ranged from $8-$11, all the kids basics, PB & J, spaghetti, hamburger, chicken fingers, etc. Meals included fruit or fries, drinks are extra. Lunch was limited to a club sandwich, burger, a salad, soup or a pizza - that was it, again everything $18+. We also had dinner in a few nights due to my son falling asleep at 5pm and heavy rain. For dinner you could choose the lunch offerings or a steak, filet mignon & lobster, a chicken dish, fresh fish or a pasta. Dinner entrees ranged from $28-$42., don't forget about the $5 delivery charge and the 18% service charge. Had an amazing linguini with scallops and shrimp, the filet and lobster was the worst i've ever had. Food always arrived withing 30 minutes and was great all but the night we arrived - everything was cold, it had definetly been sitting around for a while. Prices in the restaurants are basically the same as the room service prices. I don't mind paying resort prices as long as the food is good and it really was. The resort and grounds are beautiful, everything was decorated for christmas. We were there for the tree lighting on Dec. 1st. We sat sipping our hot chocolate in the pouring rain waiting for Santa. He and an elf actually parachuted in! It was a nice show and the lights were beautiful. Everyone just wrapped up in towels and pulled out their umbrellas. It rained so hard at one point that we just started laughing - it was rediculous! Our clothes were soaked all the way through by the time we got back to our room. The staff - everyone we dealt with before and during our vacation were extremely nice and helpful. They were all great with the my kids too. If you e-mail any requests before your trip be sure to follow up. I took up to a week to receive a reply at times and we still had to make an additional requests once in our room for things that were forgotten. One of the staff members did send us a beautiful cake for our anniversary to make up for the delays. We also received a box of chocolates, and a wooden pineapple and card upon arrival in celebration of our anniversary. Bottom line, would we stay at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua in the future? The answer is an easy no for a few reasons - the weather can be very iffy and I don't like to have to pack up the kids and drive to the other side of the island each day to find the sun, the resort is not family friendly, and i've been to the Four Seasons in Wailea so I know how good things can be. If you're trying to decide between the Ritz and the Four Seasons I'll tell you why I liked the Four Seasons so much more: much larger rooms, great kids club and plenty of on site activities for families, DVD players in the rooms - great if you have kids, great restaurants, extensive room service and kids menus, complimentary cabanas at the pools, lounge chairs directly in the sand on Wailea Beach, and it has a great paved beach path that stretches to the Grand Wailea and Kea Lani for more dining and shopping choices. I think the Ritz Carlton Kapalua would be a great choice for honeymooners or adult couples that want a quite secluded week by the pool - weather permitting. This isn't the place to be for young families or the party crowd. The Ritz is quiet, low key and secluded, if that's not your cup of tea this isn't the resort for you.

Reviews.Title: “Dream Honyemoon at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: travelbuddy20
Reviews.Content: I think it was a week before our honeymoon that I said to myself "Let me go online to tripadvisor and see all the good things about the Ritz!". Well... after reading some reviews I became so nervous! Hahaha, good thing I kept an optimistic view because our honeymoon was nothing less than stellar. Does the Ritz Carlton need updating? Yes. Are the tv's old? Yes. BUT they have signs up that ask you to please excuse the appearance while they are renovating. So, to me, I excuse it! Lets go onto bigger and better things. The rooms were really nice... great beds and great bathrooms. The pool is gorgeous and the pool service was excellent. The beach isn't that far. Its down a pathway .. walk.. its good for you! The tennis courts were pretty good.... lots of them so we didn't have to wait. The spa is very nice a bit small but good service. The gym is really good too,plenty of machines. We had continental b'fast included and I'm so happy we did. The b'fast was yummy & had a great view. The weather: It was sunny everyday. Not one drop of rain in our 8days there. There is a bit of a wind but its a warm Aruba like wind and it was welcomed! We had a great time at the Ritz and will absolutely go back!!!!

Reviews.Title: “We are here right now!!! What is everyone complaining about??”
Reviews.Author: BrandoReefDiver
Reviews.Content: Ok, I am going to make this short as I am on vacation as I am typing! Here is the real deal! The Ritz is very nice, very classy. THey had the Christmas Tree lighting the fiirt night we were here. There is a slight musty order to the room but we took care of it with a plug in freshner. It really was NO big deal... The staff has been awesome, the grounds are beautifully decorated. I really can find nothing to complain about. I think for some people, if it isn't perfect, it isn't any good. I have traveled quite a bit and have never had a perfect vacation. I think some need to get over the uppyness and just enjoy their vacation! Ok, couple of quick side points-the beach on the property is dirty (stuff wahing onto shore) and is rough for non-oceangoing folk. A short shuttle ride down the hill takes you to the main bay that is protected. Very clean, awesome snorkling spot. I did a scooter dive here, lots of turtles, octopus and eels. Very cool. Last point-if you want action, book at one of the resorts at Kaanapali. Otherwise, take the Ritz... We are very happy we did... Brandon Wisconsin

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: JBlakey
Reviews.Content: Contrary to many of the reviews we read, the Ritz proved to be a rather pleasant surprise. I planned the trip for our anniversary and didn't read the reviews until after it was fully booked. I got nervous after reading some of the negative reviews and almost switched our hotel to the Four Seasons, I am so glad we didn't make that change. The Ritz staff was undeniably exccellent. We arrived to a very warm greeting as if they had been waiting for us for days. Our name was used so often in a gracious and authentic manner and smiles and greetings were abundant. Every time a staff member passsed us a warm aloha and smile was ever present. The room decor was not the greatest and it did smell a little musty when we arrived, but we bought a candle and never thought of it again. I imagine that the precipitation on this side of the island had something to do with it. The breakfast buffet was wonderful it kept us full until dinner. This was a wonderful trip and a great resort, quiet, secluded, but close enough to Whaler's Village and LaHaina to make it very accessible to the "action." Highly recommend the Ritz

Reviews.Title: “Finishes Strong”
Reviews.Author: JuanC
Reviews.Content: We arrived late in the day, well beyond the benefit of light to guide us or reveal the sights, including entrance to the hotel. It was clear the room we occupied hadn't been occupied in some time. The tropics had descended on the room and it was musty and dingy. I was surprised given Ritz-Carlton's reputation for sharp properties. We decided to head to the bar for a drink and dinner. The service was underwhelming. "Oh, my. Is this what everything is going to be like?" The sunrise brought a totally different Ritz, and a decent candle we'd brought along and cool on "high" did away with the musty smell (by the way, the A/C in the rooms is nice and cool). The view from the "Garden View" room was gorgeous. We could see the surf and the sunrise over the mountains. Fabulous. The pool was large and accomodated a "full" hotel. The service around the pool was great. Staff would grab towels and scout empty chairs and the beverages were rarely empty. The relative seclusion of the property was a bonus. The private beach (not really private but feels like it) was flawless with lots of character. The staff there was friendly, too. The best staff were those at the front door. The second time I took the car out, the staff knew me by name and every arrival was a homecoming. Nice touch. The Ritz's strong points: Service, location and seculsion. Of course, things are going to be pricey, but if you have to ask... Overall, I'd go back in a second and choose a room upgrade.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: ducati748
Reviews.Content: Wonderful! After booking our trip we read some reviews that almost made us change to the Four Seasons in Wailea. We decided to stay the course, and were extremely happy we did. Beautiful and tranquil. Great service, great rooms, and wonderful private beach. Spent many sunsets sipping cocktails on their beach-side restaurant ("The Beach House"). Will definitely go back. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxed, and Special-- a Honeymoon Review”
Reviews.Author: TeacherTina
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose to stay at the Ritz-Carlton because we've had positive experiences with them in the past. The friendly staff and accomodations were what we expected and we were very satisfied. The "Best" Parts-- All of the staff was extremely friendly, polite, helpful, and eager to please. In particular, the concierge desk was essential in planning all of our excursions since we did not book any activities before we left. They handled everything from snorkeling trips to dinner reservations. They also have detailed maps and driving directions for any destination in Maui for you, free of charge. The breakfast buffet was the best buffet I've ever experienced, and I'm definately not a buffet fan. The breakfast staples were always fresh and ready to go, plus they changed up some of items so we didn't feel like we were eating the same thing daily. We had purchased the breakfast package with our trip, and it was definately worth it. Even though it was a buffet, the serving staff was very attentive with coffee refils and water. I found the room to be very nice and a good size. The "partial ocean view" was AWESOME... we saw a lot of the coastline and the pool right from our room... it was gorgeous. The Not So Good Parts-- The pools were clean and well maintained with plenty of towles and lounge chair covers. During peak hours we did have a hard time finding a good spot to settle. There were two jacuuzis that did need some repair. Wait staff at the pool was minimal, and we always wound up going to the bar ourselves to get our own cocktails since we were never waited on from our seats. The rooms were slow to be cleaned, though it did not interfere too much with our stay since we were out most of the day. We left our room early every morning, and twice we just passed the cleaning attendant leaving our room at 4pm. Trash and room service items lingered in the hallway for many hours before being removed. A note to honeymooners--- My husband and I were Maui newbies, and when we booked our trip we of course wanted the most romantic setting possible. Maui did NOT dissapoint. We timed our trip in the offpeak season to avoid massive crowds and families. We were told to stay at The Ritz for the most calm, romantic experience possible, versus other hotels like the Grand Wailea (very, very nice, though!) because it was geared towards families.* We suggest having dinner at SanSei, just down the road from the hotel on the same property (a 2 minute drive, max) for the freshest sushi and tastiest entrees. The hotel sushi bar was extremely good, but two small rolls and two beers was over $70. In summary, we'd definately return to Maui and to the Ritz. *I'm not a parent (yet) and in no way do I wish to offend people who travel with children. I'm a teacher, I love kids, but we wanted to focus on romance without the shrieks and boisterous behavior of little tykes on vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh”
Reviews.Author: kfastuff
Reviews.Content: Look. It's a perfectly acceptable resort, but this is indisputably not one of Ritz Carlton's finest properties. It has a dated feel -- replete with the light woods and pastelles of the late 80s, along with the depressing floral patterns in the corridor. Everything was a little off -- a shower door that didn't close entirely, a mound of dirty bath towels lying on the poolside valet stand, a "non-smoking" room that reeked of smoke, a front desk that was seemingly impossible to reach. Word is that the rooms will undergo a major facelift in the coming months. It's almost as if they're phoning it in until the first contractor arrives. The busy, unflappable concierge desk deserves an "atta boy." They were precise, helpful, candid and efficient. The RC-Kapalua may again be a top-notch resort, but right now, it's sputtering toward its first -- badly needed -- remodel.

Reviews.Title: “Got married on Maui and stayed at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: mlibner
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I started our vacation by spending two days on Oahu (11/3 & 11/4) and then the remaining six days on Maui (11/5-11/10). We flew Delta from Atlanta to Honolulu. It was a 9.5 hour flight. There is a five hour time difference between SC and HI that we never got used to while in HI. We were always dead tired by 9:00 pm and up at 5:00 am. We had a great time on both but there was no comparison to the two islands or hotels. We stayed on Oahu primarily to visit Pearl Harbor and see the USS Arizona Memorial, the USS Missouri etc. That alone is worth the trip to Oahu. A day or two on Oahu is all you need. Honolulu is a very busy and crowded city full of tourist, mostly from Japan, traffic and high rise hotels. Maui on the other hand is much more laid back. We flew into Kahului, Maui and rented a jeep. I would strongly encourage anyone visiting Maui to rent a car. A convertible jeep if you can afford it. We got married at sunset on the beach in Kaanapali. I would highly recommend Jeff and Fuji at Happy Maui weddings for getting hitched. Now about the Ritz. We got "leid" as soon as we got there with fresh beuatiful flowers. When we told them we were getting married the immediately upgraded our room to ocean view. The bellhop was very friendly and informative. He immediately filled our ice bucket up with ice. Once we got to our room I noticed the safe key was missing. I called the front desk and they immediately had the lock replaced. The pillows and mattress were very soft and comfortable, probably down. The room was spacious. The bathroom was wall to wall marble and large. Very first class all the way. That evening when we got back from dinner we noticed the hotel left us some chocolates and a leather bound photo book for us to keep our wedding photos in. The waiter at the pool talked to us 45 minutes giving us the 411 on where to go, where to eat etc. He was very helpful. The day of our wedding my wife needed safety pins. We looked in drug stores and grocery stores with no luck. When we got back to the room I called the front desk to see if they had any. Ten minutes later they delivered an envelope full of safety pins to the room! We got turn down service every night which included fresh towels and bottled water. The breakfast buffett is the best I have ever seen. Fortunately for us it was included in our package because it is VERY expensive. $30 a piece! Since it was included in our package we ate there every morning. The pools were first rate. You don't need to bring towels. They are provided and free of charge. The drinks poolside are expensive. $5.50 for a can of Miller Lite but hey it's the Ritz right! The jacuzzi was nice but did show some age. The cement around the edges was coming loose. The hotel is 14 years old and was told by a server renovations are planned for next year. We didn't eat at the Banyan Tree which is part of the Ritz but I can tell you the Pineapple Grill down the road is fantastic and expensive. The Ritz is surrounded by top rate golf courses although we don't golf and didn't while we were there. If you love golf Kapalua is the place to be. The beach is little stroll from the hotel because of an ancient Hawaiian burial ground that you have to walk around. This didn't bother us because we were so busy we only went to the beach at the Ritz once. They have lawn chairs at the beach on a nice grassy area about twenty feet from the sand. I would highly recommend doing the following while in Maui; snorkeling/snuba diving, attending a Luau, drving to Hana (water falls, lava tubes, black sand beach, blow hole, seven pools etc). The best thing about the Ritz was the service. We felt rich while staying there although we are far from it. The only additional charge on our bill was the $18 resort fee. We had no surprise charges when we checked out. I would highly recommend the Ritz and Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the Four Seasons and Go To The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: flygalaz
Reviews.Content: I loved this place! Itâ€™s very typical Ritz Carlton as far as the classic look and I found all the service staff to be extremely nice and accommodating. The pool area is fantastic and has a sweeping view of the Ocean. The beach is a bit of a hike down but itâ€™s on a well groomed path (sidewalk all the way) and golf carts will transport you if you wish. Once you get to the beach (or tennis area), itâ€™s beautiful and very secluded. If you are a golfer, Kaplua is for you. Lots of good courses including the one at the Ritz. They also have an excellent fitness facility for those of you who want to keep your workout up. Very well equipped and good hours. The breakfast buffet was OK, probably not worth the money. Order a-â€˜la carte. The other restaurants are good and I liked the fact the main bar offers a small sushi bar overlooking the ocean and while it has a limited selection, itâ€™s fresh and there is a great sushi/seafood restaurant within walking distance. Kapalua is a little removed from the â€œactionâ€� but I like it that way. Felt like I could really relax. If you want more action, in a quick drive (20 minutes max) you can be in Lahaina town or even closer is Whalers Village and â€œHotel Rowâ€� where the big hotels are (Westin, Sheraton, etc.). I have also stayed at the Four Seasons on the other side of Maui and I prefer this place. Itâ€™s a personal preference but I like the classic type places better and I think the people are more down to earth than at the Four Seasons (this is not always my opinion of Four Seasons vs. Ritz, sometimes itâ€™s the opposite but in the case of Maui, I would go Ritz, plus there is more to do on the west side of the island). Do take a trip around the island as there are some really cool places to see so get out and then come back and enjoy your evening at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz”
Reviews.Author: EastSide22ZD
Reviews.Content: This was for an incentive trip. So, I might not compare to the average visit. At 200 plus rooms, the hotel probably put a special effect forward. 1st, the staff was excellent. Any request or question was addressed immediately and professionally. The room was not especially luxurious, but was spotless and very comfortable. If you're a beach fan, this isn't the place for you. However, the pool complex is fantastic. Food: Again, this was a corporate event. They did a fantastic job, and had a wide variety cusines over the days, and I'm tough to please.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch resort - with a few hitiches”
Reviews.Author: spacechimp
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is an impressive resort in an equally impressive location. The west side of Maui can offer tantalizing ocean views, but with it's isolated location, be prepared for long drives to many key hot spots elsewhere on the island. The grounds of the resort is fairly well kept and the decor of the buildings apparently. The staff is polite and friendly. The room we were in (a base suite) was nice, clean with a good sized bathroom. The TV was a little dated and small. The biggest problem while there was the thermostat. Our room (and entire wing it seemed) was an ice-chest! We attempted to raise the temp our first night there in our room (hmmm, is 85F high enough!!!) and was still popcicles! The only solution was to turn the vent off - which kind of worked, but still seemd to only make the room 'cold' as opposed to 'fridgid.' The highlight there has to be the pool. I've been to nicer pools in Maui (the Kea Lani Wailea is notable) but it's very beautiful with excellent pool staff! With it's complex layers and landscaping, it seems you could find a great spot anywhere on the pool deck - even when busy. Very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: klhodge7
Reviews.Content: This was absolutely the best vacation we have ever had. The Ritz Carlton, Kapalua was amazing, and I would recommend it to anyone looking for a relaxing and luxurious vacation. The food was delicious and the drinks were wonderful (try the Kapalua Punch). I would highly recommend upgrading to the club level. They provide a more personal concierge service and there are 5 food presentations daily, not to mention it's open bar! It's definitely worth the money. It starts with a continental breakfast, lunch, an afternoon snack (their cookies are famous), light dinner and finally cordials and chocolates (the chocolate covered strawberries are the best). Honestly it is worth every penny & there are always chocolate chip cookies available 24 hours a day (convenient after you go out)! You won't be disappointed, unless you're a bit hard to please. The rooms are simple and elegant and the beds are very comfortable. The location is phenomenal. It's located away from the city and up on a big hill. It has the most beautiful views of the ocean and the mountains. It is super quiet, which make you really feel like you're "away" from it all, yet is close enough to anything and everything you might want to do. We loved the pool. Itâ€™s beautiful and the pool chairs were very comfortable. The poolside wait staff kept the drinks coming, too! The beach was really nice. It has a private feel to it and isnâ€™t easy to get to if you arenâ€™t staying on Ritz property. It was definitely different from other hotels we visited. The hotel staff couldn't do enough for us, also. They were so happy to assist and somehow anticipated our needs before we even asked the question! It was the epitome of top-notch service with a smile. We were there during the earthquake, and everyone was incredibly calm and controlled. It was just business as usual, which was comforting for those of us who hadn't experienced a "quake", yet. We also visited several other well-known hotels in Maui, and by far the Ritz was the best in service, splendor and overall feel. You wonâ€™t be disappointed! We absolutely loved every minute and are looking forward to returning to the Ritz Carlton, Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Not what the Ritz used to be.......”
Reviews.Author: caskel01
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been called one of the "best in the world" by a popular travel publication. Take it from someone who has stayed at some of the best properties in the world, this hotel is utterly average! The rooms remind me of staying in a Marriott Courtyard property. Nothing fancy, lots of pastel colors, dated decor. The hotel staff are poorly trained and do not live up to the Ritz standard. The restaurants food is below average and the service is substandard. When the staff was told it was our Honeymoon the best we got was a congrats and have a great time. At $395 a night, and a gold level Marriott customer, I expected more! The location is just ok, the beach area is exposed and is dangerous for small children and older adults. There are great snorkling and protected coves a short bus ride away. The pool is nice and there is adequate seating on the busiest of days. The grounds are beatifully landscaped and are the hotels only saving grace.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: caliking1971
Reviews.Content: We took direct flights via United from LAX. Booked our whole vacation through Pleasant Holidays. Picked up car rental from Dollar and drove to the Ritz Carlton. It's really FAR from the airport. This was our first time on Maui, so we didn't expect such a long drive. It is very scenic with views of the ocean almost the entire way. The Ritz sits on what I feel may be the most beautiful rolling hills. My wife and I fell in love with the location. Check-in was a little cause for concern. The front desk didn't seem to have my name in their system and acted like they didn't want to give me a room. Good thing I had our trip itinerary in my backpack. After about 10 minutes, they tell us our room wouldn't be ready till after 3pm. This upset my wife because she had a headache and wanted to shower and lay down from the long plane ride. The front desk did try and be somewhat accomodating, they offered us use of their spa area to shower and relax until our room was ready. We took advantage of that and then went to lunch in Lahaina. What we did not like about the hotel was that most things or places you wanted to go to were a bit of a drive. Our room was finally ready, the hotel called us by cell phone. We felt that the grounds and main lobbies were well appointed, we didn't see any signs of frayed carpets or worn sofas as many on these boards had written about. Our room was an ocean view room on the 8th floor. A bit of a walk I thought. Room was very clean and we liked the view. Maid service was good. Room was cleaned at least twice daily with turn-down service every night. From what I've read on these boards, Ritz Kapalua is due for renovation. Well, bring it on. Rooms are not equipped with computers in rooms, not even ones that interface with the television. And speaking of televisions, oh my, the one in our room must've been15 yrs old. It was a 19 inch, with a dinosaur for remote! I couldn't believe that. When I asked about internet access, the front desk showed me an area in the hotel where I could use a credit-card and be charged by the minute for internet access. This really bothered me, when rooms cost about $400/day average you'd think, they'd give you internet access for free. We were there for 5 days, each day, we started off with full buffet breakfast in the The Terrace Restaurant. It was so delicious and every seat is an ocean view. We really looked forward to this breakfast. It's kinda pricey, about $30 bucks per person, but is sometimes included in your hotel package. The wait staff there is very good and efficient. The pool area is beautiful very clean and remarkably quiet. We went to the pool each morning after breakfast. The grounds are manicured to perfection. What we liked most about the Ritz was the attention the staff payed to detail. We have already decided that when we return to Maui we will only stay at the Ritz Carlton. Having gone to a luau in Kaanapali where some of the other hotels are we feel Ritz Carlton had them beat. We felt the other restaurants at the hotel were too pricey for average food. We ate at the Banyan Tree one night and the The Pineapple Grill, which is in Kapalua also, not on hotel grounds. Checkout was also a little awkward, when I went to front desk to review my bill and settle it in cash, the concierge told me that my hotel package must've only included my rental car and flight. I told her that couldn't be, because I had already paid Pleasant Holidays for the entire trip, including my room fees. I called the TA and returned to check-out, magically, the front desk help was able to figure out that I had already paid in my package. Despite a few sour notes, we will return to Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “We Are Still Asking Ourselves Why They Treated Repeat Guests So Badly”
Reviews.Author: yellowplumeria
Reviews.Content: We had an incredibly horrible stay at the Ritz last month. It was like a bad episode of the Twilight Zone. We have stayed at the Ritz about 8-10 times since 2002 and have always been treated so well. Our Ritz stays have always been the highlight of our Hawaii trips. We always called it our home away from home because we knew that no matter how the rest of our trip went, that we would have a great stay at the Ritz. This was not meant to be this time. Upon check-in we were not recognized as repeat guests and definately not treated that way. We arrived early and did not expect to check in right away, but we had to wait over five hours when they plenty of availibility. We asked the front desk where we could change for the pool while we waited. They told us to use the spa as they have lockers there. When we arrived at the spa, the woman there told us to go down the hall and use the PUBLIC restrooms to change. We told her twice that we were waiting to check-in. So the tone is setting for this stay. After about five hours and twenty minutes they finally had our room ready. We were the last people who had thier luggage stored by the bell desk to get checked in. Whe booked an Ocean View Suite. We almost died hwn we saw where they had put us. It was the worst room in the category! We were on the side towards the back. We had to crane to the left to see the ocean. We were facing some woods too. The double lanai was so small on one side that it would be hard for the two fo us to fit on it. The other side had no roof over it. We found it VERY strange that this was the first time we had not recieved an upgrade. I would understand if they had a full house, but they were fairly empty. We just looked at each other and told the bellman not to take our luggage off the cart. They finally put us in an Ocean Front Suite. They had so many avilable that they gave us four choices. On a previous stay they asked for our preferences for which side of the resort we like as well as our wine preferences, etc. Why did they put us through this hassle then? When we were there last March, there was a knock on the door every hour for five hours with welcome back amenities. This stay, we didn't even have one knock. We didn't even get the obligatory welcome back letter from the GM. We called down to let housekeeping know what time we like our turndown and regular houskeeping done. It's always 10:00 am and 6:30 PM. That night at 7:00 PM they still hadn't come for turndown and we had dinner on the way, so they had to rush up to refresh towels etc. We are off to a very bad start and it still gets MUCH worse. Of course there were 35 mile an hour winds so we couldn't enjoy our lanai's. My husband had to pull a chair into the very corner to smoke a cigar. The next morning we sent down a lot of dry cleaning and went to the pool for the day. That evening they put our drycleaning in the living room closet. We ordered dinner at 7:00 PM. When you order room service they always say that dinner will be up in 30 minutes or less. We were talking and noticed that it was 7:45. I called down to see where our dinner was. They said they had a problem with our order. How bizzare. They said it would be another 25 minutes. I called down to management to ask why we were being treated the way we were. They didn't know what to say. Dinner finally showed up around 8:15 or a bit before. The manager said that dinner was on them. I will gladly pay my bill, just give me what's promised. By this time we had decided that we were checking out three days early. Enough was enough. Apparently, guest loyalty didn't mean too much to the Ritz Kapalua. The next morning I went to put on one of the blouses I had dry cleaned. All the clothes we sent down were Tommy Bahama, which is all silk. I looked at it and it had huge blue ink stains on the front and back. When we checked all our other clothes we had sent down, we found 7 articles that were ruined. Management sent up loss prevention and they took pictures to put in a claim. Once Tommy Bahama does a print they never do it again. My blouses can never be replaced. My husband lost 4 pair of Tommy Bahama shorts and the rest were mine. The Ritz has since sent us a check for $580.00. We cannot fathom why the Ritz would let loyal guest such a us go through what we did. The whole thing was so weird because my husband kept saying that he had a creepy feeling this stay and I told him that it felt like someone was watching us. I don't know if the rumors about the Ritz being haunted are true, but the hair on the back of my neck still stands on end when I remember how both of us had an eerie feeling while on that property. I have not felt the "cold"(ghost) spots people talk about, but if someone built a resort on top of or so many feet from my relatives, I would haunt it too. We were told that the GM would be contacting us soon. To this day, we haven't heard from him.

Reviews.Title: “Good for Maui and the price, lacking for the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: RBerthelot2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on the NW side of the island of Maui, Hawaii. This is not convienant for sightseeing on the island, but GREAT views and a nice property. The rooms are said to be renovated next year (2007) and they badly need them. However, the grounds are nice, the staff was extremely nice, free self park and a great restaurant on the grounds - The Banyan Tree. The hotel was good for the price of the rooms, however, a little under par for a Ritz Carlton. The breakfast buffet is ok, but not great.

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Stay”
Reviews.Author: IlliniRon
Reviews.Content: This is a nice property and a beautiful place to be located on Maui. The grounds are very spacious, and the walk to the beach is longer than you might expect, but there is a shuttle for those who need assistance. Our room was comfortable and it had a nice view of the courtyard and ocean in the distance. The pools were well attended by staff who would deliver great drinks and food. Prices are typical of a Ritz Carlton, but that was expected. The sushi restaurant in the lobby area was really nice. The breakfast buffet was top notch. The staff was very polite and attentive and made the trip very enjoyable for us and our daughter. We would definitely consider staying here again and the deal from the hotel was good for a Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: mrzip
Reviews.Content: My husband, 11 year old son and myself stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Maui for five days in late July early August. We booked a club room with 2 double beds. Upon check in the check in staff member informed us that the only room available on the club floor was a king size room. I explained that we made our reservation six months ago. It did not matter to him. He said that they cannot guarantee this room. He told us we could get a roll away bed. I was not happy but we did take the king size room with the roll away. Upon entering the room there was a very musty smell. Other reviewers have also noted this problem. When reading trip advisor reviews for this hotel for six month prior to our trip I did not believe the negative reviews. Really, how bad could the Ritz Carlton in Maui be. We have stayed at the Ritz in Naples, Floriida several times and that hotel was extremely nice. In my opinion no hotels are perfect but I was sure the Ritz in Maui would come close. In reading other reviews for this hotel I found both the negative and positive reviews to have accurrate information (except for maybe a few). First the negataives: Not getting the room we booked six months in advance. After spending 3 nights in the King size room we moved down a floor to a room with 2 double beds. This was not the club floor but we kept the club floor amenities. The furniture in both rooms was indeed very dated. The curtains in both rooms had a lot of small holes in them. In the morning, the sun would stream through these holes. Basically the rooms appeared to be pretty clean but the bathroom in the lower floor had a bright yellow stain around the toilet. (gross). The first floor on the club level had a very damp, musty smell. The lower floor did not. Our second day at the hotel it rained constantly. That evening the musty smell in the room was bordering on unbearable. Because the smell got worse after a constant rain there must be some issues with dampness in the hotel. The rest of our stay we enjoyed very nice weather. We did notice the wind in our first room. This room was on the top floor and was located at the end of the building. There was one side of the balcony that did not have a wall therefore you really could not sit out there. The lower room was located in the center of the building and that balcony was very pleasant. This was the only time I noticed the wind. There was always a pile of wet towels located on top of a trash can when you entered the hotel from the pool area. I understand that there are going to be renovations at this hotel but renovations will not do anything for keeping the hotel grounds neat. The restroom at the pool had overflowing trash cans. The floor was wet and messy. Did not appear to be very clean. No one ever approached us at the pool to take a food or drink order. The pool restaurant/bar was close so it was not a big deal to get our own food/drinks but it just didn't do anything for having a feeling of being at a luxury hotel. We were charged $95.00 for a pool cabana. We never rented a cabana. Upon a phone call to the front desk, this charge was taken off. I read other reviews to check your bill daily on the television. That tip did help. The landscaping around the hotel was very basic (nothing special). Tiles were missing from the hot tub. I thought the beach at the hotel was a long walk. Even if you are in good shape, it's not fun carrying towel, and beach gear up and down a hill. I did not see the golf carts. They may be there but I don't think they sit there waiting for guests. You may catch one by chance. The staff told us that the beach was not safe to swim in. Positives: The views from the hotel were very beautiful. The club floor staff was very professional. They were extremely helpful in making activity and dinner reservations. The food on the club level was good but could have used more variety. Just a note regarding alcoholic drinks on the club floor. If you wanted a drink , a staff member would get it for you. Not a big deal but if they were busy you had to wait. In Naples, they would have an open bar so you could help yourself. We do not drink a lot but enjoy one or two drinks before dinner. If the staff member was busy and you were short of time it was annoying to wait. All in all the club floor amenities were nice. We used the Ritz shuttle to go to Kapalua Beach and the Plantation House Restaurant. This was very convenient. The shuttles were prompt and the drivers professional. The Plantation House restaurant was very nice. Enjoyed the food, service and spectacular views. We ate there twice. We ate dinner at the Terrace Restaurant once. Service and food were fine. The only problem was that everything came out so fast that we were not able to sit and relax. The buffet breakfast at the Terrace was very nice. Even though it was a huge buffet, the food was well presented. Some people have complained about the birds in the morning making noise, etc. This is not just at the Ritz but other locations. I thought the birds were beautiful and fun to watch and listen to. If we return to Maui, I 'm not sure that we will stay at this Ritz unless some of the problems are corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlohaMaui
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days in Sept at the RC and were disappointed. We have visted Maui frequently in recent years and have stayed at various properties. The Ritz was just so-so. The room was standard hotel offering - no wow factor even with an upgrade ocean view room. The room smelled musty and had no character. The pools were nice, but Kapalua is very windy much of the time. The beach is nice as are the grounds, but nothing special. We heard that soon the RC will be converting to time shares. Our last morning was spoiled by loud drilling and having our room's water turned off at 9 am! With no notice! - didn't they know we were there??? Beware of the trade winds if you plan to play golf! We played the Plantation course or a non-windy day and the course defeated us! Good shots down the middle rolled off the fairway and were lost in the thick long "grassy" rough. Shots to the greens rolled off. Putts rolled fast or slow - we never knew what would happen. The restaurants are ok. Vinos is a tapas bar and tasty. The PIneapple Grille and Plantation House were nice. All in all we prefer the South properties - especially the beaches. Our last week we spent in a lovely condo at the Wailea Palms (non ResortQuest property). PS: Roy's Kihei is not to be missed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: Bride0506
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights as part of our honeymoon. The hotel was AMAZING! The hotel was everything we expected and had hoped for. The food, staff, surroundings were all perfect! We also enjoyed the proximity to activities in Whaler's Village & Lahaina. We will look to return at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “loved the staff/waliking trails”
Reviews.Author: gabanna
Reviews.Content: My family checked in at the Ritz for 7 days the third week of August. The Lei greeting was a wonderful surprise and the juice was refreshing. My husband and I stayed in a golfview room with a partial ocean view to the right and my daughter and her grandmother stayed in an oceanview room which actually overlooked the pool and the ocean. Both were very nice, rooms were very clean, bed very comfortable, and room size was larger than other hotel rooms. We had a nice balcony where we watched beautiful sunsets, while drinking champagne. We also enjoyed the Bulgari soap bath amenities and actually loved gthe smell so much purchased the parfum when I got home. Our rooms were cleaned promptly everyday and the turn down service at the end of the day was great! The staff at the restaurants were excellent, and the luau was very entertaining!
