We enjoyed the Honolua general store (less than 5 minutes walk from hotell) you can charge all purchases to your room at the Ritz. Breakfast was so delicious and plentiful, and very reasonable at the General Store! A plus is also the Catholic church that is by the general store and had Saturday evening and Sunday service!!! We also enjoyed the walking trails every morning, it was a good workout. The towels and cold water at the bellhop desk at the entrance of the hotel were so convenient!!!!! We would get them as we took the shutle to the snorkling beach and drop them off when we returned!!! The weather was excellent, in the 7 days we were there it rained for about 1/2 hour one night while we had dinner and another time for about 10 minutes, no hard prolonged rain. Buffet breakfast was excellent, and the sushi bar at the lobby lounge was also very good! We were not able to eat at the Banyan Tree as it was all booked the night we tried. Enjoyed the Friday entertainment at the lobby which featured local performers. The nearby Japanese Restaurant Sansei, which actually moved was very good and reasonable, and the Tapas bar VIno, the appetizers were excelent and the melon Martini was awesome (also walking distance from hotel). Free Shuttle service was available to these restaurants. Our only compliant would be that there are no loungers on the beach and if you wanted to bring a chair you have to carry it down yourself! Aside from that we had a great time, and will definitely go back to the Ritz the next time we are in Maui! All the beaches in Maui are beautiful but if you looking for service the Ritz is the place to stay, we were so pampered and the staff were just great! One other eating place in Lahaina try MALA which is at the beginning of Front Street, we loved the food, you are so close to the water and the view of the sunset is beatiful. You mujst ask to be seated out in the terrace, by the water! Dessert was also fabulous! We also stayed 3 days on the Wailea side(also very beautiful) but talking about the wind, it was so windy that I commented to my husband that the ocean looked so angry!!!! I have to add though that this was late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: detjason
Reviews.Content: The property is in a very beautiful, plantation-style, garden setting. The location is my favorite on Maui so far. Much more green and tropical then Kaanapali. It is everything we expected it to be and more. The resort is very large (several hundred acres) and has a free shuttle. The beach is a small and cozy and did not have large waves when we were there. The hotel has lounge chairs at the edge of the beach with food and drink service. My wife and 1 year old son enjoyed our week here and appreciated the slight breeze in the afternoon. It only rained 1 day for 20 minutes. I had no complaints about this property. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay at Ritz”
Reviews.Author: brianrr
Reviews.Content: Jsut returned from a 10 day honeymoon at the Ritz. First of all overall it was excellent, good service,great food and excellent facilities. Yes, the wind does blow (on average 10-20 mph) but the pool area is sheltered and comfortable - the hotel beach is nice but the wind can sometimes make it dangerously rough and sand blows around on windy days- there are no sunning chairs on the beach (local law) but some comfortable ones just above it overlooking. If you insist on laying on a beach all the time this may not be the best choice. The rooms are very nice although perhaps could use a bit of an update which they say is coming soon.Still,comfortable,good beds, sufficiently large. We had a deluxe oceanview which overlooked the beautiful pool area with only limited ocean view - I probably would not pay extra for ocean view again as the way the hotel is laid out most rooms (except suties) are only going to get ocean view from the side. Staff and servcie are excellent and the concierge desk is helpful though busy. Nearby Honolua store is a plus for typical "general store" type things. The grounds and resort area are lovely and expansive,good running routes and excellent (andreasonably priced tennis (at the nearby Tennis Garden we played with ball machines for a very reasonable $31 an hour which they usually let you strecth to 1.5 hours, there are also free courts on the Ritz property). Food here is very good, the package breakfast buffet at the Terrace is ample and delicious - definitely worth it, as the charge is $61 fro two without the package. The Banyan tree is the best restaurant in Maui (and we ate at almost all the top rated ones) but it is somewhat pricey (lots of $35-45 entrees). We loved the location it is quite and besutiful but it is a drive to anything off the Kapalua resort area Kaanapali is about 5 minutes and Lahaina 10-15. We are not golfers but there are also 3 world class (PGA) golf courses. We also did the Luau they have twice a week and it was fun - food again was ample and very tasty and the entertainment was enjoyable as well (music, fire dancers etc.). It's $95 per person with open bar so not a bad deal either. Do it if you want the luau experience ( they do the buried roast pig and a lot of local foods). On the whole I would highly recommend it - we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: gengrace
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent three nights at the Ritz and one night at the Four Seasons in early Sept. 2006. We loved BOTH hotels and highly recommend them. The pros about the Ritz: * Friendly, courteous, and helpful staff. From the second we walked into the hotel lobby, they made us feel special and welcomed (and we weren't even celebrating an anniversary or birthday!). We talked to the concierge at least twice a day to get advice on restaurants, the road to Hana, and other activities, and the staff was always friendly and prompt. * We opted for the cheapest room we could find, and it sounds like we made the best decision. Our "garden view" room offered a gorgeous view of palm trees, hillsides, and YES - a huge view of the ocean (see pics). It was stunning and so surprising. Our room was #1609 and I think all of the rooms in this wing, facing due east, offer this same view. The room itself had a very comfortable bed, tasteful colors, a fridge, and a gorgeous bathroom. Loved the Bulgari soaps too! An added bonus was the twice-daily housecleaning service. * Beautiful, expansive grounds. Our first night, we watched the sun set while sipping cocktails by the beach. The whole experience was romantic, uncrowded, and relaxing. Our second night, we walked from the hotel to the nearby Sansei restaurant. The walk takes you along the coast, past the pristine villas, toward the Napili resort area, which offers stunning sunset views. * Open, airy design of the hotel. Unlike a few other reviewers, we found the decor to be just fine (and not run-down). We liked how breezy and open the corridors and lobbies were. * Proximity to great beaches and snorkeling (Kaâ€™anapali, Kapalua Beach, Kahekili Beach/Old Airport Rd -- turtles here!), as well as to shopping and dining in Lahaina. The cons about the Ritz: * Okay, we heard the weather is sometimes rainy and gusty in Kapalua. BUT, we had abundant sunshine for three days, and only a couple of hours of rain. Ironically, the most rain we had was in Wailea (where the Four Seasons is), which is supposed to be one of the driest and sunniest parts of Maui!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz - Good & Bad, but overall a good experience”
Reviews.Author: Clemson_ChE'01
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz in late August of 2005 for our honeymoon. The 4 nights we stayed were pleasant. The Ritz does have its flaws...windy, sometimes rainy, rooms not as nice as would be expected at a Ritz. But it does have its good points. The staff was always more than helpful, whether at check in/out, around property, or when leaving for the day. We enjoyed the leis when checking in and also the bottled water placed out front all day long. I admit that the weather could be a little rainy at times but, its an island...if you don't like the weather on this side try the other. One morning it was raining at the hotel but we decided to go see other parts of the island and the weather was fine. Most of the time the weather was fine at the Ritz and the big plus was having a more secluded area. If you're like me and want to get away from the crowded areas down the coast then this is a good choice. It is bad when wanting to eat though as restaurants are a decent drive away but not too bad if you plan ahead. The Honolua Store nearby was GREAT for breakfast. All in all it was nice maybe not for the money. To sum up it'tt probably make some people happy and others not.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it !”
Reviews.Author: chat2
Reviews.Content: The worst hotel I have ever stayed at. Would never ever recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz was OK”
Reviews.Author: DanaB2478
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently returned from a delayed honeymoon at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. It was the second leg of our 2 week vacation that started in Oahu. Neither my husband nor I had ever stayed at a Ritz so I was excited to find out he had booked it for the week(i didn't know until we got there). When we arrived we were brought up to our room, which was NOT what my husband expected. He booked the $600 a night ocean view room, and when we got there it was a view of the pool, with a sliver of ocean to the right. After conferring with the front desk we were offered a room facing the golf course. We went check it out and it was nicer than the last view(mountains in the front and a little more ocean to the left). So we stayed there. I didn't find the hotel to be in "horrible" condition at all. I thought the room was nice, the bed super comfy, and the bathroom was pretty(marble, separate shower, etc.). The pool area is nice(more kids than I had thought which cut down on the serene/calm). I loved the chairs and fresh towels available. Though my hubby is a sun person, I like to relax in the shade, so a few umbrellas would have been nice. You can reserve the cabana for $75(not worth it). By the way, the weather was not bad. One day was very windy, the rest was sunny and nice. All in all it was a nice experience, though I would not book the ocean view again. I would opt to book the cheapest room since the view in the more expensive room isn't that great anyway. We didn't spend a lot of time in the room to begin with. I think I may have just put the name "ritz" on such a pedastal that I expected more. I didn't feel oh so pampered(no fresh pineapple passed around while we were there) I think if we go back to maui, I'll try the four seasons.

Reviews.Title: “It was pretty marvelous!”
Reviews.Author: chumpmuffin
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here and were married on the property, so our happiness may have blinded us to any flaws. Also, I think we might have been given some extra attention due to the wedding, etc. But all in all, we were tremendously happy with our choice to stay here & really impressed with the experience. To sum it all up, definitely stay here if: You are getting married on the property. We were treated like royalty, upgraded & pampered like crazy. You'd prefer a romantic getaway rather than be in the middle of all the hubub. Kapalua is not that far away from Lahaina, but oh so much more relaxing! Don't stay here if: You are going to freak out over all the little charges. The place is not cheap. Best things about the Ritz: The staff & service. Distinctive. Truly the best part of the whole place. The breakfast buffet. Better than we expected & they change the options everday. The worst things: Interiors aren't the newest and bath products are marginal Still, this is being very, very picky. Can be a bit windy - if you hate wind, this probably isn't the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!! Don't listen!!”
Reviews.Author: tvsullivan
Reviews.Content: Loved it!!!! Don't listen to the bad reviews!! Ok, I was very nervous about the Ritz Carlton In Kapalua!!! After reading all the bad reviews we arrived and I was soooooo surprised at how wonderful it is!! This is our second night and we have spent most of the time so far here at the hotel and loved it! I do say I am very spoiled and have experienced travel at it greatest! Africa, Italy, San Fran etc and I am a Hotel junkie! I really have come to rely on this trip advisor and that is why I sit here in the room taking the time to share this! The Hotel is older, but not stinky or dingy!! The rooms furnishings ar uuuhhh-maybe 8 years old, the location is really more for the seasoned traveler, it is away from the party all night croud, It is a quiet setting It is in a small town atmosphere. The drinks in the bar are a little pricey, but hey if you choose a Ritz what so you expect?? I just can't say enough-no it is not the Marriott or Hyatt where you have the coffee pot in room or the starbucks in the lobby, but you do have the old fashioned respect and detail attention.-Hope this helped!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Ritz, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: redwing22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for our Honeymoon from August 14-21 and loved it! We were upgraded from ocean view to club level which was incredible! I'm not sure how much more it is to pay for the upgrade, but the club level is definitely worth it. My wife and I only had to pay for dinner with all of the different food selections they offer throughout the day. You can't beat the free drinks too! The concierge was very nice and helpful. We appreciated the fact that they had no problem recommending places to eat outside of the hotel and always seemed very knowledgeable about where to find just about anything on the island. Our room was very nice, no mildew, peeling wallpaper, or torn furniture like other reviews. The ocean view was breath-taking and we felt so spoiled with the evening turndown service. The food is pretty good too. They only thing I'd suggest staying away from is ordering a burger from room service. I asked for medium well and it was more like medium rare. That was the only bad meal we had here though. The club room food and the breakfast buffet down at the terrace was great. The seafood offered in the lobby lounge was pretty good, although a little pricey for what little food you get. The Banyan Tree was amazing, it was easily the best food we had at the Ritz. The chicken quesadilla we had at the poolside bar was pretty good too. The staff was always helpful and friendly. If we had any requests, they were at our room right away to drop it off. The pool staff was excellant as well. They were always willing to setup our chairs or carry our towels. When they started the drink/food service around 11am, they came by often to see if we needed another drink or a bite to eat. The guy walking around offering fresh pineapple was a nice too! The weather was fantastic too! It was around 90 and sunny every day and a low in the mid 70's at night. If there was any rain, it was only a brief shower overnight, and everything was cleared up by the morning. There is a pretty good breeze in Kapalua, which we really liked when you lay out in that hot sun. Both my wife and I commented about how much more comfortable it is in West Maui than in South Maui while we were there because of the constant breeze you get in West Maui. Overall, we would come back to the Ritz again and again and again. We didn't mind the 10 minute drive to Kaanapali and we actually preferred the more intimate setting of Kapalua to the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali or Lahaina.

Reviews.Title: “Quite the disappointment”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl06
Reviews.Content: We were looking forward to our trip to the Ritz (we were there for a week for a family wedding upcountry), but left with less than warm and fuzzy feelings about the Ritz. We had called ahead months in advance to insure that we had adjoining non smoking rooms, one with double beds and one with a king. We were checked in to different rooms with no double beds that reeked of smoke. We were finally moved into other rooms after complaining. The hotel is run down and in need of a remodel. I was shocked by the condition of the rooms, the furniture and the wallpaper that was starting to peel in the hallways. Also, the tvs are archaic, there is limited TV options and no dvd players (we had a day of rain, it would have been nice to have some options). Service was spotty. We had great experiences in the Terrace restaurant, but pool service required waving your arms in the air frantically and we had our pool cabana reservation lost on more than one occasion (a bigger deal that one would expect since they only have a limited number, charge $75 per day and have no umbrellas at the pool). What hotel with 365 days of sunshine and heat does not have pool umbrellas? There were upcharges for everything ($18 resort fee should have included the valet or at least the umbrellas). The spa is lovely, the massage was great. Also, this is a bit more removed than other resorts on Maui, so be prepared to either make a trek for dinner or become inventive with the limited food choices at the resort. Though, if you love Japanese food, Sansei sushi is a mile a way and phenomenal. By comparison, I stayed at the Ritz in Shanghai for 10 days in July and found it to be a much more pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “It is mildewy and dirty”
Reviews.Author: hhhhh1
Reviews.Content: The halls were mildewy with peeling wallpaper, filthy carpet and the rooms weren't much better. The only way to make it liveable is to leave the doors open (the air speads the stinky mold smell) The carpet needs to be torn out along with the apolstery and the curtains. The beds are old and uncomfortable. While the staff was very friendly and accomodating the service was terrible and physical accomodations stunk. I was even served a moldy hamberger. Maybe it will be better when they renovate next year but for now - AVOID this propery.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time - Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Postighone
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz from 7/20 - 7/25. Was really nervous based on reviews on this site. It was my wife and I and our two daughters (9&5). We had a fantastic time! The property and location were great. The beach was awesome and never crowded. It is a little bit of a walk to the beach, but there is a shuttle.The pool was not cold, the weather was great and the wind was refreshing. Yeah - the rooms need to be updated, but what are you doing in your room in Hawaii stupid? -Bathroom was huge and shower was great. -Never had a problem finding self parking - 5 minute walk. -Honoloa store - 5 minute walk - has everything you need. -Played the Plantation course - awesome! -Service was great and staff was great to the kids. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort - watch the weather!”
Reviews.Author: 30yr-old.traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in March 2006 for an all expense sales trip. We were scheduled to stay for one week however, after being there 2 days we knew we had to leave. The Ritz is an absolutely beautiful resort - the pools are magnificent, the views are incredible, the golf unbelievable and the spa is like nothing I've ever experienced. The only issue we had was the weather. Because Kapalua is at the tip of the island it is hit with bad weather regularly. The temperature was in the 70's, it was cloudy for the entire time we were there and we wore sweatshirts instead of swim trunks. Finally we decided to rent a car and travel the island since it was too cold and windy to sit by the pool. Much to our surprise we found that the rest of the island was sunny and hot! It turns out that kapalua is the windiest and coldest part of the island (for resorts). We left the hotel and headed for the south - we ended up staying 10 minutes down the road at Kaanapali beach and had sun and calm winds the entire time. We would always see the storm over Kapalua and the Ritz, though. If you want a place to enjoy a spa and golf you cant find anything better than the Ritz. For sun and hot weather dont stay on this part of the island. To reiterate and to be fair to the Ritz - the staff was great, service impeccable, and resort grounds beautiful, they are just on a bad part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great golf....”
Reviews.Author: AggieNut
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews from this site, I had no idea *what* to think about the Ritz Carlton Kapalua before arriving. We were very pleased with the RC Kapalua and wanted to add our thoughts as well. By the way, this was our first time to Maui but not our first time to a Ritz Carlton. Rooms: The latest reviews about the rooms are accurate. They are undergoing renovations right now, so look for updated rooms in the future. I never noticed a musty smell, and the term "threadbare" is completely overstated! Service: Hands down, some of the best we experienced on the island. Friendly, cooperative, and accomodating. Pool: Yes, it is windy. This is not the RC's fault, nor is it exclusive to this part of the island (we spent the day at the beach in Wailea, and it was just as windy!). The plexiglass does *not* distract from the natural beauty of the outside, or whatever. Plenty of chairs and towels and the pool itself is very clean and not in need of repair. Food: We really enjoyed The Banyan Tree. It was my husband's favorite restaurant (and we ate at several nice restaurants). I'd skip room service as it wasn't all that great. The sushi bar was good, however.... Price: Yes, this place is very expensive! On top just being Maui itself, you *are* staying at the Ritz Carlton. It's *going* to be expensive. I'm surprised when people complain about the cost of things here.....I assumed it was a given. Golf: Beautiful views and immaculate care. My husband really enjoyed himself. Spa: This was pretty small, so I was pretty much in and out. We had a couples' massage, which was excellent! All in all, we enjoyed our stay here. Bear in mind, we did *not* spend all of our time here....we ventured out most of the time. I would stay here again in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a pleasant experience”
Reviews.Author: TexasBostonian
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week-long trip to Maui to celebrate our 5th wedding anniversary. We chose to stay at the Ritz despite some of the negative reviews we saw on TripAdvisor and in a couple of guidebooks. Overall, the experience was good, but I have to admit that I was disappointed with some aspects of staying at the Ritz. First of all, our room DID smell musty, as other Trip Advisor travelers have noted. The common areas were beautiful, but if you looked closer, the carpets were frayed and things looked worn. I did see some housekeeping issues - like room service food left out in the hallway for way too long and some lack of service in the dining room (like getting coffee refills and minor things like that). On the positive side, the hotel sits on a beautiful piece of property. You do have to walk, or take a golf cart shuttle, to the beach, but it really isn't that far. The beach is beautiful and not overcrowded since there aren't many resorts in that area. The ironwood trees are beautiful, and we find the constant breeze to actuallly be refreshing in the hot July sun. We went down to the south of Maui, where the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea are, and let me tell you, it was HOT! The breezes at Kapalua were nice, indeed! Anyway, if you want hot, there is beautiful Kaanapali Beach, which is only ten minutes from the Ritz. I actually thought Kaanapali Beach was better than Wailea Beach. My husband and son had a ball snorkeling at Black Rock, which is right by the Sheraton Hotel on Kaanapali Beach. Anyway, back to the Ritz. Our breakfast was included in our package and was quite good. Lots of variety and quite tasty. The staff at the Ritz were always friendly and always willing to help out if you needed something. We attended a luau at the Ritz, which was pretty standard, I guess, but the food was good, and my husband and son had a great time. The Ritz Carlton signature facial was excellent. There were two great restaurants nearby that we visited - Vino and Sansei. Both are owned by two Japanese guys, and the food is great. Vino is located in the same building as the golf pro shop, but the food is excellent and the environment was nice, too. Sansei had excellent sushi but also had a great dinner menu, too. Both restaurants are accessible by the Ritz Carlton shuttle service and are just a couple of minutes away. We did not go to Banyan Tree and did not miss it one bit. Maui is a beautiful island. We had a wonderful time touring Haleakala, the road to Hana, and visiting its many beautiful beaches. The Ritz Carlton definitely had its issues, but overall, we enjoyed our vacation there. One word of caution, however. If you plan to do a lot of driving and sightseeing, the Ritz Carlton is way over on the upper northwest side of the island, so you will have to drive a lot to get to many of the attractions. This isn't too bad, but make sure you avoid the morning and evening rush hour traffic. Yes, there are traffic jams in Maui when all of the residents are trying to go to work, or go home from work. Also, when we arrived at the airport, the first thing we did was stop at the nearby Walmart to stock up on water, sunscreen, and snack items. This helped us a lot during our exploration of the island. Maui is beautiful. You will love it!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Barely-Glorified Marriott”
Reviews.Author: JohnTes
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 4 nights in May and was so excited to stay at the Ritz. My excitement didn't last too long. Though the check-in process was smooth and everyone was friendly, all I had to do was walk down the hallways for the disappointment to set in. The baseboards were scratched, the wallpaper was coming off, the upholstery on the benches were stained, the carpet was worn. Not what I would expect in a $500+/night hotel! Then I got to the room...the linens were MAYBE 200 thread count. The matresses were uncomfortable. The furniture was possibly stylish in the '80s. I was actually surprised that a TV that old had a remote control. The carpets were stained, the iron was a $10 model. I honestly felt like I was staying at a Marriott or something--except that Marriott hotels are usually near civilization. The Ritz, however, is far away from everything except golf courses. Even the beach is a walk. It rained most of our stay, but the pool and grounds did look quite nice. There was bocce, tennis courts and, of course, golf. Room service rates are insane (as expected), but there is a nice General Store just beyond the parking lot. Bottom line: stay elsewhere--even if you get a great rate--until they remodel and it becomes a TRUE 5-star property.

Reviews.Title: “Best massage ever!”
Reviews.Author: redfitgirl
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of staying at this resort last November. I found it to be stunningly beautiful and very relaxing. The staff was very friendly, always greeting you in the hallways with an "Aloha". The rooms were lovely and the bed was like heaven on earth. I slept like a baby. The traditional Hawaiian massage that I had at the resort spa was out of this world. I have never experienced another like it. It was well worth the cost. The only downside to this resort is that it is located in an area where there is a lot of wind and a frequent misty rain. The beach had signs daily that stated the ocean wasn't safe for swimming that day. We didn't mind - we just drove 15 minutes into Kaanapali and went to the beach there. Awesome snorkeling at the beach near the Westin. I loved the sound of the frogs chirping at night. It felt like paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: 2babies
Reviews.Content: It really disappoints me to see such negative reviews of this dream of a hotel.. I have stayed here three different times over the last six years and it is just heaven. The open air and Hawaiian breezes are so relaxing. The service is second to none and the breakfast buffet is some of the best food that I have ever eaten! The Banyan Tree Restaurant was an enjoyable and relaxing dining expereience, but I wasn't overly impressed with the food. The pool is very pretty but does get crowded. The water is a little on the cold side. The beach is farther away and there are some huge waves but it is still paradise. We usually go to Ka'anapali to visit the beach. When I am having a bad day or need to make myself relax, this hotel is what I picture to help calm myself. The rooms are so luxurious with marble showers and comfortable beds. The rich decor is plush and beautiful. All of the staff including the housekeeping, is so friendly and accomodating. If someone can complain about this location, I cannot see them being happy anywhere they stay because this hotel and island are truly paradise!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel- Some Insights”
Reviews.Author: abitofsun
Reviews.Content: We got married in Maui and stayed at the Ritz. It was truly unbelievable. Our room was amazing with top of the line sheets and pillows and a wonderful balcony view. We loved the pool and the service. We feel in love with the spirit of aloha at the Ritz. The hotel had fresh fruit, leis, and fruit punch on a daily basis, as well as water. The hotel is located at the north end of Maui which is windy and not as sunny. But the drive to close by beaches is only five minutes away, so after the hustle and bustle of the day, we would come back to our hotel and relax. We got married at Makena and was glad we didn't stay on the South end of Maui because of the tourist and overpriced hotels. The Ritz is lovely and classy. Our needs were met and more, and again, we really experienced the aloha spirit there. BTW, the best sushi place in Maui is right by the Ritz, it's called Sensei. We took our parents there for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “I will return...”
Reviews.Author: geppettoVancouver
Reviews.Content: My wife and I celebrated our tenth anniversary at the Ritz with a 6 night stay (July 1 to Juky 6) before moving on to Kehei. After reading other reviews, I was a little worried about what to expect. When all was said and done, I would have to say it was a good stay. The room (2503) was large, comfortable and clean. It was classified as a garden view, but I would say it would have been more appropriately called partial ocean view. The lanai was big enough to seat four comfortably. The bathroom was also quite nice. While we didnâ€™t spend much time in the room watching television, I was surprised to find a TV that looked as though it was 20 years old. The service was generally pretty good. When I initially booked the room (using the Internet) I had requested a King bed. When the confirmation email arrived (not booked directly through the Ritz) it stated that no King beds were available. Since this was our anniversary, I decided that I would try to secure a King bed through the hotel directly. One email resolved the issue. In addition, we were surprised by a bottle of sparkling wine on the second day of our visit!!!! I found the pool staff to be great. We didnâ€™t wait long for drinks, food, or towels. They were friendly and helpful. On a slightly negative note, there were a few issues that I thought could have been handled better. One day, after spending the entire day exploring the Island, we returned back to the room to find the door ajar. It was very obvious that the room door was left open. Given that this was at the end of the day and we had left early in the morning, it had to have been left open by hotel personnel. I was stunned by this rather huge lapse in security. I was further annoyed when I called the front desk to complain, only to be told that their â€œloss prevention managerâ€� (I think that is what they called the person) would look into it, but never received any word about this after the fact. Quite frankly, I expected a manager to call and apologize. We did spend a fair amount of time at the pool and billed a number of items to our room. I am a little anal, so each day I would check my charges for the previous day (using their television system). On three separate days I found charges that should not have been applied. First I found a valet charge that should have been included as part of our package. Then there was a charge for 14 Miller Lights (from the pool). The following day there was another $70 of other pool stuff charged to the account. In all three cases, the charges were immediately removed; however, I donâ€™t think I should need to check my account so closely EVERYDAY. In addition, I felt that given the ongoing nature of the problem, that a manager should have contacted us and apologized. We ordered room service on one evening and had very mixed feelings about the experience. I asked if we could eat on the lanai. When the food arrived the gentleman who delivered the food had everything needed for a romantic dinner on the lanai. He did a fantastic job setting up a table that looked as though it belonged in a fine restaurant. Unfortunately, the food was awful. I think part of the problem was that we ordered appetizers as well as entrees. In a regular restaurant they would come separately; however, because it was room service, they arrived together. By the time the appetizers were done the entrees were cold. Even the appetizers were not the greatest and they were warm. Since the food is so pricey, I would have thought they could take the added effort to deliver it in two stagesâ€¦ I know that is asking a lot, but given what we spent, I would expect that kind of service. Okay, enough complainingâ€¦ The hotel and grounds were beautiful. While there was no doubt that it was windy;however, I found the breeze to be refreshing when we were sitting poolside in the hot sun. During the six day stay we got sprinkled on twice, and it was only for a few minutes. I enjoyed the free coffee in the morning and the nightly entertainment was really great. Our package included the breakfast buffet in the terrace restaurant. The food and selection was great. Each day it was different in slight ways (different fruit selections and variations on eggs benni). We were served by Amy on our third day, and we requested her every day after. After our first day, she knew what we drank and even offered to toast our bread for us. She was awesome! This was my fourth trip to Hawaii this year. What struck me most about this stay was that at any time of day, I could go to the pool and find an empty lounger. On Oahu, it seems that if you want a poolside seat you need to wait in line at 7:30 in the morning. At the Ritz, you can relax, relax, relax. I will never tire of hearing â€œCertainly Mr. xxxxxxxx, it would be our pleasureâ€�. I have talked a lot about some negatives, but all the plusses far outweighed the negatives. Iâ€™d like to visit again!

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked the ritz carlton alot. It has a beautiful view of the ocean and great pools to swim in. But the bad thing is, it is very windy. I stayed there for 5 days and there was not one day that its was calm. Its a great hotel but always know that it is most likely to be windy.

Reviews.Title: “can't control nature”
Reviews.Author: djgordon
Reviews.Content: this is a great hotel,,,well run,,and consistent. I have stayed about six times over the last five years,,and the service keeps getting better,,,its a well oiled machine, which is particularly remarkable given the hotels size. The major problem is the wind and weather, Its always windy, which can be nice, since it keeps things a bit cooler,,but it is often rainy and overcast when then sun is blazing a few miles away. The comments about the need for remodeling may have more to do with the somewhat dated (but clean and luxurioius) decor,,,its old style Ritz Carlton, and those who have stayed at the South Beach or recently renovated Laguna Niguel Ritz will know what I mean. Don't get me wrong, this is a great hotel,,,,and to make it even better, there is a new chef at Banyan Tree who is so amazing we went back for a second night,,,, If you can handle a little wind and a few sprinkles, stay there,,,,if not, you mgiht seek a warmer part of the island.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous to go to this resort after reading trip advisor. I have come to the conclusion that some people have nothing better to do then complain. Trust me this resort is amazing. The moment we stepped into the lobby I was greated (by name) with an aloha and a beautiful lei. I still don't know how they knew my name, because I had not told them. It took me all but a minute to check in. The hotel and grounds are just beautiful with breathtaking views of the Pacific and the 3 tiered pool. The whole staff was wonderful. If you needed something they always responded with my pleasure. The food was delicious. You must eat in the Banyon Tree. There is also another restaurant off grounds The Plantation House, overlooking a golf course and the ocean. The food was great. If you can get the breakfast package at the ritz. We had a huge buffet breakfast every morning. The rooms are very clean and well maintained by the staff. The best part about this resort is that it is in an area where there are no other resorts. The other areas of Maui, while beautiful, are hotel after hotel. We went to visit the Four Seasons. The hotel is beautiful, but the pool area is small and seemed very crowded, and again it has other hotels around it so the grounds are also much smaller then the Ritz. I liked the Ritz much better. I have one suggestion if you are planning to stay here don't go in the winter it is the rainy side of the Island. The summer and fall are the best we had no rain at all. As you can tell I loved this resort and hope to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Save Your Money on better location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua in April for our teens' spring break. We were told that it was a 5 star hotel on the best part of the island with lots to do! The hair salon was tiny and dirty with a staff that wasn't the best trained to say the least! (The stylist burned me 3 times with the flat iron!) I dared not try the spa after the salon experience! We stayed in a waterfront suite and because our flight out wasn't until 10:00 p.m., we were told by our travel agent that they would gladly let us stay in our room until late. Well, we even offered to pay to stay in our room later on checkout day and was told "absolutely not". (We stayed in most expensive room on site, too!) Don't waste your money here! This hotel sits on windy, rainy side of island with nothing to do except play golf! And, when the surf is high, which is pretty much all of the time, the beach staff will refuse to rent surfboards, etc. to you! How absurd! Want to go biking? Nope! The bicycles are offered at the base of a very large hill and only offered rental in the mornings! Not even the best people in shape could forge that hill! Front desk service stinks, too! If you want a 5 star experience, I'd suggest Oahu for lots to do and maybe try another quality hotel with a better spa...plus you'll get more sunshine on Oahu and less rain! If you must do Maui, Lahaina town is the only place to go! However, we wish we'd have just gone to California again instead. Many places in California look like Hawaii with the cliffs and surf and your wallet will thank you for the difference in costs. Overall, we would Not travel to Hawaii again.

Reviews.Title: “Dead Bird in the Pool”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While having a nice relaxing swim in the pool, a dead bird washed up on my wife's shoulder. She screamed in horror and all the staff could do was offer us a cup and ask us to fish it out for them. Not exactly what I expected from the Ritz. I thought they might approach us later and offer us a complimentary drink or some other gratuity, but nothing. Overall, we were very disappointed with the quality of the room, it was tired to say the least, and needed an overhaul. The sheets were worn and the bed had indentations where people had slept. Not to mention the cabinet door in the bathroom that was falling off the hinges. Not what you see in the brochure.

Reviews.Title: “Eight days in Paradise...............”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews on this site, my wife and I decided that based upon the outstanding overall reputation of the Ritz Carlton, we would give it a shot for our 10th Anniversary celebration. Rooms: We found the room to be very spacious yet probably in need of some what of an updated makeover. Grounds: The resort grounds were impeccable. Very nicely laid out and spacious with probably one of the most if not the most beautiful private beaches we have ever seen. Service: The service was second to none. We found the staff to be extremely courteous and helpful. Exactly what you would expect from the Ritz. Pool: Absolutely beautiful! never really crowded with plenty of room for all. Fitness Room: used it every day. Found it well kept with plenty of work out options. All equipment was very modern. Cost: The most money I've ever paid for food and drink. Probably the biggest draw back to our stay. Opted to go into town for more reasonable fare. Weather: Perfect! Lots of sun with some moderate breeze mixed in made it ideal. Golf: What's not to like! Summary: One of the best vacations ever! I would highly recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton Kapalua - the objective review”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I recently stayed at the Ritz in Maui, despite the mixed reviews. I wanted to give a relatively objective review, addressing a number of the concerns raised by the negative reviews. Before I do that, a little about the stay, so that you know where I am coming from. I traveled to the Ritz to celebrate my engagement with my fiancÃ© in June 2006. I am well traveled and in my late 20â€™s. Room quality â€“ The hotel rooms do appear to need some kind of renovation. With that said, this has been acknowledged by management, as the hotel will undergo a major renovation at the end of this year. Despite that, the rooms were still comfortable. We did notice a smell in the room, but realized that it went away once the A/C was turned on. We did not ask for a change, and smell was not noticed after the first hour in the room. Hotel layout â€“ The beach is down the hill, and quite a walk. The reason for this is due to the hotel being moved up the hill to leave ancient burial grounds intact. This hill is not huge, but gets annoying after the first couple of trips. Again, the management realizes the issue and provides a shuttle bus free of charge. Service quality â€“ drink services took some time at a number of locations. Frankly, I am not sure why this is, other than the pool and beach areas were relatively crowded. When speaking with local friends, this is not an issue with the Ritz, but an issue of the cost of living making finding good help an issue with all the hotels. Nonetheless, there was a number of times where we felts that certain staff members went above an beyond the call and lived up to the Ritz reputation. Weather â€“ People have complained about the wind. Indeed there were 20 to 30 mph winds throughout the resort. I am not sure what the other resorts were like, but no matter where we were on the island, we experienced similar winds, leading us to believe that this is an island phenomenon rather than poor location. With that said, given the heat of the sun, the wind was a nice touch cooling us down. Cost â€“ Food costs are astronomical â€“ no other way to say this. However, the $30 for breakfast is typical at all the resorts on Maui. This is not the Ritz ripping you off, but the cost to ship most ingredients from the mainland to Maui. We went to a number of â€˜localâ€™ restaurants and paid similar prices to the Ritz. Conclusion â€“ People complain that the hotel may be overrated, and they are entitled to their opinion. I agree that this may not be the best place for families, as a number of the activities are geared towards adults. With that said, we had a wonderful time. I would not have a problem going back to this resort and paying the prices that they ask. Lastly, and I need to stress this part â€“ Maui is a great place. It have a number of fantastic things to do, and while sitting by the pool/beach is nice, I seriously recommend only spending one to two days at the resort and the rest of the time exploring the island.

Reviews.Title: “We Love the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: gpa59
Reviews.Content: The more recent post of the Ritz was less than positive. I wanted to give our take on our stay last week. We just returned home from our second stay at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. We were there a year ago with my parents and it was a great trip, so we hoped lightening would strike twice. It did! We were greeted warmly by the staff and we were shown directly to our room. (We arrived mid-week, so maybe the person who says it took 45 minutes arrived on a busier day?) We stayed on the same floor my parents were on last year, so I know the rooms have been updated. (We checked our pictures from last year!) Different color schemes in the carpets, drapes, and bedding. The room was quite comfortable and we were told we had a partial ocean view. It was a pretty "full view" by me! We had a nice view of the bay from the chairs on our lanai. This year I booked us the bed and breakfast package. We were glad we did, but we did over indulge the breakfast buffet! I was surprised that someone said he wished for fresh pineapple. There was plenty of it on the buffet and even papaya and melons, too. The waitstaff was very friendly and made us feel welcome, in fact, they even remembered our names each morning! There really wasn't any incentive for them to be so nice, our package meant that the tip was already included, so they could have treated us indifferently knowing we were on the "package". We also splurged and had dinner in the Terrace Restaurant one night and we thought our steaks were great! The weather in Kapalua is different from even Kaanapali, which is just a short drive to the south. If you want to bake in a hot sun, then don't stay in this area. We like the cooler breezes up that way and we don't worry about a little drizzly rain. It rained two mornings, but it was gone by 10:00 and didn't interfere with ourday at all. The fitness center was really nice, we were sorry we hadn't checked it out in our previous visit, but we will be sure to use it again in the future. Massages and other spa treatments were pricey, but all we wanted was to use the gym, and that was complimentary. (On the second leg of our trip on a different island in a different hotel we had to pay to use the fitness center) The beach area is nice, and I don't think it's a mile walk, but it is a good downhill trail to get there. It took us only five minutes to walk it. And, if you're tired and not willing to face the uphill walk when you're ready to head back to the room, there is a shuttle ride on a golf cart you can use, free of charge! The beach is public and state maintained, but it's secluded, so it's pretty much just the Ritz patrons. Yes, the crowd is more mature than other hotels, so if you're looking for other young couples or singles to hook up with, don't stay here. We were annoyed that there was a family with loud children who were allowed to run amok in the dining room at breakfast. At least it was just one group! Personally, I think if your children don't have Ritz Carlton manners yet, then please stay at another hotel! Give me a quieter "mature" crowd, to each his own.... (and I mean no disrespect to families. We saw many familiies on our trip with very well-behaved children. It's the ones who are out of control that one remembers) Despite the great stay, I will make a couple of complaints. First, I agree that poolside and beach area service was gone this year. I don't know if they were understaffed or if they didn't hire enough people to offer bar/snack service this season. And, the lounge area is nice, but their bar menu is very limited if you don't like sushi. We had a big lunch while out touring one day and hoped for appetizers and a cocktail that evening. Since we didn't like the choices on the bar menu we ended up driving down to Kahana and got a light dinner there. Also, the staff was very helpful, but they need be sure that they keep up with daily schedules and changes in policy. We were told the first night that the Beach House Grill was open for dinner, only walk down there and find that it was closed due to the Luau. Then, were told that our Bed and Breakfast package was good for room service orders and a la carte items, which wasn't true. If you book that package you need to eat at the Terrace Restaurant and order the buffet. (Which was very good!). I spoke to the manager about that and she apologized telling us that the package used to be more open ended and she would be sure that employees are reminded of that change. All things considered, the Ritz is our hotel of choice. We love the quiet, secluded area. We love the cooler weather (hence more Cook Island Pines than palms) and the more mautre crowd. We visited Kaanapali Beach one evening only to find it wall-to-wall people. We were glad to get back to our quiet hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this Property IF you know what 5 star service means”
Reviews.Author: trgvideo
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to the Ritz-Carlton for our honeymoon. Our greeting was less than perfect and it took us 45 minutes to get to our room. When we got to the room, we were greeted to a nice hotel room. Although the room was a little plain, it was fine. I was surprised they left us two chocolate covered strawberries on our honeymoon arrival. I would expect the Maui Ritz to have FRESH pineapple (at least a few chunks) every morning. I get fresh fruit at many other hotels I stay at for business. The real dark spot is the pool. The service was horrible and unacceptable. It is staffed by a bunch of inept white college students or mainland expatriots. No one EVER offered to set up our chaise chair. When I was at a Raddison in Aruba, you couldn't set foot near the pool before the guy comes to you finding the BEST chair in the house along with setting your towels on the chair. The Ritz never offered this service. Speaking of service, it was like pulling teeth to get a cocktail pool side. Finally, my wife and I began bringing our own hooch and ice and I was a better bartender anyway. (and yes I would share with you!) Looking for late night (after 9pm) apps or snacks? Not going to happen at this Ritz. Go to the store and be sure to have snacks in your room and enjoy the balcony with your sgnificant other and make your own happy hour! The grounds and campus was beautiful. Valet was fine too. Surrounding restaurants (not Ritz) were fantasic. Bottom line... if you know what good service is and you have either stayed at another Ritz or maybe even Mandarin Oriental or Raffles hotel, you will will be disappointed. Keep in mind, a disappointing stay at the Maui Ritz is better than a day in the office! Mahalo!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful honeymoon for a picky traveler”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I selected the Ritz Kapalua for our honeymoon over four years ago...we still long for those days now that we have a 2 year old! Anyway...we were reviewing hotels for another trip to another location and I just happened to see some of the reviews here...I was dumbfounded so felt like I should put in my two cents! (of course if you want to listen to a guy who spells cemetary..semetary..that is your perogative!) Our only complaint was the surly lady at the Kapula airport desk who gave my husband a hard time when we could not locate his golf clubs upon arrival. Everything having to do with the Ritz was top notch for us. When we checked in we put on our thick comfy Ritz Carlton robes, called room service and they brought everything out to our lanai overlooking the Pacific Ocean. We had the aboslute best cheesburgers with our complimentary bottle of champagne while we toasted our good fortune. We drifted to sleep every night to the sound of the waves...not loud crashing waves but soft, calming waves (because the hotel is set back off the ocean it is very peaceful). We enjoyed huge (included) breakfasts every morning on the verandah overlooking the pools, gardens and ocean..read the paper and planned our lazy days. There was never a need for lunch because breakfasts were so good and so filling. We loved the waterfalls at the pools, the little shaded cabanas (we're fair skinned), having a beer at the beachside hut, listening to the live music every night on the lobby bar verandah while the sun went down. We met very nice couples, we went in to Lahaina for dinner many nights and we went down to Wailea one day because everyone had warned us that it would rain on our honeymoon in Kapalua..we wanted to see what we may have missed. All I can say is that to us Wailea felt too commercialized and we were grateful to head back north to the Ritz after that day...I am big on cleanliness and the way a hotel looks and smells...aesthetics are very important to me and I won't relax and have fun if my surroundings are ugly or dirty. To me the Grand Wailea seemed dingy and dirty and dated and I didn't feel I missed a thing! Oh and it didn't rain on us at all. I am VERY picky (I have cruised on The Morrings yachts and have traveled internationally (for pleasure and for business) and stayed in some of the nicest places you can in large metro areas. I loved the Ritz. My husband says it is one of the nicest places he's been, too. I guess if you are looking for an exciting vacation full of action, maybe this isn't the place..but if you want to relax in a luxurious and calming place this would be a great place to be. We can't wait to go back when our daughter is older!

Reviews.Title: “Gives a whole new meaning to shabby chic.”
Reviews.Author: elisaruland
Reviews.Content: Our travel agent arranged our stay at the Ritz Kapalua for 5 nights. After reading some of the reviews I was apprehensive but kept an open mind. The bad news is that I could not wait to get out of there. Even our kids, age 11 and 13, seemed unhappy. The furnishings in both of our rooms were threadbare. The sunlight poured in through dozens of frayed holes in the curtains every morning and the rooms really did smell bad. It sounds like I'm being picky, but it was kind of depressing, especially since we had been looking so forward to this vacation. Quite honestly, I think it is a disgrace for a hotel chain of this caliber to let the condition of their property get so run down. It's almost bizarre. I knew that to ask to change rooms was pointless, as we were on the club level and the other rooms looked as threadbare. The beach is beautiful, but it is a hike. It didn't bother us at first, since we love to excercise, but the walking up and down the hill did get old. There are lounge chairs available above the beach, but no beach chairs on the beach. When we're on such a great beach, I want to be by the ocean, so we ended up lying on little beach towels like we did in high school. We had just come from a 4 night stay at the Four Seasons on the Big Island, which I admit, was a tough act to follow. It is my idea of the perfect spot to vacation in Hawaii. The dining was okay at the Ritz but not great. I guess because of the wind, they've installed giant sheets of plexiglass in the dining areas which took all the natural feel away. Also kind of depressing. My one last negative thought is about the number of other guests who sat around smoking and yakking loudly on their cell phones. It really is hard to ignore. At our previous hotels cell phone use was discouraged. Now for something positive. The service was excellent. The staff really did bend over backward to be pleasant and accomodating. It is probably the only thing that is keeping the resort afloat until they do some renovations. "The weather was an absolutely perfect sunny 80 degrees the entire time we were there. We didn't experience the dreaded wind problem. Also, there is snorkling nearby that is excellent. My advice if you are thinking of staying at this resort is: DON'T DO IT!! The island experience is simply too beautiful to be tarnished by bad accomodations at a supposedly luxury resort. I honestly don't think I'll ever feel the same way about a Rtiz-Carlton again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Please ignore the negative reviews about the Ritz. We just returned from a week long vacation at the Ritz and it was fabulous. I am so pleased with our choice and it was the perfect place to spend our honeymoon. The weather was wonderful and it only rained once (for about 10 minutes, at 7:30 a.m.). The beach is not far from the hotel at all, just a quick walk. The pool is gorgeous, peaceful, and the perfect place to relax. The pool was never over-crowded and it was nice to be away from screaming children and babies. If you are looking for a place to stay that is beautiful, carefree, relaxing and serene, I highly recommend the Ritz. The service was wonderful and everyone treated us like we were there most important guests. I can't wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Love Hawaii but not Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 5 days in Kapalua after spending 5 at the Grand Hyatt in Kauai. We absolutely LOVED Kauai and the Hyatt so maybe that biased our opinion of the Ritz. Fortunately we stayed using Marriot points because if we had paid out of pocket, we would have been very disappointed. Basically, the hotel is beautiful and the staff wonderful but the hotel is located far from the beach with an ancient cemetary between the hotel and the ocean. They have golf cart shuttles to the ocean for those that don't want to walk. The pool was FREEZING. My 19 month old cried when I brought him in and he loves the water! West Maui just doesn't have that beauty that Kauai or Hana in Maui has. It's very commercialized and you actually drive past a sewer treatment facility to get up to the Kapalua/Kannapali area and you can definately smell it! Kapalua is also windy and about 10 degrees cooler than Kannapali which is just 10 minutes south. If you have your heart set on Maui, we recommend the Wailea area (less windy) with lots of amazing restaurants (Ferraro's,etc). We've stayed at the Four Seasons and had a wonderful time there. If you're looking for a remote Hawaii getaway, we recommend Hotel Hana Maui in Hana or the Hyatt in Kauai. We wouldn't return here. It's too long a flight for us for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz - quiet and romantic”
Reviews.Author: guthrie16
Reviews.Content: I apologize for the late review of the hotel, but I finally have a few free moments to add my opinion of the resort. My husband and I chose the Ritz for our wedding and honeymoon in July of 2005 and don't regret our decision one bit! Upon arrival we were upgraded to an ocean veiw room (we paid about 250/night so it was quite a deal!) We had a lovely wedding coordinator who made all of the wedding arrangements prior to our arrival (Bethany Wood) and once we were married at the beautiful chapel on the grounds our honeymoon began. We stayed for 10days and it was perfect! We toured other resorts on the island, ie: Four Seasons, Grand Wailea, the Fairmount) and feel we made the perfect choice. I am not sure if it depends on the time of year but we had perfect weather. While at the other resorts in Wailea we were so hot! It appeared that people were on top of you whereever you went. The pools seemed crowded and loud! Not our idea of a perfect honeymoon, but as we drove towards Kapalua the weather became about 10 degrees cooler, the tradewinds picked up, and we felt like we were back in paradise. The pool area is large and serene. The beach is a short walk from the pool, but there is a shuttle to take you down if you feel you can't walk a couple of hundred yards (the reason for that is there are ancient burial grounds from which the hotel is set back). The shops at Kapalua are really nothing exciting but there is an excellent sushi place called Sensai that we still talk about! The spa at the Ritz is nice, the rooms a little ordinary, but I know that the resort is under going a major renovation so it should only get better!

Reviews.Title: “Asolute bore!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hyastan
Reviews.Content: We had a choice to stay at the Ritz or Westin, and we thought Wesin looked more fun so we stayed there. But we wanted to see if we missed anything at the Ritz, and wend up there to check it out. I can not tell you how extatic I was that we stayed at the sunny and fun Westin. First of all, it was drizzling up by the Ritz, it was foggy, almost no palm trees, instead they had pines everywhere. Pines? Then it looked like you had to walk a whole mile to the beach. There was only one pool and it was nothing spectacular. I guess if you're a golfer you can go there, there was a big golf course there, but I personally could care less what it was and how good it was. I don't fly 9 hours in a plane to do sports. Also, everyone int he hotel was, how can I say it nice, older... I dont have kids and do not particularly enjoy their screaming everywhere, but the Ritz was so quiet, it was like visiting a semetary. Not to compare with fun and upbeat yet luxury Ritz Carlton at Naples, FL, where we stayed some while ago. I would not go to the Ritz in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Very cold and windy, NO SUN to be found”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If your idea of a vacation is spent warm and at the beach/pool this is NOT the hotel for you. This hotel well north of the more protected hotels in Kaanapili and Wailea. We had a great few days in Wailea and witnessed a 14 degree tempature drop in the 30 miles drive to the Ritz. Also, this hotel is windy not in a gentle breeze kind of way but more like a small hurricane. This hotel is located in Kapalua and is a good drive from the closest entertainment which you will want if you plan on seeing the sun or being warm. I have no diea why the Ritz would have chosen this locaiton for a beach resort. My wife and I tried to go back to the Grand Waliea (best hotel in Maui) but they were sold out. Avoid this hotel if you want to enjoy any outdoor activites.

Reviews.Title: “THIS is a Ritz-Carlton?!?”
Reviews.Author: carns55
Reviews.Content: Boring, overpriced, and stuffy. Don't visit this hotel unless you are over age 55. It is not for any younger crowd, definitely not a hotel for children. The breakfast menu had a good selection, but way too overpriced. Rooms were small for the price..........I guess you would pay big $$ just to have a cot in this place. The spa was a high point of the visit, but I can stay in Denver and go to a luxurious spa. Maybe I should have.............oh well. I would also advise against going to Kapalua during the fall and early winter. It was rainy and drizzling everyday, had to jump in the rental car and go to Lahaina just to catch some sunshine. Next time, I will stay in Lahaina or Wailea on the other side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Kapalua is top shelf!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Luther48201
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I just returned from a 5 night, 6 day stay at the Ritz Kapalua. Our stay was excellent and we highly reccommend this resort. First, stay in the club level if you can afford it. It's worth the additional price, as you get a free continental breakfast every morning, plus 4 more food presentations daily and free drinks (including bottled water) at all times. If you are disciplined, this is a great way to save money. The food at the hotel is very good, but like all resorts (and not just the Ritz - the food is more expensive at the Hyatt where we spent 2 nights) it is expensive. Furthermore, the Ritz provides you with a personal concierge with a club level room. The folks that helped us (Kimberly, Kong, Leslie, and Erin) were fabulous. They were so helpful, so friendly, and really helped make a great trip all the more special. They made (and cancelled) reservations for us, gave us great activity reccomendations, and were all around a pleasure to visit with. The Ritz should be aware of their fabulous contributions. As for service generally, we also found this to be very good. After being "lei-d" upon our arrival at the resort, we were checked in and escorted to our room. Whenever we needed anything, somebody was there to help us out with a smile. Otherwise, we were left to ourselves. We did overhear a few other people complaining about slow service at times, but we did not personally experience this. Of course, people have different expectations of what first class service really is and there are complainers in every bunch. Other items. We had a basic room, which was very nice. Our only disappointment was that we did not have a soaking tub. Otherwise, we enjoyed the room very much and the private lanai offered a great view of both the pool and the ocean (see pictures). My fiance wishes we got a suite so that she could watch tv during those times that my work intruded on our vacation, but c'est la vie. The beach is not that far - as other reviews would have you believe. It's a five minute walk downhill. The Ritz also offers cart service around the property, but seriously. If this is a problem you need to lose some weight and get on a treadmill. The beach itself is beautiful. Although all beaches in Hawaii are public by law, the Ritz's beach has a very private and intimate feel to it. The sand is soft like sugar and the water is both warm and rock-free (hardly a given at the various beach resorts we've stayed at around the world). We had a great time boogie-boarding as well as just relaxing and soaking in the sun and the beautiful pacific ocean. The pool is awesome. It is actually three pools, each lower than the next and connected by a waterfall. It is a very relaxing atmosphere, not like some other resorts where the pool is "a scene." If you want to relax, soak in some sun, swim, read a book, etc., the Ritz' pool is perfect. If you want to see and be seen, try someplace else. Finally, if you are a golfer, the Plantation course is a must-play. The course is in great condition, the service is fabulous, and the views are amazing. The wind blows hard here, however, so pratice your knock-down shots. Also, make sure you eat dinner at the restaraunt in the clubhouse. This is not some random golfcourse bar. The food - and the fish in particular - is the best seafood we had on Maui. Try either the Plantation Oscar or the Fish Special. Overall, this is a great property. For those looking for a relaxing, luxurious vacation, the Ritz Kapalua is a can't miss. We loved it and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “No Glitz at the Ritz Maui”
Reviews.Author: BizTravelerTX
Reviews.Content: The glitz and customer service is missing at the Ritz.. We stayed at this hotel 5 years ago and loved the service and facilities. However, we just finished a 4 night stay and were less than impressed This time the pool staff did not want to go out of their way to help or assist, tiles were missing in the hot tub and and the pool bar closed an hour early and no one knew why...When I asked for a beverage they said to go inside..... Next time we will sure try a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton is still as classy as ever”
Reviews.Author: eightydegrees
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ritz many times. It is the place on the islands where I feel tranformed from a wiki-wiki person (hurry hurry) to a serene and peaceful person. We arrived at the Ritz on March 27th for five nights. The bell staff is the best. They are always smiling and will answer any questions they can. Check in was flawless. The front desk staff is very cordial and got us checked in quickly. We were upgraded to an ocean front suite. We used to walk by these on previous visits and say that one day we will stay in one. Our wish came true. It was enourmous! As we walked in through the foyer, there was a small hallway with bathroom. It had a shower, water closet and a vanity. We walked through our huge livingroom and into our bedroom with another full bathroom. It is all marble and has seperate shower and tub. We also had two huge lanai's. We were in heaven. The next thing we know there is a knock at the door and they delivered a nice bottle of wine with cheese and crackers. A little while later there was another knock at the door and they had sent up some kukui nut lei's with a book about Hawaii. I have the lei's around my bedroom lampshade. I think it was four times all together that they sent up goodies to us. Later in the week we met a woman named Joy who is the guest relations manager. What a pleasure it was talking to her. She even asked us for our preferences on certain things. Before we know it she had sent up a wonderful bottle of chardonnay to us. It felt like christmas. They know that we love the resort's mascot. She's a tiger cat named Carly. They took a picture of Carly with a lei around her neck, put it in a card and wrote a note from Carly that she was glad we were back. I will always treasure that picture. We like to get the Maui News when we are on the islands but the hotels are now delivering USA Today. I asked if I could get the Maui news. Even though they are a rare commodity at the hotels, the bell staff delivered one to our door every morning. What else could one ask for. This experience was sheer bliss. Thank you so much Phyllis and Joy. We mostly ate in room because it was raining so hard the whole time we were there. (all the islands had that freaky weather) We had in room breakfast included in our package, which we savored. We hate buffets! I eat like a bird so they are really a waste for me and my husband loves his eggs benedict, which you can't get at a buffet. We ate once at Banyan Tree and I have to honestly say that we don't care for the new chef's creations. It has always been our favorite restaurant but we left there (Banyan Tree) feeling deflated. We want the Austrailian chef back. I can still taste his food. yum. Room service was impeccable. They always brought up everything we ordered and it was nice and warm. They were pleasant and always timely. The food is absolutely delicious. We ventured down to Lahaina a few times because we had to go to Dan's Greenhouse to see a Palm Cockatoo named Prince Ele Ele. We used to be so afraid of him. He's rather ominous looking but he's as friendly as can be. He hopped right on our arms and kept wanting us to pat him. It was awesome. These birds are rare, so it's a hightlight for us to go see Price each time we go back. Imagine being in Hawaii and the highlight of your day is going to a pet store to see a bird? That's me! The weather was horrendous. I have never seen so much rain in my life. Kapalua can be rainy, but all the islands were going through the same thing. We didn't get to use the pool once. We had a couple of hours of sun one day and made a beeline to the chairs down by the beach. Actually these storms washed out the entrance to the beach so you would have to walk way around to get down there. We were just as happy to sit on the chairs as long as we had some sun. The clouds started to roll in so we took a ride down to Lahaina to Mr. Wine. If you want great wine go see them. We love Kongsgarad and Mer Soleil charddonay and they usually carry it. You name it, they have it. We stoped by all the shops and also went to see Prince again. The rain was so bad there was not a whole lot we could go and see or do so we went back to the Ritz and to our cavernous suite. The resort is doing a $40 million renovation starting next year. We can't wait to see how they decorate it. It was a wonderful stay. I am really glad we stayed on the days we did because shortly after we went to another part of the island I became very sick and had to go to the urgent care center. I am still recovering. At least I wasn't ill for my Ritz stay.l

Reviews.Title: “Nice but has Key Drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: UhuBayArea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a seven-night stay here. Overall, I think it is a nice resort with a few key drawbacks. Pluses: As mentioned by other reviewers, the service is excellent - probably the best I've experienced at hotels/resorts of this caliber. Almost everone from management to housekeeping to the bellhops says "Good morning" or "Aloha." Staff in the lobby even walk up to me to greet me and ask if they can help me even after several days into my stay. We had a few inconveniences, that were addressed satisfactorally (see below) along with $100 in credit for each complaint we had. The food is very good - not cheap of course- especially the breakfast buffet for $26 which offers high quality and a nice selection. The location is relatively secluded - ideal if you want to get away from a more congested scene like Kaanapali. MInuses: The hotel is located on a bluff in a windy location. The resort is shaped like a"U" with the open part facing the ocean, which creates a wind tunnel effect through the pool area in the center of the "U." When I stayed there, trade winds were predicted to be 15-20 mph throughout the island, however at the Ritz poolside,winds were easily 25-35 mph - strong enough to make laying around the pool unpleasant. The Ritz seems to address this by a 6 foot plexiglass wall for several of the reclining sun chairs which seem to offer very little actual shelter. For this reason, we cut short our stay by 3 nights and moved to the Grand Wailea, a warmer and less windy location. Secondly, the room we stayed in was in need of repair/renovation - the carpet was older and musty smelling. I didn't feel comfortable, having my 13 month old daughter crawl on it. Also, the door frame was cracked and the TV was old (with no convenient AV jacks in front of the TV which I use to review my photos and videos recorded for the day). Thirdly, I noticed several ants in my room, which I complained about on my first day. Apparently the ants weren't exterminated promptly and my baby girl suffered about a dozen ant bites. Another important consideration is that the three pools are all 3.5 feet deep with no deep areas for diving nor any slides or other extra features. The pool was not heated as well, making it less inviting for my baby girl to get comfortable in. Also, the closest beach is about a 5-10 min walk down hill but the waves break a bit rough - not ideal for snorkeling. Also I paid extra for a ocean view room which turned out to feature a partial view of ocean if I were standing on the deck. I paid roughly half the full price since I was part of a convention. At a reduced price I think I got a fair deal, but would definitely not recommend this place at full price.

Reviews.Title: “better choices for your money”
Reviews.Author: travelduo33
Reviews.Content: Let me start with the good news. The service at the Ritz was excellent. I felt like every time I came back to my room the dirty towels had been replaced. (It's the small things, you know). The food is excellent though pricey. The grounds are beautiful. You are between two of the nicest beaches on Maui, Kapulua Bay and D.T. Fleming. You're also in the best spot on the island for golf. The room is above average. The bathroom is very nice and the bed has soft sheets. Now for the bad news... It's a cloudier part of that area. Almost every day we would drive down toward Kaanapali and it would always be much sunnier just 10 minutes down the road. So even though the area is nice, I wanted some rays, so we would have to leave. Also, the pool is too cold and the hot tub is too hot. Basically, it's just not as nice as the Four Seasons or Grand Wailea. When I saw those resorts, I just went "wow, now this is where I want to be". Also, the Kaanapali beach area was awesome! I would definitely stay there too.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Linda-JamesM
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews, I thought I may have made a mistake reserving a room at this hotel. I did not have to be concerned. The Ritz Carlton Kapalua was everything I expected and more. We were upgraded to the club level which was wonderful. The staff in the Club Lounge was gracious and very accommodating. They always greeted us with a smile and asked if there was anything they could do for us. After our 6 days there in March 2006, we were sad to say goodbye. The room appropriately reflected the Hawaiian style and was very comfortable and spacious. Unfortunately the weather was less than ideal so we were unable to take advantage of the great pool but we had a wonderful view of the ocean and pool area from our lanai. We will be returning for the wonderful Ritz experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: sp1000
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I spent a few days at the Ritz and we were definitely treated like royalty. I would highly recommend the club level. You get 5 food presentations daily, better views of the pool and sea, excellent and attentive staff. Everyone tends to you - even the bell boy kept on handing us water bottles while we were waiting for the taxis to come pick us up. The pool area is also very relaxing and relatively quiet compared to the Hyatt (which we also stayed at). Even though we were rained in every day (only sporadically throughout the day), it was lessened by the fact that this place was just heavenly. If you want a trip where you don't even have to lift a finger, this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Slightly disappointing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Six months ago my wife and I put a deposit down on a wedding package at the Ritz. Needless to say we decided on eloping and saving $20k on a wedding. We notified the Ritz and they informed us that we would lose our deposit, I had given them a four month notice. OK $3000 lost. We decided we were still going to stay there and make it our honeymoon and have a great time. The staff informed us that our depostit would hold for a year and that we would still get some of the amenities that were included in our original wedding package. (3 nights free, 3 free breakfasts) Cool. I'm thankful that the breakfast were included because each breakfast for two that we ordered averaged $60. No kidding, $23 for an order of pancakes, $19 for a hamburger, $15 for shrimp cocktail, 3 pieces of shrimp. We got a discounted rate of $425 for an ocean view, somehow the tax and resort fee I blocked out of my head, $50 a day extra. After driving an hour to Mama's Fish House to once again experience a 300% mark up on food we entered back into the Ritz and walked by the ballroom and watched the band Train performing for a Banking convention. They invited us in to enjoy and that we did. Great time. The grounds were beautiful, the staff outstanding, the proximity to the golf courses I wanted to play was outstanding. It rained everyday, except for four hours of sun which we enjoyed at the pool. Valet was $15 a night for guests, we walked 1/4 mile to self park about 5 times.
