We booked a Lua for $179 at the Hyatt through our concierge. We showed up and they were going to perform in a ballroom. Who goes to a Lua in a ballroom? After explaining this to our concierge for 20 minutes she finally agreed to refund our money. But first had to speak to her supervisor. We visited the resorts on the other side of the island, Four Seasons, Kea Lani, Grand Wailea and came back a little disappointed at where we stayed for our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Just average by Hawaii standards”
Reviews.Author: Metsare1
Reviews.Content: Now understand, on Maui you have dozens of great resorts to choose from and this is NOT one of them for a variety of reasons. First and foremost is the location. Kapalua is the coldest, windiest, wettest resort location in western and southern maui. We stayed 4 nights in Ka'anapali 15 minutes south and never saw a cloud. The next 4 nights we stayed at the Ritz and never saw the sun (although we rented a car and spent each day at our former resort, the Maui Sheraton, a much better choice). The grounds are beautiful, but the same goes for every hotel on the island. The rooms, however, are NOT. The bathroom was great, but the sleeping area could have been a budget room at a cheap vegas motel (not joking, if you dropped me in there blindfolded and had me guess where I was, I would have said the Imperial Palace in Vegas). The hotel has a very victorian, stuffy feel which is not what you want from Hawaii. You can tell the paintings and chandeliers are expensive, but that is sad considering that you can barely see the ocean from the hotel. Morale of story: If this was not hawaii, it is a good hotel. But it is, and by Hawaii standards, it fails. For the amount of $$ you'll spend on a room here, there are MANY other better hotels to choose (Westin, Hyatt, Grand Wailea, etc, etc, etc.)

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful relaxing getaway.”
Reviews.Author: DBSnaples
Reviews.Content: I read some negative reviews last year on your site after booking the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua to celebrate our 10th Wedding Anniversary. Needless to say since we had already booked I was very leary of what to expect. I can absolutely say, with no hesitation, this was the best stay we had ever had at a resort. The grounds are absolutely beautiful. The service was above and beyond anything we could have imagined - right down to the complimentary bottle of champagne and chocolate covered strawberries for our special day. We had dinner one night at the Banyon Tree on grounds and it was wonderful. The only "negative" comment we could have is the pool water is cool - but hey we live in south Florida so we decided to wait and swim at home... Overall our stay was a complete 10 and then some...we chalked it up to some people will always find something to complain about.. none from us. Relaxing - calming - romantic - just what we wanted..

Reviews.Title: “Amazing resort!”
Reviews.Author: Alohababy
Reviews.Content: We returned 3 days ago from the most wonderful vacation at the Ritz in Kapalua. This was our second time staying at this resort within the past 3 1/2 years. We went back because we had such a wonderful experience the first time. We renewed our vows for our 25th Anniversary on Flemming beach on our first visit. It was magical! I don't understand any of the negative reviews that I have seen in the past. When we arrived it started immediately with valet by welcoming us back and using our names in the process. Next was the hostess standing in the open air lobby with her arms open welcoming us back and yes, using our names once again, stating that it is like coming home. Boy, did she hit the head on the nail. She escorted us to check in which took only a couple of minutes. Next to our delight they up-graded us to a club level. Our room was great, nothing out of place, dirty, or outdated. It was perfect from the minute we arrived to the minute we had to leave. The weather was beautiful, we stayed 7 days and only on the last day it was mostly cloudy but warm. Flemming beach was beautiful, the surf was great, not to rough, and the wind was pretty calm during our stay. The air temp was 83-86 degrees most days and mostly bright sunshine. Water temp. felt about 76 degrees. Kapalua Bay is just a great beach and we went quite a few times to snorkel and soak up the sun. Reiko Fukino still entertains in the lobby lounge some evenings and she is still great! I could not find one thing to complain about this entire week, oh what a week! We are going back next year for sure, for our 30th Anniversary. Best time of our lives in Kapalua! Magical Maui is an understatement.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Customer Service at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBum
Reviews.Content: My husband and I usually go to Maui once a year and we have always stayed up in the area of Kapalua. We have stayed at the Kapalua Ridge Villas several times with our boys as well as just by ourselves. We have also stayed at the Hyatt at Kanaapali. All of those were fun times and we were happy with the accommodations. However, in stayng at the Ritz for a week in October, I would have to say that we will definitely be doing that again! We wanted a quiet time just to ourselves and the Ritz provided all of that plus the excellent customer service. From the time of check-in, to our times laying out by the pool or by the beach, the staff were friendly and always greeted us. I was also impressed with how the coffee cart in the morning really made sure that they found some soy milk for my latte, since I don't drink milk! A short drive down is the Kapalua Bay where you can snorkle and we didn't mind the 3 minute drive there at all. The grounds of the Ritz are so beautiful and the surroundings with the golf courses really takes you away. If you like the hustle and bustle, this may not be the place for you since you can't just "walk" to lots of shops or eating places. It's more a time to relax and get away. The rooms are all well appointed and spacioius with all the great ammenities--not exrememly luxurious however. My only complaint is that the lanai eating place upstairs right off the lobby--our waitress was very slow and it took forever to get our food and by the time we got it, my husband's food was cold! But, you can't be perfect, right? I'm looking forward to going back there this October, that's for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Don't Believe the Hype”
Reviews.Author: MLMD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz in Kapalua for part of our honeymoon. I have to say we were very disappointed. The hotel itself and the grounds are beautiful, but we felt the service was very poor. The front desk staff made us feel like they thought they were better than us, when in actuality they should have been servicing us and making us feel like kings and queens, especially at the prices we were paying! The other guests also seemed to be pretty uppity and not at all friendly. The most annoying part of our stay was our inability to use the pool area because it is situated in some sort of wind tunnel. People lounging by the pool were often wrapped up in their big white Ritz-Carlton towels trying to keep from freezing to death from the onslaught of the deafening wind. We tried on several occasions to use the pool area, but everytime was the same. The beach, which was within walking distance, suffered the same problem of rough winds and, thus, rough currents. If you want to escape the winds you need to drive to the beaches further south on Maui, so I would recommend just staying at a hotel down there. With so many beautiful hotels and resorts to choose from in Hawaii, you'd be better off choosing a hotel that will provide you with better service.

Reviews.Title: “Beauty and the Aloha Spirit personified at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: gbcfb
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were fortunate enough to stay at the Ritz Carlton, Kapalua as part of a small (30 couples) incentive trip group in late February. I was leery of the resort due to the numerous negative reviews that are posted on this site. After my stay, I've got to report that my fears were unfounded. From the moment we stepped off the transport bus (or in my case my rental car) we were treated like royalty. The concierge and his staff arranged for a private check-in for our group. What a way to start a vacation/business trip - with yummy local treats and that gorgeous view of the blue ocean beyond. Our room was spacious and clean. IMHO was tastefully decorated in a subdued tropical motiff. The beds were so comfortable. Down comforters and mattress pads. Bliss on a bed! The partial ocean view from my lanai was just that. You could see the ocean with a little bit of neck craning. Our room overlooked the spacious lawn and tennis courts. In the distance you could see the beach area. A little bit of a walk but if it really was an issue you could call for the golf cart for a ride up the road. The room was kept clean throughout our stay. We had no issues with bugs or other vermin. Although one of our group members reported that the staff had left water in their ice bucket from the past guest and mold had started to grow. The cleaning staff was responsive to her and to us. Whatever we needed-we received in a timely manner. The one thing that was a little off - was the layout of the hotel. It took a little to get used to. To get to our room (1329 - executive suite) you had to walk down two "never ending" and at times stuffy hallways and take "the second" elevator down to the third floor. But again this was a minor issue in the scheme of things. Some members of our group experienced what I call "sticker shock". Most understood that Hawaii was expensive with Maui being the most expensive of all of the islands. Add to that the fact that we're at Ritz which adds at least 25% more to any bill. All we could think was "ouch"! There aren't many placed where I would consider paying $30 for a buffet breakfast and smile while doing it. But I'm on vacation, the food was good, the view was better - I just acknowledged that it's expensive and moved on. Not a gripe just a comment. Another minor problem for some - was the location. The Ritz is located in a "remote" area approximately 15 minutes from Kaanapali and Lahaina. Most of the group had nothing on the agenda except sunning by the pool and watching for whales on our lanais. The rest of us were forewarned and got cars so that we could explore the island. The remoteness is part of the attraction for me. The area is beautiful and quiet. If needed adventure I'd head off to Lahaina. My husband and I were lucky enough to have a couple of spa treatments. The spa itself is tucked away on the fourth floor the hotel. It is smaller than I expected. The "wait and relax" area seemed a little cramped and busy. Many people going in and out which made it hard to concentrate on relaxing. The treatments were good but expensive. Their saving grace was that they didn't push their spa goodies on us after we were done with our treatments. The last thing I usually want to hear is that my skin ----- and would be "vastly" improved if I used their $50 face creams and lotions. One thing that overcomes all of minor negatives is the Ritz' commitment to customer service. As I said before, they treated us like royalty. We weren't Joe Schmo's, we were Mr Schmo! Most of the people in my group experienced the same. Two examples of the kind of customer service provided. A couple in our group brought their 10-mos old son, they told me that each time they walked through the lobby, their son would receive a small gift - a small stuffed animal or a t-shirt. They really cater to the small keikis and were wonderful to this little boy. Another couple joined the Ritz sponsored "leisure walk" around the Kapalua resort. Unfortunately, the employee was new and basically checked all of the people in and then did her own power walk, leaving the 40-50-60 year olds huffing and puffing in her wake. The couple voiced their complaints with the concierge. All they wanted was something more than the "ok - so you didn't like the walk - what do you want me to do about it" response. They were impressed with the concierge's initial response. "We're sorry - she is new and will receive more training on customer service. Please accept my apologies". The Ritz staff called them later on that afternoon, again apologized, was given an update regarding the employee and get this - was give a complimentary massage for two". Why they couldn't add me to the list of walkers I don't know. Customer service is their forte' and it shows. You felt welcomed at this resort. You will never passed a staff member without hearing "aloha" or receiving a small smile or nod in acknowledgement. The resort itself was spectacular. Beautiful views from the lobby and throughout the resort. Although it isn't directly ocean-side, I have more respect for the Ritz for valuing the sacredness of the site to the Hawaiian people and building higher up the mountain. All in all it was a great week. I would not hesitate to stay at the Ritz again. By the way - the Feast at Lele, Skyline EcoAdventure's zip lines and Warren and Annabelle's are not to be missed. Mahalo for your time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort-lots of kids”
Reviews.Author: larkoolaw
Reviews.Content: The ritz is great- all the trappings of a great resort but with the feeling of being at someones very expensive and gracious home. Staff from start to finish was excellent and accomodating. We had a wonderful room ( partial view upgrade) and although not super stylish the rooms were well appointed with nice large balconies and nice bathrooms. Half way through our stay we had to request a room change due to the non-stop crying infant next to us. Although we moved and were equally happy with our room getting settled in for 8 days and then having to move is a tad aggravating- but oh well. What bothered me more is the fact that this hotel obviously caters to honeymooners or those like us with no kids looking for a relaxing trip or families with small children. They should be conscious when placing people in rooms that maybe the couple looking for peace and quiet may not want to be next to a family with a toddler and newborn. Every time we walked down the hall we saw numerous cribs-etc. Again- the staff took care of us but not until a whole night of a baby crying. Don't pay to valet- too easy to park yourself. Service at beachfront was not the best-we rented a palapa for the day and never could find someone to take our numerous drink orders- maybe they were short staffed that day. all in all- really pretty but definately isolated if you want to do more touristy activities- Hana- Oreo Gulch-etc. Make the hike to the waterfall at Oreo Gulch - really beautiful-and not crowded like the seven pools. Ritz location is much more wild and exotic compared with Four Seasons which could have been on a beach in Cancun.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is a great deal”
Reviews.Author: spurg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here december 2004 for a week in a club level room. Nice experience. we now call it the 'fat trip' since we gained so much weight during our stay (even though we swam and hiked every day). our room was on the top floor, very quiet with a great view. because you are a great distance away from the water, you will not hear the ocean. The room was probably about 500 square feet and very nice, although starting to feel dated then. (i believe they are refurbishing now). The club level costs a bit more, but you probably save money in the long run. food is free and alcohol is free. and you get a special key to the club level and other perks (like free breakfast buffet). if you drink and eat alot, book the club level. The grounds are huge, with ancient hawaiin burial grounds, dramatic golf courses and you will never feel pinched in the way you will at the four seasons wailea during high season. there is more wind here than wailea. less kids here than wailea. easier to get a tee time here than wailea. basically, less crowded than wialea. THE COVE: there is great snorkelling at a cove nearby. free shuttle from the hotel to the cove. free self-parking. also, you are closer to the maui blow hole which no one ever talks about. if you are at the maui ritz, check it out! the drive it a bit hairy, but worth it. The beach here is far from the main edifice, but really special. no one on it. deserted. but not the best for snorkelling - hey, go to the cove for snorkelling! Having stayed in wailea at 4 seasons and kea lani, i would recommed the ritz carlton to honeymooners or the more adventurous who still want to be pampered a bit. If you are a golfer, the rits is ideal, better than the makena and wailea experience. the driving range itself has an amazing vista, the course you have seen on TV during the PGA tournamant. Tiger was staying on the club level when we were there. Versus FS wailea or Kea Lani, i would certainly recommend the ritz at high season since wailea becomes packed with people. If you are a family and have young kids though, wailea may make more sense. You might want to book the Grand Wailea so they can have fun and learn to socialize on the water slide.

Reviews.Title: “Blown Away!”
Reviews.Author: js31401
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay at the Ritz Carlton - Kapalua after reading the reviews on this site, but the Four Seasons was completely booked so I decided to give it a try. I was upgraded to an Ocean View Club Floor room, and from check-in to the fond farewell, the service was World Class. I was personally escorted to my room and given a tour of the property by the Manager of Guest Services. The Club staff was the most friendly, professional and attentive I have encountered. There wasn't a cloud in the sky for 5 days and the temperature was between 75 and 82 - absolutely perfect! Although the hotel was 97% occupied, the pool was never crowded and I never felt that the public spaces were crowded. The room was elegantly appointed, although the television was a bit outdated (if you're going to Maui to watch television, you should consider staying home instead!) The bed was very comfortable and there was absolutely no "moldy" or "musty" smell anywhere in the property. Both the Club concierge and the hotel concierge were very helpful and quick to recommend off-property places to eat, that were suitable to the occasion, and reasonably priced. I would highly recomment this property, and I will definitely be back - Soon!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Ritz, but not much glitz”
Reviews.Author: lucyethel
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Ritz Carlton. Things we liked: The grounds are absolutely beautiful and very well maintained/manicured. Beautiful pools and 2 large jacuzzis on the property. There are 2 different towels available by the pool, one for you to dry off with and another for your lounge chair. The beach is a short hike down a hill past the Hawaiian burial site. Not too bad of a hike, but a little inconvenient. We had a ground floor room that had a small lanai with 2 charis and a table. The room was a good size with nice Hawaiian furniture and a mini fridge to keep our drinks cold. Didn't notice any weird smells. The bathroom was HUGE. There were 2 separate showers (one a stand up and the other with a tub), 2 sinks, and plenty of nice shampoos, conditioners, etc. 2 terrycloth robes and slippers were also provided in the room. Large closet also. The staff were friendly and upon arrival they give you a nice cold hand towel to cool off with and offer you a drink. My husband also lost his wedding ring during our stay by accidentally leaving it on the bed . When housekeeping came, the ring apparently got mixed in with the sheets. After a call to the front desk, they were able to find and return the ring to us the next day. There is a great little convience store located by the golf course before the Ritz entrance that had great food and was cheap. Things that could've been better: A couple of the jacuzzi tiles had come off and were not fixed. Not a big deal, but for a Ritz Carlton, we expected more attention to detail. The parking lot was kind of far from the hotel entrance, so if you have a lot of luggage and are not going to use the valet, I'd recommend dropping off the luggage first and then going to park your car. Otherwise you'll have to lug it all downhill to the hotel. Also, at night the parking lot gets kind of crowded so you may have a pretty far walk to your room and the parking lot is poorly lit. We had told the Ritz in advance that it was our anniversary, but nothing special or extra was provided as some other people had mentioned. Not that big of a deal, but it would've been nice. The location on Maui itself could be better. It's on the windy, side so often we would get dark clouds rolling in along with some brief showers. The Ritz is kind of far and secluded from a lot of other attractions in Maui such as Wailea, Haleakala, etc. It's about an hour drive from the airport. Lahaina and Whaler's Village were relatively close to the hotel. Probably about a 20 min drive. Overall it was a nice stay, but it was a definate splurge and we normally don't spend that much on a hotel room. So for the price I don't think we would stay there again just based on the location alone. I think we'll try somewhere more central. But if you're looking for a secluded get-away, the Ritz is a good place for it. You really feel like you're away from it all.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, They are all true.....”
Reviews.Author: Fredtraveler2
Reviews.Content: One benefit of coming back from vacation is always writing a review at Tripadvisor. Been to the Ritz,Kapalua property three times and yes we will go back if not yearly. Stayed for 10 days this time and just recharged while there. Yes the rooms need updating, yes the food is not all that good, and yes sometimes the service can be spotty. When we stayed at the Ritz, I was concerned to of all the current negative reviews as we have not been back in three years. We figured, you cannot go wrong with the Ritz so we chose to come back. Service was outstanding from the moment your car pulled up to the lei greeting at the front desk and down to your room. Since we have a one year old, I requested a room that is of garden view but lead directly to the pool. The first room provided did not have immediate access. Requested another room and the next time we were provided an Ocean View room with direct access to the pool and playground. Unheard of specially during Christmas holiday week. We spent 6 days poolside and really enjoyed ourselves. After a while, you get to know the people around you from different states and countries. We inquired on how their stay was going and 15 out of the 16 we asked consistently responded that - you can never go wrong at the Ritz in Kapalua. Most of the families come from the East and the South and just really enjoyed their 8-10 days in Kapalua. Here is the deal. When you stay at the Ritz in Kapalua or Ritz in general, you choose to stay for the experience. Its not the luxurious rooms or the good food or the outstanding service or the Hollywood and Sports Celebs which the place was peppered with (Kinear, Hopper, Parker and Broderick, LT, Vijay, Pettit,etc...) by themselves but the whole package. When you stay at the Ritz, you pay for the experience. Do not expect to save a few dollars on the food or receive a discounted room. If that is the goal, then the Ritz is not for you. Service at the Ritz, Kapalua is outstanding. There will always be some bad apples as with any other place. Ritz, Kapalua employees and management still practice the Ritz Credo and Basics (ie. Smile - you are on stage, We are Ladies and Gentlemen serving Ladies and Gentlemen...). For additional information, please visit this website: Yes, the carpets and room had some musty smell. We lived in the tropics for several years and know first hand the challenge of mixing carpet, humidity/tropical climate can lead to this challenge. Its not because the rooms were not cleaned or maintained, its just the mixture of materials and the climate. In fact, I saw them shampoo and steam cleanded several rooms. Nice gesture but carpet lifespan in this environment is about 5 years. We also discovered that the Kapalua property will be undergoing renovations beginning in March 06 with plans of adding flat pannel TV, ***Tiles*** in lieu of carpet,etc... Wade, a Director at the Ritz invited me to three model units as prototype for the rest of the property. We ran out of time so was unable to view the rooms and take pictures for this audience. Wade promised that an announcement is forthcoming and pictures posted on their website for the public to see. The New Year's eve Luaua was fantastic and cost $100 per person including unlimited drinks. This was a gourmet buffet. The entertainment was fun and food was excellent!! Trust me, we come from San Francisco. As I said the service was outstanding with a few bad apples. Thanks to the following for making our stay memorable: Poolside: Ben, Jamie, Travis and the pool Engineer - Randy who can also be the Concierge, host... Front Desk: Ryan, Jocelyn and Wade. Valets: My buddy Luccho and Kane. Nice job guys!! Readers, please enjoy your travels and focus on the positive things. Life is great!!

Reviews.Title: “The Banyon Tree Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ritz is great! We have been there 3 times. Christmas Eve we wanted to do something extra special so we read the reviews on the Ritz web site and decided to go for The Banyon Tree Restaurant since it was Voted #1 by the local Maui Newspaper. It is a JOKE!! This is like walking into a swiming pool hamber restaurant and paying $200.00 for a meal that is terrible. The atmosphere is non existant, the food is terrible and we paid a fortune. Funny enough the waiter kept the smile on our face. I think he was a French circus actor or something and at the end of the evening when we were walking out he brought the GM up to us and he asked the ultimate question: "How was it?". My wife begged me not to be truthful but I told him DAIRY QUEEN was much better. The food is awful, and the atmosphere is terrible. His excuse about the atmosphere was canceled reservations. We were at the hotel the next evening at another restaurant which was wonderful and it was still very lacking. Don't wast you money on this one. The Ritz is great this restaurant is terrible and the GM should be washing dishes to rejunivate his resaurant skills.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like many on this site, I was nervous about staying at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua due to many bad reviews. However, we had already booked and paid a deposit before I read the reviews, so it was a point of no return. In general, I was very pleased with the RC. We stayed there 12/22 to 12/29 and the weather was perfect the whole time. Only on one morning was it overcast and windy, but no rain the entire time. It was occasionally windy by the pool and on the beach, but the sun was hot enough to make the wind pleasant and cooling, rather than annoying. Check in was smooth. We were immediately greeted with a lei and a fresh fruit drink, although we did have to wait in line for about 15 minutes before being attended to at the desk. We had booked a garden view for the first 4 nights and then an ocean view for the remainder of the trip, they upgraded us to an ocean view for the whole stay, so we wouldn't have to move. The lobby and grounds are really pretty. The room was probably the biggest disappointment of the stay. The man at reception kept asking us if it was ok with us to be on the ground floor and we said "fine", given that he was upgrading us, but perhaps we should have taken that as a warning. There definitely was an obvious musty smell. This was covered up in the mornings with a flower scented spray housekeeping used, but by the afternoon it was pretty obvious. Perhaps it is just ground floor rooms that smell bad? I'm pretty sensitive to bad smells and it wasn't bad enough for me to ask for a room change, it was bearable. The linens and towels were fine, not super luxurious, but not torn or thin or anything. The furniture was fine, if a little spartan and the bathroom was quite nice. The carpet was truly terrible and this needs to go! Our view was pretty good, especially from our lanai, and I liked our location with easy access to the pool and the grassy area. A long walk to the lobby, though! The pool was very pretty and nice and warm. The pool towels are plentiful, large and soft. The pool service was ok, not great. I always had to find my own chair and get my own towels, an unheard of event at the 4 seasons, but at least it saved me in tips! Rarely I would see attendants walking around with free pineapple or iced water to offer. The staff from the pool bar are very attentive and the food was great, although pricey, as expected. My biggest beef is that there was absolutely no shade, unless you booked and paid for a cabana ($75 a day). The 4 seasons offers complimentary cabanas and has many more of them. The RC needs to provide umbrellas for the people who don't want to fork out $75 just to sit by the pool. All the food we had at the restaurants was good. We actually liked our dinner at the Terrace better than the Banyon Tree. Food is expensive, as expected at the RC. $5 sodas at the beach restaurant - this is a small cup with lots of ice and little soda. The beach is only a short walk. Not a big deal. The beach is much more secluded and private than the beaches at either Kaanapali or Waliea. It was nice to only have to share the beach with RC guests and a few locals. We walked along the beaches at both Kaanapali and Waliea and there are literally hundreds of resort guests on both beaches, vying for space. I liked the quietness of the RC beach. The only downside is that they won't let you take any of their beach chairs onto the beach, I don't understand why when all the other resorts do it. Overall, I was pleased with the RC and would stay there again, but perhaps only if we could get a better deal on the rooms. We paid $475 for the first 4 nights and $725 for the last three. For those prices, I do expect that the room should have been in better shape and that the poolside service should be immaculate. If I was paying mid threes to low fours, I would have been very happy.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Ritz!!!”
Reviews.Author: tomcarlsonjr
Reviews.Content: Let me start by putting these reviews into perspective. These are opinions of travelers and nothing more. They do not represent the values/actions of the hotels and we must remember that. I state this because I feel the one and two star or â€œcirclesâ€� in the TA case are ridiculous (pertaining to the Ritz Carlton Kapalua). I have stayed at a handful of Four Seasons, St. Regis, Starwood Luxury Collection, etc. and the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is right up there if not better than most. I would even put the RCK higher than the Ritz-Carlton Bachelor Gulch in Beaver Creek, Colorado, its newest prize. Having said that I digressâ€¦ My new wife and I just returned from a wonderful 10 day honeymoon spent at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. We had an unbelievable experience. This was my 11th trip to Maui and most definitely the best. The exact dates of our trip were December 9th-19th. Reservations The Ritz-Carlton website was easy to use as always and I was able to book dinner reservations, tee times, spa services, and room upgrades all through the website and email with the hotel concierge. The reservation staff was very helpful and met every request we had. The same can be said for the hotel management. I was in constant contact prior to our trip with Wade H. of the RCK management team and he offered a room upgrade at not cost for our honeymoon. Arrival/Check In The door staff was very friendly and helpful. They immediately directed us to the front desk and informed us they would meet us with our luggage after check-in. We were presented with a lei and guava juice upon our approach to the check-in counter. The staff was all smiles and very hospitable. As stated earlier they accommodated and upgrade to a deluxe ocean view. After check in the bell staff walked us to our room while giving us an overview of the hotel and its services. Great experience! Rooms The rooms DO NOT smell poorly as indicated in many reviews. We walked into six or seven different rooms during our stay and all of them had a very fresh flower smell. Very comfortable. The rooms are average for a five star hotel. They probably need some updating but donâ€™t get me wrong, the rooms are very nice. The twice a day service is wonderful and our room stayed spotless. The bathrooms are nice, again, nothing out of the ordinary but nice. Grounds The grounds are beautiful. The hotel does an excellent job maintaining the area. VERY clean and refreshing. As stated in other reviews there are a few pictures that are a bit off centered or crooked but I was looking for it. My wife didnâ€™t even notice. The facility itself does not look dated. In fact it looked very modern and new. Spa/Pool/Athletic The spa is nice, a little small but nice. I have seen smaller five star resort spas and larger. It had all the amenities one would expect. The three tiered pool is nice and it keeps the crowds separated. The tennis courts/club are/is being remodeled, we think. They may be getting rid of their tennis club all together. We played tennis a couple of days and it is a beautiful facility however it needs to be fixed up. The beach is a short walk down the hill and is nice and secluded. Every beach in Hawaii is public so you share it with the locals but you hardly notice they are there. The beach bar/restaurant is perfectly situation next to the sand. Food Other reviews talk about how expensive the food is at the Ritz. Yes, it is expensive but think about what Island you are on. As stated earlier I have been to Maui numerous times and I found the dining costs far less (with the exception of the Banyon Tree) than any of the hotels on Wailea. Case in point: the breakfast buffet at the RCK is priced at $24 per person. The three star Renaissance Wailea is $29 per person and less quality. All food in Hawaii is expensive, the Ritz Carlton is no different. Yes, the Banyon Tree is extremely pricy. $52 for their lobster/steak combo. My duck was $32. Itâ€™s a great experience, you must do it once. Staff The staff at the Ritz was the best part. Absolutely amazing. EVERY time you passed a staff member they smiled and said hello, and your name if they knew it. Roger (from France) at the Banyon tree is AMAZING. Best service I have EVERY had was from him. Spa staff is great, pool staff is great, everyone was great. Location/Weather We never saw one drop of rain the entire time we were there. Perfectly clear blue skies the entire time of our stay. 82 degrees every day with only a slight breeze the first and last day, absolutely perfect. The location is on the North side of the island but close to Lahaina. I donâ€™t know why other reviews say, â€œbe prepared to driveâ€�? Drive where? Anywhere you stay on the island you have to drive to excursions. Donâ€™t let that sway you. If you want to drive to Haleakala it will take a while, if you want to drive to Lahaina you have the advantage over those that stay on Weilea. Itâ€™s all six one half dozen or the other. Opportunities The spa needs a full time staff member to clean the mens room. They only have three showers and they are used frequently. Every time I used their showers I was having to step over used towels etc. The spa is nice, it just needs to be better maintained. Price at the Banyon Tree. Itâ€™s a little steep. Final Thoughts You can save yourself $15 a day by self parking. The self parking lot is no more than 25 yards from the front door. I donâ€™t know what other reviews were talking about when they said it was far. Really, it is one of the best experiences I have ever had at a five star resort. I have stayed at all the big hotels on Wailea and the value isnâ€™t even close. We paid mid 200â€™s each night for our RC stay. The rates for the same time period on Wailea were in the 400â€™s. The Renaissance Wailea was in the 300â€™s and that hotel is terrible. Kapalua is secluded, quiet, and perfect for all types. We saw plenty of kids and there was plenty for them to do. We also saw a lot of young honeymooners and we all had a blast. I will DEFINITELY return to Kapalua and not the Four Seasons or Fairmont on Wailea

Reviews.Title: “Great time at Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BigNYkingy
Reviews.Content: Like so many reviews we too poured over everthing folks had to say about various resorts in maui. We plumped for the Ritz and couldn't have been happier. Kapalua is on the north shore and is much more secluded than other big resorts in Wailea. There are no hotels overlooking each other which we liked. The pool size was excellent (there are three) and the beach was just a short walk down the hill. It should be noted that if you just want to soak up the sun this may not be the place as being on the north shore it gets the worst of the weather. It can be blowy and gets a lot more rain. We had a couple of days which rained hard but then we were always out and about so didn't bother us. The hotel is certainly five star and has all the ammenities you would require. If I was really being picky I could point out that some things look slightly worn here and there but nothing major. Our ocean view room upgrade was awesome and everyone at the resort was particularly friendly. No issues with any musty smells in the rooms as I have read others to say, but i could see why that might happen given that area gets it's fair share of rain. Our room was spotless everyday. I'd certainly recommend the hotel and it's very handily placed to Lahanai if you are looking for dining alternatives. The Golf was superb and the plantation course is the cream of the crop. The condition was excellent dispite recent heavy rain - it's very playable although the greens are tricky. You also get a better rate staying at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Leave the kids at home”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family just returned from the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. I was eagerly awaiting what I expected to be either an amazing hotel or the worst place on earth based on prior reviews. It was neither. The customer service was GREAT, from the week prior to our stay when we were contacted by guest services for any special needs, reservations, etc. to the moment we arrived and were upgraded to a "deluxe" ocean view room, and throughout the stay. Awesome service in all areas. Banyan Tree was very good. Pricey but nothing too crazy for Hawaii. The property is beautiful. Spa is small and it wasn't that clean. I would not go back. Leave your kids at home. The pool area is very quiet so we tried the beach. It was very windy and cold. Skip the Ritz beach and go to the Kapalua Bay Hotel beach in the hotel shuttle. Much better beach. No food or drink service on the beach but you can walk up to the pool bar and order to-go there. Now the rooms...they are in need of a major renovation. The carpet has to be the same carpet they installed 13 years ago. It was gross. Beds were very comfortable, but furniture looks like it may have been nice 13 years ago as well. Sheets and towels also need to be replaced. We stayed at the Grand Wailea the remainder of our trip. Customer service was not the same but the kids had a much better time there. If you have not booked yet, conside the GW or Kea Lani in Wailea if you have kids and the Four Seasons if not. Better weather and nicer hotels. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: it's a great hotel in a secluded area. Nice swimming pools and secluded beach. The service is great but not comparable with Ritz in Bali. I think it's a true 5 stars hotel. However, there are some minor flaws. The room is a bit noisy when other guests use the bathroom or when the maid cleans the next/above room. Their breakfast is lovely. The gym is almost perfect. I also had the chance to go to Four Seasons in Wailea and I think it's much more luxurious. So, if the price is the same, go to Four Seasons. The location for Ritz is far from the nightlife and kahuluui airport. For sure you need to rent a car. Wailea are is closer. Go to West Maui airport if you still want to stay at Ritz. Next time I go back to Maui, for sure I want to try Four Seasons.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, relaxing, casually elegant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were greeted with leis and juice. Check-in was prompt, efficient and friendly. The Ritz was not stuffy as so many are, but casual in a classy way. The hotel had open air entrance and terraces and beautiful art displayed everywhere. The breakfast buffet was bountiful and service was outstanding. In fact, all the staff greeted with smiles and a warm "Aloha." Our partial ocean view room had an attractive view of green expanse with palm trees and uncluttered grounds, but scarcely a tad of blue to be seen. We requested an upgrade which we received on the third night of our eight night stay. The "new" room definitely smelled musty (though everything was clean), one of the shutter doors to the terrace did not work smoothly, the faucet in the bathroom sink dripped, there was someone's leftover food in the mini-fridge and the carpet had some stains. The first room was in better shape and more pleasing, but these were only minor matters that certainly did not detract from a very comfortable and relaxing stay. Golf was why we chose this hotel and we were not disappointed. The courses were gorgeous and in excellent condition but carts had to remain on cart paths for the most part. That meant LOTS of walking and these were long, hilly courses. I was a rider most of the time but my golfer husband thoroughly enjoyed these top notch courses. I took some great photos of gorgeous scenery. The resort location is removed from the action of Lahaina but a close drive and easily done. There were occasional showers, but light and brief and it did get windy, especially out in the open of the golf courses. (Most of the time the weather was sunny and not too hot.) But then, one does know this when coming here if the homework is done and does not let minor weather inconveniences tarnish the overall beauty and low-key, but gracious surroundings and service that can be expected. It was a very pleasant experience. We especially enjoyed the casual snack/bar area near the beach. The pool was beautiful and there were lots of chaise lounges available. The grounds, setting and Kapalua area are quiet, beautiful and so relaxing it's hard not to enjoy. The $15 daily service charge did not include local phone calls. But the shuttle to the golf courses and their recommended restaurants was a welcome convenience, as the parking lot was a bit of a walk and uphill(did not want to pay the $15 daily valet parking fee, but when you're paying this much for a top-notch vacation spot, some would not care). Overall, we loved the area and the hotel was comfortably classy, not stuffy as the Ritz and their staff can be.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing -- Not what a Ritz should be”
Reviews.Author: mrs_nuts
Reviews.Content: I've never stayed at a Ritz before, but have stayed at Four Seasons, and I guess I was expecting that type of service. Yes, the check-in was great and the people at the concierge desk were helpful, but the staff was not overly friendly. Very few "alohas" when out and about on the resort. No tropical garden areas, minimal vegetation. The pool area is very windy, which is evidenced by the plastic shields strategically placed around the area. The beach is a 5 minute walk away and small. Cocktail service at both locations is poor. The rooms were a bit shabby and definitely need to be updated. Mini-bugs were everywhere and the towels were very thin. I'm sure there are worse places to stay, but if you are looking for a luxury Ritz-Carlton experience, this is certainly not it. Hope to hear of a renovation real soon!

Reviews.Title: “Some people just can't be made happy”
Reviews.Author: baileydog
Reviews.Content: I must agree with a previous review - to quote - the sky is not falling at the Ritz. Rainy? Yes, it does rain daily - everywhere in the Hawaiian Islands for that matter - usually at night or very early morning for about 15 - 20 minutes. Windy? More like breezy which is the case for most of the island. Bugs? Are you kidding me? Not at this hotel. Not in the bed, not in the bath not even on the lanai. Service? Oh and how...Not one employee failed to say "aloha, good morning, afternoon etc upon passing. Phone anywhere in the resort- valet, front desk, housekeeping etc and the call is always answered with "aloha mr or mrs so and so. How may we help?" Maid service twice daily keeps the room spotless. Nighly turn down service with complimentary bottles of water on each nightstand. We were celebrating our anniversary and received upon check in, large fruit basket and chocolate covered strawberries on a bed of fresh coconut plus congratulatory letters. All staff we encountered were gracious and polite. More than I can say for some of the guests - way too stuffy and uptight and on occasion - down right rude. Hint: Relax, have fun, SMILE - you're on vacation. Stained carpet, worn rooms/hallways etc? Where did these people stay? True, some of the furnishings were rattan (not my personal favorite) but certainly not old and crusty. Tv is not a flat screen plasma HD. This matters? Maybe if you're paying $500 and up a night. And if you are, next time talk to your travel agent. We've been working with a wonderful gal that has been saving us money for years. The Ritz usually offers a free night special that includes daily buffet breakfast. Comparing the rates directly through the hotel vs what our travel agent could work out - big difference plus the perks of breakfast, free night, convertible car, etc. We have taken advantage of this special both January 2005 and October 2005. At $26pp for breakfast buffet, we welcomed the savings. Location - Northwestern side of the island slightly removed from the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali or Lahaina but only 10 - 15 min drive. If you want to be in the middle of the action (the "strip" numerous hotels/shops/restaurants/bars) stay in one the two aforementioned areas. For a bit more privacy, Kapalua is perfect. From our partial ocean view room, we enjoyed beautiful views of Molokai, sunset, some ocean and palm trees. We had a deluxe ocean view in January - full ocean view - no obstructions. Interior of both rooms was exactly the same - king bed with down mattress cover/comforter/pillows - marble bath with double sinks, shower/tub combo, separate shower and separate toilet. Plus two incredibly plush robes and slippers. Slippers average - robes well above average. But both were free for use during your stay. Have visited other resorts in the islands that charge for both. Resort fee? $15 daily per room and yes it is a nickle and dime thing but that's the same with all of Hawaii. Almost all resorts charge either a daily parking fee or resort fee. Four Seasons is about the only resort that doesn't charge for those things but the nightly rate well makes up for that $15. Golf/beach/pool/grounds - We don't golf so firsthand knowledge of the links doesn't extend past what was asthetically pleasing. Beach is awesome! Crescent shaped, soft sand, crystal clear water and fairly private. All beaches in Maui are public. However, Ritz Carlton is the only resort that fronts the beach so it's never crowded. The three tiered pool is terraced into the hillside and is open 24hours along with the hot tubs. Plenty of poolside lounges - no 7am scramble for a seat. Grounds are lush and well manicured. Lots of flowers and foliage. Not a speck of trash other than those inconsiderates who carelessly flick their cigarette butts where ever they chose. Come on guys - use an ashtray already! We witnessed several employees taking the time to stop and pick them up. Dining - The Banyan Tree and the sushi bar Kai are wonderful. Also breakfast at the Terrace with sweeping views of the grounds and pool was fantastic. Banyan Tree is such a treat for a well executed gourmet meal though your wallet won't necessarily agree. If you're looking to spend a little less on food costs, don't eat at the resort or any resort for that matter. Resort dining is always more expensive than it is off property no matter where you stay. The room had a brand new mini fridge which I would suggest utilizing if you're looking to save $$. All of the above info is based on the assumption that one will rent a car while on island (pick up and drop off at the airport is easiest). Maui is such a diverse and beautiful island - without the car you will certainly miss out on most of the sights. We had a ball at the Ritz but are really in love with the island and it's people in general. Maui is the perfect mix of all the islands in one. Definitely something for everyone. Overall, if you're looking for a beautiful resort, generous amenities, and the slower paced 'good life', Ritz Carlton Kapalua does not disappoint.

Reviews.Title: “We were pampered!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our first response to the Ritz Carlton was that the entrance had no WOW effect.....The lobby was far from the level we felt the Ritz should have. Now with saying that we continued on to our room which was quite nice (love the robe). And we then continued on to the pool, which is beautiful. But again the pool bar should look more desireable. We didn't eat at the restautants only because we felt others were more desirable. But I will say the quality of service was excellent!!! The grounds were nicely done!!!! All rooms with a ocean view!! We were there without our kids and felt that others were there to do the same. Not a place for kids!! WOW the entrance lobby and decorate the pool bar and this is a excellent hotel!!!! We will be back and we look forward to it!!! ALOHA!!

Reviews.Title: “Plus and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Here is a simple breakdown: Pluses: -Nice large marble bathrooms. -Located in the best part of Maui (in my opinion). -Beautiful beach on the resort (high waves). -Housekeeping went the extra effort to clean and maintain room. -Beautiful garden and beach views from the lobby (and walking 1/4 mile to my room). -Staff very friendly. Minuses: -No refrigerator or microwave in room (cannot save leftovers). -Not informed of the $15 per day activity fee (if I knew this I might have played some tennis). -Snobby and rude front desk workers. -Restaurants on resort too expensive for the amount and quality (order food at the bar in the lobby it is the best deal, especially late at night). Keep in mind I do not play golf so I might have rated it higher based on the courses that surround it.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: GloriaM
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were recently married in Maui and we spent 6 days at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. Upon arrival we were greeted with beautiful fresh orchid leis and pog juice. Check in was smooth and friendly and we were upgraded from a garden view to a partial ocean view room. Our bellman was very friendly and told us about some must sees in Maui-he was also very gentle with my wedding dress. When we arrived in our room it was wet and hot. The carpet felt wet. We blasted our air conditioner while we settled in and that solved that. The bathtub was a little dingy so I used the shower and some of the lamps were being held together with wires. Another strange thing was the beds-they have these down mattress pads that slip and slide all over the mattress. That is the extent of my "negative" comments. Our view was spectacular and the balconies are very private. The resort is very quiet and very adult. We had drinks in the lounge and they were very good and strong. The walk to the beach is scenic and smooth, but we were happy that golf carts came every few minutes to chauffer us back to the top. The spa is worth every penny...I had a facial, massage, mani and pedi. We mostly ordered room service. Breakfast was always tasty-the kona coffee is a must...it really gets you going for the day...the pizzas were very tasty and the filet and lobster is to die for. It did rain a lot on that side of the island-almost every day we were there. The concierege is very well organized...we loved the pre printed instructions on how to get to popular tourist destinations. Later we upgraded to a club level suite. The suite was in better shape than our partial ocean view room-and the club levels amenities like the breakfast, brunch, lunch, dinner and cordial and chocolates were amazing and well worth the extra money. Overall we had an amazing and pleasant experience. We will definately come back.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Let The Other Reviews Fool You..This is INCREDIBLE”
Reviews.Author: MForsgren
Reviews.Content: Reading the reviews on this hotel everyday for a month, ok maybe two months, before my departure to Maui, I began to become increasingly unsure of how my stay would be. WOW, why did I waste my time on all of the negative reviews! I was over the top excited to arrive at this excellent hotel, and to be able to experience the "Aloha Spirit" these great people give. I can not remember one time that I passed an employee at this hotel and was not greeted with a smile and hello. The grounds are beautiful and very well taken care of. The beach at this hotel, is not a long walk as some say. After eating the great food here, you need to walk the distance :) and not only that, the golf cart is always active taking people back and forth. The beach is AWESOME for body surfing, if that is what you enjoy, or even just relaxing in the sand and soaking up a great tan. We went to Black Rock (access to this area is at the grounds of the Sheraton Hotel)and snorkeled there for days, I highly recc. this area if you like to snorkel, tried Polo Beach in Wailea, wouldnt recc that spot. For the hotel, we got the "Breakfast Package" with our room rate, I would do this in a heartbeat upon returning to this hotel. Getting a breakfast buffet (which had a VERY nice selection) that will typically run you $65 per couple per day, is worth the extra in room rate. There is free parking at this hotel, valet is $15 per day, and not worth it at all unless you are physically unable to get to a car in a parking lot. I am not sure what else to state other than, DO NOT pass this hotel up for any other. I will say, this is a great place for couples, older and young. The atmosphere is nothing like that of Kaanapali, in which I stayed at the Hyatt several years ago and would be considered more for kids. The area is very upscale, not far at all from all of the action in Lahaina. I highly recc. getting a car when in Maui, there is too much to see and do outside of the hotel. I love the Lahaina area (Front St.), there is great shopping, people watching, and restaurants. Good luck on your decision, what is there not to love about Maui..... by the way I just returned today, so this is fresh on my jet lagged mind......

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Aloha! I recently traveled to Maui on business and decided to treat myself to a one night stay at the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua Maui. This resort is located on the Lahaina side of the island - about 1 hour from Kahalui Aiport. My expectations were set pretty high. This hotel prides itself on being that of a five star hotel- it's far from it. I am not a golfer so I don't pretend to know much about the whole golfing experience that this particular hotel is known for. What I can tell you is that the front desk and valet are very nice folks. I was pretty much assaulted with a fresh flower lei and an ice cold drink at check in. I was certainly feeling the "Aloha spirit," even though I am from Oahu. The woman at the front desk was helping train another gentleman so my check in took a little longer than normal, but that is okay. I was given my room key and I happily wandered off to my room, enjoying all the anticipation of a relaxing visit. My room was about 1/4 mile away- again...that is okay. I needed the exercise. As I left the main lobby, I slowly creeped into a part of the hotel that is starting to look a little shabby. Oh well, it was a lobby- I entered the room and was really let down. The floor was a little dirty, the beds looked comfy but when I plopped down on it- there was a poof of dust that led me into 3 minutes of sneezing. The furniture was worn and scratched with what looked like crayon in some areas. The clock radio was totally beat up as was the telephone. I entered the bathroom to find towels with Ritz logos that looked in about the same condition of those towels that I use to dry my dogs. You know that type- about 5 years ago they were your best towels- and now you just use them as handy wipes to mop things up. The fixures were scratched and I was less than impressed. I came back from dinner to turn on the light and find 5 baby cockroaches flying around the sink fixtures. I killed 2 but 3 got away. I'm a girl that is used to living in the tropics and I can catch a roach with the best of them. I do NOT want to see roaches in a hotel that expects guests to pay $300 / night. Now, that being said, I did not pay that. I did get a Kamaaina rate ...but it was still $195!!! I went to the desk to explain about the roaches- they offered to "spray" my room. Now, I was a little tipsy from the $10 drinks - so I don't want to smell RAID roach killer while I try and get a good nights sleep. I was very surprised that I was not offered another room- they should have offered to help me move into another room, don't you think? This hotel is not a dump- it's just not worth the money they are asking. These are the days of good value and this hotel is NOT one of them. I am very disappointed and I wanted to warn off all travelers that are blindly expecting luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay”
Reviews.Author: Fun2Travel13
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz-Carlton on our honeymoon for 2 nights. We followed our stay at the Ritz-Carlton with a stay at the Four Seasons for four nights (because of the reviews from this site, we chose to stay at the Four Seasons longer). We were more impressed with the Ritz than we were with the Four Seasons. We do play golf and enjoyed the Kapalua courses. Windy and tough, the views on the course were spectacular. We played in Wailea too and found it to be crowded. Our room at the Ritz was not the best decorated but it was clean and spacious (we stayed in a suite with a view of the golf course). I found the rooms at the Four Seasons to be dark but better furnished and modern. We thought the service at the Ritz was much better than that at the Four Seasons. We were taken care of for our entire time there. We did stay at the Club level at the Ritz and found the amenities to be excellent, the service may have been better because of this. However, we were looking for a quiet place for our honeymoon and found the grounds and hotel at the Ritz to be beautiful, spacious and comfortable. We did not feel as relaxed when we moved to the Four Seasons. The amenities were much better (and mostly free) at the Four Seasons, but crowded. The Ritz does charge for things that the Four Seasons does not but it does make for more crowded pool time, waiting for the valet and longer time to be serviced. The buffet breakfast at both places were terrible compared to the fresh food you were offered at the breakfast buffet at the Kapalua Bay Hotel. The restaurants were Ok in Kapalua. We ate at Vinos and found the tapas to be ok. We also ate lunch at the Pineapple Grill (I think that is the name, it is located on one of the golf courses) and the food was good but not excellent. There were definitely fewer selections to choose from if you didn't want to drive. The beach at the Ritz is windy and choppier than the beach near the Kapalua Bay Hotel. If you were to spend time at the beach, take the shuttle there for good snorkeling and calmer water. Overall, if you are looking for a more relaxed stay, good golf and a great view, stay in Kapalua If you want more restaurant choices, better shopping and better amenities, stay at the Four Seasons. You do have to "beat the crowd" at the pool for prime cabanas and deal with more kids at the Four Seasons. For honeymooners looking for quiet and solitidue, consider the Ritz instead. My husband loved the Ritz and would never go back to the Four Seasons. I found both to be great for different reasons. We did drive to Hana (I got car sick even though I was driving!!) and would recommend staying down in Hana if you are looking for an area less crowded and more quiet. Good luck and enjoy Maui.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Heaven”
Reviews.Author: NewYorker10023
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I just returned from a two week Hawaiian honeymoon. We visited three islands and stayed 14 nights. The Ritz Carlton Kapalua was our first destination. We stayed on the Club Level and loved the hotel. Service throughout the hotel was fast, friendly and wonderful. The Club Level costs approximately $100/day more than a regular room but in our opinion the extra cost is worth the personal pampering, the all-day food (changes 5 times during the day and is all very delicious -- lots of tasty gourmet appetizers), free drinks (we had multiple dirty martini's and/or mai tai's every evening before going to dinner), helpful private concierge and other extra services that the Club Level provides. The room was very clean and comfortable, especially the lania (balcony) which directly overlooked hole #3 of the Kapalua Bay Golf Course (and the ocean and other islands in the distance) and featured a large nice table and two chaise lounges. The room decor was above average and Hawaiian-themed, down to the metal pineapples that are featured on the balcony railings. Those who expect ultra-modern furnishings will be disappointed -- this is a Hawaiian beach resort and the furnishings are more themed to this type of locale and culture than they would be to a toney modern hotel located in other mainland resorts (no ultra suede upholstery and halogen lamps here). The furnishings are not new, but they are clean and nice and fit the theme. The TV is not a fancy plasma -- yes, it's a Magnavox that works just fine (and in my opinion, if you are going to Maui to watch TV you could save yourself alot of money by staying home). The bathroom was classic Ritz -- all marble, large and terrific -- and we liked all the great smelling Ritz Carlton bath potions and products too. Speaking of smell -- we also feared finding the musty/mildew smell that others here have experienced, and we were pleasantly relieved to not smell anything beyond the normal "humid" conditions found at all beach resorts. The grounds of the hotel are also lovely and extremely well-maintained -- lots of beautiful island flowers, great views and singing tropical birds. Pretty pool area too. We never made it to the beach but did play two rounds of golf on the spectacular Kapalua and Wailea courses. In a previous trip to Maui I stayed in the Four Season Wailea -- another wonderful hotel that is newer and has a more modern "feel" than the Ritz Carlton. I happened to like the Ritz Kapalua equally as much if not better and after my wife and I visited Wailea to play golf, we decided that we also prefer Kapalua's scenery and ambiance over Wailea.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz in Maui from October 2nd - 12th. I was a bit nervous after reading all the negative reviews. But decided to go with an open mind. From the moment that we arrived, we received the 5star service that we expected from the Ritz. When checking in I mentioned that we were getting married while on our visit to Maui. When we got to our room, we were pleased to discover that they had upgraded us from a garden view to a partial ocean/pool view. While we were unpacking we received a letter along with coconut-chocolate covered strawberries. They wanted to congratulate us on our upcoming wedding. (nice touch) A few days later we received another card thanking us for our stay along with a Ritz Carlton photo album. Any time we called housekeeping or the bell desk we were always greeted by our name. The staff was very prompt, whenever we called for service we had what we needed in less than 15 minutes. One tip, if you use the valet service and move your car by 10pm, they donâ€™t charge you the $15 fee. The Ritz is definitely a 5star hotel when it comes to service. The rooms are a bit outdated I must admit. I tend to like the higher end hotels and expect the rooms to be 5 star quality. However, the room itself and the bathroom were very spacious. The large closet had a full length mirror and there was plenty of space to either hang or put your clothes away. The beds were also surprisingly very comfortable. Over all, the room needs to be redecorated but it's not that bad! There were so many other things that made up for it. The pool area is beautiful and was never crowded. We were always able to find a spot right next to the pool, overlooking the ocean. The beach is down the hill, about a 5 minute walk, but worth it. The beach at the Ritz is very private compared to the other beaches in Kaanapali. The Ritz has itâ€™s own beach side bar/restaurant. The have lounge chairs available on a small grassy area just above the sand area over looking the ocean. If you dont want to take the walk to and from the pool, you can get a ride up and down the hill. We enjoyed the walk back and forth from the beach as the scenery was gorgeous. While at the Ritz, we ate at the Terrace Restaurant. The Sea Bass was incredible and worth every penny. The beach side grill also had the best Kuala pork sandwich!! Another thing, Kapalua is known to have more rain and wind. We thought it was fine. It is actually really green due to the rain. We saw rainbows over the hills to the North of us almost every day. If you like Sushi, you have to eat at Sansei Seafood and Sushi at the Kapalua Shops. It's less than a 5 minute drive from the Ritz. (make sure to make reservations as we got turn down the 1st time we tried to eat there as it was already booked full) Since we were getting married while we were there, we had family and friends at other hotels on the island. After visiting some of the other hotels down in the Kaanapali area, we were happy that we chose the Ritz. We didnâ€™t mind driving down to Kaanapali/Lahaina where the majority of the action and night-life is. (Itâ€™s about a 10 minute drive) The beaches, shops and restaurant in Kaanapali were always busy. We walked along the path way and the pool area at the other hotles were really crowded and not very private. The beach are in Kaanapali was also crowded as there are a lot of hotels in that one area. We like the idea that we could escape the crowds back at the Ritz, where it was very private and peaceful. We also drove down to the Wailea area to check out the beaches and the hotels. The area is very nice and the weather was a bit hotter down there. Wailea has fewer hotels than Kaanapali. The beach was not as crowded. But all the hotels shared the same strip of beach. The one thing about the Ritz, is that the beach area is secluded. Wailea is also about a 35-40 minute from the main area in Lahaina. The only down side to the Ritz is the rooms need to be updated. But according to some of our friends and family who stayed at other major upscale hotels down in the Kaanapali area, their rooms were smaller than ours and they complained that there rooms needed to be updated. Overall the Ritz is a great place to stay. As we were leaving we were already talking about our next trip to Maui and how we plan to stay at the Ritz again.

Reviews.Title: “What a Disappointment! This is not up to Ritz-Carlton standards”
Reviews.Author: 7travelnyc
Reviews.Content: Stay at the Four Seasons! We stayed a week at the Ritz-Carlton and a week at the Four Seasons. What a contrast! The Four-Seasons was everything you would expect from a luxury hotel- beautiful rooms, wonderful service, clean and meticulous. The Ritz-Carlton on the other hand, was completely rundown. The hotel itself is on a gorgeous piece of property but the rooms are in terrible shape. When was the last time you saw a Magnovox TV?! The room looked like a rundown Sheraton hotel. The wallpaper was peeling off, the carpet in the room was bare-thin and the sheets on the hotel bed were worn through and there was an actual tear in the top sheet! A hole in the sheet at a luxury hotel!!!! We had a deluxe room with oceanview and for the amount of money spent, the Ritz-Carlton should have made some renovations long long ago. We were completely disappointed. Don't stay here unless you're an avid golfer because they do have great discounts for the golfing on the property. The weather in Capalua is also not as sunny and warm as it is in Wailea (where the Four Seasons is located). Again, if you're golfer, then perhaps a good idea but otherwise, stay at the Four Seasons for the money. The Ritz-Carlton charges $75 for the poolside cabana for 1 day use. The Four Seasons is free. The Ritz-Carlton charges as "resort fee". Four Seasons does not. Ritz charges for valet parking, Four Seasons does not. Food at the Ritz is mediocre. Food at Four Seasons was fantastic. All in all, our 1 week stay at the Four Seasons made up for our big disappointment at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really a Ritz?”
Reviews.Author: elledee33
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe everyone is writing such great things about this property. I am not the pickiest person with hotels but I can be pretty discerning when it comes to nice up to date, clean rooms. I will say that the property was beautiful and well kept. The rooms are really what my major problem was for the trip. We were in town for a wedding and lucked up on some rooms at suite actually for $105 per night. The room was supposed to be $1050 per night. The first room I had was infested with ants on every piece of furniture. We were on the 3rd floor and there were ants. So we moved out to another suite with a different configuration and that alleviated the bug problem. I found the rooms to be very outdated. The loud floral patterns did not always match. We have 5 different colors of lamps in our room. The furniture was old and the Rattan looked as if it had seen better days. The carpet was old and quite worn as well. If this room was really $1050, I would have been offended. I would not have paid over $140 for this room and it was a huge suite. Say what you want, but this was no ritz to me. I have stayed in far better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but not for me”
Reviews.Author: daveWoodlandHills
Reviews.Content: My wife, infant daughter and I just got back from staying at this resort from Oct 3-8, 2005. The grounds at this hotel are so beautiful that we were more impressed with it compared to a botanical garden we visited on the island. The staff at this hotel are some of the friendliest people I have ever encounter anywhere. Our room that we got on the 1st floor smelled very bad of mold and we were cheerfully given a different room on the main level which was fine. The room is average compared to other Ritz locations we stayed at but still nice. The pool is beautiful to look at but, freezing! The beach at Ritz had very large waves and there was not even one person laying out. The hotel is very quiet and is not for anyone looking for action. This hotel in my opinion is not for young couples or for kids. We ended cutting our trip short at this hotel and going to the Grand Wailea Hotel on the other side of the island. We loved it! Also, it does not rain nearly as much other side either.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel for most!”
Reviews.Author: lucycan
Reviews.Content: I am an avid user of this site, and like many others, was a bit scared to stay at this hotel due to some of the negative reviews. We just returned today from a week here. It is a VERY nice hotel and let me summarize the good and bad points: GOOD: 1) Service was excellent. 2) Staff is super friendly. 3) Super confortable beds. 4) Club Lounge is the BEST and the staff is awesome - especially Leslie!! 5) The grounds are wonderful as is the pool. 6) The secluded beach is amazing. 7) The food is good. 8) The massages at the spa are some of the best anywhere. 9) Great people watching possibilities. Just think of it! 10) Great location close to most things but far enough away from many. 11) Great baths on the club level. BAD: 1) Check in was awful. They actually sent us to a room with someon in it! 2) The food is expensive. $16 for a burger is the most expensive we saw on the island. 3) The pool is very cold. Most people didn't swim. 4) It does rain for some period of time most days. 5) The hotel is old school. My wife and I are 30 and prefer a more modern, hip hotel such as a Park Hyatt. But I knew that going in. 6) The carpet in the rooms must go! 7) The TVs are left overs from the 80s. But you dont go on vacation to watch TV! 8) Almost an hour drive from the airport. All in all, a great vacation and a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelmavenLaJolla
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua several years ago, I thought I had an idea of what to expect during this stay. How wrong I was! Everything was far superior than what I remembered! From the minute we arrived, the staff went out of their way to make us feel comfortable. The staff appears to enjoy working there. From the check in staff, to the concierge desk, to housekeeping, to the staff at the front door, to the small but efficient spa, to the restaurant staff...every need was anticipated. I am a travel agent and I am very particular in reviewing a property...the Ritz Carlton Kapalua is 5 stars all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BobAgent21
Reviews.Content: I was very scared when I booked my reservations for this hotel from reading some of the others and the fact that it was only getting a 4 out of 5 on the scale. It was a great hotel for my wifes and I's 10th anniversary. I guess the only drawback to the hotel was the weather(which I am told is not normal for this time of year). It did rain in the mornings and clear by the afternoon, it was also windy. But the views and the grounds are to die for. We visited a few of the other hotels(four seasons,hyatt,grand wailea) and only felt the four seasons to be at the same par-but at a cost of $300 more per night. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Thanks Ritz Carlton!

Reviews.Title: “Fanatastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: midtownfoodie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Carlton in Maui September 17-21. My husband and I were celebrating our 5 year anniversary. I was quite nervous after reading many of the negative reviews. I would have changed hotels but most were already booked. Thankfully, I am glad that I didn't change. I have stayed at many Ritz properties and was blown away by the Maui hotel and service. Uon arrival my husband and I were informed that the hotel was sold out and that because we were Ritz regulars we had been upgraded to an ocean view club level room. We had an unbelievable view of the ocean and the pool. The bed and linens were quite comfortable and up to the Ritz standards. As far as the rooms being outdated I didn't get that impression at all. The furniture was typical Hawaiian and the carpets seemed to be relatively new. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach but they have a golf cart that will take you down and bring you back up. At the beach the do not allow you to take the lounge chairs on the actual sand because it is a public beach. Also the beach bar closes at 5:00 each day. We spent alot of time by the pool as well. There was always staff around to get you a drink or fill any other requests. Even though the property was sold out due to a convention the pool and beach never seemed overcrowded. We ate at the Beach Bar and the Terrace restaurant. We looked at the menu for the Banyon Tree but decided the entrees seemed a little more exotic than what we wanted. Both of the restaurants had decent food but a little pricey. The wine selection at the Terrace was lacking. For lunch one day we went down the street to the Honolua Store. It was crowded and the lady that took our order reminded me of the Soup Nazi from Seinfeld but the food was pretty good. Overall I have to say that the Ritz Carlton Maui is spectacular. Excellent service and property. I can't wait to go back and I only wish that we had spent our whole vacation at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Anyone who did not like it obviously has no idea what they're talking about....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Anyone who complains about this hotel is just looking for things to complain about. My husband and I went for our recent honeymoon, and let me start off by saying that we have only ever stayed in 4 or 5 star hotels for every vacation we have gone on. (Not to be snobby, but to avoid children as much as humanly possible...we love them, but not in a hot tub while we are drinking wine.) We arrived at the hotel around 3pm, and it was moderately busy in the lobby. We barely noticed all the other people though, because we were so attentively taken care of from minute one. Our car was parked and luggage hauled immediately upon arrival, and we got our lei greeting right away as well. The front desk staff was excellent and we got a free upgrade to an ocean-view room. Our room was gorgeous and I have no idea what this "mildew smell" is that these pretentious rich people speak off. I smelled nothing but plumeria blooms and food from the fabulous restaurants the entire 10 days we spent there. As for the TV comments...who on earth travels to a tropical paradise to watch TV!? My husband and I only had the TV on for the channel with relaxing Hawaiian music playing 24/7. I also read a comment about having "nowhere but their luggage to store their clothing." I have no idea what kind of room they had, but we had a normal, ocean-view room and it came equipped with about 5 dresser drawers, a few shelves and a large double closet complete with numerous hangers, robes, slippers and an auto shut-off light. The bathroom was fabulous and the twice- daily maid service was sure to replenish our towels every time they came. Our lanai was beautiful and so was our surprise ocean view. The maid service was nothing short of stellar and the food was not priced much higher than any other 5 star resort we have stayed in. Anyone complaining about the food prices clearly has no idea what the "usual" prices are in 5 star hotels. We food none of the prices unusual at all. The pool was fabulous, and besides the few inconsiderate people who brought their babies (yes I said babies) into the hot tub, we didn't have too many problems with children running rampant. My husband and I wondered aloud who on earth would travel to a place like this and bring children? They cannot possibly appreciate it and they have to take care of them the entire time so how is it a vacation for them? Whatever happened to Disney or Cape Cod for little ones?
