Anyway, I digress....we were nothing but impressed with the Ritz, even when they screwed up! They called us on our second to last day and asked us if we would mind spending a night at the Kapalua Bay resort as they had overbooked and needed the room. They were entirely gracious and apologetic with no need to be as they removed $800 from our bill and gave us hours before we had to vacate. Everyone was sweet and competant from day one. If I had to be picky, the only thing that ever bothered me was that sometimes there would be random cups and trash in the hallways that had been left by guests. It would always be picked up by the next time we had walked by, but it was still not usually something you see in a 5 star resort. Overall, we were deeply impressed with everything at the Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton was the best!!”
Reviews.Author: FuzzBear5
Reviews.Content: I wished we could have stayed longer!!! My husband attended a conference at the hotel and we were able to make it into a mini-vacation. The housekeeping staff were perfect. The concierge staff (especially Mary) had terrific recommendations and always williing to help out with reservations. My only advice is to eat outside of the hotel as their food is pricey. This also gives you a chance to explore the rest of the island! If we ever get a chance, we are definately going back to the Ritz Carlton in Kapalua! Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Honeymoon at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved the Ritz at Kapalua. It was the perfect honeymoon spot - secluded, not too many children, with plenty of lounge chairs by the pool and beach. The walk to the beach was nice, it was never crowded, almost like a private beach. The Beach House Restaurant was a great lunch spot. The pool was so beautiful with a very attentive wait staff. We spent alot of time there. The atmosphere was so relaxing, the resort never seemed crowded. Our room had a partial ocean view, and was very spacious. We did have robes and slippers in our room, and the staff was not stingy with the toiletries. It was perfect. We also liked the location, close enough to Lahaina and the night life, but far enough away to feel secluded. The drive from the airport was so scenic too. We did miss the hotel entrance the first time, but that just lead to more sight-seeing! I was a bit concerned after reading all the negative reviews on this site. After staying there for a week, I have no idea where those reviews came from. The only negative thing I can think of is the $15 resort fee and the internet usage fee. Other than that, the Ritz was our ideal honeymoon paradise. I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a romantic get-away.

Reviews.Title: “Blew me away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent a lot of time on this site researching hotels in Maui for my honeymoon. Like others, I was cautious about the Ritz after seeing some decidedly mixed reviews here. However, from the moment I entered the resort I knew that unpleasant experiences were not the norm. I had booked a partial ocean view room, and upon arrival we were upgraded to a club-level room with a full ocean view. Being on the club level entitled us to free food and drinks at the club lounge (which saved us a bundle given their otherwise high prices), and allowed us to use the extremely helpful concierges, who were able to book tours, etc., for us and have them billed directly to our room. My only complaint was the unpredictable weather in Kapalua. It would appear to be bright and sunny when we looked out the window, but by the time we got downstairs and were walking toward the pool, the sky would open up and it would rain heavily for half an hour. The intermittent rain and wind also made it difficult to enjoy the beach. My only other complaint was the distance from the hotel to the beach, which wasn't bad but which was much more than what you would get in the Ka'anapali hotels. Speaking of Ka'anapali, I would advise anyone looking for a quiet relaxing hotel to avoid that area. Although it seemed nice, it was very hectic and lively compared with Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable 20th at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: ValriB
Reviews.Content: I was a bit nervous about staying at the Ritz after reading several comments posted here. I shouldn't have been! We were returning to Maui for our 20th wedding anniversary - the Ritz (and just about everything north of Lahaina) weren't even in existence in 1985. The property, room, and amenities were superb! After snorkeling at the beach near the hotel (not a long walk - besides, walking is good for you!) we decided to complete our SCUBA certifications - the Kapalua Dive company that is the operator of the beach rental concessions was a pleasure to deal with. I enjoyed everything about the place - the breakfast buffet was excellent, and the restaurants on site superb. I agree with one poster - sometimes the little details are overlooked. There were no robes in our room; we had to request them. The evening bottles of water didn't show up until our third night (we were there for a week). The cleaning staff did seem to guard the toiletries (shampoo, etc.) like gold from time to time. Also, one of the jacuzzis in the pool area was out of order our entire stay (seven nights). Other than that, we enjoyed our stay, and would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “We a great time here!”
Reviews.Author: miltowntraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed here a week with family and we had a fantastic time! The grounds are beautiful, the food was excellent! Most of us chose to pay extra for the upgrade prior to our departure for Maui (yes, I read the reviews). It was worth it. We had a gorgeous view of the pool and ocean. We spent countless hours out on the lanai people watching, eating our meals and enjoying the breeze. Another family member chose not to upgrade and stayed in the garden level rooms. By the end of the week, she chose to move because of 'the smell'. I would be remiss if I didn't mention the staff, which was excellent! The only issue I have with the hotel is that pesky 15.00 'resort fee'. Im still unclear how we benefitted from this. Other than that, we had an excellent time. I would definitley return for a stay at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful anniversary get-away”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I, too, had read a number of mixed comments at this website of this hotel, so I was somewhat concerned before our trip. I'm very happy to report that our experience was entirely positive. I suspect that, either others have much higher expectations than do we, or their rooms were markedly different from ours. For context, my wife and I went there for our 15th wedding anniversary. We're both about 40 years of age. While we didn't bring our kids, there were many there with children (including lots of infants) -- all well behaved. I've stayed at the Ritz Carlton Half Moon Bay (which I believe is generally viewed very favorably) and I believe this hotel to be of comparable (or at least close) quality. The grounds are simply beautiful and spacious. Yes, it's windy, but I'm amazed at the negative comments regarding the beach. I found it wonderful -- much cooler (but certainly not cold), very roomy, and underutilized (perhaps I shouldn't tout it). We played at both the Village and Bay golf courses, both of which I recommend, but particularly the latter. Tennis on the premises is skimpy (and admittedly windy), but the nearby Kapalua Tennis Center was very nice. There's very good snorkeling nearby. For comparisons sake, we checked out both the Fairmont and Four Seasons, both of which have received generally better reviews here. The Fairmont looked nice but it also looked like it belonged in Las Vegas. While the Four Seasons was very nice, it seemed to be too compact (you better like your neighbors there). I'm very happy with our choice. Finally, I've also read mixed reports about the restaurant David Pauls, but I had one of the best meals of my life there, and would highly recommend it as well for a special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT listen to the negative reviews! LOVED the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We LOVED the RC at Kapalua!! After I booked the rooms, I wanted to read the reviews and found this site. I was really worried about all the negative reviews about the service, the moldy smell, the room decor, etc. But when we arrived at the hotel, we experienced nothing of the aboved mentioned. When we checked in, we originally booked a terrace view room but they upgraded us without us asking to a ocean/pool view room! They even called us later on that day to make sure we settled in comfortably and to see if we were enjoying our stay! The staff and maids were very friendly and polite, they never missed a chance to say "aloha" to you and always went out of their way to go the extra mile for you! And the night before we departed, they called again to wish us a safe trip home to check to see if we needed assistance on the day of departure! The grounds of the hotel was beautiful and the views are breathtaking!! The Kapalua area reminds me of an exotic version of Pebble Beach, CA but more beautiful. This area is definitely the more exclusive part of Maui and not as touristy as Ka'anapalii and Wailea. If you're looking for a romantic atmosphere or just someplace calm and serene to relax, this is your best bet. But if you're looking for nightlife, places to stay with kids, Wailea and Ka'anapalii would be a better selection for you. Shopping, dining, and nightlife is only a 15-20 minute drive away in Lahaina and Ka'napalii. RC has a perfect location because it's away from all the "busy" areas and you can always choose to hop into the car and drive a few minutes whenever you feel like leaving the hotel. It wasn't an inconvenience to us because the drive was so scenic and relaxing! I would definitely recommend this hotel to couples if you're looking to book a romantic getaway! Before we checked out, we found out that the RC was installing new flat screen TV's in their rooms! Too bad we missed out on that. It is windy in Kapalua and I admit I was really worried about that when we arrived but it did not affect our vacation at all! It was actually nice because when we were sunbathing, we would feel the breeze from the ocean and it would cool us down from being in the sun. Book the RC Kapalua, you will not regret it! I normally don't write reviews for any of my travels but the Ritz Carlton Kapalua really impressed me. I am normally accustomed to staying at only 5 star resorts and hotels so this is not the type of review from someone who does not know what they are talking about. I felt that if I did not post my wonderful experience, I would be doing a great injustice to the staff and hotel. I hope everyone found my review helpful! Have a great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Kraster
Reviews.Content: I love reading all the posts on this site, especially after visiting a hotel firsthand for comparison. After spending the last 10 days on my honeymoon at this Ritz in Kapalua, reading some of the posts here I just have to giggle. The hotel is not horribly outdated. The rooms do not reek of mildew. The beach isn't an hour's walk away. I was able to order a decent lunch and drink at the pool. Our room did have a magnavox TV, which was an older model. However, it was 27", had a clear picture and worked fine. Besides, who travels to paradise to watch television? The service here was incredible, nothing short of perfect. Everything we asked for we were given, including some things we didn't ask for like an ocean view room and a bottle of champange on our arrival. They bend over backwards for their guests, and my only thoughts as to why some people find the service unacceptable is because (a) they are overprivileged snobs or (b) they are overprivileged snobs. The grounds and property are simply fantastic. One of the best things about this hotel is how out of the way it is -- it makes for a very relaxing stay compared to the other resorts on the island that are all in the thick of the action. It's a 20 min drive to Lahaina to go out on the town, and there are a few great restaurants in the immediate area: Sansei (wonderful sushi), The Banyan Tree (at the hotel), The Plantation House (Hawai'ian cuisine), Roy's (5 min in Kahana). The beach was a bit small but it was quite beautiful, and the nearby Kapalua bay and Ka'anapali beaches are very easy to get to. Staying at the Ritz gives you beach privileges at Kapaula bay as well. I also recommend a trip down to Wailea, the beach there was fantastic. As you might imagine, there is no shortage of amazing beaches on Maui :) The pool was wonderful; clean and clear and nicely heated. There are two hot tubs, and a few putting greens, shuffleboard, bocce ball, and tennis courts all near the pool to keep you entertained if lying around has you bored. We also spent one afternoon in their spa and got a couples massage in the garden. Being under the tent with the soft music playing and listening to birds and other exotic life chirp away in the backround just plain awesome. One of the highlights of the trip. All in all, we had a fantastic trip and a great stay at the Ritz. One of the couples we met there were returning for their 5th anniversary after their honeymoon stay, and another couple we met said they've stayed all over Maui and the Ritz just takes the cake. It's serene location, beautiful gorunds and exceptional service put it ahead of the rest. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not up to Ritz Carlton standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our daughter, son-in-law and their child- because I read previous reviews on this site a week before we arrived,I called the hotel then to request rooms without mildew (I have serious allergies) - I also requested a crib for one of the rooms. I was assured that my request would be entered into their reservations system. The day we left for Maui, since we were scheduled to arrive at the hotel about midnight, I called again to check on my earlier request. Guess what? We arrived exhausted and were rudely treated by a woman behind the desk who was wearing a parka - she clearly wasn't the usual desk clerk - our daugher and her family went to their room after they were assured it was set up with a crib - it wasn't. My husband and I went to check out our room and I couldn't barely breathe in it -- as I said to my husband, "Somebody just sprayed this room," a man appeared who asked if the room was okay. He told us he had just been told to spray it because of the mildew smell - the "desk clerk" had called him on her walkie-talkie while we were walking to the room. After much discussion back at the desk, the night manager grudgingly moved us - to a really faded room with stained carpet, promising to move us the next day. The next day the "only" room they had to move us to was directly above a play area and next to a convention party room, so we ended up staying 6 nights in this room. The pool area is pretty, the tennis shop was shut down, the spa area is tiny. There are better resorts on Maui, I'm sure, for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Take your wallet and don't expect too much!”
Reviews.Author: Listen2Me
Reviews.Content: My girlfreind and I just returned from The Ritz this very evening, 9/3/05. While the grounds are certainly beautiful, the rooms are in dire need of a remodel. They smell of mildew, and the decor is outdated. Floral prints and wicker furniture abound here, and for the price, we were both dissappointed. I beilieve the decor is circa 1980. There is no space for clothing except in your own luggage, and even the ironing board was warped. The TV was Magnavox, and I didn't even know they still made TV's. There were as many Kapalua specific channels as other channels. In all there were approximatley 14 channels, of which 7 were Maui specific (one in Japanese). This also carried on into the Gym. The gym and pool are another annoyance. You will pay a $15 a day charge for facilities, but the gym is not full of the facilities you need and the pool is not stafed with enough employees to serve you. Do not get me wrong, the staff is amazing! They are there for your every need...there are just no enough of them at the pool. The gym is under equipped with cardio machines, and adaquite free weight equipment, and the tvs are inconsistant showing only a few channels, and all different depending on which machine you are on. The food was great! The food was also Terribly Over Priced! A candy bar costs $3 and a lemonade cost $5, not to mention tax and tip!!! With the exception of The Signature Wrap (a few pieces of chicken, in a horrible sauce, wrapped in a tortilla, with a lot of lettuce for $13) at the pool, everything we ate was delicious. The drinks were very weak though, and at the cost, they could be a little heavy handed I think! I watched, and they did not even put an ounce in the drinks. Our bath tub had a shower in it that did not work. Luckily we also had a separate shower! There was also no place to put your sundries and toiletries. As stated before the grounds were beautiful. We saw the Aloha Festival Inductions, and the grounds are built on historic land. If you take the time to tour them, it can be quite relaxing and fulfilling. The beach is beautiful and private. There are plenty of chairs, and the sun is hot and strong. The evening entertainment in the lounge is very good. The Road to Hana, Iao Valley, Kaleakala Valcano, Snorkeling, and general site seeing, can all be done for the price of gas and time. Look into things before going and do it all for free on your own. You are not limited to other's time and you can explore. Other things to avoid: Molokini snorkling. Clear water but no variety of fish. My girlfirend was a first time snorkler and was unimpressed. Lahaina Princess adventures. Boat looks nothing like the picture and other boats are more attractive. We had precooked food that was served steamed, and passed off as bar-b- que lunch. ALAMO CAR RENTALS. Yikes. We reserved our car online and got there to a huge line. Understandable. But where was our car? We waited 1 hour and 10 minutes to get a car while others who came after us got their cars and left as we watched. When our car finally arrived, the drivers window did not work, I asked an employee for help incase tehy knowa bout some lock I could not find and they left never to be seen again. I went inside to get a new car and was treated fairly and hastily, but it took still another 15 minutes to get the next car. An hour and a half - after paying for a car we reserved days in advance. If there are not evough cars don't rent them, and let the reservations have priority - or don't have reservations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Did not feel like a "real" Ritz Carlton hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just ended our honeymoon with two nights at the Ritz. Compared to the other Ritz hotels I have stayed at on the mainland, we were disappointed with Kapalua. But first, the positives. The grounds and location are absolutely beautiful and the valet attendents provided great service. If you are into golf, this would also be a great place to play. Now, the negatives. The room was not much better than what you would get at the Red Roof Inn - dirty old carpet, musty smell, awful colors, no fancy furniture like you would expect. To be fair, the bathroom was exceptional (marble, two sinks, separate shower and tub and toilet areas) and the bed was very comfortable. Overall, it was a decent hotel in a beautiful setting, but not close to the Ritz experience you would get in any major city on the mainland.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is ready for a remodel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lovemonterey
Reviews.Content: First I will say that I have stayed at this property every year sometimes twice since it has always been our favorite destination. The property is still beautiful but the rooms are in need of an update. In the 5 years we have been coming there they have not even changed a bedspread. Things are still clean but carpets and linens need help. Plus I had a horrible time once again getting my soap and shampoo refilled each day. The housekeepers guard that stuff like gold. The buffet was still very good and included(otherwise $27 p/person) if you stay 6 nights during the high season or 5 nights in the low season. We had one rude encounter with a staff member which has NEVER happened before(they go out of their way to be extra nice to you) but she apologized after the waitress overheard our complaint and she brought us a nice book with pictures of Maui (we forgave her). It was a very different experience going during the summer since the resort was filled with kids. We always go in the off season so kids running through the halls and pushing and shoving on the elevators wasn't the relaxing trip we are used to. We tried the spa this time and the Couple's Hawaiian Natural healing massage in the outdoor garden was excellent. My facial however was nothing special for the price. My husband also had a regular massage which he enjoyed. Another thing to mention is this hotel was about $1,000 more expensive this year than it has ever been. With all of this in mind I probably would have tried the Four Season's next year. Instead we ended up buying a timeshare at the Westin Kaanapali Ocean Resort Villa's. That resort is AMAZING and blew the Ritz right of the map.....I cant wait to stay there next time. P.S. Parking has become a BIG issue..... there isn't any free parking since the valet lot now takes up about 90% of the spaces.

Reviews.Title: “Wish we were still there!”
Reviews.Author: Burg
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews here, I was a nervous wreck that our 25th anniversary would be one to forget. After checking in with no problems, we were shown to our room right outside the swimming pool area. It was very clean, slightly dated, but in excellent condition. It was located close to the pool and the restaurants. We thoroughly enjoyed taking walks around the property and to the beach. Our favorites were renting a cabana for the day at the beach, sitting in the lobby listening to great entertainment in the evening, and the daily breakfast buffet. Dinner at Banyon Tree was great! After leaving this resort and going to another on the Big Island, we spent 5 days wishing we had not left. Can't wait to return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Astounding Customer Care in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Ritz for four nights in early August and loved it. I think the reviewers complaining about the room decor need to get over it -- it's not your home, someone else picked the carpet color, so what! And the rooms are not moldy, its just the type of tropical atmosphere you get when everyone has their A/C blowing at max with the Lanai door wide open. Prospective guests, don't be deterred by these comments; the place is clean and luxurious. The pool is outstanding. Unlike another reviewer, I didn't feel the hotel was at all stodgy; there were plenty of young couples and young families including small children around while we were there, yet nothing obnoxious or annoying. I might be biased because of the golf. It was simply amazing. The three different courses each have their own distinctive character that makes for true variety. I suppose you could stay anywhere in Kapalua and benefit from the golf, but we felt that the Ritz was great. If you want a luxurious hotel from a name with which you're familiar and great golf, the Ritz should sit squarely atop your list. Objectively speaking, if you don't golf, or if you plan on spending a great deal of time off-premises, the one detractor for me was that Kapalua is fairly isolated from other attractions. So the 25 minute drive to Lahaina (or anywhere else) might get annoying. (And trust me, the road to Hana is a loong day.) Regarding customer service: we found everyone to be truly interested in making our stay a great one. In fact, we had one snafu the day before our early morning departure involving a missed dry cleaning pickup on the part of the hotel. This could have been a major disaster for us, but the staff (all the way up to the hotel manager-on-duty) moved mountains to fix things. The care we were given was truly inspiring, and effectively reversed our attitude from "Such a great time, ruined by..." to "Such a great time, we'll definitely be back." I think you'll love your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Why the negative reviews? The Ritz is Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: TwoGirlsFromChicago
Reviews.Content: Boy, were we concerned about our trip to the Ritz after reading all of the negative reviews on this site. Now post-trip, happy to report that the sky is not falling and the Kapalua Ritz truly is up to the levels to be expected of a Ritz Carlton hotel. Not sure what's up with some of the negative nelly trip reports but I can honestly say that our stay was fantastic and having stayed at some of the top hotels in the world, I think we know of what we speak. Are the rooms spacious? By Maui standards, yes although they are not the largest in the Ritz chain. Rooms in need of an update? Our room appeared to have been recently redone, either that or very well maintained. The staff and services of the hotel were all within normal Ritz standards. Staff answered each of our requests with "Yes, of course" including our request for a late check-out which was some how accomodated even though the hotel was competely full. The pools and beach areas (very windy-not the hotels fault of course), are extremely well-maintained with very attentive staff (not a given at other Maui high-end hotels). One highlight for us was the incredible meal we had at The Banyan Tree. On scale with some of the best restaurants we've eaten at in Chicago. Our experiences at the sushi restaurant, Kai, were not as good. For us the one and only place for sushi on Maui is Sansei (located at the Shops at Kapalua-you can take the quick & easy hotel shuttle-also located in Kihei near Wailea). If you're coming to Kapalua to golf, the Ritz makes it easy with shuttles and club storage. Also, the three Kapalua courses will transfer your clubs between courses which was a nice feature. The only negative I can even come up with would be the Luau at the Ritz. Apparently, the Ritz has contracted this out to a family which runs the entire show (except food & bev). This was without a doubt the most uninspired luau you could imagine. While claiming to "stay true to the history of the island", the production is an absolute bore. While some of the other luaus may go over the top (think tacky), the Ritz event lacked spirit. We left early (as did a certain NBA superstar-hint, Detroit Pistons, seated next to us) and headed to the bar to listen to the great lobby entertainment. All in all, I'd give the hotel a 9.5.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful property...but hotel needs a face lift!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a week in Hawaii. We started in Kona and stayed at the Mauna Lani which was beautiful. We decided for our stay in Maui that we would book a room at the Ritz. Given the reputation of the Ritz and the well known Kapalua golf course our expectation was that it would be nothing less than amazing. After having been to the Ritz in Puerto Rico this year, which provided the "ritz level" service and beautiful accomodations, we would expect that it would only be better in Hawaii. We were very disappointed to say the least. I'll start by saying the Kapalua property is unbelievable. Set high on a cliff overlooking the ocean the grounds are pretty impressive. The rooms however are an embarassment to the Ritz name. They are run down and are badly in need of renovations. They truly look like a middle tier hotel and with the rates at the Ritz, we found this to be unacceptable. The beds are old and the decor is tired. The hotel is huge, so it really lacks the intimate level of service that you would expect. The beach is very nice, the golf courses are great, and the spa and gym are nice as well. If you are going to Maui and willing to spend the big bucks, go to four seasons. We wish we had.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: BFFsomd
Reviews.Content: We were a bit nervous to check in due to some negative reviews but happily all went well. In fact, we RECHECKED in to the Ritz after checking in to the Sands of Kahana. THe sands (condos) were not up to our standards (no air co, ceiling fans didn't work, and NOISY) so we 'went home' to the Ritz for 7 days. Service was excellent, food good, and although the rooms may not be very modern ( they began redecorating during our stay), who stays in the room anyway? We are anxious to return. Yes, we have stayed at other Ritz properties, but in Maui everything is much less formal and we were happy for that.

Reviews.Title: “Steer Clear!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Coming over from Oahu on our Honeymoon (stayed at the outrigger there), we were excited to spend 6 nights at the Ritz and then move on to The Big Island. Having been in the hotel business, I have come to know and respect the reputation of the Ritz brand. After driving for an hour from the airport, we arrived on property. The valet staff was attentive and check in was fast. We made our way to our room and let out an audible gasp when we walked into the room. It was as though we walked onto the set of "Golden Girls" The dated pink carpet and floral prints would have served most retirement villages well, but certainly not what I expected (and was disappointing). I was waiting for Bea Arthur or Betty White to walk in from the Lanai and say "just kidding." The large marble bathroom with double sink, private toilet area, and stall/tub shower was probably the best part of the room. Oddly enough, each room is equipped with a "cooler" that looks like a refrigerator, but does not work as such (its sole purpose is to keep things at room temperature), so we needed to order a refrigerator for the room. The hotel was extremely quiet and stodgy. Definitely not the place to bring kids, or young adults, or middle-aged adults, or young senior citizens...people 80 and over may feel comfortable there... Don't look for elaborate pools or resort type beachfronts...for this, you need to go to Ka'napali. The hotel is far from most everything and its restaurants are severly overpriced and overrated. We ate at the Banyan tree for dinner, where the atmosphere and live music was great, but the food left something to be desired (ie, small portions, big tickets, mediocre quality). The waiter there was handling roughly 10 tables on his own (during dinner hour) which indicates poor planning/management by the hotel. This level of (dis)service salted the wound of $200. The beach restaurant is ok, but overpriced and again the level of service (one waitress for the entire restaurant at lunch hour) made for a long wait, in addition to a ridiculous check when compared to the food quality. Luckily, our package included breakfast because I could not see spending $60 for two people for a buffet that probably costs the hotel $4.50 per person at most. We did have a good experience at the Terrace restaurant for dinner, where (once again, only one waiter) the gentlemen server was extremely friendly and hospitable. The absolute worst part of our stay was when the hotel valet gave our rental car to someone else, and someone else's car to us. We realized this after an hour into our drive to the Hana Highway. We wound up turning around and going back to the hotel. While the hotel manager on duty helped us rearrange our schedule and offered us 2 complimentary massages, this really aggravated my wife and I, as we totally blew a whole day on trying to track down our car and trying to rearrange our schedule of pre-booked and pre-paid activities. Lastly, on checkout, we had to wait 47 minutes for the hotel's only bellman on duty to take our bags from our room. This was the icing on the cake to our less than satisfactory visit to the Ritz. I would highly recommend that people stay at another property, because this is not the type of Ritz Carlton quality of service that exists on the mainland. Instead, check out the Hyatt or Westin in Ka'anapali (which is closer to Lahina and also has better weather). While the grounds of the Ritz are beautiful, the interior rooms need work, and the management could use a few pointers in how to run a more effective operation, in line with guest expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Does Not Meet Ritz Carlton Standards”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just checked into the Ritz Carlton with my wife and am shocked at the poor overall qualtiy of our suite. This comes after our insanely amazing trip to Manele Bay on the island of Lanai. The carpet is worn out is many areas and stained. Observing the room from the interior, I would expect this level of quality from a large national chain such as Hilton, but not the Ritz Carlton. For the premium rates we are paying to stay at this resort, I expected a lot more from this hotel. Next time, I will make sure to check into the Four Seasons or anther true five-star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz is Terrific”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had some issues prior to my stay at the Ritz, due to some reviews I had read here. I am a Marriott Maui vacation owner and was treated to a stay at the Ritz this year because of the renovations going on at the Marriott Maui. I took my concerns to Javier the GM. He was very, very gracious and understanding of the issues that I raised. He confirmed those issues and said the hotel staff was working hard on them and for me not to be concerned about our upcoming visit. I was absolutely, completely satisfied by the staff, resort accommodations and room. We had an wonderful time. The walk to the beach is nothing to be concerned about, especially with the continuing shuttle service they have. I liked the size of the waves, since we don't get much on the Gulf of Mexico in Florida. Wind was brisk, but it was very refreshing after spending our days out on the other parts of the island, which can be very hot at times. Even the daily rain showers were a nice break, but never did they interrupt our daily schedule. We played the Village golf course, which was a little bit of a let down. The views and layout are spectular and almost worth the price of play. However, I am not a big fan of the bermuda fairways, which were showing signs of lots of play. Being from up north I play on blue grass a lot, which really helps to improve your lie, when you are in the "short grass". While the menus are rather high for eating on site, I do recommend an evening at the beach front cafe'. You don't necessarily get a sunset view, but with the guitar player, hula dancer, ocean background, set amoung a grove of Palm trees and Tiki lites, it is a most enjoyable memory. Thinking about it now, makes me wish I could book my next airfare for next summer, but unfortunately it is too far out yet. Look forward to coming back to Maui next year, but will be staying at the Marriott. We really do enjoy the activity of the Ka'anapali Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: furgboutit
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua with my family (including 2 pre-teen kids). My overall impression is that the hotel is beautiful, in good shape and in a beautiful and quiet setting far from the hustle and bustle of Kaanapali, Lahaina or Wailea. Facilities are up to Ritz Carlton standards. Restaurants are pretty good, not great. Service levels are OK, but not what I have come to expect at Ritz Carltons - in general, the personnel there, from the concierge to the front desk staff to the pool staff are helpful, but not overly enthusiastic about helping guests. They would fit-in much better at a typical Hilton or Marriott. Another important thing to consider is that this part of the island is windier and cloudier than the more touristy areas in Kaanapali or Wailea. At some points, this was very annoying (although at other times, we commented on how nice it was not to overheat while we were at the pool). Another minor point is that the hotel itself doesn't offer a good set of scheduled cultural or recreational activities as most other luxury resorts do - in fact, when we inquired about scheduled activities, the concierge looked perplexed and referred us to the tour desk at the hotel. I would say that if we visit Maui and decide to spend the $$$$ on another luxury resort, we'd probably spring a few extra bucks and stay at the Four Seasons, where we ate a few times and were much more impressed with the hotel's staff and restaurants (as well as the hotel's ambiance). So, pluses are: - beatufiful, quiet location - very nice golf courses - good facilities - good pool and sports facilities Minuses: - very windy most of the time (and cloudy usually) - staff not up to Ritz Carlton standards - sub-par beach (although neighboring beaches are some of the best on the island) - I got a $320/night price in June - pretty good value

Reviews.Title: “I very nice hotel on Maui”
Reviews.Author: ILCPA
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is a great hotel. Although I would say it is not kid friendly. The grounds are very well kept and the pool and beach are nice. The beach is very nice and windy which is not a problem. The service in my opinion was very good. Plenty of parking, which is a problem at other Maui resorts (Westin). We had book 4 nights in a garden view and one night in a partial ocean view because the garden rooms were all booked. Upon check in they put us in a partial ocean view for the whole stay so we wouldn't have to change rooms on day five. Also our flight wasn't until 10:00 PM so we asked for a late check out; they accommodated us with a 5:00 pm check out in a different room. May only complaint would be that the rooms had a slight musty smell and the beds need to be replaced. The beds are old Sealy's with a feather topper which is not as nice as today's plush mattress. Overall a great experience in one of the most peaceful and beautiful areas of Maui. I would go back to the Ritz without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz-Carlton Kapalua - just a really nice Holiday Inn”
Reviews.Author: coecpa
Reviews.Content: The last reviewer nailed it on the head - this is not "Ritz" quality. We just arrived back from a trip with a group, and had come after staying for the first 4 days at a Mariott on Oahu (the Illihani - it was beautiful) we all thought it would only get better at the Ritz - and we have stayed at plenty. Our room stated "Run of the Ocean View" - we literally had to stand on a chair to see around a post to see the ocean - and then it was only about 5 to 8 degrees of view - we could see all the coconut trees you would want. Very disappointing to say the least. No lei greeting - just lei's hanging on a post to "take one". Rooms: Drab, need a refurb badly. Service: Well, I pulled up with 7 people in the van and had to unload my own luggage from the van - not a bellman in sight - I have never had to do this at a Ritz - 7 bags unloaded by me personally - they did show up with a cart to put them on and bring to the room. Grounds: Beautiful when you walk around. Final thoughts: I would not return here - in fact, I sincerely believe some of the "exceptional" reviews listed here are false. This hotel is absolutely not Ritz quality - save yourself the aggravation of high expectations and low realizations.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz was a let down.”
Reviews.Author: Tinlemon
Reviews.Content: Given the many glowing reviews, especially recently, I hesitate to provide my review considering that most people will probably read it and think that I am being overly picky or irrational. To create some credibility for my review I will mention that I've stayed at many nice hotels in the past, and even over the course of our wedding and this honeymoon alone we stayed at the Ritz-Carlton (Washington DC), LeParker Meridian (NYC), Kahala Mandarin Oriental (Oahu, HI), Orchard Hotel (San Francisco) and of course, the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua. During my stay at these hotels I've come to expect a higher level of service and an overall hotel experience that can only be provided by hotels of this level, and this is also the exact reason why I came away from the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua disappointed. I'll walk through my experience and then explain why we didn't like it. LOCATION: Kapalua is definately further from the other resorts, but we liked this. After checking out the other resorts during our stay, we valued the Ritz for the fact that it was more private and relaxing. Compared to the resorts in Wailea (Four Seasons, Fairmont) you are much closer to the action at the Ritz, and are an easy 10-15 min. drive to Lahaina where it seems most shops and restaurants are. The one downside about the Ritz location is that it's very windy in the afternoons and evenings, and also the weather is pretty unpredictable. GROUNDS: What can I say...they are beautiful! The plantation style layout and lots of land make everything feel spread out and comfortable. The pool looked amazing and was much less cramped than the Four Seasons. We spent all of our time at the beach, and while it was very nice they don't allow any of the lounge chairs to actually be on the sand... you have to sit in the designated area. Initially I didn't like this, but I got over it and it wasn't much of a problem. The beach that the Ritz is on is a public beach, but since it is further north it was never crowded and used primarily by guests of the Kapalua resorts. The lobby is very open and impressive with an expansive view of the entire resort all the way down to the ocean as soon as you walk in. CHECK-IN: Easy check in.... we jumped out of our car and went to the desk where we were greated with a lei. They offered us some guava juice as they went over the details with us which was a nice touch. Our bags were delivered promptly to our room and our car was parked without us ever having to go back outside after check-in. ROOM: This is where I start to have problems. Since this is a plantation style resort, picture the hotel to be a large U shape where the lobby is at the bottom of the U and the rooms are down 2 long halls ways to each side.... we of course got the second to last room. We joked that we needed to have a golf cart pick us up every morning, but it was a pretty annoying walk by the end of our stay. The room itself was U-G-L-Y!! Having stayed at the Ritz previously I know they use a more classic floral style for their rooms, but this was just bad. It reminded us of a cheap beach hotel. There was a white bamboo entertainment center with about 10 empty shelves, a small (27") outdated TV, our minibar was complately empty, there was a simple sitting area consisting of one white wicker chair and small table, and then a desk. The balcony was nice, and we had a real nice view of the ocean, golf course, and this small church that ended up being a wedding factory (several weddings there each day). We had a partial ocean view room and I'd say that 99% of the rooms fit this category, and full ocean view rooms are difficult as well since the resort is set pretty far back from the beach. Don't stress too much room about location because none of the rooms look over a parking lot or anything like that, mostly just golf courses. SERVICE: Service was just OK to me. The bellmen and valet were professional and friendly, and very helpful with everything... from directions to restaurant suggestions. They were all exceptional. The rest of the staff was nothing special.... in fact, this is where a lot of my frusturation with the hotel stems from. For example, while sitting at the beach (in the designated sitting area) for approx 4 hrs each day we never once had anyone come by to offer us a drink or see if we wanted something to eat. On another day we were out of our room from 7am until 4:15pm and our room never got cleaned. Also, the halls had these tables that were always full of garbage..... mostly left over room service dishes. The list goes on, but to me it seems like they need some extra staff or something because there are some details being missed that a hotel with a world wide reputation like the Ritz shouldn't be missing. ~~~~ The root of my problems with this hotel were the fact that when you stay at a luxury hotel such as the Ritz, you expect a higher level of service. Even comparing this Ritz in Maui against another Ritz (in DC) I am surprised that corporate has let this resort shape into what it is today. Throughout my stay I started making a list of the things that just struck me wrong which will eventually be made into a letter and sent to the appropriate people. Some of the other things that frusturated us were: -resort fee... $15. what this covers according to the front desk person... toll free calls only (still get charged .75 per local call), free day time valet, access to gym, reduced rates on tennis and golf (shouldn't you just include tennis in the fee!), complimentary coffee each morning in the lobby (no pastries or anything), and a newspaper. This is no exageration. For a luxury hotel to even charge for local calls is rediculous. I feel like this charge is worthless and I could've easily done without ALL of these services... but you don't have that choice. - No beachside waiter service... in previous hotels I was getting served complimentary papya slices at the beach, but here all they put out was a cooler of water and some paper cups. Then on top of that they would clean up the beach chairs each day at 3pm, which to me is pretty early. I also didn't like that we couldn't use our chairs on the beach, but I suspect that was because the beach was public (although, after seeing other resorts having beach chairs on the beach I don't know why the Ritz doesn't). The little tables around the beach chairs were also always littered with used cups and I watched numerous staff pick up used towels etc from the chairs but never touch the used paper cups. - didn't refill soaps and shampoos daily. I know this seems silly, but even if you stay at the local Holiday Inn they will toss a new bottle of shampoo into your bathroom each day. Nope... not at the Ritz... what we got on the first day of our stay was all we had for the duration. I'm sure I could've requested more, and I admit that I didn't even need the extras... it just seems cheap and another way they are cutting corners. -sheets weren't long enough on the bed. Each morning our feet were on the matress pad. Also, our matress pad was off center was hanging off the side of the bed....we had to fix this ourselves. - security chain on back of door was backwards... so if you opened the door the chain popped off. Again, there is a lack of attention that SHOULD be there at a place like the Ritz. - tables in halls always had leftover room service dishes on them. That's fine that people put their dishes there, but it's not fine that nobody comes by regularly to clean the halls. If you're going to have these tables you need to have someone take care of them. More attention to detail that is missing. - breakfast buffett was completely overpriced for what was offered. It was something like $25/pp for a very basic spread, and one morning we didn't even get our coffee served until we had finished our meal. BOTTOM LINE: Sad to say it, but the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is just another beach hotel with nothing more to offer than any other basic resort, and you might yourself disappointed for the amount of money you spent to stay here. When we picked this hotel we were a little concerned because of the previous negative reviews, but we kept telling ourselves "Hey.. it's the Ritz... it can't be THAT bad". Well it's not THAT bad, but there are many better hotels on Maui for less money. If I were to go back again to Maui I'd probably stay in the Ka'anapali area because of it's location to Lahaina, exceptional beaches, and the nicer weather compared to Kapalua.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect 10 year anniversary”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was one of the most amazing hotels. The Banyan Tree restaurant located at the Ritz, was the best meal I have ever had. Great wine list! Expensive- YES! But, well worth with. The spa and gym was prestine. Friendly and accomadating staff. Much quieter than other Lahaina and Kaanapali hotels. We had a view of the ocean and the Plantation Golf course. It was breathtaking. The bed was very comfortable. Free Kona coffee in the lobby bar every morning. Breakfast was way overpriced. If you want an inexpensive breakfast go to Gazebos in Napali or the Honolua store located in front of the Ritz. It has food ordered to go. The sushi bar was good but it didn't have the sushi bar atmosphere if you are into that. Sansei down the street in Kapalua is a much more fun sushi place. It has sushi half price after 10 pm every week night. The pool is quiet. Not very kid exciting if you are planning on taking them. As we did not this trip. I liked the beach area and bar located just below the hotel. Its a short walk from the hotel and pool. The water was warm and calm for us. I will most certainly be visiting again.

Reviews.Title: “understated elegance”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at thr ritz for our wedding and loved the hotel. Cons: the weather is not the greatest at Kapalua Bay, although I wouldn't trade it for the southern resorts; the sky was overcast almost the entire period, while half an hour south the sun was shining; we heard this weather is quite typical of the area; the rooms are also a bit outdated; Pros: gorgeous grounds; excellent service;welcoming staff, beautiful beach, pool; excellent food at the Banyan Tree. Although the rental companies forbid you from driving north on hwy 340, we took the risk and found the drive much better than the famous hana hwy and really, not very dangerous at all. We;ll be back at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Time at the Ritz!”
Reviews.Author: Airness23
Reviews.Content: We recently returned from our honeymoon, and on Maui we stayed at the Ritz from May 16 thru May 22. I had started doing research several months ago, and my wife was a bit apprehensive due to all of the negative reviews posted on the site (roaches, dirty/musty rooms, rude staff, bad service, bad weather, etc). I had asked my sister and a friend of mine who stayed there and they assured me that we would be very pleased with the Ritz. After many weeks of debate (and a great room rate we lucked out on) we decided to go with the Ritz. Even on our drive from the airport to Kapalua, we were a bit worried. We pulled in and were greeted by an extremely nice valet, and were escorted to check in. (We lucked out at this point because we were in between two conventions that day, so no line at all). We were greeted with Leiâ€™s, and the woman at the desk was very pleasant. She then told us that they had a very special room for us, and that even though it was a long walk, it was well worth it. Well the walk was very long, but it was definitely worth it. When we arrived at our room (2153), I knew we were in for something special (corner at the end of the hallway). We walked into a corner ocean front suite (foyer, living room, bedroom, vanity room, shower room, separate bathroom and a double lanai. We were shocked. I did notice that the furniture is a bit outdated, and the TV was pretty bad as well (for example, the TV hutch was pretty ugly and it looked cheap). To tell you the truth though, we could have cared less, we were in Hawaii, and the room still exceeded our expectations. STAFF: From the bell hops, to the valet, to the maid staff; everyone was pleasant, said hello (aloha) all the time and smiled. Our luggage arrived at our room minutes after we did. The twice a day maid service was fine, but we could have done without the turndown at night, just seemed like they were in our room a lot. The concierge was wonderful, always very helpful and it seemed like they genuinely wanted us to have a great trip. (the standard champagne and strawberries was nice, but the handwritten congratulatory note was a great touch). GROUNDS: I remember a review a while back saying the grounds were in bad shape (broken concrete at the pool..) We saw nothing of the sort, in fact everyday we saw several people working on the grounds every day doing general maintenance. They have a mini golf course, bocce ball court and shuffleboard as well. We did not use these, but many guests did. POOL/BEACH: We thought the pool was great. Our first morning, we decided to hit the pool for a few hours and as soon as we grabbed some chairs, a woman came over with chair covers and towels and set up shop for us. There were many cabanas for rental, but we passed as we wanted to be in the sun as much as possible. Service was great, we got the chicken quesadillas three times that week, and the drinks were pretty good as well ($9ish). We only walked down to the beach once while we were there. I read several complaints about their beach, and we actually liked it a lot (we just liked the pool better). The views were great, no crowds, the sand was nice (read a complaint about it being rocky..), the walk was not that bad at all (are we really that lazy now??), and for those of us who are lazy, they do provide a shuttle. The water did seem a bit rough while we were there. WEATHER: Yes, it was bit cooler than Kaâ€™anapali, yes it did rain, yes it was very windy. But for 6 days in the low 80â€™s, with about 5 hours of total rain, it was a heck of al of better than Chicago. This was another worry point for my wife, if the weather stunk she would have really had a bad trip. It rained one day, so we did Lahaina, Kaanapali. (and no, it wasnâ€™t a hassle driving 20 minutes..). It was windy, but it was a nice â€œair conditionerâ€� from the tropical sun. It was cooler than the resort areas to the south, if you think 80 is cool. All in all, we thought the weather was fine, but maybe we lucked out that week. FOOD: Ate breakfast 3 days there, had eggs benedict the first time (very good) and the buffet the other 2 times. The food was pretty good, and there was quite a selection, but not worth the $24 or whatever. But youâ€™re on vacation, so why not? (try the coconut maple syrup for the waffles/pancakes, good times.) We dined elsewhere on the Island for the most part, but I really wanted to try Banyan Tree. I was VERY pleased and I highly suggest it. I got the sashimi appetizer and the Kobe Beef tartar. Both were very tasty and presented well. (my wife hates seafood and or raw meat so she watched). For entrÃ©eâ€™s, I got the Ahi Tuna and fois gras with sun dried cherries. Sounds like an odd mix with the cherries, but it was spectacular. My wife got the Proscuitto wrapped filet, and it was outstanding as well (obviously not as good as some Chicago steaks, but still very good). The service was great, and they even comped our desserts and presented us a card congratulating us on our Honeymoon. MISC: We did the couples massage in the cabana at the spa the day it rained. (I think it was $130 w/o tip, but not sure). It was my first massage, and it will not be my last. The whole experience was great, from the cucumber-lemon ice water in the locker rooms to mind-blowing massage itself. It lasted an hour, and with the relaxing music in the cabana with the rain in the background, it was perfect. I felt like a wet noodle when I was done. >>Overall, we had a great time, everything was perfect. Granted, there are some flaws, but none which ruined our trip (seems that some people have to nitpick everything, OK, so there was a roomservice cart in the hallway for 4 hours, not that big of a deal). If anybody has reservations about staying here, please do so, you wonâ€™t regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay 31May-5Jun 2005”
Reviews.Author: Biker56
Reviews.Content: Check in and Room- Courteous and efficient with Lei greeting and efficient delivery of our bags. When we arrived at our room (2321) we discovered that we had a tremendous view of the center pool and great views of the other 2 pools and ocean in the distance. Our lanai was very generous in size and was at ground level. The room was large and bathroom huge. A sufficient amount of landscaping afforded adequate privacy while not hindering the view - Perfect. Pool - We loved the pool. The three-tier design and heat (81 degrees) was perfect. The trade winds made laying out much more enjoyable in my opinion. Weather was perfect, no rain, partial clouds. The lounge chairs are padded and you add an additional white cover towel and a couple of green beach towels - superb, beyond comfortable. The staff was very attentive to our requests or needs. Location- We found the location to be great, not more than 15 minutes from Lahaina. No big deal. Grounds - agree with other recent posters, the place is fabulous. Wonderful for couples, very intimate and romantic (on our 15th anniversary trip) Staff - Very pleasant and helpful whenever called upon. I had read some neutral/neg reviews of the Ritz prior to our trip. For the life of me I can't understand why anyone would find fault with the place. Absolutely wonderful, really capped off our 16 day stay since the previous 11 days were at the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “The Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: papaStl
Reviews.Content: It's hard to appropriately describe the fine quality of the staff and the facility...above excellent. Ritz outdid themselves on this one

Reviews.Title: “Paradise found!”
Reviews.Author: patriotic
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel. We had a club level room (worth the splurge for the lavish food presentations and inclusion of alcoholic beverages, especially the freshly made Mai Tai's!). The property is gorgeous and feels like paradise. It is away from the hustle and bustle of the more touristy areas. The beach was clean and pretty however, the water was fairly rough and might not be for children, depending on the time of year you visit and the currents, etc. This was the only drawback that we found. We would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: SWTwo15
Reviews.Content: We did quite a bit of research before our stay - May 30th to June 5th - and did hear some negative reviews of this property. For those considering this property, I have nothing but high marks and reports to give you. The negative reports that we saw on here were, in our experience, totally unfounded. Prior to arrival- I called the day before we were to arrive and asked the desk worker to, please, try to put us in the best room they could. He said that they were going to be quite full, but would see what he could do. The trip - a long way from Pittsburgh to Maui - but all things in life that are worthwhile are worth waiting for we discovered. On the return trip, we found the airport to be much more busy than we anticipated so allot yourself more time Check in - Courteous and efficient with Lei greeting and efficient bell service. When we arrive at our room (1336) we discovered that we had a tremendous view of not only the pool area but also the grounds and ocean. The perfect view! The room was very clean and showed not a sign of wear or abuse. I must say that the room was a little smaller than I was expecting, but in light of all the positives, this was easily overlooked. We were in Maui, after all, and did not plan on spending too much time in the room. Pool - we tremendously enjoyed our time at the pool - which was popular but never overcrowded. The three-tier design with waterfalls was quite beautiful and the cocktails ($9) were very refreshing and inviting. We enjoyed our servers and they were all quite effective and quick with all of our orders. Valet - When we called ahead, our car was always out front and waiting for us when we got to the main entrance. By the way.. splurge a little and get the convertible. The drives we had around the island with the top down, sun shining and magnificent views just added to our overall enjoyment of this trip. Trips to nightlife - We heard horror stories from guests on here who thought that the Ritz was too far from the nightlife....this is far from the truth. We were able to get to Kaanapali and Lahaina within 20 minutes, and, as mentioned before, we enjoyed the trips immensely. The trips we made were, in some cases, during what would have been peak travel times (between 4-8) and we never ran into any traffic of any note. We enjoyed Lahaina and the shops, restaurants and clubs and also Whalers Village. We had a terrific dinner at the Hula Grill (highly recommended!) to start off our trip and walked right out on Kaanapali Beach afterwards during the sunset - perfect end to a long day of travel. We did lots of other things, but I will write about these outside of this review of the Ritz. Beach - the DT Fleming Beach at the Ritz was superb - absolutely beautiful and pristine. Since the access to it is through the Ritz property and since it is "so far away" from everything else, we had to endure a perfect island paradise with at most 20 other people on most days - our first two days we counted 6 other people on the beach and the weather was simply perfect. The beach is quite large meaning that there wasn't anyone within 50 yards of us at any given time. This, to us, was reason enough to wholeheartedly endorse the Ritz - the peace and tranquility of having a tropical paradise almost to yourself. The waves were not conducive to body surfing or boogie boarding when we were there, but were perfect for just bobbing and cooling off. I feared that the water was going to be too hot to be refreshing but was relieved to find that it had just the right amount of "bite" to cool you off on a hot day (temperatures ranged from 87-92 each day) We saw kayak-ers, boogie boarders, and snorkelers (although I don't think this beach is known for snorkeling). The Ritz has all kinds of rental gear for the beach available. We took advantage of the beach chairs and enjoyed lounging in the surf. One possible negative...it was windy and sometimes the sand did whip into our faces which could be unpleasant. We looked it as the perfect excuse to jump back into the ocean to wash off...still, for those who are particularly sensitive to sand, we did find some merit in this complaint. If you have our attitude about it, it wasn't an issue...and remember they have plenty of recliners off the beach near the entrance that did not have this sand/wind problem...or go to the pool. Grounds - perfect array of flowers and tropical arrangements. The lava flow jetty made for an interesting morning walk - I went all the way to the end with the pounding surf and experienced one of those "ends of the earth" moments one bright and sunny morning. An exceptional personal experience. Bocce ball, tennis, and putting green also were available for recreation Food - We were there as part sales reward and part vacation and did not want to use up all of our per diem money on high priced breakfasts, so each morning we arose - had a complimentary cup of java at the Ritz and a piece of fresh fruit, then walked up to the Honolua Store a short walk off the Ritz grounds. There we had wonderful relaxing breakfasts outside on the porch - watching golfers and others coming and going starting their day. Nice view of the golf course (Bay course) there as well although we must have been on one of the later holes as we never saw anyone that bright and early on the hole that faces the store. We did each lunch at the Terrace on day and we both enjoyed our choices - but it was expensive. We also ate lunch at the restaurant near the beach one day - I really enjoyed my salad with rock shrimp, but my wifes Kahlua pork sandwich was soggy. Being there on a part business trip - we also had a group breakfast function - basic fare of scrambled eggs, sausage, pancakes, bacon etc. As far as buffets go, it was fine...I certainly have had much worse. Our dinner function was terrific - a steak and chicken dinner - the food arrived fresh and hot and the steak, especially, was cooked to perfection. We did have breakfast in bed our last day and, sure enough it was expensive...but the food was of high quality. We also ordered a late-night pizza on night and found it to be quite delicous and, considering where we were, reasonably priced. Shops - there are a number of high priced shops on site with beautiful clothing and jewelry...if you are looking for that type of thing. Spa - my wife had a massage and facial and enjoyed the pampering and talk with the masseuse who told her a lot about Maui and the other islands. She enjoyed her morning at the spa immensely. Concierge - very professional and helpful with suggestions and in making reservations - did all that we asked quickly and efficiently. Staff - we did not run across anyone at the Ritz who was not pleasant and many remembered us by name when we ran across them. In short, you get the attention and respect that you would want from a 4-5 star resort On the day we were to leave, we took a ride to the south end of the island and it was quite beautiful, and, admittedly we did not spend any considerable amount of time there. But we were quite certain that Kapalua was the right location for us. The Ritz was perfect, the DT Fleming beach pristine and isolated, the nightlife in Kaanapali and Lahaina was easily and enjoyably reachable and accessible. In short, you will love this resort....we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Not for beach and water lovers”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Ritz Carlton Kapalua with our two children. This was our seventh trip to Maui, but first to the Kapalua area. We have always stayed on Wailea. Since this is the windy side of the island,it is wonderful for people who like to do outdoor activities like golf, hike, play tennis, etc. You will not feel as hot as Wailea. If you love being in the water as I do, you may not want to be in Kapalua. The ocean was cold and very rough, tossed me over twice in 15 minutes and every day there was a red flag warning not to go in. Took the free shuttle to the Kapalua Bay Hotel and used their beach which was a little calmer, but still cold. The air is cool, so the pool was cold as well. Its great if you just want to sit poolside and not get overheated. Don't eat at the pool. Have an attendant take you down to the Ritz's beach in a golf cart if you don't want to walk, and eat at the Beach House which has spectacular views and a better selection than the pool. If you have children, be sure to ask for the kid's menu at all hotel restaurants. It's a great deal, and good food, but the pool attendants don't offer it unless you ask. Fun poolside activities include a children's playset, shuffleboard, and bocce ball. As for the hotel, I prefer an open air beachy Hawaiian look to the closed in, traditonal building of the Ritz. The grounds are immaculate and lushly tropical. The room's furnishings are outdated and worn, but we didn't spend much time in the room anyway. The beds, though, have down pillows and comforters. As for food, the Ritz is typically Maui expensive (most entrees in the 30-50 dollar range for dinner), but for the budget conscious, the reliable Kapalua free shuttle can take you to the Kapalua Bay Hotel's Gardenia Court for the early bird special ($17 for a three course dinner overlooking the Pacific), to the Plantation House for a delicious breakfast and beautiful views, or to the popular Sensei at the Kapalua Bay shops. We finally went to Mama's Fish House in Paia and are sorry we did. The kid's lunch meals are all $15 and consisted of 3 fried shrimp or two small pieces of fried fish, a small scoop of white rice and some cole slaw, with a scoop of ice cream for dessert. After a $110 dollar lunch bill for 2 kid meals and 2 adult entrees only, we were still hungry and feeling ripped off. We enjoyed our stay at the Ritz (hey you're in Maui - what could be so bad?), but we prefer the Wailea area and are headed back in March.

Reviews.Title: “RC Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: cseanmc
Reviews.Content: I felt the RC Kapalua was a great hotel. Compared to some other Ritz I have stayed in, it wasnt the nicest one, but was definitely a good hotel. I think one of the things that makes Ritz hotels is the wonderful customer service. Again, the other Ritz I have stayed in had better customer service, but I do not have any complaints about RC Kapalua. Pool was very nice. Yes, the prices for food and drinks are extremely high. There is a little general store right next to the Ritz that you can walk to. We bought beer, wine and snacks to put in the fridge. They also have lunches you can get there which will save you some money. The beach is a short hike down the bottom of the hill, but they do have golf cart shuttle service. The grounds of the hotel are very well kept. One disappointing item was b/c of where the hotel is located you do not get to see the sunsets. There are plenty of activities on or near the hotel like snorkling, golf, tennis, shuffleboard etc... After looking at other hotels on Maui, we would stay at the Ritz again. We liked the Kapalua area b/c it was seperated from the main resort areas, but close enough if you want to drive to Lahaina you could do so (it is about 20 min). There are many good shops and places to eat in Lahaina. If you want to do a luau, we would recommend the Feast at lele. Next to the Feast of Lele there is a wonderful place to eat on the ocean called Pacifico. If staying in Kapalua, would recommend going to Lahaina and sitting in a bar to watch the sunset. There are several good places on the water to do so. If looking a good happy hour, Moose & McG's has $1 drinks from 3-6 everyday. We did a snorkle trip with Blue Water Rafting. Great people and Captain Ray treated us well. They have a 5 hour trip on a small raft that only holds 5-7 people. So it is not crowded at all, but please note it is a rough ride b/c of the size raft. On the way out of Maui, try Momma's Seafood. It is near the aiport, so we ate there before our flight. It is very pricey, but the food is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing time at RC Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the 3-4 previous reviews. We read some negative reviews but booked anyhow 04-12MAY. We were upgraded to an ocean view suite (w/2 bathrooms!) upon arrival as it was our anniversary. We didn't even have to ask! Can't say enough about the location and service. Yes some may consider the furniture in the rooms in need of replacement, but for overall value in our case I give the RC a 10! We enjoyed the breezes as we are not beach people and never remember seeing any rain. Hands down better than the 4 Seasons IMO. We saw both and were glad to return to the Ritz at the end of each day. Much quieter and more tropical. A classy place that is very relaxed. Meals in the hotel are not cheap but the quality and service are both Top Notch. Pool was never crowded and was nicer than the 4 Season's pool. Best water pressure in the bathrooms I have ever seen. Meticulous maid service 2x/day. They really do make you feel welcome Can't say enough. We will return someday

Reviews.Title: “Great Service- Needs updating!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegotraveler
Reviews.Content: We went on the invite from the Marriott vacation club so of course, we were given the worst room in the place. No view and smelled like mold. The rooms really need some TLC there. We were given the option to upgrade for $185 a night so we did it. The upgraded room was much better. And didn't smell of mold nearly as much. The service is really GREAT there. They are so nice. And the pool is excellent and relaxing. Also, great weather. Not a drop of rain. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Kapalua weather, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: gene4655
Reviews.Content: Our one week stay at the Kapaluz Ritz Carlton ended May 3 with wonderful weather. We had four days clear skies, three partly clouded days, light breeze, ideal temperature. Travellers should note that there is a rainy season in Maui (January-March), and if sun bathing is sought, avoid those months. We stayed at the Club level and found the service excellent, though not quite as good as the Cancun Ritz. There was only a basic continental selection for breakfast, as opposed to full breakfast in Cancun, and the evening "snacks" were skimpier. The desserts in late evening were scrumptious, however, and plentiful. The room was beautiful, spacious balcony, marbled bath, and the two maid services per day were appreciated. The eating facilities here are very good, but pricey. The Banyan Tree restaurant closes the evenings of their luau and "taste of Maui" special nights, but should not be missed for quality of food. The beach is lovely, more private than Kaanapali, with great service available from staff. We found the short walk down to the beach no inconvenience at all, and should anyone need it, shuttle service is instantly available. The swimming area is very spacious, three adjoining pools, with many more cots available than needed. Towels and covers are easily available, and the drink servers continuously offering wonderful, though pricey, drinks. The grounds, with native Hawaian flowers, are immaculate and lovely. The short walk through some of them to the self-parking area was always enjoyed. In brief, a wonderful experience, and we will certainly go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Maui, where we spend the last two nights of our trip at Ritz, and we are glad we did. The hotel itself and the grounds were beautiful. Our partial ocean view room was clean. No roaches, no musty smell in the room, actually it smelled very nice after twice-daily hosekeeping left the room.ã€€ã€€We were upgrated from garden view room, and we believe this was possible because the hotel was not fully booked and we were there for only 2 nights. Bathroom was huge, with separate shower and bath tub. Chocolate-covered strawberries and mini album were sent to our room as our honeymoon gift. There are some reviews about bad services at Ritz, but we did not receive any bad servicesâ€¦all employees were friendly, especially the people at the front desk and the valet people. We saw the valet people running around so that they can get the cars for guests promplty, There were few employees without smiles, but they were still polite and we dont consider those as rude or bad services. We could not try the Banyantree restaurant, because we were there on the two nights they are closed (Sundays and Mondays). But we tried the breakfast buffet at Terrace restaurant and it was very good. We stuffed ourselves with waffles topped with tropical fruits butter and macademia nuts! We did not spend any time at the pool side, so cannot say anything about their services or food, but the pool area was beautiful as you can see in the photo. We preferred to go to the beach and we did not mind walking 3min to the beach at all, and they do offer the golf cart services if you ask. Fleming beach was not crowded at all, but the wave was strong even in the morning and thought not kids-friendly. An employee at the beach house told us it was not a good snorkeling beach and recommended us to go to the Kapalua Bay instead, so we did. We took the convenient shuttle service from the hotel to the Kapalua Bay, so we would not have to worry about the parking at this popular beach. We saw a lot of fish there, and when we were ready to get back to the hotel, all we had to do was just ask the people at the beach house to call the shuttle, and we did not have to wait long. We also used this convenient shuttle service when we went to the Plantation House restaurant in the golf course. We used the spa service for a couple's massages in the garden cabana. Very niceâ€¦ Next time we hope to try it in the ocean side cabana, which we were told in repair at the time. We loved the smell of the lotion they use. It was cooler and windier in Kapalua compared to Wailea or Kaanapali, but we knew about it and little rain was expected. Ritz may not be a place for families with kids, as the wave is strong at the beach and the pool may not be fun enough for kids. But it was perfect for us honeymooners. We enjoyed our stay at Ritz thanks to the beautiful settings and those friendly peopleâ€¦just what we neededâ€¦

Reviews.Title: “Plenty Ritzy For Us! We'll Be Back!”
Reviews.Author: buddybutler
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous property, roomy guest rooms, spectacular setting - the Ritz Carlton Kapalua really has it all. We were in the cheapest room category but our "terrace" (golf course view) room was elegant, quiet and private, with a wonderful bathroom. We heard all about the wind at Kapalua, but other than the first night we were there, we barely noticed any wind. The included breakfast buffet was outstanding (in the same class as the Halekulani's). The short hike to the beach didn't bother us, and we could always get a ride back on the Ritz's shuttle cart. Dinner at the Ritz's Terrace was delicious but a little pricey. We drove to Lahaina for dinner at one night at Mama's Fish House, and to Kaanapali to eat at Hula Grill. They were both great and reasonably priced, but the Plantation House right at Kapalua was one of the most memorable meals we've ever had, anyplace - and the included shuttle service took us there and back so we didn't have to worry about driving. Stunning views, wonderfully-prepared fish - get there early to get a windowside table. We almost always check out a few other hotels when we visit - the Westin Maui's rooms we thought were way too small, Kapalua Bay was looking a little neglected (it's being torn down next year, we were told), the Four Seasons doesn't live up to the reputation (overpriced for what you get, unspectacular guest rooms but fabulous activities and game room for kids if that's important to you). The Grand Wailea was the only hotel we saw that we would've considered trading for the Ritz. But with the offers available at the Ritz (sixth night free, breakfast included) it just might be the best luxury deal on Maui, especially if you don't have kids. Suggestion: the Ritz should serve regular dinners in their "Lobby Lounge". The menu there only mentions drinks and sushi bar but guests were regularly talking waitresses into bringing them burgers and sandwiches. With live entertainment each evening and a beautiful view of the property, they could draw a serious crowd for dinner at the Lounge if they just offered a couple of simple entrees like fresh fish. Everyone seemed to be having as good a time as we were. It's not the newest property, not cheap but not the highest-priced either. The setting is jaw-droppingly beautiful, service was consistently friendly, it felt like Paradise and we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Hawaii !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ritz Carlton at Kapalua for the last week of April. This was our second stay and it gets better every time !
