This could quite possibly be one of the best hotels in all of USA. The accomodations, dining, staff and location are exceptional. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel to even the most fussy of travellers, you will not be dissapointed. We'll be back as soon as we can.

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best out of Three”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This review will probably be better geared toward the vacationers going to stay at the Ritz from Dec- Mid April. First I have to say, if you want warm, balmy and swimable conditions from December to mid April, I would highly recommend that you try to stay in Wailea. 10 night trip (March 2005), staying at 3 different hotels throughout the island. We wanted to get the full experience of the island! We stayed at The FOUR SEASONS (1st stop~4nights/review posted) The Hotel HANA Maui (2nd stop~3nights/review posted) The Ritz Carlton (last stop~3nights) Everything was perrrrrfect until we reach the Ritz. The hotel itself I have nothing to complain about, as it maintains its standard, LUXURY. It is where it's located! ******************Cold, Cloudy & WINDY!******************** Average temp during our stay 72-75 The pool area is beautiful but the weather does not make it inviting to get in. The beach is about 1/2 mile(maybe a little less) down(meaning down the hill) from the building. But we saw that they have golf carts that take you down to the beach and back up if needed. Being that the weather was chilly & windy, the ocean was turbulent and unswimable. The hotel was orginally planned to be build right beside the beach but they unearthed a very LARGE ancient Hawaiian cemetery while digging. So they had to build about 1000ft back from the ocean. The rooms, restaurants, gym, spa, etc. was right on the money but the location is the downfall. This is my first time at this hotel, at this location, maybe during the summer months it is better. If we went back to Maui, we would stay at the Four Seasons & Hotel Hana Maui again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not for young families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz after spending a couple of nights at the Hyatt in Kaanapali. We had a wonderful stay at the Hyatt. Our sons (ages 4 and 6) loved the pools at the Hyatt and the neighboring beach. When we went to the Ritz, we were surprised at how completely different the weather became. It was incredibly windy and cold compared to the Kaanapali area. The Ritz also has no kid-friendly pool like the Hyatt (e.g. slide). Our youngest son kept asking to go back to the Hyatt! Note that we didn't try the kid program at the Ritz. We also like to try different restaurants. As other reviewers noted, the Ritz isn't very close to other areas and it seemed like a long drive to go places (when compared to staying at the Hyatt). Sansei is close by and I highly recommend it if you like Japanese food. For the caliber of hotel, I was a bit surprised at the number of crooked pictures and lopsided table lamps that we saw. I just assumed that little details like that would be attended to, but this is really nitpicky stuff. Having said all that, the service and facilities at the Ritz were wonderful. The accomodations were definitely in a higher class than at the Hyatt and I loved the twice-daily housekeeping. The beds were incredibly comfortable - we slept very well! Even though the hotel was booked, it didn't seem crowded. Very relaxing and quiet. And for the most part, the people working there were very friendly and eager to help.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: dogloverducy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 short days at the end of our Maui vacation and the place was wonderful. The food was fantastic - the best we had on the Island. Service was super. Very friendly staff and our room was kept in perfect shape. Beach is lovely. It was worth the price for a luxury hotel. Even when it rained we enjoyed ourselves!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel and Service!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Maui a few days ago, where we spent the first 6 days of our 10 day trip at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua. While we have been to Kapalua previosuly, this was our first stay at the Ritz, and it did not fail expectations! We checked in early on a Saturday and we were upgraded to a full ocean view. The service was outstanding! Our name was remembered by most employees (valet, front desk, housekeeping) and everyone acted liked they were genuinely pleased to serve/help you. It was like they wanted to insure you had an amazing stay. It was probably the best service we have ever received at a resort. However, (seems like there is usually one!) our only complaint was the pricing of some of the services and food. You expect high prices at such a resort, especially one in Hawaii, but a few things were a little extreme in my opinion. I just couldn't bring myself to buy a $20 cheeseburger by the pool! My husband ordered a shrimp cocktail at the lounge one afternoon ($17) and he got 3 medium sized shrimp with about 1 1/2 Tbs. of relish. I took a yoga class one morning ($15) but didn't think too much about the fee until we stayed at the Grand Wailea where it is offered for free (as well as their valet.) But even with these incidentals, I would definitely stay here again. We stayed the remainder of our trip at The Grand Wailea, which was another great resort, but their service just wasn't on the same level as the Ritz. Oh, and one more thing, my husband and I agreed that the Ritz had one of the most comfortble beds and pillows we have ever had! We slept great from day one. I love my bed at home, but I am missing those pillows!

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton Kapalua Nice but Not Perfect”
Reviews.Author: jazzmom
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 7 nights 8 days a the RC Kapalua. Drove up in our rental car and were greeted warmly at check in. We received our complimentary lei ,fruit punch and a warm towel to refresh. Our room was not ready, so we proceded to sit awhile on the lovely outdoor lobby bar to wait. We sipped our fruit punch and enjoyed the view. Met another nice couple who had just arrived and had been on our plane from Houston. About 45 minutes later we were escorted to our room. It was a ground floor room overlooking the golf course. We were not sure what type of room we would have as were in Maui at the invitation of Marriott Vacation Club to tour their property. We were comfortable enough, but noted the room decor was a bit shabby and worn. The next day we asked about moving to a higher floor. We were graciously accomodated and while we were out our luggage was moved to a new room. It was comfortable. We made a couple of requests during our stay and everything was done promptly. Everyone we talked to was delightful and helpful. Had two meals on the property. Food quality very good but very expensive. As far as the weather goes, it's true that the sun shines much more in other parts of the island and it's very windy. As we are not sun worshipers, it was not a major problem for us. If you are travelling with small children be aware the beach is not the typical postcard hawiian beach and you will do a lot of driving to visit the other sights and hotels and restaurants. This hotel seems much more appealing for adults. Overall, we would return to RC Kapalua but after a renovation of the guest rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Below expectations!”
Reviews.Author: csrighter
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from what ended up being a wonderful week in Maui. We started out at the Maui Marriott Ocean Club for two nights, because the RC Kapalua was booked for the first two nights of our trip. We arrived in Maui during what was apparently an unusual winter storm in Hawaii, so our first day was a rainout. Day 2 was much better, until we drove from Lahaina to Kapalua to check in at the Ritz. I had read plenty of review on this site and others, so was fairly warned of the weather. We figured we'd take the chance and splurge a little on a week at the Ritz. Long story short - we checked out early! We saw the sun without rain for maybe 20 minutes during the two days we were there. The wind was unbearable and the sunshiney-rain wasn't pleasant. We are sun and beach lovers, so this was a bit of a nightmare. When we awoke to more dark clouds and wind monday morning, we rented a car (definitely a must, now we know better!) and drove until we saw the sun. We spent the week in Wailea - where at most we had a partly cloudy afternoon. It was gorgeous there, and about 15 degress warmer than Kapalua. Personally, I don't think it's worth the risk - you can't predict the weather, but the odds are much better further south on the island! We stayed near the Four Seasons and Grand Wailea, which both looked fabulous. If you are going to spend the money on the Ritz, you mine as well spend it further south at the Four Seasons. Also....we were really surprised at the lack of service at the Ritz. Our oceanview room was only of the golf course. After complaining, we were pleasantly surprised by having our choice of three other ocean front rooms. Great right?? Except we were told our room would be ready by 3:30 at the latest - at 5:00 we ended up walking down to the front desk ourselves to find out once and for all what was going on. There seemed to be a break in communication somewhere along the lines, and we had to pay for it. To top it off, we were treated a bit crassly upon checkout. The gentleman behind the desk let us know we were checking out early (thanks...). But he didn't seem to care why or bother to ask. All in all, we were really disappointed. The property was beautiful - we will say that. And had the weather been perfect my review would have been different. But never again will we risk a week's vacation in Kapalua - esp. at the Ritz Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryAlbertaDaveP
Reviews.Content: Stayed in March 2005. Hotel is clean and well kept thought the decor is a little tired. Billed as a 5 star resort it is really about 4 star. Service ranges from good to awful particularly bad at poolside. Staff also range from friendly to surly depending on your luck. Very expensive meals and drinks, most people bring take out back to their rooms or eat at the local dining choices. Rooms are not particularly large, though the bathrooms were large, well appointed and clean. The beach is great although the Ritz is situated on the stromy north coast of Maui and gets the worst weather of the resort spots on the island. It rained about half the time, even though it could be sunny at the same time in Lahaina down the coast. For the money I would check out resorts closer to Lahaina or at Kaanapali.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I celebrated our 45th Wedding Anniversary In Hawaii. We stayed at the Ritz In February & were more than pleased! The service was excellant & every worker did all they could to make our visit as enjoyable as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon in Paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband & I just got back from spending our honeymoon at The Ritz Carlton in Kapalua. I had read several reviews that were questionable about the area & resort. We went ahead & decided to test all & am glad we did. The trip was beyond perfect. We checked in to find out that they had upgraded our garden view room to a full ocean view room. We had a room at the tip of the resort, so no "crooked" views of the ocean. (yes we seemed to walk a mile to get to our room each time, but exercise on vacation is not always a bad thing). Our room was wonderful, no musty smell, no swaying beds--all you could ask for in a 5 star! The staff were more than friendly, there anytime you wanted something. They even gave us a complementary photo album from the Ritz with a card congratulating us on our marriage. Yes, everything is a bit pricey but look where you are staying! We ordered room service dessert one night & they pulled up a chocolate covered strawberry with vanilla ice cream that was fabulous! *One thing to be aware of, they ask for a hold of $200/day for incidentals. I know this is customary but we don't do credit cards & were shocked to find out they held so much a day* The ocean is not right outside of the hotel, as others have complained but take a minute & realize why--there is a sacred burial ground directly in front of the hotel so there is a short walk to the ocean, but they do offer golf cart rides to & from all day. As far as bugs--ok, we saw 1 roach (yeah, you are in the tropics, they seem to be larger there!) & 2 salamandor/lizards. They didn't bother us & we didn't bother them. Most of the time away from the resort that we spent was sight seeing--Road to Hana, etc. Well worth it! If you are looking for "cheap" places to eat--we found a few that were well worth trying--Aloha Mixed Plate in Lahaina, Hard Rock Cafe in Lahaina, Hula Grill in Whaler's Village, Roys in Kahanna. We loved our trip & wouldn't change it for the world!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but not as good as the Four Seasons”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz for 2 days and at the Four Seasons in Wailea for 4 days during my honeymoon in February 2005. When we first landed, we checked into the Ritz and found it to be a very nice hotel. The service was as expected and the grounds were beautiful. The quality of the food was below expectations though. Then we moved to the FS in Wailea and my reaction to the Ritz changed. My wife and I both said the same thing - that we wasted 2 days at the Ritz! In comparison, the FS is a much much better resort. They call you by name at the FS and cater to your every need. Small details like complimentary cabanas at the pool and refilling your water by the pool, free valet parking and L'occitane toiletries make this hotel that much more luxurious. The decor in the common areas and the rooms were much newer and cleaner. The food was way better than the Ritz and the prices were the same. Even though these two chains compete for the business of the luxury traveler, at least in Maui, the FS blows the RC away. The only drawback to the FS are the room rates which is roughly 50% more than the RC. But it is well worth the money if you are on a once-in-a-lifetime trip like a honeymoon or anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “One week just isn't enough!”
Reviews.Author: Nacn022
Reviews.Content: Here I am in my beautiful room at the Ritz Kapalua. We just finished an amazing dinner and one of the room service attendants ran us down to give us chocolate covered strawberries. She said she had an extra one. That is the kind of service you will find here, from the moment you arrive at the valet to the front desk to the bellman and on and on. We booked this hotel with our Marriott reward points and they upgraded us to an amazing oceanview/poolview room #2429. They didn't have to do this but they did. We have been here now for five days and still no rain. In fact it has been downright beautiful with hardly any wind and so much sunshine. It must have been about 85 for the past three days. We are here from March 1 to the 8th. We loved the Banyan Tree. Yes it is expensive but well worth it. If you go please order the Lemongrass soup. It is amazing. It sounds different but you will not regret it. One night we even got treated to a fireworks display over the ocean. And we watched it all from our balcony! My husband looked at me and said this is the best trip to Hawaii we have ever had. This is our seventh trip so I'd like to think I know what constitutes a great Hawaiian experience. We have stayed at the Fairmont Kea Lani twice, The Renaissance Wailea, The Marriott Ocean Club, The Kauai Marriott and the Marriott Waiohai. This resort is the most luxurious and has a well trained staff that is second to none. They truly know what customer service is and will go above and beyond to achieve it. Our room by the way does not smell and we certainly have not seen any roaches. The pool is very beautiful and isn't missing any tiles. The reviewer that said it needed work must have been at another resort. The pool staff has been incredible as we are traveling with our baby girl. They treat her so well and I can't say how much it helps when I am alone while my husband is taking the three day lessons at the Kapalua Golf Academy. He highly recommends it. He has one day left and has already improved his score dramatically. There is a huge conference going on right now but you hardly notice it. We are treated with grace and ease. The staff seems to not be overwhelmed at all. Next year we are planning to come back here but not for one week, for two weeks! I will be counting the days the moment we touch down on the mainland. I am already dredding leaving this place and we still have two full days left. This place is amazing and you won't regret it! Take the bad reviews with a grain of salt.

Reviews.Title: “Even a little rain couldn't spoil the deservedly 5 star Ritz”
Reviews.Author: PTHYPE
Reviews.Content: Honeymooned at the Ritz Kapalua in February 2005...booked through Pleasant Holidays and was happily surprised to find that somehow my package included the $27 a head breakfast buffet daily. Very happy to let the packages of bagels I had bought at the Costco in Kahului spoil to enjoy the bountiful buffet at the Ritz--worth $27? No way, but for free, pass the coconut syrup and macadamia nut pancakes, please. Room was supposedly a 'garden view'...if only my garden at home looked like this...While I could see a bit of the garden from my lanai, I had sweeping full ocean views from the room, which was spacious and gorgeous. The TV was of low, garage sale quality, the kind people who are now buying plasma tv's threw out three TV's ago, but I wasn't there to watch TV...never experienced any of the probs other TA users have had...no moldy smell or roaches present in my room! Loved the comp. shoe shine! Must disagree with the user who did not care for the Banyan Tree but liked Kai, the Ritz' sushi bar...Dined at Banyan Tree the first night, food was high priced but excellent. Highly recommend the scallop/foie gras appetizer...also had the opakapaka and the mahi special with lobster medallions. The food was perfectly prepared though the wine ($50ish range Pinot Grigio) was wholly unimpressive. True, it was expensive at around $40-45 an entree, but, as about as discerning an eater as you can find, I would recommend it highly. On the other hand, Kai looks as if it were added as a sympathetic concession to the many Asian visitors...it was in the middle of the lobby bar with no noticeable difference between the raucous bar and the sushi bar. High prices for run of the mill sushi -- no toro, uni, or amaebi here...instead, you'll find very safe california rolls and $10 salmon nigiri...save your money and go to the interesting Sansei (on Kapalua) instead. Only complaint was the few hours of rain and high winds we had while Kaanapali and south was beautiful...other whine involves being told the resort fee included snorkel equipment and finding on the bill that it most certainly did not. Not even those minor complaints could ruin what was a spectacular stay at the Ritz Kapalua!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise, paradise, paradise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for 2 weeks in November 2004. I can't even begin to say how perfect it was. All employees at the hotel couldn't have been more helpful. Anything you needed, that is if they hadn't already thought of it, was there within minutes. The resort itself is beautiful, everything was exceptionally clean and fresh. We did not experience any problems with insects as indicated by another writer. The spa was under construction at the time we visited but they still provided spa service which were wonderful. The food was devine, especially the Bayan Tree restaurant. The beach is a minutes walk from the pool area. You won't be disappointed if you stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Like Paradise but only better”
Reviews.Author: kimanjo
Reviews.Content: I cannot say anything negative about this hotel. It is superb! After reading a few negative reviews I was a tad concerned, but I can't imagine what those writer's were thinking or experienced--had they even stayed at the same Ritz as I? We didn't have a suite--just a room--but what a room! Fresh towel delivery 2x a day. More toiletries than you can wink at and refreshing of toiletries as needed. The staff was more than polite-- intelligent, friendly yet reserved, professional. Complimentary shuttle bus service around the Kapalua premises (hotels and shopping). Mini-fridge (non-electric) kept cool with ice bucket inside. We shopped in a local grocery market for such items as yogurt and beverages and kept cool in the fridge. We did not eat at the Banyan Tree (the most highly rated restaurant) but we did eat at the Terrace (very good) and the Kai (spelling?), a sushi retaurant in the hotel. The night before we had eaten at the San-sei sushi restaurant in the Kapalua shops plaza, and I know that the San-Sei is the most highly rated sushi restaurant on the island, but we found the Ritz to be even better. It was the absolute best I have ever had at my life and between hubby and I and many dishes and his sake, our bill came to only $70 total. While we were there it was the Hula Bowl and there was something like 200+ cheerleaders of all ages on the premises, and we never heard a peep out of them. Talk about great soundproofing. The design of this hotel is very similar to that of the Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge in DisneyWorld, but the Ritz is much more plushly appointed. Possibly the same architectural firm?? Anyway, a couple of travelers have mentioned a funny smell in the room when the A/C is turned off and the balcony door opened. I, also smelled a faint odor (my husband did not) but I recognized it immediately as the adhesive used for laying down new carpeting. There was no musty odor in the room. All in all, a great hotel if you want to be on the "quiet" northern side of the island.

Reviews.Title: “Great Out of The Way Getaway.”
Reviews.Author: tennis_ace_2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for five nights and absolutely loved it. We have also stayed at the Four Seasons in Wailea. Great property with incredible facilites from the tennis courts, lawn bowling, pool and beach. A couple of things that people should think about is the fact that the beach is quite a walk from the hotel and the pool could use some work, but this did not affect our overall experience. Rented a cabana for a day which is actually a bargain with all the goodies and extra service you receive. Another noteworthy consideration is the location of the property. It is out of the way which we loved, but other people may not like the extra driving to sight see. Yes this property could use some updating. The rooms at the Four Seasons are much nicer, but the facilities and the staff here really make up for it. We travel alot and stay at Ritz, Pennisulas, Four Seasons and JW's etc. and always found properties to have it's pluses and minuses. This hotel is a great choice for a quieter spot in Maui.

Reviews.Title: “How can there be critics?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our best trip ever. After an exotic week treking acrross an active volcano in search of moving lava, and seemingly hiking every diverse inch of the big island, we took a local charter over to Maui and checked into the Ritz at Kapalua. I had read negative items about this hotel posted on this site prior to our trip and had mixed emotions about dedictaing an entire week to one place. I cannot believe anyone could find fault with this place. Other than the person who called them out on the slightly dated style of the halls everything else couldn't have been more wrong. A true 5 star resort. Spectaclar beach, Great food, and even for non golfers like us we never wanted to leave the compound to seek out anything (the road to hana cost us a whole day of Ritz time, not worth it!) Even at 100% occupancy (they had their premier event of the year the Mercedes Classic Golf tournament) the staff was fantastic and nothing seemed even remotely crowed (exept the lobby bar the night Joe Cocker played!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz, hated the Banyan Tree Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 3 day stay at the Ritz-Carlton in Kapalua and had a wonderful experience. When we checked in, there was an issue with our reservation. Rather than it be a big deal the desk people promptly gave us a room and settled it the next day. Boy, did we have the nicest room. Room 1142. A room at the end of the hotel facing out to the beach. The minute we opened the door, the view took our breath away. The waves, palms and coastline were framed by our ground floor french doors with a private patio. We would sit on the patio throughout the day and watch the whales play in the water. What a treat. The rooms are a little tired and the thing that bothered me the most were the stains on the older pale green carpet. It looked as if someone had gotten sick on them! The maid for some reason always left our robes in the pile that we left them in. That seemed strange, the rest of the room was very clean. However, we would stay in the room again because of the spectacular view. The Banyon Tree was a joke. We had dinner with 3 drinks and the total for 2 was $240.00. It was pretentious service and presentation in a restaraunt that is like a pool snack house with patio furniture. Half the food was delicious, but not worth the price at all. The servers were terrible and the host was the rudest person we encountered at the hotel. Eat at David Paul in Lahaina for the most exquisite, generous,fabulously served food in any restaurant anywhere in the world. We went to David Paul twice and wanted to go again but were leaving the island. We ate at Vino's for lunch at the village golf course and that was very tasty. The best food at the Ritz may be the Honolua country store on the property for lunch or breakfast. Wonderful store with homemade meals that you take outside and eat on the store porch. The tuna melt was exceptional. All in all the hotel is wonderful and we would go again. We loved the privacy of the area and not being surrounded by people with their big drink cups and laundry baskets all day (Marriott Ocean Club). It rained each day for a short time and then the clouds would open up and the sunshine would return. We will certainly go back because of the location. Do not waste your time or money at the Banyan Tree.

Reviews.Title: “Would Ritz it again!”
Reviews.Author: ChloesMomBetsey
Reviews.Content: After reading hte reviews, we didn't know quite what to expect from the Ritz. The room exceeded our expectations. The marble bathroom was truly luxurious, as were the supplied robes. My husband and I shared the King bed and our 14 year old daughter slept on a roll-away (read- very nice twin bed on wheels,) which we put out on the room's balcony every night. Basically, she slept outside the entire 6 night stay. So fun! Our room was partial ocean view and full pool view. I did not notice any mustiness issues; we did request a down free room, due to allergies. Perhaps that made a difference? Due to weather we arrived one day late. Even though we prepaid with a package, they shifted the room dates so we wouldn't lose anything. I thought that was gracious and more than one would expect on a holiday week. I loved and hated the seclusion of the Ritz. After visiting Ka'anapoli Beach and seeing the MOBS of people down there, I liked how quiet the Ritz was, even though they were quite busy over Christmas break. However, it was a very long way to drive for ANYTHING. So it's a trade-off. The beach and pool were beautiful and not crowded. If we return to Maui and the Ritz I will be prepared for the very high restaurant prices. We got in late and "grabbed" hamburgers at the Terrace Restaurant. At $17/ each those added up very quickly. A 12 oz. coke at the pool was $5. There are reasonable prices to be had for good food on Maui. You won't find them at the Ritz, however.

Reviews.Title: “Ritz Carlton junkie!!”
Reviews.Author: MizzPisces
Reviews.Content: The best thing about my recent trip to Maui was my stay at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua! This service-oriented hotel has amazing amenities and very accommodating and polite staff. Unlike the rude reception my boyfriend and I received at the Grand Wailea (see Grand Wailea review). I don't think I ever heard a NO from any of the Ritz staff. The executive suite is huge with two marble bathrooms. The view of the three-tiered pool from my private lanai was gorgeous!! The restaurants were excellent. Musty smell?? Never noticed it. Must be all the beautiful orchids/flowers in my suite everyday. We had a really nice gentleman at the front desk who checked us in and out. He was very polite and very discreet when I encountered a problem with one of my credit cards. Also, the cabana/poolside wait staff were wonderful. I loved this hotel so much, I'm on my way back there this Friday. I've stayed at both the RC San Francisco and Half Moon Bay and they all top my list. If you want to feel really pampered in your next vacation, you should check this hotel out.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it.”
Reviews.Author: bird1010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz for five days in October of 2004 and I absolutely loved it. I am a discerning traveler who can usually find something to complain about but was pleasantly surprised. We had stayed at the Kea Lani for the week prior to our Ritz stay, which was lovely. The prices at the Ritz were almost half of those at the Kea Lani and it is a breathtaking property with fabulous rooms. I recommend staying at both using the "fifth night free" promotion both hotels offer. The restaraunts at the Four Seasons in Wailea are world class and so is "Vino" in Kapalua. Definitely get the breakfast package in both hotels, the Ritz's is the best, but the Fairmont is awesome too.

Reviews.Title: “PARADISE FOUND!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Ritz Carlton Kapalua is perfect in every way, quietly elegant, fabulous grounds, pools, beach and acres of greenery. My family of four stayed from December 18th thru December 25th and our holiday could not have been more enjoyable. Prior to arrival, I read some so/so reports on the web, those reviewers must have been on another planet. I must compliment the Ritz staff, from the manager to the room maids, they were without a doubt the very best resort staff we have every experienced, pleasant, warm and helpful. We will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe the conditions at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I surprised my husband with a ten day rather than a seven day trip to Hawaii. We had been there for our Honeymoon and were looking forward to the return eight years later. We had left the Maui Ocean Club with a less than perfect stay because of the mold in the air conditioner and the room over the laundry area that had constant aroma of laundry detergent wafting into our room. I assured my husband that it would be worth the extra money for a first class hotel. On check-in, we were told our reservation was lost. We went to the Terrace Club for a pizza while we waited for them to work it out. Two of the three ingredients on our pizza were missing and about fifteen minutes later they arrived on a separate plate. The waitress apologized and was very nice. Two hours later (because the delay with the pizza) we tried checking in again, they still couldn't find the reservation, but gave us a room anyway. When we arrived, the bellhop laid out our suitcases, took his tip and left. It was then that I noticed the robe on the chair (used), the jacket from the previous guest's stay on the table, and when I walked into the bathroom was shocked to see open toiletries everywhere. I called for assistance to clean the bathroom and 40 minutes later walked to the front desk with the open bars of soap, shampoo, etc. to exchange. It was another 20 minutes before a maid showed up to clean the room. That night, I was tired and disappointed but determined to make the best of it and laid down on the bed, curled up on my side, and promptly slid to the floor as a result of the swayback mattress. I propped up the mattress with a pillow and just slept, hoping the next day would be better. We left a note for them to switch or flip the mattress and weren't surprised when the tip was gone, but the note still there hours later. The best part of the stay was the pool, we had it to ourselves at night and swam our frustrations away, but I feel we were robbed for the price we paid for a mediocre dirty room, less than five star service, and a lack on the part of management to make things right. I will never pay to stay there again. And oh yes, I took pictures of the room and mattress to share with my friends back home just in case they thought it too bizarre to be real.

Reviews.Title: “simply awesome”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hi guys, I have a family of four and we found this resort to be simply amazing. We also had the chance to visit other hotels in the region and none of them even compared to the Ritz. (We visited the Hyatt and Marroit). The pools were awesome the beach was both exclusive and clean. THe facilities were another thing that amazed us. The gym, spa, and activity room for the kids were all highlights in our trip. All in all.....If theres one place to stay in maui its the Ritz!

Reviews.Title: “Great Setting, Rooms OK”
Reviews.Author: FenwayFan
Reviews.Content: Giving this hotel a single grade is difficult because there are some things about it that were great and others that were only so so at best. Kapalua is absolutely beautiful, and the fact that it is away from the hustle and bustle of Lahaina and the glitz of Wailea was exactly what my wife and I were looking for on our honeymoon. As background we spent two weeks in Hawaii and were really looking to relax. The Four Seasons Hualalai was perfect for our first week, but our second week was to be spent in Wailea. We checked into our hotel and then checked out the next morning. We drove to Kapalua and checked into the Ritz. The hotel does not feel like a huge beach resort, rather it feels a bit more like a relaxed, upscale seaside lodge. The views of the ocean and other islands are gorgeous and the rolling lawns and golf courses surrounded by forest give a little feel of being in the mountains. Also despite the fact that the Ritz is bigger than either the Maui FS or Fairmont it feels more intimate and less cramped. The food at the Banyan Tree was wonderful and the burgers I had for lunch down at the beach bar (go here instead of Cheeseburger in Paradise) were two of the best I have had anywhere. The breakfast buffet was good, but after two weeks of breakfast buffets I was more interested in fruits and juice than omelettes and bacon. The pool is very nice and the overall service, while not quite as attentive as the Four Seasons, was mostly good. However, this resort has a few areas to improve upon, the most important of which is the rooms. Since my wife and I were last minute guests we did not have much choice, but we did look at a few rooms and each one had the distinct mustiness mentioned by other posters. I have bad athsma so it was almost enough to keep us away, but we really liked the setting and feel of the hotel and knew we would not be happy in Wailea. Since it was not uncomfortably hot at night (the cool mountain breezes helped) we wound up keeping the windows open and the A/C off most nights and this helped the smell immensely. I think the smell came mostly from the A/C vent because the minute it was turned on the smell would return. The furnishings were a bit dated and the beds were mediocre at best. While I mentioned that the hotel setting is beautiful, the grounds could use a little bit more attention. A few of the tiles around the pool and on the walkways were broken or missing and little things like left behind trash or overturned flower pots were not dealt with in what I would consider a timely manner. The tennis courts were built in a nice cluster with a clubhouse, but the clubhouse was closed while we were there (is this permanent?), and the courts seem to receive little love from the staff these days. I do not know if I payed the $15 resort fee because my travel agent handled all of the arrangements, but hidden charges like that irritate me. The $15 valet parking fee seemed unusual given that it was a complimentary service at the other hotels. I only used it when we checked in, but was annoyed since the majority of the hotel parking spaces were reserved for valet parking. Overall my wife and I liked the Ritz and for what we wanted it was the best spot on Maui. However, it is likely that our future Hawaiian vacations will focus on the Big Island and Kuaui and not Maui. Maui was just a little bit too touristy and built up for our liking.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Hawaii”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel was Fantastic !!!! We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapulua for 7 days and it was just WONDERFUL. Great service Staff are very friendly and the views and the rooms and pools are just Great !!! I and my family will be defenitely going back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: GinaCalifornia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a short (3 night) trip to Maui and stayed at the Ritz. I've stayed in both Kaanapali (Alii) and Wailea (Four Seasons) in the past so this was my first time in Kapalua. We loved it! The resort was quite empty and peaceful and the staff were all extremely friendly from check-in to check-out. The layout reminded me a lot of the Four Seasons although the swimming beach in Kapalua was not as calm as in Wailea so we didn't get to go in the ocean as much as we would have liked. But it was very refreshing to be away from the more crowded areas for once. While the Four Seasons is amazing, I now prefer the Kapalua area for much better views, a little cooler (which was perfect- highs around 85) and more laid back. We didn't get a chance to eat the Banyan Tree as we didn't realize it was not open Sun-Mon (we stayed Sat-Mon and hit Roy's our first night) but we'll definitely check it out on our next trip. The pool at the Ritz was spectacular - we sat at the base of the lowest level so we could see the view of the waterfalls cascading from the upper levels. Again, a very peaceful place. Definitely a 5 star resort. Our room was very nice - no musty/mildew smells or sightings at all. We were upgraded from a garden view room to a partial ocean view (facing the pool area) which other than having to deal with someone on a lower lanai smoking a cigar, was also a great location.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK, but not great”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We arrived on December 4th for 7 nights. I had used reward points from Marriott to book the room so the hotel had not cost me anything. I had read many horrible reviews and we were definitelty concerned. We were upgraded from a garden view room to an ocean view room in the Honolua wing. The room was ok, but not much compared to some other 5 star hotels I'ved stayed in. There was no musty smell or mildew anywhere. The service was very much up to Ritz standards. We ate at the Banyan Tree 2 times and both times were excellent, probably one of the best restaurants on the island. The weather was not great at all. Thankfully we had a car and drove down to Wailea almost everyday to go to the beach. If you are considering the Ritz Carlton make sure you have a car available, otherwise you will be stuck in the Kapalua resort and that's it. It was a average experience which we enjoyed, but thankfully did not have to pay for it. If I had to pay that much for a room I would stay at the Fairmont or Four Seasons in Wailea. Also, we heard through the Marriott grapevine that Kapalua Bay will be a Marriott Grand Residence and that the Ritz Carlton will be turned into a Ritz Club. If anyone is interested in dining suggestions, Chez Paul's was amazing and Mamma's Fishhouse was good, but very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “we had a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: bishopdds
Reviews.Content: We had a terrific stay at the ritz nov- 26-29th. Before going I had read some of the reviews and I was a little leary about what to expect. We arrived at the hotel tired after a 14+ hour plane ride and we were greated by everyone with a very pleasant "aloha" attitude (this included our lais, cold towels, cold juice & attention to our baggage). Our hotel rooms were great. We just booked a "standard" room and had wonderful views of the grounds, the pool and the ocean, but every room here has a balcony with a table and two chairs for reading on it). I was concerned about the mustiness that so many people have mentioned- please keep in mind that you are in hawaii- at the foot of a rainforest- it is not that bad- you can turn the air conditioning down as low as you would like- but if you keep your patio doors open the air will shut off, i.e. the humidity will come in. If you have ever been to Florida, or anywhere in the south- the humidity here is not that bad in comparison- if however you are from the dry western states then I think that you will notice the humidity. When we were there I found that there was no "dress code" to the coffee bar, as you would expect at any nice hotel no one walked around in ripped up clothing, but you did not have to "dress up" as was implied in another review. There were alot of families staying here and although we have no kids it seemed as though everyone treated the kids with equal respect. The onsite dining is good and going to the plantation golf course- they have a shuttle if you do not have a rental car- offered wonderful views while dining. We did dine at the bayan tree restaurant on site and thought that the meal was wonderful along with the service. I feel that this is a wonderful hotel to stay at if you enjoy golfing as we do, or would like a nice quiet location to enjoy you time in maui.

Reviews.Title: “Meh- it was okay”
Reviews.Author: igotoou
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in October for about 10 days for our honeymoon. We felt like we were at a honeymoon factory - they tried to make us feel special but it was pretty robotic - preprinted cards saying Welcome to your Honeymoon. With so many couples on their honeymoon though, it was nice of them to at least try to make us feel special. We actually stayed at a Four Seasons on our wedding night before our flight to Maui and they gave us a handwritten note and some chocolates. At the RC in Maui, they did give us a complimentary bottle of champagne. The lobby was really pretty. We were greeted with leis and fruit juice. The views of the ocean from the lobby were spectacular. Our rooms were not what I would call the nicest we have ever stayed in. They looked really cheesy and outdated - with bamboo and wicker furniture and really old television and alarm clock. The carpet was green and had stains. The bathtub was just okay, not very fancy and didn't really seem like it was built for two. Room service was mediocre. They pride themselves on saying they clean the room twice a day, but I think they only changed our sheets and bedding once while we were there and the room wasn't that impressive. Room service was a rip off. Everything was pricey, and we started ordering off the kid's menu because it was the same, if not better food, for a lower cost. It took forever for them to come get our trays. Once we called after we were done eating, waited about half an hour, decided to leave and came back about 4 hours later, and the table was still in our room. We pushed it out to the hall and called room service again to let them know about the table. It stayed there for another 4 hours. We peeped in the morning and it was finally gone. We did stay on the Club Level, but I didn't feel like this was any big deal. There were a TON of people there, it started to feel like a frat party sometimes. There must have been a young group who traveled together because they would go in, take all the tables, order a bunch of beers, and be loud and obnoxious. However, the concierge on the Club Level were absolutely WONDERFUL!!! They made our stay worthwhile. The pool area was nice. They come by every once in a while with water and a piece of pineapple when it got hot. There were lots of kids by the pool though, which is not something you really want to see on your honeymoon, but then again, we weren't at a Sandals so we can't really complain. The beach was gorgeous. We had a lot of fun playing in the waves and it was very clean. Overall, it was an average hotel with really high prices. I don't know what the $15 fee per day was for. We parked our own car instead of paying another $15 for valet. The spa was okay. We enjoyed our massage, but it smelled really musty and the gym really reeked and it was close to where we had to go for our treatments. The carpets looked really old too. The sushi place at the hotel was fantastic. They had great California rolls and sake. I also recommend the breakfast buffet - so yummy, especially the macademia nut pancakes with coconut syrup. Lots of fresh fruit. We will probably go back to Maui someday, but I would like to look into other hotels in the area. It just wasn't worth the money. It was just okay.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service at the Ritz-Carlton!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My sister & I stayed at the Ritz Carlton for a week (girls' getaway). We had a suite, loved the bathrooms. Maid service was impeccable, seemed to anticipate every need. I cannot say enough about the customer service. Everyone was so polite and friendly. I fully expected to be intimidated by the staff, but they were so nice! When my Sis mentioned to the bellman in passing that the Plumeria was my favorite flower, he CLIMBED A TREE and brought me one, placed it behind my ear. I have my own business, and that is how I want my employees to treat the customers. Everyone, from the front desk to the waiters, to the attendants at the beach, was so friendly and helpful. The only thing that keeps this post from a 5-star review was the parking valets. They seemed very cursory and were driving recklessly with the cars. After the first day, we parked our own. But all-in-all, we had a wonderful time. Contrary to earlier postings, did not notice ANY smells or bugs...everything was spotless. (Of course, we were not looking for a "free" room, either.) The breakfast was wonderful! Every hotel should have this standard of service. We took the Road to Hana. No matter what anyone says, it was worth it! You must do this!! Oh, do I want to go back, & take my hubby this time...still dreaming about that beautiful beach and the Lava Flows at the bar!

Reviews.Title: “Better places to stay on Maui”
Reviews.Author: HeyMan76
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Ritz for a week this past May and let me tell you that for the price, there are at least six better hotels that are nicer and in better locations than the Ritz. For starters, believe everything you here about this hotel being in a bad location. It rains hereâ€¦ a lot! I saw the reviews before I went and thought to myself, â€œIâ€™ve been to Maui two others times and it never rainedâ€�. Well it still didnâ€™t rain in the other locations I stayed at even on this trip ( Kaanapali beach and Wailea), but boy did it ever rain in Kapalau where the Ritz is located. Everyday there was more rain and wind than there was sun. And from what Iâ€™ve come to learn, this is pretty much par for the course on this part of the island. Even discounting the poor weather conditions, this Ritz does not come close to living up to the expected Ritz standards. Average rooms that look as though they have not been updated since the hotel opened well over ten years ago. The spa was a complete joke with broken equipment, worn out carpeting and even worse, poor service. My wife made a massage appointment two days in advance and when she showed up they said they had overbooked and couldnâ€™t honor her appointment. They did offer to reschedule but since we were leaving the next day, she was, to quote the receptionist, â€œout of luckâ€�. Pool area was just O.K. (youâ€™ll find much better at the Hyatt, Four Seasons, Grand Wailea and of course, the Fairmont). Even the Marriott on Kaanapali is nicer than this Ritz, though more crowded with kids and families. Beach was another big disappointment. If youâ€™re looking for a beach front hotel, definitely do not stay here. Kaanapali or Wailea is your best bet. You spend enough (probably more than you should) when traveling to Hawaii. Staying at the Ritz will have you paying a lot and getting very little.

Reviews.Title: “A must for your honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Ritz, I do not understand why this hotel has gotten so many bad reviews. My husband and I stayed at the Ritz during 10/21/04-10/26/04. We were to be married in Maui and decided on staying at the Ritz despite all of the bad reviews. From the time we arrived, we were welcomed with many friendly faces, one of the bellboys drew us a map of the island with all of the must-see spots (since it was our first time in Maui). The woman at that checked us in, Amanda, was very nice and did everything in her power to upgrade us to a suite. The Concierge sent us complimentary strawberries, champagne, and a Ritz Carlton gift because they somehow found out we were getting married in Maui. My husband made friends with some of the employees, (Hi Ken). We had a great time and will return next year. The only downside is that the hotel is a little pricey, but it is a very, very beautiful hotel and highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Even roaches stay away from the Ritz @ Kapalua”
Reviews.Author: jja347
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton, Kapalua Bay Resort for our honeymoon and it was terrible. We booked the resort expecting to enjoy a five-star hotel in Maui. This certainly was not the case, especially when compared to our experience at the other five-star hotels we stayed at on Hawaii and Oahu. From the moment we arrived, we knew we wanted to leave. We had to remove our own bags from our rental car since the young woman who was working at the bellhop desk could not lift them herself. Inside, we were not greeted as we had been when we arrived at the other hotels we had visited with flower leis and cool drinks. While checking in, we were not placed in the same room category as we had reserved. We were told the only room ready was one with a partial ocean view. What initially appeared to be an upgrade, was in fact a pool view room with a huge palm tree obstructing any view of the ocean. We were given the keys and told to walk down the hallway and find it ourselves. We were not offered any tour of the resort, explanation of amenities or services, nor the breakfast that was included in our rate, or locations of the various facilities. In fact, there was a whole hallway full of shops that we stumbled upon before we checked out that we never knew of. To add insult to injury, during our stay we watched as other guests were greeted with such amenities and shown to their rooms by hotel staff. While the property at the Ritz Carlton is aesthetically pleasing, it certainly leaves a lot to be desired in every other department. The room had a musty odor that resembled dirty socks and urine and overall was generally was dirty. The housekeeper did not change or even pick up our robes off the floor during our entire stay. The sheets were not changed. Those are just complaints related to the condition of our room. While at breakfast the first morning, I was given a "wake up call" by pouring clumpy sour milk into my coffee. Trying to relax at the pool was impossible. There are no umbrellas to shade guests from the intense Hawaiian sun. In order to sit in a cabana, you need to rent it for more than $75 a day. While at the pool one day, a rude waiter insisted that we moved seats while he was ordering our drinks despite us being the only people sitting in the particular location for forty minutes while waiting for him to return. We even overheard him bad mouthing us to other guests. Our bed was broken and worn out. There was a big gully on one side. After complaining about the bed, we returned one night to find an alleged "new mattress," which was curiously covered with down feathers. The bed linens were thrown in a ball on top of our luggage. We were quite surprised to see that the room had been left in that condition, if only to somehow prove to us that the mattress had been changed. At least we did not see any roaches, maybe they don't like musty odors and clumpy sour milk.

Reviews.Title: “Rizt-Carlton Kapalua gets it”
Reviews.Author: gulch
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is amazing. The property Gets IT! In that I mean they capture the feel of Maui in their amazing, elegant way, If you do not know what I mean by saying, they get IT, then by all means do not stay here. We were greeted properly with leis, the staff all around was friendly and went out of their way to make us feel welcomed. We were there not to celebrate a new marriage like many of the accompanying guests, but were made to feel just as special, if not more so. We LOVED KOI, the sushi restaurant and also made it to the Banyan Tree. Not one complaint, if anything we had to pass up on massages because the atmosphere was so relaxing and perfect that an extra treat was not needed. Stay at this property and ENJOY!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay - if you have the cake!”
Reviews.Author: snooks34
Reviews.Content: We had an awesome time in Kapalua at the Ritz on our honeymoon - just returned this week. While I found the front desk staff not very experienced, the remainder of the staff were very helpful, and provided great service. I didn't see one cockroach at the hotel during my stay, and in my opinion - the clown who wrote the poor review below - most likely is one of those guys who looks for a free stay wherever he/she goes, and was finally denied by someone who knew better. We stayed in a deluxe ocean view room and it was incredible - very spacious, with two balconies - one off the master bedroom and one off the main living area - both with ocean views! The pools were very nice and relaxing and never crowded. We met many friendly people - most enjoying a honey-moon or celebrating an anniversary. One final tip of advice - pay the extra money and get club level access. You get breakfast/lite lunch/dinner and free beverages - beer/wine/mixed drinks etc, and the staff is excellent. This is also a great way to meet other people if you're social people like ourselves.

Reviews.Title: “Infestation”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The tone of our honeymoon was set when we dealt with the passive aggressive front desk person on checkin. She was better qualified to tend phones for my credit card company than to present herself as the face of a 5 star resort. While the grounds, rooms and location felt like the Ritz, the service was inconsistent at best and not what one would expect from a 5 star hotel. As an example, we were horrified by the sight of cockroaches not once but on three separate occasions in our room. The response of the Ritz staff was to inconvenience us by supposedly sending an exterminator that prevented us from entering our room for a full day. When we finally entered our room we were greeted by a cockroach on the back of the bathroom door. After describing our greeting to the front desk we didn't even get an apology, much less an offer to discount our rooms or even a free drink at the hotel bar.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of the view you are paying for!!!”
Reviews.Author: MillionMilr
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapalua for about 5 nights. This was the first time I have ever paid $675 a night for a room so we made sure we did our homework. We booked an oceanview suite and repeatedly called the hotel to ensure that we were given a room that had had a commanding view of the water. The view in a hotel room is very important and I totally understand paying extra for this feature. Check-in We checked in around 4pm on a Friday afternoon and it took about 10 minutes for us to get to the front of the line. I have never seen such a slow checkin process at what is supposed to be a 5 diamond hotel. They do handout leis when you check in. Room We booked an oceanview suite and was given 1519. We were extremely DISAPPOINTED with the view. This was supposed to be a FULL OCEANVIEW room but really it seemed like a partial oceanview room. We could only see a small part of the water by going out to the edge of our balcony and looking to our extreme left. We were extremely disappointed with this. I noticed that the rooms that do not face pool side have a terribly inferior view of the water; the Ritz should not sell these as full oceanview rooms. If you want oceanview, you should definitely ask for a room that faces the pool side of the property. The next day, I called the front desk and spoke with the manager, JoAnne. She said that another room was available. She managed to get us 1540. This room has an AWESOME view because it is a corner room at the end of the hall. I found out that this room is not an oceanview suite, rather it is a seaview suite that goes for about $1100 a night. I am extremely thankful that JoAnne basically upgraded us for. However, I felt irritated that I had to complain about this in a property such as the Ritz. It seems like all the oceanview rooms face the water at an angle. I would request that reservations fax you a layout of the property before making a booking. The hotel is gorgeous. I have stayed at the Ritz in Bali and the Four Seasons Jimbaran Bay and Sayam in Bali and the Ritz Kapalua is the most beautiful hotel I have ever seem. Kapalua is beautiful and it has an exclusive feel staying there. ONE PROBLEM: The main problem with this hotel is that it is a huge property and has a lot of rooms. I think this is the largest Ritz in the world It's hard to give 5-star service when the hotel has so many guests. The food is nothing special. If you want good sushi, skip the hotel restaurants and go eat at Sansei at the Kapalua Shops. The overall service is adequate; If you are used to other properties in Asia, then you will be disappointed at the Ritz because the service does fall short. My overall thoughts are that Kapalua is beautiful and it definitely is worth it to stay here. Kapalua has to be one of the most beautiful spots on earth. I totally envey the people that have those homes on the hill that you can see from the Ritz. The hotel and the whole area never really felt crowded. The beach is also very private. You should do your homework about the kind of room you want and are willing to pay for. The seaview suite we were subsequently upgraded to is excellent but I can't justify paying $1000 a night for a room like that. We drove to Wailea to have lunch at the Four Seasons and noticed that the pool area there was extremely crowded. However, as always, they have the signature Four Seasons service which is consistently excellent. I have never been disappointed with the service at any Four Seasons in the world and we have stayed at their properties ranging from Maldives to Bali to Dallas and San Francisco. I guess next time we will try the Four Seasons in Wailea. If the Ritz could adopt the Four Seasons standard of service, then the Ritz Carlton Kapalua would be the best hotel in Hawaii.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful”
Reviews.Author: wileywb
Reviews.Content: I felt compelled to post a review after reading several months of comments prior to my departure to Maui. My wife and I recently returned from the Ritz Carlton - we have nothing but great things to say about the facilities, staff and service. Upon arrival, we were greated with lai's and then promptly upgraded to an ocean front suite in honor of our honeymoon. Later than evening, a complimentary bottle of champagne arrived, again, in honor of our honeymoon. Our room was wonderful, the pool was fantastic, the walk to the beach was short, the buffet breakfast glorious...and the staff went out of their way in the Ritz Carlton fashion I was accustomed to. We particulary enjoyed evenings in the lobby listening to live music. This hotel is wonderful - don't let the bad reviews fool you.

Reviews.Title: “Not 5 star- Very Disappointed! (mildew, roaches,etc)”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapaula from August 21-27. We have been married for 3 years & thought this would be a great anniversary getaway. We spend 1 week in the Princeville in Kauai before this...which I ADORED! Wonderful, Fantastic place....very luxurious, but enough about that. From the beginning of our check-in, we had issues/problems. Our room smelled awful -- like urine & mildew. I called to talk to the front desk, who said they would be right there---over 1 hour we were waiting. i called downstairs again & was told to come down & bring my bags, so we could get another room....how rude....this is a Ritz Carlton....what happened to the upscale standard. We got a new room which was better in smell, but the room looked fairly old & tatered & (just an FYI- I am not a spoled NY'er..... I am used to Hiltons, & Sheratons, but this was definitely a step below...very disappointing!) In the rooms, the the furniture was old , the lights did not work in the bedroom(we had to call the front desk to get maintenance), as stated in a review below same went for us " -- housecleaning rolled up our bedspread and set it to the side of the nightstand for our entire stay, presumably so they didn't have to actually make the bed" . The sinks were wet on occasion, when we went back to the room after it was cleaned. Carpets in the hallways were pretty dirty & there were scuff marks throughout the hallways. As a prior review mentioned- there were a few roaches in the hallway & we saw 2 in our room, but being from NY, it was not that shocking to me, although it was surprising to see this in a Ritz Carton. I will not be coming here, nor recommending it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quality Maui Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the other comments, just wanted to add my $0.02. Spent three nights at the Ritz over labor day wknd, and experienced none of the problems listed here. Overall was impressed with the room, resort and service. My only complaint was a particular overpriced and poor meal at the Beach grill. (Brunch buffet, on the other hand, was excellent.)

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Ritz Carlton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Okay, I understand that everyone has different experiences at the same places. But I have to say that my experience at the Ritz-Carlton Kapulua was nothing short of fantastic. My husband and I spent 4 nights there for our honeymoon (after 4 nights in Oahu) and had a great time. So the decor of the rooms weren't exactly up my alley (the elegant plantation look didn't do too much for me) but for a standard room, they were spacious and clean. The king sized bed was amazingly comfortable. The marble bathroom with the double sinks, the bathtub with a shower head and another separate shower stall area was a nice added bonus. While we didn't stay in an ocean front room, we had a great view of the mountains and a partial view of the ocean. The pool was gorgeous and it had a magnificent view of the ocean and the swaying trees. Very relaxing! The first night we had dinner at the Banyan Tree. The dishes I had were amazing. I can honestly say that this is the first time where I've eaten at a restaurant in a hotel and really enjoyed the food. I ordered the foie gras with the tuna and it was so good. But the topper was really the dessert. The Warm Chocolate Melt Away (similar to a souffle with a gooey oozy chocolate center) was to die for. My husband enjoyed his dinner as well since he ordered other items. We also had appointments at the spa and my therapist was one of the nicest and most capable massage therapists I've ever had. It was always about my comfort (is the water temperature right, is the pressure right, etc.). And it was such a great massage. Overall, the grounds are gorgeous, the service was amazing (every one was always nice and courteous and accomodating), there was an abundance of clean towels everywhere (bathroom, pool, beach). I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Resting on its laurels as a member of the Ritz Carlton Family”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ritz Carlton Kapaula for 6 days (August 21-27) for our honeymoon. We had arrived there from a 6-day stay at the Hyatt Regency in Kauai, where we had a fabulous stay. Unfortunately, from the minute we checked into the Ritz, we knew there were going to be problems. When we opened the door to our room, it smelled like a combination of dirty socks, urine, mold and mildew. The carpets were wet as if they had just been cleaned. When we called to complain, neither phone in the room worked, so my husband went to the front desk where he was reassured that someone would be there "immediately" to move our bags to a new room. 30 minutes later, nobody showed and since we couldn't use the phone, my husband had to go to the lobby, stand in line and re-check in all over. No assistance was offered in relocating us, nor were any concessions offered. As other reviewers have said, everything in the room was outdated -- the t.v. was small and old; the furniture was old; our lamps didn't work; housecleaning rolled up our bedspread and set it to the side of the nightstand for our entire 6 day stay, presumably so they didn't have to actually make the bed; housecleaning never once cleaned the glass shelf over the sinks in the bathroom. Finally, the carpets in the extremely outdated elevator were filthy and coming up in the corners and there were scuff marks all over the hallway leading to our room. For a hotel chain that prides itself on customer service and everything being "their pleasure," we were highly disappoined and will never return to this property.

Reviews.Title: “The Ritz Was Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from a great week at the RC Kapalua. Apololgies to all you naysayers, but our experience there was grand. While it's true that the price tags on just about everything at the resort are high, that's why Hawaii exists, right? Anyway we cached in a bunch of Marriott points so our stay was free and we passed on most of the $50 a plate restaurant drek in favor of Maui Tacos and hit a few spots in Lahaina including Gerard's and Cafe O'Lei. For an exception our sunset dinner at the Plantation House restaurant was worth the ticket, but overall I wasn't knocked out by the food on Maui because I didn't feel much like eating, which is strange because normally I'm an amateur restauraunt critic and I can't wait to get out and eat. In Maui A bag of Onion potato chips and a Kirin was heaven. Anything more than light fare and appetizers and I was too weighed down. Must have been the climate. In retrospect for us Maui was really all about the setting; ambiance, paradise, beaches, and Mai-Tais. The Ritz up on cool pleasant Kapalua was a great home base to explore the island. We took a ride down to Wailea to see the Four Seasons just to comparison shop and the differences were immediately evident to my wife and I. Wailea is like a Newport Beach/Maimi Beach/Vegas/Palm Springs kind of a place in a noticeably hotter part of the island. I felt like I was in Ceasar's Place when I was at the 4 Seasons (not my trip) and in contrast I really appreciated the sedate and distinguished exclusive charm of the Ritz. It's at least ten degrees cooler up on Kapalua, and the whole Kapalua Bay resort is great. Since we went in August I can't say what things might be like in February, and truth be told I was a bit freaked out about going to the RC after I read some of the reviews on this site, but to the people who harshly panned it all I can say is - That wasn't the hotel I stayed at. I'm giving the RC 4 stars since Maui is full of great resorts, and while good, there was nothing about the RC that sent me totally over the edge. I think if the food was better and more tuned to the climate I would have been more enthusiastic. The situation of the hotel is also something of a trade-off - The hotel is goregous, the pool grand, but it takes a little work to get down to the beach. But this is a refined trade-off since the views are stunning and we had no problem getting sunburned just the same. In the evening the tree frog seranade is unbelieveable. Just be sure to rent a car and get some snorkel gear from Boss Frog's and don't be shy. Take the shuttle to the Kapalua Bay beach and check out the island. All beaches have public access and the water is fabulous, and it's the lesser traveled paths that turned out to be the better ones. In the end Maui wasn't about big dollar digs, it was a state of mind in a natural paradise. We were just lucky enough to stay at the Ritz and get spoiled in style.

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: Bellamie
Reviews.Content: August 28th 2004 I just had to respond after reading the previous ridiculous "roaches galore" review. I think the only roaches there would be the one this person was smoking. I don't know what Ritz this person went to but it wasn't the one I stayed at. First of all the customer service was top notch, the rooms were very nicely appointed (e.g. feather beds) and cleaned twice daily, and the grounds were absolutely beautiful. We were greeted on arrival at the front desk with aromatherapy face clothes to refresh ourselves and the hostess placed leis on us and showed us to our room. My husband loved the morning jogging station set up with bottled ice water, towels and maps. The pool boys greeted us daily to set up our lounge chairs with covers and towels and brought us ice water. The dinner we had (tasting menu) at the Banyan Tree was fabulous, and the chef even took the time to come out to speak with us foodies. We travel a lot! There is no way anyone could justifiably put this place down. It deserves it's five stars.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES GALORE!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience at this Ritz Carlton. We checked in, althought the grounds were very pretty, the hotel itself left MUCH to be desired. We stayed here on our honeymoon & our travel agent recommended it. Our biggest problem was that the hotel was infested with roaches. We checked in and thought everything was fine. The food was a bit pricey, especially for the quality. I have stayed at many Ritz Carltons, but this has been the lowest in quality (not only from a Ritz Carlton standard, but from a hotel standard in general). The food was ok....nothing to rave about, at all. Getting back to the main subject....we enjoyed the day travelling around, but when we came back to the "Ritz", we relaxed in the lobby- had a drink, then went back to our room. We turned on the lights in the room & we saw roaches scurrying to avoid the light. Then we tried to step on the ones on the floor, but there were at least 15 in sight (on the walls and ceiling). When we turned on the bathroom light, the same thing occured. I was livid and I complained to management, who told me that this has been a problem and they are trying to deal with it. They did not have another room, so my husband and had to sleep with the light on and take turns staying awake. Needless to say, we left there in a hurry in the morning. I would not recommend staying here - what a poor choice for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Maui Wowie!!!”
Reviews.Author: SCHawaiiTraveler
Reviews.Content: The Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is perhaps one of the most gorgeous resorts I have ever had the pleasure of visiting. One would expect outstanding service, amenities, food, and accomodations at a 5-star resort; and this resort not only met, but exceeded all of my expectations. The last time I checked, which was today, the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua was still rated 5 stars. I wonder if the complainers in some of these reviews know exactly what discriminating travelers like myself enjoy? Obviously those who rate the hotel know what they are talking about. In my opinion, this is the best Ritz-Carlton in the world! It is located in the best place (Maui), near the most private beach (Kapalua), and employs a friendly staff which goes beyond their call of duty. This hotel is a complete universe, a place where I was able to happily sit by the ocean with a book all day one day, relax on my lanai enjoying the view another day, and rejuvinate by the pool eating fresh pineapple another day. The Ritz is located on a knoll, in a spectacular setting between the rainforest and the sea. The 5-minute stroll from the pool down the path to the beach with the refreshing breeze blissfully blowing on your back is truly an invigorating awakening of the senses. Somewhere during that walk, even the most stressed-out traveler should come upon the realization that this is paradise! This is the way life should be! When it rains, and it will (remember you are next to a rainforest), that is the perfect excuse to enjoy a relaxing afteroon nap in your room or suite. The sun will come out again soon. I found my suite to be up to par with the usual Ritz standard, complete with marble baths, separate showers, private lanais, and a decadently comfortable bed. There were 3 televisions in my suite, but I never once turned them on. I preferred enjoying the ocean vistas! Finally, I must say that hospitality is the keynote at this elegant, yet non-imposing plantation-style resort. I found exemplary service topped off with good old-fashioned Hawaiian aloha! If this doesn't sound like your type of resort, please stay elsewhere. That will leave even more privacy for those of us who know how to enjoy the finer things in life. In my opinion, the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua is a Maui Wowie!

Reviews.Title: “top notch resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent seven nights at the Ritz-Carlton Kapalua, and were absolutely blown away with every single aspect of our stay. The staff is incredibly friendly, totally accommodating, and willing to do almost anything you request (within reason). The hotel is beautiful, massive (yet the common areas are scaled in such a way so you don't feel lost in space). The beach access is just a short walk, and nowhere near the trek some make it out to be. Besides, the beach is well worth it: quite, clean, and with plenty of open space. The food is excellent, presentation in the restaurants is first class, and the views are picture-perfect. The rooms (we had a suite and a standard room) were both clean, and well furnished (the beds are great). If you golf, the three courses that surround the hotel are breathtaking... The concierge was able to get me on the courses last minute with no trouble. Ignore all the complaints about the wind. Most of Maui is windy, and the parts that are not, are muggy at best. All in all, if you want a fantastic resort, with a great location, excellent service, and privacy you have to check out the Ritz. It is an expensive hotel, so if you are not willing to ignore the prices for the food and services, then I suggest you stay somewhere else. Aloha!

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT PERFECT PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent the first 5 days of our honeymoon at the Ritz, and I would certainly go back. Some of these reviews are ridiculous, people need to get off their high horses. To complain that the beach is a 10 min walk from the hotel??? Ridiculous. That the food trays were in the hallway too long? That the gym was a joke? That the pool is too small? That the plants smell? Come on. The staff bent over backwards for us, the breakfast was amazing, the pool area was beautiful, the beach was nice. Yes - the food was pricey, just like the rest of Maui. The room was clean, the towels and robes were plush, the verhanda was spacious and we had a great view. The staff was courtious and professional.

Reviews.Title: “An Awesome Stay at the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz Kapalua in September 2003, which was my second visit to the Ritz, and kabillionth time to Maui. After reading some of the recent reviews here, I had to post my own. I've relied on TripAdvisor reviews for the past year in making my travel choices, and haven't been steered wrong yet. I'm a very discriminating traveler - I look for 5 star resorts, and I expect high quality service and excellent food. The Ritz seemed an easy choice because you can count on consistent good service and beautiful surroundings. We love Kapalua because of the peace and quiet, great golf, and less-touristy feel than Wailea. Yes, it tends to be suffer from wind and rain more than Wailea, but every time we've gone in September/October, it's been lovely. This visit, the service at the Ritz was so fantastic. I had decided to take my mom on her first tropical vacation ever, and booked an ocean view room. Before leaving, I sent an email to the concierge, asking if they would try to secure us a really nice view, because (a) this was mom's first ever trip to an island, and (b) she had recently been diagnosed with a terrible illness... and I wanted to make the trip very special for her. When we checked in, we were shown to our room, which turned out had been upgraded to a full ocean view SUITE thanks to the lovely lady at the concierge desk! Plus, a gorgeous flower arrangement and a welcome basket of Hawaiian goodies. Talk about being impressed! We were overwhelmed. That kind of over-the-top service is amazing. The rest of our stay was also fabulous: service and food, both excellent. Yes, the food is expensive, but no more so than at the Kea Lani or Four Seasons. You just expect it, at a 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “You could do a lot worse”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My now-husband and I decided that we wanted to get married on a beach in Maui, and decided to try a 5-star resort in celebration of our marriage. We looked at the reviews here and I was apprehensive, but was pleasantly surprised when I arrived at the resort. We were 'leid' upon arrival, and were installed in our 'ocean-view' ground-level room. We didn't like the room, so I asked the front desk if we could be moved and was told that they would change our room the next day while we were out and moved our baggage as well. I also mentioned in passing that we'd be getting married in a few days. Our new room was much better (6th floor, better view of the ocean), and the day we got married, room service showed up with chocolate-dipped strawberries and a bottle of champange, compliments of the Ritz! We had the breakfast buffet included with our stay--well worth it, as it would have been about $30 each if not included.
